ninja:
A [b]ninja[/b] or [b]shinobi[/b] is a Japanese covert agent/mercenary specialized in underhanded fighting and espionage.

A [b]kunoichi[/b] is a female ninja.
witch hat:
A [[hat]] usually worn by [[witch]]es. Commonly pointed and with a wide brim, and [[black headwear|black]] in color.

As a rule of thumb, [[Kirisame Marisa]] most frequently uses a witch hat, while [[Mima (touhou)|]] most frequently uses a [[wizard hat]].
glasses:
Eyeglasses or spectacles, "megane" in Japanese. 
These lenses are normally worn for visual correction, such as reading or seeing things from a distance, or eye protection.

* Do not use this tag on [[monocle]]s or [[goggles]].
* Eyewear with slight amount of tint which is lighter than standard [[sunglasses]] should be tagged [[glasses]].
* Not to be confused with the drinking vessel. For that, use [[drinking glass]].
no headwear: Someone who typically wears some form of headwear (a [[hat]], a [[bandana]], a [[helmet]], etc.) is not wearing it.
single thighhigh: A character wearing a [[thighhighs|thighhigh]] on only one leg.
sunglasses:
A special kind of [[glasses]] which filter the very bright rays of the [[sun]] that enter the eyes. Also used to generally conceal one's eyes for any reason, medical or personal.

Don't tag sunglasses as [[glasses]] or [[bespectacled]].
from behind:
Perspective where the subject is observed from behind.

Not to be confused with a [[hug from behind]], [[grabbing from behind]], or [[sex from behind]].
blood on hands: [[Blood]] that is present on a person's fingers. It could be from an injury, or from a different source.
multicolored hair: Hair that has more than one color. All hair colors present should be tagged, if possible.
official alternate hairstyle:
[[Alternate hairstyle]]s of official origin, whether it be from the creators themselves, or from second-parties involved in the given copyright. Generally a hairstyle other than the standard one the character appears in.

These can often times appear in manga/anime (beach episodes, as one example), video games (whether as unlockables or as skins to be bought in gacha games), and on special events. Figures which can have such hairstyles include Virtual YouTubers.

[b]Do not[/b] use this tag with [[alternate hairstyle]], the tags are mutually exclusive.
sunlight:
The light of the sun.

[[Sunbeam]] (crepuscular rays) is where light rays stream through gaps in clouds or between other objects. These are columns of sunlit air separated by darker cloud-shadowed regions. (See post #438675)

[[Sunburst]] is for designs or figures of burst of [[sunlight]], but may not necessarily be the actual sun (See post #645306)

For tagging purposes, keep in mind that a particular image may satisfy one or more of the specific terms mentioned above.
v-fin:
A [b]V[/b] or [b]U[/b]-shaped head attachment commonly found on Gundams and similar [[mobile suit]]s, where they function as potent [[radio antenna]]s or other sensory and detection equipment. They may be a single piece, such as on the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], have protrusions like on the [[Strike Freedom Gundam|Strike Freedom]], be comprised of detached segments like [[Gundam Harute|Harute]]'s v-fin, or be made of energy or flames like on the [[Beginning Gundam]] and [[Phantom Gundam|Phantom]].

P
rope: Fiber threads twisted together to form a strong length. Rope can be used to make [[swing]]s, tie [[pig]]s, keep people out of a [[treehouse]], [[rappelling]], tie up a partner in [[bondage]], and for many other purposes.
dildo under panties:
A character wearing [[panties]] over an inserted [[dildo]].

If the dildo is also a vibrator, also tag as [[vibrator under panties]].
wavy mouth: Not the same as [[:3]]. Wavy mouth is usually seen when the character is scared, sad, or embarrassed.
covered navel: Where the impression of the [[navel]] can be seen through opaque [[skin tight]] clothing such as [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece swimsuits]], [[school swimsuit]]s, [[bodysuit]]s, [[playboy bunny|bunnysuits]], [[leotard]]s, etc.
east asian architecture: Buildings and other structures constructed in traditional East Asian design.
forehead: Posts having this tag show emphasis on a character's forehead.
sex:
[[Vaginal]] or [[anal]] intercourse. Only use this tag for actual [[vaginal]] or [[anal]] penetration with a penis or [[strap-on]]. Don't use it for [[oral|oral sex]], [[paizuri]], [[fingering]] or other acts that don't involve penile penetration or [[strap-on]]s.

When tagging images with this tag, be sure to also tag whether it's [[vaginal]] and / or [[anal]], too, if applicable.

If [[tentacles]] are involved, use [[tentacle sex]] instead.

If the sex involves 2 or more animals rather than humanoids, use [[mating (animal)|]] instead (not to be confused with [[bestiality]], where a humanoid has sex with an animal).
blunt bangs:
A hairstyle where the [[bangs]] are cut in a sharp, straight line across the entire length of the forehead. Mutually exclusive with [[swept bangs]] and [[asymmetrical bangs]].

Known in Japan as パッツン ([i]pattsun[/i]).

When combined with [[long hair]] and blunt [[sidelocks]], it becomes a type of [[hime cut]]. If the bangs are shaved or combed back at the temples, with the rest hanging loose at the forehead it may result in [[center-flap bangs]].
backlighting:
The [[light]] source appears to be behind the subject of the image.

This causes the edges of the subject to glow, while the other areas remain darker.
clothes pull:
Clothing that has been pulled down to reveal the [[breasts]] or crotch.

See [[clothes lift]] for clothing that is lifted up to show the breasts or crotch, [[clothes tug]] for clothing that is tugged down to cover oneself, and [[clothes grab]] for grabbing or holding on to clothing without the intent to move it.
web address: A web address (e.g. www.example.com) is somewhere in the image, usually as a [[watermark]].
black skirt: A [[skirt]] or [[miniskirt]] that is colored [[black skirt|black]].
itou kaiji:
The main character of [[Fukumoto Nobuyuki]]'s gambling manga and anime series [[Kaiji]] (his family name is rarely mentioned). A young man bouncing between jobs, Kaiji is locked in perpetual poverty and debt. He resorts to gambling to improve his situation, but ends up facing odds he never bargained for. While he is often on the receiving end of punishments, his ability to fight back casts him as the underdog. 

He has a [[pointy nose]], [[sanpaku]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[me
shide: A paper streamer cut in a zig-zagging fashion used in [[Shinto]] rituals.  A common element of a [[gohei]] or [[shimenawa]], a shide should only be tagged as such when depicted by itself or as part of a [[shrine]].
emblem:
A heraldic device or symbolic object as a distinctive badge of a nation, organization, or family.

Distinct and recurring emblems are frequently tagged with a "*_(emblem)":[/tags?search%5Bhide_empty%5D=yes&search%5Bname_matches%5D=%2A_%28emblem%29] qualifier.
recorder:
A family of woodwind [[instrument]]s.  The most common type are soprano recorders, with low cost plastic versions frequently issued to school children since the 20th century.

It is played perpendicular to a person's lips through a mouthpiece called a [i]fipple[/i] or [i]block[/i]. It has a slightly tapering body with eight finger holes and can come in a variety of colors. The name comes from one of the meanings of the word [i]record[/i], which is "to practice a piece of music." 

A recorder needs to have a [[whistle]] (shaped) mouthpiece.
full body:
An image focused on a character's full body. The character's entire body is visible and takes up most of the frame.

It still counts if minor appendages or accessories aren't fully in frame, such as hair, clothing, wings, or tails.

It doesn't count if the character is far away or doesn't take up most of the frame. See [[wide shot]] or [[very wide shot]] instead.
male focus:
An image featuring only male characters, or with an overwhelming emphasis on male characters.

This tag does not apply if the male(s) are an insignificant part of an image that focuses on something else, such as [[scenery]] (ex. post #4921679, post #4899185)

Should also be tagged with either [[1boy]] or [[multiple boys]].
daiwa scarlet (umamusume): Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. Voiced by [[Kimura Chisa]]. Noted as a perfectionist who always pursues  becoming "Number 1" and often fights with Vodka for similar things. Often depicted as a tsundere.
smoking:
The act of lighting up a substance like tobacco and either inhaling or tasting the [[smoke]] it emits. This can be done with [[cigarette|cigarettes]], [[cigar|cigars]], [[smoking pipe|pipes]], [[hookah]], [[bong]] and [[kiseru]]. Illegal recreational drugs like [[marijuana]], cocaine and methamphetamine can be smoked as well.

A female sexual organ, the primary female erogenous zone. Usually refers specifically to the clitoral glans, a little pink button on top of the [[pussy|vulva]].

Comparable to and homologous to the male [[penis]].

The expulsion of [[pussy juice|fluid]] from the [[pussy|vagina]] during or after an [[female orgasm|orgasm]]. Colloquially known as 'squirting' or 'gushing'.

Female ejaculate is usually drawn white or clear as a strong gush, and there will usually be less of it than there would be if the subject was peeing. If you aren't sure which it is, use your best judgment when tagging. 

Not to be confused with the [[squirting liquid]] tag, which is for non-sexual expulsion of liquids. This tag implies a vagina, in case of a [[futanari]] ejaculating  [[ejaculating while penetrated]] shall be used instead.
simple background:
An image with an empty or featureless background.

As a rule of thumb, such pictures can be easily extracted from the background, and placed on other backgrounds.

A fully [[transparent background]] also counts for simple.
hetero:
Any romantic and/or sexual depiction between members of the opposite genders, regardless of if it's mutual or one-sided or if the male is an [[otoko no ko]] and the female is a [[reverse trap]].

If it is mutual, consider adding the [[couple]] tag.
kurosaki ichigo:
Main character of [[Bleach]].

A teenager born with the ability to see spirits. His [[Kurosaki Masaki|mother]] died at the hands of an evil spirit called a [[Hollow (bleach)|]] when he was a little boy. He grew up as a normal high school student and a native in Karakura Town living with his two sisters [[Kurosaki Yuzu]], and [[Kurosaki Karin]] along with his father [[Kurosaki Isshin]]. He became a substitute shinigami (soul reaper) with [[Kuchiki Rukia]] lending her powers to Ichigo; in order
ajirogasa: Any conical hat made from wicker or bamboo traditionally "worn by priests":[https://haikutopics.blogspot.com/2006/05/hat-kasa.html#:~:text=made%20from%20finely%20woven%20bamboo,a%20dark%20orange/brown%20color.].
female pubic hair:
[[Pubic hair]] on a female character.

[[Futanari]] and [[futa without pussy]] characters count as having female pubic hair.
necklace:
A simple, circular chain worn loosely around the neck as [[jewelry]]. 

Different from [[pendant]], which has a jewel fastened to a chain as a centerpiece, or [[choker]], which fits snugly around the neck.
clitoral stimulation: Sexual stimulation of the [[clitoris]] in any form.
thigh strap:
A strap worn around the [[thighs|thigh]]. A thigh strap may be a band of fabric or leather, or a belt, but not metal.

Not to be confused with a [[thighlet]], which is a band of metal.

Sometimes connect to a [[single garter strap]].
ejaculation:
Male or [[futanari]] ejaculation, the expulsion of [[cum|semen]] through the shaft of a [[penis]]. 

Use the [[female ejaculation]] tag for female ejaculations.
patreon logo:
The logo of the [[Patreon]] platform.

This is typically used as a watermark and placed next to an artist's name or Patreon page, although it can also be used in clever ways such as to censor a character or be incorporated in an image some other way.

Use this tag instead of the [[Patreon]] tag for instances of the Patreon logo.
tattoo: An application of permanent colour to the skin for the purpose of drawing a symbol or picture.
zettai ryouiki:
Zettai ryouiki (lit. "absolute territory") is the area of bare [[thighs]] seen between a [[skirt]] or [[short dress]] and [[thighhighs]]. The skirt should not be [[skirt lift|lifted up]] or out of place; the thighs should be exposed naturally, by the skirt being too short to cover the tops of the thighhighs. Example characters include [[Tohsaka Rin]], [[Momose Kurumi]] and [[Mayura]]. 

The term itself originates from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], although it had none of the current connotations in the anime. The modern usage of zettai ryouiki originates from the creator of a desktop mascot application when he used the term on his blog in reference to [[Mayura]]. 

Do not use this tag for [[single thighhigh]], [[shorts]], or when the [[panties]], [[underwear]], or genitalia are visible beneath the skirt. [[Thigh boots]] may however still apply.
science fiction:
A genre of fiction which centers around futuristic science and technology. 

Space travel, [[robot]]s and [[alien]]s, and/or complex [[machine]]ry are common aspects of this genre. Use this tag for images which appear to be set inside of a science fiction universe. 

Scifi and [[fantasy]] often intersect, so feel free to use both tags if you feel it is appropriate.
grass:
A common word used to describe monocotyledonous green [[plant|plants]].

Use when an abundance of grass is present in an image, such as when someone is "lying on their back in a field":[/posts?tags=on_back+grass].
depth of field:
An effect where part of the image appears [[blurry]] and out-of-focus. This could be the [[blurry foreground|foreground]], the [[blurry background|background]], or both.

This mimics the photographic effect that's caused by the camera being able to focus at only one distance at a time, making objects at other distances appear blurry. This is often used artistically to draw attention to one part of the image.
armpits:
The area of the body located underneath where the arm connects to the torso, often appearing when [[arm up|one]] or [[arms up|both]] arms are raised, especially when wearing clothes that are [[sleeveless]], [[strapless]], have [[detached sleeves]], have [[armpit cutout]]s, or if the character is [[topless female]]/[[topless male]] or outright [[nude]].

[[Hakurei Reimu]] of the [[Touhou]] series is known for a meme involving her armpits since her dress does a lot to emphasize them.

Don't use when only [[armpit crease]] is needed.
lotus:
An aquatic plant belonging to the Nelumbonaceae family of flowering plants. The lotus has prominent blooms (of pink or white hues) rising 8-12 inches above the water, each with a flattened central seed pod structure and fully circular leaves with centrally-attached stems. These features help distinguish it from the [[water lily flower]] (Nymphaea), with which it is often confused.

[i]Nelumbo nucifera[/i] (also known as the Sacred or Indian Lotus) will probably be the plant of interest to Danbooru image taggers, being a divine symbol in Hinduism and Buddhism. It conveys the virtues of purity and non-attachment; it is associated with beauty, elegance, and grace.
jacket: A garment that is sleeved and hip- or waist-length. Jackets are made from thin material, therefore they are lighter. While some are for fashion, they can also serve as protective clothing when thicker material is used.
black legwear:
Deprecated tag. Use one of the below tags instead:

* [[black socks]] (also includes [[kneehighs]])
* [[black thighhighs]] (also includes [[over-kneehighs]])
* [[black pantyhose]]
* [[black leggings]]
* [[black leg warmers]]
bow:
A bow is a type of knot generally featuring two loops and two loose ends.  Bows will be seen on clothing (many [[serafuku]] have them), in hair, on [[panties]] and other [[lingerie]], on shoes (shoelaces are usually tied in a bow), and pretty much any place that there is something that might be tied.

Bows are often made of [[ribbon|ribbons]], but the same object shouldn't be tagged as both.  If the bow's tail is far longer than its width, tag it as [[ribbon]].

If a bow is tied at the neck in place of a [[necktie]] it should also be noted as a [[bowtie]].
^_^:
[[Closed eyes]] with an upward peak. Almost always paired with a [[smile]], but iconic enough to be indicative of one even when the mouth is hidden or missing.

If the eyes are crinkled tightly, use [[>_<]] instead.
twitter logo:
The former [[logo]] of [[Twitter]], featuring a silhouette of the [[Twitter bird]]. It was used until in 2023 when it was replaced with an [[twitter_x_logo|X logo]] as a part of the rebranding of Twitter to X Corp. under [[Elon Musk]].

This tag is for the "Twitter bird" logo, for the current X logo, use [[twitter x logo]] instead. If the bird serves purposes other than a logo, such as being redrawn or interacting with a character, use [[twitter bird]] instead.
planted sword: A [[sword]] whose pointed end is visibly impaling the ground.
squatting: Resting only on the feet (rather than the butt or legs) while bent at the knees. The knees shouldn't touch the ground, if they do, it's [[kneeling]] instead.
on chair: Someone is on a [[chair]], regardless if they're [[sitting]], [[squatting]], [[standing]], [[lying]] and such.
yellow pupils: A character with yellow pupils. Not to be confused with [[yellow eyes]], for when the iris (part surrounding the pupil) as yellow, or [[yellow sclera]] for when the normally white sclera are colored yellow.
ovaries: Two ovum (egg) producing female reproductive organs connected to the [[uterus]] by the [[fallopian tubes]].
starry sky:
An image with a focus on a [[sky]] filled with [[star (sky)|]]s. If it isn't a focal point, just tag as [[star (sky)]].

For posts with background [[star (symbol)|star symbol]]s (★), see [[star symbol background]].
road:
A road is a route that has been [[pavement|paved]] or otherwise improved for travel by foot or vehicle. Possible road surfaces include dirt, gravel, concrete, and asphalt.

Paved roads in [[city|urban]] settings are generally referred to as [[street|streets]]. They may have adjoining [[sidewalk|sidewalks]] for pedestrian use. Narrow lanes too small for vehicular use are called [[alley|alleys]].

Public roads, especially multi-lane arterial roads and major roads between cities, may be called
cleavage:
The depression or valley created between a woman's [[breasts]] via partial exposure of the chest.

In anime, video games, and art, the cleavage is a popular method of adding some sexual appeal to the character. It should be noted that the cleavage is sometimes shown on characters as merely a curved line, while other times it has an extra, smaller line on the end, making the shape of a "Y" at the top of the depression.

The opposite is [[breasts apart]].
ass: An epithet for one or more buttocks.  Not to be used for the [[donkey|carrier animal of the same name]].
tied to chair: A character is [[bound]] to a [[chair]] by any means.
rooftop:
The outer surface of a [[building]]'s roof.

Add [[foot dangle]] if a character is precariously sitting on the edge.
silk: Strong protein fibers, sometimes coated with adhesive, produced by certain arthropods and monsters. Examples of its use in nature include insect cocoons and spider webs.
makeup:
Any type of makeup worn on the face. 

See [[cosmetics]] for products or objects used to apply makeup.
butterfly:
A butterfly is any of several groups of mainly day-flying [[bug|insects]] of the order Lepidoptera, the butterflies and [[moth|moths]]. Like other holometabolous insects, butterflies' life cycle consists of four parts, egg, [[larva]], pupa and adult.

Butterflies have large, often brightly coloured [[butterfly_wings|wings]], and conspicuous, fluttering flight.
green eyes:
A character with green colored eyes.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as the lighting on the characters), there is an overlap between this tag and the [[aqua eyes]] tag.
bruise: A bodily [[injury]], usually caused by a blunt impact, where superficial capillaries are ruptured and leak blood into the surrounding tissue, forming a telltale discolored blotch under the skin.
fat:
Overweight; chubbier than [[plump]].

See [[obese]] for fatter than fat.
helmet: A protective piece of [[armor]] designed to protect the cranium from damage. The design and shape can vary because of the time-period, setting, and what the helmet is to protect the cranium from.
flag:
A flag is a piece of fabric, often flown from a pole or mast. Often decorated with emblems, symbols, or shapes to represent one's country or an event. Soldiers may be carrying a [[war flag]].

[[Flag]] is only applicable if the fabric in question is horizontally-oriented, if it flows vertically use [[banner]] instead. 

If the flag is of a specifically known real country, please add that country as a tag.
hatsune miku:
Hatsune Miku is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, originally released for the VOCALOID2 engine on August 31, 2007. She was the first of the Character Vocal Series and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is recognizable by her [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[twintails]] and [[aqua eyes]], although she is commonly depicted with [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[grey shirt|grey]] or [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]] with an [[aqua necktie|aqua]] or [[blue necktie]], has [[long sleeves|long]] [[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], and [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She has a [[number tattoo]] [[shoulder tattoo|on her shoulder]].

She is voiced by [[Fujita Saki]], and her first appearance was illustrated by [[KEI (Keigarou)|]].
window:
A transparent platform of glass used to allow the occupants of a [[building]] or [[house]] look outside without exposing themselves to the elements. 

Formerly used to refer to images in which a female character pressed her breasts against any glass or transparent flat surface, but this implication has since become obsolete. Please refer to [[breast press]] for those kinds of images.

Not to be confused with a software [[window (computing)]].
smile:
An expression showing pleasure, amusement, or [[happy|happiness]], usually with the corners of the mouth turned up, like this: 🙂.

If the mouth is wide open and the [[teeth]] are visible, it may be a [[grin]].
cat ears:
A character who has, or wears as a fashion accessory, cat ears (nekomimi) on their head.
Do not use this tag for actual [[cat]]s.

On Danbooru's images they are most often used for [[drawing (action)|]], [[playing games]] and accessing the [[internet]].

shotgun:
A [[gun]] that fires [[shotgun shell|shells]] containing pellets, rifled slugs, or other munitions. Shotguns have short effective range but high close-range destructive power due to the spread of the pellets. Shotguns generally have smoothbore barrels for firing multiple projectiles at once or in quick succession. There are numerous types of shotguns in different designs and configurations, such as:
* [[double-barreled shotgun|double-barrelled shotgun]] [tn](traditionally [[break action]])[/tn]
* [[bullpup]]
* [[lever action]]
* [[pump action]]
* [[sawed-off shotgun|sawn-off shotgun]]
* [[underbarrel shotgun]]

ribbon trim: Any [[ribbon]] threaded through the edges of an article of clothing, for decorative or supportive purposes.

planted: Something visibly impaling the ground. For example, a [[sword]] planted in the ground.
hairclip: A decorative clip or clasp generally used to hold hair in place or for fashion purposes. Also known as a barrette or a hair slide.
cum pool:

anime coloring:
A 2D rendering technique consisting of hard-edge shading, as opposed to any soft-edge coloring techniques, such as those prominent in [[painterly]] styles. 

It is the most common technique in 2D anime production. 

For the similar technique employed in artworks that are [[3D]] - or that intentionally mimic 3D media - see [[cel rendering]].
licking lips: Licking the lips to suggest a hunger for something about to be, or currently being, satisfied.
armchair: A comfortable chair, typically upholstered, with side supports for a person's arms.

architecture: An image that has structures with a definitive architectural style.
nose: A character drawn with a more prominent nose than is typical of anime / manga styles. The opposite extreme is a [[dot nose]].
two-tone gloves: [[Multicolored gloves]] that consist of exactly two colors.
beret: It is a soft round cap with a flat crown, with the band under the crown's body. Worn by both men and women for fashion purposes, it is also commonly seen in military and police units.
jizou: A divinity in Japanese Buddhism most commonly known for being the patron of children, expectant mothers, travelers and pilgrims, firemen, and guardian of children in limbo. The localized version of Ksitigarbha, he is one of the most popular bodhisattva ([i]bosatsu[/i] in Japanese--a person who attains enlightenment but postpones becoming a Buddha in order to help others) of the 16 attendants of Amida Buddha, a savior par exellence of those in need. Statues of male Jizou as a bald monk, standing
parody:
An imitation of another work, often for comic effect.

This often includes mimicking a scene, line of dialogue, art style, or something else from another series. It might also be a general spoof or reference to another series or character. 

Parodies and [[meme]]s are closely related. Usually a parody is a one-off joke, while a [[meme]] is a joke that has become popular and has been imitated by many people.
ankle boots: [[Boots]] that don't stretch beyond the calf.
holographic interface: A display consisting of a holographic control device projected into space (or otherwise displayed as a free-floating 3D image) for the user to view.
wide shot:
An image in which the subject is fully visible, but only takes up a small portion of the frame. This can be because the subject is far away from the camera, or because the image is too wide for the character to fill the frame.

As a rule of thumb, the character should be noticeable from the thumbnail but shouldn't take up more than 25% of the overall image.
sideboob:
When only the outer side(s) of the [[breasts]] are visible through a gap in the clothing. No bare [[nipples]] should be visible. 

Don't confuse with [[cleavage]].
curvy:
Characters who have a fuller, more exaggerated figure than average. Pronounced [[large breasts]] (or bigger), [[wide hips]], and other feminine features are good candidates for the curvy tag. Posts where simply any size of [[breasts]] or hips are visible don't automatically qualify for the tag.

For chubbier bodies, see [[plump]] or [[fat]].
bowlegged pose:
A pose in which the person squats slightly with knees pointed outward, contracting the [[ass|glutes]] to emphasize the [[crotch]] by pushing it forward. Often accompanied by [[arms behind head]] and [[leaning back]]. In general, posts with this tag should contain characters who are [[standing]] in a partial squat position. This does not include a full [[squatting|squat]] (hip joint below the knees) or [[kneeling]]. If the character is [[sitting]] or [[lying]] down, consider using [[spread legs]] instead.

Not to be confused with [[pigeon-toed]].
ocean:
A large body of [[water|water]] on the Earth's surface. There's usually a [[beach]] near the coastline of a landmass. Sometimes one can see the [[horizon]] if they look far enough.

Contains a huge amount of aquatic plants and [[animal]]s (see "Aquatic life" section of [[List Of Animals]]).
nude:
Not wearing any clothing on the chest and crotch. Clothing on other body parts, such as [[hat]]s, [[thighhighs]], [[elbow gloves]], or [[jewelry]], may still be worn.

See [[completely nude]] for when a character isn't wearing any clothing at all (except for very minor accessories).
veiny breasts:
Breasts that show visible veins.

It's difficult to tell whether veins appear or not, so be careful when tagging. Tilting the top of your monitor/screen backwards can help give you a clearer view.
hands on own chest:
When a character places or rests both of their hands on their chest, without fondling or groping themselves.

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on own chest]].
chain: A series of metal loops linked together.
flock:
Multiple birds (near always the same species) behaving as a group. Distinct from [[too_many_birds]] in that the birds must be a grouping in some way (Eg, being clustered together or flying together), for instance a pet store featuring countless cages with a few birds each or a series of taxidermy animals would be not count as flock but could be too_many_birds.


[[Too_many_birds]] not [[flock]]: post #6692857 post #6949868 post #114802
[[Flock]] and [[too_many_birds]]: post #6709824 post #57
from side: The main character or object in the image is viewed from its side. May either be 90 degrees across the subject's shoulder, or up to 45 degrees left or right.
cat girl: A girl with real [[cat]]-like features, such as [[cat ears]] or a [[cat tail]].
white leotard:
A [[leotard]] that's colored [[white]].

Not to be confused with [[white bodysuit]].
hairband:
A flexible plastic or metal band or strip of fabric [b]worn over the top of the head[/b] to hold the hair back and maintain a certain hairstyle. May also hold [[fake animal ears]].

For a band [b]worn across the forehead[/b] and primarily for athletic purposes, see [[headband]].
after anal:
The aftermath of [[anal]] penetration, be it from from a [[penis]] or a [[dildo]]. See [[after sex]] for guidelines on what to look for.

Try not to confuse this with [[imminent anal]], which may look similar to this in small thumbnails.

This and [[anal]] contextually shouldn't occur at the same time, but it's possible in a [[comic]] where anal sex is occurring in one panel, then the next panel has the aftermath.
blood on clothes: When a character's clothes are covered in [[blood]].
pantyhose:
A type of hosiery made of a sheer material that covers from the waist to the toes. These are distinct from [[thighhighs]] which only cover the legs, and [[leggings]] which don't cover the feet.

For tagging purposes, this tag should be used for most skintight [[tag group:legwear|legwear]] that covers from the waist to the toes, including tights.
short twintails:
[[Twintails]] that are [[short hair|short]], around shoulder length or less.

If only a portion of the hair is tied then it should be tagged as [[two side up]] instead.
hat bow: A [[bow]] attached to a [[hat]], often appears alongside a [[hat ribbon]].
head-mounted display:
A display device which completely covers the eyes and is not transparent. It doesn't need to be used for [[virtual reality]], but odds are that the visor displays some sort of visual or tactical image to the user.

Often used by characters in [[science fiction]] settings, or for characters wearing VR headsets.
veins: Large [[blood]] vessels bulging under the skin.
shibuya rin:
A character from [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]]. She doesn't smile much, which gives off an unfriendly aura to her peers, but despite her exterior, she likes wearing cute costumes.

She is in the unit [[New Generations (idolmaster)|]] with [[Shimamura Uzuki]] and [[Honda Mio]], as well as [[Triad Primus (idolmaster)|]] with [[Hojo Karen]] and [[Kamiya Nao]].

She has [[long hair|long]], straight [[brown hair]] and [[aqua eyes]].

Voiced by [[Fukuhara Ayaka]].
umbrella: A device that can be used to either keep one's self dry in the [[rain]] or be used as shade during a hot, sunny day. Can sometimes be used as a [[improvised weapon|weapon]].
kneeling:
Resting one or both knees on the ground. In other words, knees on the ground, butt off the ground.

Not to be confused with [[squatting]], which is when the knees are off the ground, or [[all fours]], which is when both the hands and knees are on the ground, or with [[seiza]], which is when the legs are completely folded and the butt is sitting on the feet.
fingernails:
Tag used when fingernails are noticeable in the image, i.e. the fingers aren't simply stubs.

For fingernails protruding past the fingertip up to approximately one centimeter, state [[long fingernails]]. Beyond that, use [[very long fingernails]]. If they have [[nail polish]] on them, feel free to add that as well. If they're highly decorated, use [[nail art]].
magical girl:
A magical girl (魔法少女, [i]mahou shoujo[/i]) is a young girl with magical abilities, typically being chosen to fight evil and to protect the Earth by a "mascot" familiar. They often possess a secret identity they [[transformation|transform]] into through a [[henshin]] sequence, although the name can just refer to young girls who follow a plotline involving magic and a transformation.

On Danbooru this tag is used for characters dressed in a magical girl outfit.

A garment worn on the head characterized by a brim. However, posts with this tag refer to headwear in general and is not restricted to those with brim or those without.

pasties: Stickers used to cover the [[nipples]]. [[Heart pasties]] and [[star pasties]] are common shapes.
white headwear: This tag has been deprecated for being too broad. Use a more specific tag like [[white hat]], [[white hairband]], etc.
white rose: One of the most popular color of roses across the world, representing purity and innocence.
thigh boots: [[Boots]] that are roughly thigh-high. Thigh boots extend over the knee to at least mid-thigh level, sometimes up to crotch level.
scenery:
An image that pays special attention to the scene or landscape of its composition, usually favoring it over any [[no humans|characters]] present. 

Relevant images may feature intricate [[cityscape]]s, [[landscape]]s, [[architecture]], [[building]]s, [[nature|natural features]] or even [[ruins]] and [[loaded_interior|finely-detailed]] [[indoors|interiors]], among similar concepts.
nipple rings:
A ring-shaped [[nipple piercing]]. Use this if the piercing forms a closed loop of rigid material between both points of insertion into the skin. If it is not a complete loop, or the loop is completed by non-rigid material such as chain, it should likely be tagged as [[nipple bar]] (and possibly [[nipple jewelry]]) instead.

Sometimes depicted with something attached to it, such as [[nipple jewelry]], a [[nipple chain]], [[nipple weights]], or [[used condom]].

Do [i]not[/i] use when the rings are around the [[nipples|nipple]] and not embedded in it as a [[piercing]] would be. Use [[nipple sleeves]] in this case.
reverse cowgirl position:
A sexual position in which the penetrating partner is lying down and the receiving partner is [[straddling]] them while facing away from their partner. The penetrating partner can be a man, futanari, woman with a strap-on, etc.

When the receiving partner is facing towards the penetrating partner they are straddling, use [[cowgirl position]]. If the penetrating partner is sitting upright, use [[reverse upright straddle]].
panties aside:
Panties pushed slightly aside so that the genitals are exposed.  This way penetrative [[sex]] may be had without pulling the undergarment down or completely off.

Not to be confused with [[panty pull]], which is for panties that are pulled down to the thighs.  May involve a [[panty lift]], pulling the waistband to tug them aside.
spacesuit: A special garment encompassing the whole body to keep the wearer safe from the rigours of outer space (vacuum, temperature, radiation, and so on). Space suits in sci-fi settings are usually much less bulky than those IRL.
arm grab: Ambiguous, use [[holding own arm]] or [[grabbing another's arm]].
gloves: A covering for the hands, or for the hand and wrist, with a separate sheath or opening for each finger.  Should have at least a separate opening or sheath for at least one finger, excluding the thumb.
bound: Tied up or restrained, whether sexually or non-sexually.
border:
When a picture has a border along its sides. Most often, this is a simple solid color border on all four sides. See [[ornate border]] for more complex borders.

See [[outside border]] for when a character is drawn above the image's border.

Note that [[letterboxed]] and [[pillarboxed]] do not count as borders. However [[outside border]] may be used with them.
pale skin:
Having skin that is [b]significantly[/b] lighter in tone than the usual Caucasian/Asian skintone, or skin which appears "bleached," lacking in color. For characters with completely white skin, use [[white skin]].

Pale skin, in most cultures, is associated with nobility since they did not spend a lot of time outside and did not get the [[tan|tanned]] skin the commoners have.

A good example of a character usually drawn with pale skin is [[Ayanami Rei]].
H4. Examples
* !post #8664720: Left: pale skin | Right: not pale
airship:
A type of fantasy [[aircraft]] or [[spacecraft]] from the [[fantasy]] or [[science fiction]] genres. Often, airships look similar to real [[ship]]s, except flying in the air or space through magical or fantastical means. For reference, the [[Palanquin ship]] and the [[Yamato (uchuu senkan yamato)|Space Battleship Yamato]] are the archtypical example of an airship.

This tag is not for real life blimps, but for fictional flying ships. For real life blimps, use [[dirigible]]. When in doubt, or when the vehicle exhibit characteristic of both vehicle types, apply both [[dirigible]] and [[airship]], or just use the [[aircraft]] tag.

[[Flying boat]]s are not to be confused with airships; they are a variation of [[seaplane]].
upper body:
An image of the upper body of the character, approximately from the navel up. This may or may not include the head. 

[b]Bust[/b] is an aliased term for this tag, and is not to be confused with [[breasts]].
trembling:
Trembling is a reflex motion caused by cold, fear, or excitement. It can also denote instability.

Often depicted in art with short, wavy [[motion lines]] surrounding the outline of the body. (see post #1630828)
Sharper, less subtle lines depict [[twitching]], which is more violent and momentary.

Not to be confused with [[^^^]], which expresses reaction.
rifle:
A long [[gun|firearm]] designed to be [[firing|fired]] from the shoulder, with a barrel that has a helical pattern of grooves ("rifling") cut into the barrel walls. The [[rifling]] causes the speeding [[bullet]] to spin, giving it more stability and penetrating power.

This tag also applies to a [b]carbine[/b], which is basically the shorter variant of a rifle.
ass grab: See [[grabbing own ass]] or [[grabbing another's ass]].
doggystyle:
A [[sex]] position where the receiving partner rests on [[all fours]] while being [[sex from behind|penetrated from behind]].

Don't use if the character isn't on [[all fours]] or close to it. Use [[sex from behind]] instead.
dove:
For tagging purposes, this tag refers to the white or mostly white birds, such as the "dove of peace" that is commonly associated with the term "dove." 

The term dove is frequently used interchangeably with the term pigeon.  When used more specifically, the term refers to smaller members of the bird family Columbidae, whose members are referred to by either the terms dove or pigeon. Members of this family fall under two major groups based on their diet, with one group predominately eating see
rose:
A type of [[flower]] associated with romance, and it is a traditional gift given to a loved one. Each color a rose can be in has specific symbolism as well.

[[Red Rose]]s: Red roses are the traditional symbol for love and romance. The red rose has long symbolized beauty and perfection. A bouquet of red roses is the perfect way to express your deep feelings for someone special.

[[Pink Rose]]s: As a symbol of grace and elegance, the pink rose is often given as an expression of admiration. Pink roses can also convey appreciation as well as joyfulness. Pink rose bouquets often impart a gentler meaning than their red counterparts.

[[Yellow Rose]]s: Yellow roses evokes a feeling of warmth and happiness. The warm feelings associated with the yellow rose are often akin to those shared with a true friend.

[[Orange Rose]]s: Orange roses are the embodiment of desire and enthusiasm. Orange roses often symbolize passion and excitement and are an expression of fervent romance. 

[[White Rose]]s: Represents purity and innocence. Can also symbolize honor and reverence. Arrangements of White Roses are used to express remembrance.

[[Purple Rose]]s: With their fantastical appearance, lavender roses are a perfect symbol of enchantment. The lavender rose is also traditionally used to express feelings of love at first sight.

[[Black Rose]]: Black roses do not naturally occur in nature. In fiction, they can represent a tragic romance and symbolizes death, hatred, and farewell. If one is about to embark on a long journey that are unlikely to return from, they might be given a black rose as a farewell.

Other roses not seen in nature but are tagged on Danbooru include [[Blue Rose]]s, [[Brown Rose]]s, [[Golden Rose]]s, [[Green Rose]]s, [[Grey Rose]]s, and [[Multicolored Rose]]s. 

Note that the Pixiv tag "バラ" (read "[[bara]]"), which is literally translated as "rose", is more often used to tag any [[yaoi]] or [[bara]] content, and as such only apply this tag with the actual flower is seen.
pink choker:
A [[choker]] that is colored [[pink]].

There may be potential overlap between this tag and similarly colored chokers like [[red choker]] or [[purple choker]].
ahoge:
アホ毛, literally, "stupid hair". A single (usually short and fat) lock of hair that sticks out of a character's head. 

Add [[expressive hair]] if the ahoge changes shape due to a character's emotion or state.

* Use [[cowlick]] instead if it's small and less stylized.
* Use [[antenna hair]] instead if there's  two or more thin locks of hair as opposed to only one.
* [i]NOT[/i] to be confused with [[ahegao]].
petticoat: A women's undergarment consisting of material draped from the waist and worn under a skirt or dress. It has two purposes: to keep the skirt from riding up (like a [[slip]]) and to add fullness to the skirt. For the latter reason, petticoats are often heavily ruffled and comprise multiple layers. Wearing a petticoat low enough for the lace edge to be visible is a common feature of [[lolita fashion]].
anal hair: Hair growing from the [[anus|anal area]]. Typically not included in illustrations, even those with [[excessive_pubic_hair|extensive]] [[pubic hair]].
white neckwear: Do not use this tag. Instead use a more specific tags like [[white necktie]], [[white ascot]], [[white bowtie]], [[white neckerchief]] or [[white ribbon]] (for [[neck ribbon]]s).
aqua eyes:
A character with blue-green colored eyes.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as the lighting on the characters) there is an overlap between this tag, the [[blue eyes]], and the [[green eyes]] tags.
futanari:
A female character with male genitalia.

In the context of Danbooru, the image does not need to directly show whether or not they have female genitalia. If you can visually confirm the lack of a [[pussy|vagina]], tag [[futa without pussy]]. If you can visually confirm a vagina, [[penis]], and [[testicles]], tag [[full-package futanari]].

It is [b]not[/b] related to real transgender or intersex, but is a purely fantasy-based depiction of hermaphroditism.

Futanari is not to be tagged with either [[hetero]], [[yuri]] or [[yaoi]].
frilled skirt: A [[skirt]] with [[frills]]. Don't confuse with [[frilled dress]].
tail:
A long appendage protruding from the lower back. Often covered in fur or scales. A common feature of animal girls.

In general, don't tag this on an [[animal]] unless there's something special or noteworthy about the tail, such as one of the many tags below that implicate this tag like [[heart tail]] or [[holding with tail]], or if the image is focused on the tail. Definitely don't tag an animal with a tail of its own type, like tagging [[cat tail]] on a [[cat]]. (Do tag weird combos like a [[rabbit tail]] on a [[cat]], though.)
purple background: Backgrounds with a solid or predominantly [[purple]] or [[lavender]] color. Can also apply to [[gradient background]] in conjunction with another background color.
cyberpunk:
A [[science fiction]] genre. Basic themes include the dehumanizing effects of technology, and the accompanying societal breakdown. Think dark and dirty, with lots of [[wire]]s and [[neon lights|neon]].

[b]Cyberpunk[/b] is a postmodern dystopian genre noted for its focus on [b]”high tech and low life"[/b]. The name is a portmanteau of cybernetics and punk, and was originally coined by American science fiction author Bruce Bethke as the title of his short Sci-Fi story [i]Cyberpunk[/i], written in 1980.

Cyberpunk can cover numerous themes and motifs but generally involve reflecting on the current anxieties of society and amping them up to an extreme; things like mass surveillance, corporate monopolization, climate change, mass media, artificial intelligence and any other themes can thus be accomodated by a cyberpunk setting.

For the series of the same name, see [[Cyberpunk (series)]].
city: A relatively large and permanent settlement. Cities generally have complex systems for sanitation, utilities, land usage, housing, and transportation. The concentration of development greatly facilitates interaction between people and businesses, benefiting both parties in the process. A big city or metropolis usually has associated suburbs and exurbs. Such cities are usually associated with metropolitan areas and urban areas, creating numerous business commuters traveling to urban centers for employment. Once a city expands far enough to reach another city, this region can be deemed a conurbation or megalopolis.
headset:
A set of [[headphones]] with an attached [[microphone]]. The headphones are usually small and sometimes cover only one ear, while the microphone is usually a small flexible tube that sits in front of the mouth.

Headsets are often used by customer service employees, by [[idol]]s performing onstage, and by [[military operator]]s for communications.
girl on top: For any situation (not necessarily sexual) where a girl is on top of another character.
nosebleed: [[Blood]] issuing from the nose as if someone were aroused or had their nose broken somehow. If the post has the latter case, tag it with [[injury]].
anus: The external opening of the rectum.
holding gun:
A [[gun]] being [[holding|held]] by a character.

Do not use for [[water gun|water guns]]. Use [[holding water gun]] instead.
stairs: A device composed of elevated stationary platforms that takes a person or object from one place to another, either higher or lower.
glowing eye:
A single eye that is radiating with light. Usually caused by supernatural or scientific occurrences. 

For the case where both eyes glow, see [[glowing eyes]].
leaf hair ornament:
A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like any type of [[leaf]].

For when a leaf is resting on top of the head, not being worn in the hair, see [[leaf on head]]. This is often associated with [[tanuki]] and [[kitsune]].

For when the hair is made of leaves instead see [[plant hair]].

For when a character is wearing a crown of leaves, see [[laurel crown]].
futa with female:
Images depicting at least one [[futanari]] and one female engaged in sexual interactions. 

This tag and [[yuri]] are mutually exclusive. The only exceptions are if the post also contains yuri interactions, e.g. post #851759.

If you can't see the genitals of one or more of the females involved, use the rule of "fully female until proven otherwise," and consider the tag [[implied futanari]] instead.
detached sleeves:
Sleeves that are detached from the main upper garment. 

Detached sleeves can be used with [[sleeveless]] or [[strapless]] outfits, since both tags only refer to the torso garment, which lacks attached sleeves.
breasts:
An image where the breasts are noticeable.

This tag should not be used for [[flat chest|flat-chested]] characters.
animal ear fluff:
A distinct soft-looking fuzz that protrudes from the inside of [[animal ears]]. It is usually white in colouration, often resembling tufts of cotton, but can also take the form of swept fur that is faded in color.

Most common with [[fox ears]], but can be present in any type of [[animal ears]].

This tag may be used for actual [[animal]]s' ears as well.
scarf:
A garment that consists of a thin cloth far longer than it is wide. The actual length tends to vary. The garment is typically worn wrapped around the neck during the fall or winter when it is cold out.

Known to be worn by ninjas as a sort of trademark.
sex toy: A toy or device used for personal sexual purposes. Sex toys are usually designed for [[masturbation]], but they may also be used with a partner.
legs up: Any position in which both [[legs]] are thrust upward into the air, rather than resting on a surface.
shotgun shell:
[[Ammunition]] for [[shotgun]], also known as [b]shotshell[/b]. Tubular in shape and has brass base, the shell is often made of plastic with various colors. It contains various type of projectiles, such as pellets that spread out against close range targets, or solid slug.
* Use this tag whenever a shotshell is visible in the image. They often appear tucked into a [[bandolier]], so consider tagging the two together. 
* Use [[shell casing]] if it has been fired and is now empty. Also use [[casi
skyscraper: A large, continuously habitable [[building]] with multiple floors. In modern sources, the height of a skyscraper is defined as being at least 100 meters or 150 meters, but there is no universally accepted definition. Historically, when these types of buildings began to be built in the 1880s, the term first referred to buildings of 10 to 20 stories. Skyscrapers include [[office]]s, [[hotel]]s, residential space, and retail space.
object insertion:
When an [i]inanimate[/i] object, such as a [[vibrator]], [[dildo]], a [[carrot]], etc., is inserted either [[vaginal object insertion|vaginally]] or [[anal object insertion|anally]].

This does not apply to a [[penis]] being inserted; use the [[sex]] tag for that. It also does not apply to other body parts, such as fingers or tentacles. For tentacles, use [[tentacle sex]].
extra ears:
A character possessing both human ears and [[animal ears]].

[[Fake animal ears]] do not count.

For a character with more than one pair of animal ears, see [[multiple animal ears]].
white shorts: Any style of [[shorts]] that are colored [[white]].
twintails:
A hair style where the hair is tied into sections forming two ponytails. The Japanese term for this type of hair style is ツインテール (twin tail).

All of the hair must be tied into two pigtails for this tag to count. If any hair outside of the bangs/[[sidelocks]] falls normally, it is [[two side up]] instead.

Not to be confused with [[multiple tails]] which relates to beings with more than one tail of the animal variety.
large breasts:
[[Breasts]] that are larger than [[medium breasts]] but smaller than [[huge breasts]].

Around/more than the same volume as a sphere with the same diameter as the character's face, but smaller than their head.
curtains: Curtains are sheets of cloth used for privacy and to block light, usually hung over [[window|windows]].
red hair:
Hair that is colored red.

Not to be confused with what is known as "red hair":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_hair in real life.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as the lighting on the characters) there is an overlap between this tag, the [[orange hair]], and the [[brown hair]] tags.
suspension:
A [[bondage]] position in which the subject is hanging from one or more restraints, whether the body is in contact with the ground or not.
For non-bondage forms of suspension, see [[hanging]].
burn scar:
A [[scar]] produced after healing from a severe burn.

Unlike scars produced by [[cuts]], these types of scars tend to have irregular shapes and are frequently wider and larger.
pregnant:
The state of having a [[baby]] growing in the [[uterus]].

Not to be confused with [[inflation]].

Use this tag only when the character has a visibly pregnant belly. Do not use it when the character is merely holding a positive [[pregnancy test]].
asphyxiation:
When a person is unable to breathe for any reason; suffocation.

This includes [[choking on object]]s (such as food), [[drowning]], being [[strangling|strangled]] by another person, or anything else that restricts breathing.

This also includes characters who have asphyxiated to [[death]].
clothes writing:
Clothing that has writing on it, such as [[english text|English]], Japanese, [[korean text|Korean]], and so on.

Do not confuse this tag with [[name tag]].
ruins: Man-made constructions that once stood tall, but have [[broken]] and degraded with time due to being [[abandoned]]. A staple of any good [[post-apocalypse]] themed picture or series.
light particles:
Light particles are either glowing or illuminating objects, usually very small in size and come in clusters, added to enhance an image or for special effects. (See post #7448569, post #6228) Normally can be seen along with ray of light coming from a window. (emulating the effect when light struck against dust particles in real life)

Also used for light circles in charging or accumulating power for energy-based weapons, spells and the likes. (See post #927612)

Use [[ashes]], [[powder]], [[debris]], or some related tag if the particles do not glow. If it is a considerably large, tag [[sparkle]] instead.
incoming attack: A character ready to attack the viewer.
eyeliner:
A type of eye [[makeup]]. Eyeliner is applied in a line along or near the lash line to define the eyes or create a cat eye effect.

Not to be confused with [[eyeshadow]], which is a colored powder applied to the eyelids.
cloud: A cloud is a mass of water vapor that floats in the [[sky]].
flipped hair:
When hair is curled outward at the ends.

This is [b]not[/b] for character's tossing their hair with their hand. For that, use [[hair flip]].

Note that this tag can be used with [[flipped bangs]] or [[flipped sidelocks]] if both apply.
realistic:
Art with a more realistic approach to its anatomy, proportion, lighting and so on.

Use [[photorealistic]] for posts so realistic they could be mistaken for photographs.
snake hair ornament:
A hair ornament in the shape of a snake.

Most commonly seen on danbooru as worn by [[Kochiya Sanae]] of the [[Touhou]] series, along with another [[frog hair ornament|frog-shaped one]]. In her case it is generally assumed to be a symbol of [[Yasaka Kanako]].
monochrome:
An image drawn in predominantly one color. It doesn't have to be just black and white; it could be another color such as [[red theme|red]], [[blue theme|blue]], [[green theme|green]], etc.

If the image uses more than just black and white and uses more shades of grey, also tag with [[greyscale]]. For non-[[greyscale]] monochrome pictures, add the appropriate color tag, such as [[red theme]], [[blue theme]], [[green theme]] etc.

[[Monochrome]] and [[partially colored]] are mutually exclusive. For monochrome pictures with just a bit of color, use [[monochrome]] and [[spot color]] together. If the image has a range of colors but appears grayed out or washed out, see [[muted color]] and [[pale color]].

[[Comic]]s and [[doujinshi]] are often monochrome.
collarbone: Describes images depicting characters with fully or partially exposed collarbones (clavicles).
looking at viewer:
When a character is making direct eye contact with the viewer. (i.e. simply looking at the camera/through the fourth wall)

Don't confuse with [[eye contact]], which relates to characters making eye contact amongst themselves.

Don't confuse with [[facing viewer]], which should be used when the eyes are closed, covered (e.g. with a [[blindfold]]), or looking at another direction.
bag:
A flexible container made of cloth, paper, plastic often used for transporting goods.
H4. Types
huge breasts:
[[Breasts]] that are larger than [[large breasts]] but smaller than [[gigantic breasts]].

As large as/larger than the character's head but less than twice the size of their head.
animal ears:
A character with animal ears, real or [[fake animal ears|fake]]. Also known as [i]kemonomimi[/i]. Do not use this tag for pictures of actual [[animal]]s. 

There are two areas where animal ears are usually placed. On top of the head and on the sides of the head (where a human's ears would be). The first type is much easier to [[fake_animal_ears|accessorize]] but anatomically incorrect. The inverse is true for the second type. The first type is most likely to have [[extra_ears|extra human ears]]. For the second type, "extra ears" usually means a redundant accessory.
pagoda: A pagoda is the general term in the English language for a tiered tower with multiple eaves common in China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, and other parts of Asia.
pink hair:
Hair that is colored pink, an intermediate color between red and white.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as the lighting on the characters) there is an overlap between this tag and the [[purple hair]] and [[red hair]] tags.
bubble: Usually refers to a soap bubble, which is a very thin film of soapy water that forms a sphere with an iridescent surface. However, this term can also applied to any type of bubble, including [[chewing gum]] and [[air_bubble|air bubbles]] [[underwater]].
fundoshi:
The traditional Japanese breechcloth.

Both [[loincloth]] and [[fundoshi]] nowadays are used as festival clothing (usually with [[happi]], or alone) , as a [[swimsuit]] (when worn at the [[beach]]) and occasionally, as [[underwear]] (usually worn under [[kimono]], or [[Japanese armor]] etc). Make sure to use the appropriate tag when tagging them.
twitter username:
A line in or notation on the image that gives out a [[Twitter]] account (usually one belonging to the artist). 

May be used as an alternative to [[signature|signing]] the image if the [[artist_name|name]] is associated with a profile of the artist. May also be a [[Pawoo username]] or other username; the artist entry should be checked to match their profiles.
sex from behind:
[[Sex]] from a rear position. This includes [[doggystyle]] (sex on [[all fours]]), the [[prone bone]] position, sex while [[bent over]], [[standing sex]] from behind, and any other position from behind.

If there are multiple people conducting this activity at the same time it may also be considered a [[love train]].
necktie: A long piece of cloth worn tied around the neck.  Neckties are often worn with formal clothes such as [[suit]]s or [[tuxedo]]s. With the latter, a [[bowtie]] is often worn instead.
anal object insertion:
When any inanimate object, such as a [[vibrator]], [[dildo]], a [[carrot]], etc., is inserted into the [[anal|anus]].

This does not apply to a [[penis]] being inserted; use the [[sex]] tag for that. It also does not apply to other body parts, such as [[anal fingering|fingers]], being inserted. It also does not apply to [[tentacles]] - use [[tentacle sex]] for that.
kumoi ichirin:
The "Guarding and Guarded Giant Wheel".

Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]].

A youkai with the ability to use her [i]nyūdō[/i] partner [[Unzan]] in combat. She is one of the followers of [[Hijiri Byakuren]], whom she is trying to free. Ichirin is a [[Buddhist nun]], wearing a black [[kesa]], a blue [[hood]] and a red [[pendant]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair]]. In her hands, she holds a golden [[ring]]/[[hoop]].

Appears to have developed a competitive rivalry and friendship with [[Mononobe no Futo]] as a result of their partnership in [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]].
shiny hair:
Hair that has a glossy sheen due to a light source shining on it.

This tag has been deprecated, as it would apply to most posts with visible hair.

For the old-styled hard-edge shading technique that makes hair look "shiny" like in post #5648115, [[anime coloring]] might be applicable.
big belly:
A [[stomach]] that is noticeably large, as if decisively full, [[fat]], or [[pregnant]]. Commonly used when depicting a character that has eaten a great deal of food ([[bloated]]). Not necessary when depicting [[pregnant|pregnancy]] unless the character's belly is very large even in spite of their current condition. Can be used in indecisive cases where it's not clear if the character is actually pregnant.

For a [[midriff]] that is only somewhat [[plump]] or flabby, use [[belly]] instead. Avoid using both [[belly]] and [[big belly]], as they generally do not overlap.
x-ray:
Seeing inside or through a normally opaque barrier, as if by x-ray vision. Examples: skin, bone, armor, metal containers, concrete walls...

Typically rendered as a partially transparent overlay, or a cut-out. The internal and external views should always be overlapping. Rule of thumb: It's [[x-ray]] if Superman could see it with x-ray vision.

Use [[x-ray film]] for the images taken with actual [[x-ray machine]]s (or any medical device that takes cross-section images).
after vaginal:
The aftermath of [[vaginal|vaginal penetration]], be it from a [[penis]] or a [[sex toy]]. See [[after sex]] for guidelines on what to look for.

Try not to confuse this with [[imminent vaginal]], which may look similar to this in small thumbnails.

This and [[vaginal]] contextually shouldn't occur at the same time, but it's possible in a [[comic]] where vaginal sex is occurring in one panel, then the next panel has the aftermath.

h6.Examples

* post #2090516
* post #956079
bikini:
A bikini is a two-piece swimsuit for women, typically comprising a bra-like top and a panty-like bottom; however, the bottom can also be in the style of a [[bikini skirt]] or [[bikini shorts]].

Bikinis come in a wide range of styles, with most designed to reveal more of the body, especially around the [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]].

The key distinguishing feature of a bikini is that it prominently exposes the [[midriff]], whereas other types of two-piece swimsuits may have a higher waistline and/or a top that extends further to cover the area. However, it's worth noting that most modern two-piece swimsuits are, in fact, bikinis.

If only the bra portion of the bikini is worn, use [[bikini top only]]. Likewise, use [[bikini bottom only]] when only the panty portion is worn. If a character's bikini top and bottom don't match, use [[mismatched bikini]].
pendant:
Whereas a [[necklace]] is a chain of jewelry, a pendant is a piece of jewelry that is attached to a necklace, as to be the centerpiece.
See [[charm (object)]] for more general term covering hanging ornaments aside from neckwear.
cum in ass: The act of [[ejaculation|ejaculating]], or having ejaculated, inside the [[ass]].
holding pole: Grabbing or holding on to a [[pole]].
white border:
An image that has a [[white]]-colored [[border]] surrounding its edges.

When tagging, make sure to view the original image, as images with [[transparent_border]] are previewed with a white border.
taur:
A character having the full body of an animal, but with a humanoid torso where the animal's head would be.

[[Lamia]]s, [[harpy|harpies]], [[mermaid]]s and similar [b]usually[/b] do not apply, because their lower body is not a full monster body. There are exceptions (see below).
blue headwear: This tag has been deprecated for being too broad. Use a more specific tag like [[blue hat]], [[blue hairband]], etc.
street:
A paved [[road]] in a [[city]] environment, usually designed for both vehicle and pedestrian traffic.

A street is a type of [[road]]. The difference between a road and a street is that [[road]] is for all types of roads, including [[highway]]s and [[dirt road]]s outside of cities, while a street generally refers to a paved road in a city. A street is usually designed to accommodate both vehicle and pedestrian traffic, with intersections, [[traffic light]]s, [[sidewalk]]s, and [[crosswalk]]s. A [[highway]] is usually designed only for high-speed or long distance vehicle traffic and doesn't have these features.

A street can be unpaved dirt, but is most often paved with a hard, durable surface such as asphalt, concrete, cobblestone or brick.
blush:
1. A rosy color in the cheeks. Sometimes indicates sexual arousal.
2. A sudden reddening of the face, as from [[embarrassed|embarrassment]], guilt, shame or modesty.

Not to be confused with [[body blush]], which refers to body parts other than the face.
standing:
One or more characters are standing. Their bodies are being supported by both of their feet, or by either foot.

Most often, standing characters are absolutely upright. Search for {{standing bent_over}} or {{standing leaning_forward}} when they are not.

This tag is still applicable where the character is in the middle of certain actions that keep upright posture such as [[walking]].
long sleeves:
Sleeves that cover the arms to at least the wrists. 

[[Detached sleeves]] may still apply if the sleeves begin at least from the middle of upper arms.
virtual youtuber:
A [b]Virtual YouTuber[/b], sometimes called [b]VTuber[/b], is a content creator and personality that utilizes a 3D or 2D digital avatar for online videos and/or [[livestream]]ing, often assuming a character as well. Despite the name, content is not limited to [[YouTube]], and often, a VTuber is someone who declares themselves as such.

The term was first popularized by [[Kizuna Ai]], who called herself "the world's first virtual YouTuber". Many others followed suit, and the explosion in popularity of the practice lead the term to be used even outside of [[YouTube]], though variations on the term have been introduced as to diminish the use of the brand name, including "VTuber", "Virtual Singer"/"VSinger" (for those that exclusively do music, not be confused with [[VSinger (Vocaloid)|Vocaloid China]]), and "Virtual Liver"/"VLiver" (specifically referring to virtual streamers) or "Virtual Streamer"/"VStreamer" (due to the former term reminding folks of the organ in English). In Chinese, the term "Virtual Uploader"/"VUP" is used more commonly alongside "VTuber", after being first coined by [[Xiao Xi]] on [[Bilibili]]. In English, terms such as "PNGTuber" and "GIFTuber" also exist to refer to VTubers whose models use those formats, now that they are no longer the norm among indies (that had no access to 3D models back in the day). In Japan, the term "VLiver" is also used to refer creators and companies in the 'walled garden app' niche, such as [[IRIAM]] and [[AniLive]], apps which viewers use to watch VTubers who stream exclusively on them.

This tag should apply to not only virtual YouTubers themselves, but also to [[parody|parodies]] of virtual YouTubers, references to them, fictitious virtual YouTubers, fake virtual YouTubers, and concept art that ultimately isn't used (for the latter three, [code]original[/code] should be used). While tagging mascots and staff with the tag is fine, family members and friends of VTubers don't apply, unless they too are VTubers, nor do things merely associated with VTubers.
striped:
This tag has been deprecated. See below for more specific striped tags.

* For clothes, use a tag for the specific type of clothing, such as [[striped shirt]].
* For striped skin or striped fur, see [[striped skin]] and [[striped fur]] respectively.
* For striped backgrounds, see [[striped background]].
black dress: A [[dress]] that is mainly [[black]] in color.
close-up: An image in which the subject is shown at very close range.
sagging breasts:
When [[breasts]] have a noticeable sag to their shape, as opposed to the unnaturally perky breasts that are common in anime.

Not to be used for breasts that are simply [[hanging breasts|hanging]] freely due to the character [[bent over|bending over]] or [[leaning forward]].

Note that [[small breasts]] can also have a saggy appearance to them, although this is less common.
vibrator under panties:
A [[vibrator]] worn beneath the [[panties]]. Commonly associated with [[bdsm]] practices or [[public indecency]] [[exhibitionism]].

Also tag as [[dildo under panties]] if the vibrator is shaped as a dildo.
rape:
Forced penetration and other sexual acts on an unwilling participant. The unwilling participant is often visibly unhappy, in [[pain]], distressed, [[crying]], or [[scared]].

Per topic #1489, when a woman is raping a man, use [[femdom]] and [[rape]] together.

The opposite of this is [[happy sex]].
giantess:
A female [[giant]]. Basically this means any female character who appears significantly larger than her normal-sized surroundings.

They are usually depicted in a specific fetish involving them causing [[destruction]] to their surroundings.
flying: The act of being in or moving through the air with the help of a propulsion system (usually wings, a magic broom or a mechanical device) or being hurled to the air for some distance by either a person or hit by something.
underwater:
An image that is shot from underwater, or that takes place completely underwater.

If the image is halfway below the water level, use [[partially underwater shot]] instead.
after sex:
After the act of [[sex|intercourse]] is finished. Telltale signs include [[used tissue|used tissues]] and [[used condom|used condoms]], [[cum]] [[cumdrip|dripping]] out of any particular orifice, and heavy [[blush|blushing]].

Sometimes a character will [[smoking|light up]] a [[cigarette]] while the other [[crying|cries]]. This occurs when a character is [[ruined for marriage]].

If the persons involved are still emotionally focused on each other, and it seems that the sex still hasn't really finished, but is merely winding down, then [[afterglow]] should be used instead. Also note that, while they can coexist, these two tags tend to be mutually exclusive due to reasons of conflicting mood and style.

Try not to confuse this with [[imminent penetration]], which are the moments immediately before sex occurs.
no hat: This tag has been moved to [[no_headwear]].
fingerless gloves: Any kind of [[gloves]] which do not completely cover up the fingers. Typically designed to protect the user's palm while also keeping the grip of a bare hand.
dress:
A one-piece garment worn on the torso and that hangs down over the legs. It consists of a bodice (the top part) attached to a skirt (the bottom).

Not to be confused with [[skirt]]. A dress is a single piece of clothing, while a [[skirt]] is a separate piece of clothing. Dresses should not be tagged with [[skirt]].
collar:
A band worn around the neck as a fashion accessory.

This tag is for standalone collars not part of a shirt. Do not use this tag for [[collared shirt]]s, [[collared dress]]es, [[wing collar]]s, [[sailor collar]]s, etc.

Not to be confused with a [[choker]], which is usually tighter-fitting and made of thinner material.
temple:
Generally, a place of worship other than a [[church]] or [[Shinto]] [[shrine]].

Do not use this tag when unsure if the building depicted is a place of worship at all. Instead describe the structure and other elements using other tags such as [[east asian architecture]], [[pagoda]], [[greco-roman architecture]], [[column]], [[arch]], etc.
nipple piercing:
A [[piercing]] through the nipple. The most common types of nipple piercings are [[nipple bar]]s or [[nipple rings]]. Illustrations without [[covered nipples]] should include [[nipples]] when visible.

Objects that fit around the nipple instead of piercing them are [[nipple sleeves]].
ponytail:
A hairstyle in which most or all of the hair is gathered at the back of the head and secured with a [[hair tie]], [[scrunchie]] or similar device, and allowed to hang freely from that point.

This tag is for plain ponytails at the back of the head. Do not use this tag for [[side ponytail]]s or [[braided ponytail]]s.
fang:
A character with a single, white, prominent canine tooth.

Distinct from [[fangs]], which are multiple prominent canine teeth, such as [[vampire]] or animal fangs.

Distinct from [[skin fang]], a single fang colored the same as the skin around a character's mouth.

Distinct from [[sharp teeth]], where [b]all[/b] of a character's teeth are sharp.

Opposite of [[tusks]] which are typically larger lower teeth, usually on [[orc]]s.
star (sky): Cosmic bodies that can be seen during the [[night]] / [[night sky]].
fat rolls:
A subject with several creased, roll-shaped deposits of fat on their [[stomach]] as a result of higher-than-normal weight/plumpness. Do not use this tag for single creases in the abdominal area unless there is an excess of fat, as those are natural of any non-anorexic body type.

[[Fat rolls]] are usually a good indication of [[plump]] or [[fat]], but one does not necessarily imply "the":[/posts/4603675] "other":[/posts/3371313].

h5. Bad examples
