bara:
Bara ("Gei komi'":[https://www.fujoshi.info/geikomi] in Japan) is a Japanese genre of manga and art (usually) by and for gay and bisexual men. With heavy focus on the masculine features and appeal of [[mature male|men]]. 

While mostly dependent on an artist's personal tastes, the ‘bara’ archetype features 3 main body types:
* Bear-type bodies, (typically tagged as [[plump]] or [[fat]]), are generally softer and rounder looking, with varying degrees of visible musculature.
- Artists: [[Suv (suv032)|]], [[Kuro nezumi inu]], [[Tevit (tevit15)|]].

* Hunks/Jocks or [[muscular|Muscular-type]] bodies, in contrast to the chiseled [[v-taper | triangular look]] of professional bodybuilders, have defined musculature that is usually more proportional overall, similar to that of athletic "strongman":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strongman], with a [[strongman waist | wider waist]] ("comparison":[https://cdn.donmai.us/original/e8/4f/e84f5efad6fd9ef1ff268d1982a564d6.jpg]), though the more [[shredded muscle | chiseled]] appearance can be a stylistic choice (see [[Nikism]] for reference).
- Artists: [[Tarutoru]], [[Crow (siranui)|]], [[Dopey (dopq)|]].

* Twunk or otter-type bodies, tagged [[toned]], [i]or[/i] [[muscular]] (especially with younger or sometimes older [[mature male]]s). 
- Artists: [[itto_(mentaiko)|Mentaiko]], [[Homri]], [[Torakichi (ebitendon)|]], [[Kuroshinki]]. 

Musculature, when depicted, is typically more exaggerated for emphasis (e.g. [[pectorals|pecs]]) along with the [[bulge]] (implying an exaggerated penis size), and both are usually rather noticeable even when the subject is wearing clothes -  abnormally so. When this exaggeration is paired with the points above, which assert a softer approach when drawing the male form, the 'bara' archetype becomes noticeable.

Common masculine features on subjects include: different degrees of [[facial hair|facial]] and [[body hair]] (especially the [[navel hair|happy trail]] leading to [[male pubic hair|pubic hair]]) - or a complete absence of it in the case of younger characters (depending on the artist's tastes), [[thick eyebrows|thick]], [[eyebrow cut|cut]] or [[forked eyebrows|bushy eyebrows]], [[sideburns]], [[buzz cut]], [[large hands]], [[scar]]s, [[tattoo]]s, [[bandaid]]s, [[bandage]]s, [[wrinkled skin|wrinkles]] (visible with [[mature male|mature]] and [[old man|old]] men), etc.

All of these characteristics lend the style a degree of flexibility that allows for further stylization as well as broader cultural mixing between communities; for instance, despite bara’s roots in opposition to them, there is substantial cross-over with the larger [[yaoi|Boys' Love]] community - which can be seen in some artists' styles (E.g [[Yotti]], [[Arima (arima_bn)|]]). It can also be applied to non-human and humanoid characters, such as [[furry male]]s  (E.g [[Wafu (youzora_samo18)|]], [[Boogbogex]]).

[expand= History and meaning]

The word "bara" literally means "rose" in Japanese. The term originally comes from the magazine "Barazoku":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barazoku], Japan's first gay men's magazine, with the term traditionally referring to more [[bishounen]]-esque men. As a result, the word "bara" also began being used as a slang term for any male homoerotic works in general (similar to the use of [[yaoi]] in the West).

The word "bara" as used here is primarily Western, stemming more from its application on art more commonly known as "gei komi", "gei manga", or "mens love" in Japan, a practice that began on Japanese imageboards, where they intentionally misappropriated the term, this interpretation later being exported abroad. Whilst some Japanese gei komi creators oppose the usage of "bara" due to its earlier legacy, others have embraced it. Note that, like most Manga Demographics, bara is commonly defined in terms of the target audience, not the authors or the subject matter.

Bara conceptually often contrasts with yaoi, which is gay male media traditionally made by heterosexual women to appeal to other heterosexual women. Whereas bara is gay/bi male media made by gay/bi men for gay/bi men, that generally features romantic and sexual relationships between [[muscular]] [[mature male|mature men]] and realistic(ish) relationships, often including LGBTQ issues, [[yaoi]] generally features androgynous, idealized, effeminate characters and melodramatic plots devoid of LGBTQ issues (like most [[yuri]], for similar root reasons). By its nature, it is also heteronormative, whether by stereotypically depicting overly emotional relationships or using concepts such as "uke" and "seme," and includes themes of homosociality, which contributed more to the clash between fans of the two genres, though nowadays there's a grey area between the two. What they share in common the most though is the fact that non-Japanese audiences have misappropriated them, with yaoi having become a generalized weeb term for anything involving gay men.
 [/expand]
grey skin: Skin that is colored [[grey]]. Not to be confused with [[pale skin]].
embarrassed: Appearing self-conscious and uncomfortable, usually about one's self.
white kimono: A [[kimono]] that is colored [[white]]. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
wolf tail: Use this tag when a character has a [[wolf]]-like [[tail]].
nurse cap: A cap worn by female [[nurse]]s, sometimes adorned with a cross. The cap's original purpose was to keep the nurse's hair neatly in place and present a modest appearance. It all but disappeared by the late 1980s with the near universal adoption of [[medical scrubs]].
latex:
A substance found in some plants, or made artificially. It can be used to make natural rubber, which in turn can be used for clothing.

This tag refers to such "latex rubber" materials, usually in clothing. In appearance it is very [[shiny clothes|shiny]]/reflective, tough-looking, smooth, plastic-like, and usually [[skin tight]]. For danbooru purposes, PVC is synonymous.
cow ears: A character who has, or wears as a fashion accessory, cow ears (ushimimi) on their head.
clothes lift: Clothing that has been lifted up to reveal the [[breasts]] or crotch.
red background: Backgrounds with a solid or predominantly [[red]] color. Can also apply to [[gradient background]] in conjunction with another background color.
hair stick:
A [[hair ornament]] used to hold hair up or simply to be decorative, or both. It is [[stick]] shaped, long and usually narrow. The hair is wrapped around the hair stick and then pinned in place.

Hair sticks are extremely old and can be traced back to ancient China, Egypt, Greece and India. They can be as simple as a literal stick or branch, or highly intricate with lots of detail. 

For hair sticks with Chinese elements or dangle objects, use hair stick and [[Chinese hairpin]].
heart censor: A [[heart]] positioned in a way to make the image [[censored]].
condom in mouth: A person holding a [[condom]] in their mouth, either still in the [[condom wrapper|wrapper]] or already [[used condom|used]]. Usually a precursor or invitation towards sexual activity. Occasionally the condom is applied via [[fellatio]].

Ambigous tag, previously used to refer to religious garments, most commonly the religious garments worn by Christian [[nun]]s. However, habit here broadly refers to the whole range of garments which exist for those involved in religious institutions, whether it be the clergy or religious brothers and sisters. These garments are typically tagged using the religious position in question. For those tags, please go to:

no shoes: Wearing [[socks]], [[thighhighs]] or [[pantyhose]] but no shoes. If there is nothing covering the foot, use [[barefoot]] instead.
nipple slip: When the [[nipples]] are unwittingly exposed, usually caused by leaning over while wearing a loose shirt and not wearing a bra or by wearing [[tank top]]s. Not to be confused with [[see-through clothes]] or [[wet shirt]].
shaded face:
When the upper face or eyes are shadowed without a tangible light source.

Often used to convey a wide variety of negative emotions, such as [[disgust]], [[angry|anger]], shock, or sinister intentions. Can be used for comedic effect.

If only one side of the face is shaded, use [[partially shaded face]].

Do not use this tag when the character's face is shadowed simply because of a light source - use [[shade]] instead.
between breasts: When an object other than a [[penis]] fits or is pressed between the breasts. If it is a penis, use [[paizuri]] instead.
id card: Any type of card used for identification: student ids, driver's licenses, employee badges, and so on. Usually held by a [[lanyard]].
lip piercing:
A [[piercing]] through the [[lips|lip]]. 

See [[labret piercing]] for piercings below the lip.
side slit:
When a dress or skirt has a cutout slit. Either single or double and in some cases, accidental through fighting.

Most [[china_dress|China dresses]] come with a side slit.

If a dress or skirt has high slits on both sides, it may form a [[pelvic curtain]].
If the slit starts at the top of the skirt and doesn't go all the way down to the bottom, use [[hip vent]] instead.
cross:
A symbol or object that consists of two intersecting perpendicular lines, with one or both lines divided in half by the intersection.

Ancient religions used the cross as a symbol of the sun. Christianity uses it as a symbol representing the cross on which Jesus was crucified.

This tag refers to any cross-shaped symbol or physical object.
fake tail: When an object is used to simulate having a [[tail]]. These may be glued directly on the skin, sewn onto clothes or attached to [[tag group:sex objects|sex objects]].
ribbon-trimmed sleeves:
A type of sleeve decoration with a [[ribbon]] threaded in and out of slits in the fabric, resulting in a line of "dashes" by the hemline or cuff. 

Often appears on some traditional [[japanese clothes]] ([[miko]] outfits especially) as well as in [[lolita fashion]].
gauntlets:
A type of [[armor]] taking the form of padded, hardened, or metal gloves or mitts.  A typical gauntlet will have a cuff that partially extends over the forearm with a flared opening suitable for use in conjunction with other arm protection, such as vambraces. For tagging, if it looks like a metal glove or mitten, it's probably a gauntlet.

[u]Note[/u]: There are several senses of "gauntlet." For Danbooru purposes, use this tag only for the protective gear.  Not to be confused with [[bridal gauntlets]].

pov crotch: A [[POV]] image where the viewer's crotch is visible. The viewpoint is usually around crotch or chest level, with the viewer's crotch or lower body in frame.
handbag: A [[bag]] used for carrying money and small personal items or accessories. The outside is often decorated.
4boys:
An image depicting four male characters.

Dolls only count if they act on their own. Depictions of characters on paintings etc don't count unless it plays a major role in the work. If the presence of a character is only implicated it doesn't count.
panties around one leg: [[Panties]] that have been partially removed and are wrapped around only one leg.
sheath:
Scabbard, a container for a [[sword]] or other large blade. If it is a container for a gun use [[holster]] instead.

* When the sheath contains a weapon, use [[sheathed]].
* When the weapon is partially sheathed, consider using [[unsheathing]].
* When the sheath is visible but the weapon is completely out of the sheath already, use [[unsheathed]].
* Weapons covered in a cloth bag should use [[weapon bag]] instead.
crown: A ceremonial type of headgear traditionally worn by [[royal|royalty]].
blue shorts: Any style of [[shorts]] that are colored [[blue]].
shibari:
A type of elaborate Japanese [[rope]] [[bondage]]. Common features of shibari include intricate criss-crossed rope patterns tied around the body, ropes tied to apply pressure to a woman's breasts, and [[crotch rope]]s.

[b]Shibari[/b] is Japanese for "to tie", originally an art of tying rope around objects in a visually appealing way. In modern times, shibari is now used to describe stylized bondage. In this case, it refers to any of a variety of intricate body ties originating in Japan.
snow:
Precipitation consisting of crystalline ice, which falls in arctic and temperate climates under low temperatures.

Use this tag when there is snow on the ground. For snow that is falling from the sky, use only the [[snowing]] tag instead.
open coat:
A [[coat]] that is open and unbuttoned, revealing the body underneath.

If the wearer is naked underneath the coat, [[naked coat]] may apply as well.

Usually open [[lab coat]]s don't count, unless the wearer is naked underneath, since lab coats are almost always worn open.
hakama skirt: A [[hakama]] in the shape of a [[skirt]].
anal fingering: The practice of using fingers to stimulate the [[anus]]. If the finger is inside the anus, the image should be tagged as [[anal]], too.
milking machine:
A device designed to extract milk from animals or people. The devices use cylinders or cups placed over the teat and then uses suction to induce [[lactation]]. 

Devices designed to extract milk for a lactating woman are called "[[breast pump]]s," and may be manual or automatic.  Devices designed to extract milk from animals, particularly diary cows, are called "milking machines," and are automatic.
sand: A loose granular substance, typically pale yellowish brown, resulting from the erosion of siliceous and other rocks and forming a major constituent of beaches, riverbeds, the seabed, and deserts.
sports bra: A sports bra is basically a tight-fitting [[tank top]] with the bottom half [[crop top|cut off]], exposing the [[midriff]]. Despite its name, it is typically not considered [[underwear]]. It is intended for wear during vigorous exercise that might cause the [[breasts]] to move uncomfortably or excessively, preventing discomfort and [[wardrobe_malfunction|potential embarrassment]] during exercise.
round eyewear: Eyewear that have pronounced circular or oval lenses.
messy hair: Very [[unkempt]] hair, mainly because of bad grooming or having just risen out of bed.
tassel: An ornament found at the end of rope or cord composed of a tuft of hanging threads. Can be found in a variety of styles, and is most often found on the drawstrings of [[curtains]], but can be found on wearable decorations as well.
chastity belt:
A type of groin covering that shields its wearer against sexual contact. Usually locked in place and intended for long-term wear. In historical times these were indeed used to ensure chastity (of princesses and such), but nowadays they survive within the [[BDSM]] subculture as a method of erotic sexual denial.

Modern chastity belts are manufactured in both male and female varieties, and some allow for performing bodily functions without needing to remove the belt.

Not to be confused with a [[chastity cage]], which serves a similar purpose, but wraps around the wearer's penis only, instead of their entire waist.
against wall: Leaning on, pushing up, or being held against a wall.
chibi:
Japanese for "small," this tag is used to describe [b]super deformed[/b] characters, whose proportions are smaller for a cute effect.

Use [[deformed]] for chibi-esque characters whose bodies are more proportional overall.
linked piercing: Two [[piercing]]s linked together, often with a [[chain]].
groping: Groping, when used in a sexual context, is touching or fondling another person in a sexual way. Areas of the body most frequently associated to groping in artworks are usually [[breasts]] or [[ass]].
snout:
The protruding portion of an animal's face, consisting of its [[animal_nose|nose]], mouth, and jaw. In many animals, the equivalent structure is called a muzzle, rostrum, or proboscis.

Snouts are found on many mammals in a variety of shapes. Some animals, including ursines and great cats, have box-like snouts, while others, like shrews, have pointed snouts. Pig snouts are flat and cylindrical.

[[furry|Anthropomorphic]] characters often show their snouts on a profile view, similarly to how human anime characters only show the contour of their noses on a profile view.
sleeping:
Being in a state of relatively suspended sensory and motor activity, characterized by total or partial unconsciousness and the inactivity of nearly all voluntary muscles.

Often expressed in more cartoonish art with the presence of a [[nose bubble]].

Not to be confused with [[fainting]].
blush stickers:
[[Blush]] that appears as 2D ovals sitting on the cheeks.  It's often drawn with borders around the edges, a solid fill color, or other stylized shading, and may not sit completely on the cheeks.
Generally seen on [[chibi]] or young characters, or for comical purposes.

Blush stickers may appear with or without any actual reddening of the character's skin.
@_@:
Swirling eyes which represent embarrassment, confusion, dizziness, being hypnotized, being overwhelmed, or being knocked unconscious. More rare, a character who is [[drunk]] or [[angry]] can be shown with these eyes.

Also applies when a character's iris design is naturally swirled/spiraled.

If shown on glasses (to indicate a goofy, nerdy or genius character), use [[coke-bottle glasses]] instead.
bedroom:
An image set in a bedroom.

More than just the [[bed]] should be visible in the shot, preferably enough to show the character of the room's owner. A nondescript bed or bed matched with other nondescript objects should not use this tag.
photo (object): When a drawing contains a photograph, but the actual post is not a [[photo (medium)|]].
1other:
An image depicting a character of ambiguous or indeterminate gender, either because their face or features are [[ambiguous gender|not visible]], they're [[androgynous]], they're a genderless being or their gender is not canonically known.

If said character is shown to display distinguishable gender traits, use [[1girl]] + [[genderswap (otf)]] or [[1boy]] + [[genderswap (otm)]] accordingly.

If the character is shown in a romantic or sexual relationship, use [[other with male]], [[other with female]], or [[other with other]] as necessary.

An easygoing but dutiful [[nontraditional miko|miko]] and good friend to fellow protagonist [[Kirisame Marisa]]; her cool, detached facade belies a sympathetic personality which often wins her the friendship of her former enemies, such as [[Remilia Scarlet]]. Reimu takes care of the rundown [[Hakurei Shrine]], which lay near [[Gensokyo]]'s border with the outside world and acts as its main portal, and fights using her [[holding gohei|gohei]], [[ofuda]], and her family heirloom, [[yin yang orb]]s.

Famous for her laid-back disposition and exposed [[armpits]], as well as the first subject (together with Marisa) of a notorious [[2channel]] meme - "[[Yukkuri shiteitte ne|]]!!!".

Her hair color is usually [[brown hair|brown]] or [[black hair|black]] of nearly every length and her eye colors varies between [[red eyes|red]], [[black eyes|black]], or [[brown eyes|brown]]. Her signature accessories are her [[frilled bow|frilled]] [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]], her [[frilled hair tubes]] on her [[sidelocks]], and her [[yellow ascot]]. Her outfit is a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[red shirt]] (that is sometimes depicted as a [[crop top]] or otherwise baring [[midriff]]) with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled collar]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] with a [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves|ribbon trim]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[red skirt]], [[white socks]], and either [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]] or [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]].
ringed eyes: Eyes in which the pupil and iris are composed of several rings or circles, usually concentric to the pupil.  Eyes composed of many of these rings are frequently used to give a [[crazy_eyes|crazed]] appearance.
school bag:
A catchall tag for school [[bag]]s used by Japanese students. There are two major styles: the traditional style, which looks like a [[briefcase]], and the modern style, which looks like a small blue [[shoulder bag]].

The traditional style, used by middle and high school students, looks like a [[briefcase]] with a rigid flat front and back, and a single large flap that goes over the top with a handle on the top. It may also have a shoulder strap, but this is rarely depicted. Additionally, this style of bag can also have a strap fastened on the back and can be worn like a [[backpack]].

The modern style looks like a small blue sports bag or duffel bag, with a zipper on the top and a strap on each side. The straps are typically big enough to be worn over the shoulder like a [[shoulder bag]], or sometimes on the back like a [[backpack]].

[[Randoseru]] ([[backpack]]s used by elementary school students) should not be tagged [[school bag]].

alcohol:
Any [[drink]] that contains ethanol, a psychoactive drug that has a depressant effect. Drinking too much of it can cause [[drunk|drunkenness]]. Possible health effects can include the increased risk for cancer, alcoholism, liver cirrhosis, depression, ataxia, and many more.

The word [i]sake[/i] (酒) specifically refers to the [[sake|rice wine]] [b]only[/b] when it is used as a loanword. In native Japanese, [i]sake[/i] is used as a general word for [b]all[/b] alcoholic beverages. [i]Nihon-shu[/i] (日本酒) is also somewhat more rarely used as a native disambiguation. Therefore, care should be taken when tagging based on retrieved tag translations.

nurse:
When a character is wearing the attire of a nurse. A nurse is a health care professional who regularly assists [[doctor|doctors]] and other health care professionals in the [[syringe|treatment]], safety, and recovery of [[sick|ill]] and [[injury|injured people]]. Nursing is largely a female profession, but men can be nurses as well.

While most modern nurses wear [[medical scrubs]] at their workplaces, the attire this tag most often applies to is the [[white dress]] and [[nurse cap]] combination that was popular during the 20th century. Before then, western nurses were known for wearing a combination of a nurse cap, [[black dress]], and a [[white apron]].

salute:
A gesture of greeting and respect, typically a hand raised in the air.

h6. Salute Tags

* [[straight-arm salute]]
* [[two-finger salute]]
* [[vulcan salute]]

h6. Official national forms vary from country to country:

* American: forearm at 45° angle to the forehead, blade hand with palm towards face.
* British: similar to American, but with palm facing outward.
* Straight-arm salute (also called Roman, Hitler or Nazi salute and was used by fascist or Nazi movements and governments, most notably Nazi Germany): straight arm extended forward and upwards.

h6. Stylized forms appear in many [[magical girl]] titles:

* [[Sailor Moon]] in particular popularized the "V" hand held sideways, partially framing the eye. This was later inherited by [[Asamiya Athena]] from [[the King of Fighters '96|KOF 96]] onwards
* In [[Final Fantasy VIII]], [[Rinoa Heartilly]] gestures with an upward pointing index finger.

h6. Other well-known forms:

* [[palm-fist greeting|Kung fu]]: a closed fist wrapped in an open palm, often with a slight bow
* Peace/Victory: outward palm with index and middle finger extended, arm extended forward
* Love: opposing thumbs and index fingers join at the fingertips in the shape of a heart; other fingers may suggest wings

miko:
Shrine maidens in [[Shinto]] [[shrine|shrines]] (not the same rank as priests, closer to altar boys). They sweep the shrine, do ceremonial dances, perform music, flank the priest at prayers, freshen the offerings, operate the fortune telling lottery ([[omikuji]]), sell votive tablets ([[ema]]), and in most modern shrines run the knickknack and good luck charms shop. Historically, they used to be mediums and oracles, alongside the male [[Geki]]. They are often depicted wielding [[gohei]].

This tag is for pictures where at least one character is wearing the traditional outfit of a miko: a [[hakama skirt]] (almost always entirely red) and white [[kosode]].

Conversely, do not use this tag if the character in question is employed as a shrine maiden but does not wear the traditional outfit of a miko described above. Tag them as [[nontraditional miko]] instead. [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Yae Miko]] are prominent examples of this.

chromatic aberration:
An effect where the edges of an image have a colored, blurry halo or fringe. The RGB color channels appear noticeably offset from one another.

In photography, chromatic aberration is caused by a defect of the camera lens. The lens refracts light of different wavelengths (colors) slightly differently (technically speaking, the index of refraction of a lens material varies depending on the wavelength), causing the colors to become out of focus.

In digital art, chromatic aberration is used to simulate a photographic look or for artistic effect. In small amounts it can increase realism; in greater amounts it can create a sense of motion (similar to [[motion blur]]), convey a chaotic environment, or indicate anxiety, paranoia, or mental derangement. In excessive amounts it can induce eyestrain.

A standard school-issued [[one-piece swimsuit]] usually blue, black, white or grey in color sometimes with the wearer's name written or printed on a white [[name tag]] stitched across the chest. The style has evolved over the years.

The original [[old school swimsuit]] has thicker shoulder straps, vertical seams over torso and a [[school swimsuit flap|flap]] over the groin.

The [[new school swimsuit]] is identical in style to the old school swimsuit except with no flap over the groin.

The [[competition school swimsuit]] has thinner shoulder straps, is unseamed and has no flap over the groin. It is closer in style to the more modern [[competition swimsuit]], but still in the style of a school swimsuit.

The [[nontraditional school swimsuit|non-traditional school swimsuit]] is a swimsuit that has been patterned after a school swimsuit, but is two-piece, frilled, or has other alterations to it that deviate from the norm.

An [[alcohol]]ic [[drink]] made from fermented rice.

In English, [i]sake[/i] (酒) refers specifically to the rice wine. In native Japanese, [i]sake[/i] is used as a general word for [b]all[/b] alcoholic beverages. [i]Nihon-shu[/i] (日本酒) is also somewhat more rarely used as a native disambiguation. Therefore, care should be taken when tagging based on retrieved tag translations.
clock: Picture shows that a clock is present. Use [[clockshow]] to refer to the [[television]] clock in the corner of a [[anime screenshot]].
low ponytail:
A [[ponytail]] that is tied lower on the person's head, typically near the nape of the neck. Contrast with [[high ponytail]].

For [[side ponytail]]s, use [[low side ponytail]] instead.
television: A device that receives television signals and produces them on a screen.
hand in pocket:
When a [b]single[/b] hand is inserted into a pocket. 

For both hands in two pockets, use [[hands in pockets]].

For both hands in one pocket, use [[hands in pocket]].
tied shirt:
A [[shirt]] tied together at the bottom, usually so that the [[midriff]] is exposed.

Common examples include tying the tails of button-up [[dress shirt]] together in front, often just below the breasts, or tying the bottom of a [[t-shirt]] around itself show off the midriff.

This is not for a shirt's sleeves being tied shut individually or together.  For that, see [[sleeve tied shut]], [[sleeves tied together]], or [[clothes around waist]].
office chair:
A type of [[chair]] designed for [[office]] use. They have [[wheel]]s on the bottom and can swivel. They usually have adjustable height, armrests, and back support.

Not to be confused with [[gaming chair]].
old man:
A man who is [[old]], typically more than 50 to 60 years old. Common signs include [[grey hair]], [[bald]]ness, and [[wrinkled skin]].

used condom on penis: A [[condom]] that is filled with [[cum]] while [[condom on penis|still being worn]]. For images where the condom is full but no longer worn, see [[used condom]].

crossed bangs: Strands of [[bangs]] that overlap each other in a cross formation over the forehead.
nipple tag:
Young children in Japanese elementary schools wear tags on the breast of their [[school uniform|school uniforms]] that give identifying information, such as their name, class, etc.

This tag refers to the case in which these or other such identifying tags are worn through a [[nipple piercing]].

angel:
Spiritual beings usually viewed as messengers and guardians to living beings, typically originated from [[heaven]].

Their appearance varies culturally and characteristically, but the common popular depiction is based on the medieval stylization of a humanoid with [[white wings|white]] [[angel wings]] and a [[halo]].
pouch:
Broad term for various small containers usually made from leather, textiles, or plastic. Objects called pouches include:

* A small non-rigid [[bag]] usually with a [[drawstring]] for holding or carrying things.
* A small semi-rigid container closed with a [[zipper]].
* A [[pocket]]-like semi-rigid container with a flap that folds over the opening. Pouches of this type may be designed to be worn like a belt, in which case they are tagged [[belt pouch]].
heart choker: A [[choker]] that has at least one [[heart]] on it.
kogal:
[b]Kogal[/b] (コギャル), a substyle of [[Gyaru]] (ギャル), is a [[fashion]] trend among young female Japanese high school students.

They follow the trends of gyaru fashion in their heavy makeup (especially around the eyes), sometimes [[tan]] skin, use of English-influenced slang (kogyarugo or コギャル語), coloured (and often bleached) hair, and trendy gyaru style fashion. Since they are school girls, they use their [[school uniform]] as their fashion statement, often wearing their uniform skirts very short and paired with [[loose socks]].

If there aren't any obvious signs of kogal (school uniform, [[loose socks]], [[scrunchie]], etc) then it's recommended to just tag the image with the more general [[gyaru]].
under-rim eyewear: Any type of [[semi-rimless eyewear]] that has a broad lower frame and a rimless upper frame; the opposite of [[over-rim eyewear]].
poke ball:
Japanese name: モンスターボール (Monster Ball)

[i]You know, Poké Balls!
P-O-K-accent-E Balls![/i]

Known as a [i]Monster Ball[/i] in Japan; a spherical capsule used to capture and store [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] (Pocket Monsters). The most common and recognized Poké Ball is the titular basic variant, which has two colored halves: red on top and white on bottom. It is one of the central symbols of the franchise.

Normally, captured Pokémon are shrunken down and stored inside the ball, though some refuse to go inside the Poké Balls. [[ash ketchum|Ash]]'s [[Pikachu]] is a notable example.

Some Pokémon are noticeably similar to Poké Balls: [[Voltorb]], [[Electrode (pokemon)|]], [[Foongus]], [[Amoonguss]], [[Galarian Stunfisk]], and [[Brute Bonnet]].

[b]Note[/b]: Don't use [[ball]], [[holding_ball]] and related "ball" tags when the object in question is a Poké Ball. Simply use [[poke_ball]], [[holding_poke_ball]], etc. Don't tag [[Tera Orb]]s as Poké Balls.
assertive female:
A milder version of [[femdom]]. A female character who is sexually assertive, in control of her partner, or romantically active. 

For sexual interactions, this is typically when the girl is [[girl on top|on top]] or clearly in control - no frowning, gaping, blank stares, etc. - often with a [[naughty face|naughty expression]]. Basically, she is screwing her partner instead of the other way around. If the partner is also shown to be enjoying it, it might fit better in [[happy sex]].

For romantic interactions, the girl is actively displaying affections towards the partner. This does not require any agressive, sexual, femdom expressions, as long as she's the one that's initiating the interactions. If both partners take turns in activeness, this is also a [[reversible couple]].
name tag:
A name tag sewn or pinned on a piece of clothing, such as on a [[gym uniform]] or [[school swimsuit]].

Not to be confused with other [[clothes writing]], or with [[id card]]s worn on [[lanyard]]s.

Use [[character name]] if the character's name is shown as part of the image composition.
emphasis lines:
Lines drawn in a burst pattern, radiating outward from a part of the image to which the artist wants to draw attention. They cause the area surrounded by the lines to stand out more in the viewer's eye.

These are not the same as [[speed lines]], which indicate fast motion; emphasis lines indicate [i]focus[/i], rather than motion.

A similar technique used in filmography is to focus the camera toward a specific part of the shot (sometimes off-center) while allowing other parts of the image to become unfocused, thus drawing extra attention to the focused area.
onsen:
A Japanese hot spring. The [[outdoors|outdoor]] variety is the kind usually seen in anime, but there are [[indoors|indoor]] ones as well.

Bathing areas are often divided into women's and men's, although [[mixed-sex bathing]] versions exist as well.
curly hair:
Hair that is coiled to create a curly effect.

People can be born with naturally curly hair, or can perm it to create artificial curls. This tag is for the more natural effect of curly hair. For the more extreme [[ringlets]], see [[drill hair]].
paper:
A thin material mainly used for writing upon, printing upon, drawing or for packaging. It is produced by pressing together moist fibers, typically cellulose pulp derived from wood or grass, and drying them into flexible sheets.

This tag is for [[papers|paper]] as object. For entire images drawn on paper, see [[traditional media]].

bit gag: A bitgag is a [[gag]], or a device used to restrict speech, that is modeled after the snaffle bits used on horses, from which it derives its name. A bitgag consists of a soft bar held in the subject's mouth by straps that connect behind the head.
standing split:
When a character is [[standing on one leg]] while the other leg is raised so high that it looks like the person is doing a vertical [[split]].

Not to be confused for a [[high kick]] or [[axe kick]].

In October 2020, the pose became a Twitter [[meme]] under the hashtag "#I字バランス部":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/I字バランス部]. It originated with post #4129230 and post #4119640; see comment #2047996 for details.
kirisame marisa:
"Ordinary Black Magician" and second main protagonist of the [[Touhou]] series. The sole playable character of [[100th Black Market]], where her eye color changed from [[yellow eyes|yellow]] to [[red eyes|red]].

Marisa flies by [[broom riding|riding]] a [[broom]] and fuels her magic with phantasmal [[mushroom]]s, which have given occasion to countless fanon jokes. Uses the [[Master Spark]] move when fighting, which she powers with her favorite artifact, the [[mini-hakkero]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[single braid|single]] [[side braid]] tied with a [[hair bow]]. Her outfit varies, but is usually some variation of a [[black hat|black]] [[witch hat]] with [[frilled hat|frills]], a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[black vest]] over a [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt]], a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[white socks]], and either [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]] or [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].
nami (one piece):
[[One Piece]] character. The navigator of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]]. She has an adopted sister named [[Nojiko (one piece)|]]. Her goal is to create a map of the entire world.

She is clever and very greedy, but will often run from a fight due to her lack of strength in the earlier part of the story. Later, she obtained a [[polearm]] named [[Clima-tact]] with a weather manipulation power, in which she uses creatively in various situations.

orc:
A [[monster|monstrous]] humanoid creature, semi-intelligent and usually aggressive. Very prevalent in fantasy universe stories and video games.

Their appearance varies (even more so if they are half-orcs), but usually they have a [[muscular]] or [[fat]] build, [[green skin|green]] or [[grey skin]], large [[tusks]], and [[pointy ears]]. [[Female orc]]s are often depicted as [[tall female|tall]], [[muscular female|muscular]], and voluptuous with [[large breasts]]. In Japanese fantasy art, male orcs are often also given [[pig|piglike]] [[snout]]s, pig/wild [[boar]] head or simply [[pig ears]].

Orcs are usually depicted as an arch-enemy to [[elf|Elves]], and are very frequently paired with them in NSFW works.
surgical mask:
A [[mouth mask]] of the type worn by [[doctor]]s and [[nurse]]s to prevent the spread of bacteria from the wearer's mouth and nose.  It is composed of a rectangular piece of cloth with several horizontal folds to allow it to stretch over the mouth and nose.

This term refers to two similar types of medical masks, a [i]procedure mask[/i] and [i]surgical mask[/i]. Procedure masks may not be sterile and fasten by looping around the ears; used when carrying out general medical procedures like a check-up. Surgical masks are sterile and are fastened by bands that loop around the head; used when carrying out surgeries.

In Japan, it is common to wear a face mask whilst ill to avoid infecting others in public settings. During the [[coronavirus pandemic]], it became common to wear masks worldwide.

They are also worn by delinquents, from school renegades to [[bousouzoku]] and the [[yakuza]].
android:
A [[robot]] that looks human, or very nearly human, with a fully human face.

They may appear male, female, or [[androgynous]]. Female androids, also known as gynoids, are the most common in anime. Androids often have small robotic appendages or markings to make it apparent they are not human. The most common of these are [[robot ears]], [[robot joints]], [[mechanical wings]], and attached [[cable]]s.

The difference between a [[humanoid robot]] and an [[android]] is that an android looks mostly human, usually having something resembling skin (though it needn't be skin-colored) and a fully human face, while a humanoid robot is clearly non-human, with a non-human face.

This tag should not be used if the character looks completely human, with no visible robotic traits. Tag what you see, not what you know.

Not to be confused with [[cyborg]], which is a person augmented with mechanical body parts.
lactation through clothes: When milk is secreted from a woman's [[breasts]], staining or dripping through her clothes. [b]Do not use the [[milk]] tag for milk produced by human [[lactation]][/b].
thong bikini:
A [[bikini]] with a [[thong]] bottom. A thong bottom is a thin strip between the buttocks that leaves most of the butt cheeks bare.

Don't use this tag unless you can tell the bikini bottom leaves the butt cheeks bare. Most thong bikinis are also [[string bikini]]s, but not all string bikinis are thong bikinis.

Most [[micro bikini]]s are also thong bikinis due to their skimpiness.

drunk:
The result of drinking too much [[alcohol]]/[[liquor]]. Characterized by [[blush]]ing across the face, slurring when they usually don't, and/or genrerally acting tipsy.

The beverage that is causing the intoxication must be present to prove that the character has been drinking, or alcohol consumption must be clearly referred to in speech bubbles or other texts in the image.
drugs:
Narcotics and/or stimulants which change a person's behaviour, perception, or numbs them to pain.

Usually administered through a [[syringe]] or [[pill]]. Powdered drugs may be administered via [[snorting]].
hair pulled back:
A character's hair is pulled back, usually into a [[ponytail]] or [[hair bun]], revealing their [[forehead]]. Contrast with [[bangs pinned back]]. Compare to [[hair slicked back]], where the hair is held back by a styling product such as mousse or pomade.

Not to be confused with [[grabbing another's hair]], an action.
mismatched pubic hair:
Pictures of humans who have a different color of hair on their head than on their [[pubic hair|genitals]].

Supersedes pool [b]Your Curtain Doesn't Match Your Carpet[/b] (pool #1974).
Discussion on the forums: forum #77988.
cross earrings: [[Earrings]] shaped like a [[cross]], whether it's a symmetrical + shape or the [[crucifixion]] type of cross well-known to Christian believers.
one-piece tan: [[Tanlines]] created by a [[one-piece swimsuit]], [[leotard]], or other similar garment.
green background: Backgrounds with a solid or predominantly [[green]] color. Can also apply to [[gradient background]] in conjunction with another background color.
yukata:
A light summer [[kimono]], often worn to [[festival]]s and other special occasions. In other seasons, it is typically worn after a bath in a [[onsen|hot spring resort]].

All colors and styles of yukata are aliased to their [[kimono]] variant.
full nelson:
A wrestling hold in which both arms are wrapped under the opponent's armpits and the hands are held on the back of the neck. Used as a finishing move by [[WWE]] wrestler Bobby Lashley and WWE alumnus Chris Masters, calling their versions, the "Hurt Lock" and "Master Lock" respectively.

Most often seen with the [[reverse suspended congress]] [[sex]] position, with the person being [[folded]] and held with their legs bent back instead of their arms.

This appears very similar to the lesser-used [[locked legs]] restraining pose, but the restrainer is using their own legs to pin their opponent's legs, not their arms.
energy gun:
An [b]Energy Gun[/b] is a directed-energy [[weapon]] that emits energy in an aimed direction without the means of a projectile. 

It transfers energy to a target for a desired effect.
waving:
The motion of waving one's hand or arm as if saying any of the following:

* "Hi!"
* "Bye!"
* "Over here!"

To avoid confusion, use [[waves|"waves"]] if referring to [[ocean]] or tidal waves.
bun cover: Decorative fabrics or hair ornaments that go over bun-styled hair. You will see this often with the [[single hair bun|single bun]] or [[double bun]] hairstyle.
sheathed: When a [[sword]], [[dagger]], etc. is held within a case usually located or placed on the hip or back.
bodystocking:
A bodystocking is similar to a bodysuit, but usually made of sheer material or soft fabric, while a normal [[bodysuit]] is more rigid and thick. Think of it as a full-body [[pantyhose]], and/or a hybrid of [[pantyhose]] and [[bodysuit]].

[[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]], [[Ganyu (Genshin Impact)|]] and [[Isolated Island Oni]] are examples of characters who wear bodystockings.
off-shoulder shirt:
A [[shirt]] that is [i]naturally designed[/i] with a low and wide-cut neckline, not covering the shoulders or upper chest area, leaving them [[bare shoulders|bare]]. The sleeves [i]must be attached[/i] to the shirt.

Off-shoulder shirts are meant to emphasize and accentuate the wearer's shoulders, [[collarbone]], and neck (or [[nape]]), with the sleeves of an off-shoulder shirt sitting on the upper arms instead of on top of the shoulders.
nipple clamps: Small devices that are pinned to a person's [[nipples]]. Possibly used for [[nipple torture]], or for [[nipple stimulation|stimulation]].
alley: Otherwise known as an alleyway, a narrow lane found in urban areas, often for pedestrians only, which usually runs between or behind buildings. In older cities and towns in Europe, alleys are often what is left of a medieval street network, or a right of way or ancient footpath in an urban setting. In older urban development, alleys were built to allow for deliveries such as coal to the rear of houses. Alleys may be paved, or simply dirt tracks. A blind alley has no outlet at one end and is thus
semi-rimless eyewear: Eyewear that only have rims only [[over-rim_eyewear|over the top]] or [[under-rim_eyewear|under the bottom]] of the lens, leaving the other half rimless. Also possible are eyewear that have rims only along the sides, leaving both the top and bottom rimless.
red headwear:
This tag has been deprecated for being too broad. 
Use a more specific tag like [[red hairband]], [[red hat]], [[red helmet]], [[red hood]], etc.

mismatched legwear: Legwear of two different colors or patterns. For differences in length, use [[uneven legwear]].
milking handjob: A [[handjob]] that mimics the way one might milk a cow. Usually the handjob is performed from behind, with the [[penis]] angled backwards or towards the ground, while the male (or futanari) is [[bent over]] or on [[all fours]]. The act may be performed in conjunction with [[anilingus]] or [[prostate milking]].
suspender skirt: A [[skirt]] that is held up by [[suspenders]]. Commonly known as a jumperskirt or "JSK" for short, especially when worn in [[lolita fashion]] with a [[petticoat]] beneath.
bodypaint:
Painted marks, symbols or designs on a person's body. Can be either full-bodied or various small marks. Often used by [[tribal]] cultures.

Not to be confused with [[paint on body]] which is for [[paint splatter]]s on a character's body.

[[Cammy White]] from [[Street Fighter]] shows an example of bodypaint, she has it as stripes on her legs.

Also tag as [[painted clothes]] if the paint is used to replace clothes.

See [[body writing]] for words written on the body.
necktie between breasts: When a female character has placed a [[necktie]] [[between breasts|between their breasts]]. This is typically seen with girls who have [[medium breasts]] or larger.
wrist scrunchie:
A [[scrunchie]] worn around the wrist like a [[bracelet]].

Not to be confused with [[wrist cuffs]].
black collar:
A [[collar]] that is colored black.

This is for standalone [[collar]]s not part of a shirt. Do not use for [[collared shirt]]s, [[black sailor collar]]s or other similar clothing.
pet bowl: A [[bowl]] intended to contain [[pet food|food]] or [[water]] for a pet.
unworn shoes:
[[Shoes]] that currently aren't being worn.

See [[no shoes]] for when a character is wearing socks or stockings without shoes.
urinal:
A sanitary plumbing fixture for [[peeing]] only, almost exclusive used from a standing position. Most urinals are designed to be used by men. Women may be able to use male urinals albeit with a greater risk of the [[pee]] landing outside of the urinal.

Female and unisex urinals do exist however they are far less common.
cum on feet: When [[cum]] is present on a person's [[feet]].
lolita fashion:
A Japanese fashion style influenced by [[Victorian]] children's clothing as well as costumes from the [[Rococo movement]].

The fashion consists primarily of a knee length [[skirt]] or [[dress]], [[headdress]], [[blouse]], [[petticoat]]/[[crinoline]], [[kneehighs|knee length socks]] or [[thighhighs|stockings]] and rocking horse or [[high heels|high heel]]/[[platform shoes]]. [[Teddy bear]]s and [[doll]]s are often carried to emphasize the childlike look. 

Please note that [[Lolita fashion]] and [[loli]] are two very different things. [[mature female|Older women]] can be shown wearing these clothes as well.
beatrice (umineko):
[[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]] character.

Witch of Rokkenjima, Endless Witch and primary antagonist of Umineko. She has a twisted personality and enjoys bullying others. Loves patterns and rules, but does not fully tell the truth or make predictable decisions.

Becomes childish when angry or losing.
undercut:
A hairstyle in which the sides or back of the head are shaved or buzzed short, while the hair on top is kept long. The long portion may be swept to one side, [[hair slicked back|slicked back]], or left to hang in front of the face.

The undercut was first popularized during the 1910s to 1940s, before becoming fashionable again in the 2010s among both men and women.
sweater lift: Sweater that has been lifted up to reveal the breasts.
chopsticks: A common eating utensil used in Oriental reigons, consisting of two sticks that are handled between the fingers. Also considered a fashion item to wear in one's hair.
?:
A standalone question mark in the image, either inside or outside a [[speech bubble]]. Usually denotes wonder, [[confused|confusion]], or curiosity.

This should not be used for question marks that are part of an ordinary sentence.
white tank top: A [[tank top]] that is colored white.
blue theme:
An image where blue is the dominant color. For example, a [[monochrome]] image that is blue, or an image with an overall blue color theme.

* !post #6674151: blue monochrome 
* !post #8480614: dominantly blue
open door: A [[door]] that has already been opened.
size difference:
An image that focuses heavily on the size difference between two or more people; often [[minigirl]], [[miniboy]], [[giantess]], and [[giant male]] pictures fall into this category.

If the 'natural' difference in size between characters, ie. 'short' vs 'tall' is the focus of the picture, use [[height difference]] instead. If one person has a small body overall, they are [[petite]].

Focusing exclusively on breast, penis, or muscle size difference is respectively [[breast envy]], [[penis size difference]], and [[muscle envy]] instead.

For an image that has been changed from its original size, use [[resized]].
cynthia (pokemon):
[b]Cynthia[/b], known as [b]Shirona[/b] (シロナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This Champion of Sinnoh is an archeologist who researches the history and mythology of Pokémon. Her deep love for Pokémon sent her on an adventure when she was young [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Garchomp]].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[very long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] which [[hair over one eye|covers one eye]]. She wears [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], a [[fur collar]], a [[black shirt|shirt]] under a [[black coat|black]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[fur-trimmed coat]] with a [[v-neck]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels|heels]].
after rape: The aftermath of [[rape]]. The subject who was raped should look distraught or otherwise should be clear that they were thoroughly unwilling.
key:
A device used to open locks.

As this is a general tag, never apply this tag on Key characters (i.e. [[One - kagayaku kisetsu e]], [[Kanon]], [[Air (visual novel)|]], [[Clannad]], [[Little Busters!]]) unless a physical key is present in the image. If this tag is [i]really[/i] needed, use "[[key (company)]]" instead.
red leotard:
A [[leotard]] that is colored [[red]].

Not to be confused with [[red bodysuit]].
money: Any form of currency, including banknotes (paper currency), [[coin|]]s, or even [[money bag]]s.
autumn leaves:
[[Leaf|Leaves]] that fall from trees in [[autumn]], usually red, brown, or yellow in color.

Most common are [[maple_leaf|maple leaves]]. [[oak_leaf|Oak]] and [[ginkgo_leaf|ginkgo]] leaves may be seen as well.
snake: Snakes are elongate legless carnivorous reptiles of the suborder Serpentes, and resemble [[worm|worms]] to some extent. As a rule of thumb, the head is always discernible in snakes, but it's not always the case in [[worm]].
tiles: A flat or curved piece of clay, stone, glass or concrete used for  [[tile floor|floors]], [[tile wall|walls]], [[tile roof|roofs]] and [[tile ceiling|ceilings]], often for ornamental work.
o-ring bikini: A [[bikini]] that uses circular [[o-ring]]s to connect the straps or cups of the bikini together.
head grab: A character firmly grasping the head of another. Commonly seen in explicit oral sex such as [[irrumatio]].
lipstick ring: A ring of [[lipstick mark|lipstick]] left around a [[penis]] by [[fellatio]].
half gloves:
Half gloves are a style of [[gloves|glove]] where either only the fingers are covered or the material of the glove falls noticeably short of the wrist.

The term "half gloves" is also used to refer to fingerless gloves, but for that style of glove use the [[fingerless gloves]] tag instead. The overlap in name usage may be due to gloves only covering the fingers being a fairly new fashion, with the style initially appearing in European fashion shows in 2006.
jingle bell: A spherical metal ball containing an unattached clapper with only a small slit opening, for higher pitched ringing. This [[bell]] is largely associated with holidays like [[Christmas]] or seen on the [[neck bell|collars]] of domestic [[pet|pets]].
bathtub:
A Western-style bathtub built into a [[bathroom]] and used for [[bathing]].

See [[ofuro]] or [[onsen]] for traditional Japanese [[bath]]s.
pantyhose pull: [[Pantyhose]] that has been pulled down, usually to around mid-thigh level, but not completely removed.
peeing self: [[Peeing]] in one's clothes, as opposed to moving them out of the way first. Typically as a metaphorical depiction of the character being [[scared]] of something, or as a part of the [[humiliation]] fetish.

A type of [[sweater]] that doesn't have [[sleeveless|sleeves]], but also doesnt have a [[turtleneck]] or is worn over a shirt, usually a [[dress shirt]], thus resembling more of a [[vest]] than a shirt or [[sleeveless sweater]].

cumdump: Characters excessively used by others for sex, often related to [[public use]].
black serafuku: A [[serafuku]] that has both its [[shirt]] and [[skirt]] colored black. The [[neckerchief]] and [[sailor collar]] do not count towards this tag.
dominatrix: A woman into [[bondage]] and [[BDSM]]. Often seen wearing a [[latex]] or [[leather]] [[bondage outfit]] and carrying a [[whip]] or [[riding crop]].
prostitution: Performing [[sex]]ual acts for [[money]]. This can be identified in the post by either the character's dialogues or through other evident object hinting such, such as character [[holding money]], have them [[tucked money|tucked]] somewhere on their body, or being placed near them.
pinafore dress:
A pinafore dress or jumper (US English) is a sleeveless, collarless dress intended to be worn over a [[blouse]], [[shirt]] or [[sweater]].

Not to be confused with an [[apron]], which has no back, distinctively.

For jumper (UK English) see [[sweater]].

Do not confuse this tag with [[suspender_skirt|suspender skirt]], [[high-waist skirt]], [[overall skirt]] or [[skirt set]].
bride: A woman (or a cross-dressing man) getting married in a [[wedding]] ceremony. Although different cultures have different wedding styles, usually a bride for a western wedding is portrayed on Danbooru with a long [[white dress]] (or a color of the bride's choosing), a [[veil]] and a [[bouquet]] of [[flower]]s.
implied sex:
When [[sex|sexual intercourse]] is implied to be taking place, but is not immediately obvious due to not being shown explicitly on the image, such as the penetration being obscured or that only the character dialogue is present and is hinting that sex is taking place.

When the character is [i]clearly[/i] being shown to have been sexually penetrated but the source of penetration is not shown (such as being [[out-of-frame_censoring|out of the frame]]), simply tag [[sex]] instead.
finger in another's mouth: One person is sticking at least one finger in another person's mouth.
fern (sousou no frieren):
The deuteragonist from [[Sousou no Frieren]]. Fern was an orphan adopted and raised by [[Heiter]], and is the young mage apprentice of [[Frieren]], accompanying her as a member of her party. She has a habit of [[pout]]ing when she is [[angry]].

Fern is a young human teen/adult with [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long waist-length]] [[purple hair]], styled with a [[straight hair|straight cut]] and [[blunt bangs]]. She usually wears her hair down with two additional [[sidelocks|chest-length strands]] framing her face. After her sixteenth birthday, Fern began styling her hair partially tied back with a [[butterfly hair ornament]] gifted by Frieren.

During her travels with Frieren, she is most commonly seen wearing a [[long dress|long]], [[buttons|buttoned]] [[white dress]] with a Victorian-style top, including a [[frilled collar]] and [[long sleeves]], along with [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. When outdoors, she also dons a [[long coat|long]] [[hooded coat]] [[black coat]] with a white inside layer. For her eighteenth birthday, [[Stark (sousou no frieren)|]] gave her an ornate mirrored lotus [[bracelet]] as a present, which she frequently wears on her left wrist.

After the events at [[granat (sousou no frieren)|Graf Granat's]] Domain, Graf Granat gave Fern a [[black dress|black]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[dress]] that she wears with a thick, [[white coat|white]] [[winter coat]] and [[purple scarf|purple]] [[braided scarf]] in colder settings.
sitting on person: When a character is [[sitting]] on someone else.
2koma: A [[comic]] consisting of 2 panels (usually vertical) per page.
spanking:
When a character is in the process of slapping their hand or some other tool against another's [[ass]] as a form of punishment or erotic roleplay. 

Note that spankings can be administered by oneself as well, covered under [[spanking self]].

If the ass is red or marked, include the [[spanked]] tag as well.
beam rifle:
An [[energy]] based weapon. 

It is basically an energy rifle originated and frequently featured in the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. First appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.
animal collar:
A [[collar]] worn by a person (or animal), but specifically after or as a pet collar, typically a dog collar. It's usually a [[belt collar]], often with a [[buckle]]. The shape is usually on the thicker side and often sits looser around the neck, sometimes with a [[leash]], [[name tag]], [[neck bell]] or other animal-themed [[pendant]] attached, like a [[paw print]]. Most animal collars can also be tagged with another type of [[collar]], but add-ons like these, or the context give reason to add animal collar as well. 

Often worn by characters with [[animal ears]]. Sometimes associated with [[BDSM]] or [[pet play]].

H4. Examples
* !post #6602001: animal collar + [[neck bell]]  
* !post #6073365: with a [[leash]]
* !post #2394286: on an animal
hickey:
A hickey, love bite, or slag tag is a bruise or mark caused by the [[kiss]]ing or sucking of the skin, usually on the neck or arm. The mark is created by the bursting of superficial small blood vessels under the skin.

It's sometimes called a "kiss mark", but this should not be confused with the [[lipstick mark]] tag. Also, apparently both lipstick marks and hickeys are tagged as キスマーク on Pixiv.
bandeau:
A garment similar and related to the [[tube top]], it is a narrow, band-shaped covering for the [[breasts]]. Its shape is used for swimsuit tops, undergarments and casual wear. In most cases, a bandeau is effectively a tube top that is narrow enough that it only covers the breasts and nothing more.

Some designs of the bandeau can make it easy for it to slip off the breasts, so a common addition is a [[halterneck]] to reduce the chance of slippage (example: post #700974). Some designs are [[front-tie_top|front-tie]], while others may feature [[O-ring_top|O-rings]].
yoga pants: [[tight_clothes|Tight]] stretchy [[pants]], originally designed to be worn while performing [[yoga]] or other [[exercising]]s, but now often worn as casualwear.
instant loss:
Images themed on the "almost comically instant loss" situations. Often used with [[mating press]] and [[chinpo ni wa katenakatta yo]]. Though not all instant loss post involves sexual engagements.

This tag does not necessarily have to follow the [[2koma]] format, and can apply to two separately uploaded posts, so long as they depict a series of sequential events.

"Pixiv Encyclopedia":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E5%8D%B3%E5%A0%95%E3%81%A12%E3%82%B3%E3%83%9E%E3%82%B7%E3%83%AA%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BA said that it started as a personal webcomic series by a certain artist. After that, however, the original webcomics were deleted for some reason. The series name is now used as a general tag on pixiv.

[b]Note:[/b] Just because a post depicts an SFW scene followed by an NSFW scene, it doesn't necessarily mean it's an "instant loss" situation.
white pupils: For when the pupils of a character are white instead of the normal black.
puffy long sleeves:
[[Long sleeves]] that loosely puff out along their entire length. See post #1894007, post #2046829, and post #2614098 for examples.

This tag is not to be used for sleeves that are only puffy at the shoulder and are close-fitted for the rest of their length; those are [[juliet sleeves]].
thighlet:
A metal band of [[jewelry]] worn around the thigh, often made of gold or silver.

Not to be confused with a [[thigh strap]], which is made of fabric or leather, or a [[frilled thigh strap]], which is a frilly elastic band.
obliques: This tag is to be used when well-developed oblique muscles are noticeable, i.e. you should not use this tag to describe [[hip lines]] or [[hip bones]]. The external oblique muscle is one of the outermost abdominal muscles, extending from the lower half of the ribs around and down to the pelvis ending where the [[groin]] begins. Common names to describe developed obliques are "fish gills" (upper) and the Adonis or Apollo's Belt (lower). While it is possible for females to develop this muscle, it is more visible and far more common in males due to the differences in bone structure and distribution of body fat.
smegma: Often depicted as a cloudy or white substance built up under the [[foreskin]] of a [[penis]]. Significant buildup, colloquially "dick cheese", connotes a foul odor, color, and texture. Regular hygiene of the genitalia (not exclusively male) clears away much of the substance, which otherwise lubricates the affected tissues.
izayoi sakuya:
The "Perfect and Elegant Maid". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later the third most recurring playable character (being playable in six official games) after protagonists [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]].

Head [[maid]] of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] and personal attendant to its mistress [[Remilia Scarlet]] despite being the only human in the household. Sakuya possesses mastery of [[throwing knife|throwing knives]], as well as the ability to slow and stop time, making her somewhat a homage to [[Dio Brando]] of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. She is zealously loyal to Remilia, and is frequently depicted in doujin berating the gatekeeper, [[Hong Meiling]], though their relationship in canon is generally much friendlier. Due to her [[Immaterial and Missing Power]] portrait depicting her with considerably larger breasts than her usual portraits, jokes abound of her using [[breast padding]].
loose socks:
[[Socks]] that are loose and baggy, usually worn bunched below the knee. Mainly come in white and seen most often with [[school uniform]]s. They are commonly associated with [[gyaru]] and [[kogal]] fashion.

Not to be confused with [[leg warmers]], which are similarly baggy but don't cover the feet.
tokin hat:
A small box-shaped Japanese hat, associated with [[tengu]].

A tokin is a small [[box]] worn on the foreheads of Yamabushi - practitioners of Shugendō - or [[tengu]], dangerous yet protective spirits of the mountains and forests from the Japanese mythology. It is not only worn as a head decoration, but also used as a drinking [[cup]].
crown braid: A form of [[braid]] which wraps around the head in the way a [[hairband]] or a [[crown]] would, as the name suggests.
prone bone: A sex position where the receiving partner [[lying|lies]] [[on stomach|flat on their stomach]] (generally, only the stomach, crotch and maybe thighs need to be completely down flat on the surface) while being [[sex from behind|penetrated from behind]].
long eyelashes: [[Eyelashes]] that are noticeably longer than normal, usually drawn as an exaggeration.
spade (shape):
The ♠ symbol.

First among the French [[playing card]] suits, with the original French name 'Piques' or 'Pikes' in English which explains the shape vaguely resembling the tip of a spear.
bikini top only:
Wearing a bikini top without a bikini bottom. For example, wearing a bikini top with [[shorts]] or [[pants]], or while completely [[bottomless]].

Don't use when you can't see the character's lower body, or you can't tell whether they're wearing bikini bottoms or not. This tag is for when you can tell they're not wearing a bikini bottom.

Don't use when the character is a wearing a [[bikini skirt]], [[bikini shorts]], [[sarong]], or other bottom normally worn with a bikini top.
teddy bear: A [[stuffed animal]] with the appearance of a [[bear]].
off-shoulder dress:
A [[dress]] implicitly designed with a low and wide-cut neckline that leaves the shoulders and upper chest area [[bare shoulders|bare]]. The sleeves [i]must be attached[/i] to the dress.

Off-shoulder dresses are meant to accentuate the wearer's shoulders, [[collarbone]], and neck (or [[nape]]), with the sleeves of an off-shoulder dress sitting on the upper arms instead of on top of the shoulders.
black one-piece swimsuit: A [[one-piece swimsuit]] that is colored black.
hand between legs:
To be used when a character's hand or hands is placed between their legs, but is not otherwise associated with [[masturbation]] or [[skirt_tug]] or any other such action tag.

Often used in conjunction with [[v arms]] and [[wariza]], such as in post #1241274.
pearl necklace: A [[necklace]] made out of [[pearl (gemstone)|]]s lined together on a string and clipped at the nape of the wearer's neck.
phone:
A device for transmitting sound in real time across distances.

This includes modern [[cellphone]]s and older landline phones.
hand on own cheek:
When one of a character's hand is on their own cheek.

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on own cheeks]].
doorway:
The space in a wall where a [[open door|door opens]], or a covered area just outside a [[door]]. Generally features a door frame.

creature: Any fictional animal that isn't [[monster|monstrous]], especially those that aren't "big and scary". Think of the small helper characters from [[magical girl]] shows, or the mascot for a company or series.
garrison cap: A foldable [[hat]] with straight sides and a creased or hollow crown sloping to the back where it is parted. When viewed forward the cap has a [b]triangular shape[/b]. A common part of some [[military uniform|uniforms]].
chain-link fence: A type of woven [[fence]] usually made from galvanized or LLDPE-coated steel [[wire]]. The wire runs vertically and is bent into a zig-zag pattern so each "zig" is quickly trapped on one side with the wire and each "zag" with the wire quickly traps the other. This forms the characteristic [[diamond (shape)|]] pattern or [[mesh]] seen on this type of fence.
futa with futa: A [[futanari]] engaged in sexual activities with another futanari.
poolside:
When a character is located near a [[pool]], or a character is leaning up against the side of one or climbing in or out of one.

The pool itself need not be visible if other visual cues indicate that's where the scene is located.
headpiece:
A decorative type of headwear that is fitted around one's head (usually being fitted near/on the forehead) and doesn't fit the traditional definition of a crown, tiara, hairband, et cetera. A headpiece can be worn with a hat though is usually shown being worn on its own. Headpieces are usually depicted as jewelry, though it can be made out of nearly anything such as cloth, machinery, and so forth.

[[jeanne d'arc (fate)|Jeanne d'Arc]] from [[fate_(series)|Fate]] and [[yomi_(p&d)|Yomi]] from [[puzzle_&_dragons|Puzzle & Dragons]] are good examples of characters that wear a headpiece.
drugged: Under the influence of [[drugs]], often to facilitate [[sleep molestation|date]] [[rape]].
futanari masturbation: When a [[futanari]] character is pleasuring herself.
naked apron:
An [[apron]] worn with no other clothes beneath it.

The epitome of the "teaser shot," naked apron often covers the [[breasts]] (or at a bare minimum, the [[nipples]]) and genitals while leaving the [[ass]] exposed, although aprons that only cover from the waist down, leaving the breasts fully exposed, exist as well.

See [[nearly naked apron]] for an apron worn with [[underwear]] only.
recording:
Audio and/or video recording taking place in the picture. Commonly demonstrated by framing the picture in a [[viewfinder]], or by putting ●REC or アナログ (analog) in the top left or right corners.

Can also be demonstrated by [[video camera]]s facing the participant being recorded.
presenting armpit: Presenting one's [[armpits|armpit]] to the viewer in a deliberately suggestive or lewd manner. Similar to [[spread armpit]], but doesn't necessarily require spreading.
mouth veil: A [[veil]] that covers only the mouth; most also cover the nose.
bouquet: A flower bouquet is a collection of flowers in a creative arrangement.
dogeza:
An element of traditional Japanese etiquette: kneeling directly on the ground and bowing to prostrate oneself until one's head touches the floor in order to show deference to a greatly revered high-class person, as a deep apology, or to express the desire for a favor from said person.

For the pose itself (without the intent of deference or apology), see [[prostration]].
blue one-piece swimsuit: A [[one-piece swimsuit]] that is colored blue.
vase: A tall [[jar]] designed for holding cut [[flower|flowers]] and [[water]] in it.
futon:
Japanese [[bed]]. Involves a mattress on the floor with a [[pillow]] and cover/sheets.

Not to be confused with a [[sleeping bag]] or with a Western-style folding [[couch]].
single shoe:
Wearing only one shoe. The other shoe is absent or removed.

If the unworn shoe is present, also tag [[unworn shoes]].
upskirt: Catching a glimpse up a character's [[skirt]] or [[dress]], often from a viewpoint [[from below]]. If [[panties]] are visible then it may also be a [[pantyshot]]. When [[panties]] aren't present the [[no panties]] tag may be applicable.
female pov: First-person [b]p[/b]oint-[b]o[/b]f-[b]v[/b]iew from a female subject's perspective.

She has light [[red hair]] kept in a [[braid]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Usually depicted as an office lady wearing a long-sleeved tucked in [[collared shirt]] with a [[necktie]].

Voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]] in Japanese and
long dress: A [[dress]] that extends past the knees; its hemline rests no higher than 3/4 up the lower leg.

Don't use this tag for alien characters who look indistinguishable from humans. Tag what you see, not what you know.  

For the aliens from the [[Alien (1979)|]] series, see the [[xenomorph]] tag.
two-tone fur: [[Body fur]] that is two-toned (comprised of only two colors).
covering eyes: See [[covering own eyes]] or [[covering another's eyes]].

[[Panties]] or clothing that are stained with [[pussy juice]].

trash can: A container where waste is put.
konohagakure symbol: The symbol of Konohagakure, a village in [[Naruto]].
lab coat: A knee-length smock that typically features deep pockets that is worn in laboratory or medical facilities, it's usually [[white coat|white]].
cow print bikini: A [[bikini]] that has a [[cow print]] pattern.
handjob gesture:
[[Sexually suggestive]] hand motion simulating a [[handjob]]. You'll usually find three or four fingers bent in a circle or three fingers sticking out with the index finger and thumb together.

Should not be confused with [[fellatio gesture]], as hand isn't in motion and [[tongue]] is usually visible due to [[open mouth]] and/or [[tongue out]].
school chair: A [[chair]] used by students in a [[school]] [[classroom]].
goblin:
An intelligent humanoid [[creature]], essentially a weaker, smaller, and smarter version of [[orc|orcs]]. They appear prominently throughout the broader fantasy media sphere in movies, tabletop games, video games, novels, and more, typically in antagonistic roles.

Goblins are most commonly portrayed as child-sized or human-sized creatures with green skin, [[fangs]], [[pointy nose|pointy noses]], and [[pointy_ears|large pointy ears]]. Some media exaggerate their appearance further by giving them [[oversized limbs|oversized]] ears, often half the size of their face.

Like their larger counterparts, goblins are usually depicted as arch-enemies of [[elf|elves]], and are often allied with orcs for this reason.
white sleeves: A pair of sleeves that are colored [[white]]. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently colored from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).
tray: A small platform used for placing and carrying items - such as [[food]] and [[dishes]].
haori:
A lightweight silk jacket worn over a [[kimono]]. Mostly worn by men, this jacket is at hip- or thigh-length.
There may be a decorative tie string called [[haori himo]] across the chest or the middle of the jacket.

[[Shinsengumi]] are identified by a light blue haori, with sleeves trimmed with white dandara-moyou (mountain stripes).

Not to be confused with [[kataginu]], which more resembles a vest than a traditional jacket. 

Often confused with [[happi]], which has tube-sleeves, instead of kimono sleeves.
shoulder blades:
The [b]scapula[/b], or [b]shoulder blade[/b], is either of the two flat bones, roughly triangular, found on the shoulder girdle. Their shapes are visible in the skin of the [[back]] of people.

* !post #4212517
paw gloves: [[Gloves]] that are modeled after animal paws. Often worn with [[animal ears]], or the entire [[animal costume]].
taimanin suit: A skintight [[bodysuit]] or [[leotard]] whose appearance is inspired by those seen in the [[Taimanin_(series)|]] series.
picture frame:
A rigid structure that surrounds or encloses a [[photo (object)|photograph]], [[painting (object)|]], or [[drawing (object)|]].

For images that are entirely enclosed with a similar decorative frame, use [[ornate border]] instead.
fish:
Any of various mostly cold-blooded aquatic vertebrates usually having scales and breathing through gills.

For the Nuclear Throne character see [[fish (nuclear throne)]].
dark elf:
An [[Elf]] sub-type who are said to be troublesome to others or affiliate themselves with evil and/or dark sides. In some works, they are treated as a separate but related species of elves and are not necessarily evil.

Dark elf appearances vary from depiction to depiction. Many, such as those inspired by [[Dungeons & Dragons]] tend to have [[colored skin]] in various tones of [[blue skin|blue]], [[grey skin|grey]], or [[purple skin| purple]]. Others like the [[Dark Eldar]] from [[Warhammer 40k]] tend to have extremely [[pale skin|pale]] or [[white skin]]. Typical dark elves in many Japanese copyrights instead just have [[dark skin]].

This tag can also be applied for elves from copyrights where they have none of the above yet it is their title as a character.
graffiti: A decorated writing or a drawing made on a wall, vehicle, or other public surface, usually without permission. Graffiti is often made with [[spray paint]].
