print kimono: A [[kimono]] that has any type of stylized printed patterns on it, such as [[floral print|flowers]], [[heart print|hearts]], animals, and such. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
babydoll:
A short, sleeveless, loose-fitting [[nightgown]] or [[negligee]], intended as nightwear for women.

Common features include [[spaghetti strap]]s, [[empire waist]], [[see-through clothes|see-through]] fabric, and a [[front slit]] that reveals the [[midriff]]. It sometimes has formed cups (called a bralette) for cleavage and an attached loose fitting skirt falling in length usually between the upper thigh and the [[navel]]. The garment is often trimmed with [[lace]], [[frills]], [[bow]]s, or [[ribbon]]s.
oshino shinobu:
A character in [[Bakemonogatari]].

A blonde-haired girl who appears to be eight years old and lives with [[Oshino Meme]] in an abandoned building. She is fond of donuts (especially ones of [[Mister Donut]]) and used to be a vampire.
imminent rape:
When a character is about to be [[rape]]d, but the penetration hasn't happened yet.

This is different from [[you gonna get raped]] because the context in that tag is supposed to be humorous, whereas this is considered serious sexual assualt.

Add [[imminent vaginal]] and/or [[imminent anal]] as well to show which orifice is about to be penetrated. This only covers the general fact that rape is about to occur.

If the partners are about to engage in consensual sex, or if you're not sure as
naked shirt: A [[shirt]] worn with no other clothes beneath it. Typically, though not always, an [[open shirt]].
crystal:
A crystal consists of matter that is formed from an ordered arrangement of atoms, molecules, or ions.  At the macroscopic scale crystals have well defined shapes with flat faces. Examples of crystals are [[snowflakes]], diamonds, and quartz.

For tagging purposes this tag is to be used for objects that are generally composed of translucent material and whose surface is composed of facets (flat surfaces).  

If it has been cut in an organized manner, particularly like that used for jewelry, then the [[diamond_(gemstone)]] tag should also be included.

If the object is rounded and features no edges between surfaces, then the object should be tagged [[gem]] instead.

For the Nuclear Throne character see [[crystal (nuclear throne)]].
photorealistic: Posts so realistic that they could be mistaken for [[photo_(medium)|photographs]] except upon close inspection.
ass tattoo:
A [[tattoo]] located directly on a person's [[ass]].

If it's just above the ass, use [[tramp stamp]].
whip:
For tagging purposes a whip is a tool with a long flexible line (lash) used to strike animals or people to aid in guidance or exert control through pain compliance or fear of pain.  They are frequently depicted in [[bdsm]].

A second style of whip are those that are a firm stick and lack a lash.  For tagging purposes these images should be tagged [[riding crop]] instead.

The distinct loud sound of a whip "cracking" as it is swung is produced by a part of the lash breaking the sound barrier and generating a small sonic boom.

The whip is a signature [[weapon]] of the [[castlevania (series)|Belmont]] (JP: [i]Belmondo[/i]) clan.

For [[The King of Fighters]] character, see [[Whip (KoF)]].
mature male:
An attractive "middle-aged" or older man. Usually (but not necessarily) having varying amounts of [[facial hair]] and/or [[body hair]]. Alternate terms, depending on age range, can include DILF ([b]D[/b]ad [b]I[/b]'d [b]L[/b]ike to [b]F[/b]uck; used regardless of the fact whether he's had children or not), rhino or manther.

Use with [[old man]] if drawn attractively. [[Soriz]] from [[Granblue Fantasy]] is a good example.
pink leotard:
A [[leotard]] that is colored [[pink]].

Not to be confused with a [[pink bodysuit]].
santa hat: A floppy pointed red [[hat]] [[fur-trimmed headwear|trimmed in white fur]] with a white [[pom pom (clothes)|puff ball]] at the point.
pov doorway: When the point of view is within or in front of an [[open door]]. Usually this involves either the viewer or the character answering the door.
gift box: A small [[box]] that may be wrapped with colorful paper and tied together with a [[bow]] on the outside. The inside will contain a [[gift]] for one person to give to another as a surprise.
chain leash: A [[chain]] attached to a [[collar]] and used as a [[leash]].
shoulder bag:
A [[bag]] that one carries by the shoulder.

If used by a school student, it may be a [[school bag]].
straw hat: A hat entirely made of straw, the dry stalks of cereal plants after the grain and chaff have been removed.
impregnation:
Either an actual depiction of a [[sperm cell]] hitting an [[ovum|egg]], or a scene where the female is saying that she will become [[pregnant]] as a result of being [[cum in pussy|cummed inside]].

See also [[fertilization]], and [[female fertilization]] for the female-only/sperm-free counterpart.
rough sex:
[[Sex|Sexual activity]] which is visibly very intense and energetic, and in which one or more of the participants may even appear to be in distress (though this does not necessarily mean that [[rape]] is occurring). May include elements such as [[bondage]] or [[tears]], and more violent actions such as [[asphyxiation]] or [[grabbing another's hair]]. Often will include [[spanking]] or have an [[ass]] that has been [[spanked]].

goth fashion:
A fashion style that is typically dark, sometimes morbid, with elements borrowed from Elizabethan and Victorian fashion. Goth fashion can be recognized by its stark black clothing (or hair or makeup), often contrasted with boldly colored clothing, hair and makeup in shades of deep reds, purples, blues or emerald green, lace, silks, and high heels for either gender. 

On Danbooru, the [[goth fashion]] tag refers to both western and eastern styles of gothic clothing.
stripper:
A person whose profession is [[undressing|taking off their clothes]] for [[money]] in front of an audience.

Often seen wearing [[micro bikini|small bikinis]] and [[pole dancing|dancing around]] [[pole|poles]].
yellow ascot: A yellow [[ascot]], most commonly worn by [[Hakurei Reimu]].
drinking: The act of consuming any kind of potable liquid.
burger:
A food item consisting of at least a patty of ground meat sandwiched between two halves of a [[bread bun]]. May also include condiments, cheese, an extra patty or bread, and/or certain vegetables.

For the purposes of this image board, a patty melt should also be considered a hamburger due to the inclusion of a hamburger type patty and cheese. 

Not to be confused with the japanese term for [[hamburger steak]].
gag harness:
A [[gag]] secured in place using more elaborate sets of straps than the normal two side straps.

Usually there are two straps that start at the sides, pass over the cheeks (forming a triangular shape), rejoin above the nose, from which a strap runs centrally across the face and turns over the head. However, there are also versions without the center strap. Some versions are one with the blindfold.
clitoral hood: The female prepuce, erogenous tissue which covers the glans [[clitoris]]. Anatomically homologous to the [[foreskin]].

shoulder cutout: A [[clothing cutout]] that exposes the shoulders.  Tops and dresses featuring these are typically referred to as a "cold shoulder top" or "cold shoulder dress" respectively.

ovum: The female reproductive cell, stored in the [[ovaries]] and released into the [[uterus]].
mascara:
A type of [[makeup]] used to thicken, lengthen, or define [[eyelashes]].

Use this tag for thick or long eyelashes that are evidently from wearing mascara (i.e. the character is wearing other [[makeup]], is [[applying makeup]], or a [[mascara wand]] is visible). If the character has defined eyelashes but it's not from wearing [[makeup]], just use [[eyelashes]].

Mascara should not be confused with [[eyeliner]], which is a dark line applied along the edge of the eyelids, or [[eyeshadow]], which is a colorful powder applied around the eyes.
car: An automobile, a [[road]]-going passenger [[motor vehicle|vehicle]] on wheels.
bandaged leg: When a character has at least one leg wrapped in [[bandages]].
reverse upright straddle:
A sex position for two characters sitting upright in which the receiving partner sits on or astride the penetrating partner's lap, getting penetrated from behind. Compare to [[upright straddle]], in which the participants face each other. If the penetrating partner is lying on his or her back, this becomes the [[reverse cowgirl position]].

Also known as the champagne room position.
legs over head: When a character has their legs behind or over their head.
gym uniform:
A uniform worn during physical education or gym classes.

For boys, it consists of a [[white shirt|]] [[gym shirt]] and loose [[gym shorts]]. For girls, it is usually made up of a [[white shirt|white]] [[gym shirt]] and [[buruma]], although the bottom piece can also be [[bike shorts]], loose [[gym shorts]], or [[track pants]] instead.
o-ring top:
A top where an O-shaped ring figures prominently. For example, a bikini top where the breast cups are connected in front via a large circular ring.

This also includes non-circular shapes, such as ovals, hearts, rectangles or any thing else containing a hole through which parts of a garment can pass and then connect together.
skirt hold:
Lifting a [[skirt]] or [[dress]] in a non-revealing fashion (as opposed to [[skirt lift]]), typically so it doesn't touch the floor.

If the character is pulling the skirt down so as to hide their underwear and/or legs, use [[skirt tug]].

For holding objects in a skirt, see [[skirt basket]].  For holding a skirt that's not being worn, see [[holding unworn skirt]].
colored eyelashes:
[[Eyelashes]] that have an unnatural color, anything other than the usual black or brown. Consider adding [[eyelashes]] if the eyelashes are prominent.

Not to be confused with [[eyeshadow]].
red kimono: A [[kimono]] that is colored [[red]]. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
nontraditional miko:
A modernized or adapted [[miko]] outfit. [[Hakurei Reimu]]'s and [[Yae Miko]]'s outfits are prime examples of this.

Common features of nontraditional miko outfits include:

* [[Hakama short skirt]]s – shortened to resemble modern short skirts, especially [[pleated skirt|pleated skirts]]
* [[Sleeveless]] [[kimono]] tops,  often with [[detached sleeves]]
* [[Thighhighs]] – especially white [[tabi]] ones with [[ribbon-trimmed_legwear|ribbon trims]]
* High-heeled ([[wedge heels|wedge]] or [[platform heels|platform-heeled]]) [[sandals]], often worn with above thighhighs
* Generally designs with elements taken from modern fashions like [[lolita_fashion|lolita]], [[school uniform|school uniforms]], etc.

Nontraditional miko outfits should not be tagged [[miko]], as that tag is for traditional miko outfits.
flexible: Referring to the ability to perform positions requiring a higher amount of body mobility than the average human has. This can be achieved through [[stretching]] or [[yoga]]. If the position requires extreme levels of flexibility this act will be referred to as [[contortion]] instead.
arm under breasts:
When only one of a character's upper arms are underneath one or more of their breasts.

The other arm is commonly [[covering breasts]] or [[arm at side|resting at the side]] of the body.

For both arms under breasts, see [[arms under breasts]].
hands in pockets: When [b]both[/b] hands are in two pockets. For a single hand in one pocket, use [[hand in pocket]].
handgun:
A short-barrelled [[gun|firearm]] designed to be used with one hand or [[two-handed|two hands]] and for shooting at short-ranged targets, while be more concealable to be [[holstered]] than a [[rifle]] or a [[submachine gun]]. Its [[ammunition]] feeding mechanism may vary by design, such as muzzle-loading earlier handguns, [[break action]], by using [[clip (weapon)|clips]] or more commonly [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]].

Handgun types include modern semi-automatic pistols, [[revolver]]s, [[antique firearm]]s such as [[flintlock]]s and [[derringer]]s. This tag also covers the "machine pistol", a handgun capable of fully automatic fire (e.g. [[Beretta 93R]]).

The term "pistol" refers to handguns with a single, stationary (non-revolving) chamber.  In Danbooru, the "pistol" tag redirects to the "handgun" tag.

For the hand gesture imitating a gun, use [[finger gun]] instead.
ice:
[[Water]] in solid form.

Happens when the water's temperature reaches 0°C (32°F).
hand on own knee:
A character is resting [b]one[/b] hand on [b]one[/b] of their own knees.

Don't confuse with [[hands on own knee]] or [[hands on own knees]].
oil-paper umbrella: A many-ribbed [[umbrella]] traditionally used in China, Japan and across southeast Asia. It can be made out of oilpaper or silk.
child:
This tag is for images containing children of either sex.

Use [[petite]] when the character is short but displays more developed physical attributes (e.g. wider hips for girls, wider shoulders for boys).

If the image is [[howto:rate|sexually explicit]] or [[sexually suggestive]], use the [[loli]] or [[shota]] tags as appropriate (which are mutually exclusive with this tag).

Not to be confused with [[aged down]], which is for when a character is portrayed as younger than their usual age.

[tn][b]If you are not sure whether a post should be tagged as child or loli/shota, ask in the "loli / shota check thread":[/forum/show/33650].[/b][/tn]
raiden shogun:
A playable character in [[Genshin Impact]], the Electro Archon who governs Inazuma. Notable for her [[human scabbard|peculiar sword drawing technique]], in which she manifests the [[tachi (weapon)|]] [[Musou Isshin (Genshin Impact)|]] from her [[cleavage]].

Also known as Baal or "the Shogun". 

During the story, it is revealed her name is [spoiler]Ei, and her Archon name is Beelzebul[/spoiler]. The name Baal [spoiler]was a title that actually belonged to her twin sister[/spoiler]. 

Raiden Shogun has [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]], the former which is tied in a [[long braid]] and is adorned with a [[hair ornament]]. She wears a [[purple kimono]] worn [[off shoulder|hanging off her arms]], tied with a [[red sash|red]] [[obi]] and adorned with a [[shoulder armor]]. She wears [[black thighhighs]] and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[sandals]]. Typically wields a [[katana]] called [[Musou Isshin (Genshin Impact)|]].

His signature weapon is [[Engulfing Lightning (Genshin Impact)|Engulfing Lightning]].

She is related to [spoiler][[makoto (genshin impact)|Raiden Makoto]][/spoiler], who is her [spoiler]twin sister[/spoiler].
tribal: Indigenous and self-sufficient people living outside or in isolation of modern society. Drawn portrayals often characterised by minimal or nonexistent clothing, [[dark skin]], [[bodypaint]] or [[facepaint]] and simple hunting tools such as a [[spear]].

purple kimono: A [[kimono]] that is colored [[purple]]. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
grabbing own breast:

Note that this does not automatically constitute a [[multicolored bikini]]. A good example of both tags being incorporated is post #1849899, where the white heart prints are separate from the [[yellow]] and [[blue]] gradient of the bikini itself.

head between breasts:

dappled sunlight:
The effect of light filtering through trees or leaves, creating a pattern of light and shadows.

Use [[window shadow]] if light is instead being filtered through things that cover a window.
mouse ears:
Refers to characters who either have, or wear as a fashion accessory, mouse ears on their head.

The rounded style of these ears share a similar appearance to [[bear ears]] and [[raccoon ears]].
tabard:
An official garment of a herald, emblazoned with a coat of arms or a symbol denoting membership. It is a sleeveless or short-sleeved coat/cloth worn over clothing or armor, either down the front or on the front and back. It is a purely cosmetic item intended to add individuality to someone's look, whereas a [[surcoat]] is designed to provide protection from the elements.

Mainly associated with [[Yakumo Ran]], [[Yakumo Yukari]]'s Imperishable Night outfit, and [[Ibaraki Kasen]].
light areolae: [[Areolae]] or [[nipples]] that are lighter in color than the surrounding skin. Typically seen on characters with [[dark skin]].
spreader bar: A long metal pipe used in [[bondage]] to keep a person's legs or arms forcefully spread.  The bar is either attached to [[cuffs]] or tied tightly onto the limbs.
harem: A character surrounded by 3 or more females who have visible affection to said character.
asuna (blue archive):

bathing:
The act of [[washing]] the body in a [[bath]], usually in a [[bathtub]] in a [[bathroom]] or in an [[onsen]], with the body [[partially submerged]] in some fluid.

pink headwear: This tag has been deprecated for being too broad. Use a more specific tag like [[pink hat]], [[pink hairband]], etc.
jack-o' challenge: An extreme [[top-down bottom-up]] resembling [[Jack-O' Valentine]]'s crouch pose introduced in [i][[Guilty Gear Xrd]][/i].
covering nipples:

covering face: Hands or objects obscuring the face.
fruit:
Any sweet, edible part of a plant that resembles seed-bearing fruit. An [[apple]] for example.

naked coat:
When a character is only wearing any type of [[coat]] such as a [[trench coat]], [[lab coat]], [[raincoat]], etc.

nico robin:

Having consumed the Hana Hana no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can make her body parts "bloom" from any surface as well as create full body clones of herself.

hand on own stomach:
When a person has one of their hands resting upon their abdominal region.

If both hands are on their stomach, use [[hands on own stomach]]
If a hand is on someone else's stomach, use [[hand on another's stomach]]
If both hands are on someone else's stomach, use [[hands on another's stomach]]
waitress:
A person wearing a waitress uniform, regardless of gender.

A waitress is a woman who works in a [[restaurant]] and who takes orders and serves food to customers.

Not to be confused with [[maid]] as some of the uniforms may be similar to what a maid wears.
halloween:
A Halloween-themed image.

Halloween is a holiday on October 31st, commonly celebrated by children dressing up in [[Halloween costume]]s and going door-to-door [[trick-or-treating]]. Halloween is often associated with [[pumpkin]]s, monsters, [[ghost]]s, [[witch]]es, and all things [[horror (theme)|scary]].
korean text:
The image contains text written in the Korean language.

The most common writing system in Korean today is Hangul (also known as Chosongul in the North), a syllabic alphabet, but in the past [[traditional Chinese text|Chinese characters]] were used to represent words as well (referred to as Hanja), whether exclusively or mixed with Hangul. There are also ways to romanize Korean, generally referred to as [[Romaja text|Romaja]].
sundress: Any informal [[sleeveless dress]] made of lightweight fabric that is worn as summer wear. [[white dress|White]] is a common color.
taking picture:
Taking a [[photo (object)|photograph]] of something, whether with a [[camera]] or a [[camera phone|cellphone]].

Note that this is different from [[recording]] which is capturing video footage.
in box: Someone or something is in a [[box]].
partially fingerless gloves: A variant of [[fingerless_gloves|fingerless gloves]] where some of the fingers on the gloves are missing while others are present.
half updo: A hairstyle that consists of the hair at the temples pulled back into a [[hair bun]], [[short ponytail]], or just a bow at the back of the head, while the rest of the hair remains flowing loosely. The hair being pulled back can also be tied into [[half up braid]]s.
curled horns:
[[Horns]] that are curled, like those of a sheep's. Could also be [[demon horns]].

out of frame:
When one or more character (identifiable or not) is only visually present in an image so far as to show a limited number of details. 

Not to be confused with [[outside border]], where minor parts of something are drawn beyond a [[border]] in the image.
fins: Thin appendages attached to larger bodies, often, but not exclusively, found on fish. They help generate and control movement.
mash kyrielight:
[b]Mash Kyrielight[/b] (マシュ・キリエライト; also romanized as Matthew or Mashu) is a female character from [[Fate/Grand Order]] of the Shielder class. She is a Demi-Servant, a human fused with a Heroic Spirit. She works at the Chaldea Security Organization.

She is the first person the protagonist sees when he/she wakes up in Chaldea. She has [[short hair|short]], [[purple hair]] which [[hair over one eye|covers her right eye]] and [[purple eyes]]. When not in her servant form, she wears a [[necktie]], [[black dress]], [[jacket]], [[black pantyhose]] and [[glasses]]. In her servant form, she wears an [[armored dress]] and carries an enormous [[shield]], Lord Chaldeas (named by [[Olga Marie Animusphere]]). Later in the story it is revealed that [spoiler]the shield is in fact [[Lord Camelot (fate)|]], [[Galahad_(Fate)|Galahad's]] Noble Phantasm.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Taneda Risa]] (before Sep 2016), [[Takahashi Rie]] (current)
mug: A (mostly or entirely) cylindrical drinking vessel for larger amounts of hot beverages, such as [[coffee]] or hot chocolate. It is the sturdier-built version of a [[cup]].
tucked penis:
When the [[penis]] and [[testicles]] are tucked back behind the thighs. Can also apply to a character that is sitting with the penis behind the chair, such as post #4244964.

Not to be confused with a penis being tucked into clothing; use [[covered penis]].
yokozuwari:
A Japanese term for a feminine informal sitting posture, on the knees as in [[seiza]] but with the legs folded out to one side. If the legs are folded out to either side, it's [[wariza]].

The traditional male informal sitting posture is [[indian style|agura]].
loincloth:
Any of several ancient styles of garment designed to cover the genitals. Usually made from a folded and tied length of cloth, sometimes held in place by a belt. If it has a dangling length of cloth hanging in front and/or or behind, that part is called, for Danbooru's purposes, a [[pelvic curtain]]. 

[[Fundoshi]] are a range of specifically Japanese styles of loincloth. The loincloth's modern replacements are [[panties]], [[briefs]], and [[boxers]].

Both [[loincloth]] and [[fundoshi]] nowadays are used as festival clothing (usually with [[happi]], or alone) , as a [[swimsuit]] (when worn at the [[beach]]) and occasionally, as [[underwear]] (usually worm under [[kimono]], or [[Japanese armor]] etc). Make sure to use the appropriate tag when tagging them.

If the loincloth is attached to a full-body clothing garment, consider tagging [[tabard]] as well [tn](post #7734925)[/tn].
cube: A geometric object with six faces of equal area. A common example would be [[dice]].
pinky out:
"When in doubt, pinky out."

A habit of etiquette when drinking from a teacup, where the 'pinky' finger is extended while the others are retracted. May be applied to other situations. Also known as "pinky up".

[[Iseri Nina]] is known for extending her pinky as a substitute of a [[middle finger]].
surprised: Picture where one or more characters show signs of surprise. Some visual signs of surprise are [[^^^]] and [[o_o]].
shoulder boards:
Long, flat object with some designs that are attached on the shoulder straps of a clothing article. Also known as [i]shoulder mark[/i] or [i]rank slide[/i]. Commonly found in [[police uniform|police]] or [[military uniform|military]] [[uniform]]s to indicate rank or bear other form of [[insignia]].

Unlike [[epaulettes]], shoulder boards are smaller and have no fringe trim.
torn pants: A pair of [[pants]] that have been visibly torn, whether by design or through an external event such as cutting or tearing.
two-tone background: When a background consists of only two colors. May or may not involve a [[gradient background|gradient]] transition between them.
crotch rope:
A rope tied to apply pressure to a person's genitalia.  It is sometimes used in [[bondage]].

Not to be confused with [[rope walking]].
cow tail: Use this tag when a character has a [[cow]]-like [[tail]].
paper lantern: A traditional Japanese or Chinese [[lantern]] made of thin, brightly colored paper.
center frills: [[Frills]] that are in the midcenter of a [[dress]] or [[shirt]]. Most of the time it runs between the collarbone and navel or lower chest.
lion ears: [[Animal ears]] based off of a [[lion]], seen on a human rather than the actual animal.
asymmetrical hair: Hair with a significant element of asymmetry in their styling.
flower tattoo: A [[tattoo]] shaped like any kind of [[flower]], whether it'd be realistic or abstract in design.
bonnet: A soft head covering, generally brimless and secured by a [[chin strap|tie string under the chin]], styled to cover no part of the forehead.
stitches:
Tag used to describe visible thread-holdings on clothing or ones body, you will often see this on [[stuffed animal|stuffed animals]] and [[zombie|zombies]] too. It has a distinctive train track look or appear as X's going in a line.

Sutures (also known as stitches) are used to hold skin and all other tissues of the human body together, after someone has been injured or went through surgery. This is done with a [[needle]] and preformed by a [[doctor]] or [[nurse]].

Not to be confused with [[stitched]].
cuts: Cuts or tears to the skin caused by something sharp. A type of [[injury]].
tearing up:
The [[tears]] that form in the eyes just before [[crying]] or anything else that may cause tears to be shed ([[laughing]], waking up, etc.).

For tearing paper, clothing or other items, use [[ripping]] or [[torn]].
letterboxed:
An image technique where bars are displayed at the bottom and top of a picture.
Letterboxed does not count as a border but [[outside border]] may be used with it.

See [[pillarboxed]] for when an image has bars on the left and right sides.
improvised gag: A [[gag]] made of unconventional materials, such as [[cloth gag|cloth]], [[clothes gag|articles of clothing]], or [[tape gag|tape]].
holding syringe: Someone is [[holding]] a [[syringe]] in their hand. Also counts for [[large syringe]].
This expression of 3 dots (or more) is commonly called an ellipsis. It is used to describe a moment where a person has nothing really to say, in lieu of the complete absence of expression.
church: A Christian place of worship. Can include a [[steeple]] and [[stained glass]].

Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] event. Wields a [[katana]] and [[bow (weapon)|bow]]. Wears a [[purple bodysuit]] with [[ribbed sleeves]] and [[tabard]] and/or [[loincloth]], with red [[rope]] at various areas. Also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[kote]], and black [[sandals]] with [[suneate]]. Overall she appears as a tall, [[curvy]] woman, with either [[large breasts|large]] or [[huge breasts]]. Has a [[motherly]] personality.

claw pose:
A hand pose imitating [[claws]].

Stereotypically hands at face level ; palm outward ; knuckles slightly arched ; fingers fanned out and up, curled (base may be reversed, rest may be extra bent) but tips not pointing towards the hand.

May be part of a [[fighting stance]], or intent to grab.
boy on top:
When a male is on top of someone else, which doesn't always have to be sexual.

double dildo: A [[dildo]] where both ends are shaped to be used for penetration (either [[double penetration]] or [[shared object insertion]]).
usada pekora:

Designed by [[Yuuki Hagure]].

Being a rabbit girl, she has [[rabbit ears]] (she also has [[extra ears|regular human ears]]) and a [[rabbit tail]]. She has [[orange eyes|]] or [[red eyes]] with [[rabbit-shaped pupils]], [[short eyebrows|short]] [[thick eyebrows]] shaved into [[hikimayu]], [[small breasts]] and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], [[blue hair|blue]]-and-[[white hair]].

mask on head: When a character has a [[mask]] on their head, but not worn over the face.
reading: A character is depicted reading a [[book]], [[scroll]], or other printed material.
upright straddle: [[Straddling]] another person while that person is sitting upright. May involve a [[leg lock]]. In the Kama Sutra, this position is known as the Lotus Blossom position.
blonde pubic hair: [[Pubic hair]] that is [[colored pubic hair|colored blonde]].
pendulum: A weight suspended from a pivot so that it can swing freely. When a pendulum is displaced sideways from its resting, equilibrium position, it is subject to a restoring force due to gravity that will accelerate it back toward the equilibrium position.
waterfall: A cascade of [[water]] flowing over a steep or vertical drop.
restaurant:
An establishment where people can come in and order a meal of their choice off a menu, then a [[waiter]] or [[waitress]] sends the order to the [[kitchen]] where a [[chef]] and his/her team prepare said meal. The server then returns to the table with the dish, and then the customer pays for it after finishing. This is a very popular business because most people do not have the time to make meals on their own, or don't do it as well as the restaurant does.

Restaurants exist for all three different meals through the day - [[breakfast]], [[lunch]] and [[dinner]] - and for any type of palate, whether it's American, Japanese, Chinese, Mediterranean and so on. There are also late night and 24/7 places for those who work during the night.
nose bubble: A [[snot]] bubble from the nose of a [[sleeping]] or [[sleepy]] character.
licking nipple: The act of [[licking]] someone else's [[nipples]]. Usually female nipple licking is prevalent here, but there are examples of licking male nipples, so this tag isn't restricted by gender.
feather hair ornament: [[Feathers]] worn in the hair as a [[hair ornament]].  If the feathers are actually growing out of the head of a [[bird girl]], use [[feather hair]] instead.
leg grab:
[[Grabbing]] a [[legs|leg]], whether a character is doing it on themselves or another.

When done on another person standing, there is usually a [[height difference]] between the characters.

nippleless clothes: Clothes with holes through which [[nipples]] protrude.

In the beginning of it, she gave her powers as a shinigami to [[Kurosaki Ichigo]] in order for him to defend himself and his two sisters [[Kurosaki Karin]], and [[Kurosaki Yuzu]] from an attack by a hollow. The name of her zanpakuto and signature bankai is called Sode No Shira Yuki and Some no mai Tsukishiro which completely immobilizes her opponent by freezing them solid, then instantly killing t
orange skin: Skin that is colored orange. Should not be confused with a [[tan]] or [[dark skin]].
single earring: When a character is wearing only one [[earrings|earring]] on one of their ears.
jiangshi:
A Chinese [[undead]]. Often called a "Chinese hopping [[vampire]]".

They drain people's life energy, hence the "vampire" denomination, although they are more similar in concept to Western [[zombie|zombies]].  

They usually have fulu or [[ofuda]] (strips of paper) stuck to their foreheads. Modern iterations are often seen wearing a rimmed round hat known as a [[qingdai guanmao]], referencing how Chinese officials under the Qing Empire were viewed as bloodthirsty creatures with little regard for humanity.

Some common depictions are [[Qiqi (genshin impact)|]], [[Bongun]], [[Munak]], [[Hsien-ko]] and [[Miyako Yoshika]].
transparent background:
An image with a transparent background.

Make sure you're viewing the original image, as resized sample images and thumbnails will have a [[white background]].

Can also be used with [[simple background]].
topknot: A hairstyle in which some or all of one's hair is tied up in a tuft atop the head.
asymmetrical bangs:
A hairstyle where half the bangs is worn combed back / short, and the other half long resulting in a distinctly asymmetric hairstyle.  

Examples include [[Sakurazaki Setsuna]] from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]] and [[Misaka Mikoto]] and her variants from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]].  

This tag should not be used for bangs asymmetric simply due to a part on one side, for that see either [[parted bangs]] or [[swept bangs]].
popsicle:
Also known as [b]Ice pop[/b], [b]ice lolly[/b], [b]ice block[/b], [b]ice drop[/b], [b]ice gola[/b], or [b]ice candy[/b].
A frozen, flavored, ice-based snack on a stick.

It is often portrayed [[melting]] and [[dripping]] in the [[hot|heat]] while a character [[eating|eats]] it, sometimes in a [[sexually suggestive]] manner.

On Danbooru it is used for generic ice pops, not necessarily for the "Popsicle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popsicle_%28brand%29 name brand.
teapot:
A container with a lid, spout, and handle, in which hot water is poured to steep [[tea]] leaves and from which the tea is then poured from. Often part of a [[tea set]].

Similar to but distinct from a [[coffee pot]]. Teapots are generally shorter and rounder than coffee pots.
absurdly long hair:
Hair longer than the character's height. Rule of thumb is a character is able to stand on their own hair.

See [[very long hair]] for hair that is less than body-length.
yellow dress: A [[dress]] that is mainly [[yellow]] in color.
blue hairband:
A [[hairband]] that is [[blue]] in color.

Not to be confused with a [[blue headband]].
riding crop:
A short, semi-rigid whip without a lash. Normally used for horse riding, but nowadays more often associated with BDSM.

Riding crops are often confused with teachers' [[pointer]]s.  A riding crop usually has some flex to it and often widens and flattens into a rectangular shape at its very tip. Pointers are usually thinner, completely rigid and may have an oblong cushion on the end. Even artists sometimes conflate the two.
yellow panties: [[Panties]] that are colored [[yellow]]. Do not use if the character is [[peeing]] unless the panties themselves are entirely yellow.
breast bondage: Refers to the use of rope to apply pressure to a woman's breasts.  A typical component of [[shibari|shibari]].
torn shirt: When the fabric in a [[shirt]] has been torn.
lanyard:
A rope, cord, or other fastener worn around the neck, wrist or belt and attached to an item that you do not wish to drop or have taken from you (e.g. [[binoculars]], a [[camera]], [[ID card]], [[weapon]] or [[whistle]]).
Not to be confused with [[eyewear strap]].

For the ornamental cords found on the shoulder part of a military or police uniform, see [[aiguillette]].
clipboard: A small board with a clip on the top to fasten a bunch of papers together. It is a practical way to do writing on the go for professionals such as researchers, doctors and restaurant servers.
skirt suit: A woman's [[suit]] of clothing consisting of a [[skirt]] and a matching or coordinating [[coat]] or [[jacket]].
pig: Used for the [[animal]] and for [[doll|dolls]] and other objects depicting one.
choke hold:
A [b]choke hold[/b], or stranglehold, is any type of unarmed strangulation technique used to submit an opponent or incapacitate a foe by restricting their airway (choking) or blood flow (strangulation). Choke holds are common in [[martial arts|]] such as [[judo]], Brazilian jiu-jitsu and sambo.

In judo these are known as shime-waza, and were originally codified by Kano Jigoro and the Kodokan judo school.

For Danbooru purposes, choke holds are to be tagged [[strangling]], not [[choking on object]].
striped neckwear:
See any of the following:

* [[striped necktie]]
* [[striped neckerchief]]
* [[striped ascot]]
* [[striped bowtie]]
* [[striped ribbon]] (for [[neck ribbon]]s)
goat horns:
A character having goat [[horns]].

This tag is often misused - goat horns, while often curved, usually do not curl all the way around, instead staying mostly upright. [[Sheep horns]] might be the tag you're looking for if you're looking for curled horns (or simply [[curled horns]]).
yakumo yukari:
The "Youkai of Boundaries". Phantasm Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and later a recurring playable character.

A powerful youkai of at least 1200 years of age, reputedly older than [[Gensokyo]] itself. Nominally responsible for guarding the border between Gensokyo and the outside world, but is frequently sleeping or slacking around, leaving her work to her shikigami [[Yakumo Ran]] and Ran's own shikigami [[Chen]].

Yukari has the power to manipulate boundaries, as well as create [[gap (touhou)|]]s, leading to her nickname "Sukima". However, she frequently holds back her powers and most of the time she only goes as far as playfully dragging any unsuspecting human from the outside world into Gensoukyou.

in [[Silent Sinner in Blue]] she has two pet crows - [[Zenki (touhou)|]] and [[Goki (touhou)|]].

Besides her servants, she is friends with [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] (whom she knew from as early as the latter's days as a human) and [[Hakurei Reimu]] (the other barrier guardian, whom she sometimes pesters). Also hinted to be [[Morichika Rinnosuke]]'s business partner and supplier of items from the outside world. Yukari has an as-yet undefined connection to [[Maribel Hearn]].

glint:
The sparkle of a polished or metal object. This should come from a physical object, such as [[jewelry]], a [[sword]], or [[teeth]].

[[Sparkle]], [b]glint[/b], and [[diffraction spikes]] all refer to similar patterns of bright lines radiating from a point. They are not clearly differentiated, and usage tends to be context-sensitive. In general:
* [[Sparkle]] is considered the base case. Usually four lines at right angles radiating from a point. Associated with eyes, liquid or particulate matter (e.g. raindrops, snow, sand), or nothing (appearing mid-air). Can appear in large numbers.
* [b]Glint[/b] is associated with solid objects, especially ones which are metallic and/or sharp. Usually appear singly or in small numbers.
* [[Diffraction spikes]] is the technical term for the phenomenon in general, but is used less often. Can be used for more realistic-looking effects or conversely when appearing extremely large and exaggerated. More likely than sparkle and glint to be asymmetric or to have more than four radiating lines.
ribs:

Different from [[ribs (food)]], which refers to ribs from an animal cooked for consumption.

shouji:
[b]Shouji[/b] (障子) are a type of [[door]], [[window]], or room divider in traditional [[east asian architecture|Japanese architecture]]. They consist of thin, translucent paper on a wooden lattice frame. The paper is thin enough to let light in, but not to see through.

Shouji can be used as [[sliding doors]] or as windows. Sometimes, shouji panels may include a small glass window to see through.

Shouji are similar to [[fusuma]], another type of sliding paper panel. The difference is that [[fusuma]] are made of thick, opaque paper that doesn't let light through.
:t:
[[Pout]]ing with one cheek puffed out, forming a :T shape with the lips. Typically representative of jealousy or indignation, or [[unamused|unamusement]].

Also used when the character is [[eating]] with their [[full mouth|mouth full]].
futasub:

Domination by [[tentacles]] or machines count, if the futanari is restrained by them. Softcore domination, where the futanari is teased or pleasured without restraints is allowed.
button gap:
A small gap between the [[buttons]] of a button-up [[shirt]], usually exposing a view of the character's [[cleavage]]. The gap may be caused by a [[popped button]], a [[partially unbuttoned]] shirt, or by a [[taut shirt]] tenting out due to the character's [[bursting breasts]].

The shirt should still be buttoned above and below the breasts, and the breasts should not be fully exposed.
beanie:
A tight-fitting knitted [[hat]] traditionally designed to keep the head warm in cold weather. Common styles of wear include hugging the head with a turned-up cuff, or leaving a few inches of the top unstretched to flop or stick up. 

Some knit beanies have [[pom pom beanie|pom pom]] balls at the top, and some have [[earflap beanie|earflaps]].

Also known as a tuque.
book stack:
A vertical grouping of [[book]]s where they are placed on top of one another to form a small tower.

For structures used for compact book storage, see [[bookshelf]] and [[library]].
suggestive fluid:
An innocent liquid presented in [[sexually suggestive]] way.

A common example is when a character is covered in something that looks like [[cum]] (or, less commonly, [[pussy juice]] or [[pee|urine]]), but is actually something innocent like [[ice cream]], [[milk]], [[mayonnaise]], [[sweat]], or [[lotion]].

Don't tag actual [[cum]] as a suggestive fluid. Unknown fluids that look like cum should be treated as cum if there are no context clues to suggest otherwise.

Use [[ambiguous red liquid]] when the fluid looks like blood but you are unsure.
folding fan:
A collapsible [[hand fan|handheld fan]]. 

Some of these fans were designed to be used as a weapon or shield, such as the [[Tessen]] (iron fan).

As [[bride|bridalwear]] in a traditional Japanese [[wedding]], they usually come in a set with a [[hakoseko]] and a [[futokorogatana]].
geta:
A traditional Japanese [[sandals|sandal]] with a wooden sole raised off the ground by two teeth (called [i]ha[/i]), and held onto the foot with a fabric thong ([i]hanao[/i]). There is also a specific style called [[Tengu-geta]], which has only a single peg in the middle. 

Not to be confused with [[okobo]], which are also elevated from the ground, but are made with a single platform running the entire length of the sandal instead of the teeth of the geta.
hip vent:
A [[clothing cutout]] in the hip area of a garment, like those found at the sides of the waistband of a [[hakama]]. Present in highly exaggerated form in the costumes of [[Ibuki (street fighter)|]], [[Akashi (kancolle)|]], [[Ooyodo (kancolle)|]], and [[Biwa Hayahide]].

If the cutout goes all the way down to the hem, use [[side slit]] (and possibly also [[pelvic curtain]]) instead.
neck ring: Any form of stiff [[jewelry]] worn as an ornament around the neck of an individual, as opposed to a loose [[necklace]].
aura:
The visible expulsion of inner energy. Usually associated with [[martial arts]], the use of superpowers, or perhaps comedically, such as when expressing anger.

Commonly seen when powering-up during a fight. May take the form of [[beam]]s like the [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]] when used aggressively, although it can have other uses or forms, as well. Mostly synonymous with other, popular terms like reiatsu or chakra.
sink: A bowl-shaped plumbing fixture for washing hands or utensils. Usually provided with a water source (such as a [[faucet]], or water [[pump]]) and a drain. Bathroom sinks are almost always paired with [[mirror|mirrors]]. Sinks may be free-standing fixtures or they may be integrated into a [[counter]].
hand on another's chin: When a character touches the [[chin]] of another character.
vampire:
A being in folklore who feeds on the [[blood]] of living creatures. Notable characteristics include [[fangs]], predatory eyes, and [[pale skin]].

Although typically described as undead, a vampire could be a living person. Popularized in Europe in the 18th century and codified in literature in the 19th as a Western folkloric being distinct from its Slavic(-Turkic) roots.

This tag should not be used unless vampiric traits are clearly visible in the image.

For the game produced by Capcom, see [[Darkstalkers]].

ripples: Concentric, circular patterns of small waves caused by something impacting [[water]] or other fluids.
carrot:

barbell piercing:
A type of [[piercing]] jewelry that is composed of a straight bar and with a bead on each end.

One or both beads are unscrewable for removal and/or changing of the beads. Often one of the beads is fixed, either via epoxy or welding, so that only one bead is used to install or remove the jewelry. 

There are also variations of the barbell piercing. Most common are [i]curved barbells[/i] (mostly used for [[navel piercing|navel piercings]]), [i]circular barbells[/i] and [i]surface bars[/i] which are used in surface piercings.
extra arms:

green shorts: Any style of [[shorts]] that are colored [[green]].

moriya suwako:
The "Epitome of Native Gods" (土着神の頂点).

Mountain goddess and original patron deity of the Moriya Shrine before losing it to [[Yasaka Kanako]], but has remained a fixture in the shrine. She has the power to create earth. Direct ancestor of the shrine's miko, [[Kochiya Sanae]]. Suwako joined Sanae and Kanako upon moving into [[Gensokyo]], although she is less troubled by the waning faith of people from the outside world than the latter two.

"Suwako is a god that takes the form of a frog". Her dress, her move in Hisoutensoku, and fanarts heavily depict this fact. This led to Kanako adopting snakes as her motif, symbolizing her victory over Suwako.

Her hat has almost become an entity of its own in fanarts, due to the imposing, leering eyes on top of it.

raglan sleeves:
Raglan sleeves are sleeves attached to a garment via a diagonal seam from the armpit to the neckline (rather than a simple circular seam at the edge of the shoulder). They are often made in a different color than the torso of the garment and are constructed from one piece of material. Raglan sleeves are commonly used in sportswear, as they are designed to give greater freedom of movement for the arm and shoulder. 

T-shirts with this type of sleeve are sometimes called "baseball shirts" due to their popularity of use as undershirts for baseball uniforms. Raglan sleeves became very popular in fashion outside of sports in the start of the 1970's.
top hat:
A [[hat]] with an elevated cap which is worn by people of high society or stage [[magician|magicians]].

It was created in the [[Victorian]] Era.
uwabaki:
Uwabaki(上履き, meaning 'indoor shoes') is the Japanese indoor [[shoes]] where outdoor shoes are prohibited, such as in schools, in gyms or some offices. 

Often considered as school indoor shoes made of white cloth and colored rubber often with a same-colored toe and shoe sole that sometimes indicates the grade, These are usually (but not always) in a style similar to [[mary janes]]. Students change their outdoor shoes into uwabaki at the [[getabako]]s when they enter the school.

Not to be confused with [[loafers]] which is worn quite often with school uniforms, but it is not indoor shoes.

zoom layer:
An additional layer that magnifies part of the illustration. It's a common technique used for backgrounds in character art. 

There are sometimes small, primarily 2D variations, such as:

* The layer being reversed.
* The layer being rotated.
* The layer being partially transparent, in greyscale, or having other changes in color.
* A character having a different expression.

If the layer is from a different 3D perspective, or there are larger 3D differences such as costumes, poses, or characters, it's a [[projected inset]] instead.

For the "zoom layer" effect used on [[stage]]s by projecting the performance on background [[screen]]s, use [[screen zoom]] instead.

dark penis: A [[penis]] that's darker than the rest of the body, or is visibly dark even if there's no body visible ([[disembodied_penis]]). Men regardless of skin color often have penises darker than the rest of their bodies, and this is sometimes emphasized/exaggerated in art.
denim: A textile made from cotton, or cotton-blends. It is sturdy and exhibits diagonal ribbing. [[Pants]] made of denim are called [[jeans]], and are the most common use for the material. Denim can be of any color, but is most often blue.
hands on own knees:

breastplate: A type of cast metal [[armor]] that covers the chest. It is meant to deflect or absorb incoming projectiles and blows. Most famously used by heavy infantry and heavy cavalry from the European medieval era, not to be confused with [[chest guard]]

grey dress: A [[dress]] that is mainly [[grey]] in color.

water drop: A small amount of [[water]] held together by viscosity (surface tension). Usually roughly spherical or teardrop-shaped, but may be deformed by motion.
antlers: A pair of branched solid bone horn-like structures that arise from the frontal bone on the head of animals of the deer family, and frequently depicted on [[eastern_dragon|Eastern-style dragons]].  Unlike horns, antlers are branched, quickly develop underneath a covering of furry skin called velvet, consist of dead bone once fully developed, and regularly shed over the course of the animal's life (most commonly every year).
surrounded by penises: A character surrounded by many anonymous [[penis]]es, usually in a [[gangbang]] or [[bukkake]] scenario.
dark labia:

bra lift:

thumbs up: The gesture of the raising the thumb(s), usually as a sign of approval.
saucer:

The saucer is useful to protect surfaces from possible damage due to the heat of a cup, and to catch overflow, splashes, and drips from the cup, so protecting both table linen and the user sitting in a free standing chair who holds both cup and saucer. It can also be an area to place your damp [[spoon|spoons]].

Often comes along with a [[tea set]] especially when being served to others.
souryuu asuka langley:

The red hot pilot of [[Eva 02|Evangelion Unit 02]], she is proud in nature and a tough girl with attitude. She is described as being [[tsundere]] for [[Ikari Shinji]] and the two may be considered a canon pairing as director [[Anno Hideaki]] has stated to prefer the two of them together. 

See {{Souryuu_Asuka_Langley Rebuild_of_Evangelion}} for Asuka Shikinami Langley from the [[Rebuild of Evangelion]] movies.
saber (fate):
A character from [[Fate/stay night]], [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], [[Fate/Zero]], and [[Fate/Extella]]. Saber is the female lead character of [[Fate/stay night]].

A young girl with [[blonde hair]] tied up in a [[single hair bun]] with a [[bun with braided base|braid]], [[green eyes]] and a distinctive [[ahoge]]. Often seen wielding a [[sword]] and wearing [[armored dress]], or a white [[blouse]] and a blue [[skirt]]. The Fate/Zero version is often drawn wearing a black [[business suit]] and hair tied in a [[ponytail]]. In [[Fate/stay night]], her chronological age is approximately in the late twenties, but she appears to be around fifteen, as her physical aging was stopped by magic in the "Sword in the Stone" event until her death in her original timeline.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]
mustache: A strip of [[facial hair]] that forms along the upper lip near the bottom of the nose.
tape gag: Using a strip of durable [[tape]] to shut someone up.
happy: Feeling or showing joy, contentment, or pleasure. Usually, this effect is achieved by [[laughing|laughter]] or a wide, open-mouth [[smile]].
breastless clothes: Clothing designed to intentionally expose the [[breasts]] rather than provide any real coverage. Often seen in [[bdsm]] wear or extremely provocative [[lingerie]].
red pants: Any style of [[pants]] that are colored [[red]].

Like [[full body]], except one of the character's feet are outside of the image. Part of the character's shins may be cropped out as well, but their knees should be within the image. Compare with [[cowboy shot]].

houshou marine:

She has [[heterochromia]], with her left eye being [[red eyes|red]] and her right eye being [[yellow eyes|yellow]] (although the latter is usually concealed by a black [[eyepatch]]), [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]], [[red hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]s.

stepped on:
For when a character is stepping on another character. Usually signifies dominance over another, or showing who the victor is after a [[fighting|fight]].

eyepatch bikini: A [[strapless bikini]] where the top consists of two square-cut pieces of fabric resembling a [[medical eyepatch]] and held together with two parallel straps. Often seen in a [[micro bikini]] size that only barely covers the nipples.
walk-in: A situation where at least one character enters an ongoing scene of sensitive nature, to the surprise (and often dismay) of one or both parties.
holster:
A container worn on the body to hold a [[handgun]]. Holsters may often be found belted around the [[thigh holster|thigh]], on the hip, or suspended under the [[armpits]] from a [[shoulder holster]].

For knife, dagger, or sword holsters, use [[sheath]] or [[scabbard]].
chandelier:
An often ornate lighting fixture that hangs from a [[ceiling]]. Early chandeliers used multiple [[candle|candles]] for light, but in modern times these have been replaced with [[light_bulb|electric lamps]]. Some chandeliers have arrays of crystal prisms to scatter light throughout a room. Due to their size and the amount of light they produce, chandeliers are usually installed as focal points in large rooms such as [[dining_room|dining rooms]], lounges, or [[stairs|staircases]].

This tag is distinct from [[hanging light]] in that hanging lights are of simple design and only have one or two lamps each, whereas chandeliers are large fixtures that branch out into multiple lamps.
spanked:
A character that has been spanked (struck on the buttocks, with a bare hand or other object, for disciplinary or sexual reasons). This is usually indicated by  a red mark on their [[ass]], which may or may not be in the shape of a hand. General reddening of the [[ass]] also is indicative of spanking.

While commonly tagged alongside with [[spanking]], in cases where there is no active spanking occurring, the spanked tag should be used stand alone.
sleeveless kimono: A [[kimono]] that does not have attached sleeves.
erect clitoris: A noticeable stiffening of the [[clitoris]], similar to a [[erection]]. Length may vary. The phenomenon is known as a clitoral erection and is a real sexual response in humans, caused by increase blood flow to the clitoris. The clitoris is the homolog to the penis which means it shares many functions with it, such as erections.
lucy heartfilia: The main female protagonist of [[Fairy Tail]].
shared object insertion: [[Object insertion]] where the object is inserted into multiple characters.
penetration gesture:

minigirl:

Girls who are small but not extraordinarily or unnaturally so are [[petite]] instead. Non-living [[doll]]s are not considered minigirls.

For the male counterpart to this tag, see [[miniboy]]. For non-humanoid characters like creatures and animals, see [[undersized animal]].
breast curtain: An upper-body garment with a single loose flap of cloth that hangs over the [[breasts]], resembling a very short [[tabard]]. They are unsecured against being lifted to reveal the breasts, but they may be weighted to prevent unintentional exposure.
afterimage: An instance of an object in a previous position. Usually depicted as a partial, off-set copy of the object, with varying degrees of differences.
knee pads: Protective gear worn on the knees to protect them against impact injury from falling to the ground or hitting an obstacle, or to provide padding for extended kneeling.
cum on stomach: When [[cum]] is present on a person's [[stomach]].
padlock: A detachable lock hanging by a pivoted hook on the object fastened.
shameimaru aya:
The "Traditional Reporter of Fantasy". First appeared as an opponent (and later, playable character) in the ninth [[Touhou]] game, [i][[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]][/i]. She has since reappeared in other games as a playable character, and often appears in the various print works.

Aya is a crow tengu, and has the ability to manipulate the wind in addition to the exceptional sight and long-range hearing possessed by most tengu. She is also absurdly fast, perhaps even the fastest in Gensokyo. She runs, reports, and photographs for her own newspaper, the [i][[Bunbunmaru]] Shinbun[/i]. However, the publication is notorious for being filled with rumors, gossip, and personal opinion. 

She is the rival of fellow journalist [[Himekaidou Hatate]], who runs the [i]Kakashi Nenpo[/i] ("Kakashi Spirit Times"). She was (and still is) also often depicted in fanworks as a friend to (or the superior of) the white wolf tengu [[Inubashiri Momiji]], one of the guardians of Youkai Mountain. However, it was revealed in [[Double Spoiler]] that the two actually dislike one another. 

Her catchphrase is "[[ayaya~]]".
backless outfit: An outfit either partly or fully revealing the [[back]].
brown dress: A [[dress]] that is mainly [[brown]] in color.
police hat: A [[hat]] worn by [[police]] officers. Typically depicted as a [[blue headwear|blue to dark blue]] [[peaked cap]] with police badge on it.
yor briar:
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]]. She is an assassin under the code name "Thorn Princess". She use her signature ring-pommeled [[stiletto (weapon)|]]s as her weapon.

As a part of her cover identity, she is pretending to be the wife of [[Twilight (spy x family)|]]. Both characters are unaware of the other party's secret identity. She is also acting as stepmother for [[Anya (spy x family)|]] and adores her new stepdaughter. While she's off-duty, she works as a clerk at the city hall.

She is by voiced by [[Hayami Saori]] in Japanese and Natalie Van Sistine in English.
remilia scarlet:
The "Scarlet Devil". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character.

[[vampire|Vampiric]] mistress of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] of at least 500 years of age despite her childish appearance, whose title comes from the bloodstains on her clothes and her fearsome ability to manipulate fate. Nevertheless, she is refined and friendly, if somewhat bratty. Besides her younger sister [[flandre_scarlet|Flandre]] and the rest of her household - head maid and personal attendant [[Izayoi Sakuya]], gatekeeper [[Hong Meiling]], and librarian [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and the little devil [[Koakuma]], among others - she is also good friends with her one-time nemesis, [[Hakurei Reimu]]. Atypical of vampires, Remilia has a low appetite for blood.

Sometimes drawn with her weapon, [[Spear the Gungnir]].
long braid: For longer than normal [[braid]]s or extremely long braids, from head to butt or further.
mountainous horizon: When the [[horizon|horizon's]] edge consists of a long mountain or a series of mountain tops. Do not use this tag in conjunction with [[mountain]] if they are mere specks on the horizon.
hair horns: [[Fake horns]] that are made with a character's hair. Almost like [[cone hair bun]], except the hair is tied a lot tighter so that they resemble horns. Can also be produced when a character's hair naturally sticks up to form a spike.
scared:
A character who is in an emotional state of fear.

This can be used in either a humorous or serious fashion. Characteristics include [[trembling]], wide eyes, [[tears]], [[cowering]], and in extreme cases, contracted pupils and a general sense of great danger approaching the character.

sailor senshi uniform:
The iconic costume worn by the [[Sailor Senshi]] in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. Its basic design is comprised of the following, starting from the top:

* [[circlet]]
* [[earrings]]
* [[choker]]
* [[sailor collar]]
* a [[bow]] and [[brooch]] on the chest
* [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]] (hand gloves for Sailors Uranus and Neptune)

* a [[back bow|bow on the back of the waist]]
* any variety of footwear

Each of the Sailor Senshi wear different theme colors and have design variations of the above, but the overall uniform is generally the same.

Due to them wearing skirts, it's not immediately obvious that they are wearing leotards. Because of this, images where the leotard can be seen from under the skirt usually get tagged as [[white panties]] due to Danbooru's policy of "tag what you see".

Note that this uniform represents Earth's Sailor Senshi, while warriors from different star systems like the Sailor Starlights and Shadow Galactica have completely different designs, with the sailor collar being the only consistent design aspect.

office: A building or room where people engage in business or professional activities at their desks.
oppai loli: Used when a female child or child-like character has notably adult-sized breasts, but otherwise retains their child-like proportions. blanket:

prostate milking: Manual massage of the [[prostate]], up the [[anus]], to cause [[ejaculation]].

light blue hair: Deprecated tag. Use [[blue hair]], [[aqua hair]], [[grey hair]], or [[white hair]] instead.

glass: A type of material made by exposing a silica and sodium oxide mixture into a furnace to melt it into liquid glass, then shaping it into windows, usable kitchen tools, bottles and other drinking cups, and glass art.
axe:
An [[tools|implement]] consisting of a wedge-shaped blade head attached to long handle.

As a tool, it is usually used to chop down trees or cut wood. As a weapon, it has a longer handle and a sharper, thinner, and sometimes double-edged head used to cleave and hack into opponents.
mechanical halo: A [[halo]] that floats above a character's head by mechanical or technological means. Sometimes equipped with lights.
candy:
Candy, specifically sugar candy, is a confection made from a concentrated solution of sugar in water, to which flavorings and colorants are added. Candies come in numerous colors and varieties and have a long history in popular culture. Outside the United States, it is referred to as "sweets" or "confectioneries."

green footwear: Deprecated tag. Use one of the tags below instead.

locker room: A [[room]] that has numerous [[locker|lockers]] for people to store their personal items, may also overlap with [[changing room]].
feet up:

kijin seija:

She has the power to flip anything over, and has extreme contrarian tendencies; liking whatever others dislike, becoming unhappy whenever others are happy, saying the opposite of what she really means, and so on. She is the instigator of the plot of Double Dealing Character, manipulating [[Sukuna Shinmyoumaru]] into helping her create a world where the weak will rule over the strong.

ganyu (genshin impact):

A half-human, half-[[qilin (mythology)|]] who serves as an emissary and secretary for the Liyue Qixing.

She has [[goat horns]], with [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[sidelocks]]. She wears a brown [[halterneck]] [[backless_outfit|backless]] [[bodystocking]] along with [[detached sleeves]] and a [[cowbell]] on her [[neck bell|neck]]. couple: Two persons who are shown to be [b]mutually[/b] attracted to each other. That is to say, don't add this tag if one of the group is uncertain or shying away.
slippers:
A type of soft closed-toe, flat heeled [[shoes|shoe]] meant to be worn indoors.

Not to be confused with [[sandals]]. Slippers have a soft sole and usually cover the toes, while sandals have rigid soles and usually don't cover the toes.
arm hair: Hair usually found on the forearm of males, but can also be found on the upper arm and shoulders in [[hairy]] cases.
ceiling light: A light fixture affixed to the [[ceiling]] that is controlled by a switch on the wall. This includes recessed can lights, surface-mounted fixtures, and track lighting.
body markings:

* a natural trait of the character, possibly shared by others of their clan, race or species, or;
* of ambiguous nature. It may be unclear whether the markings are [[tattoo]]s, [[makeup]]/[[bodypaint]], [[tanlines]], or something else.

spoken ellipsis: When a [[speech bubble]] contains only an ellipsis ([[...]]). Meant to show that a character is at a loss for words.
intestines:
The intestines, or bowels, are the segment of the alimentary canal extending from the stomach to the anus and, in humans and other mammals, they consist of two segments, the small intestine and the large intestine. In humans, the small intestine is further subdivided into the duodenum, jejunum and ileum while the large intestine is subdivided into the cecum and colon.

Use this tag on images where intestines, whether large or small, are visible.
neon lights:
Tube-style light fixtures named after and commonly filled with the gas Neon. Typically paired with coatings that produce brighter colors, contrasting [[fluorescent lamp|flourescents]] which are almost always white.

Due to the fragility of the tubes and risk of noxious gas leaks, many modern "Neon" light fixtures use instead LEDs in acrylic to simulate the traditional Neon lights' appearance.
coin: A round metal disk used as [[money]].
cheerleader: A person who practices cheerleading, usually a girl. Generally wears a distinctive uniform and carries cheerleading [[pom pom (cheerleading)|]]s.
fog: A weather condition caused by [[cloud]]s forming along either ground or water surface. Results in anywhere from slight to extremely reduced visibility.
bra visible through clothes: A [[bra]] visible through a top due to [[wet|wetness]] or [[see-through clothes|see-through]] material.
cheek bulge: Something pushing against the inside of a character's mouth, making their cheek bulge out. For things pushing against the outside of a character's face, use [[cheek poking]].
multicolored bikini: Multicolored [[bikini]] has two or more colors on the leg or have blended colors. See [[multicolored clothes]] for guidelines on what is considered multicolored.
suspended congress: A sexual position in which the penetrating partner lifts the receiving partner off their feet. The penetrating partner lifts the receiving partner and penetrates them in the air. The penetrating partner can be a man, futanari, woman with a strap-on, etc.
photo background:
When a real-world [[photo (medium)|]] is used as the background for a drawing.

If the photo was altered (such as being redrawn or filtered) to the point that the photo is indistinct from the rest of the image, then do not apply this tag.

If the photo is used as a reference for character's posture, then the tag [[photo-referenced]] is applicable.
full-face blush:
When a character is really [[embarrassed]] and their whole face [[blush]]es, rather than just the cheeks.

It's not a full-face blush if it doesn't extend any higher or lower than the cheeks. The blush should reach at least as far up as the forehead and as far down as the mouth.
If it doesn't reach up or down, but it extends inwards to the nose, use [[nose blush]] instead of this tag. If it extends outwards to the ears, use [[ear blush]] instead of this tag.
crop top overhang:
A [[crop top]] that hangs loosely over the [[midriff]] and/or the [[underboob]]. Usually does not apply to tighter-fitting crop-top garments.

A [[crop top]] and [[crop top overhang]] are frequently signature elements in the outfit of [[Shimakaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Matoi Ryuuko]].
heart necklace: A [[necklace]] with a [[heart]]-shaped jewel attached on the front.

off-shoulder sweater:
A specific type of shoulder-less [[sweater]] which is [i]naturally designed[/i] with a low and wide-cut neckline which ensures that the garment sits just below the shoulders, leaving them and the wearer's upper chest area [[bare shoulders|bare]]. Often features a thicker, sometimes mantle-like hem along the top.

Off-shoulder sweaters are meant to emphasize and accentuate the wearer's shoulders, [[collarbone]], and neck (or [[nape]]), with the sleeves of an off-shoulder sweater sitting on the upper arms instead of on top of the shoulders.

Frequently appears as a distinct variant of [[ribbed sweater]].
wet panties: Panties that have wet marks on them. It could be due to many reasons, such as recent [[peeing self|urination]] or [[pussy juice]] from sexual arousal.
spaghetti strap: A very thin type of shoulder strap typically found on [[camisole]]s and other feminine top wear. Note that the spaghetti strap is not a top in and of itself, but describes a thin strap used on various top styles.
happy sex:
[[Tag group:sex acts|Sexual activity]] in which the participants are visibly [[happy]].

flandre scarlet:
A [[Touhou]] character (alt. spelling Frandre, Flandoll, Frandoll). The "Diabolic Wave". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and Playable Character in [[Sunken Fossil World]].

The younger, mentally unstable sister of [[Remilia Scarlet]], sealed in the basement of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] for 495 years because of her ability to cause wanton destruction. Despite her sheltered life, she is fond of her sister, usually never tries to leave the mansion, and in more recent works such as [[Foul Detective Satori]] has shown a remarkable growth in stability and self-awareness. Flandre is easily distinguished by her unique, [[multicolored wings|multicolored]] [[crystal wings]].

Sometimes drawn with her weapon, [[Laevatein (touhou)|]]. Alternatively, it might be depicted as a tail; see [[laevatein (tail)]].
cone hair bun:

If a character's hair is tied so tightly that they resemble sharp horns ([[Mioda Ibuki]]), or their hair sticks up to form natural spikes ([[Marnie (pokemon)|]]), use [[hair horns]].
red bra: A [[bra]] or similar upper body [[lingerie]] that is colored red.
ribbed leotard:
A [[leotard]] that has vertical lines made to resemble a ribbed pattern.

The term referring to a leotard-like garment made from different material worn in replacement of a shirt.  These are different from the full body covering used for the bodysuit tag on Danbooru.

Scissors are used for cutting various thin materials, such as paper, cardboard, metal foil, thin plastic, cloth, rope and wire.
