jack-o'-lantern:
A vegetable [[lantern]] commonly carved from a [[pumpkin]], typically as a [[Halloween]] decoration. The pumpkin has a face or image carved into it, and the insides are usually scooped out so that a [[candle]] can be placed inside to illuminate the carving.

The practice originated from Ireland where they would use turnips or mangelwurzel to craft these lanterns for Halloween.  Irish immigrants brought this tradition to North America where it led to the development of carving pumpkins to make jack-o'-lanterns.
pink rose: One of the most popular, naturally-occurring flowers across the world, representing gentleness, refinement and femininity.
crotch seam:
Either:

* A vertical seam in the crotch of a pair of [[pantyhose]].
* A horizontal seam in the crotch of a pair of [[panties]].
* Less commonly, a seam in the crotch of some other type of clothing.

Not to be confused with [[cameltoe]]. A cameltoe and a vertical seam may look similar, but a cameltoe is not an actual seam in the clothing.
mouth pull: Pulling open one's own mouth or another person's mouth.
asymmetrical gloves:
Gloves that, by design, lack symmetry. 

* For differences in length, use [[uneven gloves]].
* For differences in color or pattern, use [[mismatched gloves]].
cover page: [[Cover]] art for print media, other than [[magazine cover]]s. The majority of these will be [[doujin cover|doujin covers]], although [[manga cover|manga]], [[novel cover|novel]], artbook, calendar (etc) cover art can be found here too. The tag may apply to both real and [[fake cover|mock-up]] images.
chun-li:
[b]Chun-Li[/b] (Traditional: 春麗. Simplified: 春丽) is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series by [[Capcom]]. She is the first female playable character to appear in a 1-on-1 fighting game.

Introduced in [[Street Fighter II (series)|]], Chun-Li was the youngest member of the roster and only female character in the game, the self-proclaimed "strongest woman in the world," and while not as physically powerful as the other characters, she was by far the quickest. Her most famous attack is the [i]Hyakuretsukyaku[/i] ("Hundred Crack Legs", alternately known as "Lightning Legs"), where she repeatedly kicks her opponent from a tilted standing position with incredible speed.

In the Street Fighter series, Chun-Li was an Interpol investigator from [[China]] who had been searching for clues to the recent death of her father. Getting into a friendly spar with an old teacher of hers and friend of her father, [[Gen (street fighter)|]], he gives her a lead into who may have killed her father—the mysterious crime syndicate Shadaloo and its tyrannical leader [[M. Bison]]. After an encounter where M. Bison confirms he slew her father, a tearful Chun-Li swore vengeance and made it her life's mission to destroy Shadaloo and bring M. Bison to justice. She collaborated closely with [[Guile]], [[Cammy White]], [[Ryu (Street Fighter)|]], and the other World Warriors throughout the journey.

After M. Bison's supposedly final death during [[Street Fighter V]], her mission complete, Chun-Li retired from Interpol and opened an orphanage to live a quieter life. The most famous of her young wards - practically her adopted daughter - is [[Li-Fen]].

Chun-Li is one of Capcom's most popular characters and one of the most important females in video game history, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions. Her oldest and arguably greatest cross-company rival is [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]]'s [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]].
window blinds: A [[window]] covering composed of long slats used to block light from coming through the window.
energy sword:
A [[sword]] with a blade made of some sort of energy instead of a physical blade. 

The best-known example is the [[Star Wars]] [[lightsaber]], but energy swords are also very common in [[science fiction]] themed anime and manga.

Characters such as [[Kuwabara Kazuma]] from [[Yu Yu Hakusho|Yu Yu Hakusho]] and [[Vegetto]] from [[Dragon Ball Z]] are known for having energy sword attacks.
pussy juice trail: A string connecting two or more points made from vaginal secretions.
pantylines: The outline of the [[panties]] being visible underneath [[tight clothes]]. Doesn't apply to [[panties under pantyhose]] or other [[see-through clothes]], obviously.
throne: A usually decorated and cushioned [[chair]] where a ruler or a respectable person sits.
evil smile: A sinister, sadistic or malicious [[smile]]. If the smile shows teeth, it's also an [[evil grin]].
food on face: Having particles of food on one's face. Generally a result of sloppy eating.
game controller:
A device used to provide input to a computer or [[video game]]. Normally this refers to a controller that is separate from the main machine, connected by wire or wirelessly, as opposed to the controls built into a handheld portable game machine such as [[Game Boy]] or [[Nintendo DS]]. Examples of game controllers may include [[gamepad]], [[joystick]] (which should really not be confused with gamepad), arcade stick, flightstick, steering wheel, lightgun, the Microsoft Kinect for [[Xbox 360]], and many, many more.

See "Wikipedia definition":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Game_controller for more details.
spear: A type of [[polearm]] consisting of a sharp point or blade at the end of a long shaft, traditionally for thrusting. One of the most common [[polearm]]s.
fairy wings:
The wings of a [[fairy]]. Extremely diverse and can range from insect-like designs to those resembling specific shapes.

Does not include [[butterfly_wings]].
kouzuki kallen:
A character from [[Code Geass]]. She goes by [b]Kallen Stadtfeld[/b], using her father's name, at school but uses this name, which has her natural mother's name, during her revolutionary activities.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].
stained glass:
Sectioned, colored [[glass]] often used in [[church]] [[window|windows]].

Usually also contains examples of [[mosaic art]] or [[mosaic pattern]].
cross pasties: [[Pasties]] in the shape of an X or a cross. Often, the pasties are made out of black electrical tape.
library:
A place to store reading materials. It's size ranges from one room to a single building.

The [[Voile]] from the [[Touhou]] series is a famous example of this.
heart ahoge: An instance of "expressive hair" where a character's [[ahoge]] (lock of hair that sticks up) bends to form a [[heart]], often to indicate that the owner is [[happy]] or in love. Distinct from [[heart antenna hair]], which is made from multiple ahoge.
sniper rifle:
A high-precision [[rifle]] designed to accurately engage targets at long range, equipped with a [[scope|telescopic sight]] most of the time. Most modern sniper rifles feature a buttstock with adjustable length and cheekpiece position, as well as a (detachable) [[bipod]] for stability. Some of them fire specialized [[rifle cartridge|rounds]] such as the .338 Lapua Magnum, while many models share the same ammunition with the more common service rifles, such as 7.62×51mm NATO.

This tag also apply to World War II-era or earlier conventional full-length rifles with a long range scope, such as the [[Mosin-Nagant]].
spread toes: When an image shows [[feet]] with the [[toes]] spread apart, either by themselves (i.e. flexing your toes apart) or through external means (e.g. moving them apart using hands, placing fingers between them).
innertube:
A flotation device used as a recreational swimming aid, especially by young children and older persons who cannot swim. So called because it resembles (and in earlier times, usually [i]was[/i]) the inner tube of a car tire.

On Danbooru, often constructed of [[transparent]] material, ostensibly for better visibility of the wearer.

A [[lifebuoy]] is visually similar, but its use and usual material composition are different.
holed coin: A [[coin]] with a hole in the center. Commonly seen on the Chinese "cash":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cash_(Chinese_coin)] and Japanese [[yen]] coins, where the hole was meant to string them together into easily manageable bundles.
mouse tail: A [[tail]] of a [[mouse (animal)|]], which is usually wiry and lacking fur, as compared to other tails.
polearm: Close combat [[weapon]] in which the main fighting part of the weapon is placed on the end of a long shaft.
konpaku youmu:
The "Half-Human Half-Phantom". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and later a recurring playable character.

Gardener of [[Hakugyokurou]], the netherworld pagoda, and bodyguard of its "princess", [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]]. She wields a [[katana]], Roukanken, and a [[wakizashi]], Hakurouken. Youmu specializes in rapid swordplay taught by her predecessor [[Konpaku Youki|Youki]]. She is always followed by [[Konpaku Youmu (ghost)|her phantom half]], which floats beside her. She is nicknamed "Myon" in many fanworks, based on a [[myon (phrase)|nonsensical word]] she muttered back in PCB. Ironically, although she is half-phantom, she is terrified of ghosts.
submachine gun:
A [b]submachine gun[/b] or SMG is a carbine-length, pistol-caliber [[gun|firearm]] that is capable of fully automatic fire. Early SMGs such as the [[MP18]] have rifle-like appearance. While more modern models do have features like [[folding stock]], pistol grip and a fire selector. The term "submachine gun" was coined by [[Thompson submachine gun|John T. Thompson]], to describe its design concept as an automatic [[weapon]] with notably less firepower than a [[machine gun]] (hence the prefix "sub-"). 

A subset of submachine gun is dubbed [b]machine pistol[/b], which are often used to describe a handgun with automatic fire capability (e.g. Glock 18C), or compact SMGs with [[handgun]]-like ergonomics (e.g. Micro Uzi).
cum on penis: When there is cum on a man's penis during or after a sexual act.
cockpit:
A [b]cockpit[/b] (also called [b]flight deck[/b] in big airplanes) is the area, usually near the front of a vehicle, from which its [[pilot]] controls it. 

Most modern cockpits are enclosed, except on some small [[aircraft]], and cockpits on large airliners are also physically separated from the cabin. From the cockpit an aircraft is controlled on the ground and in the air.

Most [[mecha]] also contain cockpits for a human operator.

This version of Artoria is taller, possesses [[large breasts|larger breasts]], longer bangs ([[swept bangs|swept]] or [[hair between eyes|falling between her eyes]]), and longer [[sidelocks]]. Due to her larger breasts, she's often called 乳王 (Milk/Breast King) among the fanbase.

gothic lolita: Gothic Lolita (ゴスロリ, "GothLoli", or sometimes "Loli-Goth") is a specific kind of fashion that is a mixture of both [[goth fashion]] and [[Lolita fashion|Lolita styles]]. [[Lolita fashion]] draws much of its inspiration from Rococo, Victorian-style and Edwardian fashion and often aims to imitate the look of Victorian children or porcelain dolls. Gothic Lolita applies the aesthetics of [[goth fashion]] to the childlike, pretty [[Lolita fashion]].
swim trunks:

drawstring: A drawstring is a cord that, when pulled, gathers up and shortens the material through which it is threaded. Drawstrings are commonly used to secure hoods on [[hoodie|hoodies]] and [[hooded_jacket|hooded jackets]] and tighten waistbands on garments such as [[sweatpants]] and [[bloomers]]. They may also be used to to keep [[bag|bags]] closed.

smeared lipstick: [[Lipstick]] that is smudged across its wearer's face. A common consequence of passionate [[kiss]]ing or [[fellatio]], but it can also be due to nonsexual activities like [[eating]] or [[wiping mouth]].

stubble:
Short, growing [[facial hair]], sometimes referred to as "five-o'clock shadow".
Can sometimes be a design choice between [[long sideburns]] and/or [[goatee]] for a unique full [[beard]] style like with [[Takemaru (housamo)|]].
covering mouth: See [[covering own mouth]] or [[covering another's mouth]].
fox shadow puppet:
A hand gesture created by placing the extended thumb, middle and ring fingers together while raising the little and index fingers upright. Creates a reasonable [[shadow puppet]] approximation of a [[fox]]. Commonly associated with [[kitsune]] and other [[fox girl]]s, since it is used in Japanese [[sign language]] as the sign for 'ki', derived from [[kitsune]].

Not to be confused with [[\||/]].
consensual tentacles:
[[Tentacle sex]] where the recipient of the tentacles' sexual attentions is clearly willing.

Also known as "consentacles".
clitoris ring:
A [[ring]] worn in a [[piercing]] through the [[clitoris]]. 

This is different from [[clitoris sleeve]] which is some form of jewelry or ring that goes around the clitoris like a ring around a finger.
thigh sex:
A [[tag group:sex acts|sex act]] in which a person rubs their [[penis]] in between their partner's closed [[thighs]]. Also known as intercrural or interfemoral sex, or sometimes by the Japanese term 'sumata' (すまた).

Not to be confused with [[kneepit sex]] or [[thigh straddling]]. Use [[grinding]] instead when the [[penis]] is rubbed directly on the [[pussy]] instead of between the [[thighs]].

This tag is somewhat of a misnomer because while the word [[sex]] is used, it shouldn't be tagged as such as well. Sex is only when the penis is inserted into the vaginal or anal cavities.
shushing: Shush, the index finger of one hand is extended and placed vertically in front of the lips, with the remaining fingers curled toward the palm with the thumb forming a fist; used to demand or request silence from those to whom it is directed. Can be silent or accompanied by an audible "Sssh!" sound which alone has the same meaning.
hitodama: A hitodama is a glowing spirit in the shape of a ball with a flowing tail.
carrying: Supporting something or someone, usually with one's arms.
braided hair rings:
[[Hair rings]] that are [[braid]]ed.

Also known as [[Pon de ring]] hair (ポンデリングヘア).
planet:
A large spherical astronomical object that typically [[in orbit| orbit]]s a [[star (sky)|]]. The tag should be used when at least one planet is seen from outer [[space]] or from the surface of another nearby planet. This includes real and fictional planets.  

Scientifically, there has always been some ambiguity as to what constitutes a planet, with some celestial bodies such as [[Pluto (planet)|]] and Ceres being considered at different times or by different people either as planets or as "dwarf planets". The International Astronomical Union (IAU) came up with a definition for a planet in 2006, meaning that the planets in our solar system are officially [[Mercury_(planet)|]], [[Venus (planet)|]], [[Earth (planet)|]], [[Mars_(planet)|]], [[Jupiter (planet)|]], [[Saturn (planet)|]], [[Uranus (planet)|]] and [[neptune (planet)|]], but the definition remains contentious.
arched back: When someone's back forms an inverted arch. The opposite, caused by leaning forward is [[bent back]].
showering:
The act of taking a shower. Usually within a [[shower (place)|shower]] room, but may also be used for characters caught in a [[rain|rainstorm]].

For images of the shower room or stall itself, see [[shower (place)]].
chest hair: Hair on one's chest that varies in color, length, and volume between individuals. Although almost exclusively found on (human-like) men, chest hair can also be found on [[furry|non-human humanoids]] of either gender.
green hairband:
A [[hairband]] that is colored [[green]].

Not to be confused with a [[green headband]].
broom: An object consisting of a long stick with a brush made out of stiff fibres at one end. It can be used for either sweeping the floor or [[broom_riding|transportation by flight]].
fantasy:
A genre of fiction that commonly uses [[magic]] and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting.

Fantasy settings often draw upon historical settings and costume, but subvert them in unrealistic ways, such as adding mystical or supernatural elements like mythology, magic, fictional creatures and unhistorical components. 

For imaginative settings that draw upon ideas of the future or futurism see [[science fiction]], altough they may overlap.
mini hat: A [[hat]] that's smaller in size than usual. It doesn't fit around the character's head, so it's more used as a [[hair ornament]].
gold trim: An article of clothing or armor that has a golden trim around at least one of its edges.
skeleton:
The complete set of [[bone]]s or other rigid supporting structures of a human or animal. Often seen via [[x-ray]], or left behind after flesh rots from a [[corpse]].

Skeletons animated by magic or supernatural forces should also be tagged [[undead]].

For creatures with external skeletons, see the [[carapace]] tag.

If the skeleton is from an animal or non-humanoid creature in general use [[animal skeleton]].

h6. Specific animal skeletons
* [[Dinosaur skeleton]]
* [[Fish skeleton]]
* [[Skeleton horse]]
* [[Skeleton snake]]
dog tags:
A dog tag is the informal name for the identification tags worn by military personnel, because of their resemblance to actual "dog tags":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pet_tag]. The tag is primarily used for the identification of dead and wounded along with providing essential basic medical information for the treatment of the latter such as blood type and history of inoculations. 

They are also used as fashion accessories.
tress ribbon:
A [[hair ribbon]] that is used only on a lock of hair. 

A "tress" is a long lock of hair, especially a long lock of women's hair. Archaically refers to a braid.
tail ornament: Any decorative object or ornament attached to a [[tail]].
komeiji koishi:
The "Closed Eyes of Love". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Subterranean Animism]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]], [[Urban Legend In Limbo]], and [[Antinomy Of Common Flowers]]

A "Satori":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satori_%28folklore%29 [[traditional youkai|youkai]]. Koishi has sealed off her mind-reading ability (represented by the fact her third eye is closed) so she would not experience the fear and loathing her older [[sisters|sister]] [[Komeiji_Satori|Satori]] suffered.  This indirectly gave her a new power, the ability to manipulate the [i]subconscious[/i]. Her own conscious mind was sealed away as well, and she no longer has a real personality or desires. Koishi now wanders [[Gensokyo]], going wherever her subconscious wills her.
motor vehicle: Any motorized, self-propelled ground vehicle that [b]does not[/b] operate on [[railroad tracks]]. Commonly wheeled or sometimes has [[caterpillar tracks]].
shark tail:
A character with a [[shark]]-like [[tail]], with vertical fins. See [[cetacean tail]] for tails with horizontal fins.

The character should still have human legs. If the character has a shark tail but no legs, use the tag [[mermaid]] or [[merman]] instead.
sandwiched: Situation where one person is depicted between two other people in close proximity.
tube:
Any hollow cylinder used to contain something. May or not may not have edges on either or both ends.

Note to be confused with [[industrial pipe]], which are used to transport stuff, not contain.

If the tube is a named container such as [[test tube]] or [[bell jar]], use that tag instead.
hairpin: A [[hair ornament]] used to hold hair in place. Unlike a [[hairclip]], a hairpin lacks a clasping mechanism and simply slides into the hair. It can take the shape of a 'U' or a [[hair stick|stick]] and may have decorative ornaments at one end. The simplest and the most common hairpin is a bobby pin, which is often drawn as a simple line on a lock of hair.
cowboy hat: A wide-brimmed [[hat]] worn by [[cowboy]]s, ranchers, and farmers, and is common in the western [[United states|United States]] and [[Mexico]].
green pants: Any style of [[pants]] that are colored [[green]].
bandaid on knee: When a [[bandaid]] is used to cover an [[injury]] on the [[knees]] of a character.
beach towel: An oversized and colorful [[towel]] taken to the [[beach]] or [[pool]]. Often used to [[lying|lay]] on for protection from the hot ground or while [[sunbathing]].
pout: The protruding of the lips to one side to show displeasure.
korra:
The main and titular character of [[The Legend of Korra]]. She is the antecedent avatar to [[Aang]].

She is a [[dark-skinned female]] who has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] (later [[short hair|short]]) stylized in a [[ponytail]] with [[bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears blue [[hair tubes]], a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[blue pants]], [[fur-trimmed overskirt|fur-trimmed]] [[brown skirt|brown]] [[overskirt]], [[blue gloves|blue]] [[elbow gloves]], [[vambrace
front-tie top:
A front-tie top may refer to a [[bikini]] top (or less commonly, a [[bra]] undergarment such as at post #478758) which closes in front of the chest by two or more ends tied together, forming a knot between the breasts. It may also refer to a [[tied_shirt|plain shirt]] or [[crop_top|crop top]] tied in the same manner, forming a type of [[halterneck]] which both emphasizes the resulting bare [[midriff]] and the bustline or [[cleavage]]. Variations may be purely ornamental in nature rather than functional (e.g. [[bow bra]], post #490346), mostly theoretical (a mere ribbon at post #652439), or may feature a [[o-ring_top|metal loop]] to help connect bra cups together and tie to a neck strap.

The term could arguably be used to describe a [[corset]], [[bustier]] or other similar garment which features a frontal latticework that, in turn, terminates in a central knot (e.g. post #419234).
hoshiguma yuugi:
The "Rumored Unnatural Phenomenon". Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Subterranean Animism]][/i]. Has the ability to control supernatural phenomena, but is usually just depicted as physically strong.

Yuugi is an [[oni]] with a [[single horn|single]] [[red horns|red horn]] with a [[star (symbol)|]] jutting out of her forehead. Like her old friend [[Ibuki Suika]] (both of whom were part of the "Four Devas of the Mountains"), Yuugi likes drinking out of her [[sakazuki]] and causing a ruckus. She now lives underground in the Ancient City and guides anyone entering the Palace of Earth Spirits, but only if she is defeated. Often paired with [[Mizuhashi Parsee]].
pom pom (cheerleading):
Large, fluffy ball of soft material usually waved about by [[cheerleader|cheerleaders]].

[[Pom pom (clothes)]] is for a smaller variant worn as an accessory-like thing on one's clothes.
the pose:
When a character [[lying|lies]] flat [[on stomach|on their stomach]] with their [[feet up]] in the air.

This is usually done to show off a character's [[breasts]], [[ass]], and [[feet]] all at the same time. The subject can be [[no shoes|wearing legwear]] or [[barefoot]], but their [[feet]] must be visible as this is a term coined by foot fetish enthusiasts to describe a particular pose that shows off the feet.
puddle: To describe a small pool of [[water]] on a surface, usually on a path or road. This accumulation can be caused by [[rain]]y weather. Tag can also be used to describe [i]other types[/i] of liquid that puddle, such as [[blood]] or [[peeing|urine]].
rosa (pokemon):
The female protagonist of [[pokemon_bw2|Pokemon Black 2 and White 2]]. Sometimes nicknamed "Donut-ko". Her male counterpart is [[Nate (pokemon)|]].

Known as [b]Mei[/b] in Japanese versions. Their Japanese names come from [i]kyoumei[/i] (共鳴), meaning "resonance". In English, this association is also kept, with "resonate" turning into "Rosa" and "Nate". 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[twintails]] with [[double bun|double]] [[donut hair bun]]s. She wears a [[visor cap]], a shirt with [[raglan sleeves]] and a [[pink bow]], [[yellow shorts|yellow]] [[short shorts]] [[pantyhose under shorts|worn over]] [[black pantyhose]], [[sneakers]], and she carries a [[handbag]].

Already a popular player character in her own right, Rosa enjoyed a resurgence in popularity after being revealed as an early-game free character in the story of [[Pokemon Masters EX]]. In this game, Rosa's partner is [[Snivy]], and became known for her upbeat attitude and [[stroking own chin|multitude]] of [[+_+|expressions]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Whitley[/b] (ファイツ [i]Whi-Two[/i] in Japanese).
v arms:
Arms and hands brought together in the front, with the shape resembling a V. It indicates primness and a relaxed demeanor.

If the character is sitting and has their hands in their lap in such a pose, use [[hands on lap]].

[[\o/]] and [[spread arms]] are not v arms.
slime girl:
A [[monster girl]] that is made of a viscous and typically transparent [[liquid]] (usually [[slime (substance)|]]). Often seen mimicking the shape of a human, if not, half puddled on the ground. 

Use also [[core]] for visible cores inside their body.
spoon: A piece of cutlery that has a rounded end to assist in eating liquid or non-solid foods such as [[cereal]], [[soup]], and porridge. It's also used for stirring one ingredient into another, or mixing together a flavoring/sweetener into one's beverage.
harem outfit:
A form of clothing usually worn by bellydancers. Thus, the ensemble usually emphasizes a bare [[midriff]] and includes a [[bra]], [[bustier]] or [[tube top]]. There may be [[baggy pants]], [[harem pants]], [[loincloth]] or a long [[skirt]] over the legs, as well as possibly a flowing [[headdress]] or [[veil]] and loose sleeves. Jewelry in the form of [[earrings]], [[bracelet]]s, [[necklace]]s or [[anklet]]s may be present. One or more of these articles may be [[see-through clothes|sheer]].

The [[Dunhuang style]] may be mistaken for/look a lot like harem style clothing.
shishiro botan:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[holoFive|5th]] [[NePoLaBo|generation]]. Designed by [[Tomari (veryberry00)|]]. 

She has [[animal ear piercing|pierced]] [[lion ears]], a [[lion tail]], [[grey eyes]], [[fangs]], [[large breasts]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|grey]] [[messy hair]] which she keeps as a [[two side up]] with [[long sidelocks]], an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]].
animal print: An article of clothing or an object that has a printed design of an animal, or is modeled after the fur or external appearance of an animal.
strap gap:
When there is a noticeable gap between a girl's chest and the straps of her upper garment. Often due to the size and/or shape of her breasts.

Usually happens with a [[bra]], but can also occur with a [[bikini]], [[tank top]], [[camisole]], etc.

If the gap is formed by lifting the strap, use [[strap lift]] instead.
holding another's wrist: Holding another character's lower arm or wrist.
confetti: A multitude of colored paper, usually thrown at celebrations. Not to be confused with [[petals]].
bandana: A bandana is a cloth (or strip of cloth) one wears around the head, face or neck for either protective or decorative purposes. It is also worn by high school students for self-motivation.
kitagawa marin:
One of the main characters in [[Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru]]. She is a high school student who is not only popular but also has a passion for [[cosplay]], especially her [[Kuroe Shizuku|favorite character]], [[Kuroe Shizuku (cosplay)|]].

She has [[red eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[blonde hair]] to [[red hair|red]] [[gradient hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. She wears both [[earrings]] and several [[ear piercing|piercing]]s, (including an [[industrial piercing]]), a [[black collar]] or  [[black choker|black]] [[lace choker]], [[bracelet]], [[necklace]], and a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[tied shirt|tied]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a [[blue necktie|blue]] or [[grey necktie]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

Other Attire: [[Halterneck]] [[black bikini|black]] [[string bikini|string]] [[side-tie bikini bottom|side-tie]] [[bikini]] with a [[floral print]]

Voiced by: [[Suguta Hina]] (JPN), [[Monarch_(amalee)|Amanda "AmaLee" Lee]] (ENG)
lace trim: Any article of clothing that has [[lace]] trimmed around its edges.
arthropod girl: A girl with insectoid qualities such as [[antennae]], [[insect wings|wings]], and any sort of appendages related to a particular insect or other arthropod.
soaking feet: [[Sitting]] or resting with one or both [[feet]] in the [[water]] (or another liquid). For standing or walking in water, use [[wading]] instead.
yakumo ran:
The "Nine-Tailed Strategist". Extra Stage boss and Phantasm stage midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]].

[[Yakumo Yukari]]'s 800+-year-old [[kyuubi]] [[kitsune]] shikigami who specializes in black magic. She is also powerful enough to have her own shikigami, a [[nekomata]] named [[Chen]], to whom she is portrayed to act motherly towards prominently in fanworks.

In volume two of [[Strange Creators of Outer World]], it has been revealed that Ran is actually a shikigami parasitically taking host of a nine-tailed fox youkai so strongly that the host's personality never shows on the surface; leading people to not have any difficulty seeing her as a kitsune. However, this seemed to be subtlely hinted at in Yukari's [[Bohemian Archive in Japanese Red]] article where Yukari constantly repeats to [[shameimaru aya|Aya]] that Ran is a shikigami and not an animal.

In [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]], Ran (or maybe just her host body) is revealed to have once been an inhabitant of the Animal Realm, and to have been friends with [[Toutetsu Yuuma]].

Ran has been described to have a gentle personality and to share her host's species-wide love of [[aburaage|fried tofu]]. She excels at mathematics and is able to solve nigh impossible equations instantly; simply seeing it as a hobby to kill time. She is rather robotic in nature when it comes to following Yukari's orders whereas Ran herself describes them as "Yukari's programming". Due to her master's prominent sleeping habits, Ran is usually doing her bidding at a constant. However, Yukari herself has stated that she would like to see Ran do something other than simply follow her orders.

Ran is simply seen as a tool that's loved in Yukari's eyes. If she is to ever stray away from her duties as a shikigami or to forget that she is one, she is to be violently disciplined, such as being beaten on the head by her parasol.

She is notorious in many fanworks as a streaker, earning her the nickname "Suppa Tenko":/pools/1733 ("Naked Heavenly Fox"), and for bursting into an [[excessive nosebleed]] if Chen does anything exceptionally cute.
firing:
The act of firing ranged [[weapon]]s like [[gun|firearms]], [[rocket launcher]]s, [[mortar (weapon)|]]s, or such.
Often accompanied with [[muzzle flash]], [[casing ejection]] and [[volume warning|loud noise]].
under covers:
A character under a bed sheet or [[blanket]], typically in [[bed]].

If the character happens to be [[nude]] while [[under covers]], add the [[naked sheet]] tag as well.
single sidelock: For when there's only one lock of hair growing in front of the ears; also use [[asymmetrical hair]] or [[asymmetrical_sidelocks]] when appropriate.
chocolate:
[b]Chocolate[/b] comprises a number of raw and processed foods that are produced from the seed of the tropical cacao tree.

Chocolate has become one of the most popular flavors in the world. It is a common ingredient in many [[snack]]s and [[dessert]]s, including but not limited to [[cookie]]s, [[cake]]s, [[ice cream]], [[pudding]], [[pie]]s and [[candy]]. [[Gift]]s of chocolate molded into different shapes have become traditional on certain holidays: chocolate bunnies and eggs are popular on [[Easter]], chocolate coins on Hanukkah, Santa Claus and other holiday symbols on [[Christmas]], and hearts on [[valentine|Valentine's Day]]. Chocolate is also used in cold and hot beverages, including chocolate milk and hot chocolate.
brown pantyhose:
[[Pantyhose]] that is brown.

There is considerable overlap between [[black pantyhose|black]], [[brown pantyhose|brown]], and [[grey pantyhose]].
torn leotard: A [[leotard]] that has been [[torn clothes|torn]] so that it's barely wearable.
thought bubble:
A bubble followed by a series of smaller bubbles that show what a character is thinking or dreaming about.

Often used in conjunction with [[imagining]].

For the bubble that's used for dialog use [[speech bubble]].
isometric:
A method of representing a 3D object on a 2D plane used in technical and engineering drawings. Unlike in [[perspective]] drawings or real life, parallel lines do not converge to a [[vanishing point]] and objects appear to be the same size regardless of distance.

Note that this tag refers to what is technically called "axonometric projection":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axonometric_projection, of which isometric projection is a special case. Consequently, many images tagged as isometric on Danbooru may actually be dimetric or trimetric.
black cat:
A [[cat]] with black fur.

Black cats, in Japanese lore, are associated with good luck and are able ward off evil or cure illnesses in children. In Western lore, they are associated with bad luck and [[witch|witchcraft]].

For the manga by [[Yabuki Kentarou]], see [[Black Cat (series)]].
playing card:
A classical set of [[card]] consists 52 unique cards, categorized by suit and by rank. The four suits of the french deck are [[heart|hearts]] (♥), [[spade_(shape)|spades]] (♠), [[club_(shape)|clubs]] (♣), and [[diamond (shape)|diamonds]] (♦). The ranks include Ace, the numbers two through ten, and the face cards Jack, Queen, and King. A [[joker (playing card)|]] or two may or not be present. These cards are used for various games, such as solitaire, poker, blackjack, etc. Often with [[gambling]] involved.

If characters are [[playing games]] with these cards, remember to tag the card faces accordingly. However, if the cards are too difficult to discern (for example they're very far away, stacked atop each other, depicted as loose scribbles, or are a nonstandard playing card), you don't need to tag the faces of those cards.

Additionally, if the actual playing card were played rather than being a simple prop or motif (i.e simply being held by the character), the tag [[card game]] is also applicable.
alice margatroid:
The "Seven-Colored Puppeteer".

[[Touhou]] character. Stage 3 and Extra Stage boss of [[Mystic Square]] and later a recurring playable character. One of the few [[touhou (pc-98)|PC-98 era]] characters (along with [[Hakurei Reimu|Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]]) to reappear in the Windows-era games. She first appeared in her current design as the Stage 3 boss of [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]]. She is often accompanied by her dolls, [[Shanghai Doll]], [[Hourai Doll]], or [[Goliath Doll]].

A human-turned-youkai [[witch]] who specializes in manipulating [[doll]]s and using them to attack her enemies. Unlike [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]], her neighbor in the [[Forest of Magic]], Alice is not only rather aloof, but also somewhat cowardly at heart, refusing to use her full power for any reason because she would not know how to deal with losing. This nature leads to [[doujinshi]] portraying her as having some tendencies of being [[tsundere]] towards her [[human village (touhou)|human neighbor]]. Speculated to be the daughter of [[Shinki (touhou)|]]. Bearer of the [[Grimoire of Alice]].
pillar:
Any upright shaft or structure used as building support or as a stand-alone monument.

For pillars that are decorative, see [[column]].
rainbow hair: Hair colored to resemble the [[rainbow]] spectrum, often as a [[gradient_hair|gradient]].
blue tongue: A tongue that is colored [[blue]]. If a character has their mouth open and the rest of the mouth is also blue, that can count under this tag.
bare pectorals:
When one or both [[pectorals]] are exposed while the character is wearing upper-body clothing, or is in the middle of [[undressing]].
This includes wearing [[revealing clothes]], [[torn clothes]] or [[open clothes]] etc.

[b] Do not use[/b] this tag in situations where a male character is [[nude]] or [[topless male|topless]].
If the [[pectorals]] are partially covered (e.g with [[tank top]]s), use [[pectoral cleavage]], [[underpec]] and/or [[sidepec]] instead.
imminent vaginal:
When [[vaginal]] penetration is about to occur, but hasn't happened yet. This includes [[sex]], [[sex toy]]s, [[tentacles]], [[fingering]], or any other type of penetration.

Don't use this tag if you don't see penetration about to occur. This differs from [[grinding]] in that grinding is about rubbing the penis against the vagina, while imminent vaginal is about the penis being about to penetrate the vagina.

If the penetration is non-consensual, tag [[imminent rape]].

Also, try not to confuse this with [[after vaginal]], which may look similar to this in small thumbnails.
print thighhighs: [[Thighhighs]] printed with a unique pattern of shapes or images. Common patterns include [[heart print|hearts]], [[star print|stars]], and [[animal print]]s.
magic: When a character is using magic, or magical energy is present.
santa costume:
A [[Santa Claus]]-themed outfit. This involves prominent use of red fabric with white trim on the edges. As such, many types of clothing can be used in this style - swimsuits, undergarments, outerwear etc. A wide, black belt may be present.

Due to the many variations on this costume in different cultures through history, it should be noted that although red is the most popular color used in "Santa costumes" on Danbooru, it is [i]not the only[/i] color associated with "Santa." See below for alternate tagged colors.

Use the [[Santa hat]] tag when the majority of a character's clothing is not Santa-themed except for the hat.

Images with the actual Santa Claus character should be tagged with [[Santa Claus]].
cross-laced footwear:
Deprecated tag. Use one of the tags below instead.

* [[Ankle lace-up]]
* [[Cross-laced shoes]]
* [[Cross-laced slit]]
* [[Lace-up boots]]
* [[Sneakers]]
wand:
A thin, straight, hand-held stick made of wood, stone, ivory, or metal, with ceremonial or magical significance.

In fiction, it is generally used as a magical tool to cast or channel magic just like a [[mage staff|magical staff]]. Differences between a stave and a wand include a staff being larger (several feet long, about the length of a walking stick and held one- or two-handed) than a wand (usually shorter than two feet, held in one hand or a few fingers) and that a wand is often used in l
belt pouch: A [[pouch]] that is either attached to a [[belt]] or is designed to be worn around the waist itself.
hair slicked back:
Hair that has been combed back away from the face and fixed in place with a styling product such as mousse or pomade.

For hair that has simply been pulled back and tied into a bun or ponytail, see [[hair pulled back]]. If only the bangs are pulled back, use [[bangs pinned back]].
jedi:
[quote][i]There is no emotion, there is peace.
There is no ignorance, there is knowledge.
There is no passion, there is serenity.
There is no chaos, there is harmony.
There is no death, there is the Force.[/i] - The Jedi Code.[/quote]

A fictional group from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

The honorable members of the [b]Jedi Order[/b] have been the keepers of peace and justice in the [[galaxy]] for millenia. 

Despite the pacifist nature of the order the Jedi knights are powerful and brave warriors, but they only use combat as a last resort to solve conflicts. The Jedi value the life and freedom of any living beings above anything else.

Their weapon of choice is the [[lightsaber]], an elegant weapon from a more civilized age. Jedi lightsaber colors vary and can be either white, yellow, blue, green, purple, pink, orange, etc.
headlock:
A wrestling hold in which the opponent's head is locked between the crook of the elbow and the side of the body.

See [[scissorhold]] for when a person's head is locked between another person's thighs.
qingdai guanmao:
A round [[hat]] worn by Chinese officials during the [[Qing dynasty]].

These hats are commonly seen on [[jiangshi]] with an [[ofuda]] attached to the front, referencing how Qing-era officials were viewed as bloodthirsty creatures with little regard for humanity.

* !post #3009119
* !post #7072814
* !post #7401732
battle:
A large-scale or serious conflict between multiple characters or opposing forces.

For trivial conflicts or arguments, use [[fighting]].
shirakami fubuki:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[1st generation (hololive)|]]. Also a member of [[hololive Gamers]]. Designed by [[Nagishiro Mito]]. On November 5th, 2020, Fubuki became the third member of hololive (after [[Gawr Gura]] and [[Inugami Korone]]) to reach 1 million subscribers on YouTube.

She is a white and black [[fox girl]] with [[fox ears]] with [[animal ear piercing|ear piercing]] on her left ear and a white and black-tipped [[fox tail]] with a [[pentagram]] inscription near the tip. She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair|grey]] hair with an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]. Her regular hairstyle consists of a [[low ponytail]] held with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]].
raven (dc):
A character from [[DC Comics]].

Real name [b]Rachel Roth[/b]. She is the daughter of Arella and Trigon, a powerful [[demon]]. Raven is one of, if not the, most prominent and popular characters of the superhero team [[Teen Titans]].

She was created by George Pérez and Marv Wolfman, and made her debut at [i]DC Comics Presents[/i] #26 (1980).
bra pull:
A [[bra]] lowered beneath the [[breasts]] to expose the [[nipples]].

Not to be confused with a [[shelf bra]], a minimal bra that does this by design, nor a [[cupless bra]].
pumpkin: A vegetable in the [[squash]] family, popularly associated with [[Halloween]], where people carve faces on pumpkins to create [[Jack-o'-lantern]]s.
human village (touhou): A recurring location in [[Touhou]], roughly in the center of [[Gensokyo]], where most of the setting's humans live. Commonly featured in the manga and as a stage in some of the fighting games. Despite the name, the "village" is actually a small city with a sizable population.
nishizumi shiho:

Her default outfit consists of a [[black suit]] with pair of black [[jodhpurs]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She is often depicted in fanart wearing a [[ooarai school uniform]], usually depicted being [[undersized clothes|undersized]].

male on futa: A male being the dominant sexual partner over a [[futanari]]. This typically means that the male is the one penetrating.
bamboo forest: A [[forest]] made of [[bamboo]]. Commonly shown in the [[Touhou]] series as the Bamboo Forest of the Lost, which contains the palace estate [[Eientei]] and the homes of [[Fujiwara no Mokou]], [[Imaizumi Kagerou]], [[Wriggle Nightbug]], and [[Mystia Lorelei]].
crystal hair: Hair that is made of crystal-like gems or has crystalline texture.
vambraces: Long armored cuffs worn on the forearm, often with [[gauntlets]]. For tagging purposes, use this if the cuff is present but the character is not wearing gauntlets.
pencil:
A [[writing]] or [[drawing (action)|]] device consisting of a thin stick of pigment (usually graphite), usually encased in a thin wood cylinder.

This tag is for the presence of pencils in a picture. When tagging images drawn using pencils as the art medium, use [[graphite (medium)]] instead.
wince: An expression of involuntarily flinching, as from pain, distress, surprise or extreme embarrassment.
naked towel:
Situation in which a person has a [[towel]] wrapped around their body, usually when coming in or out of the shower or dipping into a [[onsen|hot spring]]; can be combined with [[bottomless]]/[[topless female]]/[[topless male]] if the towel is not covering enough.

When the towel is only being used to cover the front, use [[nude cover]] instead. If it is only worn around the neck, use [[nude]] with [[towel around neck]].
calendar (object): When a post contains a calendar, but the actual post is not [[calendar (medium)|a page of a calendar]].
adjusting hair:
Characters casually fixing, adjusting, or otherwise manipulating their hair with their hands.

Whenever possible, try to use a more specific tag instead.
robot joints: A character with robotic arm or leg joints. Distinct from [[doll joints]] in that doll joints usually have empty space in the seams, while robot joints have a distinctly metallic nature.
coffee mug: A type of [[mug]] that holds about 2 cups of hot coffee. It's made of ceramic or glass and designed to be thick enough to be able to hold the hot beverage in the hands.
cat boy: A boy with real [[cat]]-like features, such as [[cat ears]] and/or a [[cat tail]].
yaoyorozu momo:
A character from Class 1-A in [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i]. She is the class vice president alongside [[Iida Tenya]]. 

She is one of two students chosen to attend U.A. via recommendations. Intelligent and polite, Momo is seen as a natural leader, although she is prone to losing confidence, especially when comparing herself to [[Todoroki Shoto]].

Her quirk gives her the ability to make anything she has knowledge of using her body.

She has [[black hair]] [[hair_pulled_back|pulled back
gigantic penis: An implausibly large [[penis]], even more disproportionate to its owner than a [[huge penis]]. A penis comparable in length or girth to its owner's torso deserves this tag.
spoken question mark: When a [[?|question mark]] is spoken by itself (and not used simply to indicate the character asking a question). Usually shows confusion.
explosion: A large cloud of [[fire]], gas, dirt, and shrapnel that is caused by some sort of [[explosive]] such as a [[grenade]], [[nuclear weapon]], or a chemical reaction that went horribly wrong.
tiger print: Clothing with a [[tiger]]-like texture (i.e. black marks of varying length on orange or yellow). [[Oni]] often wear tigerskin loincloths as a reference to how they were rumored to come from Northern (ushi[b][i]tora[/i][/b]) Japan.
shop: A small store or department in a large store selling a specific or select type of goods.
dancer: When a character is wearing the attire of a dancer. A dancer is one who dances in front of a large crowd, often wearing clothing that will show off their body, and a variety of accessories, including [[jewelry]], [[circlet]]s, and veils.
gawr gura:
A former [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], part of Generation 1, of [[hololive English]] (also known as [[holoMyth]]). A shark-loving Atlantean who came to the surface because she finds it boring down in the ocean. She was designed by [[Amashiro Natsuki]].

She was one of the most subscribed VTubers, having surpassed VTuber pioneer [[Kizuna Ai]] back in 2021. 

On April 16, 2025, "she announced":[https://www.youtube.com/live/7WFg2wq10rw?feature=shared] that she would be graduating from hololive, with her "final stream":[https://youtu.be/EAdh6m3E3UI] on May 1st.

She is a [[shark girl]] with [[sharp teeth]] and a [[shark tail]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] or [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], her default hairstyle consists of a [[two side up]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[shark hair ornament]]s.
arrancar:
The Arrancar are a type of supernatural entity from [[Bleach]]. They are originated from [[Hollow (bleach)|]]s who have further evolved and achieved a more compact, humanoid form (in contrast with a large and monstrous form of their previous body). And partially regained their consciousness as a result.

They are distinguished by an accessory made of [[bone]] unique to each and a [[hole on body|hole]] located somewhere on their bodies, which signify their "hollowed-out" soul. The Espada, the ten strongest Arrancar, also bear a [[number tattoo|numerical tattoo]] based on rank.
fang out: When a character shows a [[fang]] outside a [[closed mouth]].
hug from behind:
Indicates one character is [[front-to-back]] with another character and [[hug]]s them from behind.

Do not confuse with [[Grabbing from behind]].
death:
Refers to the cessation of a living organism's vital function. Use this tag that features dead or dying people, creatures, or animals, or that implies a death has taken place.

If the corpse or cause of death isn't explicitly shown but you can infer a death has taken place, use [[implied death]].

For the Grim Reaper or other personifications of death, see [[Death (entity)]]. For the tarot card "Death", see [[Death (tarot)]].
bobby socks: A type of [[socks|sock]] that was especially fashionable in the 1940s and 1950s. Commonly [[ankle socks|ankle length]], the cuff of the sock would be lengthened and then flipped downward. Either flaring out over the ankle bone or fit snugly onto it.
straight hair: Hair that is straight, without any [[curly hair|curls]], curves, or [[wavy hair|waves]].
kitsune:
A mystical shapeshifter in Japanese folklore whose normal form is that of a [[fox]]. Every 100 years, a kitsune will gain a new [[tail]], up to nine at 800 years. These tails symbolize the amount of knowledge and magical power the kitsune has gained over its long life.

A kitsune with all nine tails would usually be classified as a [[kyuubi]].
stage: A platform or area for one to publicly perform or speak.
pocket:
A small bag or pouch sewn into a piece of clothing, meant to hold small items.

[[Pants]], [[shorts]], [[jacket]]s, [[coat]]s, and button-down [[shirt]]s are a few common types of clothing that usually contain pockets. Pockets are more common in men's fashion than in women's.
astolfo (fate):
Rider of "Black" servant of [[Celenike Icecolle Yggdmillennia]] in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. A [[pink hair]]ed male with [[purple eyes]] and a [[single braid]], he is depicted as an [[otoko no ko]], appearance-wise. Wears a pink [[serafuku]] in the Agartha chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. [[Astolfo (Saber) (Fate)|A Saber version of him]] was the limited Servant in the 2019 [[Christmas]] event [[Nightingale no Christmas Carol]].

[b]True Name:[/b] Astolfo, the Twelfth Paladin of Charlemagne
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ookubo Rumi]]
lower body:
An image focused on the lower half of the subject's body, approximately from the waist down. The opposite of [[upper body]].

Most of the character's lower body should be visible. Do not use if only the character's [[ass]] is visible. Use [[close-up]] or [[ass focus]] instead.

Do not use this tag for [[faceless]], [[POV]], or mostly [[out of frame]] background characters. Like [[upper body]], this tag refers to how the main subject is framed.
amazon position:
A [[girl on top|female-dominant]] [[sex]] position in which the woman rides her partner while their legs are [[folded]] back against their chest, or spread wide with their feet in the air. In either case, her partner's thighs are in front of her rather than behind. Also known as a reverse [[piledriver (sex)|]]. The name stipulated that it originated from the mythical [[Amazon warrior]] tribe, in which the position is used simply for reproduction purposes.

A skilled woman in this position can emulate the pelvic thrusting motion typical of a male partner, giving a near-complete feeling of role reversal. It is a typical position in [[femdom]] or [[BDSM]] fetish if the partner is bound or in amazon position [[rape|against their will]].
scat:

A long, usually black, brown or tan, rain[[coat]]. Usually [[double-breasted]] and tied around the waist with a [[belt]] or [[sash]]. Frequently worn by [[detective]]s, assassins, perverts, and [[exhibitionism|exhibitionists]].

mouse girl: Girls with intrinsic [[mouse (animal)|]] features, such as [[mouse ears]] and [[mouse tail]].
headphones around neck: Wearing a set of [[headphones]] around the neck like a collar, rather than on the head as they're supposed to be worn.
halter dress: A [[dress]] held in place with a [[halterneck]].
fujiwara no mokou:
The "Crimson Watchguard". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i].

An immortal human with powers of [[fire|pyromancy]]. Mokou bears a deep grudge against [[Houraisan Kaguya|Kaguya]] for spurning her father's hand in marriage when the former was still young (humiliating him in the process), which caused her to steal and drink the Hourai Elixir as revenge. Upon reaching Gensokyo, she learned that Kaguya, too, was an immortal exile, and both have since engaged in countless fatal duels for fun.

When not picking a fight with Kaguya, she rescues lost people or guides them through the Bamboo Forest to Eientei, home of her own nemesis, or the Human Village, where her friend [[Kamishirasawa Keine]] lives, and claims to run a yakitori stand (which would put her at odds with [[Mystia Lorelei]]).

Became playable in [[Urban Legend in Limbo]] and [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]].
musical note: Used when a character is [[singing]] or carefree. Can also be used to cover musical notes in the background or on objects.  Covers all musical notation symbols beyond just notes.
one-eyed: A character depicted has only one eye. This includes both characters who have [[missing eye|lost an eye]] and those who naturally have only one (such as a [[cyclops]]).
beachball: A big inflatable ball and very light weight. Colorful, can have images print on them (e.g. A watermelon print)
lion tail: Use this tag when a character has a [[tail]] reminiscent of a [[lion]]'s tail.
samus aran:
The main protagonist of the [[Metroid]] series. A Bounty Hunter that has averted countless crises that have threatened the galaxy, such as those involving the [[Metroid (creature)|]]s, [[Phazon]] and the [[X Parasite]]s.

Adopted by the [[Chozo]] after being orphaned by a [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]] raid, she was infused with their [[alien]] DNA and raised as a warrior. She later served under Commanding Officer [[Adam Malkovich]] within the Galactic Federation Army, but after a traumatic incident she left to become an independent Bounty Hunter.

She is armed with a Chozo [[power suit|cybernetic exoskeleton]] equipped with an [[Arm Cannon]] and a [[assault_visor|visor]] known as the [[power suit (metroid)|Power Suit]] that protects her and greatly enhances her abilities. This suit also has the means to assimilate other technology within itself to [[power-up|upgrade]] it's capabilities and gain greater power. She wears the [[Zero Suit]] under it in case of a malfunction which offers far less protection and only has her armed with the [[Paralyzer]].

According to the [[metroid_2:_return_of_samus|Metroid II]] manual and concept art for [[Super Metroid]] within her power suit she is 6'3" (1.90 m) [tn]"[1]":[http://metroid.retropixel.net/gallery.php?gallery_id=m2_manual&image_id=8][/tn][tn]"[2]":[https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/metroid/images/c/c1/M3_Kraid_design.png/][/tn].
lace-trimmed panties:
[[Panties]] that have [[lace trim]] around around the waist, leg holes, or both. 

Do not confuse them with [[lace panties]], which are made entirely out of lace rather than having it just around the edges.
implied futanari:
When a character in the image seems to be a [[futanari]], but it's not 100% certain.
Signs of futanari include intercourse with a [[stomach bulge]] and [[cum]], [[condom wrapper]]s or penetrative sex positions with thrusting and sex noises.

Whether the character is canonically a futanari or not, whether related pictures have a penis showing or not, and whether the artist clarifies that it is futanari or not aren't relevant. So long as it cannot be confirmed visually, this tag can be used.

This tag can overlap with [[futanari]] for the sake of usability and blacklisting, due to tags like [[futa with female]]/[[futa with male]].

For a comprehensive guide on how to use this tag, see forum #272717.
apple:
[[Fruit]] with red or [[yellow apple|yellow]] or [[green apple|green]] skin and sweet to tart crisp whitish flesh.

A red fruit commonly associated with sin, or, in anime terms, [[Holo]] of [[Spice and Wolf]]. 

For the tech company, see [[Apple Inc.]]
ankle cuffs:
[[Cuffs]] that are worn around the wearer's ankles.

Not to be confused with [[ankle garter]]s.

paw print: A marking that indicates the presence or signature of an animal.
frilled hair tubes: [[Hair tubes]] adorned with frills, most commonly worn by [[Hakurei Reimu]].
2b (nier:automata):
The main protagonist of [[nier:automata|NieR:Automata]].

[i]YoRHa No.2 Type B[/i] or 2B is a female-model YoRHa android created to battle the machine lifeforms that have invaded the planet on behalf of the surviving humans. 2B is calm and composed, she does not encourage idle chatter on frivolous subjects and is generally reticent towards others. She also has high respect for the chain of command and rarely questions her orders. However, 2B occasionally expresses a notably sardonic wit in the face of certain situations and can even be hot-headed at times.

Her canonical attire includes a [[two-sided_dress|two-sided]] [[black dress]] with [[cleavage_cutout|cleavage]] and [[back cutout]]s and [[long_sleeves|long]], [[juliet_sleeves|juliet]] [[feather-trimmed sleeves]] under which is worn [[white leotard]] which shows off her [[huge_ass|ass]]. On her legs she wears [[thighhighs]] [[thighhighs_under_boots|under]] a pair of [[high_heel_boots|high heel]] [[thigh boots]]. On her head typically rests a [[black_hairband|black]] [[hairband]] on short [[white hair]]. Over her eyes is a [[black_blindfold|black]] [[blindfold]]. Occasionally throughout the events of the game her blindfold is removed and is thus sometimes [[no_blindfold|not included]] by artists. Her eye color is [[blue_eyes|blue]], and has a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]].

She has an [[alternate color]]ed appearance in [[Soulcalibur VI]] and [[Final Fantasy XIV]] known as [[2P (nier:automata)|]]. In this appearance she has [[dark skin]], [[black hair]], and white clothes. 2B has made appearances in several other games, including [[Star Ocean Anamnesis]], [[SINoALICE]], [[Phantasy Star Online 2]], among others.
sitting on desk: This tag has been moved to [[on_desk]].
braided bangs: Braiding [[bangs|front hair]] or [[braid]] positioned at the forehead.
outline: A person or item in the image is surrounded by an outline (usually white or black and distinct from any [[lineart]] in the image) which visibly separates it from the background.
bikini bottom only:
Wearing a bikini bottom without a bikini top. For example, wearing a bikini bottom with a [[shirt]] or [[jacket]], or while completely [[topless female|topless]].

Don't use when you can't see the character's upper body, or you can't tell whether they're wearing a bikini top or not. This tag is for when you can tell they're not wearing a bikini top.

Don't use when the character is wearing a [[tankini]], [[bandeau]], or other bikini-like top.
scope:
An optical magnification device mounted on a [[gun]] (typically a [[rifle]] of some type) used to improve a shooter's accuracy or allow him to see farther. 

Electronic scopes, which are bulkier in design, give the option to see in different filters, such as night or thermal-vision.
animal nose:
Known as the [i]rhinarium[/i]. It is referred to as the tip of the [[snout]], and breeders of cats and 
dogs sometimes use the term [i]nose leather[/i].

Informally, it may be called a "truffle", "wet snout" or "wet nose," because its surface is moist in some species: for example, healthy dogs and cats.

Animal noses are often drawn colored black as slightly big dots on [[furry|anthropomorphic]] characters.
asian:
Depictions of people from East-Asian ethnicities and countries.

Most anime characters already [i]tend[/i] towards this appearance (although many look like no ethnicity at all, a visual design concept called [i]"mukokuseki":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mukokuseki][/i] (無国籍) (Japanese for "stateless" or "without nationality")), but this tag is for depictions with increased attention to realism, facial features and detail.
partially unbuttoned:
A [[shirt]] that is partially [[unbuttoned]], rather than fully [[unbuttoned]]. Usually to display [[cleavage]], use [[pectoral cleavage]] for male characters.

If the unbuttoned buttons are between buttoned buttons, use [[button gap]] too.
hospital bed: A [[bed]] of the type typically found in a [[hospital]]. These usually have steel tube frames, are on wheels, can be adjusted to allow a patient to incline to a sitting position, and have side rails that can be lifted to prevent a patient from falling off during transport.
card:
A piece of small, flat material with something printed on it. This includes [[business card]]s, [[playing card]]s, [[trading card]]s, [[tarot card|tarot cards]], and any other type of card.

This tag is for cards physically present inside the image. For an entire image drawn to look like a card or an image of the card face itself, see [[card (medium)]].
bow bra: A [[bra]] that ties together in front with a bow, or perhaps features one as a prominent decoration rather than as a functional connector.
mori calliope:
A [[virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] part of [[hololive English]]'s 1st generation, [[holoMyth]]. The [[Grim Reaper]]'s apprentice. Designed by [[yukisame]].

She is portrayed with [[pink eyes|pink]] or [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[pale skin]]. Her default hairstyle consists of [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[sidelocks]].
cat hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a [[cat]]'s face or a miniature feline.
single elbow glove: A character wearing an [[elbow_gloves|elbow glove]] on only one hand.
white outline: A white outline that visibly highlights any characters, objects, or text to make it stand out from the background.
skull hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a [[skull]].
broken glass:
[[Glass]] that has been shattered into many pieces. Usually refers to glass that is still in "one piece" but has [[cracked glass|cracks]] inside of it.

The broken pieces of glass that have been broken off are called [[glass shards]].
paintbrush:
An umbrella tag for the following types of [[brush|brushes]]:

* [[art brush]]
* [[calligraphy brush]]
* [[trim brush]]

When tagging a paintbrush, always use one of the above specific tags.
nagatoro hayase:
Previously-original character created by [[774 (nanashi)]], now serialized into the manga [[Ijiranaide Nagatoro-san]].

She's described as being S-dere (Sデレ), or Sadodere, a term for a character who gains pleasure by toying with and teasing their love interest. Frequently torments her senpai/boyfriend, [[Hachiouji Naoto]]. The game 774 made of her lists her under the name "Nagatoro Hayashi". She has a sister named [[Nagatoro Misaki|Misaki]] and a brother named [[Nagatoro Taiga|Taiga]].
onbashira:
[[Yasaka Kanako]]'s logs. The Onbashira are sacred logs that are used, after being cut using special ceremonial tools, in renewal of the Suwa Grand Shrine that occurs every six years, the ceremony which has gone uninterrupted for 1200 years. There are used in two festivals, Yamadashi and Satobiki. Yamadashi uses large trees that are covered in red and white regalia and covered in ropes. Part of this includes the ceremony on "Ki-Otoshi" which involves young men riding onbashira down steep slopes to prove their manhood.

Satobiki involves the ceremonial placement of onbashira in the foundations of the Suwa Grand Shrine, with a ceremonial group of log bearers that ride the log as its being raised and sing from the top of the log to signify that it has been raised.
tomboy:
A girl who displays boyish behaviors. Girls who are tomboys tend to be very athletic and sporty.

They almost always dress like boys and frequently have short and/or spiky hair and can often be seen wearing tight cycling shorts. Examples include [[Kagura (azumanga daioh)|]], [[Arisawa Tatsuki]] and [[Makoto (street fighter)|]]. 

Not to be confused with [[reverse trap]], which refers to a girl with an androgynous or masculine [i]physical appearance[/i] regardless of personality. An androgynous girl may not necessarily act like a tomboy and a tomboy isn't required to look androgynous. Though there is a recognizable overlap between the two. [[Crossdressing]] does not automatically make a girl a "tomboy" either.

[b]Note[/b]: Just having [[short hair]] is not enough to count as a tomboy. The girl in question has to act in a masculine manner.
leaning back: When a character who is either standing or sitting, leans backwards at the waist. Opposite of [[leaning forward]].
idol:
In the Japanese context, idols are generally young entertainers with a combination of [[singing]] and [[dancing]], who usually wear [[idol clothes|very showy or frilly outfits]]. 

Several game, manga and anime series include idols or are even centered around idols, including [[Idolmaster]], [[Love Live!]], [[Aikatsu!]], [[Pretty series|the Pretty series]], [[Uta no Prince-sama]], [[Macross]], and [[Mahou no Tenshi Creamy Mami]], the latter two being generally considered the start of idols in anime.

Fans dedicated to a single idol are participating in [[oshi-katsu]].

Not to be confused with a certain [[planet popstar|star-shaped planet]].
lifting person: A person being lifted off the ground. This can be by another person, an animal or even an inanimate object, such as a hook.
pleated dress: A [[dress]] with vertical folds of fabric.
android 18:
Character from the [[Dragon Ball]] series. The twin sister of [[Android 17]], wife of [[Kuririn]] and mother of [[Marron (dragon ball)|]].

[spoiler]Originally named [b]Lazuli[/b] (ラズリ Razuri) when she was an ordinary human, before being modified into a bio-cyborg by [[Dr. Gero (dragon ball)|]].[/spoiler]
traditional media:
An artwork drawn with traditional tools without a computer. This is in contrast with "digital media" which dominate Danbooru.

Please use this tag only if you're 100% sure that the image is actually drawn by hand. Use [[faux traditional media]]  for digital images that mimic a hand-drawn/non-CG style.

An image that is partly traditional, but also contains digital elements (e.g. digital [[spot color]]), should receive the additional tag [[mixed media]]. Digital filtering, performed to improve the visibility of the traditional artwork (e.g. color adjustment), rather than as a creative effect or to remove flaws, does not make an image [[mixed media]].

A good way to tell if a drawing is traditional is to look for "analog" or アナログ in kana. You'll find this tag on Pixiv and used on some Japanese artists' sites. (Beware however that some people will tag their image "アナログ" that don't qualify to our standards of the tag).

If the image of the work is a photograph of the work, rather than a scanned work, then the tag [[photo (medium)]] is applicable.

For non-drawn physical art, see [[unconventional media]].
hand on own ass:
When someone has their hand on their own [[ass]].

Use [[hands on own ass]] when it's both hands, or [[ass support]] when they're lifting their own butt cheeks.
han juri:
[b]Han Juri[/b] ([i]katakana[/i]: [b]ハン・ジュリ[/b], [i]hangul[/i]: [b]한주리[/b]) is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. She makes her debut in [[street_fighter_iv_(series)|Super Street Fighter IV]]. She is the first [[Korea|Korean]] character in the Street Fighter series, and the only one that uses [[Taekwondo]] so far. She is voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]] in Japanese and Jessica Strauss in English.

She is described as being an "evil, mean and nasty" member of S.I.N. who is a main character in the SFIV storyline. The character was created by request of many Korean fans who wished for [[Capcom]] to add a Korean character in Street Fighter, something already established by [[SNK]] and [[Namco]]. 

She is depicted as being overtly [[sadism|sadistic]] and often makes denigrating and [[sexually suggestive]] remarks toward her opponents. [spoiler]According to [[Menat]], this cruel demeanor is simply a facade to hide her emotional pain and suffering as a result of her traumatic experience after her parents were killed by [[m. bison|M. Bison]], who blinded her left eye, along with her mistreatment after she was captured as a test subject by Shadaloo and S.I.N.[/spoiler]

Juri's left eye was replaced with a "Feng Shui engine," a device capable of enhancing one's power with ki energy, in which she typically covered it with her [[eyepatch]] or [[diagonal bangs]]. Normally, she has [[purple eyes]], but she may appear as a [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] when she uses the Feng Shui engine in her left eye, causing it to become [[blue eyes|blue]].

Ironically, Juri is initially met with negative reception from some Korean fanbases, primarily due to her "non-authentic" appearance, albeit these negative connotations would be dissipated afterwards. new year:
An image relating to the first day of the new year on the Gregorian calendar.

It's a tradition for many Japanese artists to celebrate the new year by drawing girls clad in expensive [[kimono]], eating [[zouni soup]], carrying [[hamaya]] (a [[Shinto]] ward against evil and bad luck) and playing [[hanetsuki]]. 

Many artists also pay tribute to the [[Chinese zodiac]] by incorporating whatever animal corresponds to the year. It should be noted that the Chinese new year is not on January 1 of the Gregorian calendar, but instead varies from one year to the next (falling in either late January or early February). The year of the horse, for example, begins January 31, 2014. Despite this, images utilizing the animal of an upcoming Chinese New Year tend to begin appearing around January 1, as Japan uses the same zodiac but does not use the Chinese Lunar calendar. 

The typical way of telling if an image is celebrating the New Year is by the phrase 謹賀新年 ([i]kinga shinnen[/i], literally "happy new year") or by one or both of the more traditional greeting exchanges (shortened as [[akeome]] and [[kotoyoro]]). It is also common for New Year images to include [[Happy New Year]] in English text, and/or the number of the year. Text indicating a new year related image may also be absent from the image itself but present in Pixiv tags/artist commentary, website text, etc.

dragon:
A mythical creature, typically presented as a large, flying reptilian creature.

[[Western dragon]]s are typically lizard-like creatures with wings and the ability to breathe fire. [[Eastern dragon]]s are typically more snake-like, with the ability to fly through the air without wings.

This tag is for the mythical creature. For people that have dragon-like features, see [[dragon girl]] or [[dragon boy]].
arrow (projectile): The projectile launched by a [[bow (weapon)|bow]] or [[crossbow]]. It has sharp, weighty point and fletchings on the rear to stabilize its flight.

cross-shaped pupils:
When a character's pupils are shaped like a + or †.

Do not confuse with [[+ +]] or [[x x]], which are specifically for eyes that shine in excitement or "dead eyes" respectively. Cross-shaped pupils are for characters with default/natural + or † pupils.
tablet pc:
A tablet computer, commonly just called a tablet, is a portable [[computer]] housed within the casing of a handheld touchscreen display.  They appear like a larger version of the modern [[smartphone]].

Unlike [[laptop|laptops]], tablet computers lack a built-in [[computer keyboard|keyboard]].  Should not be confused with a 2-in-1 laptop, which is a laptop that features a touchscreen with the ability to flip or rotate so the display can conceal the laptop keyboard.

A popular example of a tablet computer is the [[iPad]].

Should not be confused with a [[drawing tablet]], which is a computer input device that enables a user to hand-draw images on a computer.
hooves: The tip of a toe of an ungulate mammal, strengthened by a thick keratin covering.

sanpaku:
Eyes that noticeably show the whites around most of the iris during a state of rest. Can also indicate anger, exhaustion, or a dangerous demeanor. Sometimes referred to as "Dead fish eyes" among Western speakers.

The Japanese expression literally translates to "three white" as in the whites of the eyes being visible to three of four sides of the iris when the person with sanpaku eyes is looking straight ahead or when their eyes are at rest. 
The most extreme form is called [i]shihakugan[/i], meaning "four-white eyes".
carpet: A [[floor]] or [[stairs|stair]] covering made from thick woven fabric, typically shaped to fit a particular [[room]]. I.e. it covers from wall to wall. Contrast with [[rug]], which are movable loose items not covering wall to wall.
twitching penis:
A [[penis]] that is trembling, twitching or throbbing. This is usually a result of a heightened state of sexual arousal, anticipation, pleasure or desire.

This is generally indicated by lines around the penis, which are often, but not always, straight and jagged.

venti (genshin impact):
A playable Anemo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

A [[bard]] that seems to have arrived on some unknown wind — sometimes sings songs as old as the hills, and other times sings poems fresh and new.

His true identity is the human form of the Anemo Archon [[Barbatos (genshin impact)|]]. His [[Vision (genshin impact)|]] is just a glass ball he carries around to alleviate suspicion.

He has a similar appearance to the [[Nameless Bard (genshin impact)|]], whose guise he took after becoming the Anemo Archon, as well as to [[Wendy (Honkai Impact)|]] from [[Honkai Impact 3rd]].

His signature weapon is [[Elegy of the End (Genshin Impact)|Elegy of the End]].
blue fire: [[Fire]] that is predominately of a [[blue]] color. Although real-world fire can turn blue "if it's burning hot enough":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fire#Temperatures_of_flames_by_appearance], or if there are "certain chemicals in the burning material":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colored_fire], occurrences of blue fire in media are usually a visual shorthand to indicate that the fire has some kind of supernatural quality to it.
tinted eyewear:
[[Glasses]], [[sunglasses]] or other eyewear that have colored lenses.

Do not use this tag for normally black-tinted [[sunglasses]].
park bench: A [[bench]] which is specifically situated [[outdoors]], and often (though not always) in a [[park]]. These benches are usually made of wood, and almost always have a backrest and a continuous seat along their entire length.
spiked choker: A [[choker]] that has at least one small [[spikes|spike]] on it.

corset piercing:
A type of [[body piercings|body piercing]] that consists of multiple piercings in rows, with [[ribbon]], [[string]] or [[chain]]s laced through to mimic the appearance of a [[corset]], though it can be worn anywhere on the body. 

Think [[cross-laced clothes]], but it's directly on the skin instead.

In real life, these piercings are only intended to be temporary; they are rarely worn for more than a week. As such, they're typically done for short-term activites, such as a photo-shoot.

They may also be done as a form of piercing play in [[BDSM]].

hand fan: A tool used to move air towards oneself and cool oneself. It's commonly used when it's hot.
bus stop: A point on a fixed [[bus]] route for on-loading and off-loading passengers. Marked by a visible [[road sign]].
handstand:

shower (place): The room or stall where one [[showering|takes a shower]].
in container: Catch-all for the myriad combinations of characters in containers.
cake:
A baked [[dessert]] made from a dough or thick batter usually containing flour and sugar and often shortening, eggs, and a raising agent.  They're often covered in either [[icing]] or frosting and decorated with embroidery, figures, flowers, or other toppings.

Cakes are frequently the dessert of choice used for ceremonial occasions, such as [[birthday|birthdays]] and [[wedding|weddings]].

Cake is a significant element in the [[Portal (series)|]] series.

dagger:

The difference between a dagger and a [[knife]] is that daggers are double-edged or edgeless and intended primarily or exclusively for stabbing, while knives are usually single-edged and intended primarily for cutting. Many knives and daggers are capable of either stabbing or cutting.

hay: Visually, there will likely be no difference between hay and straw on Danbooru, so no distinction is made here. In agriculture, there is a major difference between straw and hay.
