bow (weapon):
A bow is a [[weapon]] that shoots [[arrow (projectile)|]]s. The weapon is used for hunting, sport shooting, and occasionally for war.

Regular bows (covered by this tag) are pulled back manually, which takes more strength than popular belief would tend to attribute to the typical archer character in fiction. However, in later times, a version of the weapon called a [[crossbow]] would arise, which replaces manual pulling of the string with pulling by means of a mechanical device such as a lever or a crank, which allows for more powerful shots and can be used by those with less strength than a regular archer.
bar stool: A type of [[chair]] that is tall enough to sit comfortably at the raised [[counter|counters]] and [[table|tables]] in many [[bar (place)|bars]]. Many bar stools have "a built-in footrest":/posts/3060716 to account for the fact that an average-sized person's legs may not be long enough to reach the floor. Despite being commonly regarded as a type of [[stool]], some bar stools have chair-like backs or even armrests.
under table: A character perched underneath a [[table]], [[desk]], or other similar object.
bikini lift: See [[bikini bottom lift]] or [[bikini top lift]].
toned male:
Also known as "ottermode" in some English speaking fitness circles.

Visible male musculature from low body fat, or by being athletic. The character may have well developed [[abs]] but little else. 
The character should look slim or slender, not buff or bulky. Think track and field, not body building.

Do not use together with the [[muscular]] tag when describing one character. 

* [b] Comparison with [[muscular male]][/b]

Details like bulkiness of the [[thick arms |arms]], [[thick neck|neck]] and [[broad shoulders]] are a good way to distinguish between [[toned]] and [[muscular]] builds.

[i]Do not use [/i][[pectorals]] size alone as a determinant for this tag. It is common in artwork to draw them unproportional to the rest of the body, especially with [[manboobs]] etc.

* !post #7055700
* !asset #13418660
* !post #4668612
* !post #4200789
no legwear: A character who normally wears [[pantyhose]] or [[thighhighs]] has [[bare legs]] instead.  This tag shouldn't be used in the case of non-canon outfits, [[underwear only]], or [[swimsuit|swimsuits]].
cigar: A tightly rolled bundle of dry and fermented [[tobacco]]. The cylinder is predominantly brown in color and larger than a cigarette. The top half is wrapped with a brand stamp.
sunken cheeks: Visible inwards indentation in character's cheeks. Sometimes drawn as a simple diagonal lines. Can be either due to sucking with their mouth or as a sign of famine, exhaustion, depression, mortal fear or death.
print legwear:
Deprecated tag. Use one of the below tags instead:

* [[print socks]] (also includes [[kneehighs]])
* [[print thighhighs]] (also includes [[over-kneehighs]])
* [[print pantyhose]]
* [[print leggings]]
cirno:
"The Small Ice Fairy"

Debuted as the Stage 2 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character. She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[ice wings]], and wears a [[blue dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She appears in [[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]] as a playable character, "[[Tanned Cirno]]."

An ice fairy living in the [[Misty Lake]], near the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]. A relatively weak fighter, but nevertheless claims to be the strongest of all (somewhat justified, as fairies are low-tier generic enemies in the series). One of her hobbies is [[frozen|freezing]] [[frog|frogs]] and watching them thaw (a third of which ends up shattering), leading doujins to portray her at odds with the frog-themed goddess [[Moriya Suwako]].

Her large ego and childish incompetence earned her the nickname "[[circled 9|⑨]]" (pronounced "maru kyuu"/"nine-ball"), based on an "elements of play" screenshot from the game manual of [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]] in which she was labelled 「9.バカ」 ("baka"/"idiot"). Another contributing factor to her portrayal as an idiot is her [[Icicle Fall]] spell card from Embodiment of Scarlet Devil, which (on Easy difficulty only) fails to hit a "safe zone" directly beneath/in front of her. Doujins also portray her as de facto leader of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] (also known as the "baquartet"), a posse of "insignificant" Touhou characters.

In Russian she is known as [i]Сырно[/i] (Sɨrno), which literally translates as "cheesy" (in adverb form). In Finnish she is known as [i]Sirkku[/i] (post #673220).
power (chainsaw man):
A main character in [[Chainsaw Man]]. She is a [[Blood Devil (Chainsaw Man)|Blood Fiend]] and Public Safety Devil Hunter who is part of [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s special 4th divison squad. Her abilities include [[hemokinesis|manipulating blood]], which she often uses to form weapons in battle.

She also [[breast padding|pads her chest]], so the chest size she is usually depicted with is a result of padding. This revelation caused [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]] to have an existential crisis.

Voiced by [[Fairouz Ai]].
asymmetrical sleeves:
Sleeves that, by design, lack symmetry. 

* For differences in length, use [[uneven sleeves]].
* For differences in color or pattern, use [[mismatched sleeves]].
yae miko:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Yae Miko is the chief priest of the Grand Narukami Shrine, which she oversees and also the CEO of the namesake Yae Publishing House. She is mentioned by the [[Raiden Shogun]] when the Archon speaks of [[Zhongli (genshin impact)|]]. She is an "old friend" of Morax and Baal, and is acquainted with [[Ganyu (genshin impact)|]].

Her attire is a [[nontraditional miko]] garment, consisting of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] paired with [[detached sleeves]] and a [[red skirt]]. Despite her [[Japanese clothes]], her outfit is not a [[kimono]] and should not be tagged as one.

She is loosely based on [[Yae Sakura]] from [[honkai_impact_3rd|Honkai Impact 3rd]], another game made by miHoYo, and shares Chinese (Du Mingya) and Japanese ([[Sakura Ayane]]) voice actresses.
dancing:
The act of vigorously moving around in tune to [[music]] either randomly or in a predetermined pattern.

For a list of specific dance styles, moves and choreographies, see [[tag group:dances]].
coat on shoulders:
A  [[coat]] draped over the shoulders, rather than worn with the arms in the sleeves.

While this may be done for a variety of reasons, the most common reasons are to cover up oneself, use as an improvised blanket to stay warm, or use as an improvised [[cloak]] or [[cape]].
eula (genshin impact):
A playable Cryo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

She is the captain of the Knights of Favonius' Reconnaissance Company and a descendant of the Lawrence Clan, a prominent family in Mondstadt infamous for its tyrannical reign before it was overthrown in an uprising led by the Dandelion Knight. 

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]]-length [[blue hair]]. In her default outfit she wears [[thigh boots]] with blue, black and white clothes. She wields the [[sword]] [[Song of Broken Pines (Genshin Impact)|]].
mechanical arms: Artificial machine arms that may be used [[cyborg|cybernetically]] (such as a prosthetic) or as part of a device that is autonomous or remotely operated.
zero suit:
A blue [[bodysuit]] worn by [[Samus Aran]] in the [[Metroid]] series.

The suit first appeared in [[Metroid: Zero Mission]], but later appeared in many other games. The suit's appearance differs slightly between games. In [[Metroid: Zero Mission]], the suit has black highlights on the legs. In [[Metroid: Other M]], the suit has dark blue highlights. In [[Super Smash Bros.]], the suit has glowing yellow [[high heels]].
inubashiri momiji:
The "White Wolf Tengu". Stage 4 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [i]Mountain of Faith[/i].

A [[wolf girl|wolf]] tengu with the ability to see great distances who patrols Youkai Mountain. For lack of official art, she is commonly depicted with [[wolf ears]] and [[wolf tail|tail]], even if inconsistently shown in official side manga. She is known for her cooperative and dutiful personality, so early fanworks often portrayed her as loyal and puppy-like to [[Shameimaru Aya]], but it was later revealed that she dislikes Aya and will not take orders from her since they belong to different chains of command.

Genderswapped/trap (otoko no ko) Momiji is very popular, and is tagged as ショタ椛 on Pixiv.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]] with [[medium bangs|medium-length bangs]] and usually has [[animal ear fluff|fluff in her ears]] and [[red eyes|red]] or [[brown eyes]]. She wears a small [[red hat|red]] [[tokin hat]] with dangling [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s, a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] [[white shirt]], [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves|ribbon-trimmed]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]], a [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[black skirt|black]] and [[red skirt]] with a [[maple leaf print|maple leaf]] [[print skirt|print]], and [[tengu-geta]]. She usually carries a [[holding sword|sword]] and a [[holding shield|shield]].
fairy:
A legendary creature, usually depicted as a [[mini person]] with translucent [[insect wings]], although this is not strictly necessary. 

Human in form, playful in nature, fairies are wielders of magical powers. They are commonly depicted having fair skin and gossamer wings.
nemona (pokemon):
[b]Nemona[/b], known as [b]Nemo[/b] (ネモ) in Japan, is one of the rivals [spoiler]and the reigning champion[/spoiler] in [[Pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]].

Due to her feeling that she does not have a proper friend and rival to bond with [spoiler]after becoming the champion of the Paldea region[/spoiler], she approached the newcomer (i.e. the protagonist) to be her rival. She is a kind and friendly girl who likes to encourage others, but her lack of social tact plus her obssession with Pokemon battles often puts other people off. Her catchphrase is [b]"Let's have a fruitful battle!"[/b]
polka dot panties: [[Panties]] that have a [[polka dot]] pattern on them.
torn shorts: A pair of [[shorts]] that have been visibly torn, whether by design or through an external event such as cutting or tearing.
shenhe (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

She is the [[Cloud Retainer (Genshin Impact)|]]'s disciple, and comes from the same family of exorcists as [[Chongyun (Genshin Impact)|Chongyun]] (She's the youngest sister of his mother, thus Chongyun is her nephew). 

Her name is pronounced [b]Shinkaku[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.
robe:
A loose-fitting outer garment, covering the body completely, that usually reaches the knees or feet.

A robe is distinguished from a [[cape]] or [[cloak]] by the fact that it usually has sleeves. Robes are often associated with [[wizard]]s and [[angel]]s, as well as with ceremonial events, such as [[graduation]]s.
hand on own head:
Putting one's hand on one's own head.

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on own head]].
iron cross:
The [b]Iron Cross[/b] ([i]Eiserne Kreuz[/i]) is a [[germany|German]] and Prussian [[military]] symbol and decoration [[medal]]. Its design consists of a black [[cross patty|cross pattée]] with white outline. Its use continues within the [[Bundeswehr]] service (after 1956).

Several video games like [[world war ii|WWII]]-themed shooters, [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] and [i][[Azur Lane]][/i] will use Iron Crosses [[euphemism|to substitute the]] [[swastika]] in order to comply with [[censored symbol|censorship]] and avoid offending their audience with Nazi symbolism.
sleeveless sweater:
A [[sweater]] that is [[sleeveless]].

Sleeveless sweater can be used together with [[detached sleeves]], since sleeveless sweater only refers to the torso garment, and do not take detached sleeves into account.
rabbit hair ornament:
A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a [[rabbit]]'s face or a miniature rabbit.
[[rabbit ear hairband]] is a rabbit-shaped headband.
buruma:
A type of [[underwear]]-like gym shorts, typically worn as part of a [[gym uniform]] with a [[gym shirt]].

"Buruma" is an English-to-Japanese-to-English transliteration of the word "bloomer", usually identifying an over-panty or public garment, whose purpose is to cover the panty and crotch area while leaving the maximum maneuvering room.

In real life, buruma are rarely part of a [[gym uniform]] these days since they're considered old-fashioned; however, they still show up in anime since they are fetishized by otaku.  

The buruma has become a feature internationally in women's [[track and field]] and other sports uniforms. Though the design and materials may be different, the "racing buruma" as they are known in Japan, serve the same purpose and have the same brief shape. 

Contrast with [[bloomers]], which are a type of underwear constructed much like boxer shorts worn by women.
arms under breasts:
When both of a character's upper arms are underneath one or more of their breasts.

Often seen with [[crossed arms]] or [[covering breasts]]

When only one arm is under the breasts, see [[arm under breasts]].
star in eye:
A [[star (symbol)|]] shape inside someone's eyes.

Do not mistake with [[star-shaped pupils]], as the pupils are not actually in star shape, but with a star shape inside it.
shawl:
A long piece of cloth, either square, rectangular, or triangular, used to drape over the upper part of the body, usually at the shoulders. May optionally be fastened together at the front with a [[brooch]] or similar item.

Not to be confused with a [[sash]], which wraps around the body.
anti-materiel rifle:
A [[rifle]] that can be used against targets other than humans, such as parked aircraft, soft-skinned or lightly-armored vehicles, ammunition dumps, and the like. Usually has caliber of 12.7mm (.50) or larger.

They are essentially very large [[sniper rifle]]s. Though not specifically designed for anti-personnel use, they are sometimes used in that role.
uzaki tsuki: Character from [[Uzaki-chan wa Asobitai!]] and [[Uzaki Hana]]'s mother. Frequently seen with her [[closed_eyes|eyes closed]].
illyasviel von einzbern:
A character from [[Fate/Stay Night]]. She is voiced by [[Kadowaki Mai]], and her nickname is Illya.

A young German aristocrat competing in the 5th Holy Grail War. Due to her white-blonde hair and red eyes, she is often considered an albino by fans. Her Servant is Berserker [[Heracles (fate)|]].

She appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as an Alter Ego Servant [[Sitonai (fate)|]], as a composite of Sitonai, Freyja, and Louhi.

Another version of her is a fifth-grade [[magical girl]] in the spinoff [[Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya]], who also appears in Fate/Grand Order as a Caster-class Servant.
misaka mikoto:
An [[electricity]]-wielding middle schooler from [[ToAru Majutsu no Index]], and protagonist of the spinoff manga [[ToAru Kagaku no Railgun]].

She has the ability to [[electrokinesis|use electricity]] in various ways, such as shooting it, using it to shoot other items as projectiles (hence her nickname [[railgun (misaka mikoto)|]]), and electromagnetism.

She has [[brown eyes]], [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]], and [[small breasts]], [[breast envy|much to her chagrin]]. She also wears a [[hairpin]].

She wears the standard [[Tokiwadai school uniform]] with [[short shorts]] [[shorts under skirt|under her skirt]] and [[loose socks|loose]] [[white_socks|white]] [[ankle socks]].

In [[Blue Archive]], her halo features a [[lightning bolt symbol]]. She also wields a modified [[FN F2000]] named "Gunvolt" (itself a reference to "[[Azure Striker Gunvolt]]", hence the name).
armored boots: [[Boots]] made out of metal, typically a part of [[armor]].
karin (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. The sniper of Millennium's [[Cleaning & Clearing (blue archive)|]]. Goes by the callsign "Zero-Two" (0-2). Her full name is Kakudate Karin

She is a [[dark-skinned female]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[black hair|black]] and [[purple hair]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], and [[large breasts]]. For her default costume, she wears a [[maid]] outfit, with a [[black dress|black]] [[short dress|short]] [[pleated dress]], with [[puffy short sleeves]], with a [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron]] with [[white gloves]], [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[strappy heels]].

Her personal weapon is a [[Boys Anti Tank Rifle]].

Voiced by: [[Numakura Manami]]
Original artist: [[mx2j]]
lize helesta:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the group [[Sanbaka (Nijisanji)|]] and designed by [[fuzichoco]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair]] and a blue [[gradient hair|gradient]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her regular hairstyle with her default outfit is [[flipped hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[sidelocks]] decorated with a blue [[hairclip]].

The [[yellow bird]] with a [[monocle]] often seen on her shoulder is her butler, [[Sebastian Piyodore]].
blue swimsuit: Use [[blue bikini]] or [[blue one-piece swimsuit]] instead, as applicable.
polka dot:
A pattern composed of same-sized circles spaced equally. 

Depending on context, such as if the circles are dot-size and are used as texture rather than pattern print, [[ben-day dots]] should be used instead. Not to be confused with [[halftone]].

* !post #8520777: [[polka dot hair]] and [[polka dot bow]] vs [[ben-day dots]] elsewhere.
plunging neckline:
A sharp, v-shaped neckline that plunges through the [[cleavage]] down to the stomach.

This should not be used for garments that are closed above the breasts (though they may have laces to hold themselves together), and should only be used for [[unzipped]] or [[unbuttoned]] garments if they are consistently worn in this manner by an established character.
cracked skin: Skin that is cracked, as if the person is composed of brittle material such as stone.
hex maniac (pokemon):
[b]Occult Mania[/b] (Japanese), [b]Hex Maniac[/b] (English)

A female-only trainer class in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] games. While they first debuted in [i][[pokemon_rse|RSE]][/i], their later appearance in [i][[pokemon_xy|XY]][/i] was much more popular. They specialize in Ghost-type and Psychic-type Pokémon.

Occasionally paired with the [[fairy_tale_girl_(pokemon)|Fairy Tale Girl]] due to an in-game trainer pair called the Mysterious Sisters. In [i]XY[/i], a Hex Maniac sells [[Moomoo Milk]].

h5. Appearance

h6. [i]Pokémon Ruby, Sapphire, and Emerald[/i] (Generation III)

See [[Hex Maniac (Pokemon RSE)]].

h6. [i]Pokémon X, Y, Omega Ruby, and Alpha Sapphire[/i] (Generation VI)

* !post #4993502: Hex Maniac as she appeared in Gen 6 games.

Most fanart is based on their later appearance which debuted in [i][[pokemon_xy|XY]][/i] and later reappeared in [i][[pokemon_oras|ORAS]][/i].

They appear as young [[mojyo|mojyo]] girls wearing a [[long dress|long]] [[black dress]], having [[@_@|swirly manic eyes]], and [[messy hair]] with a [[purple hairband]]. [i]Very[/i] commonly drawn with an [[alternate breast size]] favoring increased cup size.
crotch kick: A [[kicking|kick]] that is aimed at the genital area of the human body. It is normally used against men as it can cause them severe pain. The pain is so severe it makes other men cringe in fear at the sight (or thought) of it. For the female version of this see [[cunt punt]].
marnie (pokemon):
[b]Marnie[/b], known as [b]Mary[/b] (マリィ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Trainer from Spikemuth in the Galar region hopes to become Champion to liven up her hometown. Her battle tactics and cute appearance have earned her many fans. Her first Pokémon is [[Morpeko]].

She has [[green eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] with [[undercut]] [[asymmetrical bangs]]. She wears [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]], [[earrings]], a [[black choker|choker]], a [[pink dress]] under an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket]], [[black nails|black]] [[nail polish]], [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots|boots]], and a [[red bag|red]] [[backpack]].
towel around neck: A character has a [[towel]] draped around their [[neck]]. Depending on the towel's length, it may also drape over the shoulders.
lumine (genshin impact):
One of the two possible protagonists in [[Genshin Impact]], and the [[twins|twin]] [[brother and sister|sister]] of [[Aether (Genshin Impact)|]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long locks]] and [[hair flower]]s. She wears a [[white dress|white]], [[high-low dress|high-low]] [[halter dress]] with a [[white overskirt|white]] [[overskirt]], a [[collared cape]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[thigh boots]].

Her English-localized name is [b]Lumine[/b], [b]Yíng[/b] (荧, meaning "luminous") in Chinese and [b]Hotaru[/b] (蛍, meaning "firefly") in Japanese. In Teyvat, her true name is only used by her brother. As a result, she is often paired with [[Firefly (honkai: star rail)|]] from [[Honkai: Star Rail]], whose name is also localized as "Hotaru" in Japanese

If chosen as the player character, she is referred to in-game by the name set by the player or as [b]Traveler[/b] by most people in Teyvat. If not chosen as the player character, she is instead the [spoiler]leader of the Abyss Order[/spoiler].

Voiced by [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese).
leg ribbon:
When a [[ribbon]] is wrapped around any portion of a character's leg, regardless if one or both legs have ribbons.

If a [[bow]] is tied to the ribbon, also tag [[leg bow]].
fur-trimmed coat: A [[coat]] with [[fur trim]] along the edges.
frog: A tailless amphibian with a short squat body, moist smooth skin, and very long hind legs for leaping.
very short hair: Hair that is ear or jaw length, or even shorter. Very short hairstyles include the [[buzz cut]], [[crew cut]], and [[pixie cut]].
holding card: [[Holding]] one or more [[card]]s in the hands. If the card is held in someone's mouth, use [[card in mouth]] instead.
police: Images that depict people, equipment, machines, places, and/or scenes involving an organization, typically a part of or given authority by the government, that is tasked with the prevention, detection, and prosecution of crimes, as well as maintaining public order, safety, and health.
injection: The act of using a [[syringe]] to transfer a liquid, often performed by [[doctor]]s or [[nurse]]s.
laser: A beam of energy meant to cut through and obliterate objects, or, at weaker levels, a harmless light meant to assist shooters in targeting. Some lasers may be deflected off of reflective objects. The word is an acronym of "Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation".
jitome: When the top of the eye is drawn with a flat line. Used to effect listlessness, apathy, or a [[bored]], [[expressionless]], scornful, or [[smug]] face.
penis on head:
A [[penis]] resting on a character's head. Often followed by [[cumdrip]] or [[cum on hair]] of the character. 
Usually seen in [[bukkake]] and [[gangbang]] artworks.
ice cream:
Ice cream or ice-cream is a frozen [[dessert]] usually made from dairy products, such as milk and cream, and often combined with fruits or other ingredients and flavors. Ice cream can come in [[single scoop|scoops]].

While Danbooru often encourages tagging items with colors, as per forum #130116, ice cream will not have color-related tags due to them being regarded as superfluous and not widely used in tag searching. Please don't create tags for every possible ice cream color.
reiuji utsuho:
The "Scorching, Troublesome Divine Flame". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Subterranean Animism]][/i] and later a playable character in [i][[touhou_hisoutensoku|Hisoutensoku]][/i]. A hell raven who absorbed the powers of a [[yatagarasu]], giving her the power to manipulate nuclear fusion which she then used to try to conquer the surface. Her nickname is "Okuu" (おくう), which is based on an alternate reading of the kanji in her name. Both Reiuji and [[Kaenbyou Rin]] are pets of [[Komeiji Satori]] and live in [[Chireiden]]. 

Her (fan-given) catchprase is '[[Unyu]]'; she is also known as [[circled 6|⑥]] because, like [[Cirno]] (whose nickname is [[circled 9|⑨]]), she is rather dumb and the strongest of the Former Hell, only difference is, she actually [i]is[/i] strong.  "⑥" also reflects her status as a Stage 6 boss, and the notion of her heat-based powers being the inverse of Cirno and her ice abilities.

Her spellcards are announced with a highly visible [[radiation symbol]] and while [[pointing up]] towards the [[black sun]], often while holding her [[arm cannon]] based on a [[control rod (touhou)|]].
overgrown: Vegetation that has overtaken the works of man.
crescent: Any crescent shape or symbol (☾) other than [[crescent moon]].
sarong:
A large sheet of fabric worn around the waist as a [[skirt]], usually over a [[bikini]]. It's usually tied into a knot at one side of the hip.

The Japanese word for sarong is パレオ ([i]pareo[/i]). Technically, a pareo and a sarong are different garments: the former originates in Tahiti, the latter in Malaysia. In their traditional, native forms they might be distinguished. However they are usually equivalent in common usage.
print panties:
[[Panties]] that have printed pattern, shapes, or images on them. Examples of common prints are bears, cats, and [[polka dot]]s.

Note that this does not automatically constitute [[multicolored panties]].
gotoh hitori:
Main character in [[Bocchi the Rock!]]. Also known by her titular nickname "Bocchi", an introverted girl with an exceptional skill at playing [[guitar]]. She struggled to find any friends due to her social anxiety until she joined the Kessoku Band at the request of [[Ijichi Nijika]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[one side up]], [[large breasts]] (according to ch. 4 of the manga)  & [[hair between eyes]] (sometimes depicted with [[hair over eyes]]). She usually wears a [[cube hair ornament]], a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[track jacket]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Other times depicted wearing [[pink pants|pink]] [[track pants|track]] [[pants under skirt|pants under her skirt]]. She [[playing instrument|plays]] the [[Gibson Les Paul]] [[Electric Guitar]], which she is usually depicted [[holding instrument|holding]] or keeping in [[instrument case|guitar case]].

She is voiced by [[Aoyama Yoshino]] and portrayed by [[Morino Mamo]] in the stage-play.

Not to be confused with [[Hitori Bocchi]] from [i][[Hitoribocchi no Marumaru Seikatsu]][/i].
bolt action:
A type of [[gun]] mechanism by which the shooter has to manually cycle the action to chamber a new [[cartridge|round]] for each time they need to shoot, by [b]directly moving the bolt[/b] via a [b]bolt handle[/b] (also known as a cocking handle). The earliest example of bolt-action gun that is fielded by an military is the Prussian [[Dreyse needle gun]]

Most bolt action weapons are [[rifle]]s. The [[Welrod]] is an example of a bolt action pistol.
kaenbyou rin:
The "Traffic Accident of Hell". Stage 4 mid-boss, Stage 5 mid-boss and boss and Stage 6 mid-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Subterranean Animism]][/i]. Also known as "Orin" (お燐) to differentiate her from the earlier, concept-only character [[Satsuki Rin]].

A [i]kasha[/i] (monster [[cat girl|cat]]) responsible for transporting corpses on her [[wheelbarrow]] to the Hell of Blazing Fires to regulate its heat. Having learned of [[Reiuji Utsuho]]'s new power and her naive ambition to conquer the surface world, and fearing punishment from their master [[Komeiji Satori]], Rin sent evil spirits above the ground to warn any able fighter to face this threat. Apparent master of the so-called "[[zombie fairy (touhou)|Zombie Fairies]]". Occasionally depicted as a necrophiliac. She appears to have befriended [[Chen]] in [[Foul Detective Satori]], and passed her talent for finding and retrieving dead bodies to her.
ookami mio:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]] [[hololive Gamers|Gamers]]. Designed by [[Izumi Sai]] and rigged by [[Rariemonn]].

She is a [[wolf girl]] with a primarily black-red color scheme, mixing Japanese and western elements in her costume. tohsaka rin:

patchouli knowledge:

She has [[very long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[purple eyes|matching eyes]], and [[multiple hair bows|multiple]] [[blue bow|blue]] and [[red bow|red]]/[[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|hair bows]]. She also wears a [[vertical-striped dress|vertically striped]], [[purple dress]] under a [[robe]] with [[long sleeves|long]], [[wide sleeves]], and has [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]] with [[footwear bow|bows]] on them.

A magician youkai, resident librarian and instructor of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]], and a close friend to [[Remilia Scarlet]]. She has mastery over the seven elements corresponding to Japanese weekday names - Sun, Moon, Fire, Metal, Wood, Water and Earth - earning her the nickname "One-Week Wizard", but her reclusive lifestyle (she's apparently not left her library in 100 years, which is interpreted in some doujins as signs of [[hikikomori]] behavior) has taken a toll on her health, limiting her powers by way of asthma and anemia. Due to her baggy clothing, her bust size and overall body shape are still open to debate.

On [[NicoNico]], she is linked to [[Gachimuchi]] thanks to "a certain misheard line":https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm2852390 uttered by [[Billy Herrington]]. Such images are tagged with: "Patchouli, Urgh!" in Pixiv.

Commonly represented by [i]Hibiscus rosa-sinensis[/i], also known as [b]Chinese hibiscus[/b] and [b]Hawaiian hibiscus[/b]. It has five wide petals and a prominent long pistil covered with stamens near the tip. Common colors include pink, red, orange, yellow, shades of purple and white.

Makes the perfect accessory as a [[hair flower]] for a [[bikini]]/[[swimsuit]].

ushiromiya battler:

bamboo:
A tropical [[plant]] consisting of tall, green, tubular stems. It is technically a type of grass, but its woody tissue is as strong as timber, and the tallest species can grow to a height of nearly 100 feet (30 meters). Most species are native to Southeast Asia (around 64%), but the plant is also common in Latin America (around 33%). The rest are native mostly to Africa and Oceania, but North America does have three native species. 

Bamboo is used for various purposes, including cooking, construction, textiles, paper, furniture, and traditional medicine.

It is a dietary staple of the giant [[panda]], with which it is frequently depicted.
earth (planet):
Our home [[planet]], the third closest [[planet]] to the [[sun]] between [[Venus (planet)|]] and [[Mars (planet)|]]. Use this tag for depiction of the planet from outside.

For the element of Earth, see [[earth (element)]].
parasol: A type of [[umbrella]], carried as protection from the sun rather than from rain.  The materials parasols are made of may or may not be waterproof. Larger, sturdier parasols may be affixed to patio tables or other outdoor furniture.
duel monster: Use this tag for artworks of card monsters from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] series. This is not limited to Monster cards, and also include elements, items or characters seen on Spell and Trap cards. This tag also cover cards from [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Rush Duel]].

tracer (overwatch):
[i]"Cheers, love!  The cavalry's here!"[/i]

Real Name: Lena Oxton
Age: 26
Occupation: Adventurer
Country: England

An offense-class character in [[Overwatch]]. Lena Oxton (call sign: "Tracer") was handpicked to test the prototype of a teleporting fighter, the Slipstream. During its flight, the aircraft malfunctioned and disappeared. Lena was presumed dead. Months later she reappeared, but her molecules had desynchronized from the flow of time and she would disappear from the present on occasion. A scientist by the name of [[winston_(overwatch)|Winston]] developed a chronal accelerator for her to anchor herself to the present, and control her flow of time at will.

In "Reflections", Tracer was shown together with her [[yuri|girlfriend]] [[emily (overwatch)|Emily]].

VA: [[Cara Theobold]] (English), [[Katou Emiri|Emiri Katou]] (Japanese), Analiz Sanchez (Latin American Spanish), Ana de Castro (European Spanish), Dorothée Pousséo (French)

wolf: Commonly known as a gray wolf, a species of canid native to the wilderness and remote areas of North America, Eurasia, and North Africa. It is the largest member of its family, with males averaging 43–45 kg (95–99 lb), and females 36–38.5 kg (79–85 lb) It is similar in general appearance and proportions to a [[german shepherd]], or sled dog, but has a larger head, narrower chest, longer legs, straighter tail and bigger paws. Its winter fur is long and bushy, and is usually mottled gray in color,

komeiji satori:

Mistress of the Palace of Earth Spirits whose power as a "satori":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satori_%28folklore%29 - to read minds with her "[[third eye]]" appendage - caused even youkai to fear her, but made her well-loved by animals. She is the master of [[Kaenbyou Rin]] and [[Reiuji Utsuho]], keepers of the Hell of Blazing Fires, and older sister of [[komeiji_koishi|Koishi]].
cave: Also known as a cavern, a natural underground space large enough for a human to enter. Caves form naturally by the weathering of rock and they often extend deep underground. The word "cave" can also refer to much smaller openings such as sea caves, rock shelters, and grottos.
kazami yuuka:
The "Flower Master of the Four Seasons".

Final Boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Lotus Land Story]][/i] and later a recurring playable character, as well as the fourth [[Kazami Yuuka (PC-98)|PC-98]] generation character after [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Alice Margatroid]] to reappear in the Windows generation (specifically in [i][[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]][/i]).

A highly dangerous youkai with the power to manipulate [[flower]]s, and reputed creator and original wielder of the [[Master Spark]] (which Marisa later "borrowed"). Hinted by [[Hieda no Akyuu]] to exhibit a rather polite facade, provided she or her flowers are not harmed. Once described by ZUN as "Youkai moe~", possibly meant as a pun given that the literal meaning of moe is "budding" and Yuuka controls flowers. Yuuka's place of residence is unknown in canon, but is generally assumed to be the [[Garden of the Sun]], where she tends a [[flower field|massive field]] of [[sunflower]]s, and it is known she used to occupy the Dream World mansion [[Mugenkan]] with her then-retainer [[Elly (touhou)|]]. Frequently portrayed in fan works as the [[sadism|Ultimate Sadistic Creature]] (USC), as a bloodthirsty psychopath, or as tsundere.  Usually some combination of the first two (or of all three).  Alternately, she is often depicted as lonely due to this reputation or as very friendly to [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] and other children.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] with [[medium bangs|medium-length bangs]] and [[red eyes]], sometimes [[yellow eyes|yellow]]. Her outfit consists of an [[open vest|open]] [[plaid vest|plaid]] [[red vest]] over a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] tied with a [[yellow ascot]]. To complete her [[skirt set]] is a matching [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[red skirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]] or [[plaid pants|plaid]] [[red pants]]. Her footwear is usually [[white socks]] with [[red footwear|red]] [[mary janes]] or [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. She usually carries her [[pink umbrella|pink]] [[parasol]].

Kabedon (Japanese: 壁ドン; kabe, "wall", and don, "bang") is the popular trope of one character slapping their hand against the wall while the other character's back is currently against it, effectively locking them in. It is usually employed for romantic purposes.

When a foot is used instead of a hand, also use [[foot kabedon]]. Use [[kabedon on viewer]] for a kabedon in [[pov| first person]].

For the variant done while [[lying]], use [[yukadon]] instead.

cammy white:
[b]Cammy White[/b] is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. Her [i]nom de guerre[/i] is the codename [b]Killer Bee[/b] (christened in [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 3]] and kept for herself afterwards). She first appeared in the fighting game [[Street Fighter II (series)|Super Street Fighter II]] (1993) as one of the titular "New Challengers," the four new characters introduced in that title. She is the second female character in the Street Fighter series, following [[Chun-Li]].

Cammy is a female clone of [[M. Bison]], originally serving within his organization Shadaloo as both Bison's potential replacement body should his original body fail, and, until then, the leader of the [[Shadaloo dolls|"Dolls"]] - Bison's personal unit of brainwashed bodyguards and underlings. She later went rogue after her encounter with [[Dhalsim]] nullified Bison's Psycho Powered mind control. As of [[Street Fighter II (series)|]] onward to the present in [[Street Fighter 6]], she serves as a member of Delta Red, a British special forces unit with connections to MI6. She has made it her personal mission to locate, rescue, and rehabilitate the Dolls. She collaborates closely with most of the other World Warriors on her assignments, notably [[Chun-Li]].

Trained extensively in close-quarters combat, Cammy likes to strike with quick, sharp attacks like a stinging bee (hence her codename) and use takedowns to immobilize and cripple her foes. Her signature techniques include the [i]Spiral Arrow[/i] and [i]Cannon Spike/Strike[/i] - both flying kick attacks that send Cammy lunging feet first at sharp angles, whether straight forward, up into the sky, or down from the air - as well as the [i]Hooligan Combination[/i], where she hurls herself into close quarters to either grapple the opponent to the ground or strike from odd angles.

Reanimated human or animal [[corpse]]. Stereotypical zombies are characterized by animalistic behavior, indifference to pain, and an insatiable hunger for human flesh (particularly [[brain]]s). Some zombies walk with a stiff gait and outstretched arms due to rigor mortis. They are a common monster in [[horror (theme)|]] fiction and video games due to their predatory nature and tendency to shrug off debilitating injury.

Only characters with visible evidence of [[death]] or decomposition should be tagged zombie. Unnatural grayish-blue or green skin, [[blank eyes]], and festering [[injury|wounds]] are good indicators of when this tag should be used. Whether or not a character is canonically a zombie is irrelevant.

Her regular outfit is a [[tactical maid]] outfit consisting of a [[maid headdress]], a [[bun cover]], an [[earpiece]], a [[blue bowtie]], a [[skirt set]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[layered skirt]] consisting of [[miniskirt]] worn over a [[long skirt]] with a [[huge bow|huge]] [[back bow]], a [[white apron|white]] [[maid apron]], a [[chest harness]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]], [[elbow gloves]], a [[black belt]] with multiple [[belt pouch|pouches]], a [[thigh holster]] and [[white thighhighs|white]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[thigh boots]]. dress pull:
Pulling down a [[dress]] to reveal skin, usually to show the [[bra]] or bare [[breasts]].

Not to be confused with [[dress tug]], which is pulling down a dress to hide skin.
jeanne d'arc alter (fate):
Umbrella tag for the dark version of Jeanne d'Arc from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Also called [b]Jalter[/b] for short by fans.

Unlike the other [[alter servant]]s, Jeanne Alter is a separate entity of the original Jeanne d'Arc. She was created by [[Gilles de Rais (caster) (fate)|Gilles de Rais]], who was so obsessed with Jeanne that he used a corrupted [[Holy Grail_(fate)|]] to "revive" her. As a result, she is a polar opposite of Jeanne, as she wished to destroy France rather than protect it, as she blamed the very existence of France as a cause of her "original" death.

She is often depicted as being [[tsundere]] in official and fan works, and being somewhat annoyed (though secretly admiring) that the original Jeanne treats her as a sister.

For her original Ruler variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc (Fate)]].

For her Santa variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter Santa Lily (Fate)]].
legs together:
Legs held together along their entire length, with no or minimal separation between them.

The legs may or may not be [[crossed_legs|crossed]], and it doesn't matter if the character are [[lying]], [[sitting]], or [[standing]]. A [[thigh gap]] may be present depending on the character's proportions. Contrast with [[legs apart]] and [[spread legs]].

If a character's legs are touching at the knees but their feet aren't touching, use [[knees together feet apart]] instead.

If a character's knees and toes are touching, but their calves and heels are apart, do not use [[legs_together]].  [[Pigeon-toed]] is likely the proper tag.

If a character's legs aren't entirely visible but appear to be together, use your best judgment when determining whether to use this tag. A good example of legs touching is post #2620773.
shell casing:
The metal or plastic case that holds the [[bullet]], gunpowder, and primer as part of [[gun|firearm]] [[ammunition]]. Together the parts are called a round or [[cartridge]], though commonly 'round' and 'bullet' are used interchangeably (the bullet is technically only part of a round). 

On Danbooru, most often seen empty, being ejected one at a time from a semiautomatic firearm or [[shotgun]], in a rapid sequence from an [[machine gun|automatic firearm]], or manually ejected from a [[revolver]] cylinder (all at once, typically six at a time).
fox boy: A boy with real [[fox]]-like features, such as [[fox ears]] or a [[fox tail]].
rindou mikoto:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], who joined as part of Nijisanji SEEDs wave two. Designed by [[ni02 (asahi nini)|Asahi Nini]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with a [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streak]] in the front, [[purple eyes]], [[pointy ears]], a [[skin fang]] and [[skin-covered horns]] with a [[purple horns|purple]] [[gradient horns|horns]]. She also has a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]] and on [[mole on thigh|her right thigh]] and has [[thick eyebrows]] shaved into [[hikimayu]].

Her default hairstyle is [[short hair with long locks]] with [[crossed bangs]] [[hair between eyes|reaching between her eyes]], [[sidelocks]] held with black [[hair tubes]], and a large [[crescent hair ornament]] with [[hairpin]]s and a [[purple_ribbon|purple]] [[hair_ribbon|ribbon]].
aqua (konosuba):

She was a Water Goddess (hence her name) who governed the souls of those who have passed until the eventful day where she met [[Satou Kazuma]], whom she is forced to join through a plot by Kazuma, spawning in a ''MMORPG'' like world with him. She also becomes one of Satou Kazuma's unreliable party members as an arch-priest, joined with [[Megumin]] & [[Darkness (konosuba)|]].

[spoiler]Has outstanding stats except for her luck and intelligence, which are both not only below average, but also has zero growth during level up.
Her worshipers are infamous for being "odd in the head". Also, apparently she is really not all that famous as she claimed to be, since most people in the ''MMORPG'' like world worships [[Eris (konosuba)|Eris]] instead of her.
[/spoiler]

Aqua has [[blue eyes]], noticeable [[breasts]] and [[ass]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[bangs]] & a [[single hair ring|hair ring]] held by a blue [[hair ornament]]. She wears a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[blue shirt|blue]] [[shirt]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] showing her [[bare shoulders]], a [[choker]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[skirt]], blue [[gem]], [[green bow|green]] [[bow]], and [[white thighhighs]] [[thighhighs under boots|over her]] [[blue footwear|blue]] [[thigh boots]].

Rather famously, she seemingly [[no panties|never wears panties]] in the anime, whereas she is clearly shown to wear underwear in both the light novel and the manga.
soda can: An aluminum can containing [[soda]], or in some cases, an [[energy drink]].
lock: A device used to hold a door, chain, container, or other similar object securely shut, usually has a [[keyhole]].
triple penetration:
A sexual situation in which three of a chracter's orifices (mouth, [[pussy|vagina]] and [[anus]]) are being penetrated by [[penis]], [[tentacles]], [[clenched hand]], [[dildo]] or other inanimate object, OR when a single orifice is penetrated by three of this objects.

fubuki (one-punch man):

Blizzard of Hell, [i]Hellish Blizzard[/i] in the official translation), and she is the 1st place ranked B-class hero of the Heroes Association. She is [[Tatsumaki]]'s younger [[sisters|sister]] and a powerful [[telekinesis|telekinetic]]/[[psychic]].

bleeding: The act of losing [[blood]] from an [[injury]], which consists of red fluid drooling out of a wound or cut. For bleeding due to the female monthly cycle, see [[menstruation]].
folded clothes: A set of clothes that have been folded neatly.
closed umbrella: An umbrella or parasol that is not opened up.
stove:
A kitchen appliance that is related to the oven. It is an enclosed space that is heated with fire or coals in order to cook food or heat a room.
Known in Japan as 焜炉/コンロ ([i]konro[/i]) or ガス台. For the device called stove in Japan, see [[heater]].
raccoon tail:
Use this tag if a character has a [[tail]] resembling a [[raccoon]]'s or a [[tanuki]]'s.

While there are differences between a raccoon tail and a tanuki tail (raccoon tails are ringed but actual tanuki tails are tipped), they are often conflated with each other to the point where many characters who are supposed to be tanuki are depicted with ringed tails (thus, why raccoon and tanuki tails are consolidated into a single tag).
sailor shirt: A [[shirt]] that also has a [[sailor collar]].
suction cups:
An object that uses the negative fluid pressure of air or water to adhere to nonporous surfaces, creating a partial vacuum. Suction cups are peripheral traits of some animals such as octopuses and squids, and have been reproduced artificially for numerous purposes. 

This tag refers to the suction cups actually found on cephalopods. For artificial cups or devices that function on the same principle, see the following: 

* [[breast pump]]
* [[milking machine]]
* [[nipple clamps]]
* [[sucti
egg laying:
When a human or humanoid character (usually female) is pushing an [[object_insertion|object]] out of an orifice, whether it's the [[vaginal_object_insertion|vagina]] or the [[anal_object_insertion|anus]]. May or may not necessarily be literal [[egg|eggs]].

nessa (pokemon):
[b]Nessa[/b], known as [b]Rurina[/b] (ルリナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Gym Leader from Galar is also a popular model. She grew up playing with Water-type Pokémon thanks to her parents’ influence and is good friends with [[Sonia (pokemon)|]].

She has  [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[aqua eyes|aqua]]/[[blue eyes]] with [[blue eyeshadow|eyeshadow]], and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[black hair|black]] and [[aqua hair]] with a [[single hair bun|bun]]. She wears [[hoop earrings|earrings]] and an [[earclip]], a [[necklace]], an [[armlet]], a [[belly chain]], [[bike shorts|spats]], a [[dynamax band|wristband]], [[single glove|a]] [[partially fingerless gloves|glove]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[sandals]].
pawpads: The soft pads that cushion an animal's legs as it walks. Characteristic of [[digitigrade]]s.
asymmetrical wings: [[Wings]] that have differences in size, shape, or color.
shoe soles: When the underside of footwear, or outsole, is visible in the image.
gap (touhou): A [[portal_(object)|portal]] created by the [[Touhou]] character [[Yakumo Yukari]]. Yukari's gaps look like [[black ribbon|black]] or [[purple ribbon]]s with [[red bow]]s at the ends, and are filled with demonic-looking red or purple [[disembodied eye]]s.
bat (animal):
Flying mammal with two wings of the order Chiroptera. Not to be confused with a [[baseball bat]].
With their forelimbs adapted as wings, they are the only mammals capable of true and sustained flight.
naked ribbon: A niche fetish involving the subject being nude or nearly nude except for ribbons; these ribbons may or may not cover the nipples or genitalia but are generally positioned in a way to appear to be pseudo-clothing from the viewer's angle.  In some cases bows are attached to give the appearance that the subject is a gift to the viewer.
single mechanical arm:
A character with one mechanical arm.

See [[mechanical arms]] for characters with one or two mechanical arms.
animal hood: A type of [[hood]] made to resemble an animal, often featuring attached [[fake animal ears]].
o-ring choker: A [[choker]] with an [[o-ring]], usually at the front or the back
kafka (honkai: star rail):
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the [[Stellaron Hunters (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[empty eyes|blank]] [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], [[black jacket]] with a [[spider web print]] on the back, [[black shorts|black]] [[high-waist shorts]], [[purple pantyhose]], single [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, [[purple gloves]], multiple [[ring]]s, and [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh boot]] on her right, black ankle-length [[boots|boot]] on her left), and a black-tinted [[pince-nez]].
lillie (pokemon):
A character from [[Pokemon|Pokémon]], introduced in [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[green eyes]]. She's often depicted with her companion [[Pokemon (creature)|Pokemon]], [[Cosmog]].

She has two official outfits. The first includes a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]]. It also sometimes includes a [[white hat|white]] [[sun hat]] and a [[Poke ball theme|Poké ball-themed]] [[duffel bag]]. 

The second outfit includes a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] and a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt]], along with [[white footwear|white]] [[mary janes]]. She also sometimes wears a [[pink bag|pink]] [[backpack]].

Lillie's hair is [[official alternate hairstyle|sometimes worn]] in a [[ponytail with braided base|ponytail with a braided base]].
ass support:
Supporting or lifting the bottom edge of the [[ass|butt]] cheeks by one's own hands or those of another. Analogue of [[breast lift]], but for [[ass]].

Different from an [[ass rest]], when the butt is lifted by/placed upon an object or surface.
amber (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

A perky, straightforward girl, who is also the only Outrider of the Knights of Favonius. Her amazing mastery of the glider has made her a three-time winner of the Gliding Champion in Mondstadt. As a rising star within the Knights of Favonius, Amber is always ready for any challenging tasks.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]], [[small_breasts|small]]/[[medium breasts]], [[brown eyes]], and fair skin. She wears a jumper-like outfit composed of dark brown leather [[shorts]], a red hoodie-like top, red [[thighhighs]], and white thigh-high [[boots]] embellished with gold linings and symbols.

Her elemental skill is [[Baron Bunny (genshin Impact)|]].
hong meiling:
Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]], and later a recurring playable character.

A humanoid youkai (presumably resembling a Han Chinese). She works as the gatekeeper of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] and specializes in Chinese martial arts. Unusually for a Touhou character, it is unclear what kind of youkai Meiling is, but many fans associate her with [[dragon]]s. This is in part due to the star on her [[beret]], which bears the Chinese character for "[[dragon]]" (龍, [i]Long[/i]). Hong is also the name of a specific dragon from Chinese mythology, implying Meiling has some relation (such as parent and child), or actually is Hong, leading to frequent depictions [[Hong Meiling (dragon)|as a dragon]]. There are also occasional images that depict her [[Hong Meiling (panda)|as a panda]].

Fandom also often depicts Meiling as being lazy and ineffective at her job, and often being berated and/or [[knifed|punished]] for this by [[Izayoi Sakuya]]. In canon, however, her relationship with Sakuya is actually something closer to amicable co-workers, if not outright friendship, and she is generally very good at her job of repelling intruders, with the notable exception of [[Kirisame Marisa]], who everyone else at the mansion admits is impossible to keep out when she wants access to [[Voile]].

Sometimes known by her nickname "China" (中国, [i]Chuugoku[/i]), which originated on [[2channel]] during a debate about the proper reading of her name's kanji (some believed it to be the Japanese reading "Kurenai Misuzu", and it wasn't until later that [[ZUN]] revealed that the Chinese reading "Hong Meiling" is correct). Fans came to an agreement that her defining characteristic is being Chinese, and thus called her "China".
gourd:
The gourd is a member of the plant family Cucurbitaceae and a relative of the [[pumpkin]]. When dried, its fruit can be hollowed out and used as a container. It is also used as food.

Most commonly depicted on Danbooru is the dumbbell-shaped fruit of the bottle gourd, or calabash, which can be used to hold liquids like [[sake]].
saigyouji yuyuko:
The "Ghost of Flawless Immaculate Beauty". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Perfect Cherry Blossom]][/i] and later a recurring playable character in the earlier fighting games.

"Princess" of [[Hakugyokurou]], the netherworld pagoda, whose power to invoke death drove her to suicide when she was human, only to end up in [[Gensokyo]] without any memory of her past. 

Despite her tragic history, she often acts as a rather ditzy airhead, seemingly thinking of nothing but anticipating her meals, sleeping, and teasing her straight-laced bodyguard and gardener, [[Konpaku Youmu]]. All these facets, however, conceal an incredibly sharp mind to rival that of her closest friend, [[Yakumo Yukari]].

Depictions might show her with the cherry tree her body was buried under, the [[Saigyou Ayakashi]].

Non-ghost depictions of her can be found under [[Saigyouji Yuyuko (living)]].
kunai: A [b]kunai[/b], also known as [i]kunai-(shaped)-[[shuriken]][/i] (苦無手裏剣) is a Japanese weapon possibly derived from the masonry trowel. It's a multi-functional weapon that can be used for slashing, stabbing, throwing, and other various uses. It is commonly associated with the [[ninja]].
ice cube: A small piece of [[ice]] shaped like a square or rectangle. Water is frozen in an ice cube tray, then broken out and deposited into a glass to serve a beverage cold without relying on refrigeration.
over-rim eyewear: Any type of [[semi-rimless eyewear]] that has a broad upper frame and a rimless lower frame; the opposite of [[under-rim eyewear]].
mage staff:
An ornate [[staff]] often carried by [[magic]] users, and used as focusing implement for [[casting spell]]s. Often decorated with [[gem]]s, [[crystal]]s and metal bands; or is carved from gnarled wood with knobbly/curly projections at the end. Sometimes both.

Not to be confused with a [[wand]], [[scepter]] or [[crosier]].
glitch:
Visual artifacts reminiscent of the long gone analog days.

Blocky displacements and bent images are characteristic of this style. 

Please note that this tag is intended for intentional glitches. [[jpeg artifacts]] and [[scan artifacts]] are unintentional defects.

Also note that simply the appearance of digital squares may be an indication of [[digital dissolve]] rather than an actual glitch.

Sometimes used creatively as a means of censorship (see [[glitch censor]]).
o-ring bottom:
A bottom where an O-shaped ring figures prominently. For example, a bikini bottom where the sides are connected via large circular rings.

This also includes non-circular shapes, such as ovals, hearts, rectangles or any thing else containing a hole through which parts of a garment can pass and then connect together.
flexing: When a character is striking a pose or moving in a way that shows off their [[muscular|muscles]].
stealth sex:
Discreetly engaging in any kind of sex act in the presence of other people, so as to prevent those people from realizing that the act is occurring. When this occurs in a public place, it may be a type of [[public indecency]]. Note that not all stealth sex takes place in public (e.g. post #1124080).

This tag covers sexual activities other than sexual intercourse, so remember to also use the [[sex]] tag where applicable.

Only use this tag for sex acts that involve two or more parties. Use [[stealth masturbation]] for solo stealth sex acts.
arm ribbon: A ribbon wrapped around a person's upper arm. It can function as an [[armlet]], or as support to hold up a loose [[gloves|glove]] or [[arm warmers]].
triangular headpiece:
A type of headband sometimes worn by [[ghost]]s in Japanese folklore.

Derived from Edo period burial rituals, it was originally intended to protect the newly deceased from evil spirits. It has various regional names, [i]Hitai-eboshi[/i], [i]Tenkan[/i], [i]Houkan[/i], [i]Kami-kaburi[/i], and so on.
shoe dangle:
Dangling a [[shoes|shoe]] in the air from the toes of the [[feet]]. For lack of a better term, this tag also applies to other footwear such as [[boots]] and [[sandals]].

When a foot is being used to hold a shoe, use the [[holding with feet]] tag.
bullet: A projectile fired from a [[gun]]. Technically, most modern bullets are released from [[cartridge|cartridges]], which contain a [[shell casing|casing]], a primer, gunpowder and then the bullet itself. It is very common to refer to a complete cartridge as a bullet.
rio (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. President of Millennium's student council, [[Seminar (blue archive)|]]. Nicknamed "Big Sister", in reference to [[Big Brother (1984)]].

Her full name is Tsukatsuki Rio.

Her firearm is a [[M1911]] pistol.

Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] decorated with a single [[hairclip]] and [[ringed eyes|ringed]] [[red eyes]] with [[white pupils]]. Wears a [[white sweater|white]] [[turtleneck sweater]] underneath a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with a [[id card]]. Also wears a [[pleated skirt]] over [[pantyhose]], a [[holster]] [[thigh strap|strapped]] to her [[thigh holster|thigh]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

She is often seen with a [[tablet PC]].

Original artist: [[mx2j]]
Voiced by: [[Lynn (voice_actor)|]]
partially unzipped: A [[zipper]] that is partly zipped up, while the remainder is left open.
tilted headwear:
Images which depict headwear (such as [[hat]], [[helmet]], [[crown]], or [[baseball cap|cap]]) that is worn askew or in a sloping position on the head.

Sometimes held in place by being part of a hairband, as is often the case with [[Mini Top hat]].
green sailor collar:
A [[sailor collar]] that is colored [[green]].

There may be potential overlap between this and similarly colored sailor collars like [[blue sailor collar]].
hammer: A hammer is a [[tools|tool]] meant to deliver an impact to an object. The most common uses are for driving [[nail (hardware)|]]s in [[construction]], fitting parts, forging [[metal]], and breaking up objects. A large hammer, such as [[sledgehammer]], can be used as a deadly crushing [[weapon]].
cheese:
A type of typically solid dairy products; mostly made from cow's milk (types from other animals exist), beaten and stirred until it has reached the right texture and softness.

It is typically used as a condiment for various meat-heavy [[food]], such as [[burger]] or [[pizza]], or as a topping for other snacks.
fur hat:
Thick padded [[hat]]s that are made of fur or have thick fur trimmings. Commonly associated with Russia, where it is known as "shapka" or [[ushanka]], due to its use as standard headgear for all Warsaw Pact armies.

Don't confuse [[beanie]]s or [[Santa hat]]s to be this.

For headwear that just has a fur trim, see [[fur-trimmed headwear]].
mugshot:
A photo taken by law enforcement to keep records of arrested persons and criminals.

Not to be confused with [[close-up]], or an image composition where the character is seen from a very close range.
tri braids: A character has their hair done in three [[braid|braids]].
mask pull: When a [[mask]] is pulled down from its normal position. Most commonly, a [[mouth mask]] pulled down to expose the mouth.
straight-on:
An image whose subject is directly facing the viewer at a 0° angle. Their head, torso and hips (when visible) should all be directly facing the viewer and not turned to the side.

The subject can be leaning forward/back, have their arms in the air, or even be upside-down; as long as they are not turned to the side at all, then this tag applies.
hugging object:
Hugging an inanimate object such as a [[book]], [[doll]], [[pillow]], [[stuffed animal]], etc.

Note that the [[hug]] tag should not be used with [[hugging object]]. [[Hug]] applies only to hugging people, not objects.
uneven eyes:
A character's eyes are both open, but not to the same width.

Ex: one eye is [[wide-eyed|wide open]] while another is [[half-closed eyes|half closed]].

If one of the eyes is completely closed tag as [[one eye closed]] instead.
yin yang:
"☯"

A circular symbol consisting of a white and black droplet, a [[tomoe (symbol)|]]. In Chinese philosophy, [b]Yin[/b] and [b]Yang[/b] represent opposite but complementary qualities (Balance).

Yin represents a dark, negative, feminine figure, and Yang symbolizes a positive, light, masculine figure.
hina (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Leader of the [[Prefect Team (blue archive)|]]. Her weapon of choice is a [[mg42]].

Her full name is Sorasaki Hina.

Voiced by: [[Hirohashi Ryou]]
Original artist: [[DoReMi (doremi4704)]]
shirt in mouth: A character holding up the [[shirt]] they're wearing [[mouth hold|with their mouth]]. Usually this is the bottom hem of the shirt to expose the chest and abdominal areas.
seatbelt: A belt found in motor vehicles used to keep passengers safe during their journey.
nursing handjob: [[Breast sucking|Sucking]] or [[Breastfeeding|feeding]] at a partner's breast, while receiving a [[handjob]] from the same partner.
breast expansion:
When a character's [[breasts]] are shown to be growing or implied to have grown from a smaller to a much larger size.

Not to be confused with [[alternate breast size]], which is when the breasts are simply drawn a different size, with no implication of the breasts actively expanding in size.
snowflakes:
A flake of [[snow]], especially a feathery [[ice]] crystal, typically displaying delicate sixfold symmetry.

On pixiv, the tags "六花":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E5%85%AD%E8%8A%B1] (six sided flower) and "雪の結晶":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E9%9B%AA%E3%81%AE%E7%B5%90%E6%99%B6] (snow crystal) are used for snowflakes. Make note that this is different from "スノーフレーク":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%B9%E3%83%8E%E3%83%BC%E3%83%95%E3%83%AC%E3%83%BC%E3%82%AF] as this actually refers to "leucojum":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leucojum], a type of flower and genus of the family Amaryllidaceae.
fur-trimmed sleeves:
Sleeves with [[fur trim]] at the ends.

Different from [[fur sleeves]].
pouring onto self: The act of [[pouring]] a liquid, often [[alcohol]], onto one's own body.
lotion:
Any kind of cream or gel applied to the skin.

This tag is for the lotion itself. A [[lotion bottle]] may or may not be present.
coffee:
A hot [[drink]] that is made by filtering hot water through ground [[coffee beans]], popular for its aroma and concentrated dose of caffeine. Use this tag when coffee itself (ordinarily a black or dark brown liquid) is visible in an image.

It is normally served in a porcelain [[coffee mug]], but it can be taken on the go in a stainless steel mug, styrofoam cup, or in a paper [[disposable coffee cup]]. For the traditional porcelain or ceramic "coffee cups" that aren't mug-shaped, see [[teacup]].

As coffee can be quite bitter, it is often served accompanied by [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and [[milk]] or [[cream]]. It is usually consumed while hot, but it may be served over ice.
sensei (blue archive):
The player character of [[Blue Archive]], a teacher in Kivotos, the Academy City, leading their students to solve various incidents happening throughout the streets. They are of unspecified gender, though for the game's [[Blue Archive the Animation|anime adaptation]], the player character is [[Sensei (Blue Archive the Animation)|a male]]. 
 
Occasionally drawn resembling [[doodle sensei (blue archive)|a male doodle]] seen in an "episode":[https://youtu.be/9y_AhGXxHBU?t=98] of [[Arona (blue archive)|]] Channel and post #5944539. He later received [[sensei (blue archive the animation)|a proper appearance]] in [[Blue Archive the Animation]].

For the Sensei in [i]Problem Solver 68 Business Diary[/i], see [[Problem Solver Sensei (blue_archive)|]].
halter top: This tag has been moved to [[halterneck]].
hooded cloak: A [[cloak]] with a [[hood]] that can be pulled over the head.
cat ear headphones:
A cross between a [[cat_ears|cat ear]] headband and a pair of [[headphones]].

The version with light-up blue external speakers in the ears is a real-life product called [[Axent Wear]].
tramp stamp: A [[tattoo]] located on the lower [[back]] or above the [[butt crack]]. They can be accentuated by [[lowleg]] pants & [[crop top|crop tops]].
armpit focus: When a character's [[armpits]] are the main subject or the major focus of the image, especially in a [[close-up]].
outie navel:

tate eboshi:
A tate-eboshi (立烏帽子, lit. "standing eboshi cap") is a tall, straight hat worn by Japanese male aristocrats since the "Heian Period":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heian_period]. Afterwards, various types of eboshi were born, e.g. [i]Kazaori eboshi (Samurai eboshi), Okina eboshi[/i], etc. [i]Tate eboshi[/i] is the best-known one. This headdress came about in the "Heian period":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heian_period based on headgear known as a [i]hashiha-kouburi[/i] (圭冠).

Kanmuri are official hats worn in the imperial court and eboshi are casual headdresses worn by the nobility and it was also worn by the normal people. The Mikado never uses an eboshi. [b]Danbooru currently does not distinguish [i]eboshi[/i] from ancient Japanese [i]kanmuri[/i] (冠).[/b]

Physically, the kanmuri stands out thanks to the "koji (巾子)", a cylindrical shape that stands upright from the top of the headwear, and the "ei (纓)", string-shaped cloth which hangs down from the rear of the headwear towards the wearer's back. The Japanese at the time when kanmuri were still simple sack-like shapes had a topknot on their head. They wore kanmuri by putting the topknot through a tube and binding the root of the topknot wearing this sack and letting the rest of the string hang down their backs. The terms "koji" and "ei", which were used even when the shape and quality of the kanmuri changed, serve as a reminder of this older form. 

Notably worn by [[Mononobe no Futo]] and [[Soga no Tojiko]] of the [[Touhou]] series.

Twins]], X/1999, etc. Due to copyright issues, it is nearly always [[brand name imitation|mentioned under a different name]], usually a mangled pronunciation, misspelling, or homonym, such as Pooky, Pochy, Rocky, et. al.

lamia:
A [[monster girl]] whose upper body is human and whose lower body is [[snake]]-like. Lamia and naga are often rendered so similarly as to make it merely a matter of style which one a serpent-legged character will be called.

The term "naga":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nāga comes from Hinduism and Buddhism, and literally means "cobra". Naga can appear with varying degrees of humanity, but typically have fully human torsos. The term "lamia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia comes from Greek, though its original usage did not possess snake-like qualities. It was only in the 1600s that "Robert Burton":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Burton_(scholar) ascribed the familiar qualities, which were subsequently popularized by "John Keats":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Keats in his poem "lamia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia_(poem), published in July 1820.

The Japanese, apparently not having either of these myths as a major part of their tradition, tend to ascribe lamia/naga with personalities like those they associate with snakes in general and lamia are often the tsundere types.

This friendly and upbeat Trainer packs quite a punch, thanks to her travels in Sinnoh. Despite her skill as a Trainer, she can be a little scatterbrained at times [tn](official bio)[/tn].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]]. She wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[poke ball print|print]] [[beanie]], [[hairclip|hairclips]], a [[red scarf]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[bracelet]], a [[poketch|Pokétch]], a [[pink skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], [[pink footwear|pink]] [[boots]], and a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[duffel bag|bag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Platinum Berlitz[/b].
spider: An eight-legged predatory arachnid with an unsegmented body consisting of a fused head and thorax and a rounded abdomen. Spiders have fangs that inject poison into their prey, and most kinds spin webs in which to capture insects.
camouflage:
Camouflage is protective coloration or pattern meant to disguise animals, people, or military equipment through deception and reducing visibility against a particular environment, backdrop or terrain. 

Camouflage patterns are generally used in [[military uniform]]s and often associated with the [[military]].
bicycle: A human-powered, pedal-driven vehicle with two wheels, one behind the other.
holding fruit:
Someone is [[holding]] a [[fruit]].

If the fruit is being held in their mouth without contact from their hands, use [[food in mouth]] instead.
hydrangea:
A genus of [[flower]]ing plants of the [i]Hydrangeaceae[/i] family, native to southern and eastern Asia. Most species are [[bush|shrubs]], but some are small trees. Commonly called [b]hortensia[/b].

Hydrangeas bear globular or umbrella-shaped clusters of flowers that come out any time from early spring to late autumn in a variety of colors influenced by the pH level of the soil. Commonly depicted in shades of blue, purple, and pink.

In Japan, it is commonly associated with the [[rain]]y season. Its Japanese name is "ajisai" (アジサイ or 紫陽花), which refers specifically to [i]Hydrangea macrophylla[/i], the bigleaf hydrangea.
blouse: A blouse is a loose-fitting [[shirt]], usually designed to hang outside the clothes.
crazy eyes: Eyes of abnormal width, with unnaturally dilated, contracted or elongated pupils, signifying a character in a state of psychosis or otherwise distressed mental state, or perhaps demonic possession.
desk lamp: A [[lamp]] designed to sit on a [[desk]] or [[table]].
meat:
Generic, unidentifiable meat. If you can identify the type of meat or at least the method of cooking (e.g. [[yakitori]], [[yakiniku]]), use those tags instead.

See [[boned meat]] for the cartoonish type of meat that resembles a ham-like cylinder on a large bone.
pink shorts: Any style of [[shorts]] that are colored [[pink]].
poker chip: A small disk-shaped counter purchased at a [[casino]], used to represent money when [[gambling]]. Different colors on the chips represent varying monetary values.
lily (flower):
A [[flower]] of the genus [i]Lilium[/i] in the family [i]Liliaceae[/i].

Lily flowers have 6 petals (technically 3 petals and 3 sepals) and come in a variety of shapes such as bell, flat, funnel, recurved, trumpet, etc. They can be almost any color, but [[white lily|white lilies]] are probably the most well-known kind, being either [i]Lilium candidum[/i] (Madonna Lilies) or [i]Lilium longiflorum[/i] (Easter Lily) with their characteristic trumpet shape.

Lilies are a symbol for Girls Love as well as an eponym for its alternate name [[yuri]] due to their Japanese name "yuri".
azki (hololive):
A [[hololive]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Debuted in November 2018 and joined [i]Inonaka Music[/i] alongside [[Hoshimachi Suisei]] in May 2019, before transferring to hololive proper in April 2022 following the dissolution of the label. Current design by [[Scottie (phantom2)|]].

Her name is stylized "AZKi", with only the 'i' in lower case (a convention later repeated with [[hololive English]]'s [[IRyS (hololive)|]], who also debuted as a virtual singer before converting to a regular VTuber.)

She has [[black hair]] (although her recent models have more of a [[brown hair|dark brown]] tone) with the length depending on her outfit with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Prior to her transfer to hololive, she had distinctive pink [[facial mark]]s under her eyes, which were later removed with her transfer and the fourth redesign, and instead replaced by a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]].

Her default hairstyle in her current form is [[very long hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[double-parted bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[half updo]] tied into a [[half up half down braid]] that turns into a [[short ponytail]], decorated with a [[hairclip]], she also has [[pink hair|pink]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] in addition to the [[colored inner hair]] from her previous model.
presenting foot: Presenting one's [[foot]] to the viewer in a deliberately suggestive or lewd manner.
kirigaya suguha: A female character from [[Sword Art Online]].  She is initially mentioned as [[Kirito]]'s real life younger sister, but when Kirito is asked to give further details about her, he explains that she is actually his younger cousin who has been raised as his sibling.  She is a practitioner of [[kendo]]. She uses the avatar [[Leafa (sao)|]] in the fictional game Alfheim Online.
mobile trace suit: A [[mecha pilot suit]] worn by most of the major characters in [[G Gundam]] when they pilot their [[mecha|Gundam]]s. The mobile trace suit is generated by the Gundam whenever the pilot enters the cockpit, and includes strategically located antennas allowing the Gundam to track and exactly duplicate the pilot's movements.
tentacles under clothes: When tentacles go underneath a character's clothes; not to be confused with [[tentacle_clothes|tentacle clothes]], where the tentacles [i]originate[/i] from the clothing itself.
multiple piercings: When multiple [[piercing|piercings]] are worn on the same piercing site.
horn grab: A character being grabbed by their [[horns|horn(s)]].
air conditioner: A machine that circulates cold air in a building to keep the premises cool during hot days.
perpendicular paizuri: [[Paizuri]] where the [[penis]] is inserted pointed toward the chest rather than outward along the [[cleavage]].
gold: Gold is a soft, dense yellow metal often used for both currency and jewelry.
handheld game console: A [[game console]] meant for portability, usually due to its small and compact size.
rattle: Handheld baby toy that produces sound when shaken.
covered collarbone: When the outline of a person's [[collarbone]] is visible beneath their clothing.
singing:
The act of producing musical sounds with the voice.

The character will likely have their [[open_mouth|mouth open]] with [[musical_note|musical notes]] coming out to give more indication of their actions.
notice lines: Lines appearing around a character's head like [code]\|/[/code] to indicate that they notice something.  Can also be used around objects to point them out.
slime (creature):
A common enemy in many RPGs. Usually represented as a blob, possibly with eyes. Sometimes, it is depicted with a [[core]], which functions similarly to the brain/heart.

It usually has the ability to melt and digest its victim's body. Because of this, it became a popular monster in JRPGs and fantasy stories, especially the [[Dragon Quest]] series.

Similar to [[tentacles]], slimes are common monsters in NSFW works, partly due to its corrosive properties being used to melt the clothes instead, and partly as a measure to avoid censorship.

For slime as a substance or with tentacles, see [[slime (substance)]].
height chart:
A [[lineup]] of characters comparing their [[height]].

A height chart is a reference sheet that most (if not all) character designers do while designing the characters for a ilustration, comic or animation. The principal function of a height chart is to help the artist to draw the characters accurately when they are interacting with objects, other characters and even the background.
puckered lips: When the [[lips]] are sucked in and pushed out, often to initiate a [[kiss]].
condensation trail: This tag has been moved to [[contrail]].
covered abs: Where the impression of the [[abs]] can be seen through opaque [[skin tight]] clothing such as [[one-piece swimsuit]], [[taut clothes]], [[bodysuit]]s, [[male playboy bunny|bunnysuits]], [[leotard]]s, etc.
blue wings: Any type of [[wings]] that are colored [[blue]].
heart print: Clothing or an object that has at least one [[heart]] printed on it.
refrigerator: A storage appliance that keeps food cold.
chest jewel:
A [[gem]] located on the chest, usually on the upper sternum. 

Seems to include those of [[pendant]]s, but should probably not.

Associated with [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]], as Blades are distinguished by having a Core Crystal, which is usually located on the chest. Also a prominent feature of [[Koseki Bijou]]'s character design.
nekomata okayu:
A [[cat girl]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]] [[hololive gamers|Gamers]]. Designed by [[Kamioka Shun'ya]] (initial) and [[Seramikku]] (newer costumes).

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair|purple]] [[messy hair]] with [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[crossed bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]] and an [[ahoge]]. Being a cat girl she has [[cat ears]], a [[cat tail]] and a [[:3|cat mouth]], she also wears a [[black collar|black]] [[animal collar]] on her neck.
rias gremory:
Main female protagonist in [[High School DxD]]. She a Pure-Blooded Demon as well as the heiress of the Gremory Clan and the [spoiler]former[/spoiler] President of the Occult Research Club. She is also known as the "Crimson-Haired Ruin Princess" due to her hair color. 

She has [[blue eyes|blue]]/[[green eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] stylized with [[crossed bangs]], an [[ahoge]], and [[hair between eyes]]. She usually wears the [[Kuoh Academy School Uniform]].

She represents the [[king (chess)|]] [[chess piece]].
