danmaku:
[i]For the card game of the same name, see [[Danmaku!!]][/i]
弾幕 (lit. "Barrage")

Mode of attack used by enemies in some shooting games. Complex attack patterns, made of hundreds to thousands of projectiles fill the screen. The player must weave through tiny gaps in the barrage. End-stage boss attacks are especially spectacular, in an attempt to intimidate and dazzle the player.

Danmaku are usually made of missiles, but are sometimes combined with other hazards such as lasers, flames and lightning arcs for added challenge. 

Missiles in danmaku have been particularly creative of late, most notably in the [[Touhou]] series. Throwing knives, flower petals, paper charms and even ghosts have been employed in addition to the usual shells and colored balls.

This tag is used to refer to depictions of attacks launched by  characters or weapons from known shooting games.
afloat:
Floating in [[water]] or other liquids.

Use [[floating]] for the act of hovering in mid air.
pig tail:
When a character has the tail of a [[pig]], most notable for its distinctive curl near the tip.

Not to be confused with the pigtails hairstyle, the English equivalent of [[twintails]].
brain: An [[organs|organ]] of soft nervous tissue contained in the [[skull]] of vertebrate animals, functioning as the coordinating center of sensation, intellectual and nervous activity.
baggy pants: [[Pants]] that are [[baggy clothes|baggy]], that is loose-fitting or roomy pants known for their comfortable and relaxed style. Baggy pants tend to be wide.
finger gun:
Pointing as if the hand were a [[handgun]], usually with the index finger and thumb extended. [[Revolver Ocelot]] has a variant where his index and middle finger are extended.

For actual guns, see [[finger cannon]].
black feathers:
[[Feathers]] that are [[black]], don't use this tag if they are attached to [[wings]].

Use [[falling feathers]] when they are detached and floating around.
pantyhose under shorts: When [[pantyhose]] are worn beneath a pair of [[shorts]].
pocket watch:
A type of handheld [[clock]] kept in one's pocket instead of being worn on one's wrist.

It has a similar design to its predecessor, the [[pendant watch]], due to these similarities this tag should be used for ALL depictions not fastened around the neck.
ladle: A utensil used to scoop, transfer, and/or serve liquids.
milk bottle: A bottle that contains [[milk]] for shipment.
command spell:
A symbol from the [[Fate (series)|]] series depicting a Master's control over a particular Servant, often seen as a red mark on the Master's hand of various shape. [[Jeanne D'arc (Fate)|]] bears a large one upon her back as a sign of her Ruler class privilege to command all servants in the Grail War.

The Command Spell can be used by the Master to force the Servant to perform any actions they wanted, even if it's [[body control|against their will]], such as forcing them to commit suicide.
scythe:
A traditional long handled agricultural tool used to harvest whole plants, such as hemp or wheat. Commonly depicted as a weapon of choice used by the [[grim reaper]] as a tool to reap souls, or by other mythological beings. 

Although often seen in fantasy and anime as a [[weapon]], it is only tangentially connected to the "war scythe", which is a [[polearm]] having more in common with a [[glaive (polearm)|]], fauchard or [[naginata]] than with the original tool.
rabbit pose:
A pose where a character holds both their hands up to the top of their head, fingers together and palm flat, to mimic the appearance of [[rabbit ears]]. Most commonly done as a cute or sexy gesture. Prominently featured in the [[meme]]tic [[Caramelldansen]] video and derivative images.

Not to be confused with [[bunny ears prank]], which is when a [[V]] sign is made behind someone's head for comical effect, such as during a photo.
on ground:
When a character is [[sitting]], [[lying]], or [[kneeling]] on the surface of the earth, whether that surface be [[grass]], [[dirt]], [[sand]], [[pavement]], etc. A character on a [[beach towel]] or [[blanket]] may be considered to be on the ground.

Don't use this tag for characters who are [[standing]] upright or who are [[indoors]] (use [[on floor]] instead).
naked cape: Similar to [[naked_apron]], this refers to a character wearing a [[cape]] without any other forms of attire.
red buruma:
A pair of [[buruma]] that are colored red.

Not to be confused with [[red bloomers]].
infirmary: A [[nurse]]'s office (typically in a [[school]]) or [[hospital]] room. Often contains a [[hospital bed]] surrounded by [[curtains]].
heart-shaped pillow:
A [[pillow]] shaped like a [[heart]].

For pillows with heart shapes printed on them, see {{heart_print print_pillow}}.
egasumi: The traditional Japanese style of drawing [[cloud]]s as long horizontal oval-ish shapes linked together.
breasts on table:
A character's [[breasts]] are [[breast_rest|resting]] on a table or similar furniture.

If the breasts are resting on a [[glass table]], consider also tagging [[breasts on glass]].
miorine rembran:
A character from [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]], she is the only daughter of [[Delling Rembran]], the president of the Beneritt Group and chairman of the school's board. [spoilers]At the end of the series she marries [[Suletta Mercury]] as seen by both of them wearing matching wedding rings.[/spoilers]

She is typically paired with the main protagonist, [[Suletta Mercury]].

Her voice actress is [[Lynn (voice actor)|]].
speaker: A device that converts electronic signals into audible sounds. Often placed on the floor or on a desk mounted to a pole or a wall. Often used a a part of a [[stereo|stereo system]], [[public address system]], computer setup, or home theater system.
playstation controller:
A [[game controller]] design released with the [[Playstation 1]] [[game console]] in 1994.

Like the [[Super Famicom]]/[[Super Nintendo]]'s controller, which it was based on, the face of the controller features a [[D-pad]] on the left, four action buttons on the right, and initially two buttons in the middle (originally a Start and  Select button). It also features two sets of shoulder buttons, unlike the SNES controllers single set, and improved the ability to use those buttons by adding hand grips.

Starting in 1997, the design incorporated a pair of analog sticks toward the center of the controller and vibration functionality, both of which have remained a common feature in later iterations of the design.
foot worship: Revering the [[feet]] of another, usually in a [[bdsm]] or [[femdom]] context.
ushiromiya ange:
Character in [[Umineko No Naku Koro Ni]]. [[Ushiromiya Battler]]'s younger sister.

She is a mature looking girl with bright [[red hair]] tied with [[hair bobbles]].
human furniture: A subset of [[BDSM]] fetish where a person pretends to be "[[furniture]]" and allowed the "master" to use them as if they were an inanimate object. Typically involves using them as a "living [[chair]]" by [[sitting_on_person|sitting on them]].

Like her father, Yamato has inherited the dragon blood and as such she is [[tall female|significantly taller than an average
beam saber: This tag has been moved to [[energy_sword]].
lightsaber:
[quote][i]“This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or random as a blaster; an elegant weapon for a more civilized age...”[/i] ― [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]][/quote]

An [[energy sword]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] universe, most often wielded by the honorable [[Jedi]] knights and their mortal enemies, the evil [[Sith]]. The sword's color typically reflects the user's affiliation, with the Jedi using green or blue, the Sith and other [[darksider (star wars)|darksiders]] using red, and miscellaneous other colors used by both factions.
fringe trim: Dangling fabric cut into strips or bits of cording, which are used as decorative trim and applied to the edge of clothing or items. You'll often see it on [[Native American]] outfits and [[scarf|scarves]].
winter uniform:
A [[school uniform]] worn during [[winter]] or [[cold]]er months. Notable examples are [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black serafuku]] or [[blazer]]s worn over [[cardigan]]s.

Not to be used for military uniforms for cold climates (e.g. those with arctic camouflage).
maribel hearn:
A [[Touhou]] character (alt. spelling Maribel Han, or Maryberry Hearn; usually shortened to just Merry).

A girl living in the outside world with the ability to see borders of any kind, including the one which separates our world from [[Gensokyo]]. Along with [[Usami Renko]], she is the member of an Occult Club with the secret purpose of finding a way into Gensokyo.

Due to both characters having boundary-related abilities, as well as a degree of visual resemblance, fan theories abound about a possible connection between Maribel and [[Yakumo Yukari]], with some even going so far as to suggest that they are somehow the same person - the most common theory being that Maribel somehow cast herself backwards in time and ultimately aged into Yukari as she returned to her original era "the long way". [[ZUN]]'s own comments on the pair pointed fans towards the writer Lafcadio Hearn, who moved to Japan and was naturalized with the name Koizumi Yakumo.
mini wings: [[Wings]] on the back that are smaller than usual.
pink apron: An [[apron]] that's colored [[pink]] instead of white.
gears: A mechanical part of a clockwork system, a gear is a wheel with so-called flanks so it will interlock with other gears and spin. Radius of the wheel and edge sizes allow spinning at different speeds and thus make processing different. Obviously used the most in non-digital [[watch|watches]]. An important part of [[steampunk]] culture.
florence nightingale (fate):
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] featured in the [[E Pluribus Unum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. The eponymous "Angel of Crimea", a British nurse from the Victorian era best known for her contribution to the modern medical study and effort to improve the conditions in hospitals.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] light [[pink hair]] worn in a [[braided ponytail]]. She wears a red [[military uniform]] with a [[black skirt]]. In her third Ascension level, she has a [[bandage over one eye]] and a [[black coat]] worn [[coat on shoulders|over her shoulders]].

Nightingale usually behaves in a cold and stoic manner. Due to the side effect of Madness Enchantment from her classification, she has an obsession with keeping anything clean or sanitized, and also causing her will to treat someone to go overboard, to the point that she will do anything to treat her patient, such as killing anyone who interrupts her treatment process.

She uses a [[pepperbox revolver]] in combat in addition to other unconventional weapons, such as throwing [[bed]]s.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takahashi Keitarou]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]

petite:

Petite should only be used for people of natural size. An exceptionally small person should instead be tagged [[minigirl]].

Petite women with exceptionally [[curvy]] bodies and [[wide hips]] should be tagged as [[shortstack]]s.

For female characters that appear fully prepubescent, use [[child]] if the image is rated general or sensitive, depending on the situation as long they are not sexually depicted, otherwise use [[loli]] if the image is rated questionable or explicit. See [[howto:rate]] for more.
frilled gloves: [[Frills]] on any part of a [[gloves|glove]]. May overlap with [[frilled sleeves]] and [[elbow gloves]].

Her signature "weapon" is the Caduceus Staff, which can be used to either heal or increase the damage output of a single target.

boa hancock:
[[One Piece]] character. She is the captain of the Kuja Pirates and the current empress of Amazon Lily. Also known as the "Snake Princess" and "Pirate Empress" due to her beauty, and one of the [[Shichibukai]].

She has two younger sisters, [[Boa Sandersonia|Sandersonia]] and [[Boa Marigold|Marigold]], and is often seen alongside her pet snake [[Salome (one piece)|]]. She would later on developed a crush on [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] during the Amazon Lily Arc.

Having consumed the Mero Mero no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can fire heart beams, bullets and arrows that turn anyone who is caught by her charm into stone.

[spoiler]Hancock along with her sisters were kidnapped and sold as slaves to a member of the [[Celestial Dragons (one piece)|]] during their childhood. Because of this, she suffered much abuse while enslaved and developed a hatred for males. Hancock's hatred later softened after she developed a crush on Luffy, who was the first man who acknowledged her suffering.[/spoiler]
head fins:
[[Fins]] protruding from the head, usually around ear level. Sometimes extending from character's ears. Seen most often on [[mermaid]]s and [[monster_girl|monster girls]], but may appear on other water-type creatures.

Also tag [[animal ears]] where appropriate.
blue bodysuit:
A [[bodysuit]] that is colored [[blue]].

Not to be confused with [[blue leotard]].
broom riding:
Flying on a [[broom]]. Typically associated with [[witch]]es and [[wizard]]s. When the character stands on it it becomes [[broom surfing]].

If a character is sitting on a weapon, such as a polearm or scythe, use [[on weapon]] instead.
midriff peek: When a small amount of [[midriff]] is visible, or the [[midriff]] is unintentionally exposed by clothing that would normally cover it. Usually less midriff is exposed than in the main [[midriff]] tag (e.g. post #41973). [[T-shirt]]s and unbuttoned shirts are prone to expose a bit of [[stomach]].
spider lily:
A poisonous [[flower]] (species [i]Lycoris radiata[/i]) commonly associated with death. 

A spider lily has 4-6 flowers growing from a central leafless stem, forming a sort of dome. Natural colors include red (most common), pink, [[White spider lily|white]] and [[Yellow spider lily|yellow]], sometimes depicted in non-existent black and [[Blue spider lily|blue]]. The most noticeable features are the long stamens, which give it a distinct entangled/spidery look, earning its common English name 'Spider Lily'. 

Its Japanese name is "[i]Higan-bana[/i]" ("[i]Higan[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Higan flower) or "[i]Manjushage[/i]". It blooms without leaves and bears leaves without flowers, which is why it is also known in Japan as 葉見ず花見ず ([i]ha-mizu, hana-mizu[/i]), roughly translated as "without seeing leaves, without seeing flowers".

Not to be confused with [[chrysanthemum]], some species of which have long and thin outer petals that can resemble spider lily stamens.

mismatched pupils: When the pupils are different in each eye, often seen with [[symbol-shaped pupils]].
cage: A structure of bars or wires in which birds or other animals are confined.
opaque glasses:
[[Glasses]] that hide the character's eyes, usually because of light reflecting off the lenses.

medical eyepatch:
An [[eyepatch]] worn for medical purposes. It may be held by an elastic strap or an adhesive strip.

In Japan, these are typically square-shaped and white (post #1272300).
They might also include holes for ventilation (post #129447).

If a character's eye is covered by bandages, use [[bandage over one eye]] instead.
mika (blue archive):

She is the only Liyue character with her family name displayed on the in-game character menu. Japanese fans sometimes accidentally (or deliberately) misspell her name as [i]Kurumi[/i], the Japanese word for "walnut"; however, her name is pronounced Hu Tao even in the Japanese version of the game.

jill valentine:
[b]Jill Valentine[/b] ([b]ジル・バレンタイン[/b]) is a Special Operations Agent (SOA) of the Bioterrorism Security Assessment Alliance, of which she is a co-founder and one of the original eleven members, making her a respected and high ranking operative of the organization. Prior to this, she was a member of S.T.A.R.S. Alpha team, Position RS (Rear Security). Before joining S.T.A.R.S., she was in the U.S. Army's Delta Force training program, where she earned extremely high grades in bomb disposal. She was brought into S.T.A.R.S. for her already well-developed fighting skills.

After joining up with S.T.A.R.S., she survived the infamous Mansion incident and the Raccoon City outbreak. She is the long time partner of [[Chris Redfield]], and as a result of their partnership, the two are engaged in a deep relationship, and Jill does really care about Chris' life when he is in danger, she would sacrifice her life for Chris, like she did in the Spencer's state. She has devoted almost her entire adult life to stopping bio-terrorism and hated enemy, [[Albert Wesker]].

nintendo switch:
[[Nintendo|Nintendo's]] seventh game console, released in the Eighth Generation of consoles and the successor to the [[Wii U]]. Known as the NX during development. The first production model went on sale on March 3rd, 2017. 

The Nintendo Switch has two dedicated [[game controller]]s (one for each hand) called [[Joy-Con]]s. These can be attached to and removed from the console at will, essentially making it a hybrid home/handheld platform.

A smaller version, the [[nintendo switch lite|Switch Lite]], was revealed July 10th, 2019, built strictly for handheld gaming. The Lite has no detachable Joy-Cons; the controllers are hard-built into the console. It also has no HDMI output so cannot be connected to a TV like the original model Switch can. A [[nintendo switch - oled model|higher-end version]] featuring an OLED screen was released on October 8, 2021. 

The platform has enjoyed a positive reception and high sales numbers in the years since its release. In addition to carrying many popular flagship titles like [[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild]] and [[Super Mario Odyssey]], the Switch has also become a welcoming home for many older games from last-gen systems. This led the Switch to be the [i]de facto[/i] portable way to play popular older titles like [[Diablo 3]], [[Dark Souls I]] and [[Castle Crashers]] which had previously only been playable on non-portable platforms. As of early 2023, the combined Switch product line is one of the best-selling platforms in Nintendo's entire history, outselling both the [[Wii]] and the [[Game Boy]] and now second only to the [[Nintendo DS]].

For tagging purposes, if the Switch has its Joy-Cons detached (or is being controlled by other compatible controllers), tag it as a [[game console]] (post #3259420, post #3528468). If the Switch has at least one Joy-Con connected or the console itself is the Lite, tag it as a [[handheld game console]] (post #3471232, post #3470179).

chinese text:
The image contains text in any form of Chinese. Usually, this means Mandarin Chinese.

There are two systems in writing Chinese, [[traditional chinese text|Traditional]] and [[simplified chinese text|Simplified]] (e.g. 馬 vs. 马). Mainland China, Singapore, and Malaysia use Simplified Chinese while Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan use Traditional Chinese. There is also an official system for romanizing Chinese known as [[pinyin text|Hanyu Pinyin]].

bishounen:
A Japanese term literally meaning [b]beautiful teenage boy[/b]. The equivalent English concept is [b]pretty boy[/b]. The term describes an aesthetic that can be found in disparate areas in Asia: a teenage boy, around 13 to 18 years old, whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation. Bishounen characters are fairly common in manga and anime; a heavy number of male characters show subtle signs of the bishounen style, such as slender eyes or a feminine face. 

Bishounen are usually drawn delicately, with long limbs, silky or flowing hair, and slender eyes with long eyelashes that can sometimes extend beyond the face. It's best to tag images that focus on the character's beauty, so there tends to be a heavier emphasis on solo or duo images here. Group images are fine, so long as the majority of the males exemplify this trait.

As the name suggests, the term is best used when you can still tell that the character is a male. If there are remarkable feminine traits, consider adding [[androgynous]]. For characters where their feminine traits are at the point of making you believe that they're a female, use [[otoko no ko]] instead.

Note that with [[genderswap (ftm)|female-to-male genderswaps]], this tag can apply if they possess the above-mentioned traits.

In English-speaking circles, bishounen is used somewhat more loosely than it is in Japan, effectively used for any male character with pseudo androgynous beauty, regardless of whether they are "shounen" or not (so variants covering those older than 18, ala biseinen, bichuunen, and bidanshi, find themselves incorporated, as well as those younger than 13).

Due to their frequent collaborations and chemistry both in videos and on Twitter, it is common to see her coupled with [[Gawr Gura]], a ship known as "AmeSame". Fans were quick to also compare her to [[Akai Haato]] due to their similar chaotic nature, which extends to collabs.

electric guitar:
A [[guitar]] that uses a pickup to convert the vibration of its strings into electrical impulses. The most common guitar pickup uses the principle of direct electromagnetic induction. The signal generated by an electric guitar is too weak to drive a loudspeaker, so it is amplified before sending it to a loudspeaker. 
Due to the lack of acoustic resonator electric guitars are noticeably thinner and come in a much wider variety of shapes and designs than their acoustic counterparts.

This musical instrument is widely used in rock music.

The headpiece features a large white [[mane]], similar to the [[Barioth (Armor)|Barioth's helm]], that shouldnt be confused with the hunter's actual hair.
two-tone dress: A [[multicolored dress]] that has exactly two colors.
turret: For a turret placed on a [[warship]], see [[ship turret]]. For a turret placed on a tank, see [[tank turret]]. For standalone defensive turrets, see [[sentry]].
single detached sleeve:
When only a single [[detached_sleeves|detached sleeve]] is being worn. 

h6.Examples where only one arm has a detached sleeve, while the other arm has no sleeve

very wide shot: An image where the subject is fully visible but takes up a vanishingly small portion of the frame, even less so than in [[wide shot]]. If none of the individual characters are noticeable from the image thumbnail, consider using this tag.
needle:
A long slender tool with a pointed tip, either used for [[sewing]] ([[sewing needle]]), [[knitting_needle|knitting]] ([[knitting needle]]), poking, holding things together, or [[weapon|weaponry]] ([[throwing needles]]).

Don't use this tag for [[syringe]]s.
shorts under skirt:
A pair of [[shorts]] worn beneath a [[skirt]] or [[dress]].

This is is how girls' school uniforms in Japan nowadays are most commonly worn. Usually it's either the above knee-length [[gym shorts]] from the school's P.E. suit (e.g. post #6560334), or much [[short shorts|shorter sports shorts]] such as [[dolphin shorts]] (e.g. post #6560191), though the former long-legged type typically only among middle school students, as high school girls prefer shorts that can't accidentally show even with [[miniskirt|short skirt]] lengths.
Wearing gym/sports shorts under skirts became popularized because it simplifies changing clothes between physical classes/activities, among other things. Despite this, [[pantyshot|pantyshots]] may still happen, due to [[panties under pantyhose|tights commonly being worn]] in lieu of shorts.

Because of this, it's also becoming more and more common to see this reflected in anime and manga, being often depicted as the default among school girls in series with a "grounded" premise such as [[Hori-san to Miyamura-kun|Horimiya]], [[Karakai Jouzu no Takagi-san|Takagi-san]], or [[Asobi Asobase]].

[[Bike shorts under skirt]] are a more tomboyish variant of this.
japanese armor: Any type of traditional Japanese [[armor]], typically worn by [[samurai]].
open hand: For when a hand is open, when [[waving]] or [[reaching towards viewer]] for example. If both hands opened, use [[open hands]] instead.
green bra: A bra or any type of upper-body lingerie that's colored green.
tomato:
Considered a [[vegetable]], particularly for culinary purposes, the tomato is botanically a [[fruit]] produced by the plant [i]Solanum lycopersicum[/i] of the nightshade family.

The word "tomato" comes from the ancient Nahuatl word [i]tomatl[/i].

In the US, the US Supreme Court ruled in the 1893 case Nix v. Hedden that the tomato is legally classified as a vegetable.  This was to resolve an issue with the Tariff Act of 1883 which required a tax be paid on imported vegetables, but not fruits.
grapes: A small, round, smooth-skinned edible [[fruit]], usually purple, red, or green.
single leg pantyhose: [[Pantyhose]] that covers only one leg. The other leg may be bare or fitted with a different type of legwear such as a [[single thighhigh]].
takanashi kiara:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive English]] and a member of its first generation holoMyth. Designed by [[huke]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] with a [[green hair|green]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[colored inner hair|on the inside]], [[purple eyes]] and [[medium breasts]]. Her default hairstyle has [[hair flaps]] and [[swept bangs]]. She has clusters of [[green feathers]], which are often mistaken for [[feather earrings]], sprouting from just behind her ears.
caught: When one or more characters are caught doing something embarrassing. May be sexual or non-sexual. Not to be confused with [[captured]].
shoulder holster:
A [[handgun]] [[holster]] worn on the chest. The straps hang over the shoulders while the gun hangs suspended under the armpits. These are often worn under a [[jacket]] for concealed carrying.

* !post #5533837
* !post #7216776
electrocution: When a character is being buzzed by means of electrical appliances.
mole under each eye: A mole under each eye. Same as [[mole under eye]], but on both sides.
holding scythe: A character is [[holding]] a [[scythe]] in their hands.

light purple eyes: This tag has been moved to [[purple_eyes]].
latex legwear: Any type of legwear made of latex. Appears [[shiny]] and usually black in color.
tail grab:
Grabbing a [[tail]].

See [[holding with tail]], [[tail wrap]], [[tail around leg]], or [[prehensile tail]] for the tail grabbing something else.
houjuu nue:
The "Unidentified Fantastic Flying Girl". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]] and Extra Stage midboss of [[Ten Desires]].

A fearsome youkai defeated by humans several times in the past, but whose true form has never been revealed due to her shapeshifting ability by way of her Seeds of Non-Identification. She goes out after living underground for centuries to cause mischief for [[Murasa Minamitsu]] and her crew who are out to save their master [[Hijiri Byakuren]]. Friend of [[Futatsuiwa Mamizou]] and [[Kijin Seija]].
cake slice: A piece of [[cake]] cut off for service.
aerial fireworks: A type of [[fireworks|firework]] that consists of large, often colorful explosions in the [[night sky]] (when it's most visible). Often used during [[festival]]s and celebrations.
colorful: Images abounding in colors. When it is clear that the artist put great emphasis on getting individual colors to stand out, yet blending them into to the subject currently drawn.
kyuubi:
A [[fox]] (or [[fox girl]]) with [[multiple tails|nine tails]].

This is stated in Japanese lore to be the pinnacle of age and power for a [[kitsune]], and takes at least 800 years to attain, 100 years for each extra tail the kitsune grows as their power and age increases. Kyuubi are supposedly near-godlike in power. The Korean equivalent is called a [i]gumiho/kumiho[/i], while the Chinese equivalent is called a [i]huli jing[/i] (although, traditionally, kumiho are much more likely to be murderous and evil than playful and nice, and may not always have nine tails despite the hanja/hanji being that for "nine-tailed fox").
mizuhashi parsee:
The "Jealousy Beneath the Crust of the Earth".

Stage 2 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Subterranean Animism]] and a side character in [[Foul Detective Satori]]. A Persian "Hashihime":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hashihime that has the ability to manipulate jealousy. She lives in the [[bridge]] leading to the underworld, often attempting to drive away anyone who attempts to cross it and losing herself in a jealous rage whenever she fails. Parsee also demonstrates the ability to have a [[clone|copy of herself]] through her spell cards. Often paired with [[Hoshiguma Yuugi]] or [[Kurodani Yamame]] in fanworks due to their stages being next to each other, but also [[Kagiyama Hina]] due to both being stage 2 bosses who deal with negative emotions.
cleave gag: A cloth tied around a person's head to restrict speech; the cloth goes between the subject's teeth, holding their mouth open.
towel on head: Someone wearing a [[towel]] on their head.
chest harness:
A [[harness]] worn specifically on the chest, either the [[pectorals]] or [[breasts]].

Do not confuse with [[bondage outfit]], which is for the whole body. 
If the belt is directly underneath the [[breasts]]/[[pectorals]] and touching them, consider adding [[underbust]].
race queen:
A model usually present at auto racing events. They are typically seen wearing skimpy outfits bearing the logos of the racing team and/or its sponsors. Their official job is to hold a [[parasol]] over the driver to shield them from sunlight while their car is being worked on. Also known as a [i]grid girl[/i] or [i]umbrella girl[/i].

The term [i]race queen[/i] can be used interchangeably with the terms [i]campaign girl[/i] and [i][[booth babe]][/i] as all refer to models in skimpy outfits. Campaign girls can be seen more in trade shows and the like, specially those that market [[motor vehicle]]s, while booth babes are seen in smaller booths, especially acting as booth tenders or helpers.

Due to the increased presence of women in motorsports and safety concerns regarding their outfits in pit lanes, race queens have been phased out of almost all major motorsport series, with [[Super GT]], [[Moto GP]], and [[Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters]] being notable holdouts - DTM even offering the option for male pit models to accompany female drivers.

The most recognizable form of race queen outfit is a revealing outfit usually consisting of a [[crop top]] or [[tube top]] with a [[skirt]] or [[shorts]], designed to highlight the model's [[midriff]] and legs, although [[highleg leotard]]s and [[highleg_one-piece_swimsuit|swimsuits]] with or without additional accessories have also been common as outfits especially during the 1990s in Japan. Recently, race queens in less revealing outfits have also become more common, primarily in regions outside of Japan that still employ them - their outfits will usually consist of form-fitting [[dress]]es or [[bodysuit]]s instead.
katsuragi misato:
A character from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] who is the chief operations officer at [[Nerv]]. She is the field commander for the [[Ayanami Rei|Eva pilots]] and guardian of [[Ikari Shinji]] and [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]] who stay at her home.

[spoiler]Misato and her father were involved in the Second Impact as he was a top scientist who in the last moment put Misato in a escape capsule so she could survive the event. Afterwards Misato became [[crazy]] with survivor guilt and was admitted into a
omaru polka:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and [[hololive]]'s [[holoFive|5th]] [[NePoLaBo|generation]]. Designed by [[Kou Mashiro]].

She is a circus performer with a [[playing card theme|playing card motif]] who happens to be a fennec [[fox girl]] with long [[animal ear fluff|fluffy]] [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail|tail]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] and [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], card suit [[facial mark]]s [[mark under eye|under her eyes]], [[purple eyes]] with [[symbol-shaped pupils]] which seem to change with her emotions, often [[heart-shaped pupils|heart]] or [[star-shaped pupils|star-shaped]].

Her default hairstyle is a [[single braid|single]] [[side braid]] [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]], [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]] and a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]] on her signature propeller [[ahoge]].
nero claudius (fate):
A Saber-class servant in the [[Fate (series)|]] series. She first appeared in [[Fate/Extra]] and [[Fate/Extra CCC]], then later in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This is an umbrella tag for all versions of Nero Claudius under one tag.

She looks very similar to [[Artoria Pendragon (Fate)|]], with [[blonde hair]] tied up in a [[single hair bun]] with a [[braided bun|braid]], an [[ahoge]], and [[green eyes]] (although of a different hue), but she normally wears a military-style [[red dress]], and has noticeably [[large breasts|larger breasts]]. Her personality is more outgoing and haughty, albeit engendered by a sense of noblesse oblige. Her catchphrase is "[[umu (phrase)|umu]]!"

Despite their very similar appearances, Nero Claudius and [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]] are considered to be separate characters.

Her voice actress is [[Tange Sakura]].
haro: A small spherical robot used as a mascot character in many [[Gundam]] series.
paw shoes: [[Shoes]] or [[boots]] designed to resemble animal paws.
grabbing another's chin:
A character touching another character's chin, or more generally the underside of the bottom jaw, with the apparent intent to move, immobilize, or express control of it.

Situations without such intent may be better described as [[stroking another's chin]].

For characters grabbing or touching their own chin, see [[finger to own chin]], [[hand on own chin]], [[stroking own chin]], or [[head rest]].
hands on another's shoulders:
When both of one character's hands are on both of another's shoulders.

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on another's shoulder]].
pointy hair:
A hairstyle with at least two cone-shaped points that stick out and up, sometimes resembling [[hair ears|animal ears]]. [[Musashi (kancolle)|Musashi]] and [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]]'s hairstyles are perfect examples.

Not to be confused with [[spiked hair]], where most of the character's hair, if not the entire hairstyle, consists of sharp spikes; nor [[hair flaps]], where the ear-like flaps come from the sides, and are either flat or down.
shade: Under the shade, including headwear casting a shadow over the eyes. Doesn't include people's [[shadow|shadows]].
tamamo (fate):
Catchall tag that includes all versions of Tamamo (or specifically the Tamamo nine servants) from the [[Fate (series)|]] series.

The [[Tamamo Nine]] were a group of nine [[fox girl]] servants first debuted in [[Fate/Extra]]. They were created after the goddess [[Amaterasu (fate)|]] cut off her nine tails which later gained consciousness of their own.

So far, five [spoiler](four if not counting the "fake" Tamamo)[/spoiler] out of nine Tamamos have made their appearance in the Fate series.
lap pillow:
When someone's head is resting in someone else's lap.

If a character is merely inviting someone to rest on their lap, use [[lap pillow invitation]] instead. If the body rather than the head is resting on the lap, use [[lying on lap]] instead.
frying pan:
A flat-bottomed utensil used for frying or cooking foods.

The Japanese word 'pan' (パン) means 'bread', but this tag does not refer to this.
gift: Any box, bag, or container wrapped in plain or patterned paper and decorated with [[ribbon|ribbons]]. Gifts are often given on [[birthday|birthdays]], [[Christmas]], or [[valentine|Valentine's Day]].
starfish:
Also called a "[b]Sea star[/b]". They are star-shaped sea creatures from the class [b]Asteroidea[/b]. 

Starfish are invertebrates and not fish despite having "fish" in its name.

Wooden lifeless versions are commonly seen in the company of [[Ibuki Fuuko]].
cum on legs: When [[cum]] is present on the [[legs]] of a character.
airplane: An [[aircraft]] that flies by using fixed wings to generate lift.
hand under clothes: A hand is reaching beneath someone's clothing. It doesn't matter if it is a person reaching under their own clothes, or one character doing it to another.
stuffed rabbit: A [[rabbit]] [[stuffed animal|stuffed]] with fluff, akin to a [[teddy bear]].
tachibana arisu:
A [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category

Despite being so young (12 y.o), Arisu is a very logical girl. She loves to play games and frequently becomes engrossed in reading mystery novels. Her most prominent feature is her straight dark brown hair, which is always done up with a bow. She hates her name, and prefers to be referred to by her surname, but after becoming closer with the producer, she becomes more accepting of him calling her by her first name.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Shiomi Syuko]], [[Ichinose Shiki]], [[Katagiri Sanae]], and [[Sakurai Momoka]]. She is voiced by [[Satou Amina]].
venus symbol:
The ♀ symbol.

The symbol used for four major representations:

* the planet [[Venus (planet)|]]
* alchemic symbol for copper
* the female gender
* feminism in sociology and philosphy
damaged:
When an object has been damaged in some way but still remains functional or the object can still fulfill its original purpose.

If an object has ceased to fulfill its purpose, use [[broken]]. Does not apply to clothing, which would be [[torn clothes]].
uneven horns:
When a character has [[horns]] of the same design but different lengths. If the horns have different colors each tag with [[mismatched horns]] too.

If a character has horns of completely different designs/styles use [[mismatched horns]] only.
monster hunter (character):
Encompassing tag for player-made avatars in the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series, whether they be actual player characters (the titular Monster Hunters), fictional characters using one of the game's many sets of armor (either whole, incomplete, or mixed) or weapons, or the common depiction of the armor's wearer. If applicable, do try to actually tag the armor; if you are unsure, leave a comment on the given post or use [[clothing request]].

[b]Note:[/b] just because a character is wearing armor from the series doesn't automatically mean this tag applies, Hunters may even be drawn without any recognizable armor or weapons. This is mainly to avoid its usage on non-MH characters wearing the series' sets of armor.

For specific sets of armor, use one of the searches below:
turtleneck leotard:
A [[leotard]] with a [[turtleneck]] design.

The [[HeatTech leotard]], which has a specific design, was originally known under this tag, but the ambiguity of the tag name led it to being populated by posts not referring specifically to the HeatTeach leotard, but to leotards with turtlenecks in general, hence the need for the separate tag (see topic #21483 for the brief discussion).
single wing: Wings usually come in pairs. Use this tag when at least one wing is unpaired. It may either not exist or be cut off.
thrusters: Rocket & jet based propulsion systems usually used in [[aircraft]] or [[spacecraft]].
controller: A joystick or mechanical pad with buttons on it to control the actions of an electronic device. Commonly associated with [[video game]]s.
christmas ornaments: Ornaments for hanging on [[Christmas tree]]s. They come in many shapes and colors, with the most common being a round ball.
hand on own chin:
When a character has one of their hands on their own [[chin]]. Typically signify that the character is either in [[thinking|deep thought]] or [[bored]].

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on own chin]].
rabbit boy:
A boy with real [[rabbit]]-like features, such as [[rabbit ears]] or a [[rabbit tail]].

Not to be confused with [[male playboy bunny]], which involves boys wearing [[playboy bunny|bunnysuits]].
electric fan:
An electrical device with revolving vanes used for ventilation and general comfort. One should not stick their finger between the grills. You can make alien sounds by [[fan_speaking|speaking in front of this device while it's running.]]

This tag is generally used for corded or battery-powered fans. Electric fans mounted to ceilings should just be tagged [[ceiling fan]] instead.
waves:
Waves like you see in water, or some other liquid. 

Do not confuse with [[waving]], which is used for the hand gesture.

For sound-produced waves, see [[sound wave]].

For circular concentric waves on a fluid, use also [[ripples]].
object on head:
An object that isn't conventional headgear atop someone's head. If it the object cover's the wearers face, such as a bag, use an [i]over head[/i] tag, such as [[bag over head]] instead of [[bag on head]].

Use this tag for [b]objects that seem spontaneously placed on the character's head[/b], rather than fashioned into a head accessory (such as commonly found in  [[necktie on head]], where the necktie is fashioned into a headband). 

- Another example, if there is fruit on a character's hat, but it seems ingrained to the hat's design, use [[Fruit hat ornament]]; if the fruit seems to be attached to their hair, use [[Fruit hair ornament]], but if it looks like the fruit has been randomly placed on their head, use [[fruit on head]].
dougi:
A uniform for training, used in Japanese [[martial arts]] such as [[karate]]. This term is otherwise known as keikogi ([i]keiko[/i] means practice, [i]gi[/i] means dress or clothes).

The top part of the uniform is a [[jacket]] called uwagi, and is tied by a [[martial arts belt]]. The bottom part is a pair of [[pants]] called shitabaki.

In [[Korea]], [i]dougi[/i] are called [i][[dobok]][/i] (도복), and are used for Korean [[martial arts]] such as [[taekwondo]].
shiranui flare:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s 3rd generation hololive Fantasy.

She is a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] [[elf]] with [[pointy ears]], [[long hair|long]], [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[blonde hair]], often kept in a [[high ponytail]] held with a [[hair bow]] and [[sidelocks]]. She also has [[large breasts]] that while she downplays them with most of her costumes, are actually larger than [[Houshou Marine|Marine]]'s.

Designed by [[lack]] and rigged by [[Tou Ilie]].
minato aqua:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[2nd generation (hololive)|]]. A Marine-style [[maid]], turned [[cat girl]]. Designed by [[Gaou (Umaiyo Puyoman)|]].

On August 6, 2024, "she announced":[https://twitter.com/minatoaqua/status/1820781111074803737] that she would be graduating from hololive, with a graduation stream on August 28th.

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], [[purple hair]] with the [[colored inner hair|inner]] parts being [[blue hair|blue]] and [[streaked hair|streaks]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] or [[fanged bangs]] and an [[ahoge]], her default hairstyle consists of a pair of [[braid]]s that transition into a pair of [[twin drills|drill-shaped]] [[twintails]] tied with [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]].
breasts on head:
A fairly common trope in anime pictures involving a shorter character standing underneath a taller (and more endowed) character, with the head of the shorter pushing into the [[cleavage]] of the taller from beneath.

Also applies to any angle, so long as the breasts are being rested on the head of another character.

Often implies a significant degree of [[height difference]].

This tag does not include the [[breast_smother|face-between-breasts]] position.
smirk: A [[smile]] that is inherently [[smug]], often offensively so. Distinguished from a regular [[smile]] by the upward curl only on one side.
broken horn: A character with a single broken [[horns|horn]]. If both of the horns are broken, use [[broken horns]] instead.
floppy ears: Long [[animal ears]] that hang limp against the head, unable to perk up on their own. The ears must be completely limp, or almost completely limp, unless they are being lifted by another source, like the wind or someone's hand.
tokino sora:
The very first [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]. Originally designed by [[icakhi]], currently handled by [[Amagai Tarou]].

She has [[brown eyes]] (although she wears [[blue eyes|blue]] contacts most of the time) and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair flaps]] and decorated a [[diamond hair ornament|diamond]]-shaped [[hairclip]] on one side and a [[star hair ornament|star]]-shaped one with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]].
electrokinesis: The ability to generate/manipulate [[electricity]]. [[toaru_majutsu_no_index|Index]]'s [[Misaka Mikoto]] is a prime example.
gas mask:
A full-face [[mask]] that protects the wearer from toxic gases and airborne pollutants by covering their nose, mouth, and eyes. 

They protect the wearer by forming a sealed cover over the nose and mouth and filters the air that they breath in to prevent inhaling toxic gases or pollutants. The mask also protects the eyes from exposure to toxic gases or pollutants that may cause irritation, temporary blindness, or even permanent eye damage. 

If the mask doesn't cover the eyes, then it's a [[respirator]], not a [[gas mask]].
goldfish: A type of domesticated freshwater fish that are commonly kept as pets in [[fish tank|aquariums]], ponds or [[fishbowl|goldfish bowls]].
paper fan: A paper fan that isn't a [[harisen]], the type of folded paper fan often found in Japanese comedy.
fedora: The staple of many an old [[detective]] movie, the fedora has a crease that runs lengthwise down the crown and is pinched in the front on both sides. It frequently comes with a hatband as well.
huge weapon:
A very large [[weapon]], generally at least as large as the character wielding it.  

Popular combinations include [[huge weapon]] + [[sword]] and [[huge weapon]] + [[gun]].

More general huge objects fall under [[oversized object]].
=_=:
A smiley that is used to represent a face with squinted eyes (mouth shape is often varied).

It is primarily used to express contentment but can occasionally be used for anything from exasperation to embarrassment or sleepiness.
open pants:
[[Pants]] with an [[open fly]].

Not to be confused with [[chaps]], which are pants with an open crotch.
leather:
A durable and flexible material created via the tanning of hides.

In appearance, it is often vaguely similar to [[latex]], but with the softer shine and higher value range that come with more spread out light reflection, a distinguished pattern, and less skin-tight. The pattern is not a requirement however, and won't be visible in most images on danbooru anyway. Likewise, it will often be drawn more skin-tight than expected. 

There are various forms of leather, including ones with plastic finishes, making distinguishing between leather and latex rather hard at times, especially in anime-style art.

[[Fate/Grand Order]] [[Halloween]] 2017 [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] featuring [[Florence Nightingale (fate)|]] wearing a [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[nurse]] outfit, with a [[green bikini|green]]-and-[[purple bikini]], a latex [[miniskirt]], [[latex shrug]], and latex [[thigh boots]].

In NSFW works, her [[syringe]] holsters are occasionally replaced with a [[condom belt]].

still life: A work of art depicting mostly inanimate objects. [[Fruit]] bowl paintings are a common example.
weighing scale:
A device for [[measuring]] weight.

For the skin texture, see [[scales]].
crotchless pantyhose: [[Pantyhose]] that is [[crotchless]] by design, not [[torn legwear|torn]] open.
amane kanata:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[holoForce|4th generation]]. Designed by [[Oshioshio]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair]] and a few [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Her default hairstyle is an [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[bob cut]] with a [[single hair intake]] and long [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]]. She also has [[mini wings|small]] [[gradient wings|gradient]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]] going from [[white wings|white]] to [[blue wings|blue]] and a [[star halo|star-shaped halo]] (which is sometimes compared to a shuriken) floating off-center over her head.
leotard under clothes: When a character is wearing a [[leotard]] underneath a set of other clothing such as a shirt, pants, skirt, etc.

machine gun:
A [[gun|firearm]] designed for sustained automatic fire. Machine guns are distinguished from [[assault rifle]]s and [[battle rifle]]s by size and ammunition capacity. Machine guns are divided into three categories:
* [[Light machine gun]]: Fires intermediate-power [[ammunition|cartridges]] (except earlier and [[World War II]] designs like the [[bren lmg|Bren]]). Light enough to be operated by one personnel. Are either belt-fed or [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]-fed.
* Medium and general-purpose machine gun: Fire full-power [[rifle cartridge]]s and serve in both infantry and emplaced roles. It typically require a crew to operate, due to their bulk.
* [[Heavy machine gun]]: Fires large-caliber cartridges (at least 12 mm but less than 20 mm), dedicated for anti-materiel role. Because of their weight and large size, HMGs are typically restricted to stationary positions.
tank:
An armored, [[caterpillar tracks|tracked]] [[military vehicle]] with a single [[cannon]] (some tanks may have mounted [[machine gun]]s or more than one cannon). Its heavy armor protects  the crew from enemy fire while the tracks let it traverse difficult terrain or obstacles.

For tagging purposes this tag may also be used on any tank-like [[motor vehicle|vehicle]], whether real or fictional. This may include things such as tank destroyers (ex: [[Sturmgeschutz III]]), [[self-propelled artillery]] (ex: [[M109 Howitzer]]), rocket artillery, and the like.

For the container type tank, use the tag: [[tank (container)]]. Do not confuse with [[tank top]], which refers to a type of shirt.

desert:
An arid, barren environment. Usually covered in predominantly [[sand]] or very loose soil with few animals and plants (e.g. [[palm tree]]s and [[cactus|cacti]]) which can survive with very small amounts of water.

Commonly featured in Middle Eastern setting or [[post-apocalypse]] fiction to show that resources are scarce or some event has killed most of the life on Earth.

[b]Not to be confused[/b] with sweet food items consumed at the end of a meal, known as a [[dessert]].

obijime:
[b]Obijime[/b] (帯締め, おびじめ) is a small decorative string tied around the [[obi]], used only in women's [[kimono]].

It's about 150 cm (4.9 ft) long and is tied around the obi and through the knot, and which doubles as decoration. It can be a woven [[string]], or be constructed as a narrow sewn tube of fabric. There are both flat and round obijime. They often have [[tassel|tassels]] at both ends and are made from [[silk]], [[satin]], brocade or viscose. A cord-like or a padded tube obijime is considered more festive and ceremonial than a flat one.

Traffic lights consist normally of three light signals of the colors red, yellow, and green/blue arranged vertically or horizontally in that order. crow:
A large, all-black passerine [[bird]].

Scientifically, crows are one species of bird in the broader Corvidae family, which includes crows, ravens, rooks, jackdaws, jays, magpies, treepies, choughs, and nutcrackers. On Danbooru, "crow" includes all visually-similar birds in the Corvidae family.

Birds in the Corvidae family range in size from the relatively small pigeon-size jackdaws (Eurasian and Daurian) to the Common Raven of the Holarctic region and Thick-billed Raven of the highlands of Ethiopia. The 40 or so members of Corvus genus occur on all temperate continents (except South America) and several offshore and oceanic islands.

Crow species found in Japan, aside from [[magpie]]s, jays and nutcrackers, include the rook, [[carrion crow]], Eurasian & Daurian jackdaws, the large-billed crow, and the common raven.

[[Touhou]] characters [[Shameimaru Aya]] and [[Himekaidou Hatate]] are crow [[tengu]], while [[Reiuji Utsuho]] is a hell raven youkai.

aran sweater: The Aran jumper (Irish Gaelic: Geansaí Árann) is a style of [[sweater]] that takes its name from the Aran Islands off the west coast of [[Ireland]]. It is sometimes known as a [i]fisherman's jumper[/i]. A classical fisherman's jumper is a bulky garment of unscoured wool with [[cable knit]] patterns (often of various patterns) generally covering both the body and arms of the sweater; they are traditionally cream-coloured or off-white.

A former [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[holoforce|4th generation]]. A [[dragon girl]] in human form. Designed by [[Yaman]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[orange hair]] with a single [[blonde hair|yellow]] [[streaked hair|lock of hair]] near her forehead. Her regular hairstyle is [[straight hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair intakes]] held with a [[black hairband]], [[fanged bangs|fanged]] [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]]. She also has a pair of [[dragon horns]] with a [[horn bow|bow]] on her right horn, [[pointy ears]], [[red eyes]] with [[white pupils|white]] [[slit pupils]], a long purple [[dragon tail]] (which she had a running gag of it being a [[butt plug]] [[anal tail|tail]]). She also has quite [[large breasts]], with her subsequent outfits making them [[huge breasts|noticeably larger]].

She is fluent in English, and quite eccentric (due to being a half-American). Hosted a morning "news show"-esque 20-minute program on weekdays named "AsaCoco" (Morning Coco), which usually ended up creating absurd memes - such as [[Himemori Luna]]'s English Corner, where the cute, childish princess constantly spews out obscenities, and most notably the drug "[[asacoco]]", a potent stimulant available to be delivered in a wide variety of forms ranging from needles to anal plugs.

Despite her wild antics, insane gags and frequent foul language (which often got her into trouble with YouTube), she is very eager to help her friends if need be and has a mature, big sister-like approach to troublesome situations (though usually laced with some of her personal brand of humor to break the seriousness if it's too much).

She was considered to have the second largest bust in hololive after [[Tsukumo Sana]], even toppling [[Shirogane Noel]]'s K-night cups. She was also significantly taller than the rest of the hololive girls (180 cm, compared with [[Omega Alpha]], who is the second tallest at 175 cm without counting the gigantic Sana), especially the rest of the 4th generation (Kanata, Towa and Watame are all about 150 cm tall, Luna is the shortest at 140 cm, boosted to 150 cm with her shoes and crown).

She was the real-life roommate of [[Amane Kanata]], and the apartment that they lived in together was called by other visiting hololive members as the "KanaCoco House". This means that they could (and had several times) make appearances on each other's streams.

She is in fact a big [[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]] fangirl and has been known to play games of the series. In fact, her name and her title of "Chairwoman" ("会長" - [i]Kaichou[/i]) are direct references to [[Kiryu Kazuma]].

Kiryu Coco reached one million YouTube subscribers on February 17, 2021.

She announced her graduation from Hololive on June 8, 2021. Her final act was a live concert on July 1, 2021, which became one of the most viewed live streams in Hololive and VTuber history, reaching over 498,000 concurrent viewers.

aztec:
A group of ancient cultures located in modern day [[Mexico]]. Often the term "Aztec" refers exclusively to the Mexica people of [[Tenochtitlan]] (now the location of [[Mexico City]]), situated on an island in Lake Texcoco, who referred to themselves as Mexica Tenochca.

The [b]Aztec[/b] people were certain ethnic groups of central Mexico, particularly those groups who spoke the Nahuatl language and who dominated large parts of Mesoamerica in the 14th, 15th and 16th centuries, a period referred to as the late post-classic period in Mesoamerican chronology.

In 1521, in what is probably the most widely known episode in the Spanish colonization of the Americas (also known as "La Conquista"), [[Hernan Cortes]], along with a large number of Nahuatl speaking indigenous allies, conquered [[Tenochtitlan]] and defeated the Aztec Triple Alliance under the leadership of Hueyi Tlatoani [[Moctezuma II]]; In the series of events often referred to as "The Fall of the Aztec Empire". 

Subsequently the Spanish founded the new settlement of Mexico City on the site of the ruined Aztec capital.

panty peek:
When the legband or waistband of a pair of [[panties]] peeks out from beneath loose [[shorts]] or other clothing.

Do not use for [[pantyshot]]s. This tag is for when the legband or waistband of a pair of [[panties]] are visible, not the entire crotch.

If straps are visible above the waistline, use [[panty straps]] or [[whale tail (clothing)|]] instead.
frilled thighhighs:
[[Thighhighs]] with [[frills|frilled]] tops.

Don't confuse [[frilled thigh strap]]s (decorative frilled bands worn around the thigh) or [[lace-trimmed legwear]] for frilled thighhighs.
peeking out: Peeking around a corner, or more generally peeking out from behind any kind of object or person.
shiki eiki:
The "Highest Judge of Paradise", final boss and a playable character of [[Touhou]]'s [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]].

A "yama":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yama responsible for judging the souls of the dead, having the ability to identify good and evil. She is best known, however, for being quite moralistic and calling out other characters on their faults - more so (sometimes with physical punishment) upon her errant shinigami, [[Onozuka Komachi]]. Based on her illustration from "The Grimoire of Marisa", fanworks often comically depict her as rather petite and [[flat chest|flat-chested]] compared to her imposing, busty employee - something which angers Eiki - though a full-figured woman with long legs and [[zettai ryouiki]] is another depiction often used in fanart. Canon is inconsistent on which form is true, with some speculation that the child depiction is used as an alternate form for reasons unknown.

Yamaxanadu (ヤマザナドゥ) is her title (meaning "Yama of Paradise"), but has led fans to erroneously read her name as "Shikieiki Yamaxanadu". In actuality, her given name is Eiki and her surname is Shiki.
pigeon-toed:
Toes point inwards when [[standing]], [[sitting]], or [[walking]]. Pigeon toes are also called in-toeing,  often caused by genu valgum, or "knock-knee".

Knock-knee can be tagged as [[knees together feet apart]]. It's a medical condition that the knees are bent inwards causing the calves to be unaturally spaced out, while the thighs are closer.

So there may be overlap between the two tags, but not all knock-knees show pigeon toes, and not all pigeon toes show knock-knees.
medusa (fate): A catch-all tag for all versions of Medusa across the [[Fate (series)|Fate series]].
ear ornament:
Ear accessories that don't currently fit under the other {{ear*}} tags. Usually this is a smaller form of a hair, neck or arm accessory that is worn around the ear instead of their usual places.

[[Umamusume]] characters often feature these accessories as their "eardecs" feature prominently as part of their character designs (and to provide allusions to their real-world counterparts).
hands on own cheeks:
When a character has placed [b]both[/b] of their own hands upon their own cheeks. 

If the character has only one hand on one cheek, use [[hand_on_own_cheek]] instead.
If one character is placing their hands on someone else's cheeks, use [[hands_on_another's_cheeks]] instead.
coffee cup: See either [[coffee mug]] or [[disposable coffee cup]].
loose necktie:
When a [[necktie]] is tied but hangs loosely around a character's neck and/or shoulders.

When a tie is [[untied]] but still hanging around the wearer's neck, tag with [[undone necktie]] instead.
looking ahead: A character looking directly in front of themselves, and [b]not[/b] at the viewer. [[Looking ahead]] is relative to the [b]character’s[/b] front, not the viewer perspective. If they are [[looking at viewer]], use that instead.
untied:
Ambiguous tag. Use one of the following instead:

* [[Untied bikini]]
* [[Untied panties]]
* [[Untied ribbon]]
* [[Untied shoelaces]]
* [[Undone necktie]]
* [[Open bra]]
ramen:
A type of Japanese wheat-flour [[noodles|noodle]] popular in East Asian cuisine, derived from Chinese 'lamian' noodles.

The noodle soup dish of the same name is made by serving ramen noodles in beef or fish broth that is flavored with soy sauce or miso, and topped with a variety of items such as [[char-siu]], [[seaweed]], [[heimuer]], [[narutomaki]], [[softboiled egg]], [[chopped spring onion]] and [[kamaboko]]. There are different flavor distinctions for ramen, such as shio (salty), tonkotsu (pork bone), shoyuu (soy), hiyashi (chilled) and miso.
nightgown:
A nightgown, nightie or nightdress is a loosely hanging item of nightwear, today almost exclusively worn by women.

A nightgown may have any neckline, and may have sleeves of any type, or be sleeveless, and any shoulder strap or back style. The length of a nightgown may vary from hip-length to floor-length. A short nightgown can be called a "shortie" or a [[Babydoll]].
ship:
A ship is a large seagoing vessel, as opposed to a [[boat]] which more commonly refers to smaller vessels. 

This tag does [b]not[/b] include [[submarine]]s.
sakamata chloe:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "[[holoX]]". Designed by [[Parsley-F]].

Her general activities ended on January 26th, 2025, but she did not fully "graduate" and is still affiliated with Cover Corp, participating in future projects.

While canonically an [[orca girl]], she does not have enough orca-like features to be tagged as such on Danbooru.

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[grey hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[red eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She also has [[multiple piercings|multiple]] [[spike piercing|spike]] and hoop [[ear piercing]] and an [[earclip]].

Her regular hairstyle with her default costume is [[wavy hair]] with [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[center-flap bangs|center-flap]] [[braided bangs]], decorated with [[x hair ornament|crossing]] [[hairclip]]s. She also got an additional [[official alternate hairstyle]] for her default outfit consisting of [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]] with sidelocks, a [[side braid]] and additional hairclips.
hoshikawa sara:

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] and [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] [[orange eyes|orange]] and [[red eyes]].
clothes in mouth: A piece of clothing being [[mouth hold|held in the mouth]]. Usually a type of [[clothes lift]] where the clothing is [[lifting own clothes|lifted by the wearer]] and held in their mouth.
sakurai momoka:
An [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. She appeared in the Idolm@ster Cinderella Girls anime.

Momoka is a very elegant young 12 y.o. lady with a princess-like disposition, who acts very mature for her age. Her clothes tend to be very frilly and covered in flower motifs. She's from a wealthy upbringing.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Momoka is a mature girl who appears to have a lady-like aura about her. While she often tries to act older than she is, Momoka still is a young girl at heart and is susceptible to things girls her age enjoy. She was scouted by considering herself the prize in the Production Match Festival. She regularly holds tea parties with the younger idols, and takes them very seriously. Her favorite tea seems to be “Rose Hip Tea”, although she can occasionally be distracted from it via the antics of her guests.

Momoka found a friend in [[Umeki Otoha]], as they both shared a similar demeanor. She appears to enjoy teasing [[Kamiya Nao]], as she notes Nao chooses her clothes and costumes with the Producer in mind. Momoka also really likes the glasses [[Kamijo Haruna]] gave her, and enjoys selecting kimonos with friends. She holds the Producer in very high regard and shows that she will put herself on the line in order to show him that she cares about him.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Tachibana Arisu]], [[Ichinose Shiki]], [[Katagiri Sanae]], and [[Shiomi Syuko]].

Voiced by [[Terui Haruka]].
tentacles on male: Images depicting male characters restrained or engaging in sexual activity with [[tentacles]].

A technique in which different tones of color [b]or[/b] shades of grey are simulated using a pattern of dots that vary in size, shape or spacing. These can appear either by artistic choice, or as a consequence of reproduction.

If the dots are all equal in size, use [[Ben-Day dots]] instead.

[[Rex (xenoblade)|]]'s Blade in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]]. Known as [b]Hikari[/b] in Japanese. She is one of the personalities of the Aegis, along with [[Pyra (xenoblade)|]]. Unlike Pyra, she has an irritable, [[tsundere]] attitude.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[swept bangs]], [[yellow eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[chest jewel]]. kamishirasawa keine:
"The History Eater"

Stage 3 mid-boss and boss as well as Extra Stage mid-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]].

A were-hakutaku and schoolteacher with the ability to consume the history of [[Gensokyo]]'s Human Village to protect it from malicious youkai. Normally she has bluish-white hair and matching blue dress, except during a full moon when her hair becomes greenish-white, her dress turns green, and she grows horns. In this form, she can create and alter history.

Doujin works portray her as a [[teacher]] for some of the "child" characters in the series by whom she is feared for her punishment - a headbutt. She is also seen tutoring to [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] with predictable results. In canon, however, while she is a schoolteacher, she refuses to teach youkai. She is also a good friend to [[Fujiwara no Mokou]]. Many fans often pair her with [[Morichika Rinnosuke]] either as a childhood friend or a colleague due to their similar status as half-youkai.
sleeveless jacket: A [[jacket]] without sleeves. The easiest way to differentiate a sleeveless jacket from a [[vest]] is that the jacket comes with a collar and are often more protective against weather, vests also seldom come with a [[hood]] compared to sleeveless jackets. [[amano_hina_(tenki_no_ko)|Amano Hina]] is commonly depicted wearing a hooded, sleeveless jacket.
lowleg panties: [[panties|Panties]] whose usually thin sides are very low on the leg, even horizontal.
abuse: When one person improperly treats another in order to gain personal benefit. It comes in many forms such as physical, sexual, financial, and emotional. For Danbooru, the emphasis is usually on physical abuse. To qualify, one person must have caused [[injury]] to another, who has become distressed or [[scared|frightened]] as a result.
fountain:
An ornamental structure that shoots jets of [[water]] into the air.

See [[drinking fountain]] for the type of fixture that dispenses drinking water.
pirate hat: A hat commonly seen with the "skull and crossbones":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skull_and_crossbones insignia on the front. May or may not be worn by [[pirate]]s.
school hat:
A hat worn by Japanese kindergarten and elementary school students.

It's usually yellow and shaped like a [[pith helmet]] (example: post #32470) but different colors and designs may also be used (examples: post #677310 and post #433456).
pancake: Flatbread prepared from a sweet batter that is cooked on a hot griddle or in a [[frying pan]]. Also known as hotcakes.
balcony: A platform projecting from the wall of a building, typically above the ground floor, enclosed by a railing, balustrade, or parapet. It is supported by columns, brackets, or corbels, and accessed from a door or window.

traditional nun:
A traditional [[nun]]'s habit, specifically a traditional Christian style (Catholic, Orthodox, etc), as opposed to the fetishized, non-traditional nun habits typically seen in anime and fanart.

It consists at most of a [[long dress|long dress]] (that's black) with [[long sleeves]] and a [[guimpe]] (that's white), and typically stars the distinctive nun headdress (consisting of a [[wimple]]/[[coif]] [that's white], headwear bandeau [that's white], and [[veil]] [that's black], though it has become increasingly optional for some since the 20th century), and may also include a [[tabard]], underdress, and so on. The habit is typically white-on-black, with black the predominant color, but they can also be wholly white, or white-on-blue. Color can depend on the religious order which the nun is a part of (ex. Carmelites being white-on-brown). They can also be wholly black, which is the common choice for Orthodox nuns.

The traditional habit can be accentuated with minor additions, but not so much that it detracts from the basics (ex. [[Sister Claire]] and [[Double (skullgirls)|]] as opposed to [[Specter (arknights)|]] and [[Index (toaru majutsu no index)|]]), and some degree of modesty must be adhered to (ex. not too tight-fitting, no shortened dresses, no cutouts, no openings where they wouldn't normally be ala the chest area, no side slits which reveal skin or undergarment, no overtly sexual depictions of certain undergarments, etc).
throat bulge: Certainly a [[deepthroat]], but the penis has to be thick enough or in the right angle to push behind the trachea and form a visible [[bulge]] over the throat. Also depends much on artistic choice, but it's very unlikely to take the actual shape of a penis.

yagokoro eirin:
The "Brain of the Moon". Secondary final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]].

Lunarian pharmaceutical genius responsible for creating the Hourai Elixir that gave her good friend [[Houraisan Kaguya]] - and later Kaguya's bitter nemesis, [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] - immortality. She has since been Kaguya's bodyguard and caretaker in their mansion, Eientei. She is also the mentor of Kaguya's pet lunar rabbit, [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]], and by extension Reisen's charge, earth-born rabbit youkai [[Inaba Tewi]]. Owing to her expertise, she became [[Gensokyo]]'s chief pharmacist.

Due to her estimated age (well over 1000 years old and possibly one of the original Lunarians) and her relatively mature demeanor (compared to her charge), she is often included in the "Old Maids Alliance" with [[Yakumo Yukari]] and [[Yasaka Kanako]].

Most famous for the fans' rallying cry "Eirin! Eirin! [[Tasukete Eirin]]!" which, in fact, originated from Houraisan Kaguya.

On her hat is typically the [[red cross]] symbol. At the bottom of her dress are [[trigram|trigrams]] composing the [[bagua]]. She is frequently depicted with [[constellation|constellations]] sewn into her dress.

Her surname invokes the name of the Shinto god of intellect and wisdom, Yagokoro-no-Omoikane. This, combined with ZUN's comment about her being in "the higher order of gods", gave rise to the belief that she may in fact be Omoikane.

chen:
The "Black Cat of Bad Omens". Stage 2 midboss and boss, as well as Extra Stage midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]].

She is the [[cat girl|nekomata]] shikigami of [[Yakumo Ran]] (who is herself the shikigami of [[Yakumo Yukari]]). Despite her knowledge of black magic, Chen is rather weak by herself, only gaining a massive increase in power in the presence of her master. She is also weakened by water. Like Ran, Chen is actually the shikigami spirit possessing the nekomata, although she appears to have only a partial hold on her host and doesn't suppress the host's personality, resulting in Chen as a character being a symbiosis between the two.

Fanworks frequently portray her as a daughter figure to Ran, often exuding a level of cuteness that often gives her [[excessive nosebleed|epic nosebleeds]]. She is also considered an honorary member of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] in some fanwork circles. She appears to have befriended [[Kaenbyou Rin]] in [[Foul Detective Satori]], who has passed on her habit of finding and retrieving dead bodies.

rug: A movable [[floor]] covering of thick woven material or animal skin, typically not extending over the entire floor. Contrast with [[carpet]], which is not movable and covers the floor wall to wall.
gesugao:
An expression where a character is shown with a condescending, menacing, and sinister look. Often shown with an [[evil smile]], [[smirk]], or [[sneer]], giving them a sense of sheer disdain or superiority towards the viewer or other characters.

Usually used with a normal/nice character, to show an [[out of character]] moment. But can also applied to a character who canonically has such a face or using it to emphasize their evil side (particularity when said character is betraying the protagonist), so that the viewer would feel a sense of satisfaction when these character were defeated.

Might overlap with [[yandere]]. Although there's no need for  violence to be shown, only the expression.
puppet strings: The wires attached to a marionette and either a control bar or puppet rings, often used as a graphical metaphor of one person controlling another.

3koma: A three-panel [[comic]] strip in a continuous vertical or horizontal format, typically vertical.
mimic: A type of [[fantasy]] [[monster]] that lures unsuspecting victims to their doom by taking another appearance, most often a [[treasure chest]], but may take other forms as well.
battle axe: Any [[axe]] specifically designed for combat. Historical battle axes tend to have sharper, thinner and lighter heads than their wood-cutting counterparts, as they're designed to chop human limbs rather than tree limbs. [[huge weapon|Oversized]] fantasy examples also fall under this tag.
skirt around one leg: A [[skirt]] that has been partially removed and is wrapped around only one leg.
