amiya (arknights):
[i]Amiya, leader of Rhodes Island, will fight alongside you.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

The public face and one of the top executives of Rhodes Island. Although she appears to be a young and inexperienced girl, she is universally trusted and highly qualified for her position. She is the first person the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]] sees when they wake up from their cryosleep at the beginning of the story.

She appear to be a young girl between the ages of 14-15 years old, with [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[blue ascot]], [[miniskirt]] and Rhodes Island [[Jacket]] in her official character design.

Her ears are meant to resemble those of a [[rabbit ears|rabbit]]. However, due to the way those ears are drawn, many fans joke that "she looks like a donkey":[/pools/18086]. 

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].
ankh:
The ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic character that read "life". Egyptian gods are often portrayed carrying it by its loop, or bearing one in each hand, arms crossed over their chest.

For the [[Kamen Rider OOO (series)|Kamen Rider OOO]] character, see [[Ankh (OOO)]].
hagoromo:
A [b]hagoromo[/b] (羽衣, lit. "Feather Robe") is a long, thin [[shawl]] often associated with far-east celestial beings and deities.

Despite being thin, it is often depicted being able to remain upright in the air on its own. The cloth was modeled after ancient China's clothing called, [i]pi-bo[/i] (披帛).

Tales associated with the hagoromo include the Japanese legend of [i]tennin[/i] (spirtual beings who wear hagoromo) and some folkloric stories set in China, for example, [[Orihime (tanabata)|]] and [[Hikoboshi]].

Buddhist deities' hagoromo-like shawls are called "天衣" (Chinese: [i]tian yi[/i], Japanese: [i]tenne[/i], [i]ten'e[/i], or [i]ten'i[/i]). On Danbooru, tian yi should be tagged as hagoromo for convenience.
hakama:
Traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]], looking like either a [[pleated skirt]] ([[hakama skirt]]) or baggy, pleated [[pants]] ([[hakama pants]]). A traditional hakama has seven deep pleats, five in the front and two in the rear.

Hakama are split into a front and back section at the top, each of which have ties which are secured around the waist, often with visible [[hip vent]]s and usually covering the midriff. Hakama are worn over a [[kimono]].

Commonly worn both by [[samurai]], [[miko]] and [[kannushi]], practitioners of many martial arts including [[kyuudou]], and often by [[sumo]] wrestlers when appearing in public outside the ring.

Traditionally worn by men with either a [[kataginu]] sleeveless jacket/vest in an outfit known as [i]kamishimo[/i] (lit. upper & lower) or over a formal, long-sleeved [i]montsuki[/i] [[kimono]], with the family crest on it.  Sometimes a [[haori]] is worn over the latter.

Hakama are also commonly worn by both female college students and female teachers or professors at graduation ceremonies because during the late 19th and early 20th centuries they were the standard female school uniform until the introduction of the [[serafuku]]. Also during this time period they were a fashionable day to day outfit for young women, often paired with a kimono with a simple geometric or floral print. Women's hakama tend to be either solid color or with a graduated hue, and hakama meant for young women may be sparsely decorated with floral decorations, they are paired with a solid color kimono.
hakurei shrine:
The primary [[shrine]] of [[Gensokyo]] in [[Touhou]] and the personal residence of [[Hakurei Reimu]].

The Hakurei Shrine sits on the border between [[Gensokyo]] and the rest of Earth proper, existing on both sides as the anchor of the Great Hakurei Barrier and accessible from either side, though the Earth-side version is said to appear old and abandoned. Outside world items appear on the grounds from time to time, but no one knows how to consciously cross from one side to the other save for [[Yakumo Yukari]] and Reimu, the latter of whom will send outsiders home if asked.

[[Ibaraki Kasen]], [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Yakumo Yukari]], and Reimu's best friend [[Kirisame Marisa]] are frequent guests. The old turtle spirit [[Genjii (touhou)|]] and the Three Fairies of Light ([[Sunny Milk]], [[Luna Child]], and [[Star Sapphire]]) live in a spring and a tree behind the shrine, respectively. [[Mima (touhou)|]] once haunted the grounds, but has been absent from the games since the PC98 era and is only assumed to still be present. The inchling princess [[Sukuna Shinmyoumaru]] also lived at the shrine in a converted birdcage for a period of time. [[Clownpiece]] has taken up residence in the basement since the events of [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. Since becoming animate, [[Komano Aunn]] has taken it upon herself to be the shrine's guard dog. And others ([[Hinanawi Tenshi]], [[Yorigami Shion]], etc) have also taken up temporary residence over the years. The patron god of Hakurei Shrine is unknown, even to Reimu, though theories include Yukari, Mima, and [[Dragon God (Touhou)| the Great Dragon]].

nazi:
A post displaying Nazi imagery, symbols or characters being adherent to Nazism; such as use of the [[Nazi flag]], the [[Nazi war ensign]] or the [[reichsadler]] featuring a [[swastika]].

mordred (fate): Catchall tag for all versions of Mordred from the [[Fate (series)|]] series.
faulds:
Faulds are a type of plate armor.  They are bands of metal intended to protect the waist and hips, resembling a metal skirt, usually attached at the bottom of the cuirass and plackard.  

Faulds that extend to cover the upper thighs are also known as "tassets":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tassets.
m4 carbine:
The [B]M4 Carbine[/b] is an American 5.56mm NATO [[assault rifle]] introduced in 1994. It is based on the shorter and lighter version of the [[M16A2]]. 
This tag applies to all variants of the rifle, such as the M4 with SOPMOD II set of attachments, Mk 18 CQBR carbine with shorter upper receiver, and many more.

If you are seeing what appears to be M4-like rifle on images that takes place before the mid-1990s (i.e. during Vietnam War), the protruding barrel length is notably shorter in comparison with the forearm, or if the [[gun]] lacks more recent tactical features like Picatinny rails (post #6130843 for example) - then it is the [[Colt Commando]].
obiage:
A scarf-like length of cloth worn above the [[obi]] of a [[kimono]], worn by women. It's traditional to show more of the obiage the younger one is

* !post #7615686
taut shirt:
A [[shirt]] or other top that is so [[tight shirt|tight]] that the fabric hangs taut and ripples between the [[breasts]].

Not to be confused with [[tight shirt]] or [[impossible shirt]]. A [[tight shirt]] is a shirt that is very [[tight clothes]], but not [[skin tight]]. An [[impossible shirt]] is a shirt that is unrealistically [[skin tight]] all around the breasts. A [[taut shirt]] refers specifically to the fabric rippling effect often created by a [[tight shirt]].
stocks:
Planks that [[restrained|restrain]] only one's arms or legs.

For boards that restrain a person's body or head, use [[pillory]].

See [[stock chart]] for financial stocks.
panties on head:
Wearing [[panties]] on one's head like a [[hat]] or a [[mask]].

When a character wears the panties on their face rather than the top of the head, use [[panty mask]].
o-ring swimsuit:
A [[one-piece swimsuit]] with [[o-ring|o-ring(s)]] prominently displayed.

In the case of a [[bikini]], or other clothing with separate top and bottom, use [[o-ring_top]] and [[o-ring_bottom]] where need. If both are present, [[o-ring bikini]] should suffice.
purple sleeves: A pair of sleeves that are colored [[purple]]. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently colored from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).

A Rider-class Servant, first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Somewhat (in)famous for her [[revealing clothes]] consists of minimal armor plates [[breast curtains|just barely covering]] her [[no bra|bare breasts]] and exposed panties. As such, she is often given a [[black leotard]]-esque undershirt in some later official materials.

aqua necktie:

Kuroko is a Level 4 esper with the power to instantly teleport herself or items in her possession. Has an almost obsession-like crush on Mikoto, much to the latter's annoyance.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[bro
rigging: Equipment worn by the shipgirls of [[Kantai Collection]] or [[Azur Lane]] for example, usually strapped to their backs and limbs.
turtleneck dress: A [[dress]] that has a [[turtleneck]], post #5112780 is an example.
arm at side:
When one arm is at rest on its side of the body, while the other arm is doing something else such as being spread out, reaching out, on the hip, behind the head, and so on.

If [b]both[/b] arms are at rest on [b]both[/b] sides, use the plural [[arms at sides]] instead.
radio antenna: A metallic device used to receive radio signals.
train:
A connected series of vehicles for rail transport that move along a [[railroad tracks|track]] to transport cargo or passengers from one place to another place. There are a variety of different trains such as the bullet train (新幹線, [[shinkansen]]), [[Steam locomotive|steam locomotives]], [[Streetcar|trams]], and inter-city rail trains.

Do not use this tag if a train is only seen from the inside, use [[train interior]] instead.
cow:
A bovine, four-legged [[animal]] commonly used in agriculture and livestock.

Cows are female cattle and they commonly either lack or have smaller [[horns]] than their male counterparts. See [[bull]] for male cattle with horns.

Do not use for [[cow girl]]s, [[cow boy]]s, [[cow print]], or cow-themed images. Only use this tag for for actual cows.
monika (doki doki literature club):
Monika is one of the four main girls in [[Doki Doki Literature Club]]. She acts as president of the literature club. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[blazer]]-style [[school uniform]] with [[black thighhighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs]], and a [[white bow]] on her head.
milk carton: A carton that starts off as a square box, but then forms a triangle at the top that is easy to open. Very often used for drinking white [[milk]], [[chocolate milk]] and [[strawberry milk]] on the go.
print dress:
A [[dress]] that has printed patterns, shapes, or images on it.

Note that this does not automatically constitute a [[multicolored dress]]. A good example of both tags being incorporated is post #2337889, where the flower print is separate from the multicolored striped dress.
mandarin orange:
An orange-colored citrus fruit that is smaller than an [[orange (fruit)|]]. 

Popularly enjoyed in Japan during the wintertime, especially while sitting underneath a [[kotatsu]].
poking: The act of jabbing the index finger or a blunt object against a soft object, popularly used on fleshy parts of the skin such as the [[cheek poking|cheek]] and the [[breast poke|breast]].
school: An institution that provides learning spaces and learning environments for the teaching of students under the direction of [[teacher]]s.
whistle:
A small, simple wind instrument that can be blown into to produce sound. They have various applications with [[police]], sporting events, music, and hunting.

Not to be confused with the [[whistling]] verb.
flower-shaped pupils: Use when a character's pupils are shaped like a [[flower symbol|flower]]. Not to be confused with [[flower in eye]], where the flower pattern covers the iris of the eye.
mecha musume:
The anthropomorphization of hardware of all kinds (mecha) as cute girls (musume). Popular for military hardware, but also cars, trains, videogame consoles etc. Closely related to the [[OS-tan]] phenomenon.

For [[Shimada Fumikane]]'s "Mecha Musume in the narrower sense", use [[Konami Mecha Musume]] tag. (See also "its Japanese Wikipedia page":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%A1%E3%82%AB%E5%A8%98].)
shorts around one leg: Used when a character has a pair of [[shorts]] partially removed and wrapped around only one leg.
cheek squash: When a character's cheeks are squeezed together at the lips, either by the character pressing their own cheeks or someone else doing it. Not to be confused with [[cheek press]].
yoko littner:
One of the heroines of [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]].

She wields an [[anti-materiel rifle]] in battle and is most noticeable for her taste in skimpy attire, wearing a tiny [[bikini top only|bikini top]] and [[short shorts]].  

She has a character music video, [[Pieces of Sweet Stars]].

Voiced by [[Inoue Marina]].
tail ring: A [[ring]] that is affixed to a character's [[tail]], or similarly a small [[halo]] that is floating around the tail's tip.
lower teeth only: When only the lower [[teeth]] are drawn in the mouth.
spiked armlet: An [[armlet]] with one or more [[spikes]] attached.
squirrel tail: Use this tag when a character has a [[tail]] of a [[squirrel]].
wooden wall: A wall that is comprised of wooden planks placed next to each other.
jiangshi costume: For when a character who isn't a [[jiangshi]] is wearing the clothes of one: [[ofuda]], [[qingdai guanmao]], and sometimes a [[china dress]].
pink theme: An image where pink is the dominant color. For example, a [[monochrome]] image that is pink, or an image with an overall pink color theme.
uchiwa:
Originally from China, the uchiwa is a round or oval [[hand fan]] made of paper or silk pasted over a framework of thin bamboo strips.

With [[hand fan writing|a message written on it]], it is sometimes used in [[oshi-katsu]] as a lightweight placard.

Not to be confused with [[tuanshan]], another type of round hand fan.
kaga (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Kaga[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[side ponytail]], [[tsurime]] [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a black [[muneate]] over a [[white kimono]] top and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], blue [[tasuki]], brown [[apron]] based on the stern end of her flight deck, with the kana "カ" inscribed on it, [[black thighhighs]], and [[platform footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is very similar to [[akagi (kancolle)|Akagi's]] (and, by extension, all of Shibafu's carriers') own gear: a traditional [[yumi (bow)|yumi bow]], a [[quiver]] with a replica of the ship's mast, her full flight deck attached as a [[shield]] on her left arm and carrier-like [[geta]]. 

She has a stoic personality. In fan works, she is often paired with [[Akagi (kancolle)|]] or [[Zuikaku (Kancolle)|]]. She is sometimes portrayed as having high body temperature or being warm to the touch, due to the fact that the [i]Kaga[/i] was a converted battleship and was prone to overheating due to poor ventilation.

The historical [i]Kaga[/i] was originally designed as a battleship before being converted into a carrier. She was scuttled after being heavily damaged at the [[Battle of Midway]] in 1942.
cushion: As opposed to a [[pillow]], a cushion's use is not limited for sleeping but can be found on [[bed|beds]], [[couch|couches]], [[chair|chairs]], floors etc. Can be for decoration or comfort.
clothes around waist: Any article of long-sleeved clothing tied around a character's waist.
rimless eyewear: Eyewear ([[glasses]], [[monocle]] or [[sunglasses]]) that have no rims around the lenses. Sometimes eyewear will have a thin outline tracing the outside of the lens. Unless the outline is exceptionally thick and distinctly colored, [b]rimless eyewear[/b] may still apply to these.

Being a dog girl she has [[extra ears|both]] human and [[dog ears]] and a [[dog tail]], her upper lip is shaped like a [[:3|dog mouth]] and has [[fangs]]. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]. Her usual hairstyle consists of [[low twin braids]] and a [[bone hair ornament|bone-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. Her second, and specially her third costume reveal that she has surprisingly [[large breasts]] that where somewhat hidden by her regular attire.
scoop neck: A type of neckline that is wide and deeply rounded. A scoop neck top exposes most of the upper chest, but doesn't expose the shoulders and doesn't dip below the breasts.
barbara (genshin impact): A playable Hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]]; her full name is Barbara Pegg. [quote]"The Deaconess of the Favonius Church and a shining starlet adored by all. Although the concept of a starlet is rather novel in a city of bards, the people of Mondstadt love Barbara nonetheless."[/quote] Barbara has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], styled into [[twin drills]]. She wears a [[white dress]] with a [[detached collar]], as well as [[detached sleeves|detached]], [[puffy long sleeves|puffy sleeves]]. For legwear, she wears [[white pantyhose]] and [[fold-over boots]]. Her older sister is [[Jean (Genshin Impact)|Jean]], the Acting Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius. She is voiced by [[Kitou Akari]] (Japanese) and [[Laura Stahl]] (English).
colored tips:
A type of [[multicolored hair]] where the hair is abruptly colored differently at the very ends. The style is known as [i]dip dye[/i] or [i]tip dyeing[/i].

Not to be confused with [[gradient hair]], where the color change is gradual rather than sudden.
letter: A longish note commonly written on folded paper.
chaps:
Chaps are a type of protective overpants originating as cowboy workwear. Their purpose is to protect the user's legs and trousers from damage. They are usually made out of leather or similarly durable material.

Chaps are generally made up of a belt and two individual leg coverings held up by the belt. They lack both a crotch and a seat---i.e., the leg coverings are not connected to each other.
torch:
A rod-shaped object, bearing fire, used for illumination.  Usually the end is soaked or wrapped in flammable material like pitch or oil-soaked rags to act as the fuel source, though some wooden torches are depicted as burning the wood itself (a difficult and bad idea in real life).

English speakers outside of North America use this word to mean a [[flashlight]].  Please use that tag instead of this one for electric, handheld lights to avoid ambiguity.
arlecchino (genshin impact):
A playable Pyro character in [[Genshin Impact]]. Also known by the codename "The Knave", she is the fourth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers. She runs an orphanage known as the House of the Hearth.

Her real name is [[Peruere (genshin impact)|]]. Her signature weapon is [[Crimson Moon's Semblance (Genshin Impact)|]].

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, she is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].
holding box:
Someone is [[holding]] a [[box]]. This can include boxes in a variety of shapes, sizes and types such as a [[heart-shaped box]], a [[tissue box]], or a [[ring box]] just to name a few.

For a boxed present however, use [[holding gift]] instead.
wrestling ring:
A square-shaped, raised platform covered in canvas and surrounded on each side  by three taut [[rope]]s, in which professional [[wrestling]] matches are staged.  Distinguished from a [[boxing ring]] in that most boxing rings have a fourth rope.

Sizes can vary, but most wrestling rings are between 18-20 feet (approximately 5.5-6 meters) along each side.

Character from the series [[overlord_(maruyama)|Overlord by Maruyama]]. Overseer of the floor guardians protecting the Great Tomb of Nazarick.

Albedo is a [[demon girl]] in a [[white dress|white]] [[off-shoulder dress]] and [[white gloves]] with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[hair between eyes]], [[low horns|low]] [[white horns|white]] [[demon horns]] and [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings]]. She is in love with [[Ainz Ooal Gown]] and absolutely loyal, but also absolutely evil.
pointy breasts: [[Breasts]] that point and jut forward, with a slight conical/tapered shape. Can either be perky or saggy.
drinking pee: The act, and to an extension, a fetish that involves person [[drinking]] [[pee]], either of themselves or the others.

A [[sword]] that is [[glowing]].

multicolored fur: [[Body fur]] comprised of more than one color.
handprint: The typical shape left by a hand upon contact with a surface.
suspender shorts: A pair of [[shorts]] that have [[suspenders|suspender straps]] attached to the belt area.
fisheye:
A type of camera lens that takes photos in a distinct, distorted appearance, wherein straight lines appear increasingly curved the farther they are from the center of the image.  Use this tag for pictures that simulate this effect.

For the [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] character, see [[fish eye (sailor moon)]].
blunt ends: A hairstyle where the tips of a character's hair are cut in a sharp straight line, Not to be confused with [[blunt bangs]], although they are sometimes seen together.
heart-shaped chocolate:
A piece of [[chocolate]] in the shape of a [[heart]], often reserved for [[Valentine]]'s Day.

Don't use this tag if you only see a [[heart-shaped box]], but you're not able to actually see its contents. It's only an assumption that it could contain a chocolate heart, but it could also contain anything such as a [[box of chocolates]], [[candy]], or another present.
mechanical eye: An [[artificial eye]] that is cybernetic or mechanical in nature.

Her outfit consists of a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[china dress]] with a [[back cutout]], a [[side slit]] a [[pelvic curtain]] and a [[dragon print|dragon]] [[print dress|print]], a [[grey coat|grey]] [[vertical-striped coat]] with [[pinstripe pattern]], [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[pumps]].

diamond button:
One or multiple [[buttons]] in the shape of a [[diamond (shape)|]] (♢).

Most commonly associated with [[Komeiji Koishi]].
mouth drool: When [[drooling]] is represented as a dip in the outline of the mouth, rather than as actual [[saliva]] leaking from the mouth.
light bulb:
A light bulb is a device that produces light from electricity when turned on. Light bulbs are often used to bring light to a space or to indicate when an electronic device is on.

In many works of fiction, a light bulb is sometimes used to indicate that a character just thought up a bright [[idea]].
holding removed eyewear: Use this tag if the person's eyewear is [[unworn eyewear|removed]] from their usual place and carried in the hands. If it still rests on the bridge of the nose or head, see [[adjusting eyewear]] and its related tags.
fireplace: The part of a [[chimney]] that opens into a room and in which fuel is burned.
serious: A character with a serious or solemn demeanor or expression. Usually appears less relaxed than [[expressionless]], or provided with context such as an impending battle or someone's death.
ball and chain restraint: A restraint consisting of a [[cuffs|cuff]] fastened by a chain to a heavy ball-shaped weight.  Depending on how heavy the weight is, this may be intended to prevent a person from moving or simply weigh them down and slow down their ability to escape.
fuck-me shirt: A [[shirt]] with the [[profanity|profane]] expression "Fuck me." There are variations of the phrase, but the general gist indicates the wearer is crudely expressing a desire for [[sex]].
spine:
The [b]spine[/b] is the common name for the human vertebral column, one of the major components of the [[skeleton]].

Not to be confused with [b][[spines]][/b], the sharp protrusions found in various animals.
light:
Ambiguous tag. Please tag the specific kind of light, or light source, instead.

For objects that aren't normally illuminated, see [[glowing]].
livestream: The act of broadcasting video of oneself to an audience in real time.
sports car:
A type of [[car]] designed around dynamic performance and highlighting the fun of driving.

The highest performance and most expensive sports cars are often referred to as supercars or hypercars.
leopard tail: Use when a character has a [[tail]] of a [[leopard]].
leopard ears: Characters who have [[animal ears]] based off of a [[leopard]].
mole above mouth: A {{mole}} placed above one's mouth, whether it's left or right.
multicolored dress: When a [[dress]] has at least two or more colors present. See [[multicolored clothes]] for guidelines on what is considered multicolored.
head chain:
A type of [[jewelry]] that encircles the head like a [[headband]], but much thinner and looser. Usually made from chains of precious metal and/or decorated with gemstones.

Not to be confused with [[chain headband]] or [[chain hairband]] which are made out of more thick steel instead of gold.
gradient sky:
A sky with a smooth [[gradient]] between different colors.

This tag implicates [[sky]]. Don't use it for posts where the sky isn't a significant part of the image (forum #162192).
winged helmet: A helmet that is adorned with wings on both sides. It's seen in ancient depictions of the greek god Mercury. however in the 19th century, the winged helmet became widely used to depict Vikings and Norse gods.
kazama iroha:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "[[holoX]]". A [[samurai]] from a distant land who joined the holoX secret organization and served as a hitman and bodyguard. Designed by [[Umibouzu (niito)|]].

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium]]/[[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]], although more often than not fanart exaggerates her bust size, giving her [[medium breasts]] (at the very least).

Her default hairstyle with her default outfit is a [[ponytail]] held with a [[multicolored bow|multicolored]] [[hair bow]], an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] held with a [[black hairband]].
leaf on head: When a [[leaf]] is on a character's head. Often associated with [[fox|foxes]] and [[tanuki]].
cowboy boots: [[Boots]] popularly associated with the [[Cowboy western]] genre, since they are a type of equestrian footwear. They are generally made out of cowhide leather, have rounded or pointed toes, high shafts, and generally no lacing.
globe: A scale-model representation of the planet Earth. It usually has a stand to simulate the Earth's tilt and let it freely spin. It can be considered a type of [[map]].
takagi-san:
Title protagonist of [[Karakai Jouzu no Takagi-san]]. She is a middle school student in Class 1-2 and a blunt girl who likes teasing her classmate, [[Nishikata]]. Easily recognized for her [[brown hair|brown]], [[medium hair]] and [[parted bangs]] that reveal her prominent [[forehead]].

She wears a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[white shirt]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts|s
tape bondage: Image in which a character is bound or restrained by [[tape]].
monster energy:
Monster Energy is an energy drink, launched by Hansen Natural in 2002. The regular flavor comes in a black can with a green tear-shaped M logo, implied to have been torn by the claws of a "monster".

Various other flavors have been introduced over the years: an orange variant and blue, dubbed "Absolute Zero", a sugar-free variant, to name a few.
barbell: A barbell is a piece of exercise equipment used in weight training, weightlifting and powerlifting. These range in length from 4-8 feet.
police car: A police car is a [[car]] utilized by [[police]] officers to patrol and respond to several incidents.
green rose:
A type of [[rose]] that does not occur in nature. Symbolism for this flower is not widely identified but could be associated with common themes for green, such as fertility and jealousy.

Most bred variety of green roses only feature a slight green tint to their flower color, this is due to having chlorophyll in the petals.  Rosa chinensis 'Viridiflora' also known as the "green rose" is a case where the due to mutation the petals of the rose have been replaced with leafs.
feather-trimmed sleeves: Sleeves that have a [[feather trim]] at the base.
supermarket: An establishment that purchases food from different suppliers across the world, then makes it available for local people to shop for [[groceries]].
monster boy:
Half-human, half-monster boys. Though they can take on similar species to that of [[monster girl]]s.

* [[Dragon Boy]]
* [[Fish boy]] 
* [[Lizardman]]
* [[Minotaur]]
* [[Satyr]]

* [[Arthropod Boy]]
* [[Octopus Boy]] (for male [[scylla]]s)
* [[Plant Boy]]
* [[Slime Boy]]
* [[Lamia Boy]] 

(Keep in min
military jacket:
A [[jacket]] which is a part of the [[military uniform]] or any jackets modelled after one. It comes in various designs, for combat use or not. 

h1. See also
* [[bomber jacket]]
* [[Eisenhower jacket]]
* [[military fatigues]]
* [[Gorka]]
* [[insignia]]
* [[tactical clothes]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
kote:
[i]Kote[/i] are Japanese arm & [[shoulder armor]], a form of armored sleeve usually covering from the forearms all the way to the shoulder.  They are typically made by stitching many small plates into a padded sleeve.

[i]Kote[/i] that only cover the forearms are called [i]han kote[/i], and are also covered by this tag.

[i][[Kurokote]][/i] are a subtype of [i]kote[/i], usually made from black iron plates, which give them their color and name.
pant suit:
This tag is used for any [b]female[/b] character wearing a [[suit]] with [[pants]].

For [[suit jacket|suits]] that are clearly depicted with [[skirt]]s, use [[skirt suit]] instead.
sailor jupiter: Sailor Jupiter is one of the [[Inner Senshi]] from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She is able to manipulate electricity and uses some plant-based powers. Her civilian name is [[Kino Makoto]].
high-waist pantyhose: [[Pantyhose]] with a high waistline, from around navel height to just below the breasts.
sheep ears: [[Animal ears]] on a human character resembling those of a [[sheep]].
chest of drawers:
Also called a dresser, it's a piece of furniture that has [[drawer]]s for storing clothes. May sometimes have a [[mirror]].

For dressing table, see [[vanity table]].
orange headwear: This tag has been deprecated for being too broad. Use a more specific tag like [[orange hat]], [[orange hairband]], etc.
orange hairband: A [[hairband]] that is orange in color.
striped sleeves:
A set of shirt sleeves, [[detached sleeves]] that have [[striped|stripes]] running along them. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently patterned from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).

For [[arm warmers]], use [[striped arm warmers]] instead.
hinanawi tenshi:
The "Girl of the Highest Heaven". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody]][/i] and later a recurring playable character. A spoiled formerly-human celestial with the ability to manipulate land and weather, motivated by boredom to cause chaos. The official profile states that she was called Chiko (地子) at the time when she was human, and thus used to refer to her younger-self in fanworks.

She carries a weapon called the [[Sword of Hisou]], a tool which can be only used by celestials. She is frequently seen with her [[kaname-ishi]]s, a kind of [[floating rock]] with a [[shimenawa]] and [[shide]].

Her notable nickname is "Tenko" (てんこ; an alternate reading of her name). Many fans portray her as a [[masochism|masochist]], based on her dialogue in SWR demanding "punishment for her deeds" (though in canon this is due to her wanting a good fight), often landing her on the receiving end of other girls' wrath, especially the [[sadism|sadistic]] [[Kazami Yuuka]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[red eyes]] and usually [[flat chest|doesn't have a large chest]]. Her [[hat]] is [[black hat|black]] with a [[peach hat ornament|peach]] and a [[leaf hat ornament|leaf]] on it. She wears a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[center frills]] and [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[red bowtie]] with a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[blue skirt]]. Sometimes she is drawn with a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]] decorated with a [[rainbow gradient]] rope, and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[boots]].
squirrel ears: Use when a character has ears of a [[squirrel]].
eraser: An object, typically a piece of soft rubber or plastic, used to rub out writing.
flat cap:
A style of soft [[hat]] with a short brim and a flattened crown.

* !post #2518389
* !post #2552372

Flat caps share similarities with many other types of hat. Check the following examples for different kinds of hats:

* !post #7407209: [[Baseball cap]]
* !post #3409817: [[Beret]]
* !post #6135580: [[Newsboy cap]]

* !post #5108309: [[Donald Duck sailor hat]]
* !post #7591661: [[Peaked cap]]
* !post #5084963: [[Tam o' shanter]]
notebook:
A [[book]] of blank pages, used for writing, drawing, or taking notes. They are available in a variety of sizes and bindings, with spiral binding being especially common. Many notebooks feature perforated pages that are easier to tear out.

For notebook computers, see [[laptop]].
spatula: A flat kitchen utensil used for flipping in cooking, transferring food products from one tray/plate to another, or scraping food off a pan or bowl. A spatula can also refer to a flat rubber utensil for spreading frosting over dessert foods.
menu:
One or more sheets of paper, which may be laminated in plastic, which outline a [[restaurant]]'s food items and their prices that patrons can order from. Not to be confused with a [[menu board]].

For menu in a software, see [[user interface]].
diaper: A piece of cloth or other absorbent material folded and worn as underpants by a [[baby]] not yet toilet-trained. Posts can be tagged with [[adult_baby]] when the character is adult and ageplaying.
stasis tank:
A liquid-filled [[container]] (usually a [[tube]] or a tank) with [[transparent]] walls. Possible uses include keeping living organisms in [b]stasis[/b], accelerating growth or development after undergoing a [[clone|cloning]] process, or even post-injury healing and recovery.

An archetypal stasis tank design can be seen in post #607235. [[Science fiction]] commonly depicts people floating in these tanks, such as shown in post #80217. 

(Note that this tag can apply to a wide variety of containers/vats/tanks, as long as have a description and function similar to what is outlined above.)
kal'tsit (arknights):
[i]Rhodes Island Medical Department Officer-in-Charge, Kal'tsit.[/i]

A playable Medic Operator character in [[Arknights]].
squat toilet:
A toilet used by [[squatting]], rather than [[sitting]].

Also known by a wide variety of regional names. For example it's called 和式便所 or 和式便器 (lit. Japanese style toilet) in Japanese.
unworn socks: [[Socks]] that are present but not being worn.
black garter belt: A [[garter belt]] that is colored black.
chainsaw:
A portable mechanical, motorized [[saw]]. It is used to fell [[tree]]s and remove [[branch]]es and foliage. It's frequently seen as a weapon in horror films, often inflicting extremely bloody wounds and severing limbs.

A few characters use this as their weapon of choice, namely [[Leatherface]], [[Haruna (korezom)|]], [[Blaze (Arknights)]], [[Juliet Starling]] and [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]].
doll: A doll is a small representation of a human or humanoid figure, designed for interactive play and display. Dolls can be crafted from a variety of materials, including both hard substances like plastic and wood, and soft materials such as cloth and rubber.
sushi: Sushi is a Japanese dish of cooked and seasoned [[rice]] served with a variety of other ingredients, which usually includes [[fish]].
legendary pokemon:
A group of incredibly rare and often very powerful [[pokemon|Pokémon]]. Whenever they are available in the games, there is usually only one per game.

See also [[mythical_pokemon|Mythical Pokémon]].
one-piece swimsuit pull:
When the top straps of a [[one-piece swimsuit]] are pulled down from the shoulders to reveal part or all of the chest area.

See [[swimsuit aside]] for when the swimsuit is pulled aside from the crotch. See [[adjusting swimsuit]] for when a swimsuit is adjusted or tugged without the top being pulled down. See [[bikini pull]] for when part of a bikini is pulled down.
briefs:
Used to describe [[male underwear]]. They are short and in a tight Y-shape. They most commonly come in [[white male underwear|white]].

[[Boxer briefs]] are long in the leg, like boxer shorts, but tighter-fitting. Such underwear shall be classified as briefs and share briefs tags.
anchor hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like an [[anchor]].
pink one-piece swimsuit: A [[one-piece swimsuit]] that is colored pink.
envelope: A common packaging item for mailing [[letter|letters]] and documents, either through a mailing service or from a sender directly to a receiver.
penis shadow:
A shadow cast by a [[penis]] (or [[phallic_symbol|something shaped like a penis]]), usually on a character's face.

This tag applies even when the real [[penis]] is not exposed. If the penis is visible, add the [[penis]] tag.

If the object casting the penis-shaped shadow is actually something innocuous, add the [[phallic symbol]] tag as well.

Not to be confused with [[invisible penis]], which is when the penis itself is drawn as a shadowy shape.
ear bow: A [[bow]] tied around the ear, usually [[animal ears]].
gaming chair: A [[chair]] made for gaming. Similar to an [[office chair]], but is usually taller, with a headrest, and has a very distinctive shape of its own (post #4320722, post #4290295).
kimono lift: Lifting up a person's [[kimono]], usually with the intent to show off either their [[underwear]] or their [[no panties|bare crotch]] or [[ass|butt]].
laurel crown: A [[head wreath]] made of branches or leaves of the laurel plant. Laurel crowns are frequently associated with ancient Greece.
drill sidelocks:
[[Drill hair]] present as [[sidelocks]].

Not to be confused with [[side drill]].
patchwork skin:
For when a character has skin that has been stitched together in multiple places, possibly from multiple sources.

If the skin patches are differently colored, [[multicolored skin]] may apply as well.
string: A long flexible structure made from fibers twisted together into a single strand.
two-handed handjob: A single [[handjob]] performed on a single [[penis]] using two hands. Not to be confused with [[double handjob]], which is two separate handjobs performed simultaneously.
golden shower: The act of being [[peeing|peed]] on by one or more other people.
bea (pokemon):
[b]Bea[/b], known as [b]Saitou[/b] (サイトウ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon swsh|Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Gym Leader is a karate prodigy from Galar who is highly disciplined and trains daily. She also loves sweets, but she likes to keep that a secret [tn](official bio)[/tn].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[hair between eyes|long bangs]]. She wears a [[black hairband|black]] [[bow hairband|hairband]], a [[black bodysuit|bodysuit]] [[bodysuit under clothes|under]] a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[print shirt|shirt]] and [[side slit shorts|side slit]] [[print shorts|shorts]], a [[dynamax band|wristband]], [[single glove|a]] [[partially fingerless gloves|glove]], [[knee pads]], and is [[barefoot]].
mittens: A covering for the hand that encases the thumb separately and the four fingers together. For danbooru's purpose they're not considered [[gloves]].
milky way: A band of [[star (sky)|stars]] across the [[night sky]], part of the galactic disk seen edge-on. It is actually our own galaxy.
rolling suitcase: A [[suitcase]] that has wheels on the bottom and commonly an elongating handle that makes it easier to roll heavier suitcases on the ground.
adjusting clothes: When a character is fixing any article of clothing that they're wearing so they feel more comfortable.
hand on glass: A character is resting at least one hand on a pane of glass, regardless if the view is from the outside or the inside.
fujiwara chika:
One of the main characters of [[Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai ~Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen~]]. She is an air-headed and energetic daughter of a politician and a member of a student council. She often exploited her family connection to get away from breaking various school rules in favor of herself and her friends.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She usually wears a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] and the [[Shuuchiin Academy School Uniform]].

[[Chikattochikachika (kaguya-sama wa kokurasetai)|]] Outfit: [[red headwear|red]] [[newsboy cap]] and [[magnifying glass]].

She is voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]] in the anime.
latin cross:
A [[cross]] where the descending arm is longer than the other three arms. It is the most common form of [[christianity|Christian]] cross.

h1. See also
* [[Celtic cross]]
* [[crucifix]]
* [[inverted cross]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]
high-waist shorts: [[Shorts]] with a high waistline, from around navel height to just below the breasts.
stained clothes:
A tag for general clothes [[stain]]ed (darkened or colored) usually due to some sort of liquid (ex: wine, [[precum]], paint, etc.)

Clothes stained by not separating light and colored clothes in the [[washing machine]] also count.

For clothes that are darkened/made [[see-through clothes|see-through]] due to [[sweat]], use [[sweaty clothes]] instead.
arm around shoulder: Wrapping one arm around another's shoulder.
remote control:
A small, handheld device that controls some sort of electronic appliance from a distance. Typically the remote is wireless and paired with a television, DVD player, CD player or other audio/visual system. Some air conditioners may be operated by remote.

For Danbooru purposes this tag tends not to be applied to wireless game controllers or computer mice/keyboards.
double w: Making a [[w]] sign with both hands.
bustier:
A firm-fitting undergarment, usually worn as [[lingerie]], designed to push up the [[breasts]]. A bustier resembles a [[bra]], but longer, extending beneath the breasts to cover part of the waist and stomach. The length may vary, but a bustier usually ends above the [[navel]].

The difference between a bustier and a [[corset]] is that a corset has laces or buttons in front, is usually longer and made of stronger material, usually doesn't cup the breasts, and is usually is tighter around the waist. A bustier is usually shorter (above the navel), usually cups the breasts, and is designed mainly to hold up the breasts, not to hold in the waist.

In addition, a bustier should not be confused with an [[underbust]], which denotes attire worn below—and not on—the breasts.
budget sarashi:
A [[sarashi]] that is too small to adequately cover the torso, resulting in the character's chest/breasts or midriff being exposed.

To qualify for this tag, the sarashi wrappings should be reasonably secured tightly on the torso; in other words, it shouldn't be too loosened or mostly unwrapped, otherwise it is an [[undone sarashi]] instead.

For female characters, a budget sarashi often takes on the form of very narrow bands of cloth wrapped around the torso that minimally covers their breasts, often resulting in hefty exposure of [[cleavage]] and [[underboob]] (ie. post #4901661).
money gesture:
A Japanese hand gesture that indicates money.  It is similar to the [[OK sign]] with the thumb and index finger forming a loop, the shape of a coin.  

While the money sign can be done in the same manner as the [[OK sign]], for tagging purposes this tag should be used where the palm is horizontal as opposed to vertical and/or the looped thumb and finger are toward the viewer as opposed to toward the person performing the gesture.
meer campbell: [[Gundam Seed Destiny]] character. She looks exactly like [[Lacus Clyne]], except that she wears a [[star hair ornament|star-shaped hairclip]] and has larger breasts.
hot:
When a character is affected by hot temperatures.

Not to be used to subjectively indicate that a person is attractive. For the taste also called "hot", see [[spicy]].
severed limb:
Tag applicable when severed limbs (limbs detached from the rest of the body) are visible in an image. 

For characters who are missing limbs, see [[amputee]]. The two may be used in conjunction if both the amputee and the limbs that have been removed are visible in the image.
mars symbol:
The ♂ symbol.

The symbol used for three major representations:

* the planet [[Mars (planet)|]]
* alchemic symbol for iron
* the male gender (usage commonly indicates an [[otoko no ko]] character or [[yaoi]] works.)
cbt: Cock and ball torture (CBT) is a masochistic sexual fetish that involves inflicting pain on the male [[penis]] or [[testicles]]. This includes [[crotch kick]]ing, [[ball busting]], and other painful activities.
peach:
A soft-skinned [[fruit]] with a yellowish-orange outside and yellow or whitish flesh. This fruit is a popular theme to use in drawings.

For the Mario character, see [[Princess Peach]].
For the Precure character, see [[Cure Peach]].
cloud strife:
The [[spiked_hair|spikey-haired]] primary protagonist of [[Final Fantasy VII]]. An ex-S.O.L.D.I.E.R operative, now part of a rag-tag band of resistance known as Avalanche.

Also a supporting character in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series, a fighter in [[Super Smash Bros.]], and a hidden character in [[Final Fantasy Tactics]]. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] and Cody Christian in Japanese and English.
red cross:
A + sign colored red, commonly used as the Red Cross logo and seen on [[nurse cap]]s.

Not to be confused with [[star of life]], which is a six-pointed star.
brown sweater vest: A [[sweater vest]] that is colored brown.
real world location:
An image set in a known location in the real world.

The location could be a well-known building or landmark, or it could be an ordinary street or building with a known location.

The location should be depicted fairly accurately, so a fictionalized location with a well-known building or landmark in the background does not count. [[photo (medium)|Photos]] and [[photo background]]s also do not qualify.

Where known, please leave a comment providing some kind of location information (a Google maps link, latitude/longitude, etc). Famous buildings and landmarks should be given a tag.
drawing tablet:
On Danbooru this will typically refer to a flat, rectangular surface used as a tactile interface to a computer-based drawing program. Often this is used in conjunction with a [[stylus]], to better approximate the handling of a real-life pen, pencil or brush. 

For the computers that incorporates a built in touchscreen see the [[tablet pc]] tag. Not to be confused with a [[stone tablet]].

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graphics_tablet]
chestnut mouth: A mouth shaped like a [[chestnut]]: pointed up at the top and rounded at the bottom or pointed down at the bottom and rounded at the top. Often includes [[round teeth|round]] [[upper teeth only|upper teeth]]. Similar to a rounded [[triangle mouth]].
happy birthday: Use this tag when the greeting "Happy [[Birthday]]" is mentioned within the image.
wa maid:
A traditional Japanese [[maid]]. It usually means a [[yukata]] or a relatively simple [[kimono]] with a [[maid apron]] and an optional [[maid headdress]]. A classic example is [[Tsukihime]]'s [[Kohaku (tsukihime)|]].

If a Western maid outfit is also present in the image, tag [[mixed maids]].
whisk: A mixing utensil made of stiff wire loops fixed to a handle; used for whipping [[egg|eggs]] or [[cream]]. Typically used in a [[mixing bowl]] to form a [[batter]]. If a character is in the middle of using a whisk, add the [[whisking]] tag as well.
egg hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] that represents an [[egg]] in one of several ways. Either it can be a whole egg (post #2166040) or a cooked egg, particularly seen with [[Araragi Karen]] and [[Araragi Tsukihi]] from [[Nisemonogatari]].
red oni:
An [[oni]] with [[red skin]], or occasionally with some other form of red color scheme. Often depicted alongside a [[blue oni]], typically with humorously contrasting personalities. In such cases, the red oni tends to be more hot-blooded, while the blue oni tends to be cooler and more cynical.

For the [[Smile Precure!]] character, see [[Akaooni]].
natsuiro matsuri:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[1st generation (hololive)|]], designed by [[Minamura Haruki]]. 

She has [[blue eyes|blue]], [[aqua eyes|aqua]] or (rarely) [[green eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] which she usually keeps in a [[side ponytail]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]] and a [[cat hair ornament]], hair reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]] and an [[ahoge]].
vastaya: The Vastaya are a race in [[League of Legends]].  They are chimeric creatures of Runeterra whose lineage contains both human blood and the spiritual magic of a pre-human race. From the ferocious, bestial power of [[Rengar]] to the foxlike allure of [[Ahri (league of legends)|]], vastaya can look considerably different from one another, but they all share animal and human characteristics.
bat print: Clothing, usually [[pantyhose]] or [[thighhighs]], that has [[bat (animal)|bats]] printed on them. Especially prominent on [[Morrigan Aensland]], [[Lilith (darkstalkers)|]], and [[regina (dokidoki! precure)|Regina]].
claw ring:
A [[ring]] that resembles an animal [[claws|claw]]. Although it's called a [[ring]], it's usually longer than a normal ring and covers the finger up to the first or second knuckle. It may also include a bendable joint.

Also known as a finger claw ring or a finger armor ring.

In China zhijiatao (指甲套) were worn during the Ming and Qing dynasties by nobility, to protect their long nails, which were in fashion for men and women. Images depicting [[hanfu]] and machu wear from these eras often include what is called a "claw ring" on this site.
bull:
Colloquially: a male bovine. They often have distinct [[horns]] protruding from the sides of their head. More accurately, a male bovine that hasn't been castrated (which would be an ox, but treated synonymously on Danbooru)

Bulls are more muscular than their female [[cow]] counterparts.
turn pale:
When the color is washed out of a character's face because they are [[surprised|shocked]], [[horrified]], [[disgust]]ed, [[scared]], [[depressed]], or otherwise drained of emotion. Can also show that the character is [[sick]] or is comedically [[giving up the ghost]].

It is characterized by a blueish or white tint over the eyes, nose, or forehead, sometimes with vertical lines also drawn over the forehead or horizontal lines drawn over the nose.

Not to be confused with [[shaded face]], which is when the face is literally covered in shadow.
cowboy western:
As in, the Western film genre. These are depictions of the Wild West and its characters.

This tag is mostly used on pictures having the iconic [[cowboy hat]] and other appropriate leather clothing items (particularly [[boots]], [[chaps]], and [[vest]]s). If you can see guns in the picture, they are usually [[revolver]]s ([[Colt Single Action Army]] usually) or [[rifle]]s ([[Winchester model 1894]] usually). [[Native American]]-styled characters might also apply in tagging Western artworks.

For male characters, use [[cowboy]].
o-ring thigh strap:
A [[thigh strap]] with an [[o-ring]]. This includes [[heart o-ring]]s.

Not to be confused with [[o-ring legwear]] which is for thighhighs or other legwear with an o-ring.

For o-ring thigh straps that are part of a [[legwear garter]], use [[o-ring legwear garter]] instead.
chaldea uniform:
The uniform worn by members of the [[Chaldea Security Organization]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. 

There are many variants of the uniform, depending on the rank and position the member is. [[fujimaru ritsuka (male)|Male Ritsuka]] and [[fujimaru ritsuka (female)|Female Ritsuka]] wear a white shirt with black buckles on the chest, with the male uniform having [[black pants]] and the female uniform having a [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]]. [[Romani Archaman]] wears a doctor's uniform beneath a white coat. Other staff members like [[Jingle Abel Meuniere]] and [[Sylvia (fate)|]] wear a black shirt with the secondary color being different depending on the gender - orange for women, and aqua for men - and either [[white pants]] or a [[white skirt]]. 

[[Dark Young (fate)|]] has the same coloration as the protagonists' Chaldea uniforms.
pubic stubble:
The stubble left behind after shaving one's [[pubic hair]].

Do not use this tag when the character is simply hairless, with no sign of stubble.
aerith gainsborough:
Playable character from [[Final Fantasy VII]], featured in the Compilation ([[final fantasy vii advent children|Advent Children]], [[before crisis final fantasy vii|Before Crisis]], [[crisis core final fantasy vii|Crisis Core]]) and the [[final fantasy vii remake|Remake]]. Also a supporting character in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] worn in a [[twisted hair|twisted ponytail]] (often mistakenly depicted as a [[braided ponytail]]) with [[parted bangs]] and [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[sidelocks]], fastened with a [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon]] and sometimes a visible green [[materia]], [[green eyes]], [[medium breasts]], sometimes [[pale skin]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[red jacket]] with [[short sleeves]] ([[puffy short sleeves]] in the original [[Final Fantasy VII|FFVII]]) over a [[long dress|long]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], a [[flower choker]] (simple [[ribbon choker]] prior to [[Final Fantasy VII Remake|FF7R]]) and [[bangle]]s on each wrist. Often carries a [[yellow flower]] and [[flower basket]] and wields a [[staff]].

town: A medium sized settlement. Towns are generally larger and more modern than [[village]]s, but not as big or developed as a [[city]].

graveyard: A location where the deceased are buried under the ground and commemorated with [[tombstone]]s or [[sotoba]].
ketchup: A thick, tangy sauce used as a condiment. It is made from [[tomato|tomatoes]], vinegar, and various seasonings and spices. Dispensed from a [[ketchup bottle]].

blending:

mixed media:
Artwork in which more than one medium or material has been employed, such as a combination of [[traditional media]] and digital (computer-based) media. 

Images where the use of traditional media isn't apparent to the viewer (e.g. traditional line art existed but was mostly obliterated by digital colors) count as neither traditional media nor mixed media. 

Likewise, if 3D assets are used, it must be apparent that they are 3D assets. If they are traced and colored over by hand, that is not mixed media. (e.g. post #5889413)

This tag can also be used for images with a 2D foreground drawing over a [[3D|]] or [[photo background|]].
guided penetration: Someone (usually but not necessarily the person being penetrated) guiding another person's penetration.
vomiting:

film grain:
A grainy, sand-like texture that appears in traditional film photography. Artists sometimes simulate film grain for artistic effect, especially to achieve a cinematic or [[retro artstyle|retro]] look.

This tag includes both traditional analog film grain and digital camera sensor noise.
lighter:
A small hand-held object used to create a small [[fire]]. Commonly used to light [[cigarette|cigarettes]].

If the lighter is made of metal and has a flip-style lid, then also use the tag [[zippo lighter]].

For a lighter with a long barrel and trigger,used more commonly to light [[candle]]s, [[stove]]s, [[campfire]]s and other things it would be preferable to keep one's fingers away from, see also [[wand lighter]].
briefcase:
A case used for carrying documents, such as [[paper]]s or files or [[book]]s. Mostly used by business people.

Not to be confused with a [[suitcase]].
muted color:
An image that is barely in color, due to colors being washed out, usually by mixing with grey.

If an image's colors are muted mostly with white, use [[pale color]]. It it's muted with black,  [[dark]] instead.

veranda:

talons:
The sharp, hooked [[claws]] at the end of the toes of predator avians. Birds have one talon on every toe, and they may differ in overall shape, curvature and thickness. 

Doves don't have a use for talons as they do not hunt to feed themselves; doves have claws, but no talons.

[[harpy|Harpies]] are commonly depicted with them.

kalashnikov rifle:
Any type of self-loading [[rifle]] based on Mikhail Kalashnikov's [[AK-47]] design. This includes license-manufactured variants outside of Russia as well. Please use this tag for any unidentified AK of unknown type. 

Please do not use for:

* Similar-looking rifles with different design (e.g. [[AN-94]], [[AS Val]], [[Dragunov SVD]] and [[Vz. 58]]).
* Rifles that copy the AK design but were not officially licensed (e.g. Finnish [[Rk62]], Israeli [[imi galil|Galil]] and [[Galil ACE]]).
swastika:
Ancient religious symbol or [[mandala]] used in numerous cultures throughout history ([[India]], etc.). Takes the form of a [[cross]] with four legs bent at 90 degrees.

The clockwise, or right-handed, swastika (卐) was appropriated by the [[nazi|Nazi Party]] as its emblem. This variant was turned 45 degrees in a white circle on a red background which is known as [i]Hakenkreuz[/i] (hooked cross). The symbol continues to be widely associated with Nazism to the present day, and its public display is banned in several countries.

Another user of the clockwise swastika was the [[finland|Finnish]] Air Force, which used a blue swastika for its aircraft insignia from 1918-1944. The [[latvia|Latvian]] Air Force used a dark red version.

The counterclockwise, or left-handed, swastika (卍) is an auspicious symbol in [[Buddhism]] known in Japan as [i]manji[/i].
blood from eyes: When a character's [[tears]] are made of [[blood]] or if a character is [[bleeding]] from their eyes. Do not also tag [[tears]] unless plain tears are present in the image.
bangs pinned back:

Compare with [[hair slicked back]], where there is no object blocking the bangs, or [[hair pulled back]], where it's the whole hair, and not just the bangs.

string of flags:

energy: Power derived from the utilization of physical, chemical, or magical resources, especially to provide [[light]] and heat or to work [[machinery]].
load bearing vest:
A type of [[vest]] worn by [[military]] [[soldier|personnel]], [[police]] officers and [[military operator|special forces]] in combat. It contains integrated [[ammunition pouch]]es, slots for grenades or other equipment, and sometimes a built-in [[holster]].
May overlap with [[bulletproof vest]] due to some vests that enables the insertion of [[body armor|armor]] plates. Especially if the front side look flat and stiff.
h6. How to distinguish
* !post #7001003: [b]Load bearing vest[/b]. Pouches are integrated with the vest.
* !post #5400538: [[Chest rig]]. Pouches are separate from clothing article, situated on the torso/chest.
* !post #5944716: [[Load bearing equipment]]. Worn around the waist, the gear may consist more than just ammunition pouches.
summer:
A scene set in summer, or with a clear summer theme.

Use this tag when the setting (not just a background with seasonal vibes) shows traditional signs of summer, be it:

* [[Hot]] and sunny weather, bright [[day]]s and [[blue sky]]s.
* Light clothing, such as [[t-shirt]]s, [[shorts]], [[straw hat]]s, and [[swimsuit]]s.
* Summer activities, such as visiting the [[beach]], going [[swimming]], going to summer [[festival]]s, cooling the body with [[hand fan]]s, eating summer treats such as [[shaved ice]], [[watermelon]]s, [[popsicle]]s, etc.
microphone stand: An adjustable stand that provides support for [[microphone|microphones]], which frees the hands of the performer/speaker.
glowstick: A stick-shaped chemical light, usually called a "Cyalume".
seashell: Generic term for the empty [[shell|shells]] of various marine molluscs, often adapted for decorative use. Common seashells on Danbooru include the shells of [[scallop]]s, [[conch]]es, [[clam shell|clams]], and [[cowry shell|cowries]].
neon trim: High in contrast and usually luminescent, neon trim will generally be depicted as brightly-glowing or pulsing lines over the surface of an object (be it a mecha, outfit, or even a person's skin).
ice cream cone: An edible wafer- or waffle-like cone-shaped pastry to place [[ice cream]] on so it can be eaten without a bowl or spoon.
orange panties: [[Panties]] that are solid or predominantly colored orange.
sode:
Sode (袖) or tousei sode (当世袖) are the [[samurai]] armor's equivalent of [[pauldrons]].  They are are large, rectangular shoulder pieces made from overlapping iron and/or leather plates, tied together by leather cord.

Sode can be constructed to be relatively flexible or rigid and may cover the just the shoulders or most of the arm down to the elbow.
arm cannon: When a character has a [[gun]] that covers the arm, or a gun instead of an arm. Common in [[cyborg]]s.
garden: A purposefully cultivated, outdoor area for the enjoyment of [[nature]] or to grow plants for human consumption. The important distinction between a garden and other nature-filled outdoor spaces is that a garden is controlled, as opposed to wildly-growing and chaotic. Not to be confused with its indoor variants, [[greenhouse]] and [[conservatory]].
bath: The physical tub or pool of water used for [[bathing]]. This may be either a Western [[bathtub]] in a [[bathroom]], or a traditional Japanese [[ofuro]], or an [[onsen]], or a [[drum bath]].
horned headwear:
A type of headwear that is designed with [[fake horns]] for aesthetic reasons.

Use [[horned helmet]] for helmets.

The player avatar character in [[Arknights]]

Skilled and adaptable leader responsible for managing Rhodes Island, a pharmaceutical organization. While the Doctor's appearance is not explicitly shown in the game, they are depicted as a capable and resourceful individual who coordinates the deployment of operators, plans tactical maneuvers, and oversees operations to combat various threats and challenges across Terra, the game's world. Despite facing daunting obstacles, the Doctor remains calm, determined, and dedicated to the well-being of their team and the success of their missions.

If their gender isn't readily apparent within the image, tag them as [[1other]]. If the depicted Doctor is male or female, use [[Male Doctor (Arknights)|]] or [[Female Doctor (Arknights)|]] respectively along with this tag.

before and after:
Images showing before and after time skips for characters, locations, and objects. Living things being the most common since humanoids, plants and animals show their age, while most nonliving things stay the same; however, decay, dust and rust can be used as visual indicators. Opposite may apply if area has been cleaned instead.

The simple labeling of "Before" and "After" does not have to be illustrated in the artwork for this tag to apply.
lace gloves: [[Gloves]] made entirely of [[lace]]. See [[lace-trimmed gloves]] for gloves merely trimmed with [[lace]].
two-tone bikini: A [[multicolored bikini]] that has exactly two colors.
strapless bikini:
A [[bikini]] top that lacks any shoulder straps or halternecks, instead relying on the tightness of the fabric to keep it in place, similarly to a [[tube top]]. 

Most [[bandeau]] and [[eyepatch bikini]]s are examples of strapless bikinis.
hakui koyori:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "[[holoX]]". A [[wolf girl|coyote girl]] and the head researcher and engineer of the holoX secret organization. Designed by [[momoko (momopoco)|Momoco Haru]].

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[pink hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[wolf ears|coyote ears]], [[wolf tail|tail]], and [[large breasts]].
Her regular hairstyle consists of a [[crown braid]] that turns into [[double bun|double]] [[braided bun]]s with [[sidelocks]], [[choppy bangs|choppy]] [[double-parted bangs]] and [[antenna hair]], she also has a pair of [[hexagon hair ornament]]s styled after a chemical diagram.
The kuudere character and "accomplice" of [[Lelouch Vi Britannia|Lelouch]] from the anime [i][[Code Geass]][/i]. Often seen with [[cheese-kun]] and eating [[pizza]], specifically [[Pizza Hut]].

Her name is pronounced "See Two".
super crown:
A powerup in [[New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe]] that transforms [[Toadette]] into [[Peachette]], a [[Princess Peach]] lookalike retaining some original form attributes, with Peach's abilities and more. Canonically, the game's official website states only she can use it.

Fans, however, used it to similarly transform [[Bowser]], and from there on [[King Boo]], then many more characters, and even [[personification|personify]] items, from the [[mario (series)|Mario universe]]. More specifically in human female, but no additional abilities. The more esoteric the subject, the less “lookalike” or even “human” applies.

The trend is known as “peachifying” (ピーチ姫化) in Japan. The result is typically named with either an "-ette" suffix (in reference to Peachette), or by default a “princess” title like Peach ("-Hime" suffix in Japanese).
flag print: Clothing or an item that is designed with printings resembling a nation's flag.
multicolored coat: When a [[coat]] has at least two or more colors present. See [[multicolored_clothes]] for guidelines on what is considered multicolored.
diamond (shape):
The ♦️ symbol.

Refers to the shape of a diamond, or the [[playing card]] suit. In the playing card world, diamond represents wealth. 

See [[gem (symbol)]] for the 💎 symbol. See [[diamond (gemstone)]] for literal diamonds. For any type of diamond-shaped pattern, see [[argyle]] for more.
two-tone ribbon: A [[multicolored ribbon]] that has exactly two colors.
smelling: The act of inhaling air with the nose to determine what a particular scent is. Smells can be perceived when odor molecules bind to hair-like neurons in the nose called cilia. Pleasant smells can invoke happiness and nostalgia, while bad odors can cause revulsion and force the person to cover their nose. It is of the five senses, also called [b]olfaction[/b].
spoken squiggle: A [[squiggle]] — a round scribble that often depicts a character's [[annoyed|annoyance]], [[embarrassed|embarrassment]], [[confused|confusion]] or exasperation — used inside a [[speech bubble]].
sidecut: A hairstyle where one side is [[shaved head|shaved]], while the other rest of the character's hair is at standard length. Also known as [[Skrillex]] hair.
heart-shaped lock:
A [[lock]] in the shape of a [[heart]].

Most commonly seen in [[Kantai Collection]] images, after the [[heart lock (kantai collection)|heart lock]] feature that allows a lock to be placed on ship girls to prevent accidentally scrapping them.
white sash: A [[sash]] that is white in color.
shoulder pads:
Protector for shoulders. It is mainly worn when playing sports.
For combat use, see [[shoulder armor]].
chain headband: A [[chain]] worn as a [[headband]] or a solid metal headband designed to look like a chain, not to be confused with [[head chain]] which is a type of jewelry made of much thinner gold string.
unbuttoned: An article of clothing in the image has [[buttons]] which are unfastened.
feather hair:
Hair that includes feathers which grow out of a character's head, typically seen on [[bird girl]]s. [[Silence_(arknights)|]] is a typical example of a character with feather hair (e.g. post #3347896)

Not to be confused with [[feather hair ornament]]s, which are merely hair ornaments, not part of the character's body.
unworn helmet:
When someone seems to have recently removed a [[helmet]], and it is visible but not worn.

Use [[no headwear]] if the helmet is not visible in the image and the character usually wears a helmet.
tsurime:
Eyes drawn with the top eyelid slanting inwards. This usually produces a strong, piercing look and is generally given to characters with forceful personalities (naturally, exceptions exist). Also known as a positive canthal tilt or slanted eyes.

Opposite is [[tareme]], which usually produces a gentle, weak look.
transparent umbrella: When an umbrella is see-through or translucent. Often times, the spokes of the umbrella and the very edge of the lining is opaque, but as long as the majority of the plastic is clear, an umbrella should qualify.
turtle shell: The [[shell]] of a [[turtle]]. Should not actually be used in conjunction with [[turtle]], only in cases with anthropomorphic characters that display it like [[Bowser]] and his relatives. Can also be used if an abandoned turtle shell is present (not on the back of a turtle).
dango:
Japanese [[dumpling]]s made of rice flour, often served [[skewer]]ed and with [[green tea]].

Not to be confused with [[tanghulu]], a traditional Chinese snack of candied fruit on a stick.
crescent print: Clothing or a fabric item that has the printed motif of a [[crescent]], usually meant to represent a [[crescent moon]].
hands in hair: Characters with more than one hand in their own hair.
breast envy:
A situation wherein a girl becomes [[envy|envious]] of or feels inferior to another with a [b]visibly[/b] larger [[breasts|breast size]].

May result from a [[breast contest]].
carried breast rest:
[[breast rest|Resting the breasts]] on a [[tray]] or other similar object (carried by the same character) as if serving them to another character or the viewer.

Also known as breast delivery.
rubble: Broken rocks and/or concrete often found in [[ruins]] and after [[destruction]]. They are settled and motionless. If they are flying or in motion, use [[debris]].

One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]].

She is a young girl who is a former experimental subject, granting [[mind reading]] abilities. 'Adopted' by [[Twilight (spy x family)|]] as part of the latter's cover identity. As such, she is also the adoptive 'stepdaughter' of [[Yor Briar]]. Can be seen with plushies, such as [[Director Chimera (spy x family)|]] and Agent Penguinman.

Has [[pink hair]] with [[hairpods]] covering [[cone hair bun]]s.

She is voiced by [[Tanezaki Atsumi]] in Japanese and Megan Shipman in English.
candlelight:
Settings where [[candle|candles]] provide the majority of ambient light. This makes for dark scenes with amber-colored light radiating out from the candles themselves.

This tag is not to be used when there's merely a lit candle in the image. It needs to be a dark setting illuminated by the light given off by at least one candle.
broken mirror:
A [[mirror]] that is broken.

If you can't be sure that it's a mirror, use [[broken glass]] instead.
bat hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a [[bat (animal)|]].
lemon slice: A slice of [[lemon]], commonly seen as a garnish to cool drinks.

One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the PSP game [i]Idolmaster SP[/i].  While hailing from a wealthy family, Takane is a polyglot, has a passion for music, and although haughty, is very polite even to her rivals from [i]765[/i].

Takane is an idol from 961 Production's "Project Fairy" along with ex-[i]765[/i] idol [[Hoshii Miki]] and [[Ganaha Hibiki]].
