fake antlers: [[Antlers]] that are not real. Commonly found on hairbands.
flip-flops: A type of casual [[sandals|sandal]], consisting of a flat sole held loosely on the foot by a Y-shaped strap known as a toe thong that passes between the first and second toes and around both sides of the foot.
nakano miku:
A character in [[Go-Toubun No Hanayome]] as well as the third eldest of the Nakano [[quintuplets|Quintuplet]] sisters. Miku has a quiet and passive personality, few friends, and an interest in Japanese warlords during specific eras of Japanese history with her best subject being social science.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair between eyes]] & [[sidelocks]]. She usually is wearing blue [[headphones]] [[headphones around neck|around he
badge:
An emblem that signifies status, rank, membership, affiliation, etc. Usually made of plastic, metal, or cloth. An example is a police badge.

Badges created for fashion purposes or campaigning are called [[button badge|button badges]].
audio jack:
A connector commonly used for audio equipment. Sometimes called a headphone jack, jack plug, phone jack, or phone connector.

Almost all [[headphones]], [[microphone]]s and most consumer [[speaker]]s have one of these connectors. Consumer equipment usually has the small 3.5 mm plug and professional equipment has the large 6.35 mm plug. Electric guitars and effects units always use the 6.35 mm plug.

Plugs have a single prong with separately connected tip, sleeve, and usually one ring, sometimes more. Mono audio has no ring, often found on microphones; stereo audio has one ring and headsets with integrated microphones or control buttons have two or more rings.
mitsudomoe (shape): Three [[tomoe_(symbol)|]] (comma-shaped symbols) in a circular arrangement.
unworn shirt: A [[shirt]] that is not being worn.
orange footwear: Deprecated tag. Use one of the tags below instead.
orange choker:
A [[choker]] that is colored orange.

There may be potential overlap between this tag and similarly colored chokers like [[brown choker]] and [[yellow choker]].
moth girl: A type of [[arthropod girl]] that has characteristcs of a [[moth]]. They are frequently depicted having a thing for [[lamp]]s.
serena (pokemon):
[b]Serena[/b] is the female player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]][/i].

This Trainer from Kalos loves Pokémon and fashion. She's usually cheerful and upbeat, but when a battle starts, her demeanor shifts, revealing her calm, serious side [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]]. She wears a [[pink headwear|pink]] [[hat]] [[eyewear on headwear|with]] [[white-framed eyewear|white-framed]] [[sunglasses]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[mega ring]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[high-waist skirt]], [[thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], and a [[pink bag|pink]] [[handbag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Yvonne Gabena[/b] or Y.
gerudo: A race of [[dark skin]]ned humans in the [[The Legend of Zelda]] franchise. A mostly female desert people, with males naturally born every once in a couple hundred years.
star choker: A [[choker]] that has at least one [[star (symbol)|]] on it, whether as part of the choker itself or as an attachment. It doesn't matter what kind of star is being portrayed.
mikasa ackerman:
A character from [[Shingeki no Kyojin]].

The prodigy and top graduate of the 104th Trainees Squad and adopted sister of [[Eren Yeager]]. Mikasa is considered as an unprecedented military genius.

She is generally calm and somewhat frigid but interacts fully with others. She is overprotective of Eren whom she sometimes treats like her little brother. Childhood friends with [[Armin Arlert]]. Followed Eren's decision to join the Scouting Legion despite his protests.

Voiced by [[Ishikawa Yui
yellow lips: When a character's lips are colored [[yellow]] from [[lipstick]].
kagamine rin:
Kagamine Rin is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. She is the second of the Character Vocal Series together with [[Kagamine Len]] and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is voiced by seiyuu, [[Shimoda Asami]]. She is originally designed and illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]] for her V2 voicebank. Her V4X voicebank follows a similar outfit with readjustments designed and illustrated by [[iXima]].

She has [[blonde hair]] done in a short hair style and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[sailor collar]] shirt with [[treble clef]] print. She wears [[shorts]] along with [[detached sleeves]], [[leg warmers]] and a large [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]] connected on a white [[headset]].

Her counterpart is Kagamine Len. Their relationship (whether they are [[siblings]], lovers, etc) is officially left ambiguous and left up to the user to decide.
mouse: See [[mouse (animal)]] for the animal or [[computer mouse]] for the computer peripheral.
kanzashi: Kanzashi (簪) are [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]] used in traditional Japanese hairstyles, they are most often worn by [[uchikake|brides]] and [[geisha]]. The Chinese name is "簪 ([i]zan[/i])":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zan or "釵 ([i]chai[/i]),":http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%87%B5 which have the same Japanese reading, kanzashi.
banner: A type of [[flag]] or other piece of cloth bearing a symbol, logo, slogan, or other message that is often oriented vertically instead of horizontally. Can also be used for [[birthday]] banners or other fabrics that shouldn't be called "flag". Soldiers may be carrying a [[war banner]].
hill: A naturally raised area of land, not as high or craggy as a [[mountain]].
junko (touhou):
[i][[Touhou]][/i] character introduced as the final boss in [i][[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]][/i]. A divine spirit with the power to purify anything. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] or [[orange hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[dalachi (headdress)|]] with a [[crescent]] moon on it and [[Chinese clothes]] with a [[red tabard]]. Behind her are [[multiple tails|multiple]] [[fox tail|fox tails]] made out of energy.

She is the embodiment of all hatred against the Lunarian race, especially [[Chang'e]], whose husband shot down the sun and killed Junko's son [[Bofeng]]. She is friends with [[Hecatia Lapislazuli]] who sympathized with her as she holds a grudge against Chang'e as well.

Unlike other Touhou characters, she has no in-game title. Her official profile simply says "(無名の存在)"/"(Nameless Being)" in place of a title, likely because she has purified herself of all identifying information.
mystia lorelei:
The "Night Sparrow." Stage 2 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i] and a playable character in [i][[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]][/i].

An egocentric night sparrow youkai who can induce confusion and night-blindness with her song. She dislikes [[yakitori]] (grilled chicken) and has set up a grilled lamprey eel stand in protest, convincing blinded travellers that her eels cure blindness (she cures them on the spot). 

She is best known, however, for having been reputedly devoured by [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] during IN, only to reappear in PoFV, landing her a place in [[Team 9 (touhou)|]], a posse of low-tier Touhou characters. Her more recent association with [[Kasodani Kyouko]] as part of [[Choujuu Gigaku]], as well as the increased prominence of her food stand, have loosened her association with Team 9 somewhat.

Contrary to accusations of being illiterate by [[Shameimaru Aya]] in an interview from [[Bohemian Archive in Japanese Red]], she merely has poor eyesight, based an appearance in [[Touhou Sangetsusei]] where she uses a magnifying lens to help her read.
hoodie lift: A [[hoodie]] has been lifted up, often to reveal the wearer's chest.
traffic cone: Traffic cones, also known as safety cones or road cones, are [[cone (geometry)|]]-shaped markers used to create merge lanes during road [[construction]] projects or traffic [[accident]]s.
animal ear legwear: A type of [[tag group:legwear|legwear]], often [[thighhighs]], with an animal design along the upper band.
christmas lights:
A string of colorful lights wrapped around [[christmas_tree|Christmas trees]] and strung around fixtures to produce colored illuminations during the holidays.

For large strings of lights not associated with [[Christmas]], see [[string of light bulbs]].
water gun: A type of [[toy gun]] that is designed to shoot water, though other liquids are occasionally also used in them.  Most are shaped like a [[gun]], but other shapes exist as well (such as tube or hose shape). Furthermore while most water guns have a reservoir of water for multiple shots, some designs can only fire once before needing to be refilled.
byleth (fire emblem): One of the protagonists of [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]], the viewpoint character of the story; Byleth can be a [[male byleth (fire emblem)|male]] or [[female byleth (fire emblem)|female]]. In the Japanese version, male Byleth is known as Bereto (ベレト), and female Byleth is known as Beresu (ベレス).
drawer: Open-top [[box]]es that slide in and out of [[cabinet]]s, used to store [[clothes|clothing]] and other items.
masturbation through clothes: When a character [[masturbation|masturbates]] without directly touching their genitals, because a piece of clothing (usually [[underwear]] or a [[swimsuit]]) is in the way.
artoria pendragon (lancer alter) (fate):
[[Saber (fate)| Artoria Pendragon]] in [[Dark Persona|Alter state]] as a Lancer-class Servant, first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[London (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity. She uses King Arthur's spear [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]] instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]].

Being based on [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer) (Fate)|the hypothetical version of]] Artoria who did not possesses the age-halting [[Caliburn (fate)|]] and [[avalon (fate)|Avalon]]. This version of Artoria is [[large breasts|much more developed]] than normal. Battles while mounted on a horse named [[llamrei (fate)|Llamrei]]. Her actions as the Storm King allowed her to head the Wild Hunt after her passing.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ishida Akira]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]
long pointy ears: [[Pointy ears]] that are significantly longer than usual.
araragi karen: [i][[monogatari_(series)|Monogatari Series]][/i] character. She is the older of [[Araragi Koyomi]]'s two younger sisters, and often wears a distinctive black-and-yellow [[track jacket]].
single pantsleg: Pants with only one leg.  The other leg may have been removed or never existed.  The absent pantsleg may be cropped as far up the leg as the bikini line.
rem (re:zero):
A character from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]]. She is [[Ram (re:zero)|]]'s [[twins|fraternal twin]] [[sisters|sister]].

Rem has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], which usually [[hair over one eye|covers]] one of her [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[red ribbon|red]] or [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] and [[x hair ornament]] in her hair and the [[Roswaal Mansion Maid Uniform]].

Not to be confused with Ram, who has [[pink hair]] and [[red eyes]].

She is voiced by [[Minase Inori]].
pond: A small body of standing [[water]]. Unlike a [[lake]], a pond is small but there is not a scientific differentiation between a [[lake]] and a [[pond]].
cow boy:
A male dressed as a [[cow]] or with [[cow]]-like features.
Common features include [[cow ears]], [[cow horns]], a [[cow tail]], [[cow print]] clothing, a [[cowbell]], [[ear tag]]s, and [[large pectorals]].

If the character is wearing a cow [[hoodie]], use [[cow costume]] instead.

For western cowboys, see [[cowboy western]]. 
For [[monster boy]]s or [[furry male|furries]] with a [[bull]]'s head, see [[minotaur]].
frilled leotard: A [[leotard]] that has some [[frills]] on it, usually around the legs.
sounding:
Fetish of shoving something into the urethra of the [[penis]]. Can involve bladder flooding.

[[Genshin Impact]] character.

A loyal and brave general of Watatsumi island. Born with a beast-like fighting intuition and tenacious will, he can find a way to victory even in the most critical moments. 

His name is pronounced [b]Goroo[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.
keyhole: The hole in a [[lock]] where the key is inserted and turns.

bowing: The act of [[leaning forward]] or [[bent_over|bending over]] towards someone else as a sign of respect, gratefulness or as an apology.
open-chest sweater:
An outfit that has gone viral from a user named Myako's tweet "here":https://twitter.com/myakkomyako/status/540485949822468096, on December 4th, 2014. The [[turtleneck]] [[ribbed sweater]] prominently features a [[cleavage cutout]].

Artists eventually began throwing around the challenge to draw their waifu or husbando in the sweater.

Please note that sweaters with [[cleavage cutout|cleavage cutouts]] are nothing new. Only use this tag if the [[sweater]] the character is wearing is identical/adapted from the one in the tweet or if the artist tags it open-chest sweater/says it is related to the whole fad.

Also called "例のセーター":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%BE%8B%E3%81%AE%E3%82%BB%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BF%E3%83%BC] or [i]that[/i] sweater as with the [[virgin killer sweater]], although with limited use.
bridget (guilty gear):
A character from the [[Guilty Gear]] fighting game series. First appearing in [[Guilty Gear XX]], born as one of two male twins in an [[united kingdom|English]] village where the birth of same-sex twins was considered bad luck, they were raised as a girl, prompting their [[otoko no ko]] appearance. 

Throughout [i]Guilty Gear XX[/i], they would reject the stigma of their upbringing and work towards proving their masculinity as a bounty hunter. Years later, as of [i][[Guilty Gear Strive]][/i], Bridget had since succeeded, dispelling the superstition of their village. In absence of that purpose, they experience unresolved doubts, ultimately determining to be true to herself, embracing her identity as a girl across the conclusions of her story.

Debuted in [i]XX[/i] with a sleeveless and shortened [[nun]] habit (for ease of movement, not because they are a nun), a giant handcuff as an accessory, and [[bike shorts]]. In [i]Strive[/i], the nun habit is replaced with a similar [[hooded jacket]], with the habit's [[mars symbol]], pointed to the upper-right, changed to an [[androgyne symbol]], pointed to the upper-left, matching the orientations of these elements as in the [[transgender symbol|⚧ symbol]]. In either case, they wield a [[yo-yo]] and their pet [[teddy bear]] [[Roger (Guilty Gear)|]] in battle.

[i]Current policy is to tag Bridget as male unless physical evidence in the image proves otherwise, including the presence of the [[transgender flag]]. Non-bodily evidence (e.g. [[transgender flag]]) is only relevant to {{Rating:General}} posts.[/i]
fiery hair: Hair that is, or appear to be, made of [[fire]]. For hair that is [[burning]], use [[burning hair]]. For hair that has been [[burnt]], use [[burnt hair]].
toe scrunch:
A character squeezing their toes downward so they appear curled.

Also used when a character's toes are curled by a surface, so at times it's an unintentional action.
portrait (object): When a post contains a portrait, but the post itself is not a [[portrait]].
spacecraft:
A [b]spacecraft[/b] is a craft or [[vehicle]] or [[machine]] designed for [[space]]flight. They are frequently depicted in many works of [[science fiction|Science Fiction]].

Any vehicle capable of manned spaceflight, includes [[space shuttle]]s, [[rocket ship]]s, [[flying saucer]]s, and any other configuration such as "Star Trek's":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_trek Enterprise, [[Star Wars]] [[T-65 X-wing]]s and [[Tie Fighter]]s, or [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]]'s rendition of the Battleship Yamato. 

They can be small enough for one person to use (like the [[starfighter]]s) or as big as planets.
cum on armpits: When [[cum]] is present on a person's [[armpits]].
faux figurine:
Pictures where the character(s) seem to stand on scenic bases, similar to that of a figurine or scale model. In other words, the only real background is just a small chunk of ground or scenery.

If the background is cropped, but instead of having clear cuts with volume, they appear foggy or as if simply being erased, it's [[fading border]] instead.

Images with a "Vignette(ヴィネット)":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag_full&word=%E3%83%B4%E3%82%A3%E3%83%8D%E3%83%83%E3%83%88 tag on pixiv should be tagged  as "[[faux figurine]]" or "[[isometric]]" on danbooru.

If the base is large and includes elaborate details, multiple characters, or three-dimensional elements (especially walls), [[diorama]] may be more appropriate.
hands on own stomach: When a character has both of their hands on their own [[stomach]].
white feathers: [[Feathers]] that are [[white]], don't use this tag if they are attached to [[wings]].
grenade:
A small [[explosive]] bomb thrown by hand. This tag is reserved for [b]lethal[/b] hand grenades.
Most grenades are timed and only armed if the lever strikes the propellant inside of one, after the pin is pulled away.

* For the ammunition used for modern [[grenade launcher]]s, see [[40mm grenade]].
* For the non-lethal counterparts, see [[flashbang]] or [[smoke grenade]].

wind chime:
Also called a wind-bell, the wind chime is a decorative object suspended in midair that has three basic forms:
* A cluster of small pieces of metal, glass, pottery, bamboo, seashell, or wood that collide with each other and make noise when blown by the [[wind]]
* A cluster of tubes or rods, often made of metal or wood, that are rung by a central clapper, to which is attached a flat plate to catch the wind
* A single [[bell]] or open-ended glass globe whose clapper is attached to a flat plate to catch the wind.
frilled kimono: A [[kimono]] that has an array of [[frills]] adorning it. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
mishaguji:
Mishaguji are [[snake]]-like gods in Japanese folktales.

In [[Touhou]],  Mishaguji are underlings of [[Moriya Suwako]] and have an appearance close to the mythology. They can be seen in [[Touhou Hisoutensoku]] during one of her super moves, where she summons them to assault the opponent in a manner similar to the [[Shun Goku Satsu]]. They also betrayed [[Yasaka Kanako]] when she seized Suwako's land in the distant past, blighting the region until Kanako agreed to keep Suwako as a co-deity. They are utterly loyal to Suwako and will answer to no one else, with the possible exception of Suwako's descendant, [[Kochiya Sanae]].

In [[Megami Tensei]], Mishaguji is a god of sexual intercourse and had a phallic shape, possibly similar to an earthworm.
yellow headwear: This tag has been deprecated for being too broad. Use a more specific tag like [[yellow hat]], [[yellow hairband]], etc.
adjusting headwear: Adjusting any type of [[hat]] or other headwear to be more comfortable for the wearer.
prison: An institution that incarcerates lawbreakers for a specific time as deemed by the justice system. The intention is to remove them from society and have them learn from their mistakes before being released. Serious offenders serve longer sentences for the purpose of making the public safer.
harpy:
A [[monster girl]] usually based on birds, though some examples are dinosaur girls or other mythological creatures.

Harpies have [[winged arms|wings instead of arms]] or at least heavily feathered arms alongside wings (see post #6477937) and claws instead of feet (see post #613745). Some may only have feathered body parts (post #646639).

A traditional harpy will instead have the body of a bird but the head of a woman (post #2431167).
sparkling eyes: When a character's eyes contain star-shaped sparkles in them, adjacent to the pupil.
bartender: A person who prepares, mixes and serves drinks at a [[bar (place)|]].
irys (hololive):
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] of [[hololive English]]. A Nephilim who, upon her second awakening, has descended upon the current era to bring hope through song. Designed by [[Redjuice]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair|dark purple]] and [[red hair]]. True to her lore, she is portrayed with a [[halo]] made out of 2 layers of black and white stars, [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] [[pink eyes|purple]] and [[blue eyes]], black [[horns]], [[pointy ears]], and [[asymmetrical wings|differently-colored]] [[crystal wings]].

Formerly operated under the solo "Project:HOPE" from July 2021 until October 2023, when she was "reassigned":[https://twitter.com/hololive_En/status/1711232551061516715] to a new group with the four remaining [[holoCouncil]] members as "hololive English -Promise-". 

Similar to [[hololive]] Japan's [[AZKi (hololive)|]], her name is stylized [i]IRyS[/i], with only one letter in lower case.
dark blue hair: Deprecated tag. Use [[blue hair]], [[black hair]], or [[purple hair]] instead.
rose print: Clothing or an object that has [[rose|roses]] printed on it.
hand on another's stomach:
When one character has one hand on someone else's abdominal region.

If both hands are on someone else's stomach, use [[hands on another's stomach]]
If a hand is on one's own stomach, use [[hand on own stomach]]
If both hands are on one's own stomach, use [[hands on own stomach]]
inflatable raft: Inflatable boat or tube used in emergencies or just for water recreation. Often confused with [[air mattress]], so focus on the time and place when using either tag.
ishmael (project moon):
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.08 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named after the narrator of the 19th century novel "Moby-Dick.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moby-Dick

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[orange hair]], [[green eyes]], [[freckles]], and wears a [[headband]] made of rope with 2 [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]s. She wears the uniform of all Limbus Company sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], [[black pants]], but has a [[torn coat|torn]] [[black coat]] the length of a [[jacket]] instead of the standard [[black coat]]. 

She wields both a [[shield]] and [[flanged mace]] in her base identity with the English word 'Hearse' written on the shield. Her rope headband is consistent across all of her identities, although sometimes wearing it as a [[hairband]] or attaching it to her weapon instead of wearing it.

Sometimes drawn with [[tentacle hair]] due to a certain prerelease artwork (post #7489139).
doctor: A licensed medical physician who cares for the [[injury|injured]] at a [[hospital]], working along side medical assistants called [[nurse|nurses]]. Other parts of their job require preforming [[surgery]], giving [[x-ray]]s, [[pill|medication]] and [[syringe|injections]] of medication.
audience: People who come to watch a performance or event that is usually on a [[stage]].
see-through silhouette:
When the [[silhouette]] of a person's body is visible through a translucent object, usually clothing or [[curtains]]. Not necessarily [[see-through clothes]], since there can be just enough [[light]] to pierce the [[fabric]].

See [[invisible man]] for see-through characters.
energy wings: A [[wings|wing]] type formed using some form of [[energy]] (typically [[magic|magical]]). Often [[detached wings|detached]], but can also be attached to the character.
charm (object): A small decorative object generally connected to a [[keyring]] on a small chain known as a keychain, usually made of metal or plastic, commonly seen hanging from a [[cellphone]] or [[school bag]] of younger girls.
clone:
Two or more instances of the same character in the same scene. The instances should be completely identical and wearing the same outfit. 

Do not use this tag for a character who is a clone of another character, unless both are present in the scene.

Not to be mistaken for [[multiple_views]], where multiple images of the characters are independent, and do not react to one another, or inhabit a common environment.
purple one-piece swimsuit: A [[one-piece swimsuit]] that is colored purple.
carmine (pokemon):
[b]Carmine[/b], known as [b]Zeiyu[/b] (ゼイユ ) in Japan, is a character from [[Pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]]'s expansions "The Teal Mask" and "The Indigo Disk".

She was born in Kitakami and is a student at Blueberry Academy. She is the older sister of [[kieran (pokemon)|Kieran.]]

She has [[long hair|long]], [[two-tone hair]] that is [[black hair|black]] and [[red hair|red]]. The latter color making up her [[colored inner hair]]. Her [[crossed bangs]] go [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]. She has a [[mole under eye|mole under]] her [[yellow eyes]]. She usually wears a [[yellow hairband]].
capri pants:
[[Pants]] of which the leg length ends anywhere from just below the knee to slightly above the ankle. This tag does [b]not[/b] include pants that are [[pants_rolled_up|rolled up]] to some point along the shins.

h6.Examples

* [[Elle Mel Martha]] from [[Tales of Xillia 2]]
* [[kagura (gintama)|Kagura]] from [[Gintama]]
* [[shampoo (ranma 1/2)|Shampoo]] from [[Ranma 1/2]]
sharp toenails:
Sharp and pointed [[toenails]].

Not to be confused with [[claws]].
fujimaru ritsuka (female):
The protagonist of [[Fate/Grand Order]] if selected as female.

She has [[orange hair]], [[orange eyes]] and an [[ahoge]]. In her default attire which is [[Chaldea uniform]], she has a [[side ponytail]]/[[one side up]] tied by a yellow [[hair scrunchie]], and wears a [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]] and a pair of [[white_footwear|white]] [[boots]].

She has roughly the same characterization as the [[fujimaru_ritsuka_(male)|male version]]. She does, however, have an alternate characterization from the "Learn with Manga!" (pool #10385) comics, where she is more depraved and quick to [[female pervert|perv]] on other female Servants, particularly [[Mash Kyrielight]].

The [[fujimaru ritsuka (male)|male protagonist]] is colloquially called Gudao. The name Gudako could come from an abbreviation of [b]Gu[/b]rando Oo[b]da[/b]a, or from "Gudaguda Order" (ぐだぐだオーダー), an official series of Grand Order comics 
("English":[http://fate-go.us/gudao/], "Japanese":[https://www.fate-go.jp/gudao/]). Ko is a common ending for female names and can also mean girl.

Her appearance is based on [[Emiya Shirou]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sekine Akira]]
eris greyrat: [[Mushoku Tensei]] character. [[Philip Boreas Greyrat]]'s daughter and second cousin to [[Rudeus Greyrat]], [spoiler]and later wife[/spoiler].
paint: A mixture of a pigment and a suitable liquid to form a closely adherent coating when spread on a surface in a thin coat.
stocking (psg):
A character from [[Panty & Stocking With Garterbelt]]

[[panty_(psg)|Panty]]'s younger [[sisters|sister]]. A [[blunt bangs|blunt banged]] [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black-haired]] '[[gothic_lolita|goth loli]]' girl with an appetite for [[sweets|sweet]] desserts. Her stockings can transform into a [[sword]]. Her [[colored inner hair|inner]] [[streaked hair|hair]] is [[pink hair|pink]].

She typically wears a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]], [[black dress]], [[blue ribbon]], [[striped panties]], and [[striped thighhighs]]. Usually holds [[honekoneko (psg)|]].
yoru (chainsaw man):
Character from [[Chainsaw Man]]. The form that the [[War Devil (chainsaw man)|]] takes when possessing the body of [[Mitaka Asa]].

Takes on [[Mitaka Asa|Asa]]'s appearance, but slightly taller, with [[scar on cheek|facial scars]] and [[ringed eyes]].
jungle: A [[tropical]] [[forest]] with abundance of [[vines]], [[bush]]es, and animals.
kamado nezuko:
A main character from [[Kimetsu no Yaiba]] and the sister of [[Kamado Tanjirou]]. She was a human before getting exposed to demon blood into her veins, eventually turning into a demon when her brother found her.

She has [[pink eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] and [[brown hair]] and is often seen wearing a [[kimono]] and a [[bamboo]] muzzle around her mouth like a [[bit gag]].

[spoiler]When she goes into her "demon form", her eyebrows point downward with veins all around her head visible and stretching her skin and her pupils turn different. In this form she has a single horn but not the bamboo muzzle on.[/spoiler]
phallic symbol:
When an innocuous object is shaped like a [[penis]] or makes a blatant reference to the male genitalia. Common examples include [[banana|bananas]], [[mushroom|mushrooms]], [[carrot|carrots]], [[cucumber|cucumbers]], [[eggplant|eggplants]], [[makizushi]], [[popsicle|popsicles]] and [[hot dog|hot dogs]], especially since some of these items can produce [[suggestive fluid|suggestive fluids]].

For objects that resemble or gestures that reference female genitalia, see [[yonic symbol]].
two-tone coat: A [[multicolored coat]] that consists of exactly two colors.
torn bike shorts: A pair of [[bike shorts]] that have been visibly torn, whether by design or through an external event such as cutting or tearing.
shiranui mai:
A Japanese fire-wielding [[ninja]] from [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]] and later [[The King of Fighters]]. She debuted in [i]Fatal Fury 2[/i].

Her trademarks are her [[folding fan]], and her [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[Japanese clothes]] that show off her [[large breasts]], legs, and overall physique. She has [[brown eyes]] and most commonly wears her [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] tied up with an ornamental hairpin, usually referred to as a [[motoyui]].

Mai is the last native heir to Shiranui-ryuu Ninjutsu, with a particular skill in fire ninja magic. She has a loving infatuation with - and at least as of [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], is engaged to - fellow Shiranui-ryuu practitioner [[Andy Bogard]], whom she trained with at a relatively young age and she came to see as a good man (though she tended to move the relationship a little too quickly for Andy's liking). As of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], she and Andy both train a young Shiranui-ryuu disciple named [[Hokutomaru]]. She is good friends with most of the rest of the Fatal Fury roster, not least of which includes Andy's brother [[Terry Bogard|Terry]] and best friend [[Joe Higashi]]. In The King of Fighters, she is a founding member of the Women Fighters Team alongside [[King (SNK)|]] and [[Yuri Sakazaki]].

Mai is one of SNK's most popular characters, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions. Her oldest and arguably greatest cross-company rival is [[Capcom]]'s [[Street Fighter]]'s [[Chun-Li]]. She notably appears as a guest character in both [[Dead or Alive]] ([i]DOA 5 Last Round[/i] and [i]DOA 6[/i]) and [[Street Fighter 6]], being the second ever guest character (after [[Terry Bogard|Terry]]) to appear in a mainline Street Fighter title.

Due to her revealing attire, she was allegedly denied a cameo in [[Super Smash Bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]], since she would be challenging the game's [[CERO]] rating of A; the way Sakurai put it in the announcement ("[[Smash is for good boys and girls]]") was turned into a meme. She received a new outfit with her appearance in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]]. The [[tank top]] and [[short shorts]]/[[dolphin shorts]] casualwear/nightwear she wore in her [[SNK Heroines: Tag Team Frenzy|SNK Heroines]] ending, previously referenced in her and Andy's Real Bout Fatal Fury 2 endings, makes a cameo appearance as part of her character select animation in [[Street Fighter 6]].

yuzuki yukari:
Yuzuki Yukari is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] and [[VOICEROID]] developed by Vocalomakets and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID3 and VOICEROID+ engine on December 22, 2011. She is voiced by [[Ishiguro Chihiro]].

She has light [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[rabbit ears|rabbit eared]] [[hoodie]], [[halter dress]] (with a [[criss-cross halter]]), and [[striped legwear]]. She has [[hair ornament]]s, a single [[bracelet]], and shoes with an [[anklet]] design. Her hairstyle is [[short hair with long locks]] but it often looks like [[low twintails]].

In July 2020, it was announced that Yukari's next voicebank would be on the [[CeVIO]] engine. In 2021, voicebanks with the [[A.I. VOICE]] engine were also announced.

Her appearance is officially illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]].
red sleeves: A pair of sleeves that are colored [[red]]. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently colored from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).
fishing rod: A tool used to [[fishing|catch fish]] with a [[fishing line|line]] and [[fish hook|hook]].
denji (chainsaw man):
The protagonist of [[Chainsaw Man]].

Use this tag for Denji in his human or devil form. Do not mistake it with the [[Chainsaw Devil]]. Denji's devil form has an orange cover for his [[Chainsaw]] head, while the [[Chainsaw Devil]] has a dark grey/black [[Chainsaw]] head.
destruction:
When something is being destroyed in the picture. It may include [[debris]].

This tag is not for the aftermath of the destruction, use [[ruins]], [[broken]] or [[rubble]] for that.
bubble tea:
Bubble tea (also known as "pearl milk tea", "tapioca tea", "boba tea", or simply "boba") is a type of [[tea]]-based [[drink]] invented in Taiwan. It consists of a mixture of tea, milk, or other flavorings, plus small black tapioca balls ("boba") that float at the bottom of the drink. The drink usually comes with an extra-large [[drinking_straw|straw]], used to suck up and chew the tapioca balls.

In 2019, bubble tea experienced a sudden boom in popularity in Japan, with a corresponding rise in fanart featuring the drink.
hooded coat: A [[coat]] with a [[hood]] attached to it.
ushiromiya maria:
Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]], and [[ushiromiya_battler| Battler]]'s 9-year-old cousin. She is fascinated by the occult, and especially by the legends of [[Beatrice (umineko)|]]. She has a rather troubled relationship with her mother [[ushiromiya_rosa|Rosa]] and has no friends, to the point that her best friend is her [[stuffed_animal|stuffed lion]] [[Sakutarou (umineko)|]]. She often makes a sort of whining "[[uu~|uu-]]" sound that she repeats over and over.

Her witch alter-ego
tooth necklace: A [[necklace]] adorned with [[teeth]]. Often associated with rugged outdoorsy adventurers or [[tribal]] characters.
penis peek: Pulling [[underwear]] or other clothes so low the base of the penis or parts of the shaft can be seen. Also works in cases where clothes are small enough to show part of the [[testicles]] or only the tip of the penis, but does not count in the case of a fully exposed shaft with head (Example: Post #1760363).
soap: Hygiene product used for washing, bathing and cleaning yourself.
crab:
[[crustacean|Crustaceans]] with eyes on short stalks, a broad flattened carapace with a small abdomen folded under the thorax, and pincers.

A crab's flesh is used for a number of dishes.
hiroi kikuri:
One of the supporting characters in [[Bocchi the Rock!]].

She has [[purple eyes|purple]] (sometimes [[@_@|swirly]], otherwise [[ringed eyes|ringed]]) eyes, [[sharp teeth]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with a [[single braid|single]] [[hair over shoulder|over the shoulder]] braid [[hair bow|tied]] with a [[black bow]], and [[blunt bangs]]. Her nails are [[nail polish|painted]] [[black nails|black]].

She wears an [[open jacket|open]] [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black jacket|blac
miniboy:
A male character that appears extraordinarily small compared to his surroundings. 

For miniature non-human characters like creatures and animals, see [[undersized animal]].
lifting another's clothes:
When a person lifts up someone else's clothing. See [[lifting own clothes]] for when a person lifts up their own clothing.

This tag should always be used in conjunction with another [[clothes lift]] tag, such as [[shirt lift]], [[skirt lift]], [[bra lift]], etc. 

When the clothing being lifted exposes intimate/genital areas, also tag [[assisted exposure]].
tail wrap: When a character's [[tail]] is wrapped around someone or something.
contrail:
A vapor or condensation trail caused by [[airplane]]s.

Contrast with [[distrail]].
cane:
A long, sometimes curved stick used as an aid to walking or as a fashion accessory, which usually runs around the length of a person's leg.

Not to be confused with [[candy cane]] or [[staff]].
sakuragi mano:
The lighthearted and fluffy idol from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]] who somehow has an association with [[pigeon]]s. She is part of the unit Illumination Stars.

A pleasant and soothing girl with a compassionate personality. The type one would want to protect from looking at her, just being with her somehow brings feelings of happiness. First-year high school.

Voiced by [[Sekine Hitomi]].
clock tower:
A clock tower is a [[tower]] specifically built with one or more (often four) [[clock]] faces. Clock towers can be either freestanding or part of a [[church]] or municipal [[building]] such as a town hall.


For the video game series, see [[Clock Tower (series)]]
scowl: A look of displeasure, sullenness, or discontent in an [[angry]] kind of way. A kind of "I-really-don't-like-this" kind of look.
two-tone sports bra: A [[sports bra]] that consists of two colors.
sword over shoulder: A [[sword]] held or carried over the shoulder.
single gauntlet: When a character is wearing only a single [[gauntlets|gauntlet]] over one arm.
frog girl: A girl with [[frog]] characteristics, such as a [[long tongue]] and [[webbed hands]] and feet.
animal focus: One or more [[animal]]s are the subject of the image, e.g., {{cat animal_focus}}, {{rabbit animal_focus}}. Not to be used on [[furry]] characters.
pikachu:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0025 in the National Pokédex, an Electric-type.

A yellow [[mouse]]-like Pokémon, and the mascot of the [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] franchise. In the [[Pokemon (anime)|Pokemon anime]], it is the signature Pokémon of [[Ash Ketchum]]. It is voiced primarily by [[Ootani Ikue]].

Evolves from [[Pichu]], and into [[Raichu]]. It also has a [[Gigantamax]] form.

Playable in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series.

Japanese name: [b]Pikachu[/b]
fisting: Insertion of the entire hand into a body orifice.
over-kneehighs:
[[Socks]] or stockings that end just above the knee. In comparison to regular [[thighhighs]], they are shorter and leave a larger gap between the legwear and the [[skirt]] or [[dress]] in cases of [[zettai ryouiki]].

Judge length based on the distance from the top of the legwear and the knee, not the size of the gap. Combinations of certain clothing with full thighhighs can also produce a sizable area of exposed skin.

See post #86570 for reference, read the translation notes.
newspaper:
A scheduled publication containing [[news]] of current events, informative articles, diverse features, editorials, and advertising. It usually is printed on relatively inexpensive, low-grade paper such as newsprint.

One of these is the [[Bunbunmaru]] newspaper from the [[Touhou]] series.
wrist ribbon: A [[ribbon]] worn around a character's wrist.
sandwich: A food item consisting of two pieces of [[bread]] with one or more fillings between them. Different from a [[burger]] because sandwiches don't have a beef patty between them, instead using cold cut meats or warmed slices of meat.
akemi homura:
A character from [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[purple eyes]], and wears a [[hairband]]. When transformed into her [[magical girl|magical]] form, she wears a [[capelet]], a [[pleated skirt]], [[high heels|high heeled]] [[boots]] with [[argyle footwear|argyle]] patterns that cover the entire legs, and sometimes also has a [[shield]] on her lower left arm. She primarily uses mundane weapons such as guns and bombs. 

[spoiler]Her shield acts like a seemingly infinite portable storage space for her weapons, and also allows her to manipulate and travel through time.[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Saitou Chiwa]].
darkness:
Elemental or [[magic|magically]] altered darkness (a lack of [[light]]). Usually swirling around in [[dark]] [[cloud]]s or forming [[ink]]y [[tendril]]s.

* [[Rumia]] from the [[Touhou]] series
* [[Pride (fma)|]] from [[fullmetal_alchemist|FMA:Brotherhood]]
* [[Seras Victoria]] from [[Hellsing]]
* [[Marshall D. Teach]] from [[One Piece]]

skewer:
A thin stick used to hold small pieces of [[food]], especially grilled [[meat]] or vegetables.

The word 'skewer' may be used to refer to the stick itself or to the food item as a whole.
post-apocalypse: The desolation left behind after a huge war or other major disaster on a global scale. The settings were often used in fictional works of varying genres. Usually involves the theme of "survival of the fittest", a fascination of the bygone civilizations, an attempt to restore the old worlds, as well as a "savior" who protects the weak from the oppressive tyrant.
samurai: A feudal [[Japan]]ese [[warrior]] who wears traditional [[Japanese armor]]. Often wielding traditional Japanese weaponry, like the [[katana]], [[nagamaki]], [[naginata]], [[ootachi]], [[tachi (weapon)|]], [[tantou]], [[wakizashi]], [[yari]], or [[yumi (bow)|]].
summer festival:
A general term for various festivals celebrated in [[summer]] in Japan.

Festival-themed images are usually set at [[night]], and may include such things as:
* characters wearing [[yukata]] (or rarely [[jinbei_(clothes)|jinbei]]) and sometimes [[mask|masks]]
* characters holding [[bagged fish]], [[kinchaku]], [[uchiwa]], or [[water yoyo|water yoyos]]
* [[aerial fireworks]]
* [[food_stand|food stands]] and a wide variety of food, including:
** [[candy apple|candy apples]]
** [[chocolate banana|chocolate bananas]]
** [[cotton candy]]
** [[dango]]
** [[ikayaki]]
** [[sausage|sausages]]
** [[shaved ice]]
** [[takoyaki]]
** [[yakisoba]]
** [[grilled corn]]
* [[paper_lantern|paper lanterns]]
* [[goldfish scooping]] with [[poi_(goldfish_scoop)|poi]]
* [[yo-yo fishing]]
* [[katanuki]]
* [[shooting gallery]]
* [[ring toss]]
baby bottle: A bottle that is for feeding babies.
negligee:
A form of women's clothing consisting of a sheer, usually long (floor or knee length), dressing gown. It is a form of [[nightgown]] intended for wear at night and in the bedroom.

Modern negligees are often [[lingerie]] that are loose, made of sheer and semi-translucent fabrics, and trimmed with [[lace]] or other fine material and bows. From the 1940s to the 1970s, the trend was for negligees to become shorter in length (e.g. the [[babydoll]]).
cocktail: A mixed [[drink]], usually a mixture of [[alcohol]] with fruit juice, flavored syrups, cream, or other ingredients. Usually served in a specialized [[cocktail glass]], but an ordinary [[drinking glass]] may be used as well. More exotic cocktails are typically garnished with [[fruit]] and [[flower|flowers]] and may be served in a [[coconut]] [[fruit cup|shell]].
pee: The yellowish liquid that is released from the bladder during [[peeing|urination]]. Formally known as urine.
triangle mouth:
An [[open mouth]] in the shape of a triangle.

If the top is pointed, and the bottom is rounded, that's [[chestnut mouth]] instead.
hose:
Long rubber tube through which [[water]] runs.

Do not use this tag for [[pantyhose]].
tented shirt:
A [[shirt]] that tents out beneath the [[breasts]]. Usually caused by a character with [[large breasts]] wearing a shirt that is tightly [[shirt tucked in|tucked in]], or otherwise [[shirt tug|tugged down]].

The Japanese term is 乳テント ([i]chichi-tento[/i], lit. "boob tent").

Mutually exclusive with [[underbust]].
noa (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. She serves as the secretary for Millennium's student council, [[Seminar (blue archive)|]].

Her full name is Ushio Noa. Often the subject of offshoots of the [[gomen yui]] meme ("[[gomen yuuka]]").

She wields a modified [[SIG SAUER P320|]] [[handgun]] based on "Tokyo Marui":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Marui]'s Hi-CAPA Xtreme .45 with a carbine conversion kit.

Voiced by: [[Suzushiro Sayumi]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]] (original design)/[[DoReMi]] (in-game art)
horseback riding: The act of [[riding]] a [[horse]] or horse-like creature. This includes [[unicorn|]]s, [[pegasus|]]es, [[centaur|]]s, other equids like [[donkey|]]s mechanical horses on [[carousel|]]s, and [[pony play|people pretending to be horses]].
manjuu (azur lane): The small yellow [[chick]]-like creatures in [[Azur Lane]]. The creatures are the logo and mascot of one of the [[Azur Lane]] developers, Shanghai Manjuu Network Technology Co., Ltd. (上海蛮啾网络科技有限公司), called "manjuu" for short.
mechanical horns: [[Horns]] that look mechanical or cybernetic in nature.
juice box: A small hand sized, typically rectangular, [[cardboard]] [[box]] used to contain juice or other beverages. The [[drink]] inside is usually consumed with a [[drinking straw]].
ahri (league of legends):
A [[vastaya|vastayan]] Champion from Ionia in [[League of Legends]] usually played as an AP mid. She is a [[kyuubi|kumiho]], a fox spirit from Korean legend. Known mostly for her [[multiple_tails|nine tails]], seductive appearance and ability to charm other Champions into helplessly moving towards her.

Full title: [b]Ahri the Nine-Tailed Fox[/b]
fingering through clothes: The act of [[fingering]] the [[pussy|vulva]], [[anus]] or the area in that region through clothes.
yuuki mikan: [[Yuuki Rito]]'s little sister. Good at domestic housework, and very reliable. Also close to [[Konjiki no Yami]].
bakugou katsuki:
Deuteragonist of [[Boku no Hero Academia]], and [[Midoriya Izuku]]'s rival since childhood. His Quirk allows him to produce explosions from the sweat on his hands. Bakugou is very aggressive and short-tempered, often yelling at others or threatening to kill them. He has a superiority complex and hates being looked down on.

Bakugou has [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He is the only student in Class 1A who does not wear a tie with his [[school uniform]].
jirai kei:
A fashion subculture for "landmine-type" girls that originated in Japan's "Kabukichō":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kabukich%C5%8D] district and first spread in popularity in early 2020.

Fashion consists of two sides: 量産型 (ryousangata, literally "mass production") - a more mainstream girly style, and サブカル (subculture) - the more alternative and dark variant. Do note that the latter term is also used for alternative fashion in general.

Ryousangata tends to use a lot of pink with some black accents, and often uses frilly [[blouse]]s, [[suspender skirt]]s, [[choker]]s, heart decorations, [[bow]]s, [[platform shoes]], and [[ankle socks]].

Subculture jirai, on the other hand, leans towards darker color palettes such as black, grey, red, and white. [[layered clothes|Layered clothing]] is common, as are [[chain]]s, striped patterns, fishnets, [[leg warmers]], [[track jacket]]s, and [[boots]].

Both sides of the fashion use makeup that accentuates the [[aegyo sal]] and gives the face a "sickly-cute" appearance.
crescent earrings: [[Earrings]] shaped like a [[crescent]], but doesn't run through the earlobe or another hoop like [[hoop earrings]] do.
basketball:
A team sport. The objective is to shoot a [[basketball_(object)|ball]] through a basket horizontally positioned to score points while following a set of rules. Usually, two teams of five players play on a marked rectangular court with a basket at each width end. Basketball is one of the world's most popular and widely viewed sports.

Use this tag when referring to the game as a whole.
Use [[basketball_(object)]] when referring to the ball.
uzaki hana:
Main character of [[Uzaki-chan Wa Asobitai!]]. A short, noisy, [[large_breasts|large-breasted]] girl who often annoys her senpai, [[Sakurai Shin'ichi]].

She frequently wears a [[raglan sleeves|raglan]] [[shirt]] with [[SUGOI DEKAI]] (super huge) written on the chest. This shirt has become [[meme attire]]. Other characters wearing the shirt shouldn't be tagged as [[Uzaki Hana (cosplay)]], unless they're specifically cosplaying her.
chess piece: Any of the various pieces or "men" used to play [[chess]].
tassel hair ornament: A [[tassel]] worn as a hair ornament.
object insertion from behind: When an [[object insertion|object is inserted]], either vaginally or anally, by reaching behind the back or around the legs.
hand to own mouth:
When a character puts their hand(s) near their own mouth without covering it, such as when [[yawning]] or [[laughing]].

If their hand is covering their mouth, use [[hand over own mouth]] instead.
spoken exclamation mark: An exclamation mark symbol ([[!]]) that is spoken aloud, often in a [[speech bubble]].
o_o:
Eyes drawn as solid white circles with a thick black rim. Used to express [[surprised|surprise]].

If the eyes are solid black, use [[solid circle eyes]] instead.

These are not tagged [[blank eyes]].
soldier:
An [[military]] personnel trained, equipped, and [[weapon|armed]] to fight in a [[war]]. They usually wear [[military uniform]]s, often with [[combat helmet]]s and [[body armor]]. 

For characters which belong on certain special forces, use [[military operator]] instead.

Not to be used for random armed combatants or insurgents (even with [[camouflage]] attire), without clear context implying if they belong on the military or not.
cover:
Cover art of any type, whether real or "mocked-up".

When tagging a cover, always use one of the tags that implies it:

* [[cover page]]
* [[dvd cover]]
* [[album cover]]
* [[magazine cover]]
* [[video game cover]]
* [[doujin cover]]
* [[fake cover]]
multiple earrings: When more than one [[earrings|earring]] has been pierced into one ear.
spoken anger vein:
An [[anger vein]] inside a [[speech bubble]].

If you want to use the mark in a translation note, use the 💢 character or use the Unicode character entity reference: [code]💢[/code].
akatsuki uniform: The black [[uniform]] with drawings of red [[xiangyun|whorled clouds]] that is worn by the members of [[akatsuki_(naruto)|Akatsuki]], a group of characters of [[Naruto]].
makinami mari illustrious:
She is a newly introduced female character for the new movies [[Rebuild of Evangelion]], a retelling of the original series. She pilots [[eva_05|Evangelion Unit-05]].

[b]Note:[/b] please add the "Rebuild of Evangelion" tag when she is present in images, as she is not a character from the original series.
mizuno ami:
The blue-haired character from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] (aka. Pretty Soldier Sailor Moon) by [[Takeuchi Naoko]], who transforms into [[Sailor Mercury]]. She is considered a genius schoolgirl, but gradually opens up to hanging out with her friends more.

Voiced by [[Hisakawa Aya]] in the 90s anime, and [[Kanemoto Hisako]] in Crystal.
holding dagger: Someone is [[holding]] at least one [[dagger]]. Add [[reverse grip]] when applicable.
gun to head:
When a character is pointing a [[gun]] directly to their head or a [[weapon|gun]] is being held to their head for any reason.

Note that a character posing like this may not constitute a [[suicide|suicidal]] moment.

In [[Persona 3]], characters hold (and [[firing|fire]]) a special gun (an [[Evoker]]) to their heads to summon their Persona. Images of such "evoking" fall under this tag.
hand over own mouth:
When a character uses their hand(s) to cover their own mouth.

If their hand is near their mouth but not covering it, use [[hand to own mouth]] instead.
cigarette pack:
A typically small container of [[cigarette]]s in which they're sold.  They can either be a resealable hard pack, which is a paperboard [[box]], or a non-resealable soft pack, a light paper wrapping.  Governments typically regulate the minimum number of cigarettes per pack, commonly with a minimum of at least 20.

A carton of cigarettes is a box or container that contains usually 10 packs of cigarettes.

* !post #8079563
mutual masturbation:
Two or more people manually stimulating themselves or each other at the same time.

This includes both couples [[masturbation|masturbating]] together, without touching one another, and couples stimulating each other with their hands, whether through [[fingering]] or [[handjob]]s.
orange bodysuit:
A [[bodysuit]] that is colored orange.

Note that it is easy to confuse a Caucasian character's skin tone for an orange bodysuit, so exercise good judgment when using this tag.
mechanical wings: [[Wings]] made of metal. Hydraulic parts, screws, cables and glowing LEDs are a plus, as are clockwork parts like [[gear]]s.
grey sky: A [[sky]] which is [[grey]]. Often caused by rain and/or clouds.
magatama: A "magatama":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magatama is a curved, "comma-shaped" bead or jewel, usually worn on a necklace. Often made of jade, magatama were produced in prehistoric Japan, and are associated with ancient Japanese mythology. (Similar jewels were found in ancient Korea, where they are called "gogok":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gogok].) A famous example is the Yasakani no Magatama, one of the three [[japanese regalia|imperial regalia of Japan]]. Sometimes worn for its religious meaning, sometimes just as a fashion accessory.
yagasuri: A usually monochromatic [[tag group:image composition|traditional Japanese pattern]] of tiled [[arrow (projectile)|]]-feathers.
white cat: A [[cat]] whose fur is entirely [[white]]. Often associated with [[maneki-neko]], the Japanese lucky cat. White cats are associated with purity and are said to bring about positive changes.
red sky:
A blood-red sky.

This tag implicates [[sky]]. Don't use it for posts where the sky isn't a significant part of the image (forum #162192).
yunomi:
A tall, roughly cylindrical [[cup]] with no handle, traditionally used in Japan to drink [[tea]].

For the Japanese bowl-shaped teacup, see [[chawan]].
kaku seiga:
The "Wicked Hermit Who Passes Through Walls", also nicknamed Seiga Nyan Nyan  (青娥 娘々 [せいが にゃんにゃん]), lit. Lady Seiga. Stage 4 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]] and owner of [[Miyako Yoshika]] respectively. Often also seen with [[Ibaraki Kasen]] as a fellow hermit. 

Her name came from the title and name of the heroine of "青娥":[https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/聊齋志異/第07卷#.E9.9D.92.E5.A8.A5], an episode from "Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strange_Tales_from_a_Chinese_Studio Volume 7.
pince-nez: [[glasses|Eyeglasses]] which are supported without earpieces, by pinching the bridge of the nose.
finger on trigger:
[[Holding gun|Holding a gun]] with the finger on the trigger or inside the trigger guard, especially when not prepared to safely [[firing|fire]] it. The opposite of [[trigger discipline]].

It is possible for someone [[dual wielding]] to practice [[trigger discipline]] with one hand and not the other, e.g. post #1188474.
updo:
A women's hairstyle where the hair is tied up and held high at the back of the head, usually in a more elaborate style than a simple [[hair bun]] or [[ponytail]]. The hair may be held in place by [[braid]]s, [[hairclip]]s, [[hair stick]]s, or [[hair tie]]s.

This hairstyle is most commonly seen on dressier occasions such as weddings.
camouflage pants: Any style of [[pants]] that have a green-and-brown-ish camouflage pattern.
hair beads:
[[Beads]] that are strung together and worn as a [[hair ornament]] for decoration, or a hairpiece that keeps hair into a [[ponytail]], [[twintails]] or similar.

For hair ornaments resembling pairs of larger beads, see [[hair bobbles]].
saori (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Leader of [[Arius Squad (blue archive)|]].

Her full name is Joumae Saori.

Uses a [[SIG 516]] [[assault rifle]] with a [[scope]] and [[foregrip]] attached alongside an [[M1911]] TACOPS [[handgun]].

Voiced by: [[Ishigami Shizuka]]
Original artist: [[9ml]]
hair wings:
[[Wings]] that are actually made of the character's hair, often substituting [[twintails]].

For wings on a character's head that aren't made of hair, use [[head wings]]. 
For wing-shaped accessories on a character's hair, use [[wing hair ornament]].
For hair with feathers but not full-on wings, use [[feather hair]].
red headband:
A [[headband]] that is colored [[red]].

Not to be confused with a [[red hairband]].
artoria pendragon (swimsuit ruler) (fate:
Ruler-class version of [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]] first appearing in the [[Kenzan! Las Vegas Gozenjiai]] event. This one is based on her [[Artoria Pendragon (lancer) (fate)|Lancer]] version, sporting a [[playboy bunny]] outfit. While she calls herself the Summer Lion King and has the same lime [[green eyes]] with [[bright pupils]] as the [[Lion King (Lancer) (fate)|Lion King]] appearing in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] singularity, she says she is "entirely different".

[b]Do not add the [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer) (Fate)]] tag unless they are depicted together, or one is cosplaying as the other.[/b]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ishida Akira]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]
butterfly print: Any article of clothing or object made out of fabric that has a [[butterfly]] printed motif.
zabuton: A zabuton (座布団) is a flat rectangular [[cushion]] used when [[sitting]] on the [[floor]].
chick: A young bird, especially of a terrestrial domestic fowl.
at computer: When a character is either using a [[computer]] or in position to use a computer.
sessyoin kiara:
Wizard and master of [[Hans Christian Andersen (fate)|Caster]] in [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]].[spoiler] She leads a virtual Buddhist cult whose beliefs involve around rising to a higher plane of existence via sexual activity. She's the true antagonist and final boss of the game. [/spoiler]

Another version of her is the therapist of a branch of Chaldea in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s chapter [i]Abyssal Cyber Paradise, SE.RA.PH[/i]. [spoiler] She's later taken over by the [[demon pillar (fate)|Demon God Zepar]], taking on the personality of her CCC self, and ultimately transforms into a Beast-class Servant.[/spoiler] Her playable version is under the Alter Ego designation. While her nun and demon designs are present in both CCC and FGO, her design with arms printed on a longer dress and horns adorned with rings and tassels is exclusive to FGO.

An [[sessyoin_kiara_(swimsuit_mooncancer)|alternate Moon Cancer-class Servant]] and her [[sessyoin_kiara_(lily)|aged down]] version were introduced in FGO's Summer 2020 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tanaka Rie]]
camouflage jacket: Any style of [[jacket]] that has a green-and-brown-ish [[camouflage]] pattern.
log pose: A valuable object from the [[One Piece]] series. A special kind of compass for navigating the treacherous seas of the Grand Line. Similar in design to a wrist watch, only with an orb sitting on top and a floating needle.
elesa (pokemon):
[b]Elesa[/b], known as [b]Kamitsure[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon bw|Pokémon Black and White]][/i].

This Electric-type Gym Leader also works as a model. Watching her battle in the beautiful, bright lights of her Gym can be mesmerizing [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Zebstrika]].

In [[pokemon bw2|BW2]], she has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[purple hair|hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[blunt bangs]]. She wears [[headphones]], a [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[fur jacket|jacket]], [[red nails|red]] and [[blue nails|blue]] [[nail polish]], a [[crop top]] and [[bike shorts]] tied by [[buckle]], and [[flats]]
okita souji (fate): Catchall tag that allows searching for all versions of Okita Souji from the [[fate (series)|Fate]] series simultaneously.
breast focus: A post focusing on someone's [[breasts]], especially in a [[close-up]].
hand on another's neck:
When one character has one of their hands on another character's neck, whether it be on the nape of their neck at the back, or in the front.

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on another's neck]].
element bending:
A term from the [[avatar legends|Avatar]] series for abilities based on the classical elements. Probably too ambiguous and copyright-specific to be useful as a tag.

See [[aerokinesis]], [[geokinesis]], [[hydrokinesis]], and [[pyrokinesis]] for characters using supernatural powers to manipulate particular elements.
two-sided fabric:
A piece of fabric (e.g. a [[skirt]], [[cape]] or [[cloak]]) with different colors or patterns on each side (c.f. [[colored inner hair]]).

For instance, this might be a garment with a separate liner of a different fabric, or a single piece of fabric that looks different on the front and back. This could also be a reversible garment designed to be worn inside-out with a different color or design (e.g. a jacket).
horns through headwear: [[Horns]] passing through headwear (a [[baseball cap]], a [[hood]], etc).
puppet:
A [[doll]] of cloth or wood, which can be operated by a puppeteer by means of strings and cable or by wearing it as a glove.

If it's controlled with [[puppet strings]], it's a [[marionette]].

Some puppets have proper names like [[Shanghai Doll]] or [[Pinocchio (disney character)|]].
colored shoe soles:
Outsoles that do not match the body and are colored, white on non-[[sneakers]], or black on white footwear.

This tag does not implicate [[shoe soles]] since the bottom side surface may not be significantly visible, particularly [[high heels]] which are most likely able to apply this tag from non-below angles compared to other footwear.

[b]Avoid[/b] this tag when:

* feet lie flat and the toes are facing directly toward or away from the viewer resulting in a tiny amount of visible soles.
* the footwear is viewed [[from above]] in standing position.
* the footwear is [[uwabaki]], or similar, which are white-and-colored by default and the color covers the toe box, unless focused on [[shoe soles]].
pink pants: Any style of [[pants]] that are colored [[pink]].
jumpsuit:
A jumpsuit (boilersuit, coveralls, worksuit, etc.) is a loose-fitting one-piece garment that covers the arms and legs. Used by mechanics, plumbers, aviators, and skydivers.

For jumpsuits that have leg lengths similar to [[shorts]], use [[short jumpsuit]] instead.
tree shade: Shadows cast by [[tree|trees]], commonly used to escape the heat on warm, sunny days. Often results in [[dappled sunlight]].
morino rinze:
A composed Japanese-type girl from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]]. She is a member of the unit [[Houkago Climax Girls (idolmaster)|]].

A yamato nadeshiko with a calm demeanor. She is always well-mannered and will make a bit of space to treat others with respect. Unexpectedly she likes shoujo manga as a hobby. First-year in high school.

Voiced by [[Maruoka Wakana]].
candy apple:
Also known as [b]Toffee apple[/b], in Commonwealth English.

A whole [[apple]] covered in a hard sugar candy coating, [[caramel]], or [[chocolate]]. Candy apples are a common treat at [[autumn]] [[festival]]s such as [[Halloween]].

It is easy to mistake a candy apple for a red [[lollipop]] due to artists drawing a candy apple spherical. So take notice of the surroundings, flat bottom/top and size of the candy.
furisode:
A furisode (振袖, lit. swinging sleeves) is a style of [[kimono]] distinguishable by its dangling sleeves, and made of very fine, brightly colored silk. It is the most formal style of kimono worn by unmarried women in Japan.
H4. Examples
* !post #8643314
sanshoku dango:
Pink, green and white [[dango]] on a single [[skewer]], also known as [[hanami]] dango (flower-viewing dango).

Not to be confused with [[bocchan dango]], which is green, yellow, and brown.
stone wall:
A wall which is constructed from [[rock|stones]] (in their natural-looking form) instead of bricks or concrete.

h1. See also
* [[cobblestone]]
* [[stone floor]]
* [[stone walkway]]
hand in own hair: Characters with a hand in their own hair.
storefront: The front entrance to a store, restaurant or similar establishment. Characters can be doing a variety of activities at the storefront, such as an employee welcoming customers, shoppers entering ready to [[shop]], or likewise leaving with bags of purchased goods. Clothing stores may have one or multiple [[mannequin|mannequins]] [[display|displayed]] behind large glass windows wearing the store's clothing as mock demonstrations. For a restaurant or cafe, a server can be bringing food to diners who
nonomi (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|]].

Her full name is Izayoi Nonomi.

Weapon of choice is an [[M134 Minigun]].

Voiced by: Miura Chiyuki
Original artist: [[9ml]]
against railing: When a subject in a post leans against [[railing]].
v-neck:
Topwear with a V-shaped neckline, most commonly found in [[shirt]]s and [[sweater]]s

For outfits with a "v-neck" that trails down notably low - often to reveal the inner crease of the [[cleavage|breasts]] or [[pectoral cleavage|pectorals]] - see [[plunging neckline]] instead.
incoming food:
A character [[feeding]] or offering food to the viewer.

For when the viewer is feeding a character, see [[fed by viewer]].
chef hat: Any kind of [[hat]] commonly worn by [[chef]]s.
sports bikini:
A bikini with a [[sports bra]]-like top.

Can also apply to a sports bra-top-[[buruma]] combination seen in sports such as running events or beach volleyball tournaments.
digitigrade:
A digitigrade is a creature that stands or walks on its digits, or toes. Digitigrades include walking birds, cats, dogs, and many other mammals. This also includes any [[monster girl]]s or [[monster boy|boys]], actual monsters and alien beings. It is also common in [[furry]] artwork closer to the animalistic side of the spectrum.

Sometimes called "reverse-jointed", as digitigrade legs can look like they have a "knee" that bends the opposite way to a human knee. However this "knee" is in fact the heel; the actual knee may not be immediately apparent.
hachimiya meguru:
An energetic girl from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]]. She is part of the unit Illumination Stars.

She has an innocent, naive personality, and will talk to anyone assertively. At any rate an energetic girl who thinks of her friends. She has a Japanese father and an American mother. First-year in high school.

Voiced by [[Mineda Mayu]].
shimakaze (kancolle):
[b]Shimakaze[/b] (島風, lit. "Island Wind") is the personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shimakaze[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. 

Shimakaze has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. She wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[serafuku]], [[striped thighhighs]], [[white_gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], a short [[miniskirt]] with [[black_panties|black]] [[highleg panties]] which show off her [[ass]], and a [[black hairband]] with long floppy "ears". She has small robot familiars called [[Rensouhou-chan]]s which represent her three twin "12.7 cm/50 naval gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/12.7_cm/50_Type_3_naval_gun turrets.
mahjong: A game for four players that originated in China. A very popular gambling game in east Asia, comparable to poker in the West. The object is to score points by forming certain combinations of tiles. Mahjong solitaire was widely distributed on computers in the 1980s, leading to some confusion between it and the original multiplayer version.
figure: A small-scale [[statue]] modeled after a character.
telekinesis: Objects that appear to be mentally controlled by someone. If there is a more specific tag for what is being manipulated (e.g. [[hemokinesis]], [[hydrokinesis]], [[pyrokinesis]]), use that tag instead.
beretta 92: A series of 9×19mm [b][[handgun]][/b] designed and manufactured by Fabbrica d'Armi Pietro Beretta of Brescia, Italy in 1975. It can be recognized by the large slide cutout exposing much of the barrel and the slide-mounted safety/decocking lever (the original model had a frame-mounted safety). Use this tag for all Beretta 92-pattern [[weapon]]s, like the Taurus PT-92 (Brazil), ATI AT92C, PAMAS G1 (France), Beretta 96 (USA) .40 S&W version), etc.
laughing: An involuntary reaction to a humorous comment, story, joke or situation. It can involve producing sounds from the lungs while the face and body are contorted, and bearing a wide [[smile]] to express amusement or mirth.
large tail:
A [[tail]] at least as large as the character it belongs to.

Popular combinations include [[large tail]] + [[fox tail]] and [[large tail]] + [[squirrel tail]].
letterman jacket:
A sports [[jacket]] commonly worn by American high school/college students and athletes. Traditionally, the wearing of such a jacket indicates that the student has met a specified level of participation or performance on a varsity team.

Letterman jackets commonly have a large letter (hence "letter"man) on one side on the jackets chest, indicating typically the name of a school or team. The sleeves are often a different color from the jackets body. The jackets collar is often also horizontally striped.
female service cap: The type of hat that is sometimes issued by organizations as the female uniform's equivalent of the [[peaked cap]]. It often looks sort of like a flat-brimmed hat whose sides or back have been folded up. It's seen in the [[Japan Self-Defense Force]], on [[train conductor]]s, and [[flight attendant]]s.
power symbol:
One of two symbols composed of a Zero (Circle) and One (vertical line) overlaid on top of each other.

Under the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) 60417 standard, Graphical symbols for use on equipment, 0 is the symbol for "off" and 1 is the symbol for "on." Combining these two symbols you get either the symbol for "on/off" (a circle with a vertical line inside of it) or "stand-by" (an incomplete circle with an opening at the top and a vertical line sticking out of the opening).  For electronics it is very common to see the "Standby" symbol used nowadays, as the electronic device does not completely turn off but instead goes into a low power state.

The symbol in [[Purple Heart (neptunia)|]]'s eyes in images like post #1151905 is an example of the "stand-by" symbol.
volleyball:
A team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a [[volleyball net]]. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team's court under organized rules. It may be played on grass, sand, snow, or on an indoor court such as in a [[gym]].

[[Beach volleyball]] is a popular variant with two players per team and a slightly different set of rules.
pointing up: The act of [[pointing]], usually with the index finger, in the direction of the sky.
cross-laced skirt: A [[skirt]] with criss-crossing laces, strings or ribbons.
jessie (pokemon):
[i]Prepare for trouble![/i]

Jessie is the female half of the [[Team Rocket]] duo pursuing [[Ash Ketchum]] in the [[pokemon_(anime)|Pokémon anime]] and in [[pokemon:_the_electric_tale_of_pikachu|Pokemon: The Electric Tale Of Pikachu]]. Her partner in crime is [[James (pokemon)|]].

In Japanese, she is named after the legendary swordsman [[Miyamoto Musashi]].
plum blossoms:
The blossoms of plum trees, especially of the genus [i]Prunus mume[/i]. The petals are white, pink or red, and bloom in early spring. 

Distinguished from cherry blossoms in that cherry petals have slits at the ends of the petals. Plum petal ends on the other hand are round.
H4. Examples 
* !asset #7899985: from left to right: plum, peach, cherry
* !asset #24982687: photos of various plum blossoms 
* !post #4243163

The plum blossom is the national flower of [[China]], and is an important cultural symbol in the country. Images depicting China more often feature plum blossoms than cherry blossoms.
junketsu: [[Kiryuuin Satsuki]]'s uniform in [[Kill la Kill]]. Unlike [[Senketsu]], it never speaks, and its gender (if it has one) is unknown.
dirty clothes:
Clothes that have been stained with dirt, mud, or filth.

For clothes stained by other substances, see [[blood on clothes]] or [[food on clothes]].
metal skin:
Some or all of of a character's skin is made of metal. A common feature of many [[cyborg|cyborgs]] and [[android|androids]] that aren't designed to look convincingly human, but it may also be the case with non-mechanical beings such as certain [[golem|golems]] or [[elemental_(creature)|elementals]].

Don't use this tag unless the skin actually appears to be made of metal. Seams, overlapping plates, and a lustrous finish are valid reasons to use this tag. Skin that is simply grey or yellow is not; that's what the [[grey skin]] and [[yellow skin]] tags are for. Shiny coverings that aren't actually metal might be [[scales]] or a [[carapace]].

This tag shouldn't be used for non-humanoid [[robot]]s or [[mecha]] since they aren't typically meant to have "skin" anyway.
iono (pokemon): A digital influencer and streamer who is the [[Gym Leader]] of Levincia's Gym in [[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sv|Scarlet and Violet]]. She specializes in Electric-type [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]]. Known as [b]Nanjamo[/b] in Japan.
squirrel girl:
A girl with squirrel-like features, such as [[squirrel ears]] or a [[squirrel tail]].

For characters who themselves are named or nicknamed [i]Squirrel Girl[/i], see:

vanishing point:
Use this tag when the [[perspective]] of a picture appears to draw the viewer's eye towards a central point.  An example might be a city street as seen from the center of the road.

Convergence of the background of an image towards a single point is the key.  Do not confuse this for any use of [[perspective]] -- e.g., most [[checkered floor|checkered floors]]. For example, post #140887 just has [[perspective]], but post #1341879 has a [[vanishing point]].

It is possible for an image to contain multiple vanishing points, especially if you're viewing a scene from an angle. See, e.g. post #1312088.

This is an artistic technique, so don't bother with images with a [[photo background]] unless it's a major focus of the image. One can assume nature gets it right.
bokeh:
A photographic effect where circular [[depth of field|out-of-focus]] points of light appear in the background of the image.

Bokeh can represent known light sources in the background of an image, but can also occur in seemingly random places all over the image. The latter, known as "orbs":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orb_%28optics%29, are from light reflected off of particles in the air which would otherwise not be visible.

[[Lens flare]] artifacts can look similar to bokeh, but are due to bright light being reflected inside the camera, and don't line up with the original light source (which may not even be visible in the image).

They also have some magic in their bodies, giving them magical swords or the ability to breathe fire from the severed head.

In anime and videogames, the Dullahan is sometimes portrayed as an animated suit of [[armor]]. Examples include [[Dullahan (golden sun)|]] from [[Golden Sun]], an optional final boss character, or the [[Durahan]] species of monster in [[Monster Farm]].
seductive smile: A sultry expression with usually [[half-closed_eyes|half-lidded eyes]] and a smile. Similar to [[naughty face]], but the look is more inviting and assertive, instead of teasing and mischievous. Also known as "bedroom eyes."
skull and crossbones: A symbol consisting of a human skull and two long bones crossed together under the skull. This symbol has a few different uses, but two of the more common uses are as a symbol for poison and as a symbol for [[pirate|piracy]].
lowleg pants: A style of [[pants]] made to fit around the hips and thighs, often emphasizing the [[midriff]], and sometimes revealing [[underwear|undergarments]] and the [[ass]].
zzz: A [[sound effects|sound effect]] generally used to portray [[sleeping]], [[snoring]] or the soft, quiet breathing during sleep.
shovel:

Also includes the spade, which is usually pointier. The "[[spade_(shape)]]" tag is reserved for the card suit.

For the small gardening hand tool used for digging see the [[trowel]] tag.

imminent kiss:

The characters' mouths should be in close proximity to each other. Often there will be [[head_tilt|head tilting]], [[blush|blushing]], [[grabbing another's chin|chin grabbing]], [[closed eyes|eye closing]] (alternatively, direct [[eye_contact|eye-to-eye contact]]) and other such bodily cues present.

Not to be confused with [[incoming kiss]], which is an incoming kiss from the character to the viewer.

Depending on how ambiguous it is, this tag may overlap with [[after kiss]].
eye mask: A piece of cloth that goes over the eyes, but leaves them exposed. Commonly seen on [[bandit]]s, [[superhero costume|superheroes]], and [[Zorro]].
multiple wings: Having more than one pair of wings.

Her school attire consists of a [[black hairband]], [[green dress|green]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[yell
front ponytail: Hair wrapped and tied beneath the chin. [[Kagiyama Hina]] is the most popular example of this hairstyle.
kagiyama hina:

usekh collar: A type of broad collar or necklace worn by [[ancient Egyptian]] elites.
chalk:
A type of writing utensil typically used on a [[chalkboard]] or sidewalk. For these commercial uses, it is usually formed into a cylindrical shape, variable in length, diameter, and even color.

Use this tag when a stick of chalk is present, not just markings made by chalk.
barn: A type of [[building]] found on [[farm]]s used to store agricultural equipment, animals, and fodder. Often painted red.
kanabou:
A traditional Japanese [[spiked club]]. Also known as tetsubou (鉄棒). Typically made of heavy oak wood and studded with iron [[spikes]], later versions were sheathed in iron or even made of solid iron. 

Often found in the hands of [[oni]], the great weight of the kanabou being considered a natural match for an oni's immense strength.
arm around waist: A character's arm wrapped around another's waist.
playground: An area designed for children's social and recreational activities, usually in [[outdoors|outdoor]] settings such as [[park|parks]] or [[school]] grounds. Typical playground installations include [[bench|benches]], [[swing|swings]], [[slide|slides]], [[sandbox|sandboxes]], and [[jungle gym|jungle gyms]].
ribbon bondage: Image in which a character is bound or restricted by long [[ribbon]].
ribbed sleeves: A pair of sleeves that have a ribbed pattern. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently patterned from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).
ribbed thighhighs:
[[Thighhighs]] that have a ribbed pattern, creating the appearance of vertical stripes.

Not to be confused with [[vertical-striped thighhighs]] or [[pinstripe thighhighs]].
vial:
A small, usually glass, vessel. Vials are typically used to contain small amounts of liquids or powders, especially [[medicine]] or chemical samples. They are made in various shapes and sizes.

Generally speaking, this tag is used for small sealable glass containers for which no other tag would fit.
gusset: An inset piece of material used to strengthen and/or or enlarge the crotch of [[pantyhose]] or [[leggings]].
grey-framed eyewear:
