sweaty clothes: Clothing darkened or made [[see-through clothes|see-through]] due to [[sweat]] soaking the fabric.
writing: A character is depicted writing on something.
half-closed eye: When one of a person's eyes is about halfway closed but not completely, while the other eye is open or [[one_eye_closed|closed]]. mimikaki: A tool used for [[ear cleaning]]. The most common design has a fuzzy tip on one end and small spoon on the other end. Also known as an ear pick or an ear spoon.

red gemstone:

tachi-e:
A [[straight-on|forward-facing]] style of character sprite popular in visual novels. They are commonly (but not always) [[full body]], [[standing]], and feature a [[simple background]].

Tachi-e originated as character art in [[visual novel]]s and adventure games. Often this is a [[looking at viewer|front-facing]] [[game cg|character sprite]] used during conversations with various prepared expressions and poses that can be switched as it flows. It does not strictly require your character to be standing, nor be [[full body]] (e.g. from the [[cowboy shot|knee]] or [[upper body|waist]] up), as long as art is reusable enough - it should qualify.

Aside from the regular tachi-e used in story mode, many gacha games' skin illustration will also have a tachi-e aesthetic, thus they sometimes also come with a [[faux figurine]] counterpart, usually being its evolved form. A clean character art removed from a faux figurine will also likely become a tachi-e if the character is standing, if they're sitting it's [[invisible chair]] instead.

When tagging, use the following rule of thumb: if you can slap an image onto the random background, add a textbox and the result will look like [[fake screenshot]] it should probably be considered a Tachi-e.

Tachi-e is [b]not[/b] applicable if image:

* Has more than one instance of the character ([[turnaround]]s, [[reference sheet]]s, [[multiple views]], [[variations]], [[multiple expressions]], etc...): post #3490670, post #2195716, post #3213462, post #2538995, post #2288278
* Has non [[simple background|simple]] or non [[transparent background]]s ([[zoom layer]]s, [[gradient background]], etc..): post #2925837 (vs post #2951458), post #4133229 (vs post #4133230), post #4028183, post #4151481
* Is a [[character profile]] or featuring character [[stats]]
* Is a [[faux figurine]] or a [[dakimakura (medium)|]]
* Has a tachi-e within [[screenshot]]s or [[fake screenshot]]s: post #818170,  post #1713628
* Has an extra [[outline]]: post #3589935 (vs post #3589913)
hair ears: Hairstyles mimicking [[animal ears]], can be used alongside [[impossible hair]] if it looks unrealistic enough. Could be the result of intense [[hair intakes]], [[cone hair bun]]s, or [[hair flaps]].
purple sky: A body of [[sky]] that is colored [[purple]].
pain: A symptom of some physical [[injury]] or bodily suffering. The usual expression of pain is [[wince|wincing]] and [[tears]]. In more comical images pain can be indicated by "pain-lines", a lightening bolt that hovers over the injured area, a giant [[bandaid]], and a character [[cowering]] in front of their attacker or holding their head.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single hull piece to her back containing both her funnels, foremast, and a 12.7 cm twin gun mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a second 12.7 cm twin mount and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] as [[handgun]]s. 

Due to similarities in appearance, she is frequently compared to characters from other franchises, including [[Mash Kyrielight]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]], [[Rem (re:zero)|]] from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]] and occasionally [[Konpaku Youmu]] from [[Touhou]] and [[2B (Nier:Automata)|]] from [[Nier:Automata]].

pink pupils: A character has [[pink]] pupils in their eyes instead of the standard black.
thread: A long, thin strand of cotton, nylon, or other fibers used in [[sewing]], [[stitching]], [[embroidery]], or weaving.

single sleeve: When an upper-body garment (such as a [[shirt]] or a [[jacket]]) only has one sleeve. If the garment has two sleeves of different lengths, use [[uneven sleeves]]. Do not use this tag for singular gloves, bridal gauntlets, detached sleeves etc.
cephalopod eyes:

* Obvious examples: post #6656274, post #4069806
* Subtle examples (nearly identical to rectangular [[horizontal pupils]]): post #6223494, post #1660157

narrow waist: A waist narrower than the rest of the figure. Good candidates (not requirements) are those less than half width the of the hips or as narrow as the head.
lineart:
Art consisting mostly of solid lines, with no coloring or shading.

Image should be finished-looking, with crisp, clean lines. Basically, it's one step away, whether it's color or shading, from being a professional-looking work. For rougher-looking art, see [[sketch]].

For linearts with more coloring than [[spot color]], use [[partially colored]] instead.
imminent fellatio:

volleyball uniform: A uniform for playing [[volleyball]]. It typically consists of [[short shorts]] (sometimes [[bike shorts]] or a [[buruma]]) and a tight [[sleeveless]] [[jersey]]. [[Knee pads]], [[elbow pads]], and [[elbow sleeve]]s are common accessories.

swimming: Movement through [[water]] using one's arms and legs.
impaled: Being [[stab]]bed all the way through by something long and sharp, such as a [[sword]], [[spikes]], [[horns]], or [[spear]].

ibaraki kasen:
"The One-Armed, Horned Sennin"

Introduced in the official comic [i]東方茨歌仙 ([[Touhou]] Ibarakasen) ～ [[Wild and Horned Hermit]][/i], serialized in Chara☆Mel Febri. An enigmatic [[pink hair|pink haired]], [[red eyes|red-eyed]] (or [[pink eyes|pink]]) "pilgrim" with her right [[bandaged arm|arm]] wrapped in [[bandages]] whose search for the "Kappa Arm" led her into the Hakurei Shrine. It is soon revealed that [[amputee|there is no arm inside her bandages]], which are instead filled with a mysterious magical smoke. She wears a [[tabard]] with a [[red rose]], a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] and a [[green skirt]]. Her appetite for [[steamed bun]]s also has her frequently depicted with [[large breasts]] and/or [[eating]].

Due to the [[shackles|shackle]] on her left arm, her suspicious [[double bun]]s with [[bun cover]]s, and her title implying the existence of horns, there is rampant speculation among fans that Kasen is an [[oni]], specifically [[Ibaraki Douji_(mythology)|]], one of the Big Four. Some of Kasen's actions, such as her avoidance of [[Ibuki Suika]], also contribute to the speculation.

She is often accompanied by her pets: [[Koutei (touhou)|]] the dragon, [[Kume (touhou)|]] the giant eagle, [[Kanda (touhou)|]] the young eagle, [[Mukou (touhou)|]] the raijuu, and [[Houso (touhou)|]] the tiger.

Since both characters are hermits, Kasen is often associated with [[Kaku Seiga]], though usually on an antagonistic basis since Seiga is a "wicked hermit". 

[spoiler]Wild and Horned Hermit 35 revealed she is one of the Sages of [[Gensokyo]] alongside Yukari.[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Wild and Horned Hermit 49 would not only introduce her severed arm given semi-physical form, [[Ibaraki Douji's Arm]], but Kasen herself would become one with her arm and fully become an oni once more, revealing herself to be one of the Big Four, [[Ibaraki Douji (Touhou)|Ibaraki Douji]]. Also associated with [[Miyako Yoshika]] as the real Miyako No Yoshika wrote poems that Douji supposedly liked. [/spoiler]

clothes between breasts: When an article of clothing is nudged in between the breasts.

unworn gloves: A glove or pair of [[gloves]] are present in the image but they are not being worn.

clothed after sex: When a character is shown putting their clothes back on (e.g. post #1660407, post #2431121) or already fully dressed (e.g. post #1645318) but with some obvious clues that they've very recently had [[sex]] or [[masturbation|masturbated]]. She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]], usually in a [[ponytail]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]]. Normally dressed in her [[school uniform]] with an [[open jacket]] and [[cardigan vest]].
triforce:
The Triforce is the symbol of Hyrule in [[The Legend of Zelda]] series. The Triforce is split into three different parts, which in the games are always borne by the three central characters of the Zelda saga:

* The Triforce of Courage, which is held by [[Link]].
* The Triforce of Wisdom, which is held by [[Princess Zelda]].
* The Triforce of Power, which is held by [[Ganondorf]].

Whoever possesses all three parts of the Triforce can have any desire that he or she wants granted, but the effects of this wish upon the rest of Hyrule is largely based on whether the bearer of the Triforce is good or evil.
toast: A [[bread slice|slice of bread]] that has been [[toaster|toasted]]. Often topped with butter or [[jam]].
frog print: Clothing or an object that has either a [[frog]]'s body or just its face printed on it.
tsukino usagi:
The [[blonde hair|yellow]]  [[double bun]]-haired protagonist of the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She is a carefree schoolgirl who is often absent-minded, lazy, and a cry-baby. But she is also a good friend and stepped up many times to help others in distress.

She was found by a black cat named [[Luna (sailor_moon)|]], to become the [[Sailor Senshi|Inner Senshi]] known as [[Sailor Moon]] the "Soldier of Love". 

Her hairstyle is largely associated with her, thus making her one of the most immediately recognizable and iconic anime characters worldwide.

Voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]] in both the 90s anime and Crystal. She is the only voice actor to reprise her role in Crystal.
kimono pull: Pulling down a person's [[kimono]]. Similar to [[shirt pull]], but may or may not expose the wearer's chest.
tail through clothes: A [[tail]] going through a piece of clothing, often through an [[ass cutout]]. Only tag [[ass cutout]] if the actual cutout is visible.
path: Broad tag encompassing various types of [[road]] not built for vehicular traffic. Examples include hiking trails, paths worn by wildlife or livestock, or the approach (参道) to a Shinto [[shrine]].
quiver: A container for [[arrow (projectile)|]]s. For the movement, see [[trembling]].
symmetry: An image that is symmetrical. This is usually when the entire image can be divided into two halves that look the same in some way, except they're rotated or flipped.
paper bag:
A [[bag]] made out of recycled paper. Typically colored [[brown theme|brown]], and associated with [[shopping bag|shopping bags]], although they can be used as [[gift bag|gift bags]] as well.

Not to be confused with carrying bags that are actually [[brown bag|colored brown]].
twisted torso:
A character's torso turned to a high degree, sometimes even beyond human limits. This can occasionally result in [[bad anatomy]].

It's a popular pose with artists, to show both a character's [[ass]] and [[breasts]] at the same time.
skyline:
A skyline is the outline created by a [[city]] over the horizon, usually against the background of the sky. Major real-world cities have distinctive skylines that can serve to identify a location without having to name it.

For images without cities, consider the [[horizon]] tag instead.
skirt tug:
Tugging on one's own [[skirt]], usually to [[covering crotch|cover the crotch]]. The opposite of a [[skirt lift]].

If the skirt is being pulled down to reveal rather than to cover, use [[skirt pull]].
reverse spitroast: An act of [[group sex]] similar to [[spitroast]], except that instead of one man (at least) at each end of a woman, there is one woman (at least) at each end of a third partner. Not to be confused with [[male spitroast]].
fingers together:
Ambiguous tag. Use one of the following tags instead:

* [[steepled fingers]] - All fingers are together.
* [[index fingers together]]
* [[interlocked fingers]]
* [[own hands clasped]]
* [[own hands together]]
* [[palms together]]
* [[holding hands]]
* [[four-finger heart hands]]
* [[kuji-in]]
* [[mudra]]
* [[double fox shadow puppet]]
* [[fox shadow puppet kiss]]
* [[kitsune no mado]]
* [[finger frame]]
* [[two-finger salute]]
tropical drink: A beverage that is prepared and served in a glass decorated with [[tropical]]-themed items such as flowers and/or fruits.
strapless bra:
A [[bra]] without straps, relying on an extra-wide band for breast support. 

They are designed to be worn with [[strapless]] clothing that would otherwise expose the bra straps. They achieve their strength through a longer underwire that encompasses more of the breast, and cups with added padding, boning, and shaping panels. Some have rubberized or silicone beading inside the top edge of the cup to help keep the bra attached to the breast. Some convertible bras allow the straps to be removed, making them into strapless bras.

Don't confuse [[strapless bra]]s with [[tube top]]s or [[bandeau]]s. A strapless bra has cups, while tube tops and bandeaus don't.
volleyball net: A [[net]] that separates both teams in [[volleyball]].
dressing:
The act of putting on clothes. 

Use this tag only when there is enough context within the image to definitely tell that the character is putting on clothes, not taking them off. If you are unsure whether clothes are being put on or taken off, use [[undressing]].
sausage: Similar to a [[hot dog]], but has ground meat pumped into an edible casing either synthetically made or derived from animal intestines. Sausage making is a common method of preserving meats.
on grass: A subject is in full contact with [[grass]], usually by "sitting":[/posts?tags=sitting+on_grass] or "lying on their back":[/posts?tags=on_back+grass].
okobo:
Japanese [[platform footwear|platform]] [[sandals]] that were traditionally worn by [[geisha]] during their apprenticeship. The most notable type in fanart are the black-lacquered kind with red straps. 

Technically, the black-lacquered finish is only worn mainly during summer, and the color of the straps used changes depending upon how far along the apprentice geisha is in her training.

Not to be confused with [[geta]], which have two square "teeth" on the sole instead of being made as a solid block, or [[zouri]], which are flat like flip flops.
razor: A bladed tool used for [[shaving]]. See [[razor blade]] for the individual disposable blade itself.
waking up: When a character is waking up or is awake but [[sleepy]].
unaligned breasts:
[[Breasts]] that are bouncing in opposite directions, or that are resting at different angles. One breast points up while the other points down.

See [[breasts apart]] for breasts that are splayed sideways in different directions.
argyle: A pattern that is made of plaid diamonds in a diagonal orientation.
unsheathed:
A [[sword]] that is outside of it's [[sheath]]. The sheath should be present in the image for using this tag.

* When the sheath contains a weapon, use [[sheathed]].
* When the weapon is partially sheathed, consider using [[unsheathing]].
gold ship (umamusume):
[i][[Umamusume]][/i] character.

Gold Ship is the self-proclaimed [[pakatube|PR manager]] of the Umamusume franchise and a [[virtual youtuber]], active since March of 2018. 

As a popular character and her real-life lineage having some "serious implications":[/pools/17253] in the Uma-verse (for one thing, she would be related to the Mejiro family), she is often being portrayed as a [[aged down]] child, usually with her real-life birth color, which is chestnut.
duck:
A general term for wading waterfowls.

In Japanese, domestic and wild ducks are called differently, アヒル (ahiru) and カモ (kamo) respectively.
ringlets:
Hair that is curled into cylindrical tubes.

Not to be confused with [[drill hair]], which is hair curled into a cone shape rather than a tube shape.
foot up:
One foot being braced on a solid surface above another.

For one foot being lifted up in the air, use [[leg up]] instead.  For the toes being lifted with the heel on the ground, use [[toes up]]. For the heel being lifted with the toes on the ground, see [[heel up]].
kuwayama chiyuki:
Chiyuki is a calm and tender woman from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]]. She is in the unit [[Alstroemeria_(idolmaster)|]]. 

She used to be the oldest idol in the game, but was usurped by [[Aketa Mikoto]].

Her kind smile makes an impression, and is like everyone's older sister at the office. Her appearance characteristically overflows with calm motherliness. She is skilled with her fingers and likes to make cute small things as a hobby.
streaming tears: [[Tears]] manifesting as twin solid streams, either flowing straight down the face or (more comedically) flying off to either side.
studded bracelet: A [[bracelet]] that is layered with metal studs.
belfast (azur lane):
The personification of the Royal Navy light cruiser HMS [i]Belfast[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Kisetsu]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]].

As the current head [[maid]] of the Royal Maid Corps, she is extremely responsible and professional, taking pride in her dedication to perfectionist service, caring for and constantly addressing the [[Commander (Azur Lane)|]] as "Master", while being gentle and friendly towards most people. She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]], and her signature [[maid]] outfit features a [[chain]] [[choker]] and a [[low neckline]] that exposes a generous amount of [[cleavage]].

She is [[yuri|shipped]] with [[Enterprise (azur lane)|]] in the official anime. While in story, she succeeds her [i]Town[/i]-class elder sister [[Newcastle (Azur Lane)|]] as the head maid of the Royal Maid Corps.

The real life [i]Belfast[/i] was saved from scrapping by private venture and became a tourist attraction afterwards. She is currently part of the Imperial War Museum, permanently moored on the Thames river, near the Tower Bridge, London, since 1971.
convenient leg:
Used for cases where the placement of a leg blocks the view of the crotch, whether one is wearing panties or not.

[b]Also see[/b]: [[convenient censoring]]
tsukino mito:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[Nijisanji]], part of the inaugural batch of eight. Designed by [[Nezumidoshi]]. 

Her character is a 16-year-old, 2nd year high school student who is president of her class. As such, she often starts her videos with the phrase "Stand! Attention!" (きりーつ! 気をつけ!), and fans have responded by calling her "Chairman" (委員長 | iinchou). 

She often collaborates with her fellow classmates [[Higuchi Kaede]] (who shares the same illustrator) and [[Shizuka Rin]], under the name [[JK Gumi (Nijisanji)|JK-gumi]]. She reached one million subscribers on 12 December 2022, the fifth Nijisanji VTuber to reach this milestone.

She was one of Nijisanji's first eight VTubers revealed on Feb 7th, 2018. Since then, she has become the most prominent of the group and [i]de facto[/i] first character. Like the other Nijisanji personalities, her content focuses on livestreams and direct interaction with her audience.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and dark [[blue eyes]].
rapier: A long and slender, yet sharp-tipped [[sword]] used in thrusting attacks. It usually has a complex hilt which provides protection for the hand of the person who wields it.
between toes:
Something (e.g. hair, a [[knife]], a [[pencil]], etc.) is between the [[toes]] of someone.

If someone is holding something with their foot or feet, it is also [[holding with feet]].
on vehicle: Use a more specific tag, such as [[on_car]], [[on_motorcycle]], etc.
qiqi (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character. An apprentice and herb gatherer at Bubu Pharmacy.

"Blessed" by the adepti with a body that cannot die, this petite [[jiangshi]] cannot do anything without first giving herself orders to do it. Qiqi's memory is like a sieve. Out of necessity, she always carries around a notebook in which she writes anything important that she is sure to forget later. But on her worst days, she even forgets to look at her notebook...

Her name is pronounced [b]Nana[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.
spoken blush:
[[Blush]] sign in a [[speech bubble]], with text or without.
Often appears as several slashes: ///
spoken musical note: When a musical note is either inside a [[speech bubble]] or follows a simple line from a character who has their mouth open. It expresses joy and pleasure.
nishizumi miho:
The main protagonist of the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Tank commander and leader of Team Anglerfish in a [[Panzer IV]], and overall commander for "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Ooarai Girls Academy / Team Anglerfish

h6. Original Anime

She was born into the distinguished family of the Nishizumi-style of Tankery, but she changed schools to Ooarai Girls Academy intending to run away from Tankery.  However, perplexingly enough, she was extorted into joining Tankery by the student council.  A junior in high school that considers her friends feelings more than anything else.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1283978)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Overall commander for the Ooarai Girls tankery team, and boards the Panzer IV Ausf.H (originally Ausf.D) as the tank commander.  Second daughter of the Nishizumi family which heads the Nishizumi-style of tankery.  Following the 63rd National Tankery Tournament, she led the team to victory against the Selection University team and secured the existence of the school.  Has a warm personality, but when faced with a problem, is able to put together flexible tactics that go beyond the limits of the Nishizumi-style.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]
kindergarten uniform:
A [[school uniform]] for preschool children (5 or under), typically consisting of a simple [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue shirt]] or blouse and a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[school hat]]. Boys often wear [[shorts]] while girls wear a [[pleated skirt]]. Common accessories include a [[kindergarten bag]], a [[school hat]] and a [[name tag]]. Sometimes called a [[smock]] in Japanese.

H4. Examples
* !post #4548124
* !post #4285063
* !post #8655829: girls' and boys' uniform.
blank censor: When an entire body part is [[censored]] by drawing it as a blank blob. For example, when an entire [[penis]] is rendered as a blank white or black blob.
eye of horus:
An [[ancient Egyptian]] symbol, also known as the eye of wadjet, wedjat, or udjat.

Often refers to a specific tattoo visible on [[Pharah (Overwatch)|]] from [[Overwatch]] or an Egyptian motif from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] series.
deer tail: A [[tail]] based off of a [[deer]] or [[reindeer]].
\\n/:
The 🤘 hand gesture. The index and pinkie fingers are raised, while the middle and ring fingers are held down by the thumb.

Known in the West as "the sign of the horns", "the devil's horns", or "throwing the horns". Often associated with [[heavy metal]] music, which was made popular by [[Ronnie James Dio]]. Originated as an apotropaic gesture to ward off the "evil eye," a curse cast by [[glaring]] at someone with hostility.

Not to be confused with [[\m/]] (🤟) (when the thumb is held out) or with [[fox shadow puppet]] (when the fingers are extended forward to make a fox muzzle).
exusiai (arknights):
[i]Exusiai, employee of Penguin Logistics, will clear out everything in the way using her guns[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lemuel
long earlobes:
Earlobes that are naturally elongated, without piercings or body modification.

Earlobes can be elongated for a variety of social, cultural, and religious reasons; most depictions of a [[Buddha]], for example, will have long earlobes in reference to the tale of Gautama Buddha.

See [[plug (piercing)]] for the type of ear piercing that sometimes stretches out the earlobe, also known as ear gauges.
hand on another's cheek:
When one of a character's hands is placed on another character's cheek.

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on another's cheeks]].
torpedo: A self-propelled weapon with an explosive warhead, launched above or below the water surface, propelled underwater towards a target, and designed to detonate either on contact with its target or in proximity to it.
jellyfish: A type of aquatic creature with a gelatinous umbrella-like bell and long tentacles. The bell helps with movement in the water while the tentacles capture prey.
violin:
A musical [[instrument]] of the string family. Basically it consists of a formed, resonating box over which are suspended a fingerboard and four tightened strings. The player holds the larger end under the chin and the opposite end in the hand. Meanwhile, the other hand draws a [[bow (music)|]] over the strings to make them vibrate; alternately, this strings can be plucked. Said vibrations are amplified in the resonator. 

The violin produces notes in the [[treble clef|treble]] range. It may be played with the performer sitting (usually in a chamber or [[orchestra]] setting) or standing (often in a solo context). In folk or country music settings, the instrument is often labeled "fiddle."
starry background: See [[starry sky background]] or [[star symbol background]].
oversized animal:
An animal or [[creature]] that's much larger than it would be in real life: for example, a housecat the size of a horse or even a house.

Does not necessarily apply if a person happens to be unusually tiny in comparison to the animal. In that case, you may just be looking at a [[miniboy]] or [[minigirl]].
arm hug:
Hugging another character's arm (using both arms to surround another's arm).

For characters that have only a single arm linked, see [[locked arms]].
red theme: An image where red is the dominant color. For example, a [[monochrome]] image that is red, or an image with an overall red color theme.
ibaraki douji (fate):
An [[oni]] Berserker-class Servant appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first appearing as a boss in the [[Kikoku Suimu Makyou Rashoumon]] event before being introduced as a playable servant in the [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] event.

Her Noble Phantasm is Rashoumon Dai Engi. Has red-tinted hands and feet, and carries a bone sword. The first "Raid Boss" in Fate/Grand Order, her story is later expanded upon in the [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] and [[Halloween Comeback!|Halloween 2016]] (where it is revealed that she secretly likes sweets) events. Holds a deep grudge against [[Watanabe no Tsuna (fate)|]] for cutting off her hand, in the original mythology.

She is nicknamed "banana oni" by the fanbase due to her overall yellow color scheme and her wide forehead which seamlessly transitioned into her hair, giving her a very smooth forehead.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Hidari (Left Side)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Touyama Nao]]
bird ears:
Ears with bird-like characteristics. Note that birds in real life don't have external ears.

Most common on [[Mystia Lorelei]].
nilou (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Her signature weapon is [[Key of Khaj-Nisut (genshin Impact)|]].
billiards:
A family of [[sport]] played on a [[pool table]], a table with six receptacles called pockets along the rails, into which balls are deposited as the main goal of play.

There are several variants of  cue sports, including:

* Billiards, which involves taking out numbered balls in order before taking out the final one.
* Snooker, which involves taking out as many red balls as possible before taking out the other colored ones.

For tagging purposes, this tag covers any kind of cue sports as mentioned above.
pool table: The table used when playing [[billiards]] or snooker. It has several pockets located around the edges for [[billiard ball|cue balls]] to fall into when struck by a [[cue stick]].
watering can: A portable can with a long open spout extending from one side and a handle on the top, designed for manually [[watering]] [[flower]]s and [[plant]]s.
animal on shoulder: When an animal rests on a person's shoulder.
chikan: A person [[groping]] another without permission in a crowd, a rush-hour train, etc.
yuzuki choco:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[2nd generation (hololive)|]]. A school doctor at a Makai school. She is a [[demon girl]] who looks like a succubus but isn't one. Designed by [[Masuishi Kinoto]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], [[green eyes|green]]/[[aqua eyes]], [[pointy ears]] and [[large breasts]] with a [[winged heart]] [[winged heart tattoo|tattoo]] on her [[breast tattoo|left breast]]. Being a demon, she also has [[black horns|black]] [[demon horns]] with [[horn ring|ring]]s on her left horn, [[demon wings|wings]], and a [[demon tail]].

Her default hairstyle consists of [[swept bangs]] and a [[single sidelock]] with a [[tress ribbon]].
steam censor: A classic way to [[censored|censor]] naughty parts of characters is to have large amounts of [[steam]] obscure the right places. This is assumed to better than using [[bar censor|bar]] or [[mosaic censoring]] because it feels more natural and does not disturb the image balance too much.
aris (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Game Development Department (blue archive)|]].

Her full name is Tendou Aris, though it is frequently spelled as "Alice" or "Arisu" instead. She is sometimes nicknamed "Roomba" due to her nature as a robotic organism (bolstered further by her maid alt) or "Fridge" thanks to the shape of her [[railgun]].

Voiced by: [[Tanaka Minami (voice actor)|]]
Original artist: [[DoReMi_(doremi4704)]]
greyscale with colored background:
An image where the subject is in [[greyscale]] but the background is colored. It's usually also a [[simple background]].

Do not tag these as [[greyscale]], [[partially colored]] or [[spot color]].

If parts of the image other than the background are colored, such as the subject's eyes, [[spot color]] can be used. If the subject has enough coloring on itself that you'd tag it [[partially colored]], simply use that tag instead and do not tag it as greyscale with colored background.
bronya zaychik:
A [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]/[[Benghuai Xueyuan]] character. Voiced by [[Asumi Kana]] in Japanese.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied into [[drill hair|drills]], and [[grey eyes]].
walkie-talkie:
A handheld [[radio]] transceiver unit.

See [[field radio]] for backpack-mounted radio units.
frilled collar:
A [[collar]] with [[frills]].

This is for standalone collars not part of a shirt. Don't use for collars that are part of a [[collared shirt]], [[collared dress]], etc. Use [[frilled shirt collar]] instead.
cheek-to-cheek: When two or more characters' cheeks are touching. This usually represents intimate, or at least extremely friendly, behavior.
jougasaki rika:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Passion (Yellow Sun) category. She is 12, with long, [[blonde hair]] and a [[kogal]] fashion sense. Her interests include stickers and beetles. Although she tries to act like an adult, she is very childlike on the inside.

Her sister is [[Jougasaki Mika]]. Since she is the younger sister, Rika was nicknamed Imoutogasaki (妹ヶ崎). Her card's high stats in the game attracted many players to obtain her along with Mika.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the first CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Futaba Anzu]], [[Shibuya Rin]], [[Mimura Kanako]] and [[Takagaki Kaede]]. Her seiyuu is [[Yamamoto Nozomi]] [山本 希望].

She is in the unit "Dekoration" with [[Akagi Miria]] and [[Moroboshi Kirari]], and their unit costumes are [[Pikapikapop (idolmaster)|]] in the anime.
boxing gloves: A type of thickly cushioned [[gloves]] worn for [[boxing]]. They reduce facial and hand injuries, but don't prevent brain damage.
yumemi riamu: [b]Yumemi Riamu[/b] (夢見 りあむ, ゆめみ りあむ) is an [[idol]] appearing in [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]], debuting on February 7, 2019. She is voiced by [[Hoshiki Seena]].
furrowed brow:
When the skin on the forehead (the brow) becomes creased due to concentration or anxiety. Very commonly these skin wrinkles aren't explicitly drawn but are depicted as eyebrows with inner tips bending up.

[[Raised eyebrows]] may skip this tag if the entire eyebrow is a slight curve.
floating object: An object such as a [[floating book|book]] or [[floating weapon|weapon]] floating in air without visible, physical support.
hexagram:
A hollow [b]six-pointed[/b] star ✡ formed by overlapping two equilateral triangles. When used as a symbol of [[Jewish]] religion or cultural identity, it is called the [[Star of David]]. Its three-dimensional analogue is the [[stellated octahedron]].

* !asset #20083187
hyakumantenbara salome:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], designed by [[Wata (attaka towel)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] done in a twin [[drill hair|drill style]], and [[purple eyes]].
lain paterson:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the group [[Eden-gumi]]. designed by [[Lack]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks to the front]], tied into a [[ponytail]] and [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]], [[grey eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

She has a living shark-shaped ammunition pouch named [[hohojiro-san (lain paterson)|Hohojiro-san]].
full-length zipper: Images where someone is wearing a one-piece garment with a full-length [[zipper]] from the neck past the [[navel]].

A Russian fur [[hat]] with ear flaps that can be tied up to the crown of the cap, or tied at the chin to protect the ears, jaw and lower chin from the [[cold]].

character hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] modeled after a specific character.
no eyes: When the artist forgets to add in eyes, the character's [[hair over eyes|hair is covering their eyes]] or [[shaded face|the areas around a character's eyes darkens]] (often done for dramatic effect). See [[hollow eyes]] for empty eye sockets.
harem pants: A style of (often but not always) transparent puffy pants commonly seen in stereotypical depictions of harems.
mahjong tile:
A thick, blocky tile used in the game of [[mahjong]]. Mahjong tiles are traditionally made of bamboo and bone, although most modern tiles are made of plastic.

A mahjong set usually consists of 144 tiles. They are:
* 108 suited tiles. There are three suits, each numbered 1 to 9 with four tiles each number, thus 36 per suit:
** Circles
** Bamboos (1 Bamboo actually has a bird pictured to deter cheating by adding more bamboo lines)
** Characters (Chinese numerals with 萬, [i]man[/i]/[i]wan[/i
transformation: When a character undergoes a physical body change.
whiskers: Thin hairs on the face that animals use for sensing.
marina (splatoon):
[[Splatoon 2]] character. Named [b]Iida[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[octoling]].

She is part of the band Off The Hook (Tentacles in the Japanese version) with [[Pearl (splatoon)|]], which has its own television show.

Her default costume & appearance features a black [[crop top|cropped]] [[cropped vest|vest]], [[green pantyhose|green]] / [[aqua pantyhose]] under [[black shorts]], black [[boots]] and black [[fingerless gloves]]. She has a [[navel piercing]] and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. She has [[green eyes|green]] / [[aqua eyes]], often depicted with [[red pupils]] as [[cephalopod eyes]]. She often wears [[headphones]]. She is often depicted with a [[furrowed brow]] / [[raised eyebrows]].

Her Japanese name comes from the word for the "webfoot octopus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphioctopus_fangsiao (イイダコ [i]Iidako[/i]). As revealed in [i]Octo Expansion[/i], her full name is [b]Marina Ida[/b] in English; [b]Marine Iida[/b] in Japanese.
sabrina (pokemon):
[b]Sabrina[/b], known as [b]Natsume[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [[pokemon rgby|Pokémon Red and Green]].

A powerful psychic herself, this Gym Leader who uses Psychic types can see the future with her precognitive powers. She allegedly does not like conflict. Her signature Pokémon is [[Alakazam]].

In her [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]] outfit, she has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears a [[bodysuit]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[red jacket|red]] [[turtleneck jacket|turtleneck]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] jacket, [[white gloves|gloves]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[side slit]] skirt, [[yellow thighhighs|yellow]] [[over-kneehighs]], and [[red boots]].

In her [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, she has red eyes, [[long hair|long]] [[flipped hair]], a [[crop top|cropped]] [[pink camisole]] that exposes [[midriff]], large [[bracelet]]s, [[white pants]], and [[pink slippers]].
large hat: A [[hat]] that is notably larger than the wearer's head, or larger than a normal hat of the same design.
martha (fate):
Rider-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Martha was a saint of the 1st century said to have tamed a [[dragon]] named [[Tarasque (fate)|]]. She can summon said dragon as her Noble Phantasm. Typically acts like a calm female saint, except for the few times her actual boisterous country-girl personality emerges.

She has [[purple hair|purple]]-[[blue hair|bluish]] hair in [[hime cut]]. She wears a [[leotard]]-esque robe with a deep [[plunging neckline]] reaching her [[midriff]] section. Martha typically uses a [[cross]] [[staff]] in battle, though she will not hesitate to use her fist when unable to holding back her anger.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Sakamoto Mineji]] 
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Hayami Saori]]
tonguejob: Performing [[fellatio]] by wrapping the [[penis]] with a [[long tongue|long]] or [[prehensile tongue]]. A technique often depicted in use by [[frog girl]]s (especially [[Asui Tsuyu]]) and [[lamia]]s.
very long tongue: A [[tongue]] with length equal to or longer than the length of the character's face. Often [[prehensile tongue|prehensile]].
hands in opposite sleeves:
When hands are completely tucked inside opposite [[wide sleeves]]. 

Not to be confused with [[sleeves past fingers]], which is when the character's hands are covered by the corresponding sleeves, and not the opposite ones.
open hands: Displaying both hands opened. If only one hand is open, use [[open hand]] instead.
guitar:
A plucked stringed [[instrument]], either [[electric guitar|electric]] or [[acoustic guitar|acoustic]], with a long neck.

Closely related to the [[bass guitar]] except that a standard guitar typically has [b]six strings[/b] and six tuning pegs at the top of the neck. On rare occasions a guitar may have more strings than that (e.g. 12).

Do not tag [[bass guitar]]s as regular guitars. A bass guitar has four strings, while a regular guitar has six.
zhongli (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Wangsheng Funeral Parlor's mysterious consultant. Handsome, elegant, and surpassingly learned. Though no one knows where Zhongli is from, he is a master of courtesy and rules. From his seat at Wangsheng Funeral Parlor, he performs all manner of rituals.

[spoiler]His true identity is [[Rex Lapis (Genshin Impact)|]], The Geo Archon.[/spoiler]

As a result of certain in-game lore, he is sometimes drawn in a [[genderswap_(mtf)|female form]].

His name is prono
mousetrap: A spring-loaded contraption designed to catch mice, rats, and other rodents.
snowman:
A handmade sculpture made out of compacted [[snow]]. Usually it consists of two or three large snowballs stacked on top of each other, then adding decorations like a [[hat]] or [[bucket]], [[coal]] or [[rock]] for the eyes and buttons, a [[carrot]] for the nose, a [[scarf]], and twigs for arms.

For non-snowman-shaped snow art, see [[snow sculpture]].
helicopter: An [[aircraft]] that flies using rotor blades to generate lift.
footwear bow: Any form of footwear that have a [[bow]] on them.
kicchou yachie: Matriarch of the Kiketsu Family The fourth stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is a [[turtle shell|turtle]]-[[dragon girl|dragon]] creature, a Jidiao or Kicchou (吉弔), with [[short hair|short]], [[blonde hair]], [[red eyes]], a prominent [[dragon tail]], and a pair of [[antlers]]. She wears a [[blue_shirt|blue shirt]] with a [[blue skirt]] and a pair of [[mary janes]]. Her eyes are [[yellow eyes|yellow]] in [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]] Yachie is a manipulative leader whose ability nullifies her opponents will to fight back. Her Kiketsu Family specializes in surprise attacks. She and her organization are responsible for luring the protagonist to the Animal Realm, as part of a staged invasion with the other organizations. She's the leader of the [[otter_spirit_(touhou)|Otter spirits]].
kettle:
A container for boiling water. Kettles are normally metal and have a lid, spout, and handle. The handle is generally placed at the top so that the kettle can be hung over an open fire. 

For the large cooking/boiling pots used over an open flame, use the [[cauldron]] tag instead.
blood bag:
A small bag full of [[blood]], which has been collected from the patient or from a blood donor in order to replace that patient's blood should there be a lot of blood loss during surgery, or from exsanguination due to a critical [[injury]].

Different patients/donors' blood is collected, analyzed and grouped according to blood type, of which there are four: "A, B, AB, and O":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_blood_group_systems, depending upon inherited antigens. There is also the + and - sta
cue stick: The long, thin stick used in playing [[billiards]]. It is used to poke at a [[billiard ball]] in order to knock balls against each other and send them rolling into pockets on the table.
grand piano:
A type of acoustic [[piano]] whose strings, frame and soundboard are laid out horizontally. Can be found in varying lengths between roughly five and ten feet, from the keyboard at one end to the tail at the other. Such an instrument carries a much larger footprint than an upright piano or spinet, but makes a much greater sonic and visual impact.

Occasionally, an electric or digital piano will be mounted in a grand piano-shaped [i]case[/i], such as found at post #527947.
linea alba:
The linea alba is a wide band of connective tissue from the sternum to the pelvis. Because it runs above the [[abs|abdominal muscles]], it will become visible before the "six pack" as one loses body fat. Use this tag for when the [[stomach]] appears to have some degree of [[toned|definition]], but not enough to show individual abs.

For the line in the middle of the back, see [[median furrow]].
black border:
An image with a black [[border]] along all four sides.

See [[letterboxed]] for when the image has black bars along the top and bottom sides. See [[pillarboxed]] for when the image has black bars along the left and right sides. See [[outline]] for when an object within the image has a black outline.
on bench: Someone is on a [[bench]], regardless if they're [[sitting]], [[squatting]], [[standing]], [[lying]] and such.
matoba risa:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Passion (Yellow Sun) category. Risa is a demanding young girl who absolutely loves her Daddy. It seems her father gives her anything she wants, and she seems to have a cheetah or tiger motif. She usually wears prints of these animals in her clothes. Unlike the vast majority of idols in the series, she sees the Producer as the second most important man in her life: Daddy always comes first and foremost.

She is voiced by [[Tamegai Hana]].
sweatband: [[Wristband]]s and [[headband]]s made from [[sweat]]-absorbent materials (in other words, they usually look fluffy).
tusks:
Elongated front teeth, often visible outside the mouth. Typically elongated incisors or canines. Frequently seen on [[Orc]]s.

Opposite of [[fangs]] which are usually smaller upper teeth.
open hoodie:
A [[hoodie]] left [[unzipped]] or [[unbuttoned]].

If the wearer is naked underneath the hoodie, [[naked hoodie]] may apply as well.
hair tie in mouth: A person holding a [[hair tie]] (including [[scrunchie|scrunchies]]) in their mouth, usually while [[tying hair|tying their hair]].
caution tape:
Various colored tape that can carry words like "[[Keep out]]" or "Crime scene: Do not enter". Usually the tape has a yellow background with black text, but other variants do exist like orange/black or in the case of police caution tape, white background with blue or black text with or without a checkered square pattern.

May or may not be adhesive. Most caution tape are designed to be strung between two or more points.
mop: A wooden pole with a sponge or absorbent fibers at the end, used to clean [[floor]]s.
tsushima yoshiko: One of the main characters from [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]. A [[chuunibyou]] with a made-up persona as a fallen angel named "Yohane", Yoshiko insists on being called Yohane instead of her real name. She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[blue hair]] and a [[single side bun]] on the right side of her head. She is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[Guilty Kiss (love live!)|]], alongside [[Ohara Mari]] and [[Sakurauchi Riko]]. She is also the titular protagonist of the Sunshine!!
surfboard: A long narrow board used in [[surfing]].
sailor senshi: Tag used to describe the girls from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] when [b]grouped together[/b]. Parodies included.
waist bow:
A [[bow]] that is tied around the front side of a character's waist. It should function as a makeshift belt to keep the dress around the waist. If the bow is a decorative aspect of the clothing, use [[dress bow]] instead (unless both are present).

If the bow is in the rear, use [[back bow]] instead. There are instances of both happening however, such as post #3495784.
holding scissors:
Someone is [[holding]] a pair of [[scissors]].

If they're being used as a [[weapon]], add [[holding weapon]] manually since not all scissors are made for combat.
heart tail:
When a character has one or more [[tail|tails]] bent in the shape of a [[heart]]. A common visual gag used for [[Valentine]]'s Day-themed pictures or as a general sign of affection.

Not to be confused with [[demon tail|demon tails]], which typically have a heart-shaped tip.
spill: An accidental overflow of [[liquid]] from its holding [[container]]. Use this tag for the aftermath of [[spilling]].
sleeve cuffs: A sleeve cuff is a layer of fabric at the lower edge of the sleeve of a garment (shirt, coat, jacket, etc.) at the wrist. Use this tag for cuffs distinct and notable from the garment they are a part of. If the cuffs are plain and non-distinct this tag is not warranted. For something that looks like a shirt cuff, but is detached from any garment, use [[wrist cuffs]].  For cuffs as restraints, use [[handcuffs]] for the sort of metal cuffs that a police officer might use, otherwise use the plain [[cuffs]].
lyn (fire emblem):
Character in [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]], and one of the three Lords of the game along with [[Eliwood (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Hector (Fire Emblem)|]].

She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|long]] [[green hair]] usually in a [[ponytail]]. [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] also tends to portray her as being [[large_breasts|large-chested]].

Remarkably, she ended in the Top 1 of the 2017's edition of Choose Your Legends (Fire Emblem Heroes' popularity poll), making her the first overall winner of CYL.

Voiced by [[Oomoto Makiko]] in Japanese and [[Wendee Lee]] in English.
v over mouth: Holding a v-shaped hand gesture over the mouth. If the fingers are horizontally aligned with the mouth and tongue is out, use [[cunnilingus gesture]].

Wears a [[backless outfit|backless]] [[black vest|black]] [[halterneck]] [[vest]] over her [[white shirt|white]] [[shuujin academy school uniform|uniform]] [[turtleneck]], though it is often misdrawn due to confusion about the [[overalls]]-style buckles on the neck strap.

Wiz is a lovely and well-endowed woman in her early 20s with fair skin and a curvaceous figure. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] reaching down to the front of her shoulders, f
bento: A Japanese packed lunch. A traditional bento consists of [[rice]], [[fish]] or [[meat]] (or [[tako-san wiener]]), [[tamagoyaki]], and one or more pickled or cooked vegetables, usually in a box-shaped container, and sometimes wrapped in a cloth known as a [[furoshiki]] or stacked together.

extra faces: When a character is shown with more than one face. This is distinct from [[multiple heads]] in that the additional faces may be located on somewhere else that doesn't necessitate an extra head, such as the side of the head, chest, stomach, etc..

[[Blood]] that is distinctly colored [[pink]] instead of red.

Someone is missing at least one of their extremities, but not all of them. Consider adding [[amputee]] tag. See [[severed limb]] for when the limb itself is present.

green one-piece swimsuit: A [[one-piece swimsuit]] that is colored green.
momosuzu nene:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[holofive|5th]] [[NePoLaBo|generation]]. Designed by [[Nishizawa]].

She also has [[large breasts]] that aren't always immediately apparent due to some of her outfit designs.
suicide:
The act of voluntarily ending one's own life.

The picture must show a character either having already killed themselves or being in the process of doing so.

Also tag [[attempted suicide]] if the person is shown attempting suicide, but fails for some reason (such as another person intervening).

Tag [[imminent suicide]] if the character intends to commit suicide in the imminent future.
miyako yoshika: The "Loyal Undead". Stage 3 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]]. A [[jiangshi]], or Chinese zombie, with the ability to eat anything. Humans bitten by her may turn into a jiangshi temporarily. Assigned to guard the cemetery adjacent to the [[Myouren Temple]] by [[Kaku Seiga]], she's a tough opponent who takes her duties seriously but is somewhat dumb. Referred to as a "meaningless bodyguard" by ZUN. She is partially based on Miyako No Yoshika, a real 9th century poet who was rumored to be friends with [[Ibaraki Douji (touhou)|]].
combat knife:
A [[knife]] designed with hard use in mind, often used not only for fighting but also for utility purposes. Usually built with a full-tang construction and a durable, stainless steel. The handle can consist of a number of materials, including leather, plastic or a composite. May or may not have serrations.

Few type of [[bayonet]]s do also function as standalone combat knife, such as the M9 bayonet (post #1684456).

In the Japanese translation his name is Kyu.

akanbe:
A Japanese facial gesture that consists of [[eyelid pull|pulling an eyelid]] down while sticking the [[tongue out]]. It is sometimes accompanied by the sound べえだ (beeda, pronounced "behhh-dah"). This gesture is also done in France and Québec, where it is accompanied by saying "mon oeil" ("my eye").

The gist of the gesture is an infantile taunt - the Japanese equivalent of thumbing your nose at someone, or yelling "Nyah nyah nyah" or "Neener neener" or the like.
princess daisy:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. She is the princess of Sarasaland. Cheerful, energetic, and a bit tomboyish.

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]].
For her default costume, she wears a [[gold crown]], [[flower earrings]], a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[yellow dress]] and [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[high heels]].
cum on eyewear: For use when [[cum]] is on any type of eyewear.
industrial pipe:
A tube of metal, plastic, or other material used to convey water, gas, oil, or other fluid substances.

For the item used for [[smoking]], see [[smoking pipe]].

For pipes made of lead, which are commonly used as weapons, see [[lead pipe]].
unworn jacket:
When a [[jacket]] is completely or partially removed from the body.

argyle clothes:

multicolored skirt:
A [[skirt]] that has at least two or more colors present in its design. 

Take care when there is an image with a [[layered skirt]] in it though, such as post #1850259. If each layer has a single color, then it isn't a multicolored skirt. Each layer can be tagged with each individual color, so for the aforementioned post, the tags would be {{layered_skirt yellow_skirt red_skirt blue_skirt}}. This tag is specifically when a single layer of short cloth has multiple colors on it.
cross scar: A [[scar]] in the shape of a [[cross]] or [[X]].
yorigami jo'on:
[b]The Most Despicable and Disastrous Younger Twin Sister[/b]

Main antagonist of [i][[Antinomy of Common Flowers]][/i] along with her [[sisters|sister]], [[yorigami_shion|Yorigami Shion]].

Jo'on is depicted with a [[top_hat|top hat]] decorated with a [[hat_bow|hat bow]] along with [[round_eyewear|round]] [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear_on_head|atop her head]]. Her [[light_brown_hair|light brown hair]] is held by [[ribbon|ribbons]] in a [[twin_drills|twin-drill]] [[drill hair|style]], with shorter locks framing her [[orange_eyes|orange eyes]]. Jo'on wears a [[white_dress|white dress]] underneath her [[high_collar|high-collar]] [[coat]] adorned with [[floral_print|floral prints]]. Contrasting Shion's poverty, Jo'on wears plenty of [[jewelry]], including [[ring|rings]], a [[necklace]] with a [[pendant]], [[earrings]], and a [[bangle]]. She also wields a [[gold]] [[handbag]]. Her spellcard declaration animation has her using a [[credit_card|credit card]]. She is also [[holding_fan|depicted]] with a [[folding_fan|fan]] with a [[fur_trim|fur-trim]]. Her sprite is surrounded with an [[aura]] of orange flames. She wears boots.

Jo'on is a Goddess of Pestilences who is prideful and greedy. Her ability allows her to possess humans, allowing her to seize their financial assets and drain them to the point of financial ruin. However, due to her spendthrift nature, she spends her money as fast as she earns it.
kurodani yamame:

Stage 1 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Subterranean Animism]] and stage 2 boss in [[Sunken Fossil World]] with some [[extra legs|extra]] [[arthropod limbs|spider legs]]. She's a spider youkai who has the ability to manipulate illness.

Often paired with [[Kisume]], the mid-boss from her stage. Also sometimes paired with [[Wriggle Nightbug]] and [[Mizuhashi Parsee]].
weibo logo: This tag has been moved to [[weibo_watermark]].

If the apron is combined with a significantly more modest outfit, then just use the normal [[apron]] tag. Conversely, if the additional clothing lacks any coverage of the torso or is explicitly allowed by the [[nude]] tag's guidelines ([[tag group:headwear|headwea
bulma:
A major [[Dragon Ball]] character. One of the original Dragon Team members, her meeting Goku kicking the story off. The daughter of [[Dr. Brief (dragon ball)|]] (whose name was rendered as Dr. Briefs in the original English localization, leading many Western fans to assume it was a surname, and not his given name).

Her original [[voice actor|voice actress]] [[Tsuru Hiromi]] passed away in November 2017, and was replaced by [[Hisakawa Aya]].
heart button:
One or multiple [[buttons]] in the shape of a [[heart]] (♥).

Most commonly associated with [[Komeiji Satori]].
finger in own mouth: A finger in a character's own mouth. Not to be confused with [[finger to mouth]] (though both may be tagged if ambiguous).
horizontal pupils: Pupils that are horizontal or rectangular in shape instead of circular. Horizontal pupils are common in animals such as [[sheep]], [[goat]]s, [[horse]]s, [[octopus|octopodes]], reptiles and amphibians.
taut dress: A [[dress]] that is so [[tight dress|tight]] that the fabric hangs taut and creates ripples between the [[breasts]], [[ass]], or [[thighs]].
silver wolf (honkai: star rail):
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the [[Stellaron Hunters (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Asumi Kana]] in Japanese.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient]] and tied into a [[drill hair|drill]] [[ponytail]], [[grey eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]], white [[crop top]], black [[sports bra]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], differently-colored [[thigh strap]]s, [[goggles]] [[eyewear on head|on her head]], [[fishnet socks]], and [[black boots]].
heart balloon: A [[balloon]] that is shaped like a [[heart]].
shuriken:
A shuriken, commonly known as "throwing stars", is a traditional Japanese concealed [[weapon]] that was generally for [[throwing]], and sometimes stabbing or [[slashing]].

They are sharpened hand-held blades made from a variety of everyday items such as needles, nails, and [[knife|knives]], as well as coins, washers, and other flat plates of metal. Though it is commonly depicted in popular culture as a multiple bladed (usually three or four) throwing weapon with a hole in the middle as a holding point.

This weapon is commonly used by [[ninja]]s.
chimney:
A vertical structure found on [[house]]s and common [[building]]s for venting combustion gases or [[smoke]] to the outside atmosphere. Generally made out of [[brick wall|bricks]].

For the similar object found on industrial plants, locomotives or ships, use [[smokestack]] instead.
yes-no pillow:
Yes-No [[pillow|pillows]] are matching pillows. One pillow is blue, and the other is pink. "Yes" and "No" are each written on the sides of the pillows.

These were presented as a prize to the couple who appeared in the talk show, "新婚さんいらっしゃい! ("Shinkon-san, Irasshai! - Welcome, newlyweds!":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinkon-san_Irasshai])". The program presenter never told how to use it, though it is probably used for the declaration of sexual intention.

Depending on which side is visible in an image, add the [[yes]] or [[no]] tag. Both tags may apply if there’s more than one pillow.
melting:
An object or character that is [[dripping]]. May be used to comedically emphasize [[sweat]]ing, or used as an artistic [[distortion]] effect. Or maybe it's a hot day and a character is holding an [[ice cream]] or [[popsicle]].

Use [[dissolving]] instead if a character is dissolving into a [[liquid]].
pizza:
A round, baked flat bread that is typically covered in tomato sauce, [[cheese]], and other toppings such as [[pepperoni]] and [[chili pepper]] according to preference or culture. Usually sliced into eight triangular [[pizza slice]]s.

Modern pizza originated from the Neapolitan pizza from Naples, [[Italy]]. It is one of the most popular [[fast food]] in the world.

There are also dessert pizzas that use [[chocolate]], [[cream]], [[candy]] and other sweet ingredients to create a treat resembling pizza.
crucifixion:
An early method of [[execution]] involving being tied or nailed to a [[cross|pole]].

Unlike what the name seems to imply, crucifixion "can still take place even if a cross is not present":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crucifixion#Terminology. Some examples (NSFW): post #1129852, post #1302606.

The crucifixion of [[Jesus|Jesus of Nazareth]] and his propitiation on the cross is central to Christianity, believed by Christians to be a divine sacrifice for the atonement of sins. The crucifixion
adjusting swimsuit: When a character is adjusting their own [[swimsuit]] or someone else's. Typically, this involves fixing the ass portion if the hem is tucked in an uncomfortable position, but the straps can also count for this tag.
p90:
A [[bullpup]] [b][[submachine gun]][/b], developed between 1986–1987 by Stéphane Ferrard at [[FN Herstal]]. It fires 5.7×28mm ammunition that resembles miniature rifle rounds, with more velocity and armour-piercing capability compared to conventional pistol rounds. The [b]P90[/b] introduced the PDW (Personal Defense Weapon) concept.

The [[weapon]] has a distinct futuristic appearance, ambidextrous controls, downwards [[casing ejection]], integrated [[optical sight|optics]] in the carry [[handle]] with backup iron sights on its top and feeds from an axially-mounted 50-round magazine.
bandaged neck: Some [[bandages]] are wrapped around a person's [[neck]].
animal on head: Used for when any kind of [[animal]] is resting [[on head|on someone's head]] or hat. [[Stuffed animal]]s count.
birthday cake: A decorated [[cake]] that celebrates one's [[birthday]]. Typically written with the words, "Happy Birthday" followed by the person's name. May include [[candle]](s) to give the person being celebrated a chance to make a wish upon blowing then out.
multi-strapped bikini bottom:

star necklace: A [[necklace]] that has at least one attached ornament shaped like a [[star (symbol)|]].
morgan le fay (fate):
The [[fate (series)|Fate series]]' interpretation of Morgan le Fay, [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|Artoria]]'s sister and [[Mordred (fate)|]]'s mother. Morgan appears very similar to Artoria, but wears a black crown with a black veil, and a black dress.

She is introduced as a playable Berserker-class Servant in the 6th Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]], Fairy Realm of the Round Table: [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]], [spoiler]where she serves as the Lostbelt Queen[/spoiler].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ishikawa Yui]]
hand over another's mouth: When a character uses their hand(s) to cover someone else's mouth.
tape measure: A long and thin strip of plastic or metal, etched with scales. The plastic tape measure is usually short (around 150 cm, although really long ones can reach hundreds of meters) and used by a tailor to take body measurements for clothes-making. The metal ones are usually longer (up to 5 meters and housed in a small dispenser to avoid cutting the hand of its user) and used by carpenters and builders. The dressmaking-related ones are commonly used in the act of [[bust measuring]].
hk416 (girls' frontline):

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|grey]], [[aqua hair|aqua]], or [[white hair]], [[green eyes]], and wears a black [[beret]], [[military jacket]], [[plaid skirt]], and [[black thighhighs]].

Based on her in-game lines she seems to hold her skills as a soldier in high regard and strives to outperform the AR Team, especially [[M16A1 (girls' frontline)|]]. She also shows some [[yandere]] qualities towards the [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]].

A member of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]] along with [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]], [[UMP9 (girls' frontline)|]] and [[G11 (girls' frontline)|]]. Would receive a [[HK416 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], she appears as [[Clukay (neural cloud)|]]. In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], she appears as [[Klukai (girls' frontline 2)|]].

Voiced by [[Nonaka Ai]]. Illustrated by [[Gyaku Tsubasa]], though for Herbal-Flavored Hard Candy and Percussion Bolero, she was illustrated by [[Starshadowmagician]] and [[han-0v0]] respectively.

sasaki chie:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Chie is an elementary school student who acts shy upon meeting new people, but later becomes very mature around Producer. Chie is very easily scared by people she doesn’t know, and in fact was actually terrified of Producer at first. However, once she begins to trust others, Chie becomes very level-headed and mature, even flirty, after idol work. She admits that she doesn’t trust in her idol skills, and has been found out to have developed a crush on Producer by the time she receives her first idol form.

She plays the pianica at her school and hopes to be able to play in a marching band someday. She is also very proud of her ice and flower arrangement, made from a bucket. Chie is appointed to be the leader of the "Little Marching Band Girls":https://project-imas.wiki/Little_Marching_Band_Girls unit, She is voiced by [[Imai Asaka]] ("ANN profile":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?ann-edition=uk&id=116909).

yorigami shion:
[b]The Most Despicable and Disastrous Eldest Twin Sister[/b]

Main antagonist of [i][[Antinomy of Common Flowers]][/i] along with her [[sisters|sister]], [[Yorigami Jo'on]].

Being a Poverty Goddess, Shion is depicted in tatters, unlike her sister. She wears a [[hair bow]] atop her [[blue hair]]. Her hair length is ambiguous; Harukawa's portrait of her depicts her with [[long hair]] blending with her blue aura, but the in-game sprites depict her with [[short hair]]. She has [[blue eyes]]. Shion wears a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[grey hoodie]] with the [[hood down]] and a [[blue skirt]], going [[barefoot]]. She also has a black [[stuffed cat]] perched on her arm and she holds a [[damaged]] [[bowl]]. Similar to her sister, she wears [[bangle|gold bangles]]. Debt papers cover Shion's clothes and her stuffed cat. Do not confuse them with the ofuda covering Mokou's pants.

Shion is a Poverty Goddess, and stores bad luck and debts within her. As more and more is stored within her, she explodes and scatters bad luck around. Her ability allows her to possess people to reduce their luck and make them poor. Shion is usually Jo'on's cohort in her scams.
tomoe mami:

She has [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[drill hair]]/[[twin drills]] with flower-themed [[hairpin]] and [[yellow eyes]]; normally wears a [[school uniform]] with [[black pantyhose]]. She has one of the [[large breasts|largest busts]] of the cast, and this trait tends to be [[huge breasts|exaggerated]] in her art.

Her [[magical girl]] attire includes a [[beret]], a white blouse with [[puffy sleeves]] at the shoulders, a pair of [[detached sleeves]], [[fingerless gloves]], [[pleated skirt]], [[corset]], [[brown thighhighs|brown]] [[vertical-striped thighhighs]], and [[boots]]. She uses a [[magical musket]] as a weapon.

beidou (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Captain of the Crux, with quite the reputation in Liyue. There are those who say she can split mountains and part the sea. Others say she draws lightning through her sword. Some say that even the mightiest of sea beasts are no match for her. For those not from Liyue, it may sound like a hearty joke, but those that have sailed with her will say— "No matter what sea beasts there may be, Beidou will be sure to split them all in two."

Her name is pronounced [b]Hokuto[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.
cocktail dress:
A [[dress]] suitable at semi-[[formal clothes]] occasions, sometimes called cocktail parties.

Cocktail dresses emphasize practicality. They are traditionally meant for cocktail parties, but can also be worn at bars, clubs and parties in a modern setting. Because of the practicality emphasis they are [[short dress|short]] to [[medium dress|medium]] length. If the dress is mid-calf to full-length, consider using [[evening gown]] instead.
piano: A musical [[instrument]] played by means of a [[keyboard_(instrument)|keyboard]] whose sound is produced by felt hammers striking metallic strings. Widely used in Classical music for solo performances.

A cool pretty girl, whose black hair she has bundled behind her leaves an impression. She possesses a stoic personality and won't let up on effort until she's satisfied. First-year high school.

penguin:
A type of flightless aquatic [[bird]] with upright posture and black-and-white plumage. 

Almost all penguin species are native to the Southern Hemisphere, and while they are famous for living in the frozen Antarctic, several live in temperate zones and a few are found in Africa or the equatorial Galapagos island chain.

mizunashi akari:
The main character of the anime and manga series [i][[Aria (manga)|]][/i] and its predecessor, [i]Aqua[/i], Akari is a gondolier in a small company located in a reconstruction of Venice (Neo-Venezia) on Aqua, a water planet terraformed from Mars. Akari's mentor in Aria Company is [[Alicia Florence]], and their company mascot is [[Aria Pokoteng]].

Akari has [[green eyes]] and [[pink hair]]. For the majority of the series she has [[short hair with long locks|short hair and]] [[long sidelocks]] with [[parted bangs]] or [[hair intakes]] (often showing her [[forehead]]) and adorned with [[hair tubes]] or [[hair ribbon]]s. [[aged up|Adult]] Akari has [[very long hair]] and hair tubes that are lower down than usual, with her sidelocks [[hair over shoulder|resting on her shoulders]] and looping back into a [[ponytail]]. This hairstyle is sometimes called a 'momitail' (もみーテール).

Akari is usually depicted wearing her Aria Company [i]undine[/i] [[aria company uniform|uniform]], which is colored white with blue trim and features a [[bowtie]] and a circle-and-arc [[logo]] in front and black company patches with yellow lettering on the left sleeve and [[hat]]. There are summer and winter variations: the summer uniform is topped by a short-sleeved, [[sailor collar|sailor-collared]] shirt, while the winter uniform is characterized by a v-tailed mantle, long sleeves, and [[purple pantyhose]].

She is known for being [[mute|unable to speak verbally]] (communicates with the player telepathically), her calm music and equally calm demeanor, and her exposed [[large breasts]].

Wields her personal [[instrument]] in battle, the [[etwahl]], which intrigued her adoptive mother enough to bring her into the renowned House Buvelle in Demacia.

oversized object:
A character that is holding or interacting with an object significantly bigger than normal relative to their size.  Since it is defined relatively, [[minigirl]]s and [[miniboy]]s count, but only when directly interacting with a full-sized object. 

If the object is a weapon, it may also be a [[huge weapon]] (though not all huge weapons count as oversized objects; some are supposed to be that big.)
idol clothes:
Clothes worn by [[idol]]s for performances, particularly common in j-pop. These are usually [[frilled dress|frilly dresses]] for female idols and dapper [[suit|suits]] with accessories for male idols, and are often impractical for being worn outside of performance events.

Group idols' clothes often match each other and create a sense of [[uniform]].
kusazuri:
Kusazuri (草摺) are the plated armor skirt commonly seen on traditional Japanese samurai armor, attached at the bottom portion of the [[dou]], the chest armor.  They are composed of a grid of small plates ([i]lamés[/i]) made from laminated leather or iron and riveted together in a fashion similar to [i][[sode]][/i] shoulder guards.

Their role is to protect the waist and upper thighs while still giving flexibility, much like their Western equivalent, [[faulds]] and tassets.  

A related piece of armor is the [[haidate]], a set of similarly-constructed thigh guards worn underneath the [i]kusazuri[/i] but affixed directly to the thighs instead of swinging freely.

The simple cloth equivalents found on kendo [i][[bougu]][/i] training armor are called [i]tare[/i].
shell:
A general term for the calcareous exoskeleton that protects the soft insides of many animals. Humans use them for a wide variety of purposes. 

Most commonly seen as but not limited to [[seashell]]-dwelling mollusks on Danbooru. If you aren't tagging a mollusk, it's probably also [[turtle shell]].

For the shells of [[egg|eggs]] see [[eggshell]]. For cannon projectiles, see [[artillery shell]]. For spent ammunition, see [[shell casing]].
open dress: A [[dress]] (of any kind) that is open and unbuttoned/unzipped.
plana (blue archive):
A non-playable character in [[Blue Archive]]. Similar in appearance to [[Arona (Blue Archive)|]]. 

She has [[black eyes]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]] and has [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]]. She wears all black, including a [[black serafuku]], [[black coat|coat]], [[black pantyhose|pantyhose]], [[black choker|choker]], and [[black hairband|hairband]], with a [[white neckerchief]]. Like [[Arona (Blue Archive)|]], she has [[mismatched pupils]]: her right pupil is [[blue pupils|blue]] while her left pupil is [[pink pupils|pink]].

[spoiler]Originally referred to as A.R.O.N.A., she is later renamed "Plana" by [[Arona (blue archive)|]] after the events of the Final Chapter, once she decides to join [[Sensei (Blue Archive)|]] and cohabitate in the Shittim Chest with [[Arona (blue archive)|]].[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]].
tube dress:
A [[strapless]] close-fitting casual [[dress]]. Essentially a [[tube top]] extended to dress length. Tube dresses generally reach from just past the hips to knee length, and they tend to fit snugly around the legs like a [[pencil skirt]] or [[pencil dress]].

As this tag implies [[strapless]], do not use this tag if the dress has shoulder straps or a [[halterneck]]; in such cases, [[pencil dress]] should be used instead.
rika (pokemon):
[b]Rika[/b], known as [b]Chili[/b] (チリ) in Japan, is a member of Elite Four of the Paldea region in [[Pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]]. She also serves as the receptionist for the Pokémon League, interviewing the player during the first part of the Champion Assessment. She specializes in Ground-type Pokémon, her ace being [[Clodsire]].

She has a laidback and easygoing personality. In the original Japanese she speaks in the [[kansaiben|Kansai dialect]], though she will temporarily drop it when conducting the interview. She refers to the player as "kiddo" and has a distinct "nahaha" laugh.

Owing to her Japanese name, she is popularly represented by the 🌶️ (chili pepper) emoji among Japanese fanartists.
club (shape):
The ♣ symbol.

One of the four suits in the French [[playing card]] deck with original French name 'trèfles' meaning 'clovers' which the shape resembles. The shape can symbolize darkness, fire, will, wealth, luck, and happiness.
peeking: To look at something while trying not to be noticed.
blue sleeves: A pair of sleeves that are colored [[blue]]. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently colored from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).
tankini: A two-piece [[swimsuit]] that combines a [[tank top]], [[crop top]], or other top with a [[bikini]] bottom.
teardrop:
A comical depiction of crying or tears. Very similar to [[sweatdrop]]. This tag is not meant to specify when there's one tear versus when there's more than one. Usually there is never more than one on a character's face.

Basically, teardrop is used when the tear is drawn on for comedic purposes, rather than to actually represent happiness/sadness/pain/pleasure/etc. They usually have a specific color, rather than being transparent like real tears, and are usually connected directly to the eyes. A teardrop may also accompany [[yawning]].

Rule of thumb: if the character appears to be actually crying, or the teardrop is transparent, it is usually [i]not[/i] a teardrop. For all other instances of shedding tears that don't properly meet the requirements for teardrop, use [[tears]] instead.

For non-comedic pictures with a single teardrop, use [[single tear]].
breast cutout: Clothing that has cutouts around a woman's [[breasts]].
naginata: A Japanese [[weapon]] composed of a long pole and a curved blade at the end. It is similar to the Chinese [[guan dao]] or the European [[glaive (polearm)|]]. Commonly used by and associated with women due to their relative ease of use, and widespread usage by "women militias":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onna-musha during the [[Sengoku jidai|Sengoku]] "period":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sengoku_period.
orange kimono: A [[kimono]] that is colored orange. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
against fourth wall: When characters are depicted as pressing up against the [[fourth wall]], or a wall that does not physically exist within the scenario presented by the image but rather by the image's square boundaries.
pearl thong: A kind of underwear designed to provide sexual stimulation with a strand of beads.
dog hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a dog's face or a miniature dog.
halberd:
A popular and versatile [[polearm]]. Its main distinguishing features are a head consisting of an [[axe]] blade, a [[spear]]head, and a hook or angled spike opposite the axe.

While the term halberd refers specifically to the medieval/renaissance European polearm, similar polearms such as the knightly poleaxe/pollaxe and Chinese [[qinglong ji]] also fall under this category.

Not to be confused with [[Meta Knight|Meta Knight's]] [[halberd_(airship)|signature battleship]].
carapace: A literal exoskeleton - use when it seems as though the subject is covered in natural [[armor]]. Generally applies more to [[creature]]s, [[alien]]s, [[monster]]s, etc. than to humans.
shako cap:
A tall, cylindrical [[military hat]], usually with a visor, sometimes tapered at the top. It is usually adorned with some kind of ornamental plate or badge on the front, and often has a [[feathers|feather]], [[plume]], or [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pompom]] attached at the top. This can also be used when characters are in a [[marching band]] and wearing this cap.

Take care not to confuse for a [[top hat]].
taut leotard: A [[leotard]] that is particularly [[skin tight]] for the wearer. The fabric on a woman's breasts should be stretched uniformly over the cleavage. If not, then it's an [[impossible leotard]] instead.
single boot: A character is wearing a [[boots|boot]] on only one foot.
stitched face: When a character has [[stitches]] running across a significant portion of their face.
orange leotard:
A [[leotard]] that's colored orange.

Not to be confused with [[orange bodysuit]].
snake tail: A character is depicted as having a [[snake]]'s tail. Not for when a character is depicted as having the lower body of a snake, such posts should be tagged with [[lamia]] instead.
backless panties:
[[Panties]] that cover the [[pussy]] but that leave the [[ass]] exposed; sometimes worn with the intent of reducing [[pantylines]].

If it's a [[swimsuit]] instead of panties, then use [[assless swimsuit]] instead.

If the panties have a back that covers most of the ass, but it has a single hole in it, use [[ass cutout]] instead.
spooning: A position in which both partners [[on_side|lie on their sides]] with [[front-to-back|one's front against the other's back]], named for the resemblance to [[spoon|spoons]] stacked together. Also refers to the [[tag group:sexual positions|sex position]].
chocola (nekopara): [[Nekopara]] character. Originally a mascot character of [[Sayori (neko works)|]]. More often than not drawn with her twin sister [[Vanilla_(Nekopara)|]]. Recognizable by her dark hair and [[orange eyes]].
hands on another's face:
