face-to-face: When two characters are facing one another within close proximity.
pinwheel: A small [[toy]] comprising of paper or plastic curls attached as its axle to a stick, designed to spin when blown by the wind or a person.
ferris wheel: An [[amusement park]] or fairground ride consisting of a giant vertical revolving wheel with passenger cars suspended on its outer edge.
missile:
A long-range explosive military [[weapon]] propelled by a engine. See [[rocket]] for non-weapon civilian rockets.

In modern military usage the term "missile" refers to a guided weapon system, while an unguided weapon system is referred to as a "rocket." On Danbooru, the term missile is used for both types of weapon, while [[rocket]] is used for non-weapon rocket engines.
miki sayaka:

duel:

tiger: A member of the Felidae family and the largest and possibly most dangerous of the five "[[tag_group:cats|big cats]]". Aside from their great bulk and power, their most recognisable feature is a pattern of dark vertical stripes that overlays near-white to reddish-orange fur, with lighter underparts.

Referenced in the Babylonia singularity as one of the heroes Gilgamesh summoned to defend his kingdom, and who later perished defeating an enemy commander. soapland: A Japanese word for a type of brothel where men can bathe with the prostitutes and engage in non-penetrative sex acts.

bulletproof vest:
A vest designed to protect the torso from bullets and shrapnel.

The armor can be made of Kevlar, hard ceramic/polymer scales, or a mix of the two. It may have a plate carrier, to hold removable armor plates or panels.

The vest is sometimes covered in MOLLE/PALS webbing to allow the mounting of [[ammunition pouch]]es or other general purpose [[pouch]]es.
menu board: A free-standing sign that lists various menu items or daily specials at a [[restaurant]] or [[cafe]]. This tag may overlap with [[chalkboard]] when the sign is hand-written.
sailor venus: Sailor Venus is one of the [[Inner Senshi]] from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She uses love- and metal-related powers and also serves as the leader of the Guardian Senshi who protect Sailor Moon. Her civilian identity is [[Aino Minako]].
yumi (senran kagura):
Main supporting character in [[Senran Kagura]]. A Third-Year student and leader at the Gessen Academy.

Yumi has dark-grey [[medium hair|medium length hair]], pale white skin, and icy [[blue eyes]], wearing a white and blue [[striped bow]] on the back of her head. When she transforms she wears a solid white [[furisode]] [[kimono]] with a blue double-lined trim and blue [[obi]] on the back, while the top part [[bare shoulders|exposes her shoulders]] and most of her [[cleavage]]. Yumi wields [[hand fan|fans]] and her Ice Sword during her Ice Queen transformation. She wears white [[socks]] and lavender flip flops on her feet. Her Ice Queen Mode loses her hair tie and allows her hair to grow and becoming white icy blue in color, while her eyes become [[red eyes|red]]. 

Yumi is a calm and very serious girl, giving nothing but everything she has when achieving a personal goal she has set for herself. She has also developed a good friendship with [[Asuka_(senran_kagura)|]], as her late grandfather Kurokage was once a friend and rival to Asuka’s grandfather Hanzou. Her hobby is calligraphy, and her favorite food is shaved ice with red bean on top.

When her clothes are ripped off, she is revealed to be wearing [[plaid]] [[lingerie]].

Her seiyuu is [[Hara Yumi]].
bear hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a [[bear]]'s face or a miniature bear.
corded phone:
The oldest of all [[phone|phones]], dominant in everyday use at least until the early 1990s. Uses cords to maintain electricity. Most often has a [[rotary phone|rotary dial]], although these were gradually superseded by push button systems from the 1980s onward.

The earliest corded phones had no integrated dialing system at all; either the connection was between two devices only, or a manual telephone exchange was needed.

The corded phone has generally been superseded by cordless phones an
rei no pool:
[b]Rei no pool[/b] (例のプール, lit. "the usual pool"), officially called the[b] Hanazono Room[/b], is that indoor swimming [[pool]] with angled solarium windows which can be seen in just about every pool-related Japanese adult video ever.

It is located on the top floor of a building in [[Shinjuku (tokyo)|]], and was formerly part of a private penthouse apartment during the area's economic boom. It's now owned by a company that rents locations for video shoots. Surprisingly for a studio frequently used to film porn, it overlooks an elementary school.

The pool virtually ceased being available for JAV shoots in 2020 due to the rising cost of facility maintenance expenses to clean up afterwards. The pool remains open for non-AV shoots such as gravure and non-pornographic shoots.

Despite its reputation as a common location for JAVs, the pool has recently been featured in a handful of mainstream productions as well, including an episode of [[Kamen Rider Fourze (Series)|]].
tiered tray:
A stand for displaying and serving food with multiple levels.

For a similar single tier stand, see [[cake stand]].
food on body: [[Food]] on or covering one's body. Usually a result of spillage or messy eating, or offered as an appetizer when presenting one's body as some sort of meal.
cooler:
An insulated container meant to keep [[drink]]s or [[food]] cool. Handy when going to the [[beach]].

Also known as an ice chest, ice box, or a chest cooler.
megaphone:
A funnel (cone) shaped device held to the mouth, and used for amplifying or directing sound.

This tag also includes electronic megaphones, also known as [b]bullhorns[/b], which are a device that combines a [[microphone]] with an amplified [[horn speaker]] and are used as a portable [[public address system|PA system]].
smoking pipe:
A smoking pipe is a tube with a small bowl at one end; used for [[smoking]] [[tobacco]].

This tag can include the [[bubble pipe]], which is a toy made of plastic and used for blowing soap bubbles.
american flag:
The flag of the [[united_states|United States of America]], colloquially known as the [b]Stars and Stripes[/b]. It serves as a symbol of the country's unity, independence, and democratic ideals. 

The design of the American flag consists of 13 horizontal stripes alternating between red and white, representing the original 13 colonies that declared independence from [[united_kingdom|British]] rule. In the top left corner, commonly referred to as the canton, there is a blue rectangle containing 50 white, five-pointed stars arranged in nine rows. These stars represent the 50 states of the United States. The design of the flag has evolved over time as new states joined the Union. The current version with 50 stars became official on July 4, 1960, after [[Hawaii]] became the 50th state.

The colors of the American flag also hold symbolic meaning. Red represents valor and bravery, white signifies purity and innocence, and blue represents vigilance, perseverance, and justice.

The American flag is widely recognized and displayed in various contexts, including government buildings, schools, homes, and during public events and holidays such as Independence Day ([[fourth_of_july|July 4th]]). It is treated with respect and reverence, and there are guidelines and protocols for its proper handling, folding, and display.

For images that only show patterns or other symbols representing the United States rather than the flag itself, use the [[United States]] tag.
fanny pack: A fanny pack (known as a bum bag in the UK) is a small fabric pouch usually secured with a zipper and worn by use of a strap usually around the hips or waist. One style trend involves wearing the pack across the chest. The word 'fanny' is American slang for a person's [[ass|buttocks]]. The word 'bum' means the same thing in Britain and many Commonwealth countries.

mohawk:
A type of hairstyle of which both side of the wearer's head is shaven, leaving a long strip of it down the middle of the scalp. Known and seen more when it is standing up due to gelling. Also known as a "Mohican," especially in Japan.

Mohawk also counts regardless if the hair is not standing straight up from the head.

The hairstyle is named after the Mohawk people, a Native American tribe, due to misrepresentation of their people in movies such as those from the 1930's.  It's closer to a hairstyle that was worn by the Native American Pawnee people.

A symbol shaped like a stylized [[lightning]] bolt (ex: 🗲 or ↯).

roman numeral:
Refers to the ancient Roman way of writing numbers. Likely because of the elegant style, it is still usually recognized and understood by everyday people (at least from 1 to 10), as well as frequently used on clocks.

* 1 = I
* 2 = II
* 3 = III
* 4 = IV (one below 5)
* 5 = V
* 6 = VI (one above 5)
* 7 = VII (two above 5)
* 8 = VIII
* 9 = IX
* 10 = X (can be remembered by how 2 V's form an X; 5*2=10)
* 11 = XI
* 12 = XII

* 50 = L
* 100 = C
* 500 = D
* 1000 = M
androgyne symbol:
The ⚨ symbol.

A mix of the [[mars symbol|mars]] (♂) and [[venus symbol|venus]] (♀) symbols.

It can be used to refer to characters that have an [[androgynous]] appearance, characters that are intersex/hermaphrodite/[[futanari]], or characters with a non-binary gender identity.

It can be shown pointing in any direction, and the direction is sometimes used to distinguish androgyne and intersex.

Closely related to and commonly interchanged with with the [[male-female symbol]] (⚥). Distin

soga no tojiko:
The "Departed Spirit of the Children of the Gods".

Stage 5 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]].

She is a very practical woman who can use coarse language. She also appears to be a foil to Futo's air-headed, jovial nature. In spite of the language she uses, she's actually kind, though short-tempered. Her friendship/rivalry with [[Mononobe no Futo]] led her to be unable to reincarnate like Futo and [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]]. Soga instead came back as a [[ghost]], with two [[ghost tail]]s in the place of legs. Exactly where her body transitions from human-like to ghost-like is unclear, due to the long dress that she wears.

Her name came from "Tojiko no Iratsume":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/刀自古郎女], a daughter of [[Soga no Umako]] and consort of [[Shoutoku Taishi]]. Since her name comes from the consort of the character on whom [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]] was based, the two are often depicted by fans as a [[couple]].

The [[winter uniform|winter]] version replaces the blouse with a [[white capelet]] with yellow or [[gold trim|golden trims]] and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white dress]], a long-sleeved [[white shirt|white]] [[undershirt]] and [[purple pantyhose]]

yang xiao long:
One of the main characters of [[RWBY]]. Yang is the "Y" in RWBY, and is associated with the color yellow. Her character design is inspired by [[Goldilocks]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and has fairly [[large breasts]]. 

She wields a pair of [[shotgun]]/gauntlet (technically [[vambraces]]) hybrid weapons named [[ember_celica_(rwby)|Ember Celica]], classified as "Dual Ranged Shot Gauntlets" (DRSG). Her weapons eject [[shell_casing|shell casings]]. Her symbol is a burning heart. Her eyes turn [[red eyes|red]] and [[fire]] surrounds her when her semblance (special ability) activates, which converts the damage she takes into additional strength. 

Yang tends to wear yellow/orange/brown/black clothing. Her default outfit includes a long [[orange scarf]] wrapped around her neck, a [[midriff]]-baring [[brown jacket]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] over a [[cleavage]]-revealing [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[tube top]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] underneath her weapon Ember Celica, a brown [[belt]] with [[buckle]] that secures a short [[waist cape]] over [[black shorts|black]] [[shorts]], an [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical]] pair of [[kneehighs|kneehigh]] and [[over-kneehighs|over-kneehigh]] socks, and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her Beacon [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[neck ribbon]], brown [[blazer]], and [[plaid skirt]]. 

[[Ruby Rose]] is her half-sister. She loves her family, her hair, her [[motorcycle]], and fights. Guilty of bad puns. 

[spoiler]At the end of Season 3 of RWBY, Yang has her right arm severed at the elbow by [[Adam Taurus]], and in Season 4 receives a [[prosthetic_arm|prosthetic replacement]].[/spoiler]

Noire is seen as an ideal goddess, working independently on her own time, though this often gets her sick or wears her out. She is generally very menseful towards everyone, but also comes off as stubborn since she prefers to work alone.

Noire is usually wearing a fancy dress colored dark blue, red, and white with gold buttons and lining here and there. She also sports a blue bow on her back as well as a smaller one around her neck that's attached to a monochrome collar and is adorned with a piece of gold in the center. Noire's hair is tied into two very long pigtails that reach her hips, her bangs being nice and neat, and her eyes are as red as rubies.

The ideal goddess Noire is the personification of the Sony PlayStation 3.

Voiced by: [[Imai Asami]] (Japanese), [[Erin Fitzgerald]] (English, 2011-2016), [[Erica Mendez]] (English, 2017-)
kariginu:
A type of [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]].

A notable feature are the sleeves: they are not sewn to the body of the clothing, giving a distinct [[shoulder cutout|open slit on the shoulders]].

Originally designed as hunting clothes, they were comfortable enough that they became common informal clothing for the nobility during the Heian period and onwards.

Please note that this tag does not distinguish between actual kariginu, suikan and other similar clothes, encompassing all of them.

Her excitable dere-dere nature and frequent demands for attention from the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]] lead her to being portrayed as being "protago-sexual" in fan works, falling in love with anyone who is the protagonist of a series. daruma doll:
A [b]Daruma doll[/b] (だるま) is a hollow, round, Japanese [[doll]] that are seen as a symbol of perseverance and good luck, making them a popular gift of encouragement. The eyes of Daruma are often blank. The recipient of the doll fills in one eye upon setting a goal or wish, then the other upon fulfilling it. In this way, every time they see the one-eyed Daruma, they recall the goal.

Should not be confused with [[quadruple amputee]], which will often use the 達磨 tag on pixiv.

mega pokemon: A temporary transformation form of some Pokémon. This can be achieved if the Trainer has a Key Stone while the Pokémon holds a [[Mega Stone]].
content rating:
A classification that rates the suitability of content for any type of media. A content rating will forewarn consumers as to any violent, sexual, or objectionable material presented in the show/[[video game cover|game]]/book/etc., as well as suggesting a recommended age level suitable for experiencing this content in a mature manner. Different types of media use different rating standards, although questionable material is widely encouraged to be avoided by young children.

On Danbooru, this commonly refers to explicit [[doujinshi]] that have the R-18+ notice on the [[cover page]], meaning the content is only suitable for people 18 or older. The words "For Adult Only" can also count as a content rating. Another phrase seen on covers is 成人指定 ([i]seijin shitei[/i]), which means "Reserved for Adults".

Sometimes, a content rating is also used as an [[euphemism]] in speech and thought bubbles when a character talks or thinks about sex, which is then covered up by a "R-18+" sign as censorship.
template: An image with blank spaces designed to be filled in by others. Most commonly, this includes characters speaking with [[blank speech bubble]]s, or characters [[holding sign|holding up blank signs]]. Such images are said to be "exploitable" and are frequently used to make [[meme]]s.

sauna:
A sauna is a small room or house designed as a place to experience dry or wet heat sessions, or an establishment with one or more of these and auxiliary facilities.

Saunas can be divided into two basic styles: conventional saunas that warm the air or infrared saunas that warm objects. I

This does not include characters simply wearing an [[animal hat]] or [[animal hood]].
honeycomb (pattern):
A pattern consisting of a series of [[hexagon|hexagons]] lined up together. In nature, this is seen in [[beehive|beehives]] where [[bee|bees]] store their larvae, pollen, and [[honey]].

This tag can be used if you see the honeycomb pattern present on any object, or as a free-floating design (post #2276086). If there is only one hexagon present without any others connecting to it, don't use this tag.
full armor: A full set of [[armor]] that covers the head, body, arms, and legs. This tag also applies for an armor set that's on a stand, or if a helmet is [[unworn_helmet|unworn]] but still visible.
prisma illya:
The [[magical girl]] identity of [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]], seen in [[Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya]].

Primarily seen with pink [[feather hair ornament]]s.
bust cup:
[[Breasts]] [[breast hold|held]] or [[breasts squeezed together|squeezed]] together to hold liquid (usually [[alcohol]], particularly [[sake]]) between them.
For size see [[cup size]].
no blindfold: A character who normally wears a [[blindfold]] is seen without one. Frequently seen with [[Medusa (rider) (fate)|]], [[2B (nier:automata)|]], and [[Jingliu_(honkai:_star_rail)|]].
dynamax band: Key Item in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i] allowing a Pokémon Trainer to [[Dynamax]] one of their Pokémon.
spiked club:
A [[club (weapon)|]] with [[spikes]].

The Japanese [[kanabou]] is a type of spiked club strongly associated with [[oni]].
admiral (kancolle):
The player character in [[Kantai Collection]]. 

Most admirals wear a [[naval uniform]] with a [[peaked cap]] and [[epaulettes]]. If not caught in those, they usually have on a [[dress shirt]] instead.

This tag is for male admirals only. See [[female admiral (kancolle)|Female Admiral]] for female depictions of the admiral. 

The iteration of the admiral in the second [[Kantai Collection]] anime series: "Itsuka Ano Umi de" (いつかあの海で) is nicknamed [[Admiral Narita (Kancolle)|]].
stab:
A piercing wound caused by something sharp, such as a [[knife]] or a [[sword]].

This tag can refer either to someone who has already been stabbed, or someone who is actively trying to stab someone else.

See [[impaled]] for a stab wound that goes all the way through. See [[knifed]] for when someone has a knife sticking out of them in a comedic manner.
eye trail:
A glowing [[light trail]] following a character's eyes. Often used to show anger or determination.

Although there's overlap with [[glowing eyes]], the two tags should not be confused together.
artist logo: A symbol or picture an artist uses to mark their work which may be accompanied by a [[signature]], [[artist name]], or [[dated|date]]. A logo may include an artist's initials or name in the logo itself.
shiny pokemon:
A [[pokemon|Pokémon]] whose colors are from the [[alternate color|"shiny" palette]] of the games, that are different from their usual colors. Known for being incredibly rare. See also [[shiny and normal]].

For example, [[Gyarados]] are blue, but [i]shiny[/i] Gyarados are red.

h5. Notes

* Not to be confused with [[shiny]] (or [[shiny skin]], or [[shiny clothes]]), as in something that shines, as if they were wet or oiled.
* See also [[alternate shiny pokemon]] for Pokémon with a color palette that isn't shiny or normal.
half mask: A [[mask]] that only covers half of the face. Masks that only cover the mouth and jaw should be tagged [[mouth mask]] instead.
bowsette:
A fan transformation of [[Bowser]] using the [[Super Crown]], based on a comic by [[ayyk92]]. The trend went viral in September 2018.

Bowsette's appearance is a [[fusion]] of [[Princess Peach]] and [[Bowser]]. She typically has Peach's body (but often taller and stronger), hairstyle, [[sphere earrings]] and [[chest jewel]], with Bowser's [[turtle shell]], [[spiked tail]], [[sharp teeth]], [[horns]], and claw-like [[sharp fingernails]]. She usually wears a [[black dress|black]] [[strapless dress]] or [[strapless leotard]], sometimes with an open [[skirt]], with [[black thighhighs]].

An alternate version sometimes has [[red hair]] and [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]].

Her Japanese name is [i]Koopa-hime[/i] (lit. "Princess Bowser"). Other early names were Bowserette, Peacher, Princess Koopa, Peach Bowser, Princess Bowser, and... Beach.
hanging: General non-bondage hanging, dangling, and suspension for characters or creatures.
chongyun (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

An exorcist who roams the land with Liyue as his base of operations, evil spirits fleeing wherever he goes. As the heir to a clan of exorcists, he has always possessed abilities superior to most. However, these abilities are not the result of training, but of an inborn trait — congenital positivity.

His name is pronounced [b]Chouun[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.
flame: This tag has been moved to [[fire]].
dark background: A dark background that usually isn't completely [[simple background|solid black]] unless the subject is dimly lit.
utility belt: A belt typically constructed of nylon or leather used by police and security officers to carry equipment easily, in a readily-accessible manner, while leaving the hands free, usually with [[belt pouch]]es attached.
d-pad: A D-pad (short for directional pad; also known as a joypad) is a flat, usually thumb-operated directional control with one button on each point, found on nearly all modern [[game controller]]s, and on the [[remote control]] units of some [[television]], [[keypad]] [[cellphone|cellphones]] and [[DVD player]]s.
d-pad hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] in the shape of a [[d-pad]]. Mostly worn by several [[neptune_(series)|Neptunia]] characters and [[Kaguya Luna]].
yellow raincoat: Bright yellow, rubberized [[raincoat]]. Part of fisherman [[fashion]]. Design inspired by "oilskin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oilskin].
mismatched bikini: A [[bikini]] where the top and bottom have different colors or different patterns.
aquarium:
A specific location where the public can observe large marine life and ecosystems.

For smaller, indoor containers for pet fish, see [[fish tank]].
kinchaku:
A cloth drawstring bag, sometimes with a wicker bottom, worn with and often matching a [[kimono]] or [[yukata]]. Common [[summer festival]] accoutrement.

For "a type of oden ingredient":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oden#Popular_ingredients], use [[kinchaku_(food)]], [[aburaage]] and [[oden]].
hands on lap:
When a character is sitting or kneeling and they have at least one hand resting on their lap.

If the character is standing and has their hands together, use [[v_arms]] instead.
holding pizza:
Someone is [[holding]] [[pizza]], whether it be a [[pizza slice]] or a full [[pizza]].

If a slice is in the eater's mouth without contact from their hands, use [[food in mouth]] instead.
cactus: A succulent [[plant]] with a thick, fleshy stem that typically bears spines, lacks leaves, and has brilliantly colored [[flower|flowers]]. Cacti are native to arid regions of the New World and are cultivated elsewhere, especially as houseplants.
plectrum: A small flat tool used to pick or strum any string [[instrument]], such as [[guitar]]s and [[harp]]s. Also called a [b]pick[/b].
health bar:
A bar that represents the current health of a character in video games. Also refers to other various bars such as the "super" bar.

Most commonly seen in fighting and adventure games.
cowlick:
According to "Wiktionary":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/cowlick]:

[quote]
An unruly lock or section of hair that sticks straight out from the skull or lies at an angle at odds with the rest of an individual's hair, like a whorl or vortex.[/quote]
izuna (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Ninjutsu Research Club (blue archive)|]].

Her full name is Kuda Izuna.

The main subject of the [[sunken colony Izuna (meme)|]] meme.

Uses a personally customized [[Type 100 smg|Type 100]] [[submachine gun]].

Voiced by: [[Asumi Kana]]
Original artist: [[hanekoto]]
lapels:
Lapels are the folded flaps of cloth on the front of a [[blazer]], [[suit jacket|suit]] [[jacket]]s or [[coat]]. Usually they are formed by folding over the front edges of the jacket or coat and sewing them to the collar, an extra piece of fabric around the back of the neck. 

h1. Types
* !post #7526115: [[notched lapels]]
* !post #7217279: [[peaked lapels]]
* !post #4358592: [[shawl lapels]]
* !post #6218583: [[plaid lapels]] (any shape)
twilight (spy x family):
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]]. He is a spy with his real name unrevealed; he uses "Twilight" as his code name. Also known by his cover civilian name [b]Loid Forger[/b].

He is operating in the setting's analog of East Germany, under the cover identity of "Loid Forger". As part of this cover identity, he is 'married' to [[Yor Briar]] and 'father' to [[Anya (spy x family)|]].

He is voiced by [[Eguchi Takuya]] in Japanese and Alex Organ in English.
arona (blue archive):
A non-playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. [[Sensei (blue archive)|]]'s virtual assistant residing in the Shittim Chest.

She is the main mascot of Blue Archive, appearing as the figurehead on its website and social media. In addition to providing information and updates to Sensei, she also runs a series of videos called Arona Channel, as well as being the one who is representing the in-game [[gacha (game mechanic)|]] mechanics by randomly giving the player an envelope representing student's application.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[light blue hair|blue hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair|undertones]], worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]]. She has [[mismatched pupils]]: her right pupil is [[blue pupils|blue]] while her left pupil is [[pink pupils|pink]].
She carries an [[umbrella_gun|umbrella]] [[shotgun]], which she uses to delete data.

Voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]
wheelchair:
A chair with wheels to serve as a mobility aid when walking is difficult or impossible due to illness, injury, old age, or disability.
Wheelchairs are moved either manually by its user or an attendant or by [[powered wheelchair|a built-in or attached electric motor]].
claw foot bathtub: A portable [[bathtub]] that has distinct feet at the bottom.
kotatsu:
A low [[table]] sandwiching a blanket and containing an electrical heating element underneath; with enough space to rest underneath for one or more people, depending on size. It is something of a wintertime necessity for the many Japanese homes that lack proper insulation for central heating systems. 

The consumption of [[mandarin orange|mandarin oranges]] is often a favorite activity of kotatsu users.
clothed pokemon: A [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] wearing clothes, including hats. This includes naturally humanoid and anthropomorphic Pokémon like [[Gardevoir]] and [[Lopunny]], but generally does not extend to [[personification|personified]] Pokémon.
hot dog:
A [[sausage]] served in a [[hot dog bun]]. The term can refer to the sausage itself, which is typically a wiener or a frankfurter, or the sausage and bun as a whole.

It is often topped with [[ketchup]] and [[mustard]], or sometimes [[relish_(food)|]] or other condiments.
selen tatsuki:
A former [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the second wave [[Obsydia (nijisanji)|]] and designed by [[Kamameshi Gougoumaru]]. She was canonically the sister of [[Elira Pendora]] from the first wave [[LazuLight]]. 

She was terminated on February 5th, 2024 following a month-long hiatus, which later sparked a massive controversy regarding Nijisanji's treatment of their talent after the reason behind her hiatus came to light.

Selen has [[medium hair|medium]] [[purple hair]] in [[twin braids]] with [[hairclip|hairclips]] and [[ahoge]], [[heterochromia]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[purple eyes]], and [[pointy ears]] that are usually obscured by her [[purple wings|purple]] [[head wings]].
wet swimsuit: When a [[swimsuit]] is wet with water. Visible clues that this tag can be used include the character being [[wet]], droplets of water on the swimsuit itself, and/or a [[white one-piece swimsuit]] suddenly being [[see-through clothes|see-through]].
chicken (food):
Chicken in [[food]] form, also known as chicken [[meat]]. It must be heated thoroughly (cooked, fried, roasted, steamed, etc.) before being served, as raw chicken meat may contain dangerous bacteria such as salmonella.

For the animal, see [[chicken]].
bath stool: A stool, now usually made of plastic, commonly used in Japanese bathrooms.
heads together: Multiple characters putting their heads together.
necktie grab:
[[Grabbing]] another person's [[necktie]] with your hand or hands. Not to be confused with [[adjusting necktie]],  this action is often done along with a firm tug in order to get a wearer's attention or draw them closer. 

This is often an expression of [[femdom|dominance]] between two characters.
kagamine len:
Kagamine Len is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. He is the second of the Character Vocal Series together with [[Kagamine Rin]] and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

He is voiced by seiyuu, [[Shimoda Asami]]. He is originally designed and illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]] for his V2 voicebank. His V4X voicebank follows a similar outfit with readjustments designed and illustrated by [[iXima]].

He has [[blonde hair]] done in a [[short ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[sailor collar]] shirt with [[bass clef]] print and [[necktie]]. He wears [[shorts]] along with [[detached sleeves]], [[leg warmers]] and a white [[headset]].

His counterpart is Kagamine Rin. Their relationship (whether they are [[siblings]], lovers, etc) is officially left ambiguous and left up to the user to decide.
bulletin board: A surface intended for the posting of [[note|notes]] and messages, usually made from soft materials such as cork or rubber so that papers may be pinned to them with [[thumbtack|thumbtacks]] or [[pushpin|pushpins]]. Commonly found in settings such as [[classroom|classrooms]] and [[office|offices]] for sharing public notices, but they may be used in private settings like [[bedroom|bedrooms]] as well for displaying [[photo_(object)|photographs]] and keepsakes.
ultraviolet light: A type of electromagnetic radiation that makes black-light posters glow, and is responsible for summer [[tan|tans]].
naked hoodie:
"Naked hoodie", also known as 裸パーカー ([i]hadaka parka[/i], naked parka) in Japanese, refers to a character wearing a [[hoodie]], but being [[nude]] or nearly-nude underneath it.

Danbooru currently doesn't distinguish "naked hoodie" and "nearly naked hoodie."
multicolored swimsuit: A [[swimsuit]] that has at least two or more colors present. See [[multicolored clothes]] for guidelines on what is considered multicolored.
log:
A large trunk of a fallen dead [[tree]].

Some people use them to sit on. Smaller logs - which are thick [[branch|branches]] - are burned in a [[fireplace]] for warmth. Stripped and shaped logs are also used to build structures, such as homes.
tenjouin asuka:
AKA: Alexis Rhodes (English dub)

One of the main characters of [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX]] and one of [[Yuki Judai]]'s friends. Is one of the many duelists attending Duel Academy and is part of the Obelisk Blue branch. She's the younger sister of [[Tenjouin Fubuki]].

An alternate universe version of her appears in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V]].
red pubic hair: [[Pubic hair]] that is [[colored pubic hair|colored red]].
chess: A board game in which [[chess piece|pieces]] of different powers are moved around a [[checkered]] [[chessboard]]. The object of the game is to attack the opponent's king, and put him in a position wherein it's impossible to escape ("[[checkmate]]").
nanami kento:
[b]Kento Nanami[/b] is a supporting character in [i][[Jujutsu Kaisen]][/i].

Voiced by [[Tsuda Kenjirou]].
sirius (azur lane):
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]Dido[/i]-class light cruiser HMS [i]Sirius[/i]. 
Character design by [[Kincora]], voiced by [[Aoki Ruriko]].

Sirius is portrayed as a [[maid]] in the same vein as other Royal Navy light cruisers. In-game, she is portrayed with [[short hair|short]], [[white hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[huge breasts]] accented by her maid outfit.

She is extremely loyal and doting to the Commander and will address them as "Honourable Master", but is somewhat clumsy and accident-prone. Her primary role, however, is as a bodyguard and she excels at combat as a result; she just does other duties out of her devotion to the Commander. Sirius also displays a barely-hidden lewd side, often offering to service the Commander if the "Special Touch" is used before correcting herself. Because of her physical traits and personality, she rivals [[Belfast (azur lane)|]] in popularity among the Royal Maids.
licking breast: The act of licking a woman's [[breasts|breast]].
blue sclera: When the sclera of a character's eyes (the white part) is colored [[blue]].
multiple hair bows: When a character is wearing [b]three[/b] or more [[hair bow]]s in their hair. This doesn't apply to when there are just two hair bows since it is very common, nor does it apply when the bows are on a hat or hood. For that, see [[multiple hat bows]].
holding footwear: Deprecated tag. Use one of the tags below instead.
heart (organ): The organ that [[heartbeat|beats]] and pumps [[blood]]. This should be used to show the actual heart rather than the [[heart]] (♥) symbol.
stomping:
When a character is in the process of forcefully stepping on someone or something. Motion lines can be found in these posts.

For when just a foot is on someone but there is no stomping motion, see [[stepped on]].
lace choker:
A [[choker]] that is comprised entirely of [[lace]].

Not to be confused with [[lace-trimmed choker]].

* !post #6690191: A lace choker
* !post #3842049: A lace trim. The lack of gaps in the center is important in differentiating the two.
logo: Posts with this tag incorporate a logo into the picture or [[parody]] the appearance of it. The logo may be of a company (real or fictitious) or of a copyright.
ojou-sama pose:
For use when a female (and sometimes, the rare male) character strikes a [[hand_to_own_mouth|hand-in-front-of-mouth]] pose, as per the manner of a wealthy aristocratic young lady (a.k.a. [i]ojou-sama[/i]).

This is often accompanied by a haughty "OHOHOHO!" [[laughing|laugh]].
onii-shota: A genre consisting of pairing a younger boy with an older male in a risque, sexual or romantic fashion. A portmanteau of 'onii-san' (elder brother/older man) and 'shota' (young boy).
claw (weapon): [[Claws]] that are used as weapons. Made from sharp blades that are aligned to form a claw.
round teeth:
A wide, [[open mouth|open-mouthed]] [[smile]] where the front [[upper teeth only|upper teeth]] are drawn as a single round semicircle.

Often, it is reserved for depictions of youthfulness, playful personality, and innocence, and is very often a recurring physical trait in certain characters (as with [[Mizuno Kaede]] and [[Aoi Sora (pairan)|]]). However, it is common enough that it might show up without any qualifiers.

Differs from [[buck teeth]] in that buck teeth describes only the two upper front teeth, or a something that resembles just those two front teeth, while round teeth describes the entire row of front upper teeth.
mismatched sleeves:
Sleeves of two different colors or patterns. For differences in length, see [[uneven sleeves]].

Not to be confused with [[single sleeve]].
orange planet uniform:
The [[uniform]] worn by [[undine (aria)|Undines]] from the Orange Planet Company in [i][[ARIA (manga)|]][/i]. I has 2 different variations depending on the season:

The [[summer uniform|summer]] version consists of a yellow-trimmed, [[sailor collar|sailor-collared]], [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], worn over a [[long dress|long]], [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]]. The blouse is rather short, reaching only below the breasts and features a [[patch]] with the company [[logo]] on the left sleeve and yellow [[chevron (symbol)|]] on the other one.

The [[winter uniform|winter version]] replaces the blouse with a [[white capelet]] with yellow or [[gold trim|golden trims]] and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white dress]], a long-sleeved [[white shirt|white]] [[undershirt]] and [[purple pantyhose]].

The dress in both versions has yellow trims and prominently features the company [[logo]] in yellow on both the front and the back, and is surprisingly [[skin tight]], almost to the point of being an [[impossible dress]] and has a cutout either on the front or the [[side slit|side]] of one of the legs.

Both versions feature [[yellow footwear|white]] [[knee boots]], a [[yellow ascot]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]] with the company logo on the front.
arthropod limbs: A human character with the limbs of a [[bug]], [[crustacean]], [[arachnid]], or other arthropod animal.
thumbs down:
The opposite of [[thumbs up]]: pointing the thumb(s) downward as a sign of disapproval or impending downfall. Has a somewhat harsher connotation in Japan than in the West, meaning something like "go to hell".

If a character is doing this gesture with both hands, add [[double thumbs down]] too.
vibrator in anus: A [[vibrator]] inserted [[anal object insertion|into the anus]].
drink can:
Also known as a beverage can, it is a metal container designed to hold a fixed portion of liquid.

Examples include, but are not limited to, [[soda]], [[beer]], [[energy drink|energy drinks]], [[juice|fruit juices]] and [[tea|teas]].
neckwear:
Ambiguous tag. Please use more specific alternatives like [[ascot]], [[bowtie]], [[bolo tie]], [[neckerchief]], [[neck ribbon]], [[necktie]], [[scarf]] or such.

h1. See also
* [[neckwear request]]
* [[Tag Group:Neck and Neckwear]]
debt: For images depicting someone being indebted.
cropped vest: A [[vest]] that is as short as a [[cropped jacket]].
waist cape: A piece of clothing that is designed like a [[cape]] but is worn around the waist rather than on the back.
mitaka asa: Co-protagonist of [[Chainsaw Man]] Part 2. She let a devil take over her body and becomes the host of the [[War Devil (Chainsaw Man)|War Devil]], who she refers to as [[Yoru (Chainsaw Man)|Yoru]] while under its possession.
crotch plate:
A rigid, usually metal panel, worn as a form of protection over the crotch. May be attached to clothing or applied directly to the skin. 

Some characters commonly depicted wearing one include:
* [[tron bonne (mega man)|Miss Tron]] 
* [[Meltryllis (fate)|]]
* [[Lambda-11]], [[Mu-12]], and [[Nu-13]] 
* various [[Witchblade]] users.
checkered kimono: A [[kimono]] that has a [[checkered]] pattern. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
hieda no akyuu:
The "Memory of [[Gensokyo]]".

Resident historian of the [[Touhou]] series and ninth (and current) incarnation of the "Child of Miare", possessing a photographic memory as well as the ability to recall memories from her previous incarnations ([[hieda no aichi|Aichi]], [[hieda no ani|Ani]], [[hieda no ami|Ami]], [[hieda no ayo|Ayo]], [[hieda no ago|Ago]], [[hieda no amu|Amu]], [[hieda no anana|Anana]] and [[hieda no aya|Aya]]). In-universe author of [i]Perfect Memento in Strict Sense[/i] and [i]Symposium of Post-Mysticism[/i], encyclical works on the various faces, places, and dates in Gensokyo. Also writes mystery fiction under the pen name [[Agatha Chris Q outfit (touhou)|Agatha Chris Q]]. Her original, "zeroth" incarnation was the author [[Hieda no Are]], writer of the Kojiki.

After it was revealed that all Children of Miare generally live for around 30 years in [i]Strange Creators of Outer World[/i], some fans began to count the days until Akyuu's 30th birthday, which would be, according to [i]Perfect Memento[/i], around August/September 2024 (earliest August 7, latest September 6). However, ZUN has confirmed that Akyuu wouldn't die, and that the other characters wouldn't grow old, as the series runs on 'Sazae-san time', a floating timeline (commonly called "Comic Book Time" in the west due to its heavy use in that media). This didn't stop fans from awaiting the day. Around August 7th, 2024, fans "across":[https://twitter.com/richard_effendi/status/1821886649661321351] the world began discussing the death of Hieda no Akyuu.
no mouth: Tag used when there is no visual mouth, accidentally (scan came out too bright) or intentionally (as a show of indifference).
wriggle nightbug:
The "Bug of Light Wriggling in the Dark". Stage 1 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i].
A youkai insect (in her case, based on a [[firefly]]) with the ability to manipulate insects. She is best known, however, for the confusion surrounding her gender (due to her [[androgynous]] appearance) prior to the full release of IN. Doujins portray her as a member of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]], a posse of low-tier Touhou characters alongside [[Cirno]], [[Mystia Lorelei]] and [[Rumia]]. Also humorously called "G" (short for "gokiburi", Japanese for "cockroach"), due to the antennae on her head. She is also frequently associated with [[Kazami Yuuka]], because they have similar hairstyles and because bugs pollinate flowers.
reze (chainsaw man):
Reze, also known as Lady Reze, is a [[Bomb Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]] hybrid from the Soviet Union, who was sent to Japan with the mission of stealing the Chainsaw Man's heart. She is the primary antagonist of the titular Bomb Girl arc.

Also use [[Bomb Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]] when she is in her Devil form.
multiple legs:
A [[monster girl]] or [[mecha]] with more than two legs.

These additional legs should be normal for the character, such as a [[spider girl]] having eight legs. If the legs are abnormal, such as a human having a third leg, then use the [[extra legs]] tag instead.
van: A covered box-like [[car|motor vehicle]] with high carrying capacity, typically having a rear door and sliding doors on the side panels, used for transporting goods or people.
exposed pocket: When a pair of [[cutoffs]] or [[denim shorts]] are so short that the [[pocket]]s are visible beneath the hemline of the shorts.
kitchen knife: A type of [[knife]] used for preparing food.
sleeping upright: [[Sleeping]] while [[sitting]] or [[standing]] upright, often while leaning against another person or wall.
omurice:
A Western-inspired Japanese dish that features [[rice]] cooked into an [[omelet]], forming a pouch, and usually topped with [[ketchup]]. The ketchup is often poured to spell out words (such as the intended eater's name).

Typically, the rice is "chicken rice" [[fried rice|fried]] in a pan with chicken and ketchup, but the ingredients can vary. Other variations include [i]omusoba[/i] substituting [[yakisoba]] for the rice and [i]omutako[/i] in Okinawa consisting of an omelet over taco rice.

Stories about the origin of omurice vary, but two such stories attribute its origin to Western-style restaurants. The first says it originated around the turn of the 20th century at Renga-tei in Ginza, Tokyo after the restaurant got the idea for it from chakin [[sushi]], which features sushi rice wrapped in a thin omelet. The second says it originated in 1925 at Hokkyokusei in Minami, Osaka when a cook decided to enliven a regular customer's order of an omelet with rice.
honey:
A sweet substance that is exclusively produced by [[bee|honey bees]] using nectar from flowers. It is widely used for sweetening foods, for flavoring, and for medicinal properties. 

Honey is one of the few foods in the world that in its raw state will never spoil if properly stored, this is due to honey's low water content, high acidity, and it containing small amounts hydrogen peroxide.
yellow tank top: A [[tank top]] that is colored yellow.
nakano ichika:
A character in [[Go-toubun no Hanayome]] and eldest of the Nakano [[quintuplets|Quintuplet]] sisters. Ichika is caring, thoughtful, and wise, being a responsible older sister. She enjoys sleeping and her room is incredibly messy. She aspires to become a movie actress and dedicates most of her time and resources to do so, [spoiler]to the point of having to quit schooling in order to focus on her acting career[/spoiler]. Her best subject is mathematics, and her daily hobby is jogging.

She has [
araragi tsukihi: [i][[monogatari_(series)|Monogatari Series]][/i] character. She is the younger of [[Araragi Koyomi]]'s two younger sisters, and has a distinct habit of wearing [[kimono|kimonos]].
side-tie leotard: A [[leotard]] that has strings on the sides so they can be tied.
hino rei:

Known by various names, such as: balance ball, birth ball, body ball, fitness ball, gym ball, gymnastic ball, physio ball, pilates ball, Pezzi ball, stability ball, Swedish ball, Swiss ball, therapy ball, Bosu ball, or yoga ball.

boobplate:

This tag should [b]not[/b] be used for armor that would qualify as [[bikini armor]]. A boobplate should still cover a significant portion of the torso and not just the breasts. For armor that only covers the breasts and leaves most of the upper body exposed, use the [[bikini armor]] or [[chest guard]] tags instead.

Notable examples of characters who wear a boobplate include [[Darkness_(Konosuba)|]] from [[kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!|Konosuba]], [[Catherine_(fire_emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]], [[Noelle_(genshin_impact)|]] from [[Genshin Impact]], and [[Mash Kyrielight]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]].
saria (arknights):

argyle background: A background that completely or predominantly consists of [[diamond (shape)|diamonds]].

split screen: When the image is split into two halves with a line. Several uses for this include comparing a character's different forms; placing two characters side by side in two columns (for more columns, see [[column lineup]]); or a technique used to convey [[split theme|two clashing characters]].
akagi miria:
An [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]] character in the Passion (Yellow Sun) category.

A young girl who really loves to talk. Possessing boundless energy, a sunny and positive outlook, and enthusiasm for everything she does, Miria became an idol because doing all the cute things seemed fun. She can be pretty mature at times, calling the Producer "cute" and asking him to spend time with her on their days off. But when it comes down to it, she's just a curious little girl who dreams of being an idol. Since she's 11, she's still pretty childish and naive, but she does her best at everything idol-related.

Her curiosity is quickly used as one of her charm points.
Due to her popularity, she was selected for the fourth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Abe Nana]], [[Koshimizu Sachiko]], [[Hino Akane (Idolmaster)|Hino Akane]], and [[Nitta Minami]]. She is voiced by [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].

She is in the unit [[Decoration (idolmaster)|]] with [[Jougasaki Rika]] and [[Moroboshi Kirari]] and their unit costumes are [[Pikapikapop (idolmaster)|]] in the anime.

weiss schnee:
Weiss Schnee is one of the main characters of [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth. 

Weiss is the "W" in RWBY, and is associated with the color white. Her character design is inspired by [[Snow White (fairy tale character)|]].
[[Winter Schnee]] is her sister. As heiress to the Schnee Dust Company, her life has been marked by pressure. Her arrogant and prickly exterior hides a softer heart.

A bit of a manchild, he serves as an elder brother figure for [[Shimura Shinpachi]] and [[Kagura (gintama)|]] nonetheless.
koseki bijou:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and the Sparkling Gem of hololive English [[holoadvent|-Advent-]], the third generation [[hololive English]]. Designed by [[Kitada Mo]]. Also goes by her nickname, "Biboo".

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] to [[purple hair|purple]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She also has [[purple gemstone]]s embedded or protruding on various parts of her body, most notably a large [[chest jewel]], small gems [[jewel under eye|under her right eye]] and on [[hand jewel|the back of her hands]] and [[detached wings]]. Despite appearances, her feet are not made out of gemstone and instead she has regular human feet encased in gemstone that she can remove at will. Her default hairstyle consists of [[hair flaps]], [[double-parted bangs|double parted]] [[center-flap bangs]] and [[sidelocks]].
very sweaty: Heavy sweating. Typically illustrated with numerous sweat drops, rivulets of sweat, along with other signs of exertion such as [[heavy breathing]] or a [[steaming body]].
skull print: Clothing or an object that has a [[skull]] printed on it.
starfighter:
A common type of combat [[spacecraft]] designed to be small and fast, and often manned by a single [[pilot]]. Frequent in many [[science fiction]] works.

For a real life [[jet]] fighter, see [[F-104 Starfighter]].
nishizumi maho:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Tank commander of a [[Tiger I]], and overall commander of the "Kuromorimine":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

More specifically, she commands Tiger 212, the same tank commanded in real life by the highly decorated panzer ace "[1]":[#dtext-external-links], Michael Wittman "[2]":[#dtext-external-links], alluding to her own status as a tank ace in the GuP universe.

Voiced by [[Tanaka Rie]] "[3]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Kuromorimine Girls Academy

h6. Original Anime

Having distinguished herself as the successor to the Nishizumi School of Tankery at a young age, she is Miho's older sister. She serves as the commanding officer of the Kuromorimine Girls Academy team. As a strong international player, like many celebrities she has been taken up by the media.

[tn]Source: "[4]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1291874)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Having distinguished herself as the successor to the Nishizumi School of Tankery at a young age, she is Miho's older sister. She serves as the commanding officer of the Kuromorimine Girls Academy team. As a strong international player, like many celebrities she has been taken up by the media. She has decided to study abroad in Germany.

marcille donato: Main character of [[Dungeon Meshi]] and one of the original members of [[laios touden|Laios]]' party. She is an [[elf|elven]] mage who wields a tall wooden [[staff]] that forms a loop at the top, called [[Ambrosia (dungeon meshi)|]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]], and wears a [[blue robe]] with matching [[blue hood|blue]] [[hooded capelet|hooded]] [[blue capelet|capelet]]. She [i]hates[/i] eating monsters, which (given the manga she's stuck in) is a source of constant frustration/reaction images, and has led to a good amount of memes and emotes.
whispering: When one character is speaking in a quiet voice so the conversation is kept private.
reference sheet:
An image depicting the details of a design. A reference sheet usually consists of [[multiple views]] of the same subject from different angles, with notes [[pointing out the details]] of the design, and sometimes with details such as clothing or accessories drawn separately for characters. The image often has the character with certain [[clothes on and off]].

For characters depicted in the same pose but in different clothing (as in post #1580637), use [[variations]].

This tag is for reference sheets of any subject. Use the [[weapon focus]] and [[vehicle focus]] tags alongside this one when appropriate.
multicolored kimono:
A [[kimono]] that has two or more distinct colors present in its design. See [[multicolored clothes]] for guidelines on what is considered multicolored.

This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
medb (fate):
Rider-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[E Pluribus Unum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity.

The Queen of Connacht in Irish mythology. Uses a riding crop in battle, and summons her wagon [spoiler]that she uses to kidnap men to sleep with her[/spoiler] as her Noble Phantasm. Infamous for her extreme hypersexuality, to the point where her skill in riding (a man) was one of the criteria for her Rider designation.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takayama Kisai]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sakura Ayane]]
pants tucked in:
When the legs of pants are tucked into the wearer's footwear (e.g. [[boots]]). Commonly used by [[samurai]], their baggy pants under the armor are actually tucked in [[hakama pants|hakama]].

Not to be confused with [[shirt_tucked_in]].
multiple anal: Multiple objects penetrating the [[anus]] at the same time.
asteroid:
An [b]asteroid[/b] is a metallic or rocky body that [[in orbit]]s a star and lacks any atmosphere. 

The size and shapes of asteroids vary significantly, including even dwarf [[planet]]s, but not regular size or large planets.
naked cloak: Similar to [[naked_apron]], this refers to a character wearing a [[cloak]] without any other forms of attire.
surreal: Art, (and sometimes literature) that attempts to express the workings of the subconscious. Usually characterized by fantastic imagery and incompatible or inconsistent things placed together, resulting in a oddly dreamlike image or story.
fish girl:
A fish-like [[monster girl]] with human legs, unlike a [[mermaid]]. Commonly identified by [[head fins]] and other [[fins]], fish-like [[scales]], [[webbed hands]] or [[webbed feet]], and/or [[gills]]. They may also have a [[fish tail]] in addition to their legs.

When in doubt (e.g. the lower body isn't visible), use [[mermaid]] instead.
w (arknights):
[i]W, Sarkaz mercenary, is the single most dangerous signal on the battlefield.[/i]

A Reunion Movement squad leader who had previously cut her teeth as a Sarkaz mercenary in [[Arknights]], and a playable Sniper Operator later on.
skadi (arknights):

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].
polka dot legwear: Legwear with a [[polka dot]] pattern (circular shapes) [[print_legwear|printed]] on the leg.
prosthetic leg: An artificial leg, typically intended to replace a missing leg.
multicolored background:
This tag has been deprecated. Use one of the following instead:

* [[colorful background]]
* [[gradient background]]
* [[two-tone background]]
people:
Unnamed background characters that are not part of an image's focus, usually to bring life to a scene and make spaces look less empty. They may be drawn at considerable distance from the viewer (post #1648083), or the artist may use other means to establish that they are not a significant part of the image (post #2370885). In general, characters described by this tag don't count towards tags like [[multiple girls]] and [[multiple boys]].

If there are large number of background people in the image, the tag [[crowd]] is applicable.
purple umbrella:
An [[umbrella]] that is colored [[purple]].

Popularly associated with [[Tatara Kogasa]].
tripod: A three-legged stand used to stabilize another object. Commonly used for photography, where it supports a [[camera]].
blue gemstone:
A [[gem]]stone with a blue color.

A common gemstone with this color are sapphires.
between thighs:
For when an object is situated or held between a person's thighs.  Note that most sexual connotations are covered by, and should be marked with, their own tags listed below.

Alternatively, [[hand_between_legs|hands]] (or [[tail_between_legs|tails]], arms etc.) placed between the thighs, usually in a coy manner.

An entire person in such a position is [[between legs]].
deer: A type of medium to large size ruminant mammal with [[deer antlers|antlers]]. It usually lives in [[forest]]ed areas.
hanging light:
A light fixture that hangs from the [[ceiling]] by a chain, cord, or metal rod. They are a common light source over [[kitchen]] counters and [[restaurant]] tables.

This tag is distinct from [[chandelier]] in that chandeliers are large fixtures that branch out into multiple lamps, whereas hanging lights are of simple design and only have one or two lamps each. Hanging lights are often arranged in multiples to evenly illuminate an area.
microwave:
Also called a microwave oven, it is a kitchen appliance that uses dielectric heating to warm up food.

Not to be confused with a [[toaster oven]], a small countertop oven of similar shape.  Generally identifiable by the handle at the top of the door instead of the on the side with microwave.
bag of chips: A bag of [[potato chips]], or any other type of [[chips (food)|chip]].
beer: A type of [[alcohol]] that is made by the brewing and fermentation of starches and is flavored by hops. Can be served in a [[beer bottle|bottle]], [[beer can|can]], [[beer mug|mug]], or a large glass.
leonardo da vinci (fate):
A Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Appears as part of [[Chaldea Security Organization]]'s staff, being their 3rd successful heroic spirit summon. While male in life, da Vinci chose to embody the appearance of the [[Mona Lisa]] painting that he worked on during his life, as genius has no gender.

After the events of the Part 2 Prologue [spoiler]wherein she is murdered by [[Grigori rasputin (fate)|]][/spoiler], a younger [[Leonardo da Vinci (Rider) (fate)|Rider-class version]] of her appears instead.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Simosi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sakamoto Maaya]]
blue collar:
A [[collar]] that is colored blue.

This is for standalone [[collar]]s not part of a shirt. Do not use for [[collared shirt]]s, [[blue sailor collar]]s, or other similar clothing.
candelabra: The traditional term for a set of multiple decorative candlesticks, each of which often holds a [[candle]] on each of multiple arms or branches connected to a column or pedestal. A single member of such a set is known as a candelabrum.
unconscious: When a character suddenly loses consciousness due to trauma or injury. Often characterized with a conscious character holding or carrying the unconscious character.
kurokote: A type of [i][[kote]][/i] made (usually) from black iron plates, which gives it its name: "black" [i]kote[/i].
iowa (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Iowa[/i] (BB-61). Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Hashimoto Chinami (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], grayish [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]] with visible [[cleavage]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey corset]] with her real-life hull number printed on it, [[blue shirt]] tied to the front, [[American flag print]] [[thighhighs]] (red vertical stripes for the right, blue for the left), [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], two-tone grey-blue [[miniskirt]], [[black belt]] with the US Navy emblem, and [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces containing her three historic three 406 mm/16-inch triple mounts Mk7, one to her left and two to her right. She also carries three of her ten 127 mm twin mounts: one beside the starboard main guns, two to the back of the portside main gun. Her funnel carries searchlights on either side and has two Bofors 40 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s below the searchlights. Another Bofors quad mount is atop her third main battery turret, while the second turret has three Oerlikon 20mm mounts on its top. 

Much like [[Kongou (kancolle)|]], Iowa is loud, friendly and energetic. Also like Kongou, she uses English mixed in with her Japanese speech, but her English is so broken and accented many find it incomprehensible.

Her historical counterpart is currently docked in the Port of Los Angeles complex as a museum ship, making her the first ship to appear in the game which wasn't sunk, scuttled, scrapped, or expended as a target. She is also the first Allied ship implemented in the game.
rice: Rice is the seed of the monocot plant Oryza sativa, of the grass family (Poaceae). As a cereal grain, it is the most important staple food for a large part of the world's human population, especially in tropical Latin America, East, South and Southeast Asia.
ear ribbon: A [[ribbon]] tied around the ear, usually an [[animal_ears|animal ear]]. Common feature of many [[Umamusume]] characters.
halloween bucket:
A Halloween bucket or Halloween candy bucket is a container used by trick-or-treaters for holding [[Halloween]] [[candy]]. Frequently [[pumpkin]]-shaped and/or decorated like a [[jack-o'-lantern]].

This tag shouldn't be used with the [[bucket]] tag
planet hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] shaped to resemble a [[planet]], usually [[Saturn (planet)|]] since it's the most recognizable.
sam browne belt:
A style of wearing a [[belt]] by fitting it over the right shoulder like a bandolier. It is often worn on [[military uniform|military]] and occasionally [[police uniform]]s.

It is not to be confused with the style of wearing two belts in a suspender-like fashion. 

The diagonal belt should connect to a horizontal belt at the waist. A diagonal belt by itself should be tagged as [[shoulder belt]].
winter coat: The winter version of the coat looks warmer than a regular coat. It looks like a [[down jacket]].
klee (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Spark Knight of the Knights of Favonius and the daughter of [[Alice_(genshin_impact)|]]. Constantly being punished by [[Jean (genshin Impact)|]] due to her constant use of explosives.

Klee has [[blonde hair]] and eyes that can be [[red eyes|red]] or [[orange eyes|orange]]. She wears a [[red hat]] and [[red dress]], along with a [[backpack]], [[grey gloves]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. She also has [[pointy ears]].
holding another's foot: Holding or touching another person's foot, feet, or ankle.
dollar bill: Any denomination of United States paper currency. Do not use this tag for non-US money.
no lineart: A drawing that has little or no line-art. Shapes are rendered rather than outlined. Eyes excluded.
tohru (maidragon):
Tohru is a main character from [[Kobayashi-san chi no Maidragon]]. She is a [[dragon]] from a parallel world, who travels to modern-day Japan where she takes the form of a [[dragon girl]]. She lives with [[kobayashi_(maidragon)|Kobayashi]] and [[Kanna Kamui]], while working as Kobayashi's maid.

In her dragon girl form, she has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]] which [[gradient_hair|blends]] to [[orange_hair|orange]] towards the tips. She has [[orange eyes]] with [[slit pupils]]. Tohru always possess [[dragon horns]]. While at home she features a large green [[dragon tail]], but while out in society it is usually magically hidden. While in dragon girl form she very occasionally displays a pair of [[dragon wings]]. Tohru is most often depicted wearing a cosplay-style [[maid|maid uniform]] featuring a red [[ascot]], [[puffy short sleeves]], [[white_gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]] and a [[maid headdress]].

For Tohru's dragon form, see [[Tohru (dragon) (maidragon)|]].
broken chain: A broken [[chain]] is present in the image.
binoculars: A type of optics. A pair of telescopes mounted side-by-side.
strapless shirt:
A [[shirt]] that doesn't have any straps, neck, or sleeves. The shoulders and upper chest area are left [[bare shoulders|bare]].

A strapless shirt is similar to a [[tube top]], but not exactly the same. A tube top is generally shorter and has a tighter fit, while a strapless shirt is usually longer and looser. A tube top usually wraps tight around the breasts and doesn't cover the [[midriff]], while a strapless shirt usually covers the stomach and doesn't conform as tightly to the breasts.

This tag may be used for strapless shirts with [[detached sleeves]], but not for [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] or [[off-shoulder shirt]]s. A [[sleeveless shirt]] has a neck but no sleeves; an [[off-shoulder shirt]] has sleeves but no neck; a strapless shirt has neither.
analog clock:
A type of [[clock]] normally consisting of [[dial|a circular face with 12 numbers]], one for each hour in an AM/PM system, a short hand indicating the hour, and a long hand indicating the minute. Minutes are grouped into batches of 5, though sometimes there may be smaller lines between the hour markers for each minute interval. May or may not contain an additional hand indicating the seconds.

Certain unique types of analog clocks may have greater or fewer than 12 hours, though 12 is the most
locked arms:
One arm hooked around another's, so that inner elbows (cubital fossa) are directly touching each other.

Sometimes seen in the [[back-to-back]] exercise.
fischl (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

A mysterious girl who calls herself "Prinzessin der Verurteilung" and travels with a night [[crow]] named [[Oz (genshin impact)|]].
Currently serves as an investigator in the Adventurers' Guild.

Through her unique abilities, [[chuunibyou]] personality, and (while she would never admit it herself) hard work, Fischl has become a rising star among the Adventurers' Guild's investigators, earning the recognition of all.

She has a petite build, light [[green eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[two side up]] hair with a [[black ribbon|black]] bat-winged [[hair ribbon]]. She wears a black [[eyepatch]] to not obstruct her view when possessing Oz.

Overall, Fischl seems to have designed her outfit to be as asymmetrical as physically possible. She wears a sleeveless black lace dress-like [[leotard]] with a black lace [[collar]] and [[purple bowtie]], crosses stitched in, and black and violet [[tailcoat]]s. Her [[vision (genshin impact)|]] is tied to the back of this dress with a bat wing-style [[purple ribbon]]. She wears a shoulder-length black [[gloves|glove]] on her left hand and a black and purple [[single_sleeve|sleeve]] or [[single bridal gauntlet]] on her right arm. She wears a transparent black [[single_thighhigh|thighhigh]] on her right leg and a similar thigh-high black sock held up by [[garter straps]] on her left. She wears [[black_footwear|black]] [[boots]] with a light purple lining, gold [[high_heels|heels]], and [[bat_ornament|bat wing decorations]].

In general, Fischl seems to style herself after the titular character of said book "Flowers for Princess Fischl".

Her full name is Fischl von Luftschloss Narfidort. Actual name: Amy.

She also appears in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] as a playable character.

Chinese CV: Mace
Japanese CV: [[Uchida Maaya]]
guided breast grab: A variant of [[grabbing another's breast]] that involves someone (usually but not necessarily the one whose [[breasts]] are being touched) [i]intentionally[/i] putting another person's hands to a breast.
unmoving pattern:
A repeating clothing pattern (such as a [[checkered clothes|checkerboard]], [[plaid clothes|plaid]], or [[floral print]]) that does not follow the folds or contours of the clothes or body at all. 

If there is no repeating pattern, use [[double exposure]].

Featured in many, [i]many[/i] anime, as it's much cheaper and easier than adjusting the pattern realistically. Particularly noticeable in stylized or minimalistic shows such as [[Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei]] and [[Bakemonogatari]].
stick: A long piece of wood. Not to be confused with [[cane]]s, also known as "walking sticks".
hand on hilt: When a character's hand is touching or resting upon the hilt of their own [[sword]], usually unsheathed and [[planted sword|planted in the ground]]. If a character is gripping and drawing their weapon, tag as [[unsheathing]] instead.
holstered:
When a weapon (usually a [[handgun]]) is placed on a [[holster]]. The [[weapon]] must be visible to the viewer.

caenis (fate):
Lancer-class Servant of [[Kirschtaria Wodime]] first appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Anastasia (lostbelt) (fate/grand order)|Anastasia]] Lostbelt. She was released as a playable servant after the [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt.

In Greek mythology, Caenis was a woman who was raped by Poseidon. Afterwards, Poseidon granted her a wish; Caenis wished to become an invulnerable warrior. Poseidon granted her wish, turning Caenis into the male Caeneus.

The version appearing in Fate/Grand Order has her original female body, but is often referred to with male pronouns by others in the game. She uses the masculine personal pronoun [b]Ore[/b].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Azusa (hws)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Komatsu Mikako]]
missile pod: A [[missile]] launcher system used in modern [[military]] vehicles to stock and fire those weapons.
slapping:
An open-palmed strike, usually directed to one's face.

morning glory:
A common name for more than 1000 species of [[flower]]ing plants in the [i]Convolvulaceae[/i] family.

The [[plant]] bears funnel-shaped flowers that close late in the day. They are known for their five symmetrical, finely overlapping petals and bright colors in shades of pink, red, blue, and purple; the center is often white. The flowers often have a distinctive star shape in the center, which is often emphasized by artists. Depending on the species, the leaves can be heart-shaped or ivy-shaped (three-lobed). Morning glory [[vines]] are often trained to climb [[trellis]]es but will eagerly climb [[fence]]s as well.

As morning glories are easy to grow, Japanese elementary schools often have their students grow them as part of their plant cultivation experience. It is typical summer homework for Japanese students to bring home the morning glories (that they have grown to a certain extent at school) and observe and record their growth (note that summer vacation is in the middle of the school year in Japan).

Its common Japanese name, アサガオ (朝顔 [i]asa-gao[/i]), literally translates to "morning face". There is a night-blooming species, [i]Ipomoea alba[/i], commonly called [[moonflower (flower)|]]. Its common Japanese name is ヨルガオ (夜顔 [i]yoru-gao[/i]), which literally translates to "night face".

steak: A cut of [[meat]] that is cooked to varying degrees of doneness, ranging in the following: very rare - rare - medium rare - medium - medium well done - well done. Without a qualifier, steak refers to [[beef]]steak. Other types of steaks are defined, such as [[fish steak]] or venison steak.
bass guitar: A plucked string [[instrument]], closely related to the [[guitar]]. See [[double bass]] for the traditional bowed string instrument. A bass guitar can be distinguished from a standard guitar by the fact that it almost always has four strings, and four tuning pegs at the top of the neck, usually along one side or with two on each side directly opposed. The bridge is also much closer to the bottom of the body to accommodate the longer strings. [[acoustic bass guitar|Acoustic basses]] feature a larger resonator body to better amplify lower frequencies and a longer neck compared to their [[acoustic guitar]] counterparts. Electric bass guitars use pickups to sense and convert string vibrations into electromagnetic impulses. Often they are based on existing [[electric guitar]] designs but nearly always have four or [[5-string_bass_guitar|five strings]] as opposed to guitar's six, although there are some [[6-string_bass_guitar|six string models]]. Electric basses, especially those equipped with active pickups, tend to have more control knobs than an electric guitar with an equal number of pickups. Do not tag [[bass guitar]]s as regular [[guitar]]s.
barbed wire: Barbed wire is a type of steel fencing wire constructed with sharp edges or points arranged at intervals along the strands.
