She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[multicolored hair|hint]] or [[red hair|red]], [[yellow eyes]], [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]] adorned with a [[tail ribbon]].
She's dressed in a [[black kimono]] with a [[floral print]], a [[flower choker]], [[high heel boots]] with a [[torn_thighhighs|torn]] [[single thighhigh]], and a [[fox mask]] that makes her eyes [[glowing_eyes|glow]] [[red eyes|red]].

Uses an [[Arisaka]]-type [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] with a [[tassel]] decorated [[bayonet]].

Voiced by: [[Saitou Chiwa]]
Original artist: [[NAMYO]]
armpit cutout: A [[clothing cutout]] on the underside of outfit sleeves that exposes the [[armpits]] in otherwise sleeved outfits.
pompadour:
A hair style in which the front hair is swept up from the forehead into a high roll at the top of the head. Often exaggerated in animation to comical proportions. Popular with rockers (particularly [[Elvis Presley|Elvis]] impersonator), gang members, and other rebels.

The Japanese often misunderstand the pompadour as the "リーゼント (regent style)."
open robe:
A [[robe]] that is unfastened, revealing the body underneath.

If the wearer is naked underneath the robe, [[naked robe]] may apply as well.
crepe: A type of very thin, cooked [[pancake]] usually made from wheat flour. Rolled up and often have a [[fruit]] filling of syrup, mixed [[berry]], fresh fruit or lemon cream.
ar-15:
The [B][[AR-15]][/b] is an American semi-automatic [[rifle]] designed in 1956 by Eugene Stoner and L. James Sullivan, based on the [[AR-10]]. AR stands for [b]ArmaLite[/b], its original manufacturer. The early design feature a top-mounted charging handle inside the carry handle. Its selective fire variant was eventually adopted by the U.S. military as the M16. 

Predominantly available in .223/5.56mm caliber, the rifle enjoys a huge popularity for its accuracy, and controllable recoil, as well as modular and customizable design despite surrounding controversies. Therefore various companies manufacture and market such rifles. 

* Any non-military issue rifle of this design is properly labelled AR-15 regardless of specific subvariant. Or for any AR-15-style rifles of less-known, unspecified model.
* Usage context is for non-military, civilian setting. Because further artistic details of fire selector can be rendered invisible or insignificant most of the time.
* This tag should not be used altogether to refer several better-known, AR-based military-grade rifles such as the [[M16]], [[Colt Commando]], [[M4 Carbine]], or [[h&k hk416|HK416]].
pants around one leg: [[Pants]] that have been partially removed and are wrapped around only one leg.
cucumber:
A cylinder-shaped [[fruit]], [i]Cucumis sativus[/i], with a thin green rind and white flesh. It is prepared and eaten as a [[vegetable]], and is a favorite of [[kappa|kappas]]. [[Cat]]s have an [[cats are scared of cucumbers (meme)|instinctual revulsion to the sight of them]]; it is believed they associate their appearance with snakes.

[[Kappamaki]] is a kind of sushi containing cucumber.
pearl (gemstone): A milky carbonate sphere produced by mollusks. Most pearls today are farmed with oysters and white, although they can be any color.
lowleg:
Low-cut attire (such as [[underwear]] or [[bikini]]s), typically featuring a thin waistband:

* [[lowleg bikini]]: low-cut bikini bottoms
* [[lowleg panties]]: low-cut panties
* [[lowleg pants]]: low-cut pants
* [[lowleg pantyhose]]: low-set pantyhose
* [[lowleg shorts]]: low-cut shorts
* [[lowleg skirt]]: low-set skirts
chocolate on breasts:
Melted [[chocolate]] smeared or poured on the [[breasts]].

If it's solid chocolate, use [[food between breasts]] and [[chocolate]] instead.
naked bandage: Naked bandage is a fetish involving the subject being nude/nearly nude covered in bandages. Said bandages can but don't have to cover the genitalia or nipples and may appear in such a way that they act as pseudo clothing.
four-leaf clover: An extremely rare mutation of a three-leaf [[clover]] believed to bring good luck.
blue nipples:
A character or person depicted has blue colored [[nipples]].

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as the lighting on the characters) there is an overlap between this tag and the [[aqua nipples]], and the [[purple nipples]] tags.

Generally seen on characters with [[blue skin]] or similarly nonstandard skin colors.
suzuya (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Suzuya[/i]. Designed by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[aqua hair]] with a [[hairclip]] and [[aqua eyes]]. She wears a brown [[school uniform]] with an orange [[ascot]], brown [[jacket]] and [[pleated skirt]], [[brown thighhighs]], and black [[loafers]] that have high heels. Her [[rigging]] includes multiple [[ship turret]]s with twin-[[cannon]] arrangements strapped two to her forearms, one on each thigh, and a larger one carried by a strap like a purse. She carries a mast like a backpack.

She has an energetic and informal personality, behaving like a typical high-school girl, with little sense of personal space and a frisky attitude. She's also frequently shown as being rather close to her sister-ship, [[Kumano (kancolle)|]].
sunburst: A sunburst consists of rays of light radiating out from a central disk.
aki rosenthal:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s  [[1st Generation (hololive)|]], she's a half-[[elf]] school girl from another world. Designed by [[Azumi Akitake]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[detached hair|detached]] [[low twintails]]. Her most striking feature is indeed her detached twintails and her [[headgear]], which flips around in response to her emotions.
symbol in eye: When any kind of symbol is part of a character's eyes, but is not related to the [[symbol-shaped pupils]]. For instance, a person may have blue eyes, normal pupils, and the glint seen from reflected light, but has the addition of a pink flower symbol somewhere in the blue portion. This can also count if the glint of the eye is shaped like a distinct symbol (post #2505556).
flame print: Clothing or an object with the printed motif of flames from a [[fire]].
shanghai doll:
[[Touhou]] character. The physical component for [[Alice Margatroid]]'s spellcard "Eerily Luminous Shanghai Doll" in [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] / [[Immaterial and Missing Power]], as well as her familiar in [[Imperishable Night]].

Shanghai is a very popular supporting character (or artifact) in [[Touhou]] fan art depicting Alice.

Some comic artists give the [[doll]] a personality and feelings of its own, making it a "master doll" that helps control the lesser dolls. Others show it as Alice's primary magically-controlled "puppet". These points of view can be mixed, possibly to give an impression of Alice "debating with herself" through doll use, reminiscent of the way ventriloquists use puppets. Sometimes she/it is even depicted as lacking "doll" traits entirely, resembling a [[minigirl]].

Another view is that Shanghai is a type or class of magical dolls rather than an individual doll. This is based on the fact that several Shanghai dolls are seen simultaneously in [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]].

Canonically, Shanghai, like all the rest of Alice's dolls, is a mindless drone that requires direct supervision for all but the most basic of autonomous action, despite Alice's ongoing efforts to create a truly sapient construct. When a fanwork depicts Alice finally succeeding, Shanghai is usually the subject.
hayakawa aki: A character in [[Chainsaw Man]], working under [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s special squad. He had contracts with the Curse Devil and [[Future Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]], and a former contract with the [[Fox Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]].
illustrious (azur lane):
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the HMS [i]Illustrious[/i], an aircraft carrier of the [[Royal Navy]]. Character design by [[Kaede (Yumesaki Kaede)|]], voiced by [[Amamiya Sora]].

She is portrayed as an elegant lady and as a big sister figure to [[Unicorn (azur lane)|]]. In her default outfit she wears a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[white dress]] with black [[lace trim]], a [[white headwear|white]] [[sun hat]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[white thighhighs]]. She is perhaps best known for her particularly [[large breasts]] (which often end up [[huge breasts|huge]] in fanart) to the point of in-game nods/gags.
hieroglyphics: "Hieroglyphs" refer to the characters made by graphical figures, be it animals, objects, or concepts. Most often associated with those of Egyptian origin.
bathrobe: A loose robe usually worn after a bath.
teardrop facial mark: A [[facial mark]]/[[facial tattoo]] shaped like a teardrop.
hexagon hair ornament: One or more [[hexagon|hexagons]] being worn as a hair ornament.
coin hair ornament: A hair ornament shaped like a [[coin]].
victorian maid: A [[maid]] from the [[Victorian]] era, the period of Queen Victoria's reign from 1837 to 1901. Victorian maids are characterized by a long [[apron]] and [[long dress]], accompanied with a [[mob cap]]. A classic example is [[Emma (victorian romance emma)|]] from [[Victorian Romance Emma]].
pillarboxed:
Reverse of [[letterboxed]]. An image resizing technique where vertical bars are displayed on both sides of a picture.
Pillarboxed does not count as a border but [[outside border]] may be used with it.
himemori luna:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s 4th Generation, also called [[holoForce]]. Designed by [[Kanzaki Hiro]] and rigged by [[Jujube]] and [[Date (mamanonamaebot)|]].

She has [[heterochromia]], with one [[purple eyes|purple]] and one [[green eyes|green]] eye and [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[gradient hair]] going from [[pink hair|pink]] to [[purple hair|purple]]. She keeps her hair in a [[one side up]] with a [[single hair ring]] with a [[candy hair ornament]].
ash ketchum:
[b]JP[/b]: [code]サトシ[/code] ([i]Satoshi[/i])
[b]EN[/b]: Ash Ketchum

[i]Pikachu, I choose you![/i]

Lead character in the [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] anime from 1997 to 2023, based on [[Red (pokemon)|]], the player character in the [[pokemon rgby|first Pokémon games]]. Ash is a Pokémon Trainer who, over the course of 1,200+ weekly episodes, took on the challenge of each region that was depicted in the most recent main games at the time, as well as thwarting the evil schemes of the [[Team Rocket]] trio.  He has had a number of travel partners and recurring rivals.

His signature Pokémon is [[Pikachu]], which he chooses not to evolve into [[Raichu]] due to it not wanting to.

His name in Japanese is a reference to the Pokémon creator, Tajiri Satoshi.
huge eyebrows:
Huge eyebrows, too thick to be called [[thick eyebrows]], common in [[bara]] art and with manly men.

Use this tag when the eyebrows appear to be as big or bigger than the character's eyes.
sunflower field: A [[flower field]] consisting exclusively of [[sunflower]]s, most commonly a farm of giant sunflowers. A very common motif for [[summer]]-themed illustrations.
oar:
A long object consisting of a flat blade attached to a shaft or 2 blades, attached to either end of a shaft, which is held by the user. By [[rowing]], they can be used to move [[boat|boats]] across bodies of water.

For Danbooru purposes, this refers both to actual oars, which are mounted to a boat at a pivot, and paddles, which are not connected to a boat.
iori (blue archive):

ak-47:
The [b]AK-47[/b] ([b]А[/b]втомат [b]К[/b]алашникова образца 19[b]47[/b] года) is a 7.62×39mm [b][[assault rifle]][/b] of [[Soviet]] origin, developed between 1944–1946 by [[Mikhail Kalashnikov]]. The [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] platform has a reputation for its ruggedness, reliability, simple mechanism and ease of manufacture. It can perform well with poor quality [[ammunition]] and under harsh conditions.

Visual cues of the original AK-47 are its slanted fixed buttstock profile, a milled receiver with a large rectangular indentation as the [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] guide and a smooth dust cover, (see post #4852784).

[b]Do not[/b] simply tag any [[Kalashnikov rifle]]s as AK-47 without even looking at their details.
skateboard: A short narrow board with two small wheels fixed to the bottom of either end, on which a person can ride in a standing or crouching position, propelling themselves by occasionally pushing one foot against the ground.
tiki (adult) (fire emblem):
[[Tiki (fire emblem)|]] as she appears in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]], much older.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] in a [[ponytail]], [[green eyes]] and [[pointy ears]], she wears a short [[red dress|red]] [[strapless dress]] with [[side slit]]s, a pink [[cape]], red [[thigh boots]] over pink [[thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and red [[gloves]]. She also has a [[hair ornament]] above her forehead.
covering one eye: When one of a character's eyes is being obscured or covered by a hand or object. This should be the result of a deliberate action, see [[one eye covered]] if the eye is simply covered with no apparent intent.
veiny arms: Arms that have visible vein lines, typically seen on muscular characters.

The semi-legendary pharaoh of [[ancient Egyptian|ancient Egypt]] known for her legend of her revenge against the conspirator who killed her brother and her depiction in various fictional works as the queen who helds the power of an evil and otherworldly beings. 

She is a [[dark-skinned female]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]] with [[extra ears|extra]] [[jackal ears]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Shima Udon]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tanaka Minami (voice actor)|]]
digital dissolve: A visual representation of object, character or surroundings turning into a swarm of squares, or conversely, manifest out of them. Might represent "Uninstalling..." or "Loading...".
naked scarf: A character is wearing a [[scarf]], and nothing else.
yellow wings: A pair of [[wings]] that are colored [[yellow]].
facepaint:
Painted marks or symbols in a person's face. Often used by [[tribal]] cultures.

Not to be confused with [[paint splatter on face]] which is for paint splatters on a character's face.

See [[drawing on another's face]] for the act of facepainting (applying facepaint to someone else).
mace: A mace is a simple [[weapon]] that uses a heavy head on the end of a handle to deliver powerful blows.
smelling penis:
The act of [[smelling]] a [[penis]].

Not to be confused with [[smelly penis]].

Generally indicated by a character placing their nose very close to a penis and the penis emitting an odor, often depicted as a [[steaming body]].

Smelling over clothes and nude are both applicable for this tag.
tarot:
An image featuring a [[tarot card|tarot card]], or drawn to look like a tarot card.

Tarot is a set of [[card]]s originally designed to be used as [[playing card]]s, but which was later adopted by occultists as a means of divination. A typical tarot deck consists of 78 cards, divided into two groups: the Minor Arcana and the Major Arcana.

The [[minor_arcana_(tarot)|Minor Arcana]] consists of 56 cards divided into four suits: swords, wands (batons), cups, and pentacles (coins). Each suit has ten numbered cards and four court cards: Kings, Queens, Knights, and Pages.

The Major Arcana, or trump cards, consists of 22 cards without suits:

* 0. [[The Fool (tarot)|]]†
* 1. [[The Magician (tarot)|]]
* 2. [[The High Priestess (tarot)|]]
* 3. [[The Empress (tarot)|]]
* 4. [[The Emperor (tarot)|]]
* 5. [[The Hierophant (tarot)|]]
* 6. [[The Lovers (tarot)|]]
* 7. [[The Chariot (tarot)|]]
* 8. [[Justice (tarot)|]] or [[Strength (tarot)|]]‡
* 9. [[The Hermit (tarot)|]]
* 10. [[Wheel of Fortune (tarot)|]]
* 11. [[Justice (tarot)|]] or [[Strength (tarot)|]]‡
* 12. [[The Hanged Man (tarot)|]]
* 13. [[Death (tarot)|]]
* 14. [[Temperance (tarot)|]]
* 15. [[The Devil (tarot)|]]
* 16. [[The Tower (tarot)|]]
* 17. [[The Star (tarot)|]]
* 18. [[The Moon (tarot)|]]
* 19. [[The Sun (tarot)|]]
* 20. [[Judgement (tarot)|]]
* 21. [[The World (tarot)|]]

† The Fool is unnumbered and not considered a trump card in traditional decks. It may be numbered 0 or 22 in decks designed for fortune-telling.
‡ In traditional decks, Justice is the 8th card and Strength is the 11th card. Starting in the early 20th century, they swapped positions in many fortune-telling decks.
pectoral grab: The act of [[groping]] the [[pectorals]] of a male.
victor (pokemon):
[b]Victor[/b] (Japanese: [b]マサル[/b] Masaru) is the male player character in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i]. His female counterpart is [[gloria (pokemon)|Gloria]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Henry Sword[/b].
funnels: See [[funnel (tool)|]] for the item, and [[funnels (gundam)]] for the [[Gundam]] drones.
belt boots: [[Boots]] that have one or more [[belt]]s strapped around them, either to help keep them up or for aesthetic purposes.
burning:

izumi konata:
One of the four main characters from [[Lucky Star]]. She's apparently an anime and manga addict or [[otaku]]. She also likes [[video game]]s a lot and is quite skilled at them.

Izumi is a very [[petite]] girl who looks only about 12 to 13 years old despite her real age being actually much older (making her some type of [[loli]] bait to fellow otaku). She has very long blue hair with an [[ahoge]], [[green eyes]], a [[mole_under_eye|mole]] beneath her left eye, and permanently [[:3]] shaped lips. Her [[serafuku]] is called [[ryouou school uniform]]
spring (season): Use this tag for images that clearly take place during spring. Telltale signs include lots of [[flower]]s (especially [[cherry blossoms]]) and [[lily_white|fairy heralds]].
iizunamaru megumu: Chief of the Crow Tengu Stage 5 boss of [[Unconnected Marketeers]] and primary antagonist alongside [[Tenkyuu Chimata]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[red eyes]]. She may have [[pointy ears]] because she's a tengu, although they're not shown in official art. She usually wears a blue [[tokin hat]], a [[blue dress|blue]], [[ribbon trim|trimmed]] [[frilled dress]]. Over it, a [[shoulder guard]] with a [[gem]] on it, keeping in place a trimmed [[sleeveless coat]] with [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s. She wears [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs|knee-high socks]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] or [[purple footwear|purple]] [[tengu-geta]]. She can be seen [[holding tripod|holding]] a [[tripod]]. Due to her Ability Card, she is also often depicted with [[onigiri]]. She's a daitengu, and is presumably the superior of [[Shameimaru Aya]] and [[Himekaidou Hatate]].
unworn bikini top:

concert: A live musical performance done in front of an audience. Either by a band or a solo performer.
momo velia deviluke:
Character from [i][[To Love-Ru]][/i].

Momo is the younger sister of [[Lala Satalin Deviluke]] and twin sister of [[Nana Asta Deviluke]]. She has short [[pink hair]], often with two short strands poking out of each side of her head. Of the twins, she is the curvier of the two and the more mischievous.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[imai asami|Asami Imai]] (Japanese), Chen Yanti (Chinese), Christina Kowalchuck (English), Seo Yu-ri (Korean), and Elisa Contestabile (Italian). Her art designer is [[huanxiang heitu]].
tail bell: A [[bell]] worn as an accessory on a [[tail]]. Often accompanied by a [[tail bow]] or a [[tail ribbon]].
mesugaki:
Literally, "bitch brat". A young girl who acts sassy and provocative towards adults in a sexually charged manner. Often qualifies for [[loli]]. The masculine equivalent is called "[[osugaki]]".

Typical attributes include [[smug]] or [[naughty_face|naughty]] expressions, a mocking [[laughing|laugh]], a single [[fang]] / [[skin fang]], [[twintails]], [[short shorts]], [[miniskirt]]s/[[microskirt]]s, exposed [[midriff]], calling people "[[zako (phrase)|]]", etc. May be an [[oppai loli]].

Not to be confused with erogaki ("erotic brat") who is sexually forward or seductive without being sassy, or kusogaki ("shitty brat") who is sassy without a sexual undertone.

The present meaning seems to date back to August 2018, after the announcement of [[Grim Aloe]] being added to [[Bombergirl]]. For more details, see comment #2388484.
sticky note: A small piece of paper with a strip of glue on its back, made for temporarily attaching notes to documents and other surfaces. Usually colored yellow due to the ubiquity of 3M's Post-It brand.
manga (object): A manga or doujin appearing within an image. This includes western comic books.
daiyousei:
Daiyousei's name is fangiven, meaning literally "great fairy." [[Touhou]] midboss of [[Cirno]]'s stage in [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]]. 

Thought to be friends with her, portrayed as more mature and coolheaded than other fairies. In Oriental Sacred Place, she was portrayed as incredibly shy, hiding from anyone that wasn't Cirno. The Fandom might draw her with larger breasts than any other fairy, thanks to her fan name.

She has [[green hair]] in a [[high side ponytail]] tied with a [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[hair bow]] and her eyes are usually either [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[green eyes|green]]. She wears a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[yellow ascot]], and either a [[skirt set|paired]] [[blue vest]] and [[blue skirt]] or a [[blue dress|blue]] [[pinafore dress]]. Out of all the Touhou fairies, she is most frequently depicted with [[white wings|white]] [[fairy wings]]. 

In [[Whispered Oracle of Hakurei Shrine]], her ability has been revealed as "to swim through mist". Whether this means she can move through the mist with incredible ease, as if she's teleporting through them, or her "swim through mist" is more akin to "thrive in the mist" and become stronger in the mist is up to interpretation.
green tail: A character with a [[tail]] of green color.

holding breath:
When [[underwater]], a swimmer needs to hold on to any oxygen they can inhale, but must resurface after a short time to breathe again. Without resurfacing, an excess of carbon dioxide will poison the blood with carbon. That and/or a combination of water entering the lungs can lead to [[drowning]].

Holding breath will be visible in images as a person's mouth being tight-lipped and cheeks puffed up. This tag should be used for humans who are underwater, not so much for fantasy creatures like [[

broken window: A [[window]] that has been broken. Might include [[glass shards]] or [[shards]], depending on the level of detail.

asa no ha (pattern):
[b]Asa no ha[/b] (lit. "hemp leaves") is a traditional Japanese pattern resembling overlapping six-pointed stars ([[hexagram]]), referred to in mathematics as the triakis triangular tiling. See the left side of post #136039 for a clear example.

long coat: A [[coat]] that hangs lower than the knees.
torn swimsuit: A [[swimsuit]] that has been torn, yet is still being worn.
sleeping on person: A subject is [[sleeping]] against someone else. While [[sitting]], the [[sleeping]] person will usually be [[leaning_on_person|leaning]] on the other.
seamed legwear:
Any sort of stockings, [[pantyhose]], [[thighhighs]], [[bodysuit]], or other [[tag group:legwear|legwear]] featuring a vertical seam ([i]not[/i] [[vertical-striped legwear|vertical stripes]]) running up the legs.

This tag encompasses all types of seamed legwear, including [[back-seamed legwear|back-seamed]], [[front-seamed legwear|front-seamed]], and [[side-seamed legwear|side-seamed]]. [b]Please use one of these more specific tags when tagging[/b], not just [[seamed legwear]].
license plate: A sign affixed to a vehicle displaying a series of letters or numbers indicating that the vehicle has been registered with the state.

bat girl:

gradient skin:

All skin colors in the gradient should be tagged, if possible.
haruna (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Haruna[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[long hair|long]] dull [[black_hair|black]]/[[grey hair]] (with an often forgotten [[hairclip]]), and [[brown eyes]]. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko|modified miko]] uniform with differently colored [[skirt|skirts]] (hers is [[red skirt|red]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]]. 

She refers to herself in the third-person and has a warm, humble personality. Her famous line "Haruna is alright!" has earned her the nickname "daijoubu" and its own pool: pool #9955
irida (pokemon):
[b]Irida (English) / Kai (Japanese)[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon legends: arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]][/i].

Irida serves as the leader of the Pearl Clan, and her partner Pokémon is [[Glaceon]].

As a leader, she feels it is important to have the courage to face the vast Hisui region without quailing before it. Though she is suspicious of you when you first meet, she will come to trust you thanks to the help you provide in quelling the noble Pokémon.
revealing layer:
The effect of treating an image as multi-layered paper, where ripping or removing one or more layers reveals something else (e.g. a successively less-dressed version of the character in the same pose, or the [[circuit board]] inside an electronic device).

The Pixiv tag is 妄撮 ([i]Mousatsu[/i]), pin-ups of an extinct [[magazine (object)|]] called [i]KING[/i]. Later, this effect was featured in some photo books and these books made a big hit.
tennis uniform: A set of light clothes used for playing [[tennis]]. Men wear a t-shirt and shorts, while women wear a t-shirt and either a skirt or [[short shorts]]. These allow for fluid and swift movement when trying to catch the [[tennis ball]]. [[Visor cap]] is also a common accessory.
turban: The turban is a type of headwear based on cloth winding. Featuring many variations, it is worn as customary headwear primarily by Sikh men and women.
cornrows: Hair that is braided very close to the scalp, done in rows resulting in raised braids on a characters head.
buzz cut: An all-rounded [[very short hair]]cut typically done nowadays with electric clippers. Stereotypical of high school Japanese baseball players and military recruits.
o3o:
The emoticon of loose or [[puckered lips]], usually as a face fault.

Not to be confused with [[:3]], which is for cat-like expressions.
shirasaka koume:
An [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. A very shy 13 year old girl interested in punk culture and horror.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the fifth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Anastasia_(idolmaster)|Anastasia]], [[Takamori Aiko]], [[Sakuma Mayu]], [[Ogata Chieri]]. She is in the unit [[Kawaii Boku to 142's (idolmaster)|]] with [[Koshimizu Sachiko]] and [[Hoshi Syoko]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Ousaki Chiyo]].
carrot necklace: Commonly seen accessory of [[rabbit girl]]s. [[Inaba Tewi]] is often seen wearing one.
bird on hand:
A [[bird]] resting on someone's hand or fingers.

See [[holding bird]] for when someone is physically holding on to a bird, and not merely letting it perch on their hand or fingers.
trigram:
Eight diagrams used in Taoist cosmology to represent the fundamental principles of reality, seen as a range of eight interrelated concepts. Each consists of three lines, each line either "broken" or "unbroken," representing yin or yang, respectively. Due to their tripartite structure, they are often referred to as "trigrams" in English.

Most popularly used on [[Yakumo Yukari]]'s [[tabard]] on her [[Imperishable Night]] outfit, as well as [[Yagokoro Eirin]]'s dress.
holding needle: Someone is holding a [[needle]] in their hand. If they have multiple needles betwixt their fingers, consider adding [[between fingers]].
above clouds: When the point of view is positioned in the [[sky]] above the [[cloud]]s.
bicorne: A [[hat]] whose brim is turned up such that it forms two corners.
abstract background: A background consisting of unusual colors and/or patterns.
school briefcase:
A type of [[briefcase]] designed and carried by students. Compared to a [[school bag]], it has more rigid appearance, and often a handle on top (post #6628609 for example).

It may also have shoulder straps, allowing it to be worn as a [[backpack]].
bow (music):
A special rod used in the playing of stringed musical [[instrument|instruments]] such as [[violin]], [[viola_(instrument)|viola]], [[cello]], [[double bass]]/contrabass and their various relatives. 

Usually made of wood (but alternately of fiberglass or carbon fiber), it carries a band of tightened horsehairs which are drawn across the strings of the aforementioned instruments, causing them to vibrate and generate sound.
hecatia lapislazuli:
[[Touhou]] character.

Based on the Greek goddess Hecate, Hecatia is a goddess who governs the Hells of the Earth, Moons and Otherworlds.  Like [[Junko (Touhou)|]], she also has a grudge against Chang'e, whose husband shot down Apollo and indirectly weakened Hell, as Hell wouldn't be able to exist without the sun. She's friends with Junko, and lent her [[Clownpiece]], her subordinate, to fulfill her plans.

She has [[red hair]], [[red eyes]] and wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[t-shirt]] (that is sometimes depicted as a [[crop top]]) along with a [[multicolored skirt|tri-colored]] [[plaid skirt]] of [[green skirt|green]], [[red skirt|red]], and [[blue skirt|blue]], and a [[black hat]]. She also carries ornaments of [[Moon (ornament)| the moon]], [[Earth (ornament)| the Earth]], and [[underworld (ornament)|the Spirit World]] with her, representing her ability to exist in 3 locations at once. Her hair and eye color change according to the ornament she wears in her hat: red when it's the Spirit World, [[blue hair|blue]] when it's [[Hecatia Lapislazuli (Earth)|Earth]], and [[blonde hair|blonde]] when it's the [[Hecatia Lapislazuli (Moon)|moon]], although it's not uncommon to see her with "other objects on her head.":/pools/10382

Her fashion sense has earned her the nickname "Hot Topic-chan":/pools/10945 among fans.
polka dot headwear:
A [[hat]] that has a [[polka dot]] pattern on it.

[[Touhou]]'s [[Clownpiece]] is notable for wearing a [[jester cap]] with polka dots.
brown bag:
A [[bag]] that is colored [[brown theme|brown]].

If it is made out of recycled brown-colored paper, use [[paper bag]] instead.
groom: A man (or a cross-dressing woman) getting married in a [[wedding]] ceremony.
school emblem: [[Logo]], [[emblem]] or [[coat of arms]] that belongs to certain school. They are usually sewn, printed or embroidered on their respective [[school uniform]]s.
prison cell:
A small [[indoors|room]] in a [[prison]] or police station where [[prisoner|prisoner(s)]] is/are held.

h1. See also
* [[iron bars]]
* [[prison clothes]]
sideless shirt:
A [[shirt]] that exposes the sides of a character's chest, often revealing the [[sideboob]], with some extreme examples barely covering the [[nipples]]

Sometimes used in gacha designs to show skin without revealing the cleavage.
coral: Corals are marine invertebrates belonging to the class Anthozoa of the phylum Cnidaria. Typically, many identical polyps live in dense colonies. Corals contain important [[coral reef|reef]] producers in tropical [[ocean]]s that secrete calcium carbonate to form a hard [[skeleton]].
salad: A dish consisting of cut [[vegetable|vegetables]] tossed together in a bowl, typically doused in salad dressing to give it flavor.
suppressor:
A firearm accessory designed to minimize audible report and [[muzzle flash]]. A suppressor basically consists of a tube that may screw or latch onto the end of a gun barrel and is filled with baffles that allow air otherwise pushed out the front of the gun to slow down and expand.

Suppressors are sometimes known as "silencers," but this is an exaggeration of the abilities of a suppressor to lessen sound. As long as bullet travels at supersonic speeds, it will still create the distinctive "boo
see-through legwear: Legwear that is very transparent or diaphanous, having little to no color of its own other than the color of the wearers leg.
bird legs: Bird-like legs, normally featuring [[talons]] and either [[feathers]] or rough skin. A common feature of [[harpy|harpies]].
watanabe you:
[i][[Love Live! Sunshine!!]][/i] character. An energetic student at Uranohoshi High who loves diving and sailing, often depicted in a [[competition swimsuit]] or other swimwear. Enjoys [[salute|saluting]] and using her catchphrase, "Yousoro!"

You is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[cyaron! (love live!)|CYaRon!]], alongside [[Takami Chika]] and [[Kurosawa Ruby]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] or [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. A childhood friend of [[Takami Chika]]. 

Voic
rice paddy: A rice paddy is a flooded field where [[rice (plant)|]] is grown. Very common in the [[Japan]]ese countryside.
katsushika hokusai (fate):
Foreigner-Class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A famous Japanese artist. Some of his more prominent works include the [[kanagawa okinami ura|Great Wave off Kanagawa]] (part of the Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji), and the first known portrayal of tentacle porn, [[the Dream of the Fisherman's Wife]], among others.

Similarly to [[Artemis (fate)|]] and [[Orion (Bear) (fate)|Orion]], the girl who is summoned is not actually Hokusai; the small black [[octopus]] following her is the [[Tokitarou (fate)|true Hokusai]], while she herself is his daughter "Katsushika Oei":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katsushika_%C5%8Ci], who served as her father's assistant and even produced some works under his name. He takes over her body upon reaching ascension 3, giving her an octopus-themed costume and a purple color scheme.

They have a [[katsushika hokusai (swimsuit saber) (fate)|Swimsuit Saber]] variant, introduced for the summer 2019 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Yukana]] (Katsushika Oei)
uneven gloves:
[[Gloves]] of different lengths. For differences in color or pattern, see [[mismatched gloves]].

Not to be confused with [[single glove]] or [[single elbow glove]].
easel: An upright tripod that is used to hold a drawing medium (such as an artist's [[canvas (object)|]]) in position.
orange pants: Any style of [[pants]] that are colored orange.
fishing: As a verb, it is the act of catching [[fish]]. As a noun, fishing refers to the recreational sport. Most examples of fishing on Danbooru are of the type performed with a [[fishing rod]] and baited hook, but methods of fishing vary widely, from fishing with [[net|nets]] to fishing with [[solar gun|solar guns]] and [[harpoon|harpoons]] (spearfishing) to the use of [[explosive|explosives]] (dynamite fishing). Fishing may be done from a [[boat]], from a [[shore]] or [[pier]], or while [[underwater]].
windmill:
A building with a large, wind-driven wheel, traditionally used to grind grain, pump water, or operate machinery.

See [[wind turbine]] for the modern type of windmill used to generate electricity.
megurine luka:
A [[Vocaloid]] released for the VOCALOID2 engine. She was the third of the Character Vocal Series and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is voiced by [[Asakawa Yuu]]. Her appearance was illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]].  She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a black top, a [[side slit]] [[long skirt]] and [[black thighhighs]], her [[boots]] are golden, and she has a [[single detached sleeve]] on her right arm and also a golden [[headset]]. She also has a golden [[chest jewel]] in shape of a [[trumpet]]'s [[valve|valves]] and the [[infinity symbol]].
nyotaimori: The serving of food (usually [[sashimi]]) off of a female body.
eyewear hang: [[Glasses]] or [[sunglasses]] hanging from a piece of clothing, to hold them while they're not being worn. Usually this is glasses hung from the neck of a [[shirt]], but in general it can be any piece of clothing.
black buruma: A pair of [[buruma]] that are colored black.
horned helmet:
A type of helmet that is designed with [[horns]] on them.

Use [[horned headwear]] for other headwear.

plant girl:
A sub-set of [[monster girl]] involving plant-like feminine humanoids.  Many are overtly based upon concepts like the [[mandragora]] or alraune (which are the same thing in real life, just from different languages). 

Although many plant girls are called an alraune, [[Alraune]] are variants who grow from large flower and plants.

If the creature is not feminine and sufficiently humanoid, use [[plant monster]] instead.
muzzle flash: The light that is visible at the muzzle of a [[gun]] when [[firing]].
sponge: A soft porous object used for washing or cleaning.
yamada ryo:
Character in [[Bocchi the Rock!]].

She has [[yellow eyes]], a [[mole under eye]], and [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]]. She usually wears the [[Shimokitazawa High School Uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] [[shirt tucked in]] a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. She [[playing instrument|plays]] a white [[Fender Precision Bass]].

She is voiced by [[Mi
noodles: A staple food made from dough (whether made with bread wheat, durum wheat, buckwheat, rice, etc. and may or may not include eggs), which is prepared in various ways depending on the type of noodle (one example being rolled flat and made into long thin strips), then boiled in water until done (whether al dente or not). Popular types of noodles include Central European noodles such as spaetzle, Italian [[pasta]] such as [[spaghetti]], and East Asian noodles such as [[ramen]].
blood in hair: When [[blood]] is present on someone's hair.
holding fishing rod: When a character has a [[fishing rod]] in their grasp.
ram (re:zero):
A character from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]]. She is [[Rem (re:zero)|]]'s [[twins|fraternal twin]] [[sisters|sister]].

Ram has [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]], which usually [[hair over one eye|covers]] one of her [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] and [[x hair ornament]] in her hair and the [[Roswaal Mansion Maid Uniform]].

Not to be confused with Rem, who has [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

She is voiced by [[Murakawa Rie]].
purple collar:
A [[collar]] that is colored purple.

This is for standalone [[collar]]s not part of shirt. Do not use for [[collared shirt]]s, [[purple sailor collar]]s, or other similar clothing.
palutena:
A major character in the [[Kid Icarus]] series. The Goddess of Light, rightful ruler of Angel Land, and patron deity to [[pit (kid icarus)|Pit]]. She is kindhearted, benevolent and cheerful, as opposed to the cruel, malevolent and cynic [[Medusa (kid icarus)|]].

Palutena serves as the leader of her army, and while she never physically aids Pit on the battlefield, she does everything in her power to support her servant from the sidelines. However, although she is demure and calm, she has a [[t
delinquent:
Depictions of various stereotypical "rebellious" and oftentimes outlaw youngsters, especially high school students of teenage years.

Delinquents have come in many types in different times and places, but the stereotype tends to attach itself to whatever scary new subculture they have come up with at that time: greasers in 1950s US, mods and rockers in 1960s Britain, [[punk]]s everywhere since the 1970s. 

h5. Japanese delinquent subcultures/styles

* !post #4397741: [[Bousouzoku]] (male)
eyewear on headwear: When a character is wearing a pair of eyewear on their headwear or hat rather than over their eyes.
tartaglia (genshin impact):
Tartaglia (pronounced [i]TAR-tal-la[/i]; also known by his codename "Childe") is a playable Hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]]. His real name is Ajax.

He is the eleventh of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers. [[Teucer (Genshin Impact)|]] is his younger brother.
holding candy:
[[Holding]] [[candy]].

If the candy is being held in their mouth without contact from their hands, use [[food in mouth]] instead.
blue tabard: A [[tabard]] that is blue in color.
musical note hair ornament:
A [[hair ornament]] shaped like a musical symbol, such as musical notes, clef symbols, and dynamic symbols.

See the [[musical note]] wiki for a list of symbols.
hata no kokoro:
The "Expressive Poker Face." Final boss of [[Touhou]] 13.5, [[Hopeless Masquerade]], and also a playable character in that game.

She is a "menreiki":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menreiki, a kind of youkai who was born from the legendary masks of "Hata no Kawakatsu":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hata_no_Kawakatsu. She has the ability to manipulate emotions, but [[expressionless|cannot express emotion with her own face]]; rather, she relies on her collection of sixty-six [[mask]]s to show her feelings, each representing a different emotion.
food focus:
A post with a major focus on one or more items of [[food]] or [[drink]].

It is most often an [[original]] work, has [[no humans]], is a [[still life]], has a certain degree of [[realistic|realism]], and has a relatively [[simple background]]. Items are often contained within a [[tray]], [[bowl]], [[plate]], [[cup]], or [[saucer]].

If you need help in finding the name of a food, use [[food request]].
bomber jacket:
A short sturdy [[jacket]] traditionally made of [[leather jacket|leather]] and having a fitted or elastic waist, a zippered or buttoned front, and often a fleece, pile or fur collar. Also called flight jacket.

Modern bomber jackets tend to be of fabric rather than leather and may be used as sports clothes. Bomber jackets are often styled into [[letterman jacket]]s, with added details common for that style of jacket. But, the fundamental construction of the garment is very similar.
ankle wrap: A strip of cloth (usually [[bandages]]) wrapped around the ankle.
seia (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Tea Party (blue_archive)|]]. Her full name is Yurizono Seia.

She has [[fox ears]], [[fox tail]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[gradient eyes|gradient]] [[pink eyes|pink]]-[[yellow eyes]], and a [[cross halo|cross-shaped]] [[yellow halo|yellow]] [[halo]]. She wears a [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[detached sleeves]] that go [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]], and [[petticoat]] under her dress. She wears a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]] and [[hair flower]] on her head.

Sometimes drawn with a [[white bird]], often a [[long-tailed tit]], perched on her.

Her firearm is a [[webley_self_loading_pistol|Webley M1913]] pistol.

Voiced by: [[Tanezaki Atsumi]]
Original artist: [[kokosando]]
covered face: A person's face is obscured by something. It can be the entire face or just partially, such as over the eyes or over the mouth.
multicolored wings:
A pair of [[wings]] that have at least two or more colors present, either as a gradient or otherwise.

If one wing is a completely different color than the other one, use [[asymmetrical wings]]. Don't use this tag if the asymmetrical wings are colored with [[greyscale]] colors (white/grey/black), as they don't fit the guidelines for multicolored.
enoshima junko:
A character from [[Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc]], titled the Ultimate Fashionista (超高校級の「ギャル」).

Has [[long hair|long]] and [[big hair|voluminous]] [[blonde hair]] worn in [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]]. Wears a [[necktie]] and [[school uniform]], usually open enough to expose her [[cleavage]]. While she always wears a [[bear hair ornament]], [spoiler]her sister, [[Ikusaba Mukuro]] wears an bunny hair ornament and a hair bow, when she dresses like Junko.

[spoiler]Her true title is Ultimate Despair (超高校級の「絶望」)[/spoiler]
neck fur:
Area of thick fur around a character's neck. Commonly seen on [[furry|anthropomorphic animals]] and [[monster_girl|monster girls]].

For characters with entirely [[body_fur|furry]] bodies, this area must be distinct in color and/or length from the rest of the body's fur.
invisible man:
When a man is portrayed as partially or completely invisible in sexual scenes, often so that his body doesn't obstruct the view of his partner.

Not to be confused with [[invisible]], when a character is completely transparent as part of their design.
scheherazade (fate):
Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] who debuted in the [[Agartha (fate/grand order)|]] singularity as the [b]Caster of Nightless City[/b]. Has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]] and a [[curvy]] design featuring lots of [[skindentation]]. She is a character from the Middle Eastern story [i]One Thousand and One Nights[/i], where she dated a king who killed every woman he courted with so they wouldn't be unfaithful to him. Scheherazade avoided death by reading fascinating stories to the king every night, stopping the tale at dawn each time so she could keep his interest. After 1,001 nights together, the king spared her life and married her.

She first appeared in [[promotional art]] for Epic of Remnant (post #2635525). She's usually grouped together with [[Nitocris (fate)|]] and [[Queen of Sheba (fate)|]] in both official and fan works due to their common traits as middle eastern queens.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Namaniku ATK]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Inoue Kikuko]]
scissorhold: Wrapping one's thighs around another person's head or neck and squeezing. Like a [[headlock]], but using the legs instead of the arms. Originally a wrestling move, on Danbooru this usually refers to a [[femdom]] practice.
nakiri erina:
Erina is one of the main heroines of [[Shokugeki no Souma]] and biggest rivals to [[Yukihira Souma]]. Wielder of the "God's Tongue", the best palate in the world. Regarded as the top student of her class and a member of the Elite Ten Council. [spoiler]She later become the school's new headmaster after graduation.[/spoiler]

She has [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]], [[purple eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She is usually seen wearing her [[Tootsuki Saryou Ryouri Gakuen uniform]].
totenkopf:
German word for "dead man's head" ([[skull]]).

A specific form of [[skull and crossbones]] used by elite German units since the 18th century. Initially used by the cavalry. Commonly associated with the [[Nazi|Totenkopf-SS]], who used it as their [[SS insignia|emblem]] in [[World War II]]. It was also used by the armored corps and the tank crews of the [[Wehrmacht]] (who are often confused as [[Waffen-SS]] because of this and their black [[military uniform|uniforms]]). It consists of a skull without the mandible at 3/4 view over two crossbones.
snake bondage: When a [[snake]] or [[lamia]] is wrapping someone up with their coils. If the snake bondage is causing pain, use the [[constriction]] tag as well.
florian (pokemon): Male protagonist of [[Pokemon SV|Pokemon Scarlet and Violet]]. Known as Haruto in Japan. His female counterpart is [[Juliana (pokemon)|]]. His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Violet Lang[/b] who has [[orange eyes]] and [[blonde hair]].
ex-keine:
The Hakutaku form of [[Kamishirasawa Keine]]. 

The nickname comes from the fact that Keine is the Extra Stage mid-boss (or "EX mid-boss" for short) of [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i] in this form. 

As a joke, fans commonly say "[[Caved (touhou)|]] by Ex-Keine."
on roof:
A character on a [[building]].

* Add [[tile roof]] if applicable.
* Add [[foot dangle]] if a character is precariously sitting on the edge.
chouzetsusaikawa tenshi-chan: Alter-ego of the main character [[Ame-chan_(needy_girl_overdose)|]] in [[Needy Girl Overdose]]. Called OMGkawaiiAngel in the English-localized version.
nightcap: A cloth cap worn in bed, usually with [[pajamas]]. Can appear very similar to a [[santa hat]].
liquid hair: For characters whose hair is made of liquid. [[Bottle Miku]] is an example.
rabbit-shaped pupils: Eyes that have a [[rabbit]] symbol visible inside the pupils.
grey sleeves: A pair of sleeves that are colored [[grey]]. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently colored from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).
deerstalker: A [[hat]] that has fore and aft brims and ear flaps that can be let down to cover the ears of the wearer, or tied up out of the way. It is made of checkered fabric such as sportsman's tweed or twill. It originated in rural nineteenth-century England, and is most commonly associated with classical depictions of fictional detective [[sherlock_holmes|Sherlock Holmes]].
meteor shower: A celestial event in which many [[meteor]]s are shown to radiate from one point in the [[night sky]].
chessboard: A square board divided into 64 alternating dark and light squares, used for playing [[chess]] or checkers.
toutetsu yuuma: [b] Undefeated Matriarch of the Gouyoku Alliance [/b] Toutetsu Yuuma is the main antagonist and final boss of [[Touhou]] 17.5, [[sunken fossil world|Gouyoku Ibun ~ Suibotsushita Chinshuu Jigoku (Strange Tale of Avarice ~ Submerged Hell of Sunken Sorrow)]], first mentioned in Wily Beast and Weakest Creature. In [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]], she is revealed to have once been friends with [[Yakumo Ran|Ran]]. As her title suggests, she's the boss of the [[Eagle Spirit (touhou)|]]s. She has large [[red horns|red]], [[sheep horns]], with a [[horn ribbon]] on both horns. She has [[curly hair|curly]], [[white hair]], [[red eyes]] with [[horizontal pupils|horizontal]], [[rectangular pupils]], and is often depicted with [[sharp teeth]]. She wears [[hoop earrings]] on her [[pointy ears]]. She wears a [[blue dress]] with [[detached_sleeves|detached]], [[red sleeves]]. Her clothing has a [[meandros]] [[patterned clothing|pattern]] with [[eye print]]s. Some artists may depict her wearing a [[blue vest]] and [[blue skirt]] instead. She often goes [[barefoot]] and [[holding spork|carries around]] an [[oversized object|oversized]] [[spork]] which may be filled with [[motor oil]] or [[blood]]. Her spork may be depicted as a [[spoon]] by some artists, either deliberately or as a mistake. Her ability allows her to devour and absorb almost absolutely anything, turning it into her power. Unlike her fellow Animal Realm matriarchs, she and her organization prefer to avoid pointless conflict, and would rather recruit or forge a mutually-beneficial relationship with their enemies, with an all-out war being a last resort for them. Taking advantage of the events in Wily Beast and Weakest Creature, she went to the Former Hell of Blood Pools in order to monopolize the petroleum deposits there, containing the desires of long dead organic beings. Note: If you can't concretely identify the utensil she is wielding (even with the tags/title/commentary/parent-child posts/pools), just tag [[utensil]] instead.
naked tabard: Partial nudity where the only piece of upper clothing is a [[tabard]], mainly to show off sideboobs and thighs.
shark hood: [[Hood]] designed to look like a [[shark]]. Mostly associated with [[Gawr Gura]] and [[A bathing ape]] shark hoodies.
arcueid brunestud:
A character from the visual novel [[Tsukihime]], who also makes an appearance in the fighting game [[Melty Blood]] by [[Type-Moon]]. She is voiced by [[Nabatame Hitomi]] in the original Tsukihime anime, by [[Yuzuki Ryouka]] in Melty Blood, and [[Hasegawa Ikumi]] in Type Lumina, the remake, and as [[Archetype_EARTH|Archetype: EARTH]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] styled in [[hair intakes]], [[medium breasts|medium]] to [[large breasts]], as well as [[red eyes]]. Her clothing consists of a white [[turtleneck sweater]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[purple skirt]] and [[black pantyhose]]. In the remake, she wears a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] instead along with a silver [[necklace]].
wind turbine:
A structure used to generate electricity from the wind. Visually, a wind turbine is a tall metal tower with several large fan blades.

See [[windmill]] for the traditional type of windmill used to grind grain or operate machinery.
bianca (dq5):
Bianca is a character from [[Dragon Quest V]]. She first befriends the [[Hero (dq5)|]] when they are both children, and the two share an adventure.  Later in the game, after both have come of age, the hero has the option to marry her. She has a pet Sabrecat named [[Borongo]].

ballet slippers: Flat slippers with thin, soft soles worn by [[ballerina]]s. Often secured to the foot by use of a [[footwear ribbon]]. For tagging purposes, this also includes [b]pointe shoes[/b], which are worn to prevent injury while dancing [[en pointe]].

nagato (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Nagato[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[Japanese clothes|Japanese-style]] [[midriff]] [[white shirt]] top, [[black corset]] with a [[gold trim]], [[black_gloves|black]] [[fingerless_gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]] with black trim, grey waist piece with a [[kikumon]] (based off her bow), [[red thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two connected hull pieces in a half-circle, fastened to her back with a funnel and containing her four 41 cm twin gun mounts and two 14 cm single mounts. 

Often portrayed as cool and professional if a bit prideful, being one (and the first) of the Big 7 battleships legally allowed by the Washington Naval Treaty system to mount 16-inch guns. Secretly likes cute things.

In real life, she was [[Yamamoto Isoroku]]'s flagship in the first months of the war (even gave the signal for the Pearl Harbor attack to commence from her bridge). She served as part of BatDiv1 with [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] and [[Mutsu (Kancolle)|]] in the [[battle of Midway]]. After the war, she was used along with [[sakawa (kancolle)|Sakawa]], [[prinz eugen (kancolle)|Prinz Eugen]] and [[saratoga (kancolle)|Saratoga]] as a target at Bikini Atoll during [[Operation Crossroads]]. She was sunk after the Baker test from a combination of damage sustained on the attack on Yokosuka and the two nuclear tests.

jockstrap:
A jockstrap is a type of [[male underwear]] designed for support and protection of male genitals, originally intended to be used in athletics or other activities requiring vigorous physical activity. It is comprised of an elastic waistband attached to a pouch (typically foam), with thigh bands to properly secure it in place.

While it has been mostly used as a utilitarian accessory, foamless or patterned variations have been made to emphasize its appeal as a fashionable and sexual garment. For this reason, both sports and fashion types are popular among gay males.

A counterpart to the jockstrap, known as a pelvic protector or a "jill", is similarly structured to cover female genitals.

chainmail:
Armor made from small metal rings linked together into a mesh.  Also known as simply "mail" or "maille."

European garments made with mail are leggings (chausses), mail hoods (coif) and mail mittens (mitons). A mail collar hanging from a helmet is camail or aventail. A mail collar worn strapped around the neck was called a pixane or standard. A shirt made from mail is a hauberk if knee-length and a haubergeon if mid-thigh length.

Japanese chainmail is called [i]kusari[/i] (鎖, lit. "chain") and was used extensively alongside the more distinctive and better known lamellar armors.
poke ball print: Clothing or an object with printings of the [[poke ball|Poké Ball]] from the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] franchise.
panty mask:
Wearing [[panties]] on the face like a [[mask]].

This is a common comedic gag for characters portrayed as [[pervert]]s (either canonically or in fan-based memes), or those that engage in [[underwear theft]].  Common culprits featuring this situation include [[Akemi Homura]] and [[Hentai Kamen]] and [[Kajou Ayame]] (as [[Blue Snow]]), who both feature this as part of their [[costume]]s.

This is typically shown as the panties being wrapped around the whole of the head (see post #912795, post #1021602) with the crotch of the panties covering the mouth and nose of the wearer, the waistband around the top of the head and chin, and the wearer's ears protruding through the leg holes, securing the sides of the waist band.

Other methods also exist, where the top of the waistband crosses below the wearer's eyes (see post #4082406, post #3944133).  This form better evokes the form of a [[mouth mask]] and seems to have become more common in response to the [[coronavirus pandemic]] of 2020.

Other variations can exist (e.g. post #3308317, post #1717051, post #65772). This tag is applicable so long as the face is largely involved, and the panties aren't simply worn on the top of the head like a [[hat]], with the waistband around the forehead.  [[Panties on head]] covers both cases, and is implicated by this tag.

For the converse of this tag, where a [[mouth mask]] is worn over the crotch as if they were [[panties]], use the tag [[mask panties]].
union jack:
Also known as the [b]Union Flag[/b], it is the name given to the national [[flag]] of the [[United Kingdom]]. It is a combination of three different flags: the red St. George's Cross of England, the white St. Andrew's Cross of Scotland, and the red St. Patrick's Cross of Ireland.

The design of the Union Jack consists of a blue field, known as the Union Flag, with a red diagonal cross (St. Patrick's Cross) that extends from corner to corner. This cross represents [[Ireland]]. Superimposed on the diagonal cross are two intersecting crosses. The upright red diagonal cross (St. George's Cross) represents [[England]], and the white diagonal cross in the shape of an "X" (St. Andrew's Cross) represents [[Scotland]].

The Union Jack's design was first created in 1606 when England and Scotland were separate kingdoms but shared the same monarch, King James VI of Scotland and I of England. The flag was officially adopted in 1801 after the Act of Union, which united the Kingdom of Great Britain (combining England and Scotland) with the Kingdom of Ireland.

Also appears in the national flags of [[Australia]], [[New Zealand]], [[Fiji]], and [[Tuvalu]], as well as those of British colonies and territories. It is also on the flag of the American state of [[Hawaii]].

This may be confused with a mecha from [[Gundam 00]] called a [[Union Flag]] used by the world superpower Union in the series.

pine tree: [[tree|Trees]] in the genus Pinus in the family Pinaceae, they are evergreen trees meaning that their shrubs stay green even in winter.
oiran:
A traditional Japanese courtesan in Edo (present-day Tokyo), the [i]Yoshiwara[/i]. They were a much higher-class subtype of [[yuujo]], the iconic feudal-era Japanese [[prostitution|prostitutes]]. 

Unlike [[yuujo]], oiran were more educated and cultured, and had talents beyond those used in the bedroom. This gave them a social standing which put them well above any common prostitute, even outside the red-light districts. The companionship of an oiran did not come cheaply, so their clientele were primarily men of high political or social ranking. 

Oiran should not be confused with [[geisha]], who tend to dress far less luxuriously and who do not provide any sexual services. After World War II, the geisha eventually ended up replacing the role of "classic, respectable female entertainer" that oiran had filled in Japanese society.
caterpillar tracks: A continuous track running between drive wheels, intended to give the vehicle greater off-road capability. Commonly used on on [[tank|tanks]], [[half-track|half-tracks]], as well as some [[bulldozer|bulldozer]]s, [[excavator]]s and farm [[tractor]]s.
cutting hair: When one's hair gets cut off, regardless of who does the cutting or how it gets cut.
hikimayu:
A traditional Japanese cosmetic practice of shaving off the eyebrows and painting on new ones, often in a distinctive comma shape or in a trapezoidal shape.

Common for women from the Heian period through the end of the Edo period, with even men joining in during the late Heian. Nowadays only seen in historical dramas and period costumes.

hachimaki:
A type of Japanese [[headband]] made of cloth or twine worn to signify dedication to extreme effort. 
A plane hachimaki is commonly used in a sports day / festival of Japanese school to indicate the team color and to try to increase their motivations / kiai (気合, "fighting spirit").
Another common type of hachimaki is printed a red circle of Japanese flag or previously rising sun emblem or / and a short inspirational slogan meant to be displayed across the forehead.

If the headband is twisted, that is called a [[nejiri hachimaki]] which is commonly worn by participants of a Japanese festival.

ice cream float:

In Japanese the term "cream soda" is used to refer to an ice cream float consisting of melon soda topped with vanilla ice cream, while in North America the term "cream soda" refers to a vanilla flavored soft drink based on the taste of an ice cream float.
tuxedo: A traditional [[suit|formal garment set]] worn by men. Women can wear tuxedos either as they are or with skirts, shorts, or a leotard replacing trousers.
watson cross:

oberon (fate):
Servant introduced in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|British Lostbelt]] of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He is known as the King of the Fairies in medieval and Renaissance literature, and is best known as a character in [[William Shakespeare (fate)|]]'s play [[A Midsummer Night's Dream]]. He initially appears as a Ruler-class servant who is able to switch to Archer, Caster, and Rider classes at will, before being revealed as the first Pretender-class servant in the franchise. [spoiler]His true name is [b]Oberon Vortigern[/b], a servant summoned by the planet itself to destroy the British Lostbelt who is a fusion of the mythological Oberon, the Oberon from A Midsummer Night's Dream, and [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]]'s uncle Vortigern.[/spoiler]

His third ascension artwork is locked until players complete Avalon le Fae.

neptune (neptunia):
The main character of [[Choujigen Game Neptune]], and of most games thereafter in the [[neptune (series)|Neptunia series]].

While depicted as a preteen girl without a single care in the world, Neptune is actually one of the four goddesses of Gamindustri, presiding over the Land of Purple Progress, Planeptune. After losing a fight with the other three goddesses in the world of Celestia, she is banished to the earth below, driving into the ground headfirst and losing her memories.

Her regular appearance consists of a [[hoodie]]/[[hooded jacket]] with [[drawstring]]s that resemble [[usb]] controller plugs, blue-and-white [[striped legwear|striped]] [[thighhighs]], and [[d-pad_hair_ornament|hair clips shaped like D-pads]]. Both her [[purple_eyes|eyes]] and [[short_hair|short]], rather messy [[purple_hair|hair]] are purple.

While many of the characters of the franchise tend to break the 4th wall on occasion, Neptune is the one who does so most frequently.

Choujigen Game Neptune's characters are mainly personifications of game companies or game consoles, Neptune represents the long-canceled [[Sega]] Neptune.

corrin (fire emblem):
[b]Corrin[/b] (Kamui) is the main protagonist of [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

Supposedly born to Hoshidan royalty, Corrin was kidnapped at an early age and raised in Nohr. As Corrin comes of age, they find themselves the subject of a stirring conflict between the two nations and must choose families, deciding the course of fate.

Much like Kris in [i][[Fire Emblem: New Mystery of the Emblem]][/i] and Robin in [i][[Fire Emblem Awakening]][/i], Corrin is an avatar character, with their name, gender, appearance, and voice customizable by the player. As such, some media refers to Corrin as simply the [b]Avatar[/b] (マイユニット My Unit).

Corrin is a descendant of the First Dragons. Carrying ancient dragon blood, they are able to tap the power of Dragon Veins to manipulate the territory around them. They are also able to turn into a [[dragon]], though they normally only do so involuntarily and out of insanity. As a result, Corrin keeps a [[dragonstone]] on their person to assume full control of their transforming powers.

Corrin's dragon form and gentle personality are strongly based on the [i][[qilin (mythology)|]][/i], a chimerical creature that, in Chinese mythology, primarily symbolizes benevolence and fortune. It is said to foretell the birth or arrival of an illustrious ruler or great human being.

Male Corrin has [[short hair|short]], [[spiked hair]], while female Corrin has [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair]] and [[juliet sleeves]], and wears a black [[headband]], often along with a Nohrian [[hairpin]]. They have [[red eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and [[bangs]] that drape over their forehead and slightly to the side. By default, they wear a silver [[cuirass]] with gray and black accents, as well as a [[collar]] with [[buckle]]s on the sides. It is worn over black clothing that covers Corrin's hands, and their [[arm guards]] broaden just below shoulder height.

Corrin also sports a long [[blue cape]] that wraps around their right hip and upwards against their back and is fastened by a [[brooch]] on their [[breastplate]]. Their [[leg armor]] notably does not cover their thighs, which are either completely covered (male Corrin) or [[thigh cutout|exposed]] (female Corrin) by their [[leggings]]. An additional [[kusazuri]]-like piece of leather covers their left thigh. They are almost always seen [[barefoot]], wielding the legendary [[sword]] [[Yato (fire_emblem)|]].

In Japanese, male Corrin is voiced by [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]], while female Corrin is voiced by [[Satou Satomi]]. They cover all the customizable voice options in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i], although their written dialogue differs between options (including a completely silent one).

In English, male Corrin is voiced by "Cam Clarke":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cam_Clarke, with certain voice options in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i] voiced by [[Yuri Lowenthal]]. Similarly, Female Corrin is voiced by Marcella Lentz-Pope, with the other voice options in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i] voiced by Danielle Judovits and "Stephanie Lemelin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephanie_Lemelin.

[b]Starting Class:[/b] Nohr Prince/Nohr Princess

pudding:
In the United States, pudding characteristically denotes a sweet [[milk]]-based [[dessert]] similar in consistency to egg-based custards, though it may also refer to other types such as bread and rice pudding.

In Japan, the "crème caramel":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cr%C3%A8me_caramel variety is the most common. The Spanish word for this dessert, [i]flan[/i], often leads artists to make visual puns involving [[Flandre Scarlet]].

hanfu:
Historical styles of clothing worn by the Han Chinese. Most styles have a “y” shape collar, but there are also styles with a rounded collar.

There are several styles that are at times mistaken for kimono (most notably [[ruqun]]). You can typically distinguish between them based on the hairstyle and headwear. Males' hair may be pulled back into a simple ponytail or bun or held by a coronet. Emperors or princes may wear [[mian guan]]. If nothing else, [[huadian]] (forehead mark), or the [[tuanshan|circular fan]] is an easy distinguishing mark. 

Hanfu differs from [[Qing dynasty|Qing]] era clothing. Hanfu specifically refers to clothing worn during dynasties wherein the ruling class was made up of the majority Chinese ethnic group, the Han. The Qing Dynasty was ruled by the [[Manchu clothes|Manchu]] ethnic minority. The frog button and mandarin collar style clothes, often simply refered to as Chinese clothes, are not Hanfu, as they are not Han clothing, but in fact Manchu. This goes too for other ethnic minority clothing in china, such as [[Miao clothes]] or [[Uygur clothes]]. These fall under the umbrella of [[Chinese clothes]], along with hanfu.

roundel:
A typically circular symbol. The term is used in heraldry, but also commonly used to refer to a type of national insignia used on [[military]] [[aircraft]], generally circular in shape and usually comprising concentric rings of different colours.

Notable examples:

* United States has circle with a white star, with two white or white-and-red bars on the left and right side.
* Japan has a single red circle, mostly bordered with white stylized after the Japanese flag.
* Germany has a black [[iron cross]] with white borders.
* Britain has a blue, white, and red circle.
** Canada, Australia, and New Zealand replace the circle with a maple leaf, a kangaroo, and a kiwi bird respectively.
* France has a red, white, and blue circle.
* Italy has a red, white, and green circle. During World War II, it has white circle bordered in black with three black fasces in it.
* Soviet Union had a five-pointed [[red star]] with white border. Belarus also uses this roundel after the collapse of the USSR, while Russia added blue border between the white and red section.
* China also has a red star, but with a Chinese text meaning "8.1" and bordered by two red yellow-bordered bars.
* Taiwan and the former Republic of China uses [[Kuomintag]] "white sun" symbol" contained within blue circle.
* Sweden has a blue circle bordered in yellow with three gold crowns in it.
* Poland has a red and white checkerboard design.
* South Korea has a red and blue yin-yang bordered with three black bars on either side.
* Israel has a blue six-pointed star on a white circle.
* Indonesia has a white red-bordered pentagon design.
* The Philippines has a blue, white, and red diamond with wings.
* Finland has a white, blue, and white circle design. Formerly, they used a blue swastika on a white circle.
single thigh boot: When a character is wearing just one [[thigh boots|thigh boot]] on either leg, while the other leg is wear either no footwear or a different length.

However, this also applies to the act of manually ejecting casingsーsuch as by cocking the slide of a semi-automatic [[handgun]] or [[pump action]] [[shotgun]], as well as by opening the cylinder of a [[revolver]].
artoria caster (fate):
Caster-class variant of [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]], introduced during the [[Fate/Grand Order]] 5th Anniversary event. First debuted in the second opening of [i]Cosmos in the Lostbelt[/i] and is a major character in [i][[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|Lostbelt no. 6: Avalon le Fae]][/i].

She is an alternate version of Artoria who was chosen by the [[Staff of Selection (fate)|]] instead of the Sword of Selection, leading her to study magic instead of becoming a knight. Notably, she does not bear the Pendragon name, unlike her selves from Proper Human History. [spoiler]This is because Artoria Caster is completely unrelated to the Artoria from Proper Human History; she was created explicitly to fulfill the prophecy of Faerie Britain and destroy the Lostbelt, a mission originally assigned to [[Aesc (fate)|Lostbelt]] [[Morgan le Fay (Fate)|Morgan]] that she abandoned.[/spoiler] Her third ascension is also known as [b]Artoria Avalon[/b].

emoji:
Emoji are Unicode characters designed to represent pictograms and [[emoticon|emoticons]]. The term itself, however, is most often used to refer to the pictograms and emoticons themselves. The word "Emoji" comes from the Japanese word "絵" ([i]e[/i], "picture") + "文字" ([i]moji[/i], "character"). Its resemblance to the word "emoticon" is purely coincidental.

Emoji as we know them originated as a proprietary system by a Japanese mobile phone operator [[NTT DoCoMo]] using a Unicode private-use block to encode their emoticons. While other mobile providers used many other systems for emoji, this system was the most compact implementation used at the time (and the closest to the current one).

The very first Emoji were actually Unicode Dingbats, of which, quite a few are now official Emoji. Emoji became a standardized system with its implementation in Unicode 6.0 in 2010 but it's only around 2014-2015 that their use exploded and became commonplace to the point that they became a cultural phenomenon with real world merchandise and even a movie about them.

However, this tag is [i]very infamous[/i] for being frequently misused among the userbase for [[open_jacket|open]] or partially-open jackets that are worn hanging off the upper arms, regardless of how they were designed to be worn.
battle rifle:
A [[gun|firearm]] that uses full-power [[rifle cartridge|ammunition]] (e.g. 7.62×51mm NATO), capable of fully-automatic fire or selective fire, and uses removable magazines. They were the connecting link between semi-automatic rifles (SVT-40, Gewehr 43) and [[assault rifle]]s. 

Though battle rifles were highly supplanted in mainstream service by lighter assault rifles, many are still used in specialist roles (e.g. designated marksman) by many [[military|armed forces]] and police units.
matara okina:
[b]The Ultimate, Absolute Secret God[/b]

[[Touhou]] character introduced as the stage 6 boss and extra stage boss in [[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]].

She has [[long_hair|long]], [[blonde_hair|blonde]] hair and [[yellow eyes]]. She wears a [[tabard]] with [[constellation print]] accompanied by a [[green skirt]] and [[boots]]. Her clothes feature [[long_sleeves|long]] and [[wide_sleeves|wide]] sleeves. Her Stage 6 portrait depicts her suspending a [[drum]] in [[floating object|midair]] while [[sitting]] on a [[chair]]; [[Touhou Sangetsusei]] subsequently depicts her sitting in a [[wheelchair]]. She is also depicted with a flaming [[aura]]. Her [[hat]] has three points.

Okina is a hidden god with a wide range of public faces, those being an Earth mother goddess, a god of noh, a god of stars, a god of silkworm breeding, a god of hindrances, a god of discriminated peoples, et cetera. As one of the Sages of Gensoukyou, she protects Gensoukyou from the Outside World. Her servants are [[Teireida Mai]] and [[Nishida Satono]]. She is based on Matarajin, a Buddhist deity. Her abilities let her create doors on the back of anything, hence she is sometimes depicted in fanworks with [[door]]s.

She bears a striking resemblance to [[Junko (touhou)|]] from [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]], and her abilities and position are similar to those of [[Yakumo Yukari]].

Matarajin is sometimes conflated with Hata no Kawakatsu (alluded to in-game via her comments on [[Eternity Larva]] and her status as a God of Noh), which has led some fanworks to depict Okina as being close to [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]] and [[Hata no Kokoro]].

This is a joke that originated in a comic (post #1917287) where an artist put his words of hatred for another artist named [[Nasu (tenpurakkusu)|]] (whose name means "[[eggplant]]"). Depending on the artist, Inazuma might slip back and forth into Plasma-chan in various ways, from being an irrational response to eggplants, to being "Inazuma's serious side", to simply being an always-psychotic character among some artists with darker proclivities.

mandarin collar:
A mandarin collar, standing collar, band collar or choker collar is a short, unfolded, stand up–style collar on a shirt or jacket. The style derives its Western name from the mandarin speaking bureaucrats in [[qing dynasty|Qing]]-era China that employed it as part of their uniform. [[Changpao]], [[Tangzhuang]] and [[China dress]]es often feature a mandarin collar.

satonaka chie:
A [[Persona 4]] character.

An upbeat girl with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] who usually wears a [[green jacket|green]] [[track jacket|athletic jacket]] decorated with buttons. Her weapon is a pair of greaves. She has an obsession with Kung fu, and even uses them in battle, similar to Lisa Silverman of Persona 2. Most of the time, she is friendly, cheerful, and energetic, but she has a short temper, especially with Yousuke. Chie, Yukiko, and Rise are unskilled at cooking, often providing the main cast with unpalatable to terribly awful dishes through the course of the story. Yousuke refers to their horrible cooking as "Mystery Food X."

Her Persona is [[Tomoe (Persona 4)|]] of The Chariot Arcanum, a muscular female figure wearing a yellow outfit reminiscent of Bruce Lee's famous tracksuit, wielding a double bladed naginata. Tomoe is shown to use both physical and low-level ice spells. Tomoe evolves into [[Suzuka Gongen]] after maxing out her Social Link, the one for The Chariot Arcana.

She is also one of the female characters whom the protagonist can have a romantic relationship with.

Voiced by: [[Horie Yui]] (Japanese), Tracey Rooney (English, PS2 release), [[Erin Fitzgerald]] (English, [[Persona 4 The Golden|Golden]] onward).

bousouzoku:
[b]Bousouzoku[/b] (暴走族, lit. "violent running gang") is a subculture of Japanese motorcycle gangs.

The stereotypical look consists of round or wrap-around [[sunglasses]], long [[hachimaki]] headbands with battle slogans, and a [[pompadour]] hairstyle.

Other styles consist of a military-styled [[school uniform]] (a [[gakuran]]) or [[jumpsuit]], with the gang's name on the back, and a [[sarashi]]. Usually, any oddities on a male's school uniform is a sign of gang activity or rebellion that falls into boso-style.

Their vehicle of choice is either a large [[motorcycle]], or a [[car]], both with extensive styling and modifications (such as [[neon lights]], low loading, etc.).
knees: The joint between the [[thighs|thigh]] and the lower [[legs|leg]] in humans.
black high heels: [[High heels]] are an element of [[shoes]], [[boots]], or [[sandals]], so use their corresponding colored tag instead.
spray can: A pressurized [[can]] with a nozzle that releases its liquid contents as a fine mist when depressed.
sleeve garter:
A band worn over the sleeve, typically around the upper arm, to keep the sleeve in place.  Were common in the US in the latter 19th century as ready-made shirts at the time only came with extra long sleeves.  Most depictions of sleeve garters will typically be tied to outfits worn in the latter 19th century or early 20th century, such as outfits of barbershop quartets or US Prohibition Era bartenders.

If worn over the bare arm, then use [[arm garter]] instead.
