torpedo tubes: A torpedo tube is a cylinder-shaped device for launching torpedoes.
boxcutter:
A [[knife]], also known as a utility knife, with a replaceable blade used for cutting open boxes.

These types of knives come in two basic forms: a solid blade or a snap(off) blade. The solid blade uses a single solid blade that requires replacing when it become dull. The snap blade design uses a single long segmented blade with which you can snap off the leading end when it dulls to once again have a sharp tip. The blade can then be replaced after you run out of usable segments.

The most common style depicted on Danbooru is the snap blade design; this may be due to the fact that the snap blade design was introduced by a Japanese company in 1956. 

It is often featured with themes of [[self-harm]].
sword of hisou: [[Hinanawi Tenshi]]'s [[weapon]] of choice. It has the ability to shape shift and find any enemy's weaknesses, no matter how powerful or well defended the enemy may be.

She has maintained her status as the most popular female character in the franchise for over 20 years, despite the introduction of many other female duel monsters since her first appearance.
track and field: A category of sports that involves various running, jumping and throwing competitions, such as short- or long-distance running, [[pole vault]]ing, [[shotput]], [[discus throw]]ing, [[high jump]]ing and others. There are also mixed events where participants compete in different events and accumulate points based on their performance. These end in -athalon, and popular examples include the triathlon for local events and the decathlon for the World [[Olympics]].
board game: A type of game that involves moving pieces around a board according to a set of rules, or can be luck-based by using dice depending on the game, or can involve testing one's knowledge with trivia. It may also include the use of [[card]]s or [[playing card]]s.

albino:
Complete or partial absence of skin and hair pigment due to an absence or defect of an enzyme needed for the production of melanin. Due to this, people and animals appear very light-skinned and typically have red eyes because while there is no pigment in the irises, the blood vessels can still be seen. This does not disqualify blue eyes, however, as most people with ocular albinism have blue eyes that bear a slight red tint due to the blood vessel still present. 

Characters with albinism [b]m

fighter jet:
A [[jet]]-powered [[aircraft]] specifically [[military vehicle|designed for warfare]], and outfitted with turbine jets. Fighting in conflicts as close support for ground troops, and maintaining air superiority in a dogfight. These crafts can travel at supersonic speeds of Mach 1, 2, and 3; armed with an array of guided and unguided penetration bombs, missiles, and vulcan cannons.

Pilots that fly them are equipped with a [[g-suit]] and an oxygen mask on their flight helmet, to allow them to withstand the heavy g-force from maneuvering the aircraft at supersonic speed, and to breathe easily while flying at altitudes of more than 20,000 feet.
tongs: A tool consisting of two long arms joined at one end, used for picking up or holding things. Commonly used as a kitchen utensil.

duffel bag:
A duffel bag, also known as a gym bag, is a cylindrical [[bag]] carried over the shoulder, made from canvas or similarly rugged materials. It can be closed with a [[drawstring]] or [[zipper]]. Older military-style designs historically had a single closure on one end; modern variants tend to have zippers along the length of the top and may have multiple compartments for easy storage.

Due to their large size and durability, duffel bags are typically used for hauling sporting equipment and/or uniforms. Travelers may carry them as an alternative to [[suitcase|suitcases]].

spray paint: A pressurized can filled with [[paint]] that can be sprayed over a surface by pressing down on a nozzle.
blur censor: [[Censored]] images that use an obscuring blur.

She is voiced b
tanabata:
A Japanese [[festival]] celebrated on July 7 that "celebrates the meeting of the deities [[Orihime (tanabata)|]] and [[Hikoboshi]] (represented by the stars Vega and Altair respectively)". One observed custom during the festival is to write wishes on small slips of paper called [[tanzaku]] and hang them on [[bamboo]]s. On Danbooru, the tanabata tag refers to this custom.

Tanabata originates from the [[Qixi festival]], written the same way. When Qixi made its way to Japan, it quickly got localized and was fused with several other local traditions, notably another folklore about the Tanabata-tsume (棚機津女), hence the reading "Tanabata", and the practice of hanging tanzuku on bamboos. 

Therefore, although written the same way, the terms should not be used interchangeably, Qixi applies strictly to the traditional Chinese version and Tanabata strictly the traditional Japanese version.
two-tone eyes: Eyes that have two distinct colors in the same socket, but aren't close enough in shade to be called [[gradient eyes]].
enpera:
When hair poofs out above a [[scarf]] (or similar apparel, like [[headphones around neck]]).

It is named after the fins near the tip of the mantle of the Japanese flying [[squid]], which in turn takes its name from Emperor [[Napoleon Bonaparte]] due to the fins' resemblance to his [[bicorne]].

Users on pixiv largely refer to this look as えんぺら (enpera), but on other sites such as Nicoseiga the term マフモコ (mafumoko) may also be used. This phrase in particular is a contraction of two words: マフラー (muffler, [[scarf]]) and モコ (moko, onomatopoeia for soft and fluffy).
sukajan:
A [[jacket]] in the style of a [[bomber jacket]] or [[letterman jacket]] with [[embroidery]] on the back and chest, often of fancy eastern-themed designs such as [[eastern dragon]]s, [[tiger]]s, [[cherry blossoms]], etc.

The sukajan has its origins in post-[[World War II]], where occupying American soldiers in Japan would commemorate their time overseas by ordering custom-made jackets with these oriental designs. For this reason, these jackets are also known as souvenir jackets.

Often seen worn by [[delinquent]]s, the [[yakuza]], or [[band (music)|]] members.

happi:
A traditional Japanese tube/straight-sleeved [[jacket]] worn during [[festival]]s. Has a thick border (usually black in color) running down the coat opening, with the jacket length usually reaching between the hips and waist. The happi may be worn [[open clothes|open]] or fastened closed with the use of a cloth belt. The sleeves are usually on the shorter side, but can also reach the wrists.

Traditionally indigo or brown in color, though other colors exist.

For a type of traditional indoor winter jacket, use [[hanten (clothes)]].

A similar Japanese garment called [[haori]] has wider kimono-sleeves, and is typically of a heavier fabric.

It normally consists of one or more cloth panels, or a woven network of twine or thin rope stretched with ropes between two firm anchor points such as trees or posts.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] tied in a [[high_ponytail|high]] [[side ponytail]] with [[sidelocks]], and reddish-[[purple eyes]]. Her outfit is similar to her (half)-sister [[honolulu_(azur_lane)|Honolulu]], wearing a [[double-breasted]] [[white_dress|white]] and [[blue_dress|blue]] [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[side-tie dress|side-tie]] [[micro dress]], [[white thighhighs]], [[high heels]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of all five of her real-life 15.2 cm triple mounts, two to her left and three to her right.

Historically, she and her sister [[helena_(azur_lane)|Helena]] differed from the first seven [i]Brooklyn[/i]-class light cruisers in having four 127 mm twin turreted mounts instead of eight 127 mm single open pedestal mounts and having their engines and boilers arranged alternately for increased survival. She served from Pearl Harbor to Okinawa before she was sold off to Brazil in 1951 and renamed [i]Almirante Tamandaré[/i], seeing further service until 1976.

dualshock:

yakuza:
[i]For the video game series known outside Japan as [b]Yakuza[/b], see [[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)]][/i].

The Yakuza are a traditional organized crime group in Japan. Well known for their code of honor and ruthless method used against enemies or traitors. Members often have elaborate [[full-body tattoo|full body]] or large [[back tattoo]]s, known as [[irezumi]]. Often notated with the following number: [b]893[/b].
sideways mouth:
A quirk of manga/anime art where a character's face is viewed [[profile|from the side]], yet their mouth is drawn on the side of their face, rather than on the front. 

Often the lips are still drawn on the front of the face, making it appear as if the character has two mouths.

One reason this may be done is to show more of the character's facial expression when it wouldn't otherwise be visible. Another reason is that, in animation, it's faster and easier to draw the mouth on the side than to animate the entire mouth opening normally, which would include having to adjust the jawline and lips.

For mouths that are [i]literally[/i] sideways (rotated from the position of a regular mouth by 90°), use [[vertical mouth]].
german clothes: Refers to any variety of clothing from Germany, or which reflects the German culture.
lava: Rock that has been liquefied by extreme heat. Molten rock that is still underground is referred to as magma, while molten rock that is above ground is referred to as lava.

iris (pokemon):
A [[Pokemon]] character.

In the games, Iris is a young, nature-loving girl and Unova's eighth Gym Leader in [[Pokemon BW|Pokémon White]]. Her specialty is Dragon-types, and she is [[Drayden (pokemon)|]]'s apprentice. Her main Pokémon is [[Haxorus]]. She returns in [[pokemon bw2|Pokémon Black and White 2]] as the new Champion of the Unova region.

In the [[pokemon (anime)|anime]], she is also one of [[Ash Ketchum|Ash]]'s former companions. She has a [[Axew]] that lives in her hair. Like [[Misty (pokemon)|]], Iris is frequently critical of Ash's actions as a trainer, calling him childish. She aims to be a master of Dragon-type Pokémon, and must evolve her [[Axew]] into it's final stage, [[Haxorus]] to be considered one. She is also known for being the first naturally dark-skinned main character in the Pokémon series. She returns in [[pokemon journeys|Pokémon Journeys]] in her capacity as Champion of Unova, and battles Ash as he climbs the ranks of the World Coronation Series. [spoiler]Eventually, she joins Ash in the Masters Eight.[/spoilers]
aki shizuha: A [[Touhou]] character, the Stage 1 mid-boss of [i]Mountain of Faith[/i]. Goddess of falling autumn leaves. Elder sister of [[aki_minoriko|Minoriko]].  Wears leaves in her hair.
crt:
A CRT (cathode-ray tube) is a display technology used in [[television]]s and computer [[monitor]]s, before LCDs and plasma displays replaced them. Characteristically fat and boxy.

While abandoned by most consumers for being much more heavy and large than other types of displays at comparable screen sizes, CRTs are still appreciated by some enthusiasts and professionals for their superior color reproduction, lack of input lag, and lack of native resolution.
mario:
[b]Mario[/b] ([b]マリオ[/b]) is the main protagonist of the [[mario (series)|Mario series]], the legendary mascot of [[Nintendo]], and basically the video game equivalent of [[Mickey Mouse]]. 

Mario is normally a [[plumber]], but in games, he uses his legendary [[jumping]] and combat abilities to defend the inhabitants of the usually peaceful Mushroom World from power-hungry villains such as [[Bowser]]. During most of his adventures, he often teams up with his brother [[Luigi]] and their partner [[Yoshi]] for extra support, as they are the only two characters he fully trusts to help him. When not adventuring, Mario participates in a variety of [[playing sports|sporting events]] and even works as one of his alter-egos, [[Dr. Mario]].
star facial mark: A [[facial mark]]/[[facial tattoo]] shaped like a [[star (symbol)|star]].
curren chan (umamusume):
[[Umamusume]] character. 

Curren Chan is the self-proclaimed cutie of Tracen Academy, although she tends to be portrayed to be more guileful with her cuteness than she really is.

She calls her Trainer "Onii-chan/Onee-chan", making her part of the "little sister" club with [[Rice Shower (umamusume)|]].
molestation:
Unwanted [[groping]] or being touched sexually by another. Tends to occur in  and in [[public indecency]].

Use [[chikan]] if the act is happening in a [[crowd]].
bendy straw: Also known as bendable straw or articulated straw. A [[drinking straw]] with a concertina-type hinge.
porkpie hat:
A [[hat]] with a flat top and a slightly curved brim going all the way around the crown. It is similar to a [[fedora]] and [[trilby]], but it is shorter with no pinched front. Pork pie hats are often associated with jazz, blues and ska musicians and fans.

Do not confuse with [[boater hat]], boater hats have stiff brims and are often made of straw.
senkou hanabi: A type of Japanese [[sparkler]]. Instead of swinging it around like a Western [[sparkler]], it is meant to be held vertically, usually pointed down, and quietly enjoyed.
sketchbook: A [[book]] filled with blank pages, which an artist can sketch drawings on.
moona hoshinova:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Area 15|1st generation]]. Moona (unwillingly nicknamed "Moonaroh", which she hates). Designed by [[Nyori]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[starry hair|starry]] [[purple hair]] with [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[colored inner hair]]. Her eyes also have a [[purple eyes|purple]] to [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[gradient eyes|gradient]] and are constantly [[jitome]].

On February 22, 2022 (WIB/JST), Moona reached 1 Million subscribers, being the first hololive Indonesia member as well as Southeast Asian VTuber to reach the milestone.
mahjong table: Tables especially designed for [[mahjong]]. They are typically square with green felt and wooden edges to keep the tiles in. "Automatic mahjong tables":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%85%A8%E8%87%AA%E5%8B%95%E9%BA%BB%E9%9B%80%E5%8D%93] have a function to automatically handle tile shuffling and wall building.
energy beam: A beam of energy fired as a weapon or attack. It may start out as an [[energy ball]] that coalesces together before being launched as a beam, as in case of the most iconic example, [[Dragon Ball]]'s [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]]. This form is less common when the energy beam is fired by a technological weapon instead of a magical or otherwise superhuman power.
hourglass:
A timing device made with two bulbous pieces of glass connected together, where sand or similar material inside the glass can trickle through one bulb to the other to measure a certain amount of time, whether it is in minutes or an hour. When all of the material has passed through, the hourglass can be turned over to start the process again.

For an "hourglass" body shape, see [[curvy]].
calligraphy: Images featuring calligraphic writing, and/or depicting characters practicing it.
o-ring panties: A pair of [[panties]] that have an [[o-ring]] keeping them together, typically at the sides.
flight deck: The flight deck of an [[aircraft carrier]] is where [[aircraft]] take off and land, a miniature [[airfield]] at [[ocean|sea]], so to speak.
german flag:
The modern [[flag]] of [[Germany]], consisting of three horizontal bars colored black, red, and yellow.

It was used from 1919 to 1933 by the Weimar Republic, from 1949 to 1959 by both East and West Germany, from 1959 to 1990 only by West Germany, and from 1990 to the present by unified Germany.

Not to be confused for the [[Belgian flag]].
unconventional maid: A [[maid]] dressed in an unconventional outfit, such as [[maid bikini]] or [[tactical maid]]s.
enkidu (fate):
[[Fate (series)|]] character first appearing in flashbacks in [[Fate/Zero]] and [[Fate/Extra CCC]]. They are the "False" Lancer-class servant of [[Wolf (fate)|]] in [[Fate/strange fake]], and first appear in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. They are [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]]'s closest friend and the namesake for [[enkidu (weapon) (fate)|his chains]], which Enkidu also utilizes in combat.

They are depicted as a long, [[green hair]]ed [[androgynous]] homunculus with [[green eyes]] and wearing a [[robe]]. Their "[[otoko no ko|appearance of a woman]]" is due to taking on the appearance of [[Shamhat (fate)|]] after she civilized them as a tribute to her. They are canonically [[1other|genderless]], but often [[genderswap (otm)|portrayed as male]] in fanworks. In [[Sensha Otoko]], she is canonically [[genderswap (otf)|]]ped into a girl.

They have been nicknamed "best clay" or "claybae" by fans (a variant of "best girl") as a reference to their origins.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Morii Shizuki]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kobayashi Yuu]]
dizzy (guilty gear):
Dizzy is a character from the [[Guilty Gear]] series and the final boss of the second game in the series, [i]Guilty Gear X[/i].

She is the daughter of [[Justice (guilty gear)|]] and an unknown human. She is not fully able to control her Gear powers, and her [[wings]] can transform (into [[Undine (guilty gear)|]] and [[Necro_(guilty_gear)|]]) and fight for her, against her will if necessary. After being hunted relentlessly by the Post-War Administration Bureau, which fears her power, she has f
sora harewataru:
[[Hirogaru Sky! Precure]] character, hailing from the kingdom of Sky Land. Civillian identity of [[Cure Sky]].

Sora has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blue hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[single sidelock]] and an [[ahoge]] that is styled into a [[side ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[hair bow]], [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[two-tone shirt]] and a [[blue skirt]] as well as [[blue thighhighs]] with [[white shoes]].
eyeball:
Eyes are [[organs]] that detect light, and give visual stimulation.

Tag can be used when eyeballs have a strong or obvious presence in the picture, such as floating, being held, scattered around, on characters' attire, in foreheads, etc.

Examples:

* [[Backbeard]] the giant floating eyeball from [[Gegege no Kitarou]]
* [[Nightmare (Soulcalibur)]] with his Soul Edge sword, which has a large eye near it's hilt.
spear the gungnir:
The name of one of [[Remilia Scarlet]]'s [[spell card|spellcards]], named after the mythological spear of Odin.
Usually appears as a large red [[spear]], made of demonic energy, [[blood]], or [[fire]].

* !post #2628869
* !post #6260093
sky print: Clothing or an object that has the printing of the [[sky]] on it. Other things such as [[cloud]]s, the [[moon]], and/or flying [[bird]]s among other things should indicate that the sky is being represented.
rotom phone: A [[smartphone]] possessed by a [[Rotom]]. It [[floating|floats]], has a built-in [[pokedex|Pokédex]], and can be attached to a [[bicycle]] to form a [[Rotom Bike]].
keychain: This tag has been moved to [[charm_(object)]].
mizuki (arknights):
[i]Landship observation target Mizuki, latent threat principally confirmed low at the present stage.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].
kasane teto:
An [[UTAU]] character with [[red hair|red]] [[twin drills]].

She is a young girl with [[red eyes]] and [[red hair|red]] [[twin drills]]. She typically wears a dark blue/gray outfit with red trim. Her official profile lists her as a "chimera", so she is sometimes given characteristics like a forked tail or wings. Her character item is a [[baguette]]. 

She was created as an April Fools joke by the VIPPERs of 2ch, meant to trick Nico-Nico Douga users into thinking she was the 3rd Vocaloid from Crypton. After the joke was over, instead of fading into obscurity Teto was picked up by [[UTAU]], a freeware knock-off of [[VOCALOID]]. She has maintained a level of popularity, and many have tried to replicate this effect with other joke and fanmade characters since.

After her 15th anniversary on April 2023, she received an [[kasane teto (sv)|updated voicebank]] under the [[Synthesizer V]] engine, which would boost her popularity even further.

Her voice provider is [[Oyamano Mayo]].

Oyamano initially used the name Oyama Nobuyo as a reference to famed singer and voice actress [[Ooyama Nobuyo]]. Since the latter is most known as the voice of [[Doraemon (character)|]], fans had Teto share similar traits. Teto's [[catchphrase]] 君は実に馬鹿だな ("You really are an idiot, aren't you?") also originated from a [[Doraemon]] comic.

Do not tag Kasane Teto as a [[VOCALOID]]. She is either an UTAU or a SynthV.
starry hair:
When a character has [[star (sky)|]]s in their hair, normally on the [[colored inner hair|inner part]]. 

A good example of a character with starry hair is [[Moona Hoshinova]].
eyelid pull: A character is pulling down the lower eyelid of one of their eyes, typically with a single finger.
hand on own neck:
When one of a character's hands is on their own [[neck]].

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on own neck]].
;3: Represents a cat's smile like [[:3]], except the character is also [[one_eye_closed|winking]].
fake magazine cover:
Pictures which are designed to imitate [[magazine cover]]s, while actually they are not.

h1. See also
* [[fake cover]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]
innovators (gundam 00): The main antagonists in season 2 of [[Gundam 00]], led by [[Ribbons Almark]]. The Innovators are artificial humans with enhanced physical and mental abilities, and tend to have unnatural hair and/or eye colors. Each Innovator has a near-identical twin, and most are [[androgynous]]-looking.
yellow one-piece swimsuit: A [[one-piece swimsuit]] that is colored yellow.
spider tattoo: A [[tattoo]] of a [[spider]]. [[widowmaker (overwatch)|Widowmaker]] of [[Overwatch]] sports a spider tattoo.
gold armor: [[Armor]] that is visually colored gold, whether it's from paint or comprised of the actual metal.
penny (pokemon):
[b]Penny[/b], known as [b]Botan[/b] (ボタン) in Japan, is one of the rivals  in [[Pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]].

Originally from the Galar region, Penny is a shy girl in the same grade as the protagonist who is apparently good with machines and computers. She appears several times in the Starfell Street storyline serving as Cassiopeia's supply unit rep. The box legendary seems fond of licking her. 
She is very fond of the Pokémon [[Eevee]] may evolve into, which she refers to as "Veevees".

[spoiler] It is eventually revealed that she is the true identity of Cassiopeia, forming [[Team Star]] in a response to being bullied at the academy. Her true personality is sarcastic and often brusque, but she cares for her friends dearly.[/spoiler]
pony play:
A type of [[BDSM]] animal roleplay where the submissive participant dresses and plays the role of a pony and the dominant participant plays the role of handler/rider.
It can broken up into at least 3 subcategories:
* Cart Pony where the pony pulls a cart their handler rides
* Riding Pony where the pony carries the handler (either while on [[all fours]] or standing on two legs)
* Show Pony where the pony is shown off in various decorative attire by the handler.
kanbaru suruga:
A [[Monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]] character, Kanbaru Suruga has (typically) [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[thick eyebrows]], and [[brown eyes]] (though she wore her hair as [[long_hair|long]], [[low twintails]] in [[Hanamonogatari]]). She often wears a [[Naoetsu High School Uniform]] with a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[shirt]] with [[juliet sleeves]], a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[purple skirt|purple]] [[pleated skirt]] (over [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]]), [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks]] and [[white shoes|white]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[high tops|high top]] [[sneakers]] as [[shoes]].  She almost always has a [[bandages|bandaged]] left [[bandaged arm|arm]].

She is a typical [[tomboy]] and ace of the [[basketball]] team. She's an admitted [[yuri|lesbian]], [[fujoshi]], [[nude|nudist]] / [[exhibitionism|exhibitionist]], lolicon and [[masochism|masochist]]. She is the daughter of [[Gaen Tooe]] and niece of [[Gaen Izuko]].
rope marks: Marks on the body, after being restrained by ropes.
protocol omega: A soccer team in [[Inazuma Eleven GO Chrono Stone]], with three different incarnations. This tag is used for all teams that wear the Protocol Omega uniform, including Team A5 and El Dorado Team 02.
drum (container):
A large cylindrical container for storing and transporting fluids or bulk goods. Best known for being used to store and transport crude oil.
Generally made of metal; plastic versions also exist that are visually similar. For barrels made of wood, see [[barrel]].

Also known as "metal drum", "oil drum", "oil barrel", etc.
guitar case:
An [[instrument case]] that holds and protects a [[guitar]] for transport and storage.

Do not tag [[guitar]] or [[bass guitar]] unless an actual guitar is visible.
ribbon-trimmed dress: A [[dress]] with a ribbon threaded in and out of slits in the fabric, resulting in a line of "dashes" by the hemline or cuff.
crossed bandaids: Two [[bandaid]]s that overlap to form a cross, plus, or X. Typically used for comedic purposes.
island: Any form of land that is surrounded by a watery body.
floating clothes: Clothing that is blowing in the [[wind]], floating in midair, or otherwise not being held down by gravity.
wing brooch: A [[brooch]] that has at least one [[wings|wing]] present. This can also be used in conjunction with other shaped brooches if a pair of wings are framing it.
sweeping: The act of using a [[broom]] in a back and forth motion on the ground to push dirt and dust aside.
chihaya (clothing): A thin, white ceremonial overgarment sometimes worn by a [[miko]].
ginkgo leaf: Fan-shaped leaf of the [[ginkgo tree]]. Sometimes split in the middle. They start out green and turn yellow in autumn.
tenkyuu chimata: The God of the Unowned 6th stage boss of [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. A god with the ability to relinquish ownership of a traded item, effectively making her the god of physical marketplaces. Chimata has [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[rainbow gradient]] [[multicolored hairband]] atop her [[short_hair|short]], [[blue hair]]. While frequently missed or left out by artists, her hair also contains imagery of a [[cloudy sky]]. Her [[multicolored_clothes|multicolored]], [[patchwork clothes]] are held together with [[zipper|zippers]], and she adorns herself with a large [[cape]] with a [[sky print]] contained inside. She also wears a pair of [[pink_footwear|pink]] [[boots]]. She has a [[belt pouch]]. Her unique choice of clothing is the brunt of jokes, and has led her to be depicted with another [[hecatia_lapislazuli|goddess also infamous for her unique fashion sense]].
sirius symboli (umamusume): A prideful [[Umamusume]] character with a motto of "Sirius the one brightest star". Her desire is to dominate even global competition. She's brash and foul-mouthed, but how she's got real skills to back up her immense confidence endows her with a charisma of her own. Furthermore, she would never lie thanks to her dislike of dishonesty and underhanded means. Hence, she's naturally charming. She calls her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]] Puppy.
mallet: A [[hammer]]-like device with flat pounding ends.
porch: A platform-like structure attached to the front of a house. Porches typically have roofs and wooden floorboards, but are otherwise exposed to the outside. A common setting for summer pictures.
shared bathing:
People sharing a [[bath]] or [[shower_(place)|shower]], innocently or otherwise.

Use [[same-sex bathing]] or [[mixed-sex bathing]] too where appropriate.
collared jacket:
Any style of [[jacket]] with a prominent collar.
[b]Not to be confused[/b] with jackets that only have [[lapels]], such as [[blazer]] or [[suit jacket]].
cosmetics:
Cosmetics are products or objects used to apply [[makeup]].

See [[makeup]] for makeup worn on the face. Cosmetics is for the makeup products themselves.
butter: A popular dairy product made by churning [[milk]] or cream and emulsified with water. The difference with margarine is that it is extracted from plant oils rather than animal. Often used on [[bread]], [[pancake]]s, and [[waffle]]s.
suit jacket: A [[jacket]] worn with a [[suit]]. Oftentimes features [[lapels]].
butterfly net:
A type of [[hand net]] used for capturing [[butterfly|butterflies]].  For tagging purposes this is used for any type of net used for capturing bugs.

A butterfly net has a fine lightweight mesh netting to prevent damaging the wings of a butterfly.  For capturing bugs from brush and vegetation a sweep net is used. The netting of a sweep net is typically made of sturdier material than a butterfly net, such as sail cloth.
nagato yuki: Character from [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]]. An alien humanoid interface designed to observe [[Suzumiya Haruhi|Haruhi]], and a bookworm. [[expressionless|Rarely shows emotions]].
wooden chair: A [[chair]] that is made out of wood.
yellow armband:
[[Armband]] that is yellow in colour.

h1. See also
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
* [[Tag Group:Colors|Tag Group:Colours]]
levitation: Causing an object or person to float in the air without physical support.
black headband:
A [[headband]] that is colored [[black_theme|black]].

Not to be confused with a [[black hairband]].
petting: Petting an [[animal]] or other similar [[creature]]. Petting humans does not count.
mechanical ears:
Mechanical ears shaped after real ears. For ears that look like radio antennae or other similar robotic components use [[robot ears]] instead.

For mechanical ears attached to [[headphones]], use [[animal ear headphones]] too.
vertical-striped kimono: A [[kimono]] that has an array of [[vertical stripes]] running along it. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
asakura toru:
One of the idols available in the [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]]. She is a member of the unit [[noctchill_(idolmaster)|]]. She is the leader of the unit.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair|purple]] and [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[blue eyes]], [[earrings]] and [[ear piercing]]s, and [[blue nails|blue]] [[nail polish]]. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] (often with a [[pen]] in her [[breast pocket]]), a [[grey skirt|gre
swirl lollipop: [[Lollipop]]s that are flat and circular with a decorative (flavored) swirling pattern.
looking afar: When a character is looking off into the distance. Can be used with [[looking ahead]] when the character's gaze is seen to be directed straight ahead, but not at a subject that is visible in the image close-by (ie. an object or person in the same room).
otokura yuuki:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. Yuuki is a former child model who decides to start anew as an idol. While she looks boyish and mature due to her height, she actually likes pink and cute outfits, and became an idol to be able to wear them. 

She has the lowest BMI value among the idols from the iDOLM@STER series at 14.87 (40 / (1.64 x 1.64) = 14.872).

Voiced by [[Nakashima Yuki]].
bowl cut: A simple [[short hair|short haircut]] that is the same length all the way around the head, forming the shape of an upside-down bowl.
flight attendant: Also known as a cabin crew, stewards/stewardesses, or air hosts/hostesses; a member of an aircrew employed by airlines primarily to ensure the safety and comfort of passengers aboard commercial flights, on select business jet aircraft, and on some military aircraft.
wakizashi: A traditional Japanese [[sword]] with a blade between 30 and 60 centimeters (12 and 24 in), with an average of 50 cm (20 in). It is similar to but shorter than a [[katana]], and usually shorter than the [[kodachi]] ("small sword").
lattice:
The ornamental, usually wooden, panels often found in Chinese windows and furnishings, like those in the backgrounds of post #1786314 and post #1818178.

For simple wooden framework used to support plants, use [[trellis]]. For clothing with a similar appearance, use [[cross-laced clothes]].
tsurugi (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. President of the [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is Kenzaki Tsurugi.

She [[dual wielding|dual wields]] a pair of modified [[Winchester Model 1887]] [[shotgun]]s. Her most notable characteristic is her inability to control her facial expression. While she is actually a timid and shy person, she is often seen with [[evil smile|evil]], [[yandere]], or [[crazy smile]], at times borderlining [[rape face]].

Voiced by: [[Kobayashi Yuu]]
Original artist: [[mx2j]]
brown collar:
A [[collar]] that is colored brown.

This is for standalone [[collar]]s not part of a shirt. Do not use for [[collared shirt]]s, [[brown sailor collar]]s, or other similar clothing.
amamiya ren:
The [[Persona 5]] player character. Voiced by [[Fukuyama Jun]] (JP) / [[Xander Mobus]] (EN).

The leader of the Phantom Thieves. A 16-year-old young man and second-year high school student who transfers to Shujin Academy. He seems quiet and well-mannered at first glance, but gives a completely different impression once he has donned his "phantom thief" guise. He finds residence at Cafe LeBlanc, run by [[Sakura Soujirou]], after getting expelled from his school for being accused of assaulting a man who was molesting a woman.

The name used for his tag is lifted from his anime appearance, [[Persona 5: Dancing Star Night]], as well as being the default name for the 2022 re-release of [[Persona 5 The Royal]]. Previously, the manga adaption gave him the name "Kurusu Akira". His codename among the Phantom Thieves, "Joker", is used as his official name in some other sources, such as his appearance in [[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]].
inflatable toy: Catchall tag for any air-filled beach toy or flotation device (aside from [[innertube]]s, [[inflatable raft]]s, and [[beachball|beach balls]]). These are usually shaped like sea creatures such as [[crocodile]]s, [[shark]]s, [[dolphin]]s and [[whale]]s.
mummy costume: A [[costume]] that imitates the wrappings of a [[mummy]].
diving mask:
[[Goggles]] that cover the eyes and nose underwater. Used in [[snorkel]]ing and [[diving]].

For goggles that only covers the eyes underwater, see [[swim goggles]].
new jersey (azur lane):
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]Iowa[/i]-class battleship [i]USS New Jersey[/i] (BB-62). Character design by [[yyy (zelda10010)|yyy]], voiced by [[Tomita Miyu]].

She is the second natural UR ship in the game. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]], wears a black [[bodystocking]] with a futuristic style over[[coat]] on her shoulders, [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], white [[miniskirt]], bluish-chrome [[high heels]], and a headpiece with her hull number (BB-62) inscribed on it. She has an upbeat and flashy personality, rarely seen without a smile on her face.

Her [[rigging]] consists of her three 406 mm triple Mk7 mounts and four of her ten historical 127 mm twin mounts in an equally-futuristic rig with an electrically-charged glowing ring to her back.

She was launched on December 7th 1942, exactly one year after the Pearl Harbor attack. She took part in numerous actions from World War II to Vietnam and earned 19 battle stars in her long service before being decommissioned for the last time on February 8th 1991. Her historic counterpart is currently a museum ship located in Camden, New Jersey.
air shakur (umamusume): Character from the series [[Umamusume]]. Resident 'punk' girl and [i]data scientist[/i] of the series. Behind her belligerant disposition is a logically-minded genius. In the game, she has the maximum bonus of 30% in Wisdom training as well as one of the highest base Wisdom stats.
crotch:
The area between the legs where they join the torso.

Used for images where the point of view is blatantly focused on the crotch region, especially the [[perineum]] (i.e., the fleshy area between the pubic bone and the tailbone).
kitasan black (umamusume):
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

A cheerful and energetic girl who innocently takes up any challenges. She looks up to Tokai Teio and idolizes her. Her general motif is based on Japanese festivals. In the anime, she was a supporting character during Season 2. She would later become the protagonist of Season 3 and a member of Team Spica.

The original horse's name wasn't named because he had a black or brown coat (he was a simple bay) but because he is named after his sire, [i]Black[/i] Tide, an older full brother to the much more successful [[Deep Impact (Umamusume)|]].
on motorcycle: [[Riding]], [[sitting]], or resting on a [[motorcycle]]. The motorcycle may be stationary or being driven.
lace-trimmed choker:
A [[choker]] with [[lace trim]].

Not to be confused with [[lace choker]].

* !post #6690191: A lace choker
* !post #3842049: A lace trim. The lack of gaps in the center is important in differentiating the two.
minami kotori:
A member of μ's in [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]. She is also a member of [[printemps (love live!)|Printemps]], a sub-unit of μ's, alongside [[Kosaka Honoka]] and [[Koizumi Hanayo]]. She attends Otonokizaka High School, where [[minami kotori's mother|her mother]] is the chairwoman. Since the literal meaning of "Kotori" is "little bird," she is sometimes depicted in fan art as a [[minami kotori (bird)|bird]]. 

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|gray]]-[[brown hair]] arranged in a [[one side up]] with a plume. [[Kosaka Honoka]] and [[Sonoda Umi]] are her childhood friends.

Voiced by [[Uchida Aya]] (JPN), [[Cristina Valenzuela]] (ENG).
admire vega (umamusume): An [[Umamusume]] character. She's nicknamed Ayabe which is a combination of "adomaiya"(Admire) and "bega"(Vega). Has a thing for "anything that is fluffy":[/pools/21241].
xianyun (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

double-parted bangs: Bangs that are distinctly parted or swept in two different spots, usually on the left and right side of the hair.
x-ray vision:
When an image displays the ability for characters to see through clothes, walls or other objects. This can either be accomplished via some device (such as [[x-ray glasses]] or an [[x-ray phone]]) or via the innate ability of a character (such as Superman).

If there is no indication the x-ray would be visible to any characters (even offscreen characters), and it is simply drawn for the viewer's benefit, use the [[x-ray]] tag instead of this one.
okumura haru:
[[Persona 5]] character. Voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]] (JP) / [[Xanthe Huynh]] (EN).

A third-year high school student who is the daughter to [[okumura kunikazu|the president of a large restaurant company]]. Elegant but naive, she tends to observe people. Haru also has good communication skills, but is a [i]terrible[/i] driver. Her initial persona is [[Milady (Persona)|]].
foaming at the mouth:
A person foaming at the mouth.

This can indicate poisoning, insanity, extreme anger (as in the expression "a frothing rage"), or having been interrupted while brushing one's teeth. Not to be confused with [[drooling]] or having a [[milk mustache]].

tricorne: A [[hat]] whose brim is turned up in such a way as to form three corners.
bed invitation: A character is [[lifting covers|lifting the blanket]] they are lying under to show they are offering to let another character (possibly the viewer) join them in [[under covers|lying under the blanket]].

blank eyes: Eyes that are missing both the irises and pupils; only the sclera are present. Often used to show [[surprised|surprise]], [[gloom (expression)|]], or a state of [[death]]. Sometimes used to show a character of overwhelming power.
tag: An actual tag in an image. Examples include clothing tags, cow [[ear tag]]s, or [[name tag]]s.

holding with feet:
[[Holding]] something with the [[feet]]. It may or may not be [[between toes]].

Don't confuse it with the act of holding feet, which would be tagged either [[holding own foot]] or [[holding another's foot]].
paizuri invitation: When a character is suggesting the promise of or enticing someone into performing [[paizuri]], or even [[paizuri under clothes]]. This most often takes the form of a [[naughty face]] in conjunction with a strategically unbuttoned shirt that reveals [[underboob]] or [[cleavage]].
butler: The title was originally entitled to the person who had the charge of the wine cellar and dispensed liquors. Today it is mostly known as a male servant to a wealthy person.
war:
An organized, armed, and, often, a prolonged conflict that is carried on between states, nations, or armed political organization using [[army|armies]] and [[soldier]]s. Typically to either resolve diplomatic or political disputes or as an aggressive diplomatic tool against other countries. War are usually carried out between two or more [[military]] of the opposing factions.

This tag can be applied to any depiction of war, either historical or fictional, as well as various aspects of it (such as death and destruction), either literally or symbolically.

fake nails: A set of small plastic molds that can be glued to the [[fingernails]] and painted with [[nail polish]].
diamond-shaped pupils:
Use when a character's pupils are shaped like a [[diamond_(shape)|diamond]].

nakano azusa:
A main character of [[K-On!]]. She is often referred to as "Azu-nyan" by her mates.

The youngest and newest member of the Light Music Club, joining in her freshman year (with her other bandmates already in their second year). Like bandmate [[Hirasawa Yui]], Azusa is also a [[guitar]]ist, but with years of experience at hand compared to the former, [[playing instrument|playing]] a [[Fender Mustang]]. While trying to act as the straight girl of the band who often finds herself bewildered by her bandmates' lax habits, she also has a weakness for [[cake]]s and is rather easily placated, often by being [[headpat|petted]]. In her third year, she forms a new band named [[wakaba girls (k-on!)|Wakaba Girls]] with [[Hirasawa Ui]] and [[Suzuki Jun]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] stylized in [[twintails]] with [[bangs]], [[hair between eyes]], and [[sidelocks]]. Usually depicted wearing the [[Sakuragaoka High School Uniform]] with [[black socks]].
canvas (object): A fabric stretched across a wooden frame, used as a painting surface for [[acrylic_paint_(medium)|acrylic painting]] and [[oil_painting_(medium)|oil painting]].
cauldron: A large metal pot with a lid and handle, used for cooking over an open fire.
tangzhuang:
A [b]tangzhuang[/b] (Simplified Chinese: 唐装) is a kind of pseudo-traditional Chinese [[jacket]], typically with a [[mandarin collar]].

It originated at the end of the Qing Dynasty (1644-1911) as an evolution of the Manchurian [i]magua[/i], which had been adopted by the Han Chinese during the [[Qing Dynasty]]. At that time, only noblemen, aristocracy and government officials wore it, however, in modern times it was eventually adopted by common people. This kind of clothing is often seen as a national costume for men, although women wear it as well. 

[[Saotome Ranma]] from [[Ranma 1/2]] is usually seen wearing this type of jacket.
eye reflection: A reflection of an object visible in someone's eyes.
multiple scars: Having more than one [[scar]], often in different places on the body.
stheno (fate):
Stheno (Greek for "Forceful") is a character from [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], and can be summoned as an Assassin-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Her Noble Phantasm is "Smile of the Stheno", a powerful debuff and charm against a male opponent.

Has a younger twin sister, [[Euryale (fate)|]], and a younger sister, [[Medusa (rider) (fate)|Medusa]]. Depicted as a [[purple hair]]ed girl with [[purple eyes]], [[twintails]], a [[headdress]] and [[white dress]]. The difference between her sister is the black rose ornament, the slit, and arm decoration is on her left side. They appear identical in Fate/hollow ataraxia.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Akira (kaned fools)|]]

However, she is infamous as a fearsome hacker, nicknamed "Goalkeeper", and is invaluable as an asset of [[Judgement armband (toaru)|Judgment]] and Kuroko's primary o
gatling gun:
A type of [[heavy machine gun]] with multiple rotating barrels.

The original Gatling gun was invented by Richard Jordan Gatling and first used in the [[American Civil War]] and was a direct ancestor of today's [[machine gun]]s. Though not automatic in operation, it has a hand[[crank]] for the user to [[firing|fire]] the shots and, rechamber a flesh [[ammunition]] from its [[drum magazine]], in the place of the spent cartridge, for each of its six barrels as they rotates. Gatling-style rotating barrels are still used in modern heavy machine guns such as the [[M61 Vulcan]], the [[GAU-8]], and the [[M134 Minigun]], typically to increase the sheer volume of firepower while reducing the wear of each individual barrel for continued usage.

On Danbooru, [[gatling gun]] refers to any kind of [[heavy machine gun]] with multiple rotating barrels, not just the original Civil War-era Gatling gun. If the said gatling gun were small enough to be carried by a person, then the tag [[minigun]] is applicable.
breast poke:
When one or more objects press into the breast, generally with the majority of its force being directed towards the center of the breast.  The penetrating force doesn't break the skin, or otherwise breach the "skin boundary".

Some examples:

* Not a breast poke: post #198905.
* This is a breast poke: post #234777.

Where you may call the second image a breast poke, it is instead [[nipple penetration]] because it is breaching the "skin boundary".
sticker: A piece of paper or plastic, sticky on one side and non-stick on the other, with a design or text printed on it. Stickers are often used for play or advertising.
yo-yo: A [[toy]] consisting of an axle connecting two discs, and a spool of string wound up in the center. It is played with by holding the loose end of the string and either throwing or dropping it to let gravity unwind the string, then rewind back into the user's hand.

sheryl nome:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. She first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008. 

[b]Sheryl Nome[/b] is a famous songstress who grew up in the Macross Galaxy colony fleet. She probably is [[Mao Nome]]'s granddaughter.
thighhighs over pantyhose: A character wearing [[pantyhose]] with [[thighhighs]] on top.
tunic:
A type of historical clothing top worn as [[shirt]] in ancient Greece and Rome and in the Middle Ages by various Germanic people. 

Varying in sleeves length, the hem length typically reaches the thighs or knees.
through medium: Someone or something goes through the medium they are presented in, such a coming out of a page. This may be a [[fourth wall]] break, but does not have to be -- the medium being passed through may be an object depicted in the work, rather than being the work itself. For tagging purposes this also includes things that are not a typically considered a medium on their own, such as a coming out of a screen. This also includes reaching "into" the medium, eg post #2130515.
rubik's cube:
A 3-d mechanical puzzle cube, the objective of which is to have each of all six sides having a single color. This is done by twisting and turning the components of the cube.

Official website: http://www.rubiks.com/
Wikipedia article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rubik%27s_Cube
lopunny:

mount fuji:
富士山 (ふじさん)

Highest [[mountain]] in [[Japan]] at 3,776 m (12,388 ft), and one of the iconic images of the nation. Although it has not erupted in over 300 years, it is still an active [[volcano]].
hatoba tsugu: The first and titular character of the [[Tsugu (vtuber)|Hatoba Tsugu]] channel.
ritual baton:
A long and flat scepter, often made from bamboo. It originates from ancient China, where it originally served as an object to write on. It is strongly associated with ancient noblemen, [[shinto]] priests, and [[hina ningyou]].

Known as [i]shaku[/i] in Japanese and [i]hu[/i] in Chinese. 

[[enma_(mythology)|Enma]]'s [[rod of remorse]] is a variant of this ritual baton.
paper airplane: A basic airplane made of paper. One of the many basic origami patterns.
ace (playing card):
A [[playing card]].

This card acts as the alpha and omega of all playing card games. Meaning that it can either score the lowest or the highest.
paper crane: A common [[origami]] model based on the long necked [[bird]], the [[crane_(animal)|]].
magnifying glass: A convex lens that is used to produce a magnified image of an object. The lens is usually mounted in a frame with a handle. A magnifying glass can be used to focus light, such as to concentrate the sun's radiation to create a hot spot at the focus for fire starting.
diamond (gemstone):
A type of precious [[crystal]] [[gem|gemstone]] known for its hardness.

For tagging purposes this should be used for crystals that have been cut into an organized shape, particularly a shape used in jewelry.

For the ♦️ symbol or the [[playing card]] suit, use [[diamond (shape)]].
For the 💎 symbol seen on [[Idolmaster]] character cards, see [[gem (symbol)|]].
ranka lee:
A character from the [[Macross]] series.

[b]Ranka Lee[/b] is one of the main characters from the [[Macross Frontier]] science fiction [[mecha]] anime TV series and later animated movie adaptations.

She is a green haired teenager who is small for her age.

Voiced by [[Nakajima Megumi]].
pomu rainpuff:
A former [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], part of the first wave [[Lazulight|]] and designed by [[Kujou Ichiso]].

She graduated on January 20th, 2024, having "announced it":[https://twitter.com/NIJISANJI_World/status/1743271163898556612] on the 5th.

Pomu has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[multicolored eyes|multicolored]] [[red eyes|red]] and [[brown eyes]], [[pointy ears]] and a set of [[fairy wings]].
ryougi shiki:
Ryougi Shiki is one of the main protagonists of the [[Kara no Kyoukai]] novels. She is a teenage girl who possesses the [[Mystic Eyes of Death Perception]], a supernatural ability that allows the user to see the inherent mortality of everything (both living and non-living) in the form of lines.

She has short [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She is usually seen wearing a [[red jacket|red]] [[leather jacket]] over a [[blue kimono]]. When she uses her powers, her eyes [[glowing eyes|glow]] an iridescent [[blue eyes|blue]] (though she is sometimes illustrated with blue eyes while [i]not[/i] using her powers [[artistic error|by mistake]]).

During the [[Fate/Grand Order]] collaboration event with Kara no Kyoukai, she can be acquired as an Assassin-class Servant. 

[spoiler]Her [[Void Shiki|third personality]] (aka the embodiment of the Void) can also be summoned as a Saber-class Servant. This version of hers wields the Kanesada Kuji, and as she gains power, her hair grows out, her kimono grows more elaborate, and has the Mystic Eyes of Death Perception activated permanently.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sakamoto Maaya]]
ump45 (girls' frontline):
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP45]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Has [[grey hair|grey]]-[[brown hair|dull-brown hair]] worn with [[one side up]], and wears a fairly practical (by fictional standards) outfit consisting of a [[white shirt]], a [[jacket]], [[black pantyhose]] and exoskeleton. She has [[brown eyes]] and has a [[scar across eye|scar on the left eye]].

UMP45 is portrayed as the older sister of [[UMP9 (girls' frontline)|]], sister (mostly young) of [[UMP40 (girls' frontline)|]], and is the leader of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]]. UMP45 is often portrayed in the fandom as being the butt of [[flat chest]] jokes, often from either UMP9 or [[M37 (girls' frontline)|]]. Would receive a [[UMP45 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In her appearance in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], she would go by the name [[Leva (Girls' Frontline 2)|]].

Her original illustrator [[Infukun]] adapted her design from one of [[Renatus.Z]]'s Pixiv Fantasia characters, [[Renatus (pixiv fantasia)|]] (hence why they are credited as ZAGALA). Following Infukun's departure, other illustrators have picked her up to do her skins. She was previously voiced by Mineuchi Tomomi until she retired from voice acting in December 31, 2022 and is currently voiced by [[Sasahara Yuu]].
adachi rei:
A crowdfunded life-sized robot project started by [[missile (missile39)|missile39]] in 2017. She was given a computer-generated voice using the [[UTAU]] program and later used for a text-to-speech software called REPLIVOICE Adachi Rei, powered by the [[A.I. VOICE]] engine.

h5. Appearance
Adachi Rei has [[orange hair]], [[orange eyes]], and [[medium hair|medium length hair]] done into a [[one side up]] style tied with a [[hair ribbon]]. She also wears a small [[hairclip]] along with a [[headset]] equipped with accessories like a [[headlamp]] and [[radio antenna]]. She wears an [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket]] with a black [[turtleneck]] underneath and [[white gloves]]. Her jacket features a [[sound wave]] design along the colored stripes. She also wears a [[plaid skirt|plaid-patterned]] [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[culottes|culotte]] (often depicted as simple [[grey shorts]] instead) with an [[orange belt]]. Beneath that, Rei wears [[black leggings]] and [[sneakers]]. 

Occasionally she is depicted with [[cable|cables]] hanging below her skirt. If details in the eye make it applicable, then she should also be tagged with [[lens eye]].

Her character item is [[fried chicken]]. Her catchphrase is "zumo".

humanoid robot:
A [[robot]] that has a humanoid shape (bipedal with distinct arms and legs), but cannot pass for a human like an [[android]]. The robot should be clearly distinguishable from a human, and should not have a human-like face.

Note that while most [[mecha]] are humanoid, they should not be tagged under this tag. Instead, use the appropriate subtag of [[non-humanoid robot]] for the more uncommon cases of non-humanoid mecha.
hiiragi kagami:
Character from the anime series “[[Lucky Star]].” Due to being born first, she's sometimes referred as older sister to [[Hiiragi Tsukasa]], her twin sister. [b]Hiiragi Kagami[/b], unlike Tsukasa, is an outstanding student. She also reads manga, though she is not an avid otaku like Konata. 

She has long purple hair usually drawn up into [[twintails]] with ribbons, and [[tsurime]] blue eyes.

crane (animal):
Latin: [i]Gruidae[/i] family
Japanese: 鶴 [i]tsuru[/i]

A long-legged, long-necked bird. The most frequently depicted crane in Japanese art, recognizable by its red forehead and black markings, is the [[red-crowned crane]].

Do not confuse with [[heron]]s or [[stork]]s.
takoyaki: Japanese ball-shaped snack made out of batter, usually with [[octopus]] (tako) filling inside, but popular alternatives include [[corn]] kernels, meat, or tempura. Typically served with sauce, seaweed, and scallions sprinkled on it.
monkey: A primate of the Haplorrhini suborder and simian infraorder, either an Old World monkey or a New World monkey, but excluding [[ape]]s and humans.  Traditionally identifiable from apes by having a tail.

tanuki:
The Japanese name for the Japanese raccoon dog. In Japanese folklore, a tanuki is a playful shape-shifting [[traditional youkai]].

Not to be confused for the [[raccoon]], which looks similar to the tanuki but is not the same animal. A key difference is their fur color: tanuki tend to have brown fur while raccoons have grey fur.

The words "tanuki" (狸), "mujina" (貉), and "mami" (猯) were historically confused in Japan. "Mujina" and "mami" used to mean [[badger]]s in some areas, while on the other areas these terms used to mean raccoon dogs. There are some areas in which badgers were called tanuki.

In folklore, a type of tanuki called the [i]mamedanuki[/i] (豆狸) sports comically [[huge testicles]]. "Shigaraki ware":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigaraki_ware], a type of traditional Japanese pottery, often depicted these tanuki. The statues depicted a mamedanuki as he transforms (or fails to transform) into an errand boy going out to buy [[sake]] at a liquor shop.
amami haruka:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series. An excitable and clumsy girl whose interests include singing and making sweets.

Voiced by [[Nakamura Eriko]].
snap-fit buckle:
Also known as a side release buckle. This buckle is made out of plastic, where one half is made up of 3 prongs that seamlessly join together with the other half that acts as a shell. The buckle is released by pressing on the sides to push the prongs inward.

A "snap" noise is created when you connect the buckle together and when you pull it apart.
makizushi:
[b]Makizushi[/b] (巻き寿司, lit. "rolled sushi") is a type of long cylindrical [[sushi]], usually rolled in [[nori (seaweed)]] sheets. A thick roll is called 太巻き ([i]Futomaki[/i]) and a thin roll is called 細巻き ([i]Hosomaki[/i]). For posts where the seaweed is on the inside of the roll, see [[uramaki]].

Normally makizushi are cut into several pieces, but uncut rolls of makizushi are eaten as [[ehoumaki]].

Makizushi is often portrayed as a [[phallic symbol]] and used to perform [[simulated fellatio]].
miyashita ai:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]] and a second year student at Nijigasaki High School. Despite her gyaru style and flashy, loud appearance, Ai is a kindhearted, reliable girl who loves making puns.

She is a [[gyaru]] with [[yellow eyes|yellow]] or [[orange eyes|orange]] eyes and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[bangs]]. At school she ties her hair into a [[half updo]] or a [[ponytail]] with a [[hair flower]]. In her free time she lets her her hair down except for a [[side braid]] on the front.

She wears a [[brown cardigan]] with her winter uniform instead of the regular black jacket, during summer she keeps the cardigan but ties it [[cardigan around waist|around her waist]] instead and wears a [[wrist scrunchie]] and [[bracelet]]s.

She is a member of [[DiverDiva]].

Voiced by [[Murakami Natsumi (voice actor)|]].
angel mort:
Outfit worn by [[waitress|waitresses]] of the Angel Mort restaurant in [[higurashi no naku koro ni|Higurashi no Naku Koro Ni]].

off-shoulder bikini: A specific type of shoulder-less bikini designed with a wide low-cut neckline (much like regular [[off shoulder]] garments), leaving the shoulders and upper chest area [[bare_shoulders|bare]]. Usually, it is a bikini with sleeves that sit on the arms instead of the shoulders.

Honest, sensitive 16-year-old Makoto's [[reverse trap|boyish]] looks (having been raised as a boy by her father, who wanted one) and skill at sports pigeonholed her into becoming a "pretty-boy idol", much to her chagrin, having originally joined the studio in order to become more feminine.

Makoto's theme color is black, and she is voiced by [[Hirata Hiromi]].

Special [[pavement]] with bumps or ridges for the benefit of visually impaired people, used in [[train station|train stations]] and at [[crosswalk|crosswalks]].

In such cases, the blue oni tends to be cooler and more cynical, while the red oni tends to be more hot-blooded.

lying on person:

For where someone is leaning above another person but not directing lying on them, instead supporting themselves with arms, in an intend to block the other person, use [[yukadon]] instead.
fried chicken:
A [[food]] item that usually consists of [[chicken (food)|chicken]] cuts that are seasoned, breaded, and either pan-fried, [[deep frying|deep fried]], or pressure-fried.

A restaurant that specializes in fried chicken is [[KFC]].
cotton candy:
Melted sugar spun into thin threads and collected into a fluffy mass, usually on a stick or cone. Mostly enjoyed during [[festival]] events.

Also known as [b]candy floss[/b] and [b]fairy floss[/b].
grey tank top: A [[tank top]] that is colored grey.

ushizaki urumi: Parental Guardian of Ancient Fish The second stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is an 牛鬼 (ushi-oni or gyuuki), a cow-demon youkai, and has [[cow horns]] atop her [[black_hair|black]] and [[grey_hair|grey]] [[two-tone hair]]. She wears a [[cow print|cow-printed]] [[haori]] over her [[crop top]] and [[yellow shorts]]. She also wears a pair of [[sandals]]. Her ability is to manipulate the weight of everyday objects, which she once used to increase the weight of the baby statue she holds to drown people. She now lives peacefully by the Sanzu River, where she runs a fishing business, and tries to help people who accidentally come to the river.
grey nails: [[Fingernails]] and/or [[toenails]] that appear grey, either due to being painted with grey [[nail polish]] or because they are intrinsically grey (common for [[zombie]]s and other undead).
casino card table: A [[table]] to play card games at a [[casino]] such as Blackjack and Baccarat. Usually has green felt top, a raised edge to stop cards from falling on the floor and markings for [[playing card]] and [[poker chip]] placements.
over the nose gag: A type of [[gag]] that covers both mouth and nose. A regular [[mouth mask]] does not count in this tag unless it is purposely used to restrict the wearer's speech.
kuki shinobu: [[Genshin Impact]] character. Kuki Shinobu is the deputy of the Arataki Gang and [[arataki_itto|Itto's]] sidekick but far more competent than him, always bailing him and the rest of the Arataki Gang out of serious trouble.
bandolier:
A belt for holding individual rounds of [[ammunition]] or other objects, usually worn like a [[sash]] over the shoulder or chest.

Typically, each round is held in its own loop along the length of the belt. They are often seen on gunslingers in old [[cowboy western|western]]-themed settings and characters, though modern bandoliers exist and may be used to hold [[shotgun shell]]s, [[grenade]]s, or other [[weapon|armaments]].


Not to be confused with an [[ammunition belt]], a device that holds ammunition together to be used on belt-fed [[machine gun]]s.

Also not to be confused with a [[Sam Browne belt]], a similar over-the-shoulder belt once used as a more effective replacement for the traditional "frog" waist belt clip for equipping a sword's scabbard, and primarily an aesthetic feature where it is in use now.
boo tao (genshin impact): Fan-given name to the [[ghost]] that often accompanies [[Hu Tao (genshin impact)|]] in [[Genshin Impact]]. Mostly seen in her Burst Skill or idle animation. Comparable to [[konpaku youmu (ghost)|Myon]] in some regards.
diamond cutout: A [[clothing_cutout|cutout]] on any article of clothing that has a [[diamond_(shape)|diamond shape]].
black armor: [[Armor]] that is colored black. Popular with the "Black Knight":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackKnight trope seen in films, anime and video games.
cleaver:
A single-handed butcher's [[knife]] with a square blade resembling a small [[nata (tool)|]]. 

Cleavers come in two sizes, small and full size. Small cleavers are generally for home use, they are 180-210mm (7-8inch) in length. Full size cleavers are for professional/restaurant use, they are 220-250mm (9-10 inch). 

If the blade is bigger and/or it's double-handed it's a [[nata (tool)|]], a common weapon for a [[yandere]].
mummy:
A body embalmed and dried and wrapped for burial, most notably done in [[ancient Egyptian|ancient Egypt]]. A mummy can also be created due to a dead body being exposed to the elements of nature, like extreme cold or humidity.

Do not apply this tag if the character is simply wrapped with [[bandage]]s, a mummy should have a large portion of their body wrapped. If it's the former case, use the tag [[mummy costume]] instead.
upturned eyes:
When a character's eyes are pointed upwards relative to their face. This is often done to look cute, coy, childish, timid, submissive, or pleading.

This expression is sometimes accompanied by the [[head down|head tilted downward]], sometimes with face facing forward but [[looking up]], often occurs alongside [[raised eyebrows]]. It also occurs when a character is [[looking at viewer|looking at the viewer]], but is below their eye-level (such as often the case with [[fellatio]]).

This is different from [[rolling eyes]] or eyes rolled back in the head (as in [[ahegao]]) in that in this case something is actively being focused on and looked at. This is similar to [[sanpaku]] in that the white sclera of their eyes might be visible to three of four sides of their irises, but in this tag refers to a soft, gentle expression, whereas [[sanpaku]] refers to a shocked, angry, detatched, or unhinged expression.
hymen: A thin membrane present in the [[pussy|vagina]]l opening of most women. Depiction of tearing and/or [[blood]] from a tearing often is illustrated to indicate an initial ("[[defloration]]") [[sex]]ual intercourse — though tearing is not exclusive to sexual acts, nor is an intact hymen any proof that a person has not engaged in sexual intercourse.

aurora:
A natural atmospheric phenomenon that causes a pattern of colorful lights to appear in the [[night sky]].

Predominantly seen in high-latitude regions around the Arctic and Antarctic. Also known as the [b]northern lights[/b] or [b]aurora borealis[/b] in the Northern hemisphere and as the [b]southern lights[/b] or [b]aurora australis[/b] in the Southern hemisphere.

crossed ankles: Having one's legs crossed at the [b]ankles[/b], as opposed to [[crossed legs]] or [[watson cross]], where the legs are crossed at calf-, knee-, or thigh-level.
gilgamesh (fate):
[[Fate (series)|]] character who appears in [[Fate/zero]], [[Fate/stay night]], [[Fate/strange Fake]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. 

The heroic spirit of the legendary Sumerian king. Identifying as a demigod and the 'King of Heroes,' he possesses the appearance of a [[blonde hair|blonde]], [[red eyes|red-eyed]] man in [[gold armor|golden]] [[armor]]. Some appearances depict him without his armor, revealing his [[toned]] body.

He is originally summoned by [[Tohsaka Tokiomi]] during the Fuyuki Grail Wars in [[Fate/Zero]]. Following his death, he formed a contract with [[Kotomine Kirei]], who helped him take measures allowing him to survive into the Fifth Grail War in [[Fate/stay night]]. While the Fuyuki Grail summons him into the Archer class, his existence in [[Fate/extra CCC]] is unable to be constrained by class.

In [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], he takes a magic potion to become a younger version of himself, known as [[Child Gilgamesh (fate)|]], while in [[Fate/strange Fake]], he is the "False" Archer-class Servant of [[Tine Chelc]].

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], he becomes an ally and playable Servant as the Wise King of Uruk under the [[Gilgamesh (Caster) (Fate)|]] designation.

Notable for his arrogant and narcissistic personality, with him calling almost any other non-Sumerians or gods as "mongrel" (雑種 - [i]zasshu[/i]). He is enamored by [[Saber (fate)|]] for her beauty and noble spirit, her continual refusal of him only compounding his obsessive desire.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Seki Tomokazu]]
euryale (fate):
Euryale (Greek for "Far-Flier") is a character from [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], and can be summoned as an Archer-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Her Noble Phantasm is "Eye of the Euryale", a powerful single-target attack that does more damage and charms the target if it is male.

Has an older twin sister, [[Stheno (fate)|]], and a younger sister, [[Medusa (rider) (fate)|Medusa]]. Depicted as a [[purple hair]]ed girl with [[purple eyes]], [[twintails]], a [[headdress]] and [[white dress]]. The difference between her twin sister is the black rose ornament, the slit, and arm decoration is on her right side. They appear identical in Fate/hollow ataraxia.

[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Asakawa Yuu]]

hong lu (project moon):
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.06 of [[Limbus Company]]. Based off of the main character Jia Baoyu from the 19th century Chinese novel "Dream of the Red Chamber":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dream_of_the_Red_Chamber written by 18th century novelist "Cao Xueqin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cao_Xueqin.

Average height and build with pale skin and a feminine appearance. He has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|purple-ish black hair]] kept in a [[high ponytail]] or [[half updo]] in most identities. He has [[heterochromia]], with a [[black eyes|black right eye]] and [[blue eyes|cyan left eye]]. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] Sinners, a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black coat]], and [[black pants]].

He primarily wields a [[guan dao]] wrapped in red ribbons in his base identity, with the words '太虛幻境' written upon the edge of the blade.
char aznable:
The main antagonist of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] and the eponymous [[Char's Counterattack]], a supporting character in [[zeta gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] and eternal rival and foe of [[Amuro Ray]]. Also appears in [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]].

[b]Char Aznable[/b], also known as [b]The Red Comet[/b] by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [spoilers](as he was able to destroy 5 Federation battleships with a simple red colored [[Zaku I]] in quick succession during the "Battle of Loum":https://gundam.fandom.com/wiki/Battle_of_Loum)[/spoilers]), is originally a blonde-haired [[Zeon]] ace pilot of the [[Zaku II S Char Custom|MS-06S Zaku II Commander Type]], [[z'gok char custom|Z'Gok]], [[gelgoog s char custom|Gelgoog]], [[Zeong|MSN-02 Zeong]], [[AEUG]] [[Rick Dias]], [[Gundam Mk II]], [[Zero Shiki (gundam)|]], [[Hyaku Shiki|MSN-00100 Hyaku Shiki]] and the [[Neo Zeon]] [[Char's Dijeh]], [[Dijeh Traversia]], [[Geara Doga Psycommu Test Type]] and the [[Prototype Sazabi]]/[[Sazabi|MSN-04 Sazabi]]/[[nightingale (gundam)|MSN-04II Nightingale]]. 

He is usually depicted with some sort of eyewear or headwear (usually [[sunglasses]] or his trademark [[helmet]]), concealing his eyes.

[spoilers]His real name is [b][[Casval Rem Deikun]][/b] and he has [[blue eyes]]. He stole the identity of [[char aznable (real)|the real Char Aznable]]  (who is mostly identical to him except his brown eyes) to avoid being killed by [[Kycilia Zabi]] as a part of her plan to purge the Deikun family, and as such he chose to conceal his eyes to hide his real identity. He is the actual brother of [[Sayla Mass]]/[[Artesia Som Deikun]] and the true heir to Zeon.[/spoilers]

Char's name was inspired by the real life Franco-Armenian singer and actor "Charles Aznavour":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Aznavour. In [[Japan]] Char is as well known and popular as iconic characters [[Darth Vader]] and [[spock|Mr. Spock]] are in the West. 

He is voiced by [[Ikeda Shuuichi]].
corsage:
A [[flower]] or small arrangement of flowers worn by women on special occasions, typically pinned to the dress or tied to the wrist. 

If the flower is pinned visibly to the lapel instead, use [[boutonniere]].
punching bag:
A cylindrical bag designed to be repeatedly punched for training in boxing.

In Japan the term "sandbag (サンドバッグ)" is used as a "wasei-eigo":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasei-eigo referring to punching bags. The Japanese call [[sandbag]]s "donou (土嚢)".

A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. The [i]de facto[/i] onstage leader of the Nijigasaki High School Idol Club, Ayumu is a hardworking girl that puts her all into what she does. She can be very clumsy at times. Her childhood friend, depending on medium, is either [[Takasaki Yu]] (anime) or [[Anata-chan (love live!)|]] (ALL STARS).

She has [[yellow eyes|yellow]]-[[green eyes]] and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[pink hair|pink]]-[[orange hair]], arranged in a [[half updo]] with [[swept bangs|swept]], [[blunt bangs]] (often held by [[hairclip]]s) and a [[single side bun|single]] [[side up bun]] with a [[bun with braided base|braid wrapped around it]].

She is a member of [[azuna (love live!)|A・ZU・NA]].

Voiced by [[Oonishi Aguri]].
