The King of the Koopas, and [[mario|Mario]]'s arch-nemesis. He frequently kidnaps [[Princess Peach]] and terrorizes the Mushroom Kingdom.

[[Bowser Jr.]] is his son. The Koopalings, [[iggy koopa|Iggy]], [[larry koopa|Larry]], [[lemmy koopa|Lemmy]], [[ludwig von koopa|Ludwig]], [[morton koopa jr.|Morton]], [[roy koopa|Roy]], and [[wendy o. koopa|Wendy]], were formerly considered to be his children as well, but this has been "officially retconned by Miyamoto Shigeru since 2012.":https://web.archive.org/web/20180504092230/http://www.gameinformer.com:80/b/features/archive/2012/09/24/miyamoto-tezuka-interview.aspx

Japanese name: [b]Koopa[/b]
green wings: A pair of [[wings]] that are colored [[green]].
stitched arm: When one or both character's arm is either attached to the rest of the body with [[stitches]] or has a significant amount of stitches on it, commonly seen on [[zombie]]s
drop shadow:
A shadow-like visual effect consisting of a character-shaped area of color offset from the character. The shape of a drop shadow is exactly the shape of the character; if it's angled or distorted, use [[shadow]] instead.

It's basically when it looks like there's a light source just above the character's head, projecting a shadow on an invisible wall just behind the character.
empty picture frame: A [[picture frame]] without a canvas or photo.
pill earrings:
Earrings in the shape of a pill.

[[Yumemi Riamu]] from [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]] is shown by default wearing these as seen in her official art - post #3408937.
araragi koyomi: [[Araragi Koyomi]] is the male lead of [[Bakemonogatari]], has short black/dark hair and is usually wearing the [[Gakuran]] style [[school uniform]].
yamamura sadako:
The iconic antagonist of the Japanese horror movie [[The Ring]]. A [[ghost]] girl who haunts a cursed video tape by emerging [[through screen|through the screen]] of anyone who watches it.

Due to her corpse having spent too long at the bottom of a well, she has [[pale skin]], [[long hair|long]], [[black hair|black stringy hair]] [[hair over eyes|covering both of her eyes]], and her fingernails rotted away. She wears a [[white robe]], which is sometimes depicted as a [[white dress]] instead.

She has enjoyed long-lasting popularity in the Japanese - and later worldwide - anime community due to a trend of "moe-ifying" into a ghost girl with [[large breasts]] who will become shy when her eyes are exposed or when her would-be victim pointed out her breasts. This characterization has later become the archetypical depiction of various "ghost girls" in various anime media.
annoyed:
Mild anger, often caused by another's repeated troublesome actions. Annoyed characters will often appear tired or exasperated from having to endure another's antics and may show a [[squiggle]].

Distinct from [[angry|anger]] and [[furious|fury]]; use this tag when the level of frustration a character is experiencing is relatively minor.
unworn shorts: A pair of [[shorts]] that are present but not being worn.
white tail: A character with a [[tail]] of white color.
sheikah:
A human tribe appearing in the [i][[the legend of zelda|Legend of Zelda]][/i] franchise. While the tribe was introduced in [i][[the legend of zelda: ocarina of time|Ocarina of Time]][/i], few Sheikah appeared in the franchise outside of [[Impa]]'s incarnations up until [i][[the_legend_of_zelda:_breath_of_the_wild|Breath of the Wild]][/i], where they are practically the most important race in the game's backstory, being responsible for all of the high technology in the game.

They basically look just like Hylians, except with white hair and (traditionally) red eyes; [i]Breath of the Wild[/i] Sheikahs do have a wider range of eye colors. They also live somewhat longer than Hylians: Impa, Purah and Robbie are in their 120s.

Some of their members have split to form the [[Yiga Clan]] in the [i]Breath of the Wild[/i] timeline.
uncommon stimulation: When a character is sexually stimulated through unusual procedures, seldom-used erogenous zones or erogenous zones normal humans don't have, such as horns or tails.
coin purse: A small [[handbag]] with no shoulder strap, designed for carrying coins or small objects.
broken weapon: Any type of [[weapon]] that has been [[broken]].
konjiki no yami:
Konjiki no Yami (金色の闇, lit. Golden Darkness), is a major character from [[To LOVE-Ru]] and [[To LOVE-Ru Darkness]]. She is portrayed as the deadliest assassin in the galaxy who is hired to kill protagonist [[Yuuki Rito]], but instead ends up falling in love with him. 

Her character design, including shapeshifting abilities and weaponized body, is based on [[Eve (Black Cat)|]] of the [[Black Cat (series)|]] manga, which was written and drawn by the artist of [i]To LOVE-Ru[/i], [[Yabuki Kentarou]].
kataginu:
A sleeveless vest/jacket that tapers out over the shoulders, typically worn over a [[kimono]] with a [[hakama]] as part of the traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese men's outfit]] known as [i]kamishimo[/i] (lit. upper & lower).

Not to be confused with the [[haori]].

A similar vest/jacket without tapering shoulders and typically worn over [[Japanese armor|armor]] is called [[jinbaori]].
callie (splatoon):
[[splatoon_(series)|Splatoon]] character. Named [b]Aori[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[inkling]].

She is part of an [[idol]] group known as Squid Sisters (Sea O'Colors in the Japanese version) with the other member being her [[cousins|cousin]], [[Marie (splatoon)|]]. She and Marie are also both news program hostesses that announce in-game news.

She wears a purple and black-themed outfit matching Marie's and [[sushi]] [[food on head|on her head]]. Other features of this default costume & appearance include [[bow-shaped hair]] and a [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]]. In general she is usually depicted with a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]], [[thick eyebrows]] and [[star-shaped pupils]].

Her canonical [[list of weapons in splatoon|weapon]] class of choice are Rollers.

Her Japanese name comes from the Japanese word for the "bigfin reef squid":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bigfin_reef_squid (障泥烏賊/アオリイカ [i]Aori-ika[/i]) and their band's name in Japanese is a portmanteau of "shiokara" (a Japanese food made out of various marine animals, commonly squid) and "colors". Callie and Marie's names in English are a play on the word calamari.
cockroach:
Common insect pest, often [[censored]] for comic effect. In Japan, the word for them is "gokiburi", sometimes shortened to G -- especially by terrified girls who don't even want to speak their name.

Contrary to popular belief it is not poisonous and thus easy to handle manually.
orange goggles: The lens color of the [[goggles]] is orange.
surrounded: A character being surrounded by other persons. Or in a [[group sex]] situation, by their [[surrounded by penises|penises]].
oyakodon (sex): A [[threesome]] with a [[mother and daughter]] simultaneously. The term is derived from the literal translation of [[oyakodon (food)|]], a "parent-and-child donburi" that contains chicken and egg as key ingredients of the dish.
iphone:
A line of [[smartphone]]s created by [[Apple Inc.]] using Apple's [[iOS (os)|]] operating system. The first-generation iPhone was announced by [[Steve Jobs]] on January 9, 2007. Since then Apple has annually released new iPhone models and iOS updates.

If it's tablet-sized, it's an [[iPad]]. It might also be an [[iPod Touch]].

Anything that looks like a smartphone with a circular home button is probably an iPhone.
iPhone 5 and later have the headphone jack on the bottom of the device instead of the top, like an [[iPod touch]].
iPhone 7 and later have no headphone jack.
[[iPhone X]] and later have no home button.

In Danganronpa 3, he wears a [[green ne

When the subject of an image is given an original alternate design from it's official appearance.

This tag can apply for characters or mecha as well inanimate objects such as vehicles and weapons.

[b]Vi, the Piltover Enforcer[/b]

A human Champion from Piltover in [[League of Legends]] usually played in the Jungle or as Solo Top. She is known for her giant [[gauntlets]], which she uses to punch things with,  and reckless and rebellious personality. She participates in law enforcement alongside [[Caitlyn (league_of_legends)|]].

She and Jinx are protagonists in the [[Arcane: League of Legends

tile roof:
A roof made of [[tiles]]. 

Not to be confused with [[tile ceiling]]. A ceiling it's indoors, a roof it's on top of a building.
contrast: When two differing (most likely visual) aspects of a work clearly contrast with each other, and it appears to have been intentional on the artist's part.(e.g. bright foreground characters, dark background)
perfume bottle: A small spritz [[bottle]] or vial containing perfume, meant to be sprayed on a person or object to give it a pleasant scent.
headlamp:
A type of small [[flashlight]] (or other similar illuminating device) worn on the head to provide light while leaving the hands free. 

Often attached to a [[headband]] or [[hard hat]] (such as a [[mining helmet]]), but may also be affixed directly to the head.

She represents the [[stars]].

multicolored hairband: A [[hairband]] consisting of multiple colors. Popularized with [[Tenkyuu Chimata]].
naked capelet: When a character is wearing a [[capelet]] and nothing else (except [[tag group:legwear|legwear]] or arm wear).
covering another's eyes: Obscuring the eyes of another character, usually with one's hands.
hojo karen:
An [i][[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. She is 16 and has a weak body. She is in the unit "[[Triad Primus (idolmaster)|]]" with [[Kamiya Nao]] and [[Shibuya Rin]].

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the sixth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Hoshi Syoko]], [[Kamiya Nao]], [[Hori Yuko]], and [[Kobayakawa Sae]]. Her seiyuu is [[Fuchigami Mai]].
koizumi hanayo:
A character in [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]. A shy, quiet girl obsessed with idols and white [[rice]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[purple eyes]], and wears [[red-framed eyewear|red-framed]] [[glasses]] or contact lenses. Her childhood friend is [[Hoshizora Rin]].

Voiced by [[Kubo Yurika]] (JP), [[Xanthe Huynh]] (EN).
red track suit: A [[track suit]] that is colored red.
nakasu kasumi:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. She's very competitive and always wants to be number one in any competition. Despite her cute appearance and childlike mannerisms, Kasumi spends a lot of her time scheming or thinking up new ways to ensure her own victory.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]], [[grey hair|grey]]-[[brown hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[asymmetrical hair|one side slightly longer than the other]] and a [[crescent hair ornament|crescent-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. She wears a [[yellow sweater|yellow]] [[sweater]] under her blazer with the winter uniform and a custom [[argyle sweater vest]] for her summer uniform in ALL STARS. In the anime, she wears a simple [[sweater vest]].

She is a member of [[QU4RTZ (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Sagara Mayu]].
bird on shoulder: Used for when a bird is resting on someone's shoulder.
ak-12 (girls' frontline):
An android representing the [[AK-12]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. Leader of team [[DEFY (girls' frontline)|DEFY]]. Would receive a [[AK-12 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[closed eyes]] which do not obstruct her vision (her eyelids acting as filters), obscuring her [[purple eyes]],  though often depicted with [[one eye closed]], revealing them. Wears a [[tactical clothes]] and [[black pants]].

Voiced by [[Waki Azumi]]. Illustrated by [[Duoyuanjun]].
korean clothes: Any variety of traditional Korean clothing.
kotonoha akane:
A [[VOICEROID]] mascot character released as a pair along with her younger sister [[Kotonoha Aoi]]. She has [[pink hair]] and a [[kansaiben|kansaiben]] accent.
Both sisters received a [[Synthesizer V]] voicebank on July 22, 2020 and a [[neutrino_(software)|NEUTRINO]] voicebank on April 25, 2022.
kotonoha aoi:
A [[VOICEROID]] mascot character released as a pair along with her elder sister [[Kotonoha Akane]]. She has [[blue hair]]. 
Both sisters received a [[Synthesizer V]] voicebank on July 22, 2020 and a [[neutrino_(software)|NEUTRINO]] voicebank on April 25, 2022.
azusa (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Ice witch of the [[Make-Up Work Club (blue archive)|]]. [spoiler]Former member of [[Arius Squad (blue archive)|]][/spoiler]. Her full name is Shirasu Azusa.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[crossed bangs]] that reach [[hair between eyes|between the eyes]], [[purple eyes|purple]] to [[pink eyes]], [[low wings|low]] [[white wings|white]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]], and a [[yellow halo|yellow]] [[crescent halo|crescent]] [[halo]]. She wears a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[black dress|black]] [[dress]] with [[dress flower|flower]] and [[petticoat]], [[hair flower]] and [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|hair]] [[ribbon]], [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[neck ribbon|neck]] [[ribbon]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[black socks|black]] [[socks]] with [[ankle flower]], [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]], [[black sailor collar|black]] [[sailor collar]], and a [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket|white]] [[jacket]] with [[puffy long sleeves]]. Uses a white [[M4 Carbine]] with [[latin text|latin]] [[blackletter]] inscription.

Original artist: [[NAMYO]]
sakuramori kaori:
One of the idols from [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[light brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[green eyes]].

Voiced by [[Kouri Arisa]].
trefoil:
When [[panties]] or other similar clothing are [[skin tight]] across the [[ass]] and pubic area, creating a distinct three leaf clover shape.

If the material stretches straight across between the buttocks, that's not really a trefoil. You need the indentation between them.

Not to be confused with the [[radiation symbol]], which is also known as and based on the trefoil symbol.
wet towel: A [[towel]] that has been drenched in [[water]]. Usually the character is wearing a wet towel, and it has become partially [[transparent]] to show what's underneath.
duffel coat:
A [[winter coat]] held shut with toggle-and-loop fasteners. The [[toggles]] are cone-like pegs that fit through large loops to hold the coat shut. This design is made to be easy to open and close while wearing gloves in winter.

Duffel coats were originally made from duffel, a thick woolen fabric also used to make [[duffel bag]]s. The name comes from Duffel, a town in Belgium where the fabric originated.
party hat: A small cone-shaped hat often worn at [[birthday]] parties.
apron lift: When an [[apron]] has been [[clothes_lift|lifted]], usually to show the [[groin]] or pelvic area of it's wearer, including the genitals.
hangar: A large [[building]] where vehicles are stored and maintained.
piano bench: A wooden [[bench]] used by [[piano]] players, some are cushioned, some are long (rectangular) and some are short (almost appearing like a [[stool]]).
decantering:
[i]"Incredible...from such a height..."[/i]

[[Pouring]] liquid from a great height or in an improbable manner. May be impressive, but often ends in [[failure]].

Named for a [[meme]] born from a humorous typo in an English scanlation of [[Kami no Shizuku]]. The proper word is "decanting".
cleaning:
The act of making something clean.

Use this tag when a character is actually cleaning something, not simply when cleaning tools are present.
polo shirt:
A polo shirt is a [[collared shirt]] with a placket neckline that normally features three buttons.  These shirts are traditionally short sleeved, but long sleeved versions are also available.  Some of these shirts may feature a [[breast pocket]].

Example: post #1395570

These shirts are frequently not buttoned up all the way, which may conceal the top button (ex: post #1165398).
chalice:
A metal [[cup]] with a footed stem and a round bowl.

Similar to a [[wine glass]], but made out of metal instead of glass.
brushing another's hair: [[brushing hair|Brushing]] another character's hair (as opposed to [[brushing own hair|their own]]).
mat:
A padded piece of fabric used to cushion a person. Commonly used in sports like [[gymnastics|gymnastics]] to suppress the impact of a person during falls.

For inflatable mattresses used as a bed or at [[soapland|soapland]] houses for massages, see [[air_mattress|air mattress]]. For inflatable mattresses used in the water, see [[inflatable_raft|inflatable raft]]. For floor mattresses used as a bed, see [[futon|futon]]. For colorful mats used on the beach for sunbathing, see [[beach_towel|beach towel]]. For small mats used to wipe shoes and feet, see [[doormat|doormat]] or [[rug|rug]].
nontraditional playboy bunny: A [[playboy bunny]] that is not a traditional [[rabbit ears]] + [[leotard]]. This includes [[kittysuit]]s, [[fox ears]], [[pokemon_(creature)|pokemon]] playboy bunnies, etc.
caustics:
Patterns of [[light]] projected onto a surface by light rays reflected off or refracted through another object. These can be seen on underwater surfaces, when light passes through materials like [[water]], glass, and the like. The bright ripples you can see on the bottom of a [[pool]] or on things close to it on a sunny day are this.

* !post #4150718
short sword: Quite literally, a sword shorter than typical swords. Use this tag if the sword is reasonably short enough to be held with only one hand. For longer one-handed swords such as arming swords, just use the [[sword]] tag.
overskirt:
A [[skirt]] that is intended to be worn on top of another [[skirt]] or [[pants]], and that often has an open front.

Overskirt and [[showgirl skirt]] are mutually exclusive.
kadomatsu: A [b]kadomatsu[/b] (literally "gate pine") is a traditional Japanese decoration of the [[New Year]] placed in pairs in front of homes to welcome ancestral spirits or [i]kami[/i] of the harvest. They are placed after [[Christmas]] until January 7 (or January 15 during the Edo period) and are considered temporary housing ("[i]shintai[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shintai) for [i]kami[/i]. Designs for [i]kadomatsu[/i] vary depending on region but are typically made of [[pine_tree|pine]], [[bamboo]], and sometimes ume tree sprigs which represent longevity, prosperity and steadfastness, respectively.
paper stack:
A stack of individual pieces of [[paper]]. May be held or resting on a surface.

* [[papers]]
under kotatsu: A character [[sitting]] or [[lying]] under a [[kotatsu]]. Sometimes, the entire image is viewed from underneath the kotatsu.
animal bag: A [[bag]] designed to resemble any kind of animal.
side-tie peek: When the side-ties of a pair of [[side-tie panties]] peek out beneath a character's [[skirt]] or [[dress]]. Only the strings should be visible, not the rest of [[panties]].
stun gun: An electronic device used to stun and temporarily immobilize a person using a high-voltage electrical charge. Requires direct contact. Not to be confused with [[taser]] which launches probes from a distance at the target.
air groove (umamusume):
[[Umamusume]] character.

Vice President of the Tracen Academy Student Council. Frequently the victim of [[Symboli Rudolf (umamusume)|]]'s [i]horrible[/i] puns.

Air Groove's official character profile originally had a line mentioning that "she hates men because of a certain traumatic incident in a race" (レース中のとあるトラウマが原因で男嫌い). This was a reference to the 1997 Japan Cup incident where another horse, Pilsudski, won the race in front of Air Groove in spite of said horse flashing at the paddock in front of the crowd (and other horses including Air Groove), which is normally seen as a sign of distraction by Japanese horse racing fans. This line was subsequently removed, but the incident is still referenced in Air Groove's relationship with [[Fine Motion (Umamusume)|]], as the real-life Fine Motion is the half-sister of [[Pilsudski (Racehorse)|]].
swing set: A type of [[playground]] equipment consisting of a metal or wooden frame that supports one or more [[swing|swings]]. Use this tag when both the swing and the frame are in the image. If only the swing itself is pictured, just use the [[swing]] tag.
bamboo steamer:
A round or oval cookware made from [[bamboo]] with a lattice bottom and a cover. They are often stacked on top of each other so that the steam can cook many different servings simultaneously.

Often used to make [[dim sum]].

Called [i]mushiki[/i] (蒸し器) in Japanese.
chi-chi (dragon ball): The daughter of [[Gyuu Maou]], and later wife of [[Son Goku]] and mother of [[Son Gohan]] and [[Son Goten]] in [[Dragon Ball]]. She was shy and fearful when she and Goku first met, but developed a very tough and fierce personality as she got older.
uneven legwear: Legwear of different lengths. For differences in color or pattern, see [[mismatched legwear]].
laundry basket: A [[basket]] used to hold [[laundry]]. Often made of plastic with small holes in the sides.
adjusting legwear: Depicts a character adjusting their legwear.
boar: The wild boar, a relative of the common domesticated [[pig]] that usually has brown fur and small tusks. [[2007]] and [[2019]] are notable for being the [[year of the pig]] according to the [[Chinese zodiac]].
shiina yuika:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the now-dissolved [[Nijisanji Gamers]] and designed by [[Kamioka Shun'ya]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[white hair|white]] [[pink hair]], worn in a [[ponytail|long]], [[low ponytail]] and tied with a red [[hair ribbon|ribbon]].
chef:
A professional who [[cooking|cooks]] meals in a [[restaurant]] for a living. There are different ranks of chefs, such as the executive chef as the boss who runs the kitchen and designs the menu, the [i]sous chef[/i] who assists the executive, and the [i]chef de partie[/i], otherwise known as the line cook.

Their [[chef|uniform]] consists of a white or black [[double-breasted]] jacket, a [[chef hat]] for higher-ranking chefs and a [[pillbox hat]] for lower-ranking cooks, an [[apron]], black slacks, and heavy shoes.
soccer:
A team [[playing sports|sport]] played between two teams of eleven players using a [[soccer ball]]. The object of the game is to score by driving the [[ball]] into the opposing goal.

Soccer is formally called "Association football", but is more commonly known as "football" in most countries outside of the United States, Japan, Canada, and Australia.

The term "soccer" is of UK origin, being a shorthand for As[b]soc[/b]iation Football at Oxford University that has now long fallen out of use there.  It is a term in the same vein as "rugger" which refers to [b]Rug[/b]by Football.
leotard peek: When part of a [[leotard]] is visible underneath other clothes.
ichikawa hinana:
An idol of [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]] in the [[noctchill_(idolmaster)|]] unit.

She is easy-going and naturally talented, and a bit more sharp than she seems. An uninhibited girl who pushes forward towards her own "happiness". She is attached to her childhood friend and senior Tooru. First-year in high school.
heart ring: A [[ring]] with a [[heart]] ornament or design. For heart-shaped o-rings, see [[heart o-ring]].
doremy sweet:
[b]Ruler of Dreams[/b]

A [[Touhou]] character. Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[legacy_of_lunatic_kingdom|Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]], and later a playable character in [[antinomy_of_common_flowers|Antinomy of Common Flowers]].

She is a baku youkai and has the ability to create, change, and eat dreams. She is the watcher of the [[dream world_(touhou)|]].

She is depicted with [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pom-poms]] on her [[dress]], holding a [[book]] on her right arm and wearing a [[nightcap]]. She has [[short_hair|short]] [[blue_hair| blue hair]], [[blue_eyes|blue eyes]], and a [[tail]]. In Antinomy of Common Flowers she has a longer nightcap and [[long_hair|long hair]] hidden under it, as well as less pom-poms on her dress.

Her "Nightmare of Chimera" spellcard gives her a form that's been nicknamed [[doreking|Doreking]].
round-bottom flask: A type of laboratory [[flask]] with a spherical bottom and a cylindrical neck.
guard rail: A fixed and sturdy structure along roads to protect out-of-control vehicles.
diadem: A diadem is a type of crown, specifically an ornamental [[headband]] worn usually by women as a badge of royalty.
rhea (fire emblem):
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]. She is the archbishop of the Church of Seiros.

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[green hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

[spoilers]In truth, she is actually Saint [[Seiros_(fire_emblem)|]], and is also [[The Immaculate One]] in her true form.[/spoilers]
heart in mouth: A [[heart]] shape drawn in a character's mouth, usually on the tongue. Frequently paired with [[:D]].
loaded interior: Rooms or houses loaded with innumerable details and things at which to look. The outdoors equivalent is [[complex exterior]].
pokemon tail: Characters who either have a [[pokemon|Pokémon]] tail or wear it as a fashion accessory.
mejiro mcqueen (umamusume): Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. A lady from the prestigious Mejiro family, Mejiro McQueen is the resident [i]Ojou-sama[/i] character of the series. While she strives to be as prim and proper as she can, she has to deal with [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] antics as well as her own sweet tooth. While she was a supporting character in the first season of the anime, she became the deuteragonist for the second season, sharing the spotlight with [[Tokai Teio (umamusume)|]] and exploring the Mejiro family in more detail. In the mobile game, she is the main character as well as the first member of Team Sirius, after [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)|]] retired.
sleepwear: Catch-all tag for garments worn to sleep aside from [[pajamas]], [[jinbei (clothes)|]], [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[nightgown]]s, [[teddy (lingerie)|teddies]], and [[negligee]]s.
reindeer:
A species of [[deer]] native to arctic, tundra, and mountainous regions. Popularly associated with [[Christmas]] as [[Santa Claus]]' mode of transportation along with his [[sleigh]].  They're also the only species of deer where females normally have antlers.

Deer of this species native to North America are known by the name [i]caribou[/i].

[[Tony Tony Chopper]] from [[One Piece]] is a sentient reindeer.
hanged:
A method of [[execution]] or [[suicide]] utilizing a [[noose]] in which the subject is dangled by the neck until [[death|suffocation]], or is dropped so that the force of the noose going taut and stopping the fall breaks the subject's neck.

See [[suspension]] for the bondage posture, or [[hanging]] for non-bondage and non-lethal forms of suspension.

ryuzaki kaoru: An [i][[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Passion (Yellow Sun) category. voiced by Haruse Natsumi. With the age of 9 years old, she is one of three youngest Idols in the Cinderella Cast, along with [[Ichihara Nina]] and [[Yokoyama Chika]]. She is voiced by [[Haruse Natsumi]].
orange bra: Any style of [[bra]] or upper-body [[lingerie]] that's colored orange.
martial arts belt: A [[belt]] worn with [[martial arts]] outfits like [[dougi]].
sleeves pushed up:
When a character wears his or her clothes with both or one of its sleeves pushed or pulled up. This can be either to cool themselves off, to prevent the sleeves from getting dirty or wet or getting in the way of what they are doing, or simply due to the characters' taste in fashion. They also do this if they are preparing to deliver a blow to someone in a comical way or if they are getting ready for something difficult.

Do not confuse with [[sleeves rolled up]], in which cases the sleeves are carefully folded up the arm, not simply pushed up.

For [[pants]], see [[pants rolled up]].
very long sleeves:
Sleeves that extend well past a person's body. Closely related to [[sleeves past fingers]], except perhaps even more exaggerated.

Can be a result of [[oversized clothes]].
ado (utaite):

Her default avatar is [[Chando (ado)|]], with some of her songs' characters having their own names.

She provides the singing voice for [[Uta (one piece)|]] in [[One Piece Film: RED]].

She is the producer for [[Phantom Siita]].

invisible:
When a character is completely transparent and cannot be seen by either the viewer or another character. Their clothes may or may not be invisible as well.

arm wrap:
A strip of cloth wrapped around the arm, from the wrist to the elbow.

Wraps should not be confused with [[bandages]]. Wraps are used by fighters to protect themselves from injuries, as opposed to treating injuries.
undershirt:
A light typically collarless shirt or top made to be worn underneath other clothing, such as [[dress shirt]]s.  They're frequently plain and white. 

Men may wear "wifebeater" [[tank top]]-style sleeveless undershirts, especially to accentuate a blue-collar look.

When made for females, there may be some overlap with [[camisole]].  They may be worn in lieu of a [[bra]] by (typically younger) flat-chested girls with no need for supporting their breasts.

In terms of [[sportswear]], the term "undershirt" usually refers to a [[taut shirt]] worn under most clothing (a baseball uniform, for example).

This tag should [b]not[/b] be used for dress shirts.
false smile:
When a character is smiling on the outside, but their actions, situation or dialogue imply that they are anything but happy. This usually occurs during moments of shock, the bitter tension between enemies, or the proverbial calm before the storm just before they snap.

This tag is not for hysterical laughter, [[evil grin]]s, angry [[glaring|glares]], or [[yandere]].

katagiri sanae:
A 28 year old [[policewoman]] [[idol]] from [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]]. She has [[large breasts]] and [[brown hair]] usually in [[short twintails|short]], [[low twintails]]. 

Sanae is a former police officer who quit the force to become an idol, largely because the Producer convinced her. She is very flirtatious to the Producer and uses a lot of police terminology when talking. She wishes to be seen by other idols as an older sister and be called Onee-sama, despite the fact that she is shorter than idols who are half her age. Sanae has a black belt in Aikido, Judo, and Karate. She also tends to get upset if others mention that she is single, and is very easily susceptible to drinking to drown her sorrows.

She is in the upper tier for bust size, which is further enhanced because she's rather short. Her cards often reference that she wants to put the Producer in handcuffs, lock him up, and do an interrogation as a teasing double entendre.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Sanae is a former police officer. She sees herself as an older sister to her fellow idols and will go to great lengths to help promote this. She leads training lessons for [[Aino Nagisa]], [[Akanishi Erika]], [[Yagami Makino]], and [[Ohnishi Yuriko]]. While she finds it extremely difficult, Sanae continues to do so because she wants to be considered reliable. She puts other’s wants before hers, and can sometimes wind up looking like a fool because of it. She is nervous when it comes to [[Aihara Yukino]]’s high class tea and ceramics.

Sanae has a habit of getting drunk, and often drags other idols into it as well. She has found drinking buddies in [[Takagaki Kaede]], [[Hiiragi Shino]], [[Shinohara Rei]], and [[Hyodo Rena]] and made friends with [[Yanagi Kiyora]]. Sanae earned a movie role of an evil mahjong player, and in turn became one of [[Munakata Atsumi]]’s ogling victims. Her sense of style seems to mostly include extremely short dresses that show a lot of cleavage. She is said to be stunning in a bathing suit, although she has put on a child’s swimsuit in order to gain attention.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Tachibana Arisu]], [[Ichinose Shiki]], [[Shiomi Syuko]], and [[Sakurai Momoka]]. She is voiced by [[Waki Azumi]] [和氣 あず未].

yuujo:
Yuujo (遊女, lit. "women of pleasure"), were the [[prostitution|prostitutes]] of feudal era Japan. 

Yuujo are usually shown wearing a [[open kimono|kimono loosely hanging open]] or [[off shoulder|off their shoulders]] in order to expose their chest. Their hair tends toward extremes: either carefully sculpted shapes with the [[bangs pinned back|bangs pulled back]], or [[hair up|pinned up]] in an [[messy hair|artful mess]] (both of which are achieved through the use of several [[hair stick|hair sticks]] and [[kanzashi]]). Some form of makeup may be present, often [[eyeshadow]] or [[lipstick]]. Oftentimes, they are shown holding a [[kiseru]], an [[oil-paper umbrella]], or a rolled-up mat. Sometimes the [[obi]] will be tied in a bow on the front of their kimono, allegedly for "easy access". 

The most common depictions of yuujo are [[indoors]], [[on side|lying on their side]] in a state of seductive, carefully-arranged disarray, or waiting for clients at night on a [[bridge]] that crosses over a stream or a river.

There is a certain sub-type of yuujo, the [[oiran]], who despite also providing sexual services, were famed for being more cultured, educated, respectable, and skilled in providing classical entertainment and intelligent discourse.

lifebuoy:
A ring-shaped flotation device designed to be thrown to a person in the water to provide buoyancy and to prevent drowning. It differs from an [[innertube]] because it is often made of solid buoyant material (rather than being air-filled) and is colored to maximize visibility in the water. It also may have a provided line to pull the casualty holding onto it.

Note: The term "life buoy" is most common in British English. In American English these are better known as "life preservers".

murata himeko:
Murata Himeko is one of the main characters in the [[honkai_(series)|Honkai series]].

Himeko belongs to Saint Freya Houkai Fighting Strategy Unit, while also the Valkyrja Squad Fifth Platoon Commander-in-chief. Her rank is Lieutenant Commander. She is a good [[captain (honkai impact)|captain]] who is fully respected from her subordinates, able to perfectly carry out the strategy, deal calmly under any adverse circumstances.

The following year after her father’s death, she responded to call of the “Valkyrie Project” of the Houkai Fighting Strategy Unit Training Program. With her natural abilities and excellent understanding, she passed through many battles and became the existence called “Ishtar of the battlefield”. In addition with her calm deposit nature, precise judgment, superior leadership, she always emerges victorious in every one of her battles.

Due to not having the resistance against the Houkai energy at birth, Himeko was forced to have her body transplanted with artificial Stigmata developed by Shicksal, in their “Valkyrja” project,  a counter measure to fight against the Houkai. However, as the result of having her body remodeled, plus the side effects from the artificial Stigmata combined with the Houkai Energy taking a toll on her body, it has been declared that she only has one more year to live.

Current age as of Honkai Impact 3rd's start: 27.

rice hat:
A rice hat, also known as 'asian conical hat', is a cone shaped [[hat]] made of straw or matting traditionally worn by rice harvesters in several asian countries. It is kept in place by a [[chin strap]] or an internal headband. It can be dipped in water and worn as an impromptu evaporative cooling device.

Very similiar to [[ajirogasa]], a hat made of wicker or bamboo that is worn by priests, not farmers.

A variant made of metal, wood or hardened leather worn by soldiers and samurais is called [[jingasa]].

sylphiette (mushoku tensei):
A female character from the novel, manga and anime series [[Mushoku Tensei]]. A beloved childhood friend of [[Rudeus Greyrat]], [spoiler]later on known under the cover identity [b]Fitts/Fitz[/b] before eventually becoming Rudeus's [[polygamy|first]] wive. She is also the granddaughter of [[Elinalise Dragonroad]][/spoiler].

She is of mixed heritage (she has elven, human and beast race ancestors), and inherited [[pointy ears]] from the former. Her hair was initially [[green hair|green]] and short, but due to the ordeal following the Teleport Catastrophe, it became [[white hair|white]] (she also let her hair grow longer).

springfield (girls' frontline):
An android representing the [[M1903 Springfield]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with the [[sidelocks]] done in [[hair rings]] and the remainder in a [[ponytail]]. She has [[green eyes]], wears a blue [[blazer]] with a white sash and a [[white dress]]. Since the M1903 was developed in America and largely put into service during World War I, she is often depicted with the [[American flag]].

She's typically depicted as as having a housewife-esque attitude, preparing coffee for the Commander (running the base's café), making handmade chocolate during Valentines and baking muffins to eat together with the player/Commander. Appears in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]] as [[springfield (girls' frontline 2)|herself]].

She is voiced by [[Horie Yui]].
diluc (genshin impact):
A [[Genshin Impact]] character.

The current owner of the Dawn Winery, Diluc was once a member of the Knights of Favonius until a past tragedy has caused him to resign in the Knights' ranks. Despite this, he continues to protect Mondstadt as the mysterious rumored "[spoiler]Darknight Hero[/spoiler]".

bacon: A cut of [[meat]] taken from the sides, belly, or back of a [[pig]] (or any other animal), and then cured, smoked, or both. It is a popular breakfast protein, a topper in [[hamburger]]s and [[sandwich|sandwiches]], and wrapped around steaks or grilled vegetables.
son goku:
The main protagonist of the [[Dragon Ball]] series. He is married to [[Chi-Chi (dragon ball)|]] and has two sons named [[Son Gohan]] and [[Son Goten]].

Goku is a [[Saiyan]] born on planet Vegeta and raised on Earth. Capable of several different transformations including [[Kaiouken]], [[Super Saiyan]] [[Super Saiyan 1|1]], [[Super Saiyan 2|2]], [[Super Saiyan 3|3]], [[Super Saiyan 4|4]], [[Super Saiyan God]], [[Super Saiyan Blue]] and, ultimately, [[Ultra Instinct]].

His Saiyan name is "Kakarot", which is how [[Vegeta]] addresses him throughout the anime and manga. Some of his signature techniques are the [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]] and the [[Genki Dama]].

He is loosely based on [[Sun Wukong]] of the classical Chinese novel [i][[Journey to the West]][/i], whose name is translated as Son Goku in Japanese.

Goku's Japanese seiyuu is [[Nozawa Masako]], the current English dub voice actor is [[Sean Schemmel]] (though the character has gone through many different dub voice changes in the past), and his Latin American dub voice actor is Mario Castañeda.

In the early series, he possesses the [[ruyi jingu bang|Power Pole]] and the [[Flying Nimbus]].

black veil: A [[veil]] that is black. Often a [[funeral veil]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[brown hair]] in a [[high ponytail]] style held with a [[ribbon]].
haniwa (statue):
Terracotta clay sculptures buried with the dead as funerary objects during the proto-historic "Kofun period":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kofun_period in Japan. Various types of haniwa were created, ~ soldier, [[horse]], [[dog]] and other [[animal]]s.
The haniwa soldiers wear ancient-style body armors, tentatively called "tankou":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%AD%E7%94%B2] (lit. short armor) or "keikou":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%8C%82%E7%94%B2] (lamellar armor) by historians. They are not counted as [[Japanese armor]].

[[Hanny]], one of the [[monster]] tribes in the [[Alicesoft]] games are modeled on these haniwa figures.

They appear in [[Animal Crossing]] as [[gyroid (animal crossing)|]]s.

In [[Blue Archive]], haniwa exist as skill level up materials. Strangely, they're bright pink and resemble a sex toy.
shoukaku (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Shoukaku[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]] with a [[hairband]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] attire comprising a [[white kimono]] top, [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudder and propeller]] gear, and a black [[muneate]] with her identifier "Shi" marked on it. 

Her [[rigging]] is an archery-based setup comprising her [[flight deck]] to her right arm, [[brown gloves|brown]] [[yugake]], multiple [[anti-aircraft gun]] placements on her waist and thigh boots, and a [[quiver]] to her back. 

She is generally depicted as a calm, gentle, and polite woman. This references her career in which she was often damaged in battle and frequently sent back home for repairs, which can be interpreted as her staying at home for "housekeeping".

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Aircraft Carrier Water Oni]].

justice task force member (blue archive):
A nameless female mob unit in [[Blue Archive]] who serves as a part of Trinity General School's [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]]. Despite her lack of distinctive characteristics she's managed to garner quite a following. For short she may be called 正実モブ ([i]Seiji Mobu[/i], "JTF Mob") or affectionately as モブちゃん ([i]Mob-chan[/i]).

The named members of the [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]] (with the exception of [[Koharu (blue archive)|]]) all share certain character design elements in common with Mob-chan. [[Ichika (blue archive)|]] is particularly close to them, both in terms of appearance and being most likely to interact directly with them. This has lead to a common joke that Mob-chan represents a "base form" that the other members have "evolved" from. As of Ichika's recent release, these mobs have [[red eyes]].

Carries either an [[EM-2]] or an [[L85]]-style [[assault rifle]].

anastasia (idolmaster):
Anastasia is a character for the mobile game [[idolmaster_cinderella_girls|IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]].

She is half Russian, half Japanese. As being half Russian, she usually speaks/mixes some Russian in her sentences. 

Due to her popularity, she was ranked second place in the 2013 Cinderella Girl election and was given a spot on THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA MASTER Kagayaku Sekai no Mahou, along with [[Kanzaki Ranko]], [[Takagaki Kaede]], [[Koshimizu Sachiko]], and [[Shibuya Rin]]. Soon after, she was selected for the fifth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Shirasaka Koume]], [[Ogata Chieri]], [[Sakuma Mayu]], and [[Takamori Aiko]]. Her seiyuu is [[Uesaka Sumire]].

In the anime she is in the unit LOVE LAIKA with [[Nitta Minami]]. Later on, [[Kanzaki Ranko]] temporarily replaces Minami in the unit.
easter:
Easter, also called Pascha (Greek/Latin) or Resurrection Sunday, is a festival and holiday celebrating the resurrection of [[Jesus]] from the dead. In Christian faith, Jesus died [[crucifixion|on the cross]] on Good Friday and was buried. On Easter Sunday, He revived and returned to Heaven to be with the Almighty Father.

Informally, Easter is celebrated with imagery of the [[Easter Bunny]], who is purported to leave decorated baskets of candy and chocolates for children. [[Easter egg]]s are painted and hidden throughout a location for children to find as a festive activity. Since Easter frequently occurs in either March or April, it also uses images and colors related to the season of spring.
tanaka mamimi:

A Japanese [[dessert]] consisting of shaved ice in a cup, flavored with syrup and a sweetener (often condensed milk), and eaten with a spoon.

Japanese shaved ice stands usually have a flag with the kanji "ice" on it called [[kooribata]].

Shaved ice with [[matcha (food)|]] syrup is called [[ujikintoki]].

winry rockbell:
A character from [[Fullmetal Alchemist]].

An automail mechanic, and childhood friend of [[Edward Elric|Edward]] and [[Alphonse Elric|Alphonse]]. Often seen wearing a white shirt and black skirt, or a mechanics uniform. Constantly berates Ed for abusing her work, leading her to beat him with a wrench.
kise yayoi: The blonde-haired girl in [[Smile Precure!]] who is a bit of a crybaby but is an overachiever and loves drawing manga. She transforms into [[Cure Peace]].
lelouch vi britannia:
The main protagonist of [[Code Geass]], also known by his civilian alias [b]Lelouch Lamperouge[/b].

A former heir of the oppressive Britannian Empire, who take refuge to Area 11 (the Britannian-occupied Japan) after falling out of favor. After his encounter with mysterious [[C.C.]]. Lelouch gained a supernatural power known as [[Geass]], which is capable of [[mind control|controlling anyone who look into his eye to do whatever he wishes]]. He later assumed the persona of [[Zero_(code_geass)|]] to hides his identity as he leads the resistance Black Knights on a quest to defeat the Britannian Empire and liberate the world.
snail: A mollusk with a spiral shell into which the whole body can be withdrawn. If the snail is seen without its shell, it's called a [[slug]]. When made into food, they’re called [[escargot]].

[spoiler]In episode 6, it is revealed that Akane is the creator of the city and uses the kaiju to shape it to her liking by killing off anyone she doesn't like

A variation of [[side ponytail]], similar to [[short ponytail]], where the gathered hair is notably shorter than normal. Usually stops halfway between the top of the head and the chin.

Not to be confused with [[one side up]], which also has hair tied on the side but it lets some hair fall loosely. In a [[side ponytail]] the majority of one's hair—save for [[sidelocks]]—is pulled up into a ponytail that leaves [b]no[/b] hair falling loosely.

voile:
The fanon name for the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]'s [[library]] in [[Touhou]].

The stage 4 theme music of [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] is named ヴワル魔法図書館 ([i]Vuwaru Mahou Toshokan[/i], lit. "Voile, the Magic Library"). Based on this, some of the English-speaking fandom originally believed Voile to be the name of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]'s library. However, this is not canon and [[ZUN]] has consistently referred to this library as "Scarlet Devil Mansion's Library" or "The Magic Library" in official works without any mention of "Voile". See also topic #9233.

The library is tended to by [[Patchouli Knowledge]], a large squad of [[fairy maid (touhou)|fairy maids]], and, allegedly, [[Koakuma]]. [[Kirisame Marisa]] frequently breaks in to "borrow" (read: steal) books, but occasionally will sit peacefully with Patchouli.

The library is often depicted as a massive tesseract (larger on the inside) or even a pocket dimension attached to the mansion.
peroro (blue archive): A penguin mascot from in-universe Momo Friends franchise that is seen in [[Blue Archive]]. It's [[Hifumi (blue archive)|]]'s trademark item. Sometimes can be seen wearing a [[ninja]] outfit as well. The character is likely a reference to the South Korean children's program [[pororo_the_little_penguin|Pororo the Little Penguin]].
body blush: Blushing of body parts other than the face due to embarrassment, heat, or otherwise.
chemise:
A chemise is essentially a [[camisole|camisole]] that ends past the waist. Usually worn as an undergarment.

In modern usage, a chemise is generally a woman's garment that vaguely resembles the older shirts but is typically more delicate, and usually provocative. Most commonly the term refers to a loose-fitting, sleeveless undergarment or type of [[lingerie]] which is unfitted at the waist. It can also refer to a short, sleeveless dress that hangs straight from the shoulders and fits loosely at the waist. A chemise typically does not have any buttons or other fasteners and is put on by either dropping it over the head or stepping into it and lifting it up. Its usually on the plainer side, being worn under clothes to smoothe the silhouette. 

As lingerie, a chemise is similar to a [[babydoll]], which is also a short, loose-fitting, sleeveless garment. Typically, though, babydolls are more loose-fitting at the hips and are generally designed to more resemble a young girl's [[nightgown]], although many modern styles have added various sexualizing features. Babydolls also have an [[empire waist]], which chemises do not.

adidas:
A major German [[sportswear|sports apparel]] manufacturer. Besides sports [[shoes|footwear]], the company also produces other products such as bags, shirts, and other sports and clothing related goods. The company is the largest sportswear manufacturer in Europe and the second largest sportswear manufacturer in the world.

The company's clothing and shoe designs typically feature three parallel bars.

Sub-brands of Adidas include [[Yeezy (brand)|]] and [[Y-3 (brand)|]].
paint splatter on face: When a character has [[paint]] spattered or smeared on their face. Not to be confused with [[facepaint]], which is for symbols or marks intentionally painted on a character's face.
master sword:
The Master Sword, also known as the "Blade of Evil's Bane" is [[Link]]'s iconic weapon in [[The Legend of Zelda]] series. It was forged by the Ancient Sages to vanquish beings of evil who would use the [[Triforce]] to wicked ends, and can only be wielded by those who are pure of heart and strong of body.

The Master Sword is a double-edged longsword with no fuller (central blade groove), and either a purple, gold or blue hilt, depending on the game. The hilt has a noticeably large cross-guard in relation to the pommel, and interestingly, it is somewhat reminiscent to the seal of the royal family. The blade has a large ricasso (unsharpened blade portion near the hilt suitable for a second grip), although Link is never portrayed using it in any of the games. Engraved on the blade is the Triforce, and embedded in the cross-guard is what appears to be a yellow gemstone.
karaoke:
A form of entertainment done by amateur [[singing|singers]] who sing along to pre-recorded instrumental versions of popular songs with the lyrics displayed on a video screen and timed by moving animation.

Etymology: Japanese "clipped compound word":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clipped_compound] meaning "empty orchestra".
excalibur morgan (fate): A black and red version of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]] used by [[Saber Alter]].

bibi (tokoyami towa):
""[i]Konyappi! How are my favorite Tokoyami Kenzoku doing?🌟 I'll unleash Bibi onto you if you don't watch this![/i]":[https://twitter.com/hololive_En/status/1250361032175804417]"
-[[Tokoyami Towa]], 2020

Bibi seems to be both the name of the character and the name of the species, and they can take the form of a [[hat]], as well as a [[multiple legs|four-legged]] bean-shaped [[creature]] with multicolored neon [[claws]] and a [[demon tail]]. Alongside Towa herself, Bibi's character design can be credited to [[rurudo]].
glock:
Series of polymer-framed, [b][[handgun|]]s[/b] manufactured by Austrian company Glock GmbH, designed by engineer "Gaston Glock.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaston_Glock Available in various models with different sizes and calibres, the very first one is the 9×19mm Glock 17 with standard 17-round magazine. The [[gun]] is very recognizable for its boxy rectangular slide, angled grip and lack of external hammer. 

Since all Glock models have [b]identical[/b] appearance despite of specific size difference, this tag applies for any models. This includes the select fire Glock 18C.
flower over eye:
When one of the character's eyes is covered by a [[flower]].

This tag is for flowers that appear to stay in place on its own. Do not use this tag when the flower is clearly attached to a string or fabric or otherwise supported, use [[flower eyepatch]] instead.
spoken x: When the letter X is seen in a [[speech bubble]]. It can be by itself, or crossing out something that the character doesn't like, or as a way of saying "no" in a [[silent comic]].
gae bolg (fate):
[b]Barbed Spear that Pierces with Death[/b]

[[Cu chulainn (fate/stay night)|]]'s main weapon in the [[Fate (series)|]] series. A long red [[spear]] with an ability to guide itself into piecing the target's heart when commanded.

striped kimono: A [[kimono]] that is [[striped]]. This includes other kimono-styled tops such as [[yukata]]s and [[furisode]]s.
hands on hilt:
A pose typically adopted by knights or other regal figures, with their hands resting on the pommel of a [[sword]] or other [[weapon]].

Use [[hand on hilt]] when only one hand is resting on the pommel.
triangle:
Any shape that is formed using three straight lines.

For the musical instrument, use [[triangle_(instrument)]].
For the drafting or drawing instrument, use [[set_square]].
orange theme: An image where orange is the dominant color. For example, a [[monochrome]] image that is orange, or an image with an overall orange color theme.
band uniform: A uniform worn by members of a group of musicians. The outfits are embellished in bright colors, and a [[shako cap]] is a huge staple of the uniform. Women wear short pleated skirts.
smokestack:
An upright funnel for discharging [[smoke]] from a [[locomotive]], [[ship]], [[factory]], and such, and helping to induce a draft.

For those found in houses or common buildings, use [[chimney]] instead.
holding tail:
For characters who are holding their own tail, use [[holding own tail]].
For characters who are holding someone else's tail, use [[holding another's tail]].
For a tail holding something, see [[holding with tail]].
art nouveau:
An art movement popular during the late 19th and early 20th century that combined fine art, graphic and industrial design. Although Art Nouveau was not a single style, Le Style Mucha (The style of (Alphonse) Mucha), as characterized by bold lines, flat, rich colors, flowing curves and ornate circular patterns is often considered the quintessential style of the movement.

The German version of Art Nouveau goes by "Jugend", german for "youth". In Sweden this is also the predominant term. Art Nouveau differs in style from country to country.
hat belt: A [[belt]] that is worn on a [[hat]] as a [[hat ornament]].
dotted line:
A continuous line that is broken up into smaller dots or dashes.

Sometimes used to mark a [[cut-here line]].
utage (arknights):
[i]Utage, Guard Operator, is standing around on the front lines lazily.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].
honeycomb background: A background comprising of [[hexagon|hexagons]] lined up together to resemble a [[honeycomb (pattern)|honeycomb pattern]].

The final member of the [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]]-led [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]], appearing after circumstances prevent M4 from leading the team for a time. Would receive a [[RO635 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

purah:
Character in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild]][/i]. A Sheikah researcher and [[Impa]]'s elder sister. Despite being over a century old, she appears as a 6-year-old child due to an age-reversing experiment.

In the prequel [i][[Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Calamity]][/i], she is (apparently and actually) in her 20s.

In the sequel [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom]][/i], she again appears to be in her 20s like in [i]Age of Calamity[/i], but with a different outfit.
mash kyrielight (dangerous beast) (cospl: Originally an [[Fate/Grand Order|F/GO]] [[mash kyrielight (dangerous beast)|Craft Essence]] released during Halloween showing [[Mash Kyrielight]] in skimpy, wolf-inspired, [[revealing clothes]] with a [[fur trim]]. The outfit immediately caught on inspiring artists to draw other Fate characters in the costume and official merchandise like figures to be made of Mash replicating the card art. bindi:
A [[forehead mark]] that consists of a colored dot (or sticker) worn on the center of the forehead. It is worn by Hindus, Jains and Buddhists from the Indian subcontinent. The mark is always applied close to the eyebrows or in the middle of the forehead 

Note that China historically had a mark similar to the bindi, called the cinnabar mole (朱砂痣, zhushazhi) or the dot cinnabar (点丹 diandan). The cinnabar it was made from gave it the red pigment, but was highly toxic. It was used as a status symbol, with links to [[taoism]].

Use [[forehead mark]] or [[circle facial mark]] instead if the image has no correlation with [[Hinduism]], [[Buddhism]] or [[Jainism]].
cleavage reach: Reaching into a woman's [[cleavage]], as if to find an object inside. This includes women reaching into their own cleavage.

She has [[short_h

As they are commonly mistaken for [[orc]] due to naming similarity and similar characteristics, later depiction of ogres usually have a [[colored skin]] (typically brown or red, similar to [[oni]], albeit some artist is still using green skin, however), a [[horns|horn]](s), as well as usually being [[fat]] instead of [[muscular]].

frottage:

If it's a humanoid Pokemon, then it's also [[interspecies]]. If it's an animal-like Pokemon, then it's also [[bestiality]].

turnaround:
A character, often [[full body]], viewed form the same angle with different degrees of rotation while keeping the same pose and outfit. A technique commonly used on [[reference sheet]]s to demonstrate a character's entire design. This varies from a simple [[straight-on|front]] (0º) and [[from behind|back]] (180º) view to supplemental in-between angles such as the [[from side|side]] (90º) and 45º views.

For characters literally turning around for uses other than display, use [[turning around]]
cum in panties: For use when [[cum]] is inside of panties and when panties are covering cum.

Feathered headdress in the style generally worn by Native Americans of the Great Plains, such as the Cheyenne and Sioux. The more ornate ones are also called "war bonnets".

Generally consists of multiple feathers (eagle ones, usually) attached to the top edge of a leather 'headband'.

[b]True Name:[/b] Hassan-i-Sabbah, specifically Hassan of Serenity

flying kick: An execution of a [[kicking|kick]] while one is still in the air.
ump9 (girls' frontline):
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP9]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

UMP9 has orange hair worn in twintails, and wears an outfit similar to [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]] consisting of a [[white shirt]], a [[jacket]], [[black pantyhose]]. She has orange eyes and has a [[scar across eye|scar on the right eye]], in the opposite side of UMP45.

UMP9 is the most cheerful of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]] and is particularly attached to the idea of family. UMP9 is considered UMP45's little sister, and trusts UMP45 very much. Would receive a [[UMP9 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

flying fish:
Ambiguous tag, currently being used for: 

* [[Fish]] that appear to be in flight, i.e., the scene is not [[underwater]] but the fish are depicted as if swimming.
* A family of [[fish]] with enlarged pectoral fins that enable them to glide for short distances above [[water]].
matikanefukukitaru (umamusume):
Character from [[Umamusume]].

The fortune-telling horse girl with a really long name (and meant to be read as [i]Machikane Fukukitaru[/i]), Matikanefukukitaru is obsessed about fortune and luck and collects a wild range of lucky charms. The other horse girls (and humans at times) often consult her with their luck as well. She often refers to a "Shiraoki-sama" as if they were a shinto deity (and indeed, a horse named Shiraoki is the RL horse's 5th generation mare line ancestor).

Her name, when read as a whole, roughly means "Good fortune comes to those who wait".

Her real life counterpart also has the same long name. This is originally intended to be "Machikane Fukukitaru", but later shortened to "Matikanefukukitaru" because of a maximum 18 letter limit on the international rules for racehorse names. Here, Machikane/Matikane is a [i]kanmei[/i] and many of the owner's horses have limit-filling names like these (See [[Matikane Tannhauser (Umamusume)|]] as well).
yamada anna: Character from [[Boku no Kokoro no Yabai Yatsu]].
kamado tanjirou:
Main character from [[Kimetsu no Yaiba]].
He is a Demon Slayer in the Demon Slayer Corps, who joined to find a remedy to turn his sister,  [[Kamado Nezuko]], back into a human and to hunt down and kill demons, and later swore to defeat [[Kibutsuji Muzan]], the King of Demons, in order to prevent others from suffering the same fate as him.

Before he became a Demon Slayer, Tanjiro was a coal burner before his entire family was slaughtered by Muzan while his younger sister, Nezuko, was turned into a demon.

He has ruffled, [[black hair]] with burgundy tips, combed back to expose his forehead, and wide, dark [[red eyes]] with [[white pupils]] that appear lighter around the lower section of his irises.

Tanjiro first appears wearing a checkered, black and sea foam green [[haori]] over a white robe and black pants. He occasionally sports a [[turquoise scarf]] and is seen with circular, [[white bands]] looped around his calves. He also wears a distinct pair of [[hanafuda earrings]], with the image of the rising sun over a mountain.

During the Final Selection, Tanjiro wears a blue, cloud-patterned samue-styled [[kimono]] and [[black pants]], nearly identical to Sakonji's outfit. He still wears his [[hanafuda earrings]], but his hair is cut extremely short and remains the same length since. Similar to the rest of the apprentices that were trained under Sakonji, Tanjiro wears a hand-carved [[fox mask]] crafted from his master on the left side of his head. The mask has red accents on the eyes, ears, and spots on each corner of its mouth. On the upper right corner of the mask, there is a sun-shaped design that likely symbolizes the scar on his forehead.

After becoming a Demon Slayer, Tanjiro wears the standard [[Demon Slayer uniform]], a dark-brown gakuran jacket, a white belt, baggy chocho zubon pants that extend into tabi socks, a pair of zōri with red straps, and bands of white cloth wrapped tightly around his calves resembling kyahan, all beneath his signature [[checkered haori]]. He carries a large [[wooden box]] on his back (which was a gift to him from [[Urokodaki Sakonji]]), where his sister sleeps as they travel during the day.

[spoiler]After being turned into a [[demon]] by [[Kibutsuji Muzan]], Tanjiro is able to heal the growth on his face as well as regenerate his lost arm and other smaller injuries. He obtains eyes with [[slit pupils]], fangs and flame-shaped marks over his left forehead and right jaw that are reminiscent of those of [[Kokushibou]], in addition to a third, smaller flame-shaped mark coming down from the right side of his head down to his eyebrow after he conquered the weakness to sunlight. His scar turns into a flame-pattern as if it were a permanent Demon Slayer Mark, has become longer and is the largest of the three, and all three marks vaguely point towards his nose, though only his scar-mark reaches it. He still dons his bloodstained corps uniform, one sleeve ripped off where his arm was severed, but loses his checkered haori and the Nichirin Sword at his hip.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]After returning to his human form, Tanjiro loses the ability to see from his right eye, the iris of which is now a dull pink-gray color and the pupil black rather than its original white. His left arm, which he regrew as a [[Demon]], now takes the appearance of that which an older person may have, becoming wrinkled and skeletal, and he loses all feeling in it below the elbow and thus the ability to move it from his forearm down.[/spoiler]
turtle:
[b]Turtles[/b] are reptiles famed for their slow pace, longevity and [[shell]]s. Most turtles are able to retract into their shells for protection.

Turtles are occasionally depicted as [[oversized animal|massive]] in size, sometimes [[island turtle|large enough]] to carry [[city|cities]], or even worlds.
no wings:
Use this tag when a winged character is depicted without wings. This can be an [[artistic error]] (e.g. a character is drawn with wings in all but one panel of a comic) or a stylistic choice by the artist. 

When a winged character tries to hide the wings, but you still catch a glimpse of them use [[wings_hidden]].
market: An area or arena in which commercial dealings are conducted. Sellers manage stands that sell a range of items from which customers can pick and choose, then pay afterwards.
puffy shorts: A pair of [[shorts]] that are puffier than usual.
alhaitham (genshin impact):
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]]. A member of the Sumeru Akademiya's Haravatat who is known as the "Scribe". 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[antenna hair|two ahoge]], and [[green eyes]]. His outfit consists of a golden [[headpiece]] covering his ears, [[black shirt|black]] [[compression shirt]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[long sleeves]], [[black cape|black]]-[[green cape|green]] [[shoulder cape]], [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], [[black pants]], and [[knee boots|knee-length]] [[black boots]]. 

His localized name has a spelling mistake, where it should be written as either Al Haitham or Al-Haitham, with "Al" being translated as "The", which is comparable to writing [[Signora (genshin impact)|La Signora]] as "Lasignora" or [[Statue of The Seven]] as "Statue of Theseven".
white veil: A [[veil]] that is white. Not to be confused with [[bridal veil]], which should always be used in the context of a bride, marriage, or wedding dress.
open skirt: A [[skirt]] that is [[unbuttoned]] or [[unzipped]] on the side. Often the wearer is [[undressing]] or the skirt is otherwise [[skirt pull|pulled down]].
food-themed earrings: Umbrella tag for a pair of [[earrings]] that looks like [b]any[/b] kind of [[food]] item. While there are many existing tags implicated to this one, it is not feasible nor necessary to create specific food-item earring tags if they don't exist. Use this tag instead to cover those instead.
trumpet: A brass musical [[instrument]] which is played by means of three piston or rotary valves. It has an oblong-shaped tubular body and a flared bell.
ribbon-trimmed clothes:
Clothing that is [[ribbon trim|trimmed with a ribbon]].

There are existing tags for articles of clothing that have [[ribbon trim]]s. Please use the appropriate tag when this is the case.

h1. Examples

* [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves]]
* [[ribbon-trimmed legwear]]
* [[ribbon-trimmed dress]]

condensation:
Small drops of [[water]] that accumulate on surfaces colder than the surrounding air, such as on cold [[drinking_glass|drinking glasses]]. [[dew drop|Dew]] is a form of condensation usually found mornings after objects drop in temperature overnight. In freezing temperatures, condensation may take the form of [[frost]].

Condensation on glass surfaces such as [[window|windows]] and [[mirror|mirrors]] may produce a [[window fog]] effect (post #1579162). See the [[glass writing]] tag for text and
pinching: A character squeezing a body part with their thumb and another finger, usually targeting the cheeks, nose, or stomach.
foam: A cluster of minute bubbles shown coming from someone's mouth, poured beverages with head such as beer or root beer, et cetera. For bubbles produced while using soap products during bathing, see [[soap_bubbles|soap bubbles]].
dessert:
Sugary sweet [[food]]s offered at the end of a [[meal]]. Usually topped with [[ice cream]], [[whipped cream]], or a [[fruit]].

Not to be confused with a barren and desolate, usually-[[sand]]y environment known as the [[desert]].
roy mustang: Known as the "Flame Alchemist", and is Ed's superior. A strong leader, he aspires to overthrow the Fuhrer and steer the country into a more peaceful direction.
ace of spades: A [[playing card]] depicting a single [[spade_(shape)|spade]] symbol. Normally has a very ornate design compared to the rest of the simple "pip" (number) cards in the deck.
snorkel: The combination of [[diving mask]] or [[goggles]] with a breathing tube, used for shallow underwater observation.
hooded cape: A [[cape]] with a [[hood]] attached to it.
fusuma: [b]Fusuma[/b] is a type of sliding panel in traditional [[east asian architecture|Japanese architecture]]. Unlike [[shouji]], they are fully opaque and do not have a visible wooden lattice. They usually have a circular handle, and can be either plain or decorated with [[tag group:image composition|traditional Japanese imagery and patterns.]]
through clothes:
Images depicting sexual acts through articles of clothing.

Not to be confused with [[clothed sex]].
streamers: Streamers are thin strips of paper in various sizes thrown at parties and celebrations. Larger streamers are usually hung as decorations, while [[party popper|party poppers]] often contain very small streamers.
light machine gun:
A type of [[machine gun]] designed to be operated by a single person, with or without an assistant.

Early LMG designs were typically [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]-fed and they fire full-powered [[rifle cartridge]], such as the .303 British [[Bren lmg|Bren]]. Modern post-[[World War II]] designs fire intermediate [[ammunition|round]], and they can be either [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] or magazine-fed (e.g. the 5.56×45mm NATO [[M249 saw]]). They are also known as the [i]squad automatic weapon[/i].

Some LMGs are based on the existing service [[assault rifle|(assault) rifle]], such as the [[RPK]].
white serafuku: A [[serafuku]] that has both its [[shirt]] and [[skirt]] colored white. The [[neckerchief]] and [[sailor collar]] do not count towards this tag.
panda: A black-and-white bearlike species native to [[China]]. Easily recognizable by the patches of black around the eyes, over the ears, and across the body.
finger heart: A popular hand gesture among [[k-pop]] idols used as a more subtle substitute for [[heart hands]]. The index finger typically crosses the thumb in a v pattern, forming a heart-like shape where the two fingers meet. Only one hand is used for this gesture; if two hands are used then it is likely [[heart hands]] instead.
spaghetti: A type of [[pasta]] shaped like long circular strands when cooked. Arguably the most well-known kind of pasta in the world.
pochita (chainsaw man):
A character in [[Chainsaw Man]]. Pochita is the [[Chainsaw Devil]] who embodies the fear of [[chainsaw]]s. He was the original Chainsaw Man (チェンソーマン, Chensō Man) prior to becoming [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s heart and the source of his transformation power.

He is a small, orange dog-like creature depicted in a cartoonish appearance. His distinctive appearance consist of a [[chainsaw]] blade sticking out of his head and a rip cord for a tail.
facing another:
Someone is facing someone else with the eyes closed.

If someone is [i]looking[/i] at someone else (in other words, with the eyes open), use [[looking at another]].
inverted bob: A type of [[bob cut]] that features a short back and long front. The hair must gradually increase in length as it goes to the front.
dumpling:
A dish that consists of small pieces of cooked [[dough]], often wrapped around a filling. Dumplings may be prepared using a variety of cooking methods and are found in many world cuisines.

Dumplings may be savory or sweet and can be eaten by themselves, with [[gravy]] or [[sauce]], or in [[soup]]s or [[stew]]s.

dirndl:
A dirndl is a type of traditional [[dress]] worn in Bavaria, Liechtenstein, Austria and South Tyrol, based on the historical costume of Alpine peasants. An iconic outfit for female [[beer]] [[waitress|servers]] during [[Oktoberfest]].

A dirndl consists of a [[bodice]] and [[skirt]] or a [[pinafore dress]], a low-cut [[blouse]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], and a [[waist apron]].

The position of the [[apron]] [[bow]] can indicate a woman's marital status:

* Bow on left: [b]Single[/b]
* Bow on right: [b]Married[/b]
* Bow in middle: [b]Virgin[/b]
* Bow in back: [b]Widow[/b] [i](or waitress)[/i]
hands on another's cheeks:
When [b]both[/b] of one character's hands are on someone else's cheeks. 

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on another's cheek]].
inkwell: A small container holding ink, into which a [[pen]] can be dipped.
old woman:
A woman who is [[old]], typically more than 50 to 60 years old. Common signs include [[grey hair]] and [[wrinkled skin]].

See [[aged up]] for when a female character is drawn older than her normal age.

Use with [[mature female]] if drawn attractively.
oxygen mask: A [[mask]] used to transfer breathing oxygen gas from a storage tank to the lungs. This tag is also used for anesthesia masks.
on head:
A character, creature, or other living thing atop someone's head.

This tag is for animate creatures. See [[object on head]] for non-living things atop someone's head.
handkerchief:
A small piece of fabric used for personal hygiene such as [[wiping]] one's face or [[blowing nose|blowing one's nose]].

See [[pocket square]] for a handkerchief worn in the breast pocket of a [[suit jacket]].

fingersmile:
Pushing up one or both sides of one's [b]own mouth[/b] with fingers to form a smile.  Frequently associated with [[Yin (darker than black)|]] from [[Darker Than Black]] and [[Marnie (pokemon)|]] from [[Pokemon]].

If the fingersmile is applied to other, it should be [[forced smile]]. If the smile is not formed by fingers, and the fingers are simply placed on face, it should be [[fingers to cheeks]].
camilla (fire emblem):
[b]Camilla[/b] (カミラ Kamira) is a playable character in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

The eldest princess of the Nohrian royal family, Camilla carries herself with maturity and elegance on the onset but treats her family with unrivalled care and affection. She is ruthless on the battlefield, destroying her enemies with wild abandon. Along with the other royal siblings, she was subject to the family's "concubine wars" at a young age. She bathes the longest out of anyone in the army, and her birthday is on November 30th.

Camilla has [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair over one eye|one bang covering her left eye]], [[purple eyes]], full [[lips]], [[large breasts]], and well-shaped [[thighs]]. She dons [[black armor|black]] [[armor]] shaped like a [[bodice]] that exposes her [[cleavage]] and [[groin]], also showing off her [[black panties|black]] [[panties]] and leaving her [[ass]] visible (post #2147528 for an official example). She also wears [[armored boots|armored]] [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh-length]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[boots]] and a [[tiara]]. Camilla is often portrayed riding her [[undead]] [[wyvern]] and wielding a [[battle axe]].

She is voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] in Japanese. "Paula Tiso":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Tiso voices her in English [i][[Fire Emblem Fates|Fates]][/i], and "Misty Lee":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misty_Lee voices her in English [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] and [[Fire Emblem Warriors]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Revenant Knight (Malig Knight)
flower necklace: A [[necklace]] made from [[flower|flowers]] or having flowers in its design.
curtsey:
A traditional Western method of [[bowing]], usually performed by women, involving slight flexion of the knees, often in conjunction with a [[skirt hold]].

Note that a curtsey is often [i]accompanied[/i] by a skirt hold, [i]not[/i] a skirt hold itself. Don't use this tag on skirt hold posts if there's no bowing involved, even if the character has [[crossed legs]]/[[crossed ankles|ankles]] or wears a [[gown]]. That's not a curtsey.
painting (action): When a character is engaged in the activity of painting.
birthday:
Celebrating the anniversary of the day someone was born.
In addition to birthday [[party|parties]], it is common for people to receive [[gift]]s. There is also [[cake]] to eat at the gathering.

A starchy tuber vegetable that grows in the ground. It is commonly made into [[mashed potatoes]], [[chips (food)|]], and [[french fries]].

Use this tag for the food. For the dog from [[Air (visual novel)|]], see [[Potato (Air)]]
dwarf:
A fantasy race of short, stocky humanoids. Classically depicted as resembling tiny old men, generally bearded. They are commonly associated with metalwork and mining.

Only apply this tag if the character depicted features the defining characteristics of a dwarf, such as significantly short stature (typically around child's height), bulky build relative to the height, etc.
ichinose shiki:
An [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cute category.

Shiki is a curious 18 y.o. girl who can be described only as "a mad scientist". She loves experiments, and is motivated by finding new things to hold her attention; if it's not interesting, she's not interested. Rather than being scouted by Producer, she chose him as part of one of her experiments. She sniffed the Producer and his smell convinced her that he was the right one for the experiment. She became an idol for this reason.

It's implied she uses pheromones to attract fans, and even in idol form, her hair looks messy and uncombed.

In the 11th Magic Hour SP, she revealed that she went to an American university before being an idol, but she got bored of it and returned to Japan. She attends a Japanese high school and lives on her own. She likes tabasco sauce and her forte is chemistry, but she dislikes wasabi and waking up early.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Shiki is introduced by [[Yanagi Kiyora]]. Her sniffing habits show up as early as her first line and her “Nyahaha” laugh appeared soon after. She seems to be friends with [[Sagisawa Fumika]] and [[Jougasaki Mika]], who both also know of her nose. Her smelling often causes her to fall asleep and she highly regards the Producer’s jacket as a source of soothing smells. Shiki got a job as a background character in a Wild West film.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th set of CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Tachibana Arisu]], [[Shiomi Syuko]], [[Katagiri Sanae]], and [[Sakurai Momoka]]. She is voiced by [[Aihara Kotomi]] [藍原 ことみ].
pyramid (geometry):
A geometric object with lateral faces in the shape of a triangle. Commonly depicted with a square base and has four lateral faces. One with three faces is a [[tetrahedron]]. With a single curved face, it is a [[cone (geometry)]].

For the monumental structures shaped like a pyramid, see [[pyramid (structure)]].
gag around neck: A [[gag]] of any kind is hanging around the wearer's [[neck]] instead of it [[gagged|being placed in their mouth]].
