ikazuchi (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ikazuchi[/i]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a [[hairclip]]s on her left, [[brown eyes]], and a [[fang]]. Her default outfit is the Special-Type's [[serafuku]] ([[white shirt]], [[black sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]]), but with the addition of a "III" pin unique to the [i]Akatsuki[/i]-class. The "III" is on the right side of her collar.

An excitable girl, she is often shown with her sister ship [[Inazuma (kancolle)|]]. The two are extremely similar in appearance; having been laid down on the same day they are depicted as [[twins]]. She is also often depicted as very doting to the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]], many a times spoiling them beyond help (her Pixiv nicknames "Loli-Okan" and "Useless Admiral Maker" refer to this side of her). Sometimes depicted as being clingy, to the point of being [[yandere]], leading to the nickname "Black Thunder" among the fandom.

oyama mahiro:
Protagonist of [[Onii-chan wa Oshimai!]]. He wakes up one morning to find he was [[genderswap_(mtf)|transformed into a girl]] when his little sister [[Oyama Mihari|Mihari]] drugged him the night before.

haniyasushin keiki: The Sculptor God Crafted by Utter Isolation The stage six boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is a god that can bring her sculpted idols to life with faith. She is the creator of [[joutouguu_mayumi|Joutouguu Mayumi]] and her [[haniwa_(statue)|haniwa]] army. She has [[pink_eyes|pink eyes]] and wears a [[green headscarf]] atop her [[long_hair|long]], [[blue_hair|blue hair]]. She is adorned with a [[magatama_necklace|magatama necklace]]. Her [[green_apron|green apron]] hangs over her [[yellow_dress|yellow dress]] with a [[single_strap|single strap]] and is filled to the brim with an assortment of [[tools|crafting tools]], such as [[knife|knives]], [[paintbrush|brushes]], and [[pliers]]. She wears a pair of [[sandals]]. Summoned by the enslaved human spirits of the Primate Spirit Garden, she and her idols took control over the Primate Spirit Garden and posed a threat to the Animal Realm at large. Since her idols had no flesh, soul or desire, the beast spirits could not resist them. Hence, the beasts executed their plan of pretending to invade Hell in order to recruit the protagonists, kickstarting the plot of Wily Beast and Weakest Creature in the process.

shiroko terror (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Similar in appearance to [[Shiroko (blue archive)|]]. Also goes by the name of "Anubis".

[spoiler]A version of Shiroko who remains the sole survivor of Abydos High School, exposed to Chroma by the Nameless Priests, which also altered her physical appearance. Shiroko would go on to serve the Nameless Priests directly under the protection of [[Phrenapates (blue archive)|]], until the main timeline's Sensei infiltrated the Ark of Atrahasis, leading to its subsequent destruction. In Volume 1 Chapter 3, Shiroko was summoned by [[Plana (blue archive)|]] to assist in subduing [[Hoshino Terror (blue archive)|Hoshino Terror]], whose mental state began to spiral similarly to hers.

As of the end of Volume 1 Chapter 3, Shiroko has now been appointed as a member of the General Student Council, and her Halo has slowly begun to heal, now that she's since let go of the guilt of losing her friends.[/spoiler]

She uses a [[SIG SG550]] [[assault rifle]] with a [[SIG P220/P226]] [[handgun]] as a sidearm. [spoiler]She additionally wielded the weapons of the deceased [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|Foreclosure Task Force]], but has since discarded them as a sign that she's begun to move on.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: [[Ogura Yui]]
Original artist: [[mx2j]]
galaxy:

interior: The inside of a [[structure]] or vehicle, such as a [[car]], [[ship]], [[airplane]], or [[train]].
spoiler (automobile):
An extension at the back of a [[car]], typically in the shape of a flat plate with two smaller plates covering both ends. The spoiler improves the vehicle's aerodynamic quality at high speed by redirecting airflow to the back.

A staple features in high-performance cars and [[racecar]]s.

starry moon:
A common error or stylization among scenery artists, where the [[moon]], usually in its [[crescent moon|crescent]] phase, is depicted as having stars inside its (obscured) radius rather than being drawn as a solid, spherical celestial body that occults the stars behind it.

Do not use this tag if the moon is depicted as an object rather than a satellite in space (for example, if a character is sitting inside the crescent moon).

Correct use of this tag: post #2876397
shana:
Shana is the main heroine of the [[Shakugan no Shana]] media franchise.

She is the Flame Haze bound as contractor to the Crimson God [[Alastor (Shakugan no Shana)|Alastor]]; their job is to stop other Crimson Denizens from running amok. The series begins when she gets involved with [[Sakai Yuuji]], an ordinary high schooler who's been imbued with a powerful artifact that can't fall into the wrong hands. Shana becomes his protector, and gradually more like a partner as he learns to fight; in turn, sharing daily life with Yuuji gradually brings Shana out of her shell (she's always lived in the world of Flame Haze, to the point of not even bothering with a [i]name[/i] till Yuuji gives her one).

Shana is often seen wearing a [[pendant]], the vessel of Alastor, and wielding the [[sword]] she's named after, the Nietono no Shana. She sports [[long hair]] ([[black hair|black]] normally, [[red hair|red]] with a flame effect when she's fighting), an [[ahoge]], and [[zettai ryouiki]]. Her closest connections are with Alastor (partner and advisor), Yuuji (love interest), [[Yoshida Kazumi]] (friend/love rival), and [[Wilhelmina Carmel]] (mother figure). Her love for [[melon bread]] is the stuff of legend.

While not the first [[tsundere]] character, Shana is rivalled only by [[Tohsaka Rin]] for most famous one.
nagisa (blue archive):
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[tea_party_(blue_archive)|Tea Party]]. Her full name is Kirifuji Nagisa.

She has [[long hair|long]] light [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]] and [[white wings|white]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]]. Her usual hairstyle is a [[crown braid]] with [[double-parted bangs]] and decorate with a pair of [[hair flower]]s.

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shrug]] worn over a [[white dress|white]] [[double-breasted]] [[sailor dress]] with [[long sleeves]] (which gives her [[short over long sleeves]]), a [[white sailor collar]] with a [[black neckerchief]], a [[black pantyhose]] and [[white shoes|white]] [[pumps]]. She also has a [[chest harness]] with a [[holster]] hanging from it.

Her personal weapon is a [[Walther]] [[Walther PPK|PP]] [[handgun]].

Voiced by: [[Hayami Saori]]
Original artist: [[famepeera]] (original design)/[[DoReMi (doremi4704)]] (in-game art)

kepi: A kind of [[hat]] that has a [[flat cap|flat]] top and cylindrical in shape, with a visor. This hat is mainly associated with the French forces, with its use going back to the 1850s. Many countries used it in the late 19th to early 20th centuries (including France, Japan, Brazil, Austria-Hungary, Romania, and Italy). Philippe Petain and Charles de Gaulle wore one in their official portraits during WWII.

fubuki (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Fubuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a small [[ponytail]] and [[sidelocks]] in front, [[black eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit, the Special-Type uniform, is a [[serafuku]] comprising a [[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], [[neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast carried as a form of backpack, while carrying two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap|thigh straps]] and a 12.7 twin gun mount Type A as a [[handgun]]. 

She has an earnest and diligent personality, but lacks any notable quirks or notable personality traits, and is often considered very plain. She is the viewpoint character of the official 4koma [i]Fubuki-chan Gambarimasu![/i], as well as the leading role in the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]] adaptation.
waver velvet: A character from [[Fate/Zero]]. College student, apprentice mage, ended up in way over his head after absconding with Kayneth Archibald's summoning catalyst, and then summoning [[Iskandar (fate)|]] for the Fourth Holy Grail War in Fuyuki.
hexagon: A polygon with six sides and six angles.
kurapika:
One of the main characters from [[Hunter x Hunter]].

A Blacklist Hunter and member of the Kurta Clan, being the only remaining member so far, Kurapika vows to avenge his fallen clan by destroying the Phantom Troupe after the latter massacred his clan for their "Scarlet Eyes", thus being his ultimate goal in becoming a Hunter.

He is usually calm, smart, and reticent, but becomes more wrathful and callous when threatened, attributing to his tragic past. This makes him impulsive sometimes, despite doing so for the sake of protecting his friends and avenging his clan.

Voiced by [[Hidaka Noriko]] (Pilot OVA), [[Kaida Yuki]] (1999), [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] (2011), and [[Erika Harlacher]] (2011; EN).

blake belladonna:
Blake Belladonna is one of the main characters of [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth. 

Blake is the "B" in RWBY, and is associated with the color black. Her character design is inspired by both of the eponymous characters in the fairy tale [[Beauty and the Beast (fairy tale)|]].
Blake is somewhat aloof, enjoys reading, and seems to have a checkered past.
goalkeeper: A position in [[soccer]]. Goalkeepers typically wear [[gloves]] and a different [[soccer_uniform|uniform]] from the other players on their team.
camellia:
A flower growing in evergreen shrubs native to Asia, especially in Japan, China, and Korea.

In art, these flowers are usually red, but sometimes white or pink. They have a bright yellow center that sticks up and often only have a single layer of petals. They grow on a bush, though they are more often seen as cut flowers.

The actual flower has more differences between varieties, particularly in the number of petals, but the "Camellia Japonica" variety is the one most commonly seen in anime-centric art.
step and repeat: A repeating pattern of logos used as a backdrop for publicity events.
lucario:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #448 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Fighting/Steel Pokémon.
Lucario is a bipedal, canine-like Pokémon, with fur that is predominantly blue and black. It possesses a short, round spike on the back of each forepaw, in addition to a third on its chest. It has a long snout and ears. Playable in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series.

During the day, it evolves from [[Riolu]] when leveled up and can [i][[mega pokemon|mega evolve]][/i] into [[Mega Lucario]] with the [i]Lucarion

naval uniform: A [[military uniform]] worn by members of a navy. Typically these will be either white or khaki in summer or tropical regions, and black or very dark blue in winter or cold regions. A [[naval dress uniform]], meant for ceremonial purposes, would usually be worn for special occasions while ashore, but rarely worn on an active vessel. Conversely, a [[naval working uniform]] is the typical clothing worn while out at sea, and is usually meant more for protection than for good looks.

Loader of Team [[Anglerfish]] in a [[Panzer IV]] on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Voiced by [[Nakagami Ikumi]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Ooarai Girls Academy / Team Anglerfish

h6. Original Anime

Loves nothing more than tanks! She uses that knowledge to help the team. In admiration of Miho she joined the team.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1283986)[/tn]

Belongs to the Ooarai Girls tankery team.  Team Anglerfish's loader.  The new Student Council Vice-President. The daughter of a family that runs a barber shop on the Ooarai school ship, she has liked tanks ever since she was little. achilles (fate):
Rider-class Servant first seen in [[Fate/Apocrypha]] as the [b]Rider of "Red"[/b] servant of [[Cabik Pentel]]. The greatest hero of the Trojan War, and was responsible for slaying [[Hector (fate)|]]. When he was a child, his mother Thetis submerged his entire body into the river Styx to give him invulnerability, except for his heel where she held him. Achilles is thus killed by Hector's brother [[Paris (fate)|]] when he shot an arrow at his heel.

The term "Achilles' heel", meaning a weakness in someone who otherwise has a strong constitution, is attributed to this mythology.

yamato (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Yamato[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[ponytail]], multiple [[cherry blossoms]] in her hair, and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s and a [[red sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], grey [[collar]] with a [[kikumon]], a "Z" [[signal flag]] [[armband]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[hip vent]]s, [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[black socks]] (knee-length on her right, [[black thighhighs|thighhigh]] on her left), AP shells on her [[thigh strap]]s, and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. She also uses Type 91 AP shell caps as [[breast padding|breast pads]] as shown in her damaged arts. 

Her [[rigging]] consists a headpiece containing her two Type 21 [[radar]]s, and two large hull pieces in a half-circle and held by a funnel to her back, containing all three of her 46 cm triple gun mounts and either four triple 155 mm triple gun mounts (base) or two triple 155 and six 127 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s (kai). She also uses a [[red umbrella|red]] [[oil-paper umbrella]] patterned off her real-life tripod mast. 

Because the historical [i]Yamato[/i] had a career mostly based around impressing people, Yamato is often depicted as a shy and soft-spoken housewife. Yamato was historically referred to as the [[Hotel Yamato]], due to her relatively luxurious quarters and the fact that she was never used in combat until late in the war, when defeat was certain.

Yamato only fired her massive 460 mm guns in battle once during the Battle of Samar to finish off [[Gambier Bay (kancolle)|]]. This is the only confirmed kill of Yamato during her entire career. She was sunk on 7 April 1945 during [[Operation Ten-gou]], in which she was bombarded with dozens of bombs and torpedoes before being sunk off southern Kyushu.

user interface:
Posts depicting a [i]tangibly visible[/i] user interface, that is, a visual layout of various elements that a user might need in order to interact with software or some other technological product. Often features buttons, overlaid text, and/or a list or menu of choices. Older or more technically-oriented user interfaces may instead consist purely of text on a solid color background.

Most game screenshots or spoofs of the same ([[fake screenshot]]s inspired by games) will likely qualify for this tag. 

Avoid using this tag for physical input devices or other mechanical elements if there is no visible "UI screen", even if they might technically qualify as user interfaces (e.g. HID) in a formal sense.

gibson les paul:
Solid body [[electric guitar]] manufactured by [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] since 1952, designed with input by famed jazz guitarist Les Paul whose name ended up as the name of the [[guitar]] itself, work and prototypes commenced in 1950, with 1951 prototypes being strikingly similar to the final product until its introduction in 1952. The Les Paul eventually caught big success in a seemingly endless array of genres, pinning it as one of the most well known and popular guitars along with its contemporaries, the [[Fender Telecaster]] and [[Fender Stratocaster]]. It's similarly been used by musicians far and wide, including [[Slash (Musician)|Slash]], Joe Perry and James Dean Bradfield among others.

The Les Paul also holds a strong cult following in Japan. Within anime and manga, [[K-On!]]'s [[Hirasawa Yui]] is most associated with the Les Paul, using a Cherry Sunburst Les Paul Standard (now Traditional). Other prominent characters include [[iDOLMASTER Million Live!]]'s [[Julia (Idolmaster)|Julia]] using a TV Yellow Les Paul Special, [[Bang Dream!]]'s [[Mitake Ran]] with a red Les Paul copy, and [[Bocchi The Rock!]]'s [[Gotoh Hitori]] with a black Les Paul custom.

Original Les Pauls were released with goldtop finishes, P90 ("soapbar") pickups and either stopbars or tailpieces. Prominent Gibson versions of the Les Paul include:
* Standard, most famous example in anime being Hirasawa Yui's model.
* Junior/Special, lighter glossier model with soapbar pickups with the Junior only sporting a single pickup, most commonly seen being used by iDOLMASTER's Julia.
* DC/DC Lite, a double-cutaway version, famously used in Japan by [[B'z]] guitarist [[Matsumoto Takahiro (B'z)|Matsumoto Takahiro]]. (post #2361213)
* Custom, featuring gold hardware, most commonly seen in either black or white. (post #1867738)

king (chess): A [[chess piece]] with a crown that has a cross on top, meant to represent the king in the game of chess. Although the king is the most important piece, it is usually the weakest piece in the game until a later phase, the endgame. Players cannot make any move that places their own king in check.
marianne von edmund:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Golden Deer.

She has [[blue hair]] typically worn with a [[crown braid]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She is commonly depicted with [[bags under eyes]] and a shadow over her face before the time skip. After the time skip when she is older, these go away.

She has low self-esteem and dislikes talking to people. However, [[hilda_valentine_goneril|Hilda]] is generally depicted as her only friend. She's also fond of animals, in particular horses.

[spoilers]Her low self-esteem is caused by her blood carrying the Crest of the Beast, belonging to a hero who was long lost to history, which promises contempt for those who bear it. It corresponds to the tarot of the Devil, who is also commonly known as "the Beast". She is acutely aware of this and keeps it a secret. As a result, she is deeply religious.[/spoiler]

Remarkably, she ended in the Top 1 of the 2021's edition of "Choose Your Legends":[https://vote5.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en-us] (women's side), making her the first non-main character to win the event, alongside the [[Gatekeeper_(fire_emblem)|]].

abe nana:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category, Nana is a hardworking and determined individual. Her appearances show that she likes to dress in maid outfits, something that reflects her attitude. She is also optimistic and believes that she can become a top idol. She is also caring for the Producer, as she sees him as a partner and confidant. Her hobby is communicating with her 'home planet' Usamin. Some of her speeches involves uttering "Pipi", signifying her communicating from there. She is a fan of anime, and one of her dreams is to become a seiyuu.

Some of her Affection UP and MAX comments reveal that she is not a real alien, and is a normal girl, but hopes that the Producer doesn't expose that fact and that they'll continue to work together. She claims to be "eternally 17", but it is hinted on her CD interview that that this is not true and she is actually at least in her early 20's, after her mother calls her to remind her to vote.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the fourth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Akagi Miria]], [[Koshimizu Sachiko]], [[Hino Akane (Idolmaster)|Hino Akane]], and [[Nitta Minami]]. She is voiced by [[Miyake Marie]] [三宅 麻理恵].

motorcycle helmet: A [[helmet]] used to protect the user's head while riding a [[motorcycle]]. Although it covers the entire head like a [[helm]], it should not be tagged as such because it is not designed to protect the face.
super creek (umamusume): [[Umamusume]] character; the resident "mama" who is often seen with Tamamo Cross or Oguri Cap. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked_hair|streaks]] tied into a [[low-tied long hair|low-tied]] [[braided ponytail]] and [[braided bangs]].
kirlia:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0281 in the National Pokédex, a Psychic/Fairy-type (pure Psychic-type prior to Generation VI).

Resembles a young [[ballerina]] with [[green hair]], [[red eyes]], and a [[white skirt]].

Evolves from [[Ralts]], and into [[Gardevoir]] or [[Gallade]].

Japanese name: [b]Kirlia[/b]
killua zoldyck:
One of the four main characters of [[Hunter x Hunter]].

Killua is a boy with a calm and laid back personality, however, his ruthlessness and aptitude in killing show the other side of him—deadly, violent, and bloodthirsty. He is a member of a famous family of assassins, the Zoldyck Family. He is the third son of [[Silva Zoldyck|Silva]] and [[kikyou_zoldyck|Kikyou]]. Killua is considered a promising member of the family but ends up running away from home and entering the Hunter Exam. Killua ends up meeting [[Kurapika]], [[leorio_paladiknight|Leorio]] and [[gon_freecss|Gon]], the other three main characters of the series. Gon later becomes his best friend.
acoustic guitar: A [[guitar]] that uses only an acoustic sound board to help transmitting the strings' vibrational energy to the air in order to produce a [[music|sound]].
chocolate cake: A [[cake]] made out of or flavored to be [[chocolate]].
behind-the-head headphones: A style of [[headphones]] where the strap is designed to go around the head from the back instead of around the top.
lampshade: A fixture that covers the lightbulb on a [[lamp]] to diffuse the light it emits.
blowing kiss: Displaying affection by kissing one's hand, and then "blowing" the kiss at the recipient.
spaceship hair ornament: A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a [[spacecraft|spaceship]].
two-tone hoodie: A [[multicolored hoodie]] that consists of exactly two colors.
oma kokichi:

He is a short boy with [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] (sometimes stylized to [[purple_hair|purple]]) and has [[purple eyes]]. He wears a torn [[straitjacket]] with a [[checkered scarf]]. His i

Wears all [[black]] with a [[baseball cap]], and has [[black hair]], [[eyelashes]], [[pale skin]], and [[yellow eyes]]. Removing the hat reveals that he has an [[ahoge]] underneath.

[spoiler]Becomes the true protagonist of the game after [[Akamatsu Kaed
lei: The distinctive Hawaiian flower garland, or slight variations therefrom.

If a single hand is involved, use [[hand on another's thigh]].
crystal wings: [[Wings]] made of or featuring [[crystal]]s as part of them.  Might be entirely formed from crystals, or might be wings similar to [[Flandre Scarlet]]'s - thin wings with floating crystals instead of feathers.
long beard: A full [[beard]] that extends past the shoulders of the wearer.  Additionally use [[very long beard]] for those that extend to roughly the level of the navel or lower.
forehead tattoo: A [[tattoo]] located on the person's forehead.
temari ball: A thread ball used both as an ornament and a toy. It originated in China and became popular in Japan in the mid-7th century.
black sweater vest: A [[sweater vest]] that is colored black.
getou suguru:
Character from [[Jujutsu Kaisen]].

Getou Suguru was a curse user and the closest companion of [[Gojou Satoru]]. [spoilers]After his death, he was possessed [[Kenjaku]] and appeared as [[Getou Suguru (Kenjaku)]].[/spoilers]

In his younger appearances, he wears a black Jujutsu High uniform. Later in life, he wears buddhist monk uniform consisting of a [[black kimono]] and a [[kesa]].
morpeko:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0877 in the National Pokédex, an Electric/Dark-type.

Alternates between its two forms, the yellow and [[happy]] [[Morpeko (Full)|Full Belly Mode]] and the purple and [[angry]] [[Morpeko (Hangry)|Hangry Mode]].

Notable Trainers with Morpeko include [[Marnie (pokemon)|]] and [[James (pokemon)|]].

naked overalls: "Naked overalls" refers to a character wearing [[overalls]], but being nude or nearly-nude underneath it.
incoming hug:
The viewer is about to be given a [[hug]].

For two characters about to hug, see [[imminent hug]].
unitard:
A [[skin tight]] one-piece garment similar to a [[leotard]], but with long legs and usually [[long sleeves]], usually stopping at the wrists and ankles.

A [[bodystocking]] is a similar piece of clothing, but worn as lingerie or underwear. A [[catsuit]] is also similar, but made of thicker material.
melusine (fate):
Lancer-class Servant introduced in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|British Lostbelt]] of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Despite her initial introductory title as Fairy Knight [[Lancelot (fate/grand order)|]], she is not a genderbent version of him.

She is the adoptive daughter of [[Aurora (fate)|]]. [spoiler]She is actually the white dragon of Britain [[Albion (fate)|]], reborn as a fairy. She is also [[Percival (fate)|]]'s adoptive sister.[/spoiler]

red tail: A character with a [[tail]] of red color.
white tube top: A [[tube top]] that is colored white.
jingasa:
A traditional Japanese soldier's hat. Often made from metal.

coconut:
The [[fruit]] of the [[coconut tree|coconut palm]]. It has a hard brown shell, which holds edible white flesh; the liquid inside the cavity is called coconut milk. The entire fruit is covered by a fibrous outer husk which is usually removed before the coconut is further processed.

Coconuts vary in appearance, ranging from having a smooth green shell, to a yellow one, and of course the common brown color that is covered in bark strips.
yellow sleeves: A pair of sleeves that are colored [[yellow]]. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently colored from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).
dock: A structure designed to fit (usually large) ships in for hull repair ([[drydock]]) or passenger/cargo transfer (wetdock). You can spot a cargo dock by the large water-side cranes. 2 [[jetty|jetties]] can form a dock if they're designed to fit one (and only one) ship between them.
sugoi dekai:
A [[raglan sleeves|raglan]] [[shirt]] with the words "[[romaji text|SUGOI DEKAI]]" written on the chest. "Sugoi dekai" means "super huge".

The shirt was originally worn by [[Uzaki Hana]] from [[Uzaki-chan Wa Asobitai!]], but it became [[meme attire]] after the anime adaptation was released. Other characters wearing the shirt shouldn't be tagged as [[Uzaki Hana]], unless they're specifically cosplaying her.
bullet hole: A hole left by the impact of a [[bullet]].
zundamon:
[b]Zundamon[/b] is a character who was originally created as [[VOICEROID]] [[Touhoku Zunko]]'s pet since 2017, but received an official [[personification]] and later a text-to-speech voicebank under the [[VOICEVOX]] software in August 2021. She later received a singing voicebank under [[NEUTRINO (software)|]] on July 31, 2022.

After the release of her text-to-speech voicebank, Zundamon became immensely popular within Japan and later aboard, to the point that she has completely overshadowed her original master Zunko.

Her gender was unknown until her human form's profile was released, describing her as a [[tomboy]]ish girl. Nevertheless, as [[VOICEROID]] characters are predominantly female, she is a popular target for [[genderswap]]s.

If Zundamon is only depicted in her [[Zundamon (UTAU)|UTAU]] (mascot) form, do not tag with [[VOICEVOX]].
low-braided long hair:
Long or very long lock of hair that has been [[braid|braided]] somewhere in the middle.

The starting point of the braid must be lower than the shoulder (otherwise it's not long hair).

If the starting point of the braid is secured by ribbons or other hair accessories, consider using [[multi-tied hair]].

The opposite of this is [[high-ended braid]].
see-through skirt: A [[skirt]] that is [[see-through clothes|see-through]], whether because it's made of sheer material or is fully transparent.
osakabehime (fate):
An Assassin-class servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Halloween Strike!]] event. Osakabe-Hime is a youkai that haunts the walls of Himeji Castle, and a friend of [[Tamamo no Mae (Fate/Extra)|]] and [[Kiyohime (fate)|]]. While she uses a [[bat (animal)|]] motif, Osakabe is actually a kitsune that attained human form (and also notes that it would be confusing if there were two kitsune Servants in the game). She is also a massive [[hikikomori]], and has the ability to control the [[origami]] animals she creates.

Appearance-wise, Osakabe has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] [[gradient hair|fading into]] [[brown hair|brown]] tips that she wears in [[twintails]], [[purple eyes]], and wears [[glasses]]. Her standard outfit is a kimono-themed [[hoodie]] and a [[purple skirt]]. Due to her dialogue in her swimsuit variants, she is also often depicted with a [[plump]] body.

She has a [[osakabehime (swimsuit archer) (fate)|swimsuit version]] for the summer 2019 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Moriyama Daisuke]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Fukuen Misato]]

A [[bracelet]] made out of [[gold]].

brown bodysuit:
A [[bodysuit]] that is colored [[brown]].

dusk (arknights):
[i]Coming on a whim, the great painter, Dusk, puts only the finishing touches on all jobs.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].
gunpod:
A [b]gunpod[/b] is a detachable pod or pack containing [[machine gun]]s or an automatic [[cannon]], mounted externally on a vehicle. They are usually used in [[military]] [[aircraft]].

Gunpods increase an air combat vehicle's firepower without occupying internal volume. When not required for a specific mission they can be omitted to save weight so the vehicle becomes lighter, faster and consumes less fuel.

Also used in some anime [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] series like [[MACROSS]].
canal:
A large watercourse made by mankind. 
The natural equivalent is the [[river]].
snow globe:
A [[toy]] or ornament consisting of a [[model]] of a scene in a liquid containing white particles that, when shaken, mimic a [[snowstorm]].

Not to be confused with a [[crystal ball]].
nebula:
An astronomical object made up of the remains of a star having gone supernova. The gas and dust of a nebula eventually form into new stars.

Usually depicted as colourful clouds in [[space]].
gondola:
A traditional passenger-carrying [[boat]] of Venice, Italy, measuring a law-regulated 10.85m in length and having an maximum breadth of 1.40m. It is often sculled by a single person standing on the rear deck, with the [[oar]] resting on an oarlock. Gondolas with multiple rowers also exist, an example being the [i]traghetto[/i] or ferry gondola. 

[i]Gondole[/i] can be differentiated from other boats by being asymmetrical, with one side being slightly longer than the other, and by the presence of a [i]ferro[/i], a stylized S-shaped bow ornament made of metal whose design represents elements of Venice and whose weight counterbalances that of the gondolier.

Gondolas figure prominently in [[Amano Kozue]]'s anime and manga series [[Aria (manga)|]].
tire: See [[unused tire]] for unused or detached tires.
bunching hair:
When a character holds part of their hair (or someone else's hair) up with their hands to give the appearance that they have a certain hairstyle, usually [[twintails]].

This tag should not be used when a character is putting their hair up in a ponytail or [[tying hair|tying their hair]].
non-humanoid robot: A [[robot]] that doesn't have a humanoid shape. [[Robot animal]]s, pods, [[walker (robot)|]] robots, spider-tanks, all count.
jester: A jester was historically a [[medieval]] to [[Renaissance]] era entertainer who entered the [[house]] of a nobleman or monarch and was employed to entertain guests. They were also traveling entertainers who entertained ordinary people at [[festival]]s and [[town]]s. It is thought that jesters wore brightly colored clothes and eccentric [[hat]]s in a mottled pattern. The jester's other characteristics were their way of [[laughing]] and their mock [[scepter]].
frilled swimsuit: See either [[frilled bikini]] or [[frilled one-piece swimsuit]].
multiple belts:
For when a single character has more than one [[belt]] on them.

Do not tag just when multiple characters are wearing belts.
military operator:
A [b]special forces[/b] (derived from [i]special operations forces[/i]) is an elite [[military]] [[soldier|infantry]] unit being tasked for risky or demanding operations by the government or the army. An individual served in the special forces are known as a "military operator", or "operator" for short.

This tag covers images with military operator(s) armed with "tactical" [[gun|firearms]] (which may consist of prototype or advanced [[weapon]]s, especially those with the various mounted accessories such as [[laser sight|laser sighting system]], [[optical sight]]s and/or [[suppressor]]s). They are also usually seen equipped with [[tactical clothes|tactical]] loadout that may consist of [[ghillie suit]]s, [[bulletproof vest]]s, [[camouflage]]d [[military uniform]]s, [[helmet]]s, [[night vision device]]s, [[radio]]s and more. 

Certain SOF groups, such as the US Green Berets, British [[Special Air Service|SAS]], and Soviet/Russian [[Spetsnaz]] (also [[VDV]]), can be distinguished by coloured [[beret]]s. These are, respectively, green berets, red berets, beige berets and blue [[military hat|berets]].
gradient dress: A [[dress]] with a noticeable [[gradient]] on it.
animal slippers: [[Slippers]] in the stylized likeness of an [[animal]]. The canonical example is [[bunny slippers]], but there are many variations.
kissing cheek: [[Kiss|Kissing]] someone's cheek. It represents a dear, courtesy, or satisfaction to the person.

[[Kantai Collection]] personification of the German aircraft carrier [i]Graf Zeppelin[/i].
Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Hayami Saori]].
cure peach: The Pretty Cure alter ego of [[Momozono Love]], also known as the Cure of Love, and is the leader of the [[fresh precure!|Fresh Precure]] team. Her theme color is pink and her suit symbol is the heart. Her upgraded form is [[cure peach (angel)|Cure Peach Angel]].
female butler: A female character wearing a [[butler]] uniform. The opposite of [[male maid]].
paw print soles:
For images where the sole of depicted footwear features a [[paw print]] design, typically a single print per sole.

This tag should only be used for normal footwear and should [b]not[/b] be used for images depicting [[paw shoes]], as those normally always have [[pawpads]] built into the design.
yumehara nozomi: The first Cure to be discovered in [[Yes! Precure 5]], transforming into [[Cure Dream]]. Nozomi is a typical schoolgirl heroine who doesn't know what to do with her life, and is best friends with [[Natsuki Rin]]. Nozomi grows close to [[Coco (yes! precure 5)|]], the first mascot introduced in the series, even gaining a crush on him.
soda bottle: A [[bottle]] that tapers into a thin neck, where [[soda]] is stored for future consumption. The bottle can either be made out of glass or plastic.

[[BASIL (FARAWAY) (omori)|]] has [[short_hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[pink_flower|pink]] [[hair flower]]. He wears a [[white_shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] under a [[green sweater vest]] with [[brown shorts]].
[tn]For his preteen FARAWAY appearance, use this tag and [[aged down]].[/tn]

[[BASIL (HEADSPACE) (omori)|]] has [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]] with a [[blue_flower|blue]], [[pink_flower|pink]], and [[purple_flower|purple]] [[flower_wreath|flower]] [[head_wreath|crown]]. He wears [[blue overalls]] and a [[green shirt]].
tail feathers:
For bird tails, see [[bird tail]].
For tails with a few feathers on it but not covering the tail fully, see [[partially feathered tail]].
leopard girl:
Girls with intrinsic [[leopard]] features.

Despite the names, leopards and [[snow leopard]]s are only distantly related.
orange sleeves: A pair of sleeves that are colored orange. The sleeves have to either be [[detached sleeves|detached]], or differently colored from the rest of the garment the character is wearing (such as [[raglan sleeves]]).
shirt overhang: A [[shirt]] that hangs loosely over the [[breasts]] and in front of the stomach, instead of fitting tightly to the body. Like [[crop top overhang]], but for full-length shirts.
polka dot neckwear: Do not use this tag. Instead use a more specific tags like [[polka dot necktie]], [[polka dot ascot]], [[polka dot bowtie]], [[polda dot neckerchief]] or [[polka dot ribbon]] (for [[neck ribbon]]s).
kaguya luna:
[b]Kaguya Luna[/b] is a [[Virtual YouTuber]] who made her debut on December 9, 2017. She was managed by Vic inc. from the start, but between fall 2018 and fall 2019, she operated under her own autonomous agency, [[THE MOON STUDIO]]. In addition to her YouTube content, she produced music under the Sony Music label [[SACRA MUSIC]]. She was designed by [[Mika Pikazo]].

While neither she nor Vic Inc. have officially announced that she had graduated, her most recent YouTube video was published on August 29th, 2020, and the Kaguya Luna Official channel has been inactive ever since. Kaguya Luna's Twitter account has not been active since October 20th, 2020, and as of the end of 2021, the Kaguya Luna Fan Club website has shut down.

Her voice was often compared to [[Hamtaro]], earning her the nickname "Strangled Hamtaro" (首を絞めたハム太郎).

[spoiler][[Pmaru-sama]], who has "admitted":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ADVUKyyq3uA] she is the talent behind Kaguya Luna, remains very active with her own channel on YouTube.[/spoiler]
variations:
Pictures of the same character repeatedly in the same image that have been either copied and pasted or redrawn. Only a single outfit should be present, and most of its appearance should be preserved between variations, with only minor alterations to hair/clothing style, color, and accessories. If the difference is more significant, use [[multiple views]] instead.

This should be differentiated from sequential actions, such as a frame-by-frame rendition of a dance, or the stages of creating an illustration (sketch, inking, color, etc.). The latter should be [[how to]]. This also does not include [[comparison]]s between different characters or different characters [[matching outfits|wearing the same outfit]].

Not to be confused with [[variant set]], which refers to a series of images depicting the same scene with some differences.
hagoita: A wooden [[paddle]] used by girls to play [[hanetsuki]] on [[New Year]]s day. Hagoita usually have ornate or detailed images painted on them making them very special. They can be bought at the end of the year (prior to New Years) during a special event called [i]hagoitaicha[/i] where various artists from local temples will compete against each other to make the best hagoita.
sewing needle: A [[needle]] with a small hollow on the non-pointed end to allow for [[thread]] to pass through. Then the prepared needle is run through [[fabric]] to sew clothing.

The Ultimate Inventor. Likes to experiment with new gadgets, but has disowned her most well known invention, "Eye-drop Contacts", after selling it off. She is a rude, crass girl until someone responds in turn, which causes her to back down almost immediately.

Wears a pink [[serafuku]] with [[goggles]] [[goggles_on_head|on her head]]. She wears a [[black choker]] and smaller [[barbed wire]] necklaces. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[bl
suzuhara lulu:
A former [[Nijisanji]] affiliated [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. She debuted on the same day as [[Yukishiro Mahiro]].

Due to some odd events (such as streaming ten hours of [[Ring Fit Adventure]] [i] immediately after[/i] streaming ten hours of [[Dark Souls I]]), Lulu gained a reputation for behaving like some sort of inhuman creature, a notion further developed by her habit of staring directly at the viewer when something doesn't go as it should and her weird remarks like implying her eyeballs can regenerate after being crushed, while claiming to be nothing but a normal college student.

She is part of the [[Saine Sisters]] trio along with [[Kamishiro Kurea]] and [[Sephira Su]], as the three virtual youtubers were designed by [[Saine]] and consider themselves sisters, sometimes appearing in each other channels.

Unexpectedly announced she would be graduating and ceasing activities on June 30, 2021.
patterned background:

akiyama mio:
A main character from [[K-On!]]

The [[left-handed]] bassist of the Light Music Club, playing a 3-Color Sunburst Fender Jazz Bass. The extremely shy Mio intended to go to Literary Club, only to be forced by her childhood friend [[Tainaka Ritsu]] into joining the band. While often trying to pose a confident exterior, her stage fright (ironically, she is also a vocalist in the event [[Hirasawa Yui]] can't sing) and phobia of anything disturbing makes her the target of Ritsu's pranks.
airplane interior: The interior of an [[airplane]] (as opposed to the exterior).
miyamoto frederica:
An [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. A half-French half-Japanese, she is an energetic, fashionable 19 year old. She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], and [[green eyes]] which often show [[sanpaku]]. 

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the seventh CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Himekawa Yuki]], [[Ichihara Nina]], [[Hayami Kanade]], and [[Sagisawa Fumika]]. She is voiced by [[Takano Asami]] [髙野 麻美].

But there is another side to the mild-mannered Xingqiu everyone knows. A daring, adventurous, and much more mischievous side...

His name is pronounced [b]Yukuaki[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Xingqiu has dark, navy [[blue hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] and [[yellow_eyes|golden amber eyes]]. He has a slight
robin (fire emblem):
A customizable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. Can be [[male robin (fire emblem)|male]] or [[female robin (fire emblem)|female]]. Default gender is male and default name (which is also the name given to the character in [[Super Smash Bros.]] for 3DS/Wii U) is [b]Robin[/b] ([b]Rufure[/b]/[b]Reflet[/b] in the Japanese version). Has little memory of the past, but is a gifted tactician.

sith:
[quote][i]Peace is a lie. There is only Passion.
Through Passion I gain Strength.
Through Strength I gain Power.
Through Power I gain Victory.
Through Victory my chains are Broken.
The Force shall free me.[/i] - The Code of the Sith.[/quote]

A fictional [[darksider_(star_wars)|darksider]] group from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

An evil and brutal order of merciless, treacherous (even among themselves), chaotic and power-hungry murdering warriors and conquerors, the [b]Sith[/b] despise weaker lifeforms and seek only total control of the galaxy and the Force with the complete and utterly destruction of their adversaries, most notably the [[Jedi]].

Their main weapon is the [[lightsaber]], which usually has a [[red lightsaber|red colored laser blade]].
tape on nipples: A form of [[pasties]] consisting of some type of adhesive [[tape]] placed over the [[nipples]].
hookah:
A single or multi-stemmed (often glass-based) water pipe for [[smoking]]. Originated from India. Operates by water filtration and indirect heat. It can be used for smoking herbal fruits, tobacco, or even marijuana.

The [[caterpillar]] from Lewis Carroll's book [[Alice in Wonderland]], is illustrated smoking one of these.
two-tone bodysuit: A [[multicolored bodysuit]] that consists of exactly two colors.
saw:
A saw is a [[tools|tool]] consisting of a hard blade, wire, or chain with a toothed edge. It is used to cut through relatively hard material, most often wood. 
The cut is made by placing the toothed edge against the material and moving it forcefully back and forth.
cum swap: The sexual practice of two people exchanging [[cum]] mouth-to-mouth, usually in a [[kiss]] or by drooling. Colloquially known as snowballing.
ouroboros: An ancient Eastern European symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating its own tail. What is represents is debated and may vary from artist to artist. Common interpretation are that of eternity, cyclic nature of life and death and self destruction.
dowsing rod:
A Y or L shaped rod used for divining the location of water, oils, gravesites, or finding radioactive materials. Dowsing rods are sometimes used in a way not too dissimilar from a Ouija board, in which you ask a question and if the Dowsing rod moves the answer is yes.  It can be made from a variety of materials. 

Dowsing can also be conducted with a pendulum made of a crystal, or other materials, to find the location of materials. It works in a similar fashion to the rods, with the crystal po
ho'olheyak (arknights):
[i]Caster Operator Ho'olheyak walks the long, winding path of history.[/i]

tight shirt:
When a [[shirt]] is too [[tight clothes|tight]] for the wearer.

The opposite is [[oversized shirt]].
puff of air:
A cartoon puff of air: 💨. Usually comes from a character's head to indicate [[angry|anger]], [[annoyed|annoyance]], [[exhausted|exhaustion]], [[smug|smugness]], or simply a [[sigh]].

Not to be confused with the facial expression [[:3]].
mitsurugi meiya:

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair|hair]], usually worn in a [[long hair|long]] [[ponytail]], and she is often seen with a [[katana]].

Meiya was voiced by Okushima Kazumi up until the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]], where the role was transferred to Nanami Karin. She's
kukri: A Nepalese [[knife]] with a distinct inward curve.  The weapon is sometimes associated with [[Sniper (tf2)|]] of [[Team Fortress 2]] and serves as his default melee [[weapon]].
looking at animal: When a person looks at an [[animal]] or a [[bug]].
lyre:
A lyre is a small stringed [[instrument]]. It is able to be picked up by the player, and is while being used. It has with strings fixed to a crossbar. They're often U-shaped, but can come in various appearances. They're often associated with ancient Greece.

Lyre is a distinct tag from a [[harp]], which is larger in size ans stands upright while being used.
nanao yuriko:
One of the characters of “[[idolmaster million live!|THE IDOLM@STER MILLION LIVE!]]”.

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[blue hair]] with [[crown braid]].
hand puppet:
A type of [[puppet]] that is controlled by the hand or hands that occupies the interior of the puppet.

Use [[shadow puppet]] if the “puppet” is literally made of hands.
green armband:
[[Armband]] that is green in colour.

tied jacket:
A method, similar to [[tied shirt]], of wearing a [[jacket]] so that the [[midriff]] is exposed. May include either conventional-length jackets that have been modified, creating a [[crop top]], or those [[cropped jacket|specifically designed]] to be cropped. Notable wearers of the [[tied jacket]] include [[Agnes Tachyon (umamusume)|Agnes Tachyon]] and [[march 7th (honkai: star rail)|March 7th]].

This is not for cases of a [[jacket]]'s sleeves being tied shut individually or together.  For those, either [[sleeve tied shut]] or [[sleeves tied together]] as applicable.
aqua headwear: This tag has been deprecated for being too broad. Use a more specific tag like [[aqua hat]], [[aqua hairband]], etc.
floating book: The use of [[levitation]] magic on a [[book]].
ooi (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Ooi[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her base outfit, shared with her sister [[Kitakami (Kancolle)|]], is composed of a [[green shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]] with white stripes, and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

Her base [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, a 14 cm [[handgun]] mount, and twin 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] on her left arm.

Often referred to as "Ooi-cchi" by [[Kitakami (Kancolle)|]]. Sometimes depicted as extremely Kitakami-sexual.
leaf-pattern stripe: This tag has been moved to [[leaf_print]].
kagura suzu: A traditional Japanese musical [[instrument]] consisting of three tiers of [[jingle bell]]s suspended by coiled brass wires. Often seen used by [[miko]]s. Sometimes adorned with various colored [[ribbon]]s.
holding popsicle: Someone is {{holding}} a {{popsicle}}. If a popsicle is held in their mouth without contact from their hands, use {{mouth_hold popsicle}}.
holding ice cream: Someone is holding some [[ice cream]], whether it's in [[soft serve]] or ice cream balls on a [[ice cream cone|cone]], in [[popsicle]] form, or as a [[parfait]].
akagi (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Akagi[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu_(glock23)|]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]]. 

She has [[long hair|long,]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She is typically seen wearing a [[muneate]] over white and red [[japanese clothes]] in a [[nontraditional miko]] style with a red [[tasuki]]. She also wears an apron based on the stern end of her flight deck, with the kana "ア" inscribed on it. She wears white [[thighhighs]].

Her [[rigging]] includes notably less armor or machinery than most shipgirls. She holds a traditional [[Kyuudou]] [[bow_(weapon)|bow]] and has [[arrow (projectile)|]]s in a [[quiver]] slung over her shoulder by a strap which also has a replica of her ship's [[mast]]. On her right arm, she has her flight deck worn like a shield. She wears [[geta]]-like sandals that have carrier-like decks on them.

She is nicknamed the "Bauxite Queen" and portrayed as a [[glutton]]ous eater thanks to her reputation for eating up all the Bauxite reserves in your inventory.
ainu clothes:
Clothing of the [[Ainu]] people, an indigenous group from Japan (Hokkaido) and Russia (Sakhalin & the Kurin Islands).

Their clothing are distinctive from [[Japanese clothes]] in their pattern and cut.
rabbit ear hairband: A type of [[animal ear hairband]] specifically referring to [[rabbit ears]]. Very common as part of a [[playboy bunny]] costume.
flip phone:
A [[cellphone]] that features a clamshell design that flips open.

With the advent of [[smartphone]]s, flip phones have generally fallen out of favor. However, with developments in flexible OLED screens enabling foldable smartphones, [[garaho flip phone|some modern smartphones]] have begun using a flip design.
aoki reika: The blue-haired girl in [[Smile Precure!]] who serves as the Student Council's vice president. She transforms into [[Cure Beauty]].
sports festival: A [[school]] event where students participate in [[playing sports|sport]] activities.
scarf over mouth: A [[scarf]] that is covering the wearer's mouth.
amplifier:
A device used to amplify electric [[instrument]]s so they can produce sound. Amplifiers are most commonly used for [[electric guitar]]s and [[bass guitar|basses]].

An amplifier usually consists of a small [[speaker]] connected to a [[guitar]] with builtin controls to adjust the sound.
oekaki:
A drawing made with very simple tools, usually imageboard/bbs-embedded drawing software, with [[jaggy lines|very sharp and thin lines]].

Oekaki (お絵描き) is Japanese for "scribble" or "doodle". On the Internet, an Oekaki is a message board system that revolves around computer art created by a local art program. Oekaki artists often post their art to other websites, such as personal pages or free gallery websites, in addition to the original board.
wiping tears: The act of removing [[tears]] from one's face, typically by hand, sleeve, or tissue.
kisaragi chihaya:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series. While naturally talented, Chihaya is less enthusiastic about the "idol" aspect of her career, preferring classical music, and is actually rather awkward with other people. Well-known for her occasional insecurity regarding her rather [[flat chest]].

Her mother is [[Kisaragi Chigusa]]. [spoiler]She also has a deceased younger brother, [[Kisaragi Yuu (idolmaster)|Kisaragi Yuu]].[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Imai Asami]] and, in [[Idolmaster X
yuigahama yui:
One of the main characters in [[Yahari Ore no Seishun LoveCome wa Machigatteiru.]] A member of the Service Club with her friends [[Hikigaya Hachiman]] and [[Yukinoshita Yukino]]. Has an unnamed [[yuigahama yui's mother|mother]].

She has [[brown eyes]] ([[blue eyes]] in the light novels), [[large breasts]], [[short hair]] that's usually either [[brown hair|brown]], [[red hair|red]], or [[orange hair|orange]]-ish [[pink hair|pink]] generally done up in a [[single side bun]] and [[bangs]].

mercedes von martritz:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and a member of the Blue Lions.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] (though she cuts it [[short_hair|short]] after the in-game timeskip), [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

A motherly and religious woman, Mercedes can't ignore people in need, being always prone to help her friends if there's a problem. She tends to let people tell her what to do, rationalizing this to be the will of the Goddess. She is good friends with [[annette_fantine_dominic|Annette]].

In-game, Mercedes is one of the best healers available to the player, being one of only two characters with access to the Fortify spell (the other being [[flayn_(fire_emblem)|Flayn]]). She also does reasonably well with offensive magic, but she has terrible physical stats.

[spoilers]Mercedes's half-brother is [[Jeritza von Hrym]], who was once known as Emile von Bartels. The two were separated when Emile's step-father, Baron Bartels, attempted to dispose of his wife, Mercedes and Jeritza's mother, and force his step-daughter to bear him a child with the power of a Crest but his plan was stopped by Jeritza who kill his father before running away.[/spoilers]
wreath: A wreath is a ring made of flowers, leaves and sometimes fruits that can be used as an ornament, hanging on a wall or door, or resting on a table. A small wreath can be also worn on the head as a form of headdress, in which case it would be a [[head wreath]].
santa gloves: [[Red gloves|Red]] and [[white gloves]] similar to the ones used by [[Santa Claus]]. Use these tags instead.
throwing knife: A [[knife]] designed to be used primarily by [[throwing]] in [[battle]].
yoga:
A commonly known generic term for physical, mental, and spiritual disciplines which originated in ancient India.

On Danbooru, it is used to refer to one of the positions in yoga to test a character's suppleness.
table humping: Humping the corner of a [[desk]], [[table]], or other similar furniture for [[masturbation]] purposes. Known in Japanese as "corner masturbation" (角マス).
hair dryer: A handheld electric appliance used for [[drying hair|drying]] and styling hair.
infinity symbol: The ∞ [[symbol]], used to represent the concept of infinity. The symbol looks like a sideways number 8, or two interconnecting loops.
pipe in mouth: When a character has a [[smoking pipe]] [[mouth hold|in their mouth]]. They may or may not be [[smoking]] through it.
diona (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Diona is the daughter of [[Draff (Genshin Impact)|]], a hunter in Springvale.

Despite being a bartender at Cat's Tail, she actually despises alcohol and wants nothing more than to ruin Mondstadt's wine industry—a feat easier said than done when her patrons absolutely love her drinks.
sanji (one piece):
[[One Piece]] character. Full name Vinsmoke Sanji. The cook of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]]. His goal is to find the All Blue, the legendary sea where the four great seas of the world meet.

A skilled kick-based martial artist with a perverted side that manifests in episodes of exaggerated [[nosebleed]]s at the sight of a beautiful woman. Has [[curly eyebrows]]. He specializes in using coordinated kicks as his main fighting style, better known as "Black Leg Style".

He is the main character of the spin-off culinary manga [[Shokugeki no Sanji]].

nia (xenoblade):

igarashi kyoko:
An [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cute category.

Kyoko is a gentle teen who makes a perfect housewife. Her notably nice attitude is often considered to be her most notable trait. Kyoko is sweet and gentle, with the perk of being good at housework. Her hair is usually tied with a ribbon into a [[side ponytail]].

It has been shown in her "The Seven Mysteries of Sacred Slipper Academy" S Rare+, that she can look more menacing than she usually does. Fans say that Kyoko has the possibility of crossing into yandere territory, however it is more likely that she is taking the role seriously.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Kyoko is a sweet girl who has a joyful disposition. She loves to clean and enjoys remembering her journey as an idol. Kyoko admits that she likes the Producer enough to marry him, and hopes to share an umbrella with him when she’s caught in the rain. Her kindheartedness is displayed when she delivers Christmas presents with her fellow idols to [[Sajo Yukimi]] and how she takes care of the Producer on their day off at the beach. She seems to have trouble drawing cats, as they tend to look more like rabbits, and loves to cook.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 9th set of CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Ninomiya Asuka]], [[Ohtsuki Yui]], [[Nakano Yuka]], and [[Aiba Yumi]]. She is voiced by [[Tanezaki Atsumi]].

She's part of [[Pink Check School (idolmaster)|]] with her friends [[Shimamura Uzuki]] and [[Kohinata Miho]].
nata (tool):
A usually double-handed striking tool with a sharp rectangular blade used to cut and split wood. It resembles an oversized [[cleaver]].

It also is an archetypical [[yandere]] weapon.
kagami mochi:
A traditional Japanese [[New Year]] decoration consisting of two round [[mochi]] (rice cakes), the smaller placed atop the larger, and a "daidai":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daidai ([[mandarin orange|mikan]]-like fruit) with an attached leaf on top.

Usually placed on top a stand called [[sanbou]].
explosive: Any type of material designed to [[explosion|explode]], including (but not limited to) [[weapon]]s such as [[grenade]]s, [[mine (weapon)|mines]], and [[bomb]]s.
wringing clothes:
When a character is squashing [[wet clothes]] within their hands, sometimes to force water out to dry the clothes.

For other methods of drying clothing, see [[drying clothes]].
jack daniel's:
Jack Daniel's is a brand of Tennessee whiskey and the top-selling American whiskey in the world. It is produced in Lynchburg, Tennessee, by the Jack Daniel Distillery, which has been owned by the Brown–Forman Corporation since 1956.

Packaged in square bottles, Jack Daniel's "Black Label" Tennessee whiskey sold 12.5 million cases in 2017. Other brand variations, such as Tennessee Honey, Gentleman Jack, and Tennessee Fire, added another 2.9 million cases to sales. Sales of an additional 800,000
hisakawa hayate:
[b]Hisakawa Hayate[/b] is an idol appearing in [i][[idolmaster cinderella girls|THE IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i]. The last of seven new characters announced for 2019, she debuted in [[idolmaster cinderella girls starlight stage|Starlight Stage]] before Mobamas, fully voiced, alongside her [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]] [[Hisakawa Nagi]]. She was added to Mobamas on April 5, 2019.

Like her sister, she has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[braided bangs]] along the side. Unlike her sister, she wears it untied with uneven [[bangs]], and has [[blue eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She's further distinguished by her expressive face and lively personality. She is voiced by [[Nagae Rika]].
dress flower: At least one [[flower]] that is used to decorate a [[dress]] or [[skirt]].
musket: A muzzle-loaded, smooth bore long gun, fired from the shoulder. Generally identified by the presence of a lock on the side of the gun.
hanging plant: [[potted_plant|Potted plants]] where the [[flower pot]] or basket is suspended beneath a structure rather than sitting on a surface.
flaming sword: A [[sword]] that is either made of flame or that is giving off flames.
sonoda chiyoko:
A girl who likes chocolate and sweets from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]]. She is a member of the unit [[Houkago Climax Girls (idolmaster)|]].

An ordinary girl whose type you could find in any class. She's bright and easy to make friends with and likes sweet things. Using her name, she wants to make an image as a chocolate loving idol. Second-year at high school.

Voiced by [[Shiraishi Haruka (voice Actor)|]].
osaki tenka:
Timid girl from [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]] and [[twins|twin]] sister of [[Osaki Amana]]. Her bangs curl to the left side of her face, going in the opposite direction of her sisters bangs.

She is in the [[Alstroemeria_(idolmaster)|]] unit.

The 'older sister' of the Oosaki twins. From a young age she has looked after her younger sister Amana. She's not good at talking with people and has many indoor hobbies like anime and games. Second-year in high school.

Voiced by [[Maekawa Ryouko]].
subaru duck:
[[Oozora Subaru]]'s "3D" model. Thanks to her hilariously bad attempts at [[ASMR]], she has been compared to [[Donald Duck]] and then, [[duck|ducks]] in general. Thus, in this form, she appears as a white duck with her signature baseball cap. Might or might not be randomly tumbling and changing sizes.

The duck later became her own channel [[mascot]]. It speaks using Subaru's ASMR duck voice.
nissin cup noodle:
[b]Cup Noodle[/b] (known as "Cup Noodles" outside Japan, or colloquially "Nissin Cup Noodle"/"Nissin Cup Noodles" to distinguish it from other noodle brands) is a brand of cup noodles by [[Nissin]].

This tag is specifically used for the Nissin line of cup noodle/ramen products (including classic, chili tomato, seafood, shio, curry, miso, "mystery meat":[https://soranews24.com/2017/09/20/the-true-identity-of-cup-noodles-mystery-meat/], tom yum goong, spicy, etc., featuring their big/mini versions, rich versions, variants, such as cheese curry, Hokkaido milk seafood or negi shio, or international exclusive types if they exist), or [[brand name imitation|imitations]] of their packaging. Only tag [[cup ramen]] if other cup noodle brands are present.
curry rice:
[[Rice]] topped with [[curry]].

The [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] adopted curry from the [[Royal Navy]], who adopted it from India, and it became the origin of present Japanese-style curry rice. The [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]]'s tradition of eating curry rice every Friday lunch originated with the IJN.
pastry bag: Also called a piping bag, it is a handheld bag made from cloth or paper for piping semi-solid foods. It is filled through a wider opening at the opposite end, rolled or twisted closed, and then squeezed to extrude its contents. The most popular usage is for [[icing]], although pastries and garnishes can also be created this way.
nekomusume: [[Cat girl]] character from [[Gegege no Kitarou]]. Her name literally means "cat girl". Her appearance has varied over time, but she typically wears a [[red dress]] with a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]].
super saiyan:
A form exclusive to the [[Saiyan]] race in [[Dragon Ball Z]] and onward. In order to go Super Saiyan for the first time, one must be either full-Saiyan or half-Saiyan. Early on, one must have gone through months or years of rigorous training, and have a pure heart or pure purpose. At first, one must've experienced something that would send them into a moment of ultimate rage, but over time that requirement was sidestepped.

On Danbooru, the tag indicates someone is going or already in Super Saiyan form, generally indicated by [[blonde hair|blonde]], [[spiked hair]], [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[green eyes]], and a jagged, golden [[aura]]. Due to its nature as an umbrella tag, it is also used for references to the form (even if only the aura is used). Additionally, it can also be used as a stand-in for indeterminate cases, especially those born out of the difficulty in differentiating between the original [[Super Saiyan 1]] form and [[Super Saiyan 2]].
ootachi:
A type of Japanese [[sword]]. The ootachi (also known as 野太刀, [i]"nodachi"[/i]) is essentially a [[katana]] with a very long blade, often longer than the wielder's height. The best-known examples are probably [[Sephiroth]]'s Masamune in [i][[Final Fantasy VII]][/i] and the various long sword-class weapons featured in the [i][[Monster Hunter (series)|]][/i] series.

The ootachi was a rare weapon. In real life, it was used by men on foot to fight against mounted cavalry, however [[polearm]]s were much easier to produce and in most cases were more effective in that role. Due to it being an expensive weapon that was difficult to forge, it was seen as proof of a swordsmith's skill and a status symbol for a samurai who carried it.
side drill:
Denotes an instance of the hair being tied into [[drill hair]] off to the side on a character.

Not to be confused with [[drill sidelocks]].

rook (chess): A [[chess piece]] with the design of a siege tower, meant to represent the rook, formerly called the castle, in the game of chess. The rook moves horizontally or vertically, through any number of unoccupied squares.
virgin killer outfit:

[quote]

飲み会とかで何回か童貞を殺す服を見てきたけどやっぱりダントツはNO.S PROJECTのブラウスとかスカートとかそのへん

[quote]

I have, on multiple occasions, seen various "virgin killer" outfits at drinking parties and such, but by far the best ones have got to be those blouses, skirts, etc from NO.S PROJECT, and the like.
[/quote]

Many variations exist of the outfit described as "virgin killer", but the most frequent articles of clothing include dark-colored [[high-waist skirt]]s, [[suspender skirt]]s, or [[corset]]s that come up to the [[underbust]] height in order to emphasize the breasts. They are usually worn with [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]]s.

Notably similar to [[Shidare Hotaru]]'s costume from [i][[Dagashi Kashi]][/i]. To a lesser extent, they are also similar to the [[Anna Miller]] and [[Kobeya]] waitress uniforms.

nishida satono:
[b]The All-Too-Dangerous Backup Dancers[/b]

A [i][[Touhou]][/i] character, introduced as one of the stage 5 bosses in [i][[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]][/i].

Satono has [[short hair|short]], [[brown_hair|brown hair]] which she often wears with [[short hair with long locks|two locks]]. She wears a [[purple dress]] with [[frills]] and a [[waist apron|waist apron]]. Her dress is decorated with [[bow|bows]] and [[ribbon|ribbons]]. She has [[purple eyes|purple eyes]]. She wears [[purple footwear|purple]] [[shoes]] with a pair of [[black thighhighs]]. Her hat is a [[tate eboshi|kazaori eboshi]].

Along with [[teireida mai|Mai]], she is based after Matarajin's two servants, Nishida and Teireida respectively. Like her mythological counterpart, she is depicted holding a [[myouga (plant)|myouga plant]] in her character portrait.

Satono and Mai are [[matara okina|Okina's]] loyal servants. They used to be human children, but Okina's magic made them less human. They dance for Okina's sake and are essentially an extension of Okina's power. Satono is depicted as discreet but overconfident. Her abilities allow her to draw out one's mental energy by dancing behind them.
buruma pull:

Joy-Cons can be used either paired in both hands or by itself, and come in a variety of colors and have several related accessories, such as a grip, an attachable controller shell, and a [[thigh strap]] for use with [[Ring Fit Adventure]].
special week (umamusume): The main character of the first season anime adaptation of [[umamusume|Umamusume: Pretty Derby]]. She is part of Team Spica in the anime and Team Sirius in the mobile game. Her real-life namesake, [[Special Week (racehorse)|]], passed away on April 27, 2018.
curtained hair:

ayanami (azur lane):
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ayanami[/i]. Character design by [[Ootsuki Momiji]], voiced by [[Taichi You]]. 

She is a Japanese/Korean/Taiwan server-only starter ship, being replaced by [[Z23 (azur lane)|]] in the English and Mainland Chinese servers. She is claimable after obtaining the other three starters.

noh mask:
A traditional Japanese theater [[mask]].

[i]Noh[/i] (能) is a classical Japanese form of dance drama. Noh masks are also used in Kyōgen performances (the comedic counterpart to [i]Noh[/i]) and sometimes also in other Japanese performing arts and ceremonies.

Noh masks are traditionally made from carved cypress wood, painted or lacquered. They are frequently affixed by means of a red silk tying cord. They tend to employ heavy emphasis of shadows in order to portray different emotions (which can be changed by angling the mask).

Masks depicting human beings tend to reflect traditional medieval Japanese aesthetics (resembling characters from woodcut prints), having pale 'chubby' faces with well defined brows and cheek lines, plus prominent eyebrows. Masks depicting older humans tend to have extensive wrinkles and beards.

Masks depicting supernatural entities tend to have large eyes and exaggerated expressions. They may also have horns, fangs and other nonhuman features. Gold paint is frequently used to (literally) highlight the otherworldly appearance of such entities.

Noh masks are used to portray different characters when on stage, similar to Western makeup. An actor may, however, rapidly switch between different masks to fulfill different roles.

cagliostro (granblue fantasy):
[i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i] character.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], a [[red skirt]] with [[vial|vials]] along the side of it, a [[tiara]]-like [[hairband]], and a [[cape]]. She is always holding a book.

She is actually over 1,000 years old, and is widely known in the Granblue universe as the person who basically invented alchemy. Her original body (which was biologically male) was always of ill health and would've died in adolescence; to avoid such a fate, she learned how to use alchemy to create new bodies and transfer herself into them, thereby living indefinitely. This is how she wound up in her current female body, which she views as her "ideal" form.

Her nickname on the internet is "Uncle Cali" (カリおっさん, Cali-[i]ossan[/i]).

Note that, because her male form was never even seen in-series, Cagliostro's presence only warrants the [[genderswap_(mtf)]] tag if the image references it somehow. See topic #11614 for details.

Examples of this would be [[shinomiya_kaguya|Kaguya]] in her “bakaguya”/moron mode and [[pallas_(arknights)|Pallas]] from [[Arknights]].

Not to be confused with [[hair flower]].
iei: An iei is a [[portrait (object)|portrait]] [[photo (object)|photo]] of a deceased person. Commonly seen in scenes during, before, or after Japanese [[funeral|funerals]], either on display or carried by a family member. They are distinguishable by their frames, which are typically wrapped on both the left and right top corners - often with a bow in the center.
grid background:
A typically single-color background formed into a square grid by a series of thin lines.

The lines must be perpendicular or parallel with respect to each other, but not necessarily to the sides of the image; a square grid that has been rotated is still a square grid.

Not to be confused with [[checkered background]], where the squares contain two alternating colors, or [[border]], a line that runs along three to four edges of the image.

lux (league of legends):
A playable character from [[League of Legends]]. She is the younger sister of [[garen_(league_of_legends)|Garen Crownguard]].

[b]Luxanna Crownguard[/b] hails from Demacia, an insular realm where magical abilities are viewed with fear and suspicion. Able to bend light to her will, she grew up dreading discovery and exile, and was forced to keep her power secret in order to preserve her family's noble status. Nonetheless, Lux's optimism and resilience have led her to embrace her unique talents, and she now seeks to bring greater tolerance and understanding to her homeland.

In-game, Lux is a long-range mage who can lock down her enemies from a distance, shield her allies, or blast the opposition down with her spells.
pegasus wings: Pegasus Wings are majorly worn By Kurokuma Saki from Touhou Project and sometimes by Pegasania also.
yun jin (genshin impact):
[[Genshin Impact]] character.Character designed by "Weiwei (危危)":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Yun_Jin/Design]

The current director of the Yun-Han Opera Troupe and a famous figure in Liyue Harbor's opera scene. Despite performing in mostly traditional music and plays, she holds a secret love for intense genres of music like Xinyan's rock'n'roll.

Her Vision's element is Geo and she wields a polearm in battle.

Her name is pronounced [b]Unkin[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.
underwater sex: A sexual act which takes place while the participants are submerged in water. May be in deep waters or in a bath, totally or partially submerged.
fish boy: [[Monster Boy]]s that have fish characteristics. Differs from a [[merman]] or [[mermaid]] in that while they can be humanoid, they have more blatantly fishy characteristics than a fish tail, such as gills, multicolored skin, scales across the body, or different fish physiology like head protrusions.
costume switch:
Two or more characters wearing each other's default clothes; an outfit swap.

Never use this tag if there is only one character in the image who happens to wear another character's clothes or if one of the two characters in the image wears the other's clothes, but the other is still wearing his/her own clothes, especially one that is a duplicate of the cosplay; use [[cosplay]] instead, if that tag is absent. Cannot also be used on obvious switches covered across two images; make those parent and child posts instead.
flat ass: Barely flat or not so prominent buttocks.
paizuri over clothes:
When [[paizuri]] is performed over the top of/through clothing, with no skin contact.

If the character is merely clothed while performing traditional [[paizuri]] (with skin contact), use [[paizuri under clothes]] instead.
bazooka (gundam):

patch:
In the context of Danbooru, the word patch has two related meanings:

* A piece of fabric stitched in place to repair torn clothing or similar items
* An embroidered design stitched or adhered to clothing, like a [[crest]] or [[badge]]

Not to be confused with an [[eyepatch]]. For medical plasters see [[bandaid]].

split mouth: An artistic style where the line representing a character's mouth isn't fully connected. The mouth is usually [[closed mouth|closed]] but can also be [[open mouth|open]].
lunatic gun: [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]]'s gun that was introduced in the fifteenth [[Touhou]] game, [i][[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]][/i], in which she becomes a playable character. bomb:

Unlike missiles or mortar shells, bombs do not propel themselves toward the target.
single sandal: A character is wearing a [[sandals|sandal]] on only one foot.
winged footwear: Any type of footwear that has a pair of miniature [[wings]], usually on the heel portion.
gakuran:
The traditional, military style [[school uniform]] for male students in middle schools and high schools in Japan, usually in either black or navy. 

The top has a standing collar buttoning down from top-to-bottom. Pants are straight leg and a black or dark-colored belt is worn with them.

Frequently seen in many anime male protagonists.
shrine bell:
鈴 ([[bell]])

light censor:

[[Light rays]] from external sources can also conceal these parts, as well as [[dappled sunlight]], and in these cases can be a form of [[convenient censoring]].

human scabbard:

kizuna ai:
The world's premier [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. She uploads a variety of videos to her YouTube channel, the A.I. Channel, in a similar format to other popular YouTubers. She's produced by activ8 under their [[Kizuna AI Inc.]] autonomous subsidiary.

Her character designer is [[Morikura En]] (post #2638467), while her [[voice actor]] was kept a secret (until April 24, 2020 when it was revealed that [spoiler]Kasuga Nozomi[/spoiler] was her "voice model"). She made her debut with the video [i]"Creating A Twitter account!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoPFGj3uuYo][/i] on November 29, 2016. Her 3D model is available for "download":[http://kizunaai.com/download-page/] from her official website. 

She describes herself as a 16 year-old super intelligent A.I. that is curious about humans. As the sole resident of an endless white void, she finds human life fascinating, and wishes to use her channel to learn more about them. In a "live stream":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C3Fx-9s9Y68] celebrating a new subscriber milestone, Kizuna Ai gave her impression of her own three-sizes: 83-56-81.

On February 26, 2022, Kizuna Ai went on an indefinite hiatus following a final [i]hello, world[/i] virtual concert. At the final live, an [[kizuna no allele|anime project]] and a [[CeVIO]] voicebank ([[KZN (cevio)|]]) based on her were announced. Exactly 3 years later, on February 26, 2025, she announced "the resumption of her activities":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j53m3DSqhKo.

Kizuna has had an immense amount of game collabs, including an appearance as a shipgirl in [[Azur Lane]], an unlockable [[Fall Guy]] skin in [[Fall Guys]], and an appearance as a playable pilot in [[Super Mecha Champions]]. activ8 has also ensured she had collaborations with crypto ventures, such as Otaku Coin and Japanese metaverse/NFT project METAANI, as well as previously having talked about Bitcoin, which is met with mild controversy among anti-crypto crowds.
