rash guard:
A Rash Guard (sometimes called a [i]Rash Vest[/i], [i]Rashie[/i] or [i]Swim Shirt[/i]) is a type of athletic shirt worn for extra function and protection when surfing, snorkeling, jet skiing, or doing other watersports where you want more protection than a [[swimsuit]], but don't really need a full [[wetsuit]].  Most rash guards have long sleeves and while some women's tops show midriff, most are regular shirt length.  Of note, they are sometimes worn under a wetsuit or [[diving suit]] for added comfort.

Because rash guards are made from [[tight clothes]]-fitting materials like spandex, nylon, polyester, or neoprene and are often sold as matching top/bottom sets, this can sometimes make them appear similar to a [[wetsuit]] or [[one-piece swimsuit]] at a glance when no midriff is visible.  A clue to watch for is the horizontal line where the top-piece and bottom-piece come together/overlap.  If there is no line clearly identifying top from bottom, assume the garment is a wetsuit instead.

zuikaku (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Zuikaku[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] dark [[green hair]] in [[twintails]], [[yellow_eyes|yellow]]/[[green eyes]], and [[small breasts]]/[[flat chest]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] set comprising a [[white kimono]] top, [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudder and propeller]] parts, [[brown gloves|brown]] [[yugake]], and a black [[muneate]] with her identifier "Zu" marked on it. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her [[flight deck]] on her left arm, her real-life hull to her back and used as a [[quiver]], and multiple [[anti-aircraft gun]] placements on her waist and thigh boots. 

In contrast with her sister ship [[Shoukaku (kancolle)|]], Zuikaku is depicted as a brash, hot-headed, reckless, and somewhat [[tomboy]]ish girl, in reference with her turbulent wartime career, in which she was credited for damaging and sinking several ships, but usually at a cost of large numbers of airmen.

She is frequently portrayed as a [[turkey]] and her in-game line "don't call me a turkey" is widely used as a joke on [[4chan]] and [[2channel]]. This stems from the IJN's notoriously poor performance in the battle of the Philippine Sea, where well-trained USN aviators referred to fighting inexperienced IJN pilots as a "turkey shoot". 

Her abyssal form is assumed to be the [[Abyssal Crane Princess]].

omikuji:
Random fortunes written on strips of paper at [[Shinto]] [[shrine]]s in Japan. Tying these strips of paper to trees or wires is a common custom, especially when receiving a negative fortune.

The short messages that may be found on them follow below, ordered tentatively from worst to best:

* 大凶 (dai-kyou), Great Curse
* 末凶 (sue-kyou), Future Curse
* 半凶 (han-kyou), Half-Curse
* 小凶 (shou-kyou), Small Curse
* 凶 (kyou), Curse
* 末小吉 (sue-shou-kichi), Future small Blessing
* 末吉 (sue-kichi), Future Blessing
* 半吉 (han-kichi), Half-Blessing
* 吉 (kichi), Blessing
* 小吉 (shou-kichi), Small Blessing
* 中吉 (chuu-kichi), Middle Blessing
* 大吉 (dai-kichi), Great Blessing

The temples and shrines across Japan do not have a unified system for their omikuji. Some places do not offer the full range of fortunes, and a few offer an additional fortune rank:
* 平 (hira), Neutral

How the unmodified "Blessing" ranks compare to Small and Middle blessings also varies.

[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ushio[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and [[brown eyes]]. 

Her default outfit is the Special Type's [[serafuku]] and [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. Her [[cannon|12.7 cm twin gun mount]] is colored pink, and which has a [[:3]] face upon its top so that looking down at it, the cannon barrels look like ears on a bunny. She normally hugs her cannon tightly to her chest (to hide her chest, presumably). She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a notable [[ahoge]]. The [[torpedo tubes]] strapped to her thighs have puppy, kitty, bunny, and other cartoon animal [[sticker]]s on them. 

Her damaged CG reveals that she's hiding surprisingly [[large breasts]] for a destroyer/young girl. The reason for this may be that "Ushi" is the word for "cow", so she has "Ushi Oppai", or "cow tits", which is how some Japanese mock women with larger-than-normal cup sizes.

Historically, the real-life [i]Ushio[/i] took part in many of the IJN's operations and was one of the extremely few surviving Japanese destroyers of [[World War II]], alongside only [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Hibiki (kancolle)|]] of the ships in the game. Also famous for being a "lucky" ship, she is unlike [[Yukikaze (Kancolle)|]] and [[Shigure (Kancolle)|]] in the sense that she protected her companions instead of jinxing them.

setsubun:
[b]Setsubun[/b] (節分, lit. "seasonal division") is the last day of winter in the Japanese calendar. It usually corresponds to February 3rd in the Gregorian calendar.

A ritual performed on this day is to throw roasted soybeans in order to drive away [[oni]]; this is known as [[mamemaki]].

In the Kansai region, it's customary to eat [[makizushi]] while facing this year's lucky direction; this practice is known as [[ehoumaki]].

panzer iv:
The [b]Panzerkampfwagen IV[/b] (Pz.Kpfw. IV), commonly known as the [b]Panzer IV[/b], was a medium [[tank]] developed in [[Nazi]] Germany in the late 1930s and used extensively during [[World War II]]. Its ordnance inventory designation was Sd.Kfz. 161.

Designed as an infantry-support tank, the Panzer IV was not originally intended to engage enemy armor—that function was performed by the lighter [[Panzer III]]. However, with the flaws of pre-war doctrine becoming apparent and in the face of [[Soviet]] [[T-34]] tanks, the Panzer IV soon assumed the tank-fighting role of its increasingly obsolete cousin. The most widely manufactured and deployed German tank of the Second World War, the Panzer IV was used as the base for many other fighting vehicles, including the [[Sturmgeschutz IV]] assault gun, [[Jagdpanzer IV]] tank destroyer, the Wirbelwind self-propelled anti-aircraft weapon, and the Brummbär self-propelled gun.
geisha: A Japanese female entertainers who wear elaborate hairstyles, makeup and kimonos. They work as hostesses and provide varying forms of entertainment such as music, dance, games and conversation in order to entertain male customers.
weapon case:
A type of portable case designed to safely store, carry and transport [[weapon]]s (including the accessories) in concealed manner. It comes in various colours and shape, though rectangular is the most common one - as well as being made from various material (e.g. fabric, leather, or plastic).
Weapon case can be carried on back just like [[backpack]] (post #5190996), or being handheld like a [[briefcase]] (post #3566073). It can be soft or rigid container (post #5334885). Some designs feature internal foam pad for extra protection (see post #3702122). 

This type of bag can also take shape as an [[instrument case]] (see post #5947317 or post #3958907).
cat on head: When there is a feline upon your head, you will enjoy it.

chibi usa:
The pink-haired character from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] by [[Takeuchi Naoko]]. She is also the future daughter of [[Tsukino Usagi]] and [[Chiba Mamoru]].

When she first appears, she is a small child from the 30th century who visits the past to seek help from the series' primary heroines, the [[Sailor Senshi]]. She later returns, a few years older, in order to train as a Senshi herself — [[Sailor Chibi Moon]].

Note that her full name is [b]Tsukino Usagi[/b], the exact same as her mother's. She is given the nickname [b]Chibi Usa[/b] in order to differentiate between the two Usagis. 'Chibi' means 'small', while 'usa' is the first part of her full name, so it means 'small Usagi'.

Voiced by Araki Kae in the 90s anime, and [[Fukuen Misato]] in Crystal.

marie (splatoon):
[[splatoon_(series)|Splatoon]] character. Named [b]Hotaru[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[inkling]].

She is part of an [[idol]] group known as Squid Sisters (Sea O' Colors in the Japanese release) with the other member being her [[cousins|cousin]] [[Callie (splatoon)|]]. She and Callie are also both news program hostesses that announce in-game news.

She wears a green and black-themed outfit matching Callie's and wears a food cup on her head. Other features of this default costume & appearance include [[bow-shaped hair]] and a [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]]. In general she is usually depicted with a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]], [[thick eyebrows]] and [[star-shaped pupils]].

Her canonical [[list of weapons in splatoon|weapon]] class of choice are Chargers.

Often drawn with a more melancholic expression compared to her cousin. 

Her Japanese name comes from the Japanese word for the "firefly squid":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watasenia_scintillans (蛍烏賊/ホタルイカ [i]Hotaru-ika[/i]) and their band's name in Japanese is a portmanteau of "shiokara" (a Japanese food made out of various marine animals, commonly squid) and "colors". She and Callie's names in English are a play on the word calamari.

nemo (fate):
Umbrella tag for the members of the Nemo Series from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. [[Captain Nemo (fate)|]] is the leader of the series and the first one to appear in the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|]] chapter as [[Sion Eltnam Sokaris]]' servant, with [[Marine Nemo (fate)|Marine]] only briefly appearing. The rest of the series only manifest after he declares his true name in the [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] chapter and manifests the [[Nautilus (fate)|]]. The series is a result of Memory Partition he learned from his master, allowing Nemo to divide his skills up into [[multiple persona|multiple selves]] to manage all the operations of his submarine.

Although the Nemo Series' genders were initially left ambiguous, the male-to-female ratio was eventually confirmed to be 3:3 by Fate/Grand Order material XI. In-game details, such as the annual Valentine's Day event, have shed light on the genders of each Nemo: the confirmed men are Captain and the Marines, the confirmed women are Engineer and Baker, and Professor and Nurse's genders are still unknown, though Professor is implied to be female.

ooyodo (kancolle):
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Ooyodo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], a [[hairband]], [[blue eyes|bluish]]-[[green eyes|green eyes]] with [[glasses]], and [[small breasts]]. In the game, she has two roles: as the girl who appears in the quest menu, taking the role as "Ninmu Musume" or "Mission Girl"; and as a playable ship, whose upgraded version contains a command facility that can retreat damaged ships.

Both versions of her wear a [[white shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[hip_vent|hip vents]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[thigh boots]]. 

As an NPC, she carries notebooks and holds a [[quill]]. As a playable character, she uses a 15.5 cm triple gun mount as a [[handgun]], an [[aircraft catapult|catapult]] attached to her right arm, another triple gun holstered on her thigh and a large seaplane hangar attached to her back. Several [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts are attached to her and her hangar, and there are three masts with [[radar]]s on top of the rig.

pentacle: An [[amulet]] used to cast magic; not to be confused with [[pentagram]], which is a geometric shape. While the word implies the use of a pentagram, it can also use a [[hexagram]].  Often worn as a [[pendant]].
kasugano sakura:
[b]Sakura Kasugano[/b] ([b]春日野 さくら[/b]) is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. She is introduced as a 16-year-old (as of [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 3]]) Japanese schoolgirl who has an intense fixation with [[ryu (street fighter)|Ryu]]. She has managed to copy and learn some of Ryu's techniques but really wants him to train her personally. In her most recent appearance in [[Street Fighter V]]'s new [i]Arcade Edition[/i], she has graduated high school and has taken a job at an arcade to make ends meet, but she still persists in fighting and training.

Sakura has typically fought in her school's uniform, a short-skirted [[serafuku]] with the [[popped collar|collar popped]] and [[red buruma]] underneath. She wears a red top under her uniform, red gloves, and a [[white headband]] (given to her by Ryu before Street Fighter Zero 2). As of Street Fighter V, she has replaced the school uniform with the [[employee uniform]] of the arcade she works at. She has short brown hair. 

Chronologically, Sakura first appeared in [[Shiritsu Justice Gakuen|Shiritsu]] [[Justice Gakuen]], where she had started to participate in street fighting after watching Ryu win the first World Warrior tournament. Justice Gakuen saw Sakura involved in the adventure between her school and others in Ashura City. Fighting in it, she realized how much it meant to her to protect something she cared about.
tailjob: The equivalent of a [[handjob]], but done with a [[prehensile tail]].
bee:
A flying insect that pollinates flowers and produces [[honey]] and beeswax. They live as colonies and build [[beehive]]s to store their honey, and possess stingers that inject minuscule amounts of venom in anyone they deem intruders.

The most common type of bee is the European honey bee. Human management of honey bee colonies for honey production is called apiculture or beekeeping.

She has [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long]] [[white hair|silvery white]] hair with a single prominent [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streak]] in the front. She also has [[yellow eyes]] and [[demon horns|demon-like horns]].

For her default outfit, she wears a skimpy 'dress'-like outfit (with prominent [[breast curtains]]) over [[bodystocking]]s. Also wears a [[black cape]] and [[high heels]].

One can sit or lie on it in a lot of different positions because it adapts its shape to one's body.

For small bean bags used for juggling or games, see [[bean_bag|bean bag]].

Yang was executed by strangulation after Xuanzong's guards convinced him that her family was responsible for the "An Lushan Rebellion":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/An_Lushan_Rebellion.

[[Splatoon 2]] character. Named [b]Hime[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[Inkling]].

She is part of the band Off The Hook (Tentacles in the Japanese version) with [[Marina (splatoon)|]], which has its own television show.

Her Japanese name comes from the word for the "Northern pygmy squid":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idiosepius_paradoxus (ヒメイカ [i]Hime-ika[/i]). As revealed in Octotune's album booklet, her full name in Japanese is [b]Hime Houzuki[/b].

In her default costume & appearance she wears a [[white dress]], [[pink pantyhose]], black [[fingerless gloves]], white [[shoes]] and a [[crown]]. She has [[thick eyebrows]] and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. She has white / yellow [[star-shaped pupils]]. While she typically has [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[white hair|white]] + [[pink hair]], the white part is sometimes drawn more [[blonde hair|blonde]].
wrestling mask: A fabric-based [[mask]] that some professional wrestlers wear as part of their in-ring persona or gimmick.
crazy:
A person who appears insane.

If the character in question goes crazy by obsessive love, use [[yandere]].
team galactic: A villainous [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] team operating in Sinnoh.
arrow in body: When an [[arrow (projectile)|arrow]] is embedded inside someone's body, often in the chest or in the back.
mud: A mixture of soil and water. May cause characters to become [[dirty]].
apologizing: When a character offers an apology to be forgiven (sometimes with a [[dogeza]]).
leg hold:
A character is [[holding]] one of their [[legs]] upwards, or a character is holding the [[legs]] of another.

In the former, it is often done as part of a [[standing split]].
on shoulder:
An [[animal]], [[creature]], or person resting or [[sitting on shoulder|sitting]] on someone's shoulder.

Don't use for inanimate objects or clothing. See [[over shoulder]] for inanimate objects being carried on someone's shoulder.
human stacking:
When several people [[lying|lay]] [[stacking|stacked]] on top of one another, usually in a sexual manner. This often involves [[presenting]] their bodies to the viewer,  as in [[take your pick]].

See [[human tower]] for towers of people stacked on their heads or shoulders.
naked chocolate: Lit. "smeared with chocolate". For use on images that depict a [[nude]] character that's covered in liquid [[chocolate]].
